b'Migration Statistics Specialist - Reannounce Job SummarySummary of the Position
Providing technical assistance on the preparation of statistics related to internal and international migration, in accordance with the direction of the relevant director Duties and Responsibilities
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing work plan in accordance with the general plan of the Central Statistics Organization (NSIA) in order to achieve the goals set by the NSIA
\xe2\x80\xa2 Providing technical assistance on the collection of information regarding migrations
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring the quality of the collected data
\xe2\x80\xa2 Studying, checking and controlling the migration data and ensuring it is worth of providing to national and international authorities and it does not possess any kind of errors and flaws
\xe2\x80\xa2 Creating the required tables regarding the major migration indicators on international level for the usage of relevant department
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing questionnaires for migration surveys, analyzing migration data and establishing and developing the indicators related to migration, immigration, emigration, returnees, displacements and other indicators related to migration 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Analysis of migration data taking into account the relevant SDG indicators.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Writing reports on migration statistics
\xe2\x80\xa2 Implementing the objectives of the programs in the directorate of population statistics in order to achieve the desired goals.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Training and transferring knowledge, skills and experience to the staff of relevant department
\xe2\x80\xa2 Performing other duties and tasks assigned by the top management in accordance with the laws and regulations of the organization. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Training and transferring knowledge, skills and experience to the staff of relevant departmentTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Government Qualifications
Qualifications and Experience: Migration Statistics Specialist would have the following qualification and work experience;
\xe2\x80\xa2 A Master degree with 1 year of relevant experience in Demography, Economics, Business Administration, Mathematics or Statistics.
\xe2\x80\xa2 A bachelor degree with 2 years of relevant experience in Demography, Economics, Business Administration, Mathematics or Statistics and Computer (Combined Degree).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient user of MS Office and one of the statistical analysis software SPSS, STATA and R
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong communication skills.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work in a team.'

b'Admin Assistant Officer Job SummaryAdministrative Assistant Officer will be hired to perform all administrative tasks of VHC with national/international and having a good communication skill with VHC donors and etc. Under the direct supervision of the VHC head and representative, the administrative assistant is responsible for planning, coordinating and implementing , daily, weekly, monthly and yearly reports of development implementation activities for VHC head and representative.
1. Support VHC head in the areas of development implementation and project remarks.
2. Maintain and monitoring systems of the project and program; supervise and maintain operational expenditures are in accordance with approved documents and that all committing documents are complete and consistent; and report variations from budgets considerations.
3. Organize /select and analyze data from a wide variety of sources, including VHC corporate systems and data.
4. Monitor the receipt of Government contributions and ensure that all procurements and other documents projects and the office are properly requested and obtained.\xc2\xa0
5. Brief local and international staff, experts, and consultants on specific aspects of allowances, salaries, financial matters, contracts, recruitment etc.\xc2\xa0
6. Ensure the good formal communication with other national/international organizations. 
7. Keep proper record of all receipts, payments and close and on time coordination with Donor agencies
8. Purchase, check in and receive daily deliveries from different vendors and distributor as per VHC purchasing procedure.
9. Obtain Approvals from Administration and finance department in due course according to the budget line.
10. Perform other related duties as required Administrative 1. 12th Graduated or University degree in a field related to administration or extensive work experience in relevant areas.
2. Minimum of one year of professional experience in the field of management, administration, development management, including supervisory experience and exposure to personnel management.
3.     Working knowledge of the VHC official language used for communication within the country English and working knowledge of the most widely used local language (Dari and Pashto)'

b'Coordinator - Rem. & Human Capital ( Re- announcement)  Job Summary\xef\x82\xb7 The mission is to Coordinate Human resources remuneration and human capital process being implemented and ensure compliance
\xef\x82\xb7 Responsible for the implementation Employee recognition program in order to build a culture of reward & recognition of exceptional performance within MTNA on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis Key Tasks:
\xef\x82\xb7 Perform the process of Reward & Recognition i.e., the MTN Shine program in MTNA, develop culture of reward and recognition and keep line managers informed of MTN Shine nominees
\xef\x82\xb7 Educate the business about online Innovation Submission Form processes and criteria, encourage employees to present nominations and review all nominations
\xef\x82\xb7 Advertise the MTN Shine program inside MTNA premises to inform employees of various stages of the program and of the winners
\xef\x82\xb7 Develop and implement OpCo change plan to implement integrated recognition framework and drive education campaigns defining the value, benefits and ROI of recognition
\xef\x82\xb7 Identify constraining factors and causes that hinder managers from recognizing employees,
\xef\x82\xb7 Develop and implement new initiatives to drive manager led recognition; align these initiatives and assess their impact on the culture of recognition and fostering of MTN values
\xef\x82\xb7 Facilitate behavioral change and sustenance of manager led recognition
\xef\x82\xb7 Provide input for process improvement
\xef\x82\xb7 Prepare all the Human Capital Reports and ensure that all necessary reports are accurately and timely prepared
\xef\x82\xb7 Daily monitoring of attendance system, Timely reporting of absentees, Timely registration of MTNA employees
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure installation of Hand key readers in all MTNA premises
\xef\x82\xb7 Report /resolve issues of attendance / door system if any
\xef\x82\xb7 Provide timely and accurate ID cards to the new recruitments, problem solution of the issues raised in MTNA ID cards
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure to provide ID cards within 2 days to the employees who lose their IDs and Proper record of the ID cards
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure employees get new ID cards with new MTNA logo until the end of March 2011
\xef\x82\xb7 Prepare accurate list of employees birth dates, Celebrate employees birthdays on the exact dates; also Provide a bouquet of flower on the birthday
\xef\x82\xb7 Provide a birthday card duly signed by the GM \xe2\x80\x93 HR, concerned Division head and CEO
\xef\x82\xb7 Clear the invoices of cake and bouquet suppliers on the end of each month and to keep a proper record
\xef\x82\xb7 Collect the TIN forms from new recruitments and existing if any and Send them to the MoF for the TIN generation
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure to provide the original TIN number form to employee
\xef\x82\xb7 Keep proper record of all TIN numbers issued to MTNA staff
\xef\x82\xb7 Accurate record keeping of all employees
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure presence of necessary documents
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure all the relevant documents of employees are timely placed in their personnel file
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure all personnel files are properly placed in the hanging files
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure the files are placed on MTNA number in the shelves
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure all the processes are followed
\xef\x82\xb7 No single task to be carried out without the proper steps of HR processes
\xef\x82\xb7 Report any amendments / modifications as required or necessary
\xef\x82\xb7 Prepare a proper format for the reports
\xef\x82\xb7 Timely provision of reports required
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure the customers are dealt well in your area
\xef\x82\xb7 Timely request fulfillment of customers
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure all clearance forms are processed immediately
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure to receive all the necessary items like ID card, SIM card etc
\xef\x82\xb7 Place all the clearance forms in to the personnel files of employees
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure that balance leave of employees are indicate in the clearance forms
\xef\x82\xb7 Report the reasons in exit interview form to immediate supervisor
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure all employees are provided with necessary medical services when needed, Proper tracking of all records
\xef\x82\xb7 Proper process and tracking of payment reimbursement for Medical service provider
\xef\x82\xb7 Ensure new comers timely receive their Email ID and official GSM
\xef\x82\xb7 Proper tracking and record Human Resource Education: Bachelor degree-business degree major in HR or equivalent
Experience: 4-5 years of relevant experience
Training: Business & HR planning Computer literacy-MS project, MS Word, MS Excel, MS access, MS PowerPoint Statistical analysis'

b"DCOP Job SummaryThe Deputy Chief of Party (DCOP) acts as the company's back up Chief of Party (COP) for Oxus' support of Kabul Carpet Export Center (KCEC) within Afghanistan; In addition to the primary role of assisting with technical matters related to the carpet trade of Afghanistan, the DCOP is responsible for supporting the Chief of Party (COP) in all operational management and decisions necessary to meet agreed upon expectations from the prime contractor. This includes overall project administration and management of the KCEC inclusive of program management and impact; external representation; and coordination with USAID, program partners and stakeholders, other donors and other program contractors. The DCOP serves as the key point of contact when the COP is not available for USAID/Afghanistan, the Afghan government, and any other key stakeholders for the program. General Job Functions:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide program leadership, managing assigned aspects of the program in Afghanistan, working closely with Oxus Management, the KCEC prime contractor leadership, and COP. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Building strategic partnerships with USAID/Afghanistan \xe2\x80\x9cfor role of COP when COP is not available\xe2\x80\x9d, the Afghan carpet industry and government, and other program stakeholders in the carpet sector. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Works closely with project team members to monitor implementation and to ensure high quality and timely completion and submission of all contractually required deliverables. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinates and Oversees with guidance of COP the design and implementation of efficient, results-oriented, cost-effective interventions to improve Afghan carpet production, exports and new job creation. 
Specific Job Functions:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supervisory: Directly supervises Managers; cooperate with the COP to supervise employees; and addresses any personnel and management issues that escalate to a senior level needing direct oversight. Carries out responsibilities in accordance with office policies and applicable U.S. and Afghan laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, training and supervising Mangers; planning, assigning and directing work; appraising performance; addressing complaints; and resolving problems before they are escalated to a senior level. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Introduces the COP to carpet manufacturers and assists KCEC in vetting carpet makers for each project. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Arranges meetings between manufacturers, KCEC and customers utilizing online media options
\xe2\x80\xa2 Oversees the KCEC personnel on the process of product development , order entry, carpet production, inspections, (repairs, if necessary), packing, export paperwork, customs clearing and shipping. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Acts as KCEC principal liaison when the COP is not available. Responds to office visits and telephone inquiries from clients, and other stakeholders
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provides input and helps oversee the development and implementation of KCEC strategies, business plans and goals. Identifies problems, and introduces policies and procedures through an organized recommendation and acceptance policy directly with the COP
\xe2\x80\xa2 Oversees development and implementation of employee standard operation procedures. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintains good working relationships with the COP, Mangers, Functional Leaders, Senior Advisors, Consultants, staff and clients in Afghanistan and bolsters relations with the active prime-contractor and Oxus U.S. based operations. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Undertakes task directives from COP. Reviews daily, weekly, and monthly agenda and assists with received direction. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Meets or beats established deadlines. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Establishes and memorializes best practices and lessons learned. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Works a flexible schedule including long hours, nights and weekends. Comfortable living and working in Afghanistan and not averse to the changing security environment. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Reports directly to the COP. Receives periodic formal performance reviews from the COP as it relates to fulfillment of requirements outlined in the job functions.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Business Administration \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree in Business Administration or any relevant other relevant field, or higher, preferably MBA. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of 5 years of professional experiences in the relevant field, work experience with USAID funded projects in Afghanistan is an advantage.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work experience economic sector and private sector development would be an asset. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent oral and written communication skills in both English and local languages."

b'Receptionist Job Summary 1. WORK AS A BRIDGE: A Bank receptionist is like a bridge between the clients and bank personnel
2. BASIC DUTIES: He or she has to perform the basic duties of clerical which is a combination of administrative work, and banking tasks
3. PROVIDES CUSTOMER SERVICE: Bank receptionist has to provide customer service and must help customers with any queries and provide them with information and guidance needed. 
4. DOCUMENT MAINTAINANCE: He or she has to maintain the documents also and deal with supply management, file maintenance and record keeping.
5. HELPING CLIENTS: He or she has to help clients if knows more than one language in translating the interactions
6. Manages the phone desk throughout the day and channelize the calls to the right members of the staff.
7. Taking care of postal and courier consignments.
8. Any other tasks assigned by the line supervisor. Administrative DBA holder with one year of Experience (14th grade graduate), BBA preferable.'

b'Natural Resources and Infrastructure Statistics Analyst- Reannouce Job SummarySummary of the Position
The collection compilation and analysis of natural resources and infrastructure data Duties and Responsibilities
Preparing work plan in accordance with the general plan of the Central Statistics Organization (CSO) in order to achieve the goals set by the CSO
Preparation and arrangement of tables of statistical figures of natural resources and infrastructure for publishing in the statistical yearbook
Ensuring the accuracy and precision of statistical data about natural resources and infrastructure
Designing and developing standard questionnaires related to natural resources and infrastructure
Analysis of natural resources and infrastructure data taking into account the relevant SDG indicators
Writing technical reports on natural resources and infrastructure statistics
Completion and filling of questionnaires of national and international organizations in order to provide accurate information
Providing constructive advices to resolve the problems of the relevant department
Training and transferring knowledge skills and experience to the staff of relevant department
Performing other duties and tasks assigned by the top management in accordance with the laws and regulations of the organization
Training and transferring knowledge skills and experience to the staff of relevant department.
Qualifications and Experience: Natural Resources and Infrastructure Statistics Analyst would have the following qualification and work experience;
A Master degree with five years of relevant experience in Economics Environmental Sciences Agriculture Business Administration Mathematics Agricultural Economics Statistics or Engineering (Civil or Mining).
A bachelor degree with seven years of relevant experience in Economics Environmental Sciences Agriculture Business Administration Mathematics Agricultural Economics Engineering (Civil or Mining) or Statistics and Computer (Combined Degree).
Proficient user of MS Office and one of the statistical analysis software SPSS STATA and R
Strong communication skills.
Ability to work in a team.
Professional Competencies
Ability to exhibit strong commitment in the relevant disciplines
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English and working knowledge of national languages i.e. Dari and Pashto
Ability to work with and be a partner of a team of diverse backgrounds
Ability to work efficiently and to meet deadlines
Ability to function effectively in a team environment inspiring trust and cooperation of other team member
Strong communication negotiating skills and good interpersonal relationsTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Government Qualifications and Experience: Natural Resources and Infrastructure Statistics Analyst would have the following qualification and work experience;
\xe2\x80\xa2 A Master degree with one year of relevant experience in Economics, Environmental Sciences, Agriculture, Business Administration, Mathematics, Agricultural Economics, Statistics or Engineering (Civil or Mining).
\xe2\x80\xa2 A bachelor degree with two years of relevant experience in Economics, Environmental Sciences, Agriculture, Business Administration, Mathematics, Agricultural Economics, Engineering (Civil or Mining) or Statistics and Computer (Combined Degree).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient user of MS Office and one of the statistical analysis software SPSS, STATA and R
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong communication skills.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work in a team.'

b'(DRR) master trainer Job SummaryThe central role of this job holder is to ensure sound technical quality of all disaster risk reduction activities and supporting the participation of community in preparedness, mitigation and response initiatives under SIDA funded project. This will include thorough analysis of local disaster risks, and regular visits to project sites to support and stimulate communities to plan and consider how they can mitigate the impact of disaster and mobilize resources to implement mitigation plan, as well as establishing Eco- Disaster Management Committees in disaster prone areas and providing trainings on ECo-Disaster Risk Reduction and Emergency preparedness and Planning whenever required.
The post holder will lead and manage the planning and successful implementation of Afghanaid Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) programme at national level with particular emphasis on the implementation of ECo- Community Based Disaster Risk Management (CBDRM) approach at the provincial level \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate and support the provincial teams on planning, budgeting and implementation of Community Based Eco- Disaster Risk Management activities in Samangan, Ghor, Nangarhar and Badakshan provinces 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with Afghanaid other programme staff on mainstreaming DRR in to existing programme activities such as agriculture, livelihood, micro enterprise etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop ToRs and coordinate with partner organisations to organise and conduct DRR related capacity development trainings such as CBDRM, First Aid, Search & Rescue, Early Warning & Evacuation and community disaster preparedness etc 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with ANDMA, Provincial DMA, DRR National Platform and NGO DRR coordination body for advocacy and networking 
\xe2\x80\xa2 With the support of DRR specialist, develop Community Based DRR operational guidelines for field staff and work towards developing Afghanaid National DRR programme strategy
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work together with DRR specialist and partner organisations to develop DRR training modules and CBDRM manual for field staff 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in national level Technical Working Groups and contribute to the development of Strategic National Action Plan (SNAP) of the government of Afghanistan 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support ANDMA sub-national tiers at provincial and district level through their capacity development, supporting them to develop National, provincial and district disaster risk management plans through consultative process involving representatives of rural women and men
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support field staff to organise and conduct Hazard Vulnerability and Capacity Assessments (HVCAs) 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the field staff to develop community DRR plans based on the HVCAs and implement community level risk reduction activities 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work together with DRR specialist and relevant artists to develop and print disaster preparedness awareness materials such as posters, leaflets etc. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify training needs of the field staff and volunteers and  facilitate capacity development initiatives 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify best practices related to DRR and develop case studies and other knowledge management outputs for sharing and improvement of the programmes
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in national and international forums and contribute to the on-going debate to develop the DRR sector 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design, resource and deliver DRR-CBDRM capacity development strategy, plan and resources as part of the overall CBDRM strategy and plan, including planning and implementation of community awareness programme to reduce impacts of disaster risks on human life and productive assets (animals, crops, water, etc.); CD will be focused on staff, community-based DRR structures, and government institutions (e.g. district and provincial level tiers of ANDMA)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Working closely with relevant provincial teams and district teams members to integrate and mainstream DRR in the ongoing agenda and priorities of existing community and cluster level structures of informal governance (i.e. CDC, CLDC) including establishment of village DRR committees 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support community and cluster level governance structures to identify and prioritise appropriate CBDRM interventions to reduce vulnerabilities of communities to potential future disasters; develop medium term plans and support them to identify financial resources through government and non-governmental sources to fund these interventions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in Afghanaid internal meetings and discussions to develop systems, guidelines, programme approaches and project proposals 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the field staff to conduct emergency needs assessments as and when necessary. Plan and coordinate emergency response activities in consultation with the senior management 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Promoting Gender Equity and Diversity: To ensure that gender is fully taken into account in all aspects of the programme analysis, design and implementation.
Others:   To perform any other related duties as required by the line manager. Programme Education / Training Bachelor degree in a relevant field  Master degree in a relevant field 
Experience Minimum 3  years hands on experience of CBDRM and Eco- DRR at a middle level programming structure within an international NGO or a large national NGO Having working relationships and understanding of ANDMA at Kabul level, preferably also at provincial level 
Competencies, Skills & Abilities \xe2\x80\xa2 Hands on proven track record of Eco- DRR and CBDRM sector
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent written and spoken Dari and Pashtu
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to communicate well in English language 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Project cycle management experience
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrative evidence of skills in hazard and vulnerability mapping
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to lead rapid assessments 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Staff and community capacity development experience including designing capacity development medium term initiatives and delivering them for grassroots
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring and evaluation skills and experience
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to link with other players in the DRR and CBDRM sector working in the province including the government authorities
\xe2\x80\xa2 Computer literacy (word processing, power point, and basic excel)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to travel extensively 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Commitment to Red Cross Code of conduct and Sphere Standards
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience of preparedness work, especially around floods and droughts
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong team building skills and orientation of working in team setting
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work against tight timelines
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be able to resolve conflicts within community and team 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design and deliver capacity development initiatives
\xe2\x80\xa2 good report writing  \xe2\x80\xa2 Previous experience of having designed CBDRM projects for floods, landslides  and drought mitigation
\xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding of grassroots early warning systems 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of the district and provincial level DRR and CBDRM programmes including of PDMA be an added advantage.
Values & attitude \xe2\x80\xa2 Team approach
\xe2\x80\xa2 Respect for all views and opinions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Commitment to value of equality regardless of gender, faith and ethnicity
\xe2\x80\xa2 Respect for local communities and their ways of life 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Respect of government authorities  
Languages Dari and Pashtu, Uzbek will be a definite advantage'

b'Labour Statistics Specialist- Reannounce Job SummarySummary of the Position
The collection, compilation and analysis of statistical data of labour statistics, workforce statistics and labour market statistics. Duties and Responsibilities
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing work plan in accordance with the general plan of the National Statistics and Information Authority (NSIA) in order to achieve the goals set by the NSIA
\xe2\x80\xa2 Providing advices and technical assistance to the head of labour statistics 
\xe2\x80\xa2 The final check and control of numbers and figures related to labour statistics and labour market statistics for sake of ensuring their quality and put forward for publication
\xe2\x80\xa2 Studying and reviewing all the prepared data for the questionnaires of ministries, departments and other authorities before forwarding and also ensuring their precision and accuracy
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring data collection from ministries, departments and other authorities in order to overcome deficiencies, solving problems and accelerating the processes of data collection related to labour force and labour market data
\xe2\x80\xa2 Designing labour force survey and developing questionnaires for labour force survey 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Analyzing labour force data and produce labour force and labour market indicators 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Writing technical reports on labour force statistics and labour market statistics
\xe2\x80\xa2 Studying the annual statistical tables and standard forms to ensure that they are according to the plan and program of the NSIA
\xe2\x80\xa2 Making decisions after the realization of goals and programs of the organization and provide technical advices to the technical working environment of the relevant department
\xe2\x80\xa2 Training and transferring knowledge, skills and experience to the staff of relevant department
\xe2\x80\xa2 Performing other duties and tasks assigned by the top management in accordance with the laws and regulations of the organizationTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Government Qualifications
Qualifications and Experience: Labour Statistics Specialist would have the following qualification and work experience;
\xe2\x80\xa2 A Master degree with 1 year of relevant experience in Economics, Business Administration, Mathematics, Agricultural Economics or Statistics
\xe2\x80\xa2 A bachelor degree with 2 years of relevant experience in Economics, Business Administration, Mathematics, Agricultural Economics or Statistics and Computer (Combined Degree).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient user of MS Office and one of the statistical analysis software SPSS, STATA and R
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong communication skills.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work in a team'

b'Female Translator Job SummaryIn this context, MSF is recruiting Female Translator OBJECTIVES OF THE POSITION
As a translator: 
- Translate documents from / to mission language into a local one upon request 
- Translate discussions / meetings as requested 
- Always keep respect towards patients, collaborators, authorities, military factions and MSF staff participating in discussions. 
- Ensure confidentiality of all translation is maintained as directed by the Mission/Project coordination team 
- Ensure neutrality and accuracy when translating 
- Declare any \xe2\x80\x9cconflict of interest\xe2\x80\x9d when asked to translate (e.g. personal involvement) which would necessitate using other staff members for translation 
- Inform international staff about local customs, tradition, etc., that will help understand better the context and better communicate Translation MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS AND COMPETENCIES
 Education 
- High school diploma (12th class) essential 
- University degree desirable 
- Proficient user of MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) essential 
Experience 
- Other experience in similar position desirable 
Languages 
- Dari/Pashtu: oral and written essential 
- English: oral and written essential 
- English: knowledge of medical vocabulary is required.
WORKING HOURS AND SALARY
FULL TIME / ROSTER
Salary : 27,250 AFN / Gross Per Month (non negotiable)'

b'Driver Job SummaryTo be responsible for driving and maintaining of the vehicle assigned and for the safety of the passengers and cargo being carried and Ensure all vehicles are in good condition and functioning well and repaired on timely manner. Driving:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Drive the vehicle in a safe manner complying with all Afghanaid regulations and obeying all Road Traffic Acts and to ensure that security advice is obtained before any journey.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out daily and weekly checks on the vehicle as assigned and report any required repair and maintenance to the line manager.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the Vehicle is kept clean, tidy and in roadworthy condition.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fill out the Vehicle Log Books and have it signed for each journey.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Record the number of kilometres covered, fuel consumption, repairs and services done.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Report any damage, mechanical faults or mishaps that occur to the vehicle
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that passengers are driven to and from their destination in a safe manner
\xe2\x80\xa2 Comply fully with Afghanaid procedures on the reporting of accidents involving Afghanaid vehicles
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that loads and cargo are secure and transported safely
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the vehicle is parked safely at all times, especially on overnight assignments.  If necessary stay with vehicle when parked
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the vehicle is always parked at a Afghanaid compound or approved alternative
\xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out any other relevant duties as assigned by the immediate supervisor.
Mechanical
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that all vehicles in Head Office are maintained and checked on time on daily basis, all vehicles are repaired on proper manner and technical advice is given to the drivers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the daily checks of Head Office vehicles and need of spare parts and vehicles wiring system are work properly.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Having a well organised filing system including records of work done, staffing rosters, and performance reports
Reporting:
1. To provide monthly report of tasks for line manager as per need. Administrative \xe2\x80\xa2 12th class graduate is desirable and must have valid Afghan driving license.
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least 3-5 years driving work experience is required and skills in minor vehicle 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Repair and having knowledge of first aids are an advantage.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of driving rules and regulations
\xe2\x80\xa2 Working knowledge of English is required
\xe2\x80\xa2 fluency in Dari and Pashto is required
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to operate mobile telephones 
OTHER INFORMATION 
Afghanaid\xe2\x80\x99s core values are creativity, fairness and honesty. Our staff is passionate about and proud of their work and Afghanaid. Teamwork is fundamental to our standards and demonstrated by taking initiative, assisting others and taking on additional responsibilities / tasks if necessary. We are results driven, committed and motivated to achieve targets and take accountability for our own actions. Our remuneration and benefits package is competitive with other similar organisations. 
This position presents an excellent opportunity for someone who has the ambition and determination to move up in their career.
Other:
To perform any other related duties as required by the line manager.'

b'Telemarketing Officer Job SummaryTelemarketing officer will answer the phone calls, receive customer orders and solve customers problem over the phone \xe2\x80\xa2 Answer incoming calls from prospective customers
\xe2\x80\xa2 Receive orders over the telephone
\xe2\x80\xa2 Input order details into the computer system
\xe2\x80\xa2 Use scripts to provide information about product\xe2\x80\x99s features, prices etc. and present their benefits
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ask pertinent questions to understand the customer\xe2\x80\x99s requirements
\xe2\x80\xa2 Persuade the customer to buy by demonstrating how merchandise or services meet their needs
\xe2\x80\xa2 Record the customer\xe2\x80\x99s personal information accurately in a computer system
\xe2\x80\xa2 Communicate respectfully and politely with potential customers at all times Sales/Marketing Must have a high school degree.'

b"Marketing Officer Job SummaryThe Marketing Officer oversees the company\xe2\x80\x99s marketing campaigns both internally and externally and plays a key part in communicating the organizations marketing message. Preparing, planning, and project managing the publication of all publicity material to maximize brand promotion.
Creating marketing campaigns and working with the company's external PR agency to see them executed.
Creating and developing new innovative ways to communicate the company message to their existing customers.
Contributing to the annual sales and marketing plan.
Planning and project managing marketing events and evaluating their success.
Evaluating the effectiveness of all marketing activity.
Developing and implementing an internal marketing programme.
Supporting the marketing manager in day to day marketing activities.
Plan, develop and deliver campaigns as agreed within timescales. Sales/Marketing Previous experience in a similar marketing role.
Ideally, a degree in marketing although not essential.
Strong and confident communicator.
Excellent copywriting skills and experience.
Design skills including graphics and web design."

7. \xd8\xad\xd8\xb5\xd9\x88\xd9\x84 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb7\xd9\x85\xdb\x8c\xd9\x86\xd8\xa7\xd9\x86 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb2 \xd8\xaa\xd8\xa7\xd9\x85\xdb\x8c\xd9\x86 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xd8\xaa\xd8\xa8\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb7 \xd9\x88\xd9\x87\xd9\x85\xd8\xa7\xd9\x87\xd9\x86\xda\xaf\xdb\x8c \xd8\xa8\xdb\x8c\xd9\x86 \xda\xa9\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xda\xa9\xd9\x86\xd8\xa7\xd9\x86 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xaf\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xd9\x87 \xd9\x85\xd8\xb1\xda\xa9\xd8\xb2\xdb\x8c \xd9\x88 \xd9\x88\xd9\x84\xd8\xa7\xdb\x8c\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaa \xd8\xa8\xd9\x87 \xd8\xb5\xd9\x88\xd8\xb1\xd8\xaa \xd8\xb5\xd9\x88\xd8\xaa\xdb\x8c \xd8\x8c \xd9\x88\xdb\x8c\xd8\xaf\xdb\x8c\xd9\x88\xdb\x8c \xd8\xba\xd8\xb1\xd8\xb6 \xd8\xaa\xd8\xa7\xd9\x85\xdb\x8c\xd9\x86 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xd8\xaa\xd8\xa8\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb7\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaa \xd8\xa8\xd8\xa7 \xd9\x85\xd9\x82\xd8\xa7\xd9\x85 \xd8\xb1\xdb\x8c\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb3\xd8\xaa  \xd8\xac\xd9\x85\xd9\x87\xd9\x88\xd8\xb1\xdb\x8c \xd9\x88 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xaf\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaa \xd8\xb0\xdb\x8c\xd8\xb1\xd8\xa8\xd8\xb7\xd8\x9b
8.  \xd8\xad\xd8\xb5\xd9\x88\xd9\x84 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb7\xd9\x85\xdb\x8c\xd9\x86\xd8\xa7\xd9\x86 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb2 \xd8\xa7\xd9\x86\xd8\xaa\xd9\x82\xd8\xa7\xd9\x84 \xd8\xaa\xd8\xac\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xd8\xa8 \xd9\x88 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb7\xd9\x84\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb9\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaa \xd8\xaf\xd8\xb1 \xd8\xb1\xd8\xa7\xd8\xa8\xd8\xb7\xd9\x87 \xd8\xa8\xd9\x87 \xd8\xa7\xd9\x86\xda\xa9\xd8\xb4\xd8\xa7\xd9\x81 \xd9\x88 \xd8\xb1\xd8\xb4\xd8\xaf \xd8\xb3\xdb\x8c\xd8\xb3\xd8\xaa\xd9\x85 \xd8\xaa\xda\xa9\xd9\x86\xd8\xa7\xd9\x84\xd9\x88\xd8\xac\xdb\x8c \xd9\x85\xd8\xb9\xd9\x84\xd9\x88\xd9\x85\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaa\xdb\x8c \xd8\xaf\xd8\xb1 \xd8\xa8\xd8\xae\xd8\xb4 \xd9\x85\xd8\xb1\xda\xa9\xd8\xb2\xdb\x8c  \xd9\x88\xd8\xb2\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xd8\xaa \xd8\xa8\xd8\xa7 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb3\xd8\xaa\xd9\x81\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaf\xd9\x87 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb2 \xd9\x85\xd9\x86\xd8\xa7\xd8\xa8\xd8\xb9 \xd9\x85\xd9\x84\xdb\x8c \xd9\x88 \xd8\xa8\xdb\x8c\xd9\x86 \xd8\xa7\xd9\x84\xd9\x85\xd9\x84\xd9\x84\xdb\x8c\xd8\x9b
9. \xd9\x85\xd8\xaf\xdb\x8c\xd8\xb1\xdb\x8c\xd8\xaa \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb2 \xd8\xb7\xd8\xb1\xd8\xad \xd9\x88 \xd8\xaa\xd8\xb7\xd8\xa8\xdb\x8c\xd9\x82 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb3\xd8\xaa\xd8\xb1\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaa\xdb\x8c\xda\x98\xdb\x8c \xd9\x88 \xd9\xbe\xd8\xa7\xd9\x84\xdb\x8c\xd8\xb3\xdb\x8c \xd9\x87\xd8\xa7\xdb\x8c \xd9\x85\xd9\x86\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb3\xd8\xa8 \xd8\xa8\xd8\xb1\xd8\xa7\xdb\x8c \xd8\xa8\xd9\x87\xd8\xa8\xd9\x88\xd8\xaf \xd9\x88\xd8\xb6\xd8\xb9 \xd8\xb3\xdb\x8c\xd8\xb3\xd8\xaa\xd9\x85 \xd8\xaa\xda\xa9\xd9\x86\xd8\xa7\xd9\x84\xd9\x88\xda\x98\xdb\x8c \xd9\x85\xd8\xb9\xd9\x84\xd9\x88\xd9\x85\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaa\xdb\x8c \xd9\x88 \xd9\x86\xd8\xb8\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xd8\xaa \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb2 \xd9\xbe\xd8\xb1\xd9\x88\xd8\xb3\xd9\x87 \xd8\xaf\xdb\x8c\xd8\xb2\xd8\xa7\xdb\x8c\xd9\x86 \xd9\x88\xd8\xa7\xd9\x86\xda\xa9\xd8\xb4\xd8\xa7\xd9\x81 \xd8\xaf\xdb\x8c\xd8\xaa\xd8\xa7\xd8\xa8\xdb\x8c\xd8\xb3 \xd9\x87\xd8\xa7 \xd9\x88 \xd9\x88\xd8\xa8\xd8\xb3\xd8\xa7\xdb\x8c\xd8\xaa \xd8\xa8\xd8\xa7 \xd8\xaf\xd8\xb1 \xd9\x86\xd8\xb8\xd8\xb1 \xd8\xaf\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb4\xd8\xaa \xd9\xbe\xd8\xa7\xd9\x84\xdb\x8c\xd8\xb3\xdb\x8c \xd9\x87\xd8\xa7\xdb\x8c \xd9\x85\xd9\x88\xd8\xac\xd9\x88\xd8\xaf\xd8\x9b
10. \xd8\xb1\xd9\x87\xd8\xa8\xd8\xb1\xdb\x8c\xd8\x8c \xd8\xb3\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb2\xd9\x85\xd8\xa7\xd9\x86\xd8\xaf\xd9\x87\xdb\x8c \xd9\x88 \xd9\x85\xd8\xaf\xdb\x8c\xd8\xb1\xdb\x8c\xd8\xaa \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb2\xd9\xbe\xd8\xb1\xd9\x88\xd8\xb3\xd9\x87 \xd9\x86\xd8\xb5\xd8\xa8 \xd8\xb3\xd8\xb1\xd9\x88\xd8\xb1\xd9\x87\xd8\xa7\xd8\x8c \xd8\xb3\xd9\x88\xda\x86\xd9\x87\xd8\xa7\xd8\x8c \xd8\xaa\xd9\x84\xdb\x8c\xd9\x81\xd9\x88\xd9\x86 \xd8\xaf\xd8\xa7\xd8\xae\xd9\x84\xdb\x8c \xdb\x8c\xd8\xa7 (PBX) \xd9\x88 \xd8\xaf\xdb\x8c\xd8\xac\xdb\x8c\xd8\xaa\xd8\xa7\xd9\x84 \xd9\x88 \xda\xa9\xd9\x85\xd8\xb1\xd9\x87 \xd9\x87\xd8\xa7\xdb\x8c \xd8\xa7\xd9\x85\xd9\x86\xdb\x8c\xd8\xaa\xdb\x8c \xd8\xa8\xd9\x87 \xd9\x85\xd9\x86\xd8\xb8\xd9\x88\xd8\xb1 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb3\xd8\xaa\xd9\x81\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaf\xd9\x87 \xd8\xb1\xd8\xb3\xd9\x85\xdb\x8c \xda\xa9\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xda\xa9\xd9\x86\xd8\xa7\xd9\x86 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xaf\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xd9\x87 \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb2 \xd9\x88\xd8\xb3\xd8\xa7\xdb\x8c\xd9\x84 \xd9\x85\xd8\xaa\xd8\xb0\xda\xa9\xd8\xb1\xd9\x87.\xd8\x9b

b'Marketing Offer Job SummaryMarketing Officer is responsible for developing, implementing company strategic sales and marketing policies, plans and procedures in order to identify and attract potential customers and retain existing ones. \xe2\x80\xa2 2. Analyzing and forecasting the market demand.
\xe2\x80\xa2 3. Monitoring the market trend and competitors movement.

\xe2\x80\xa2 7. Reviewing and approving contacts terms and conditions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 8. Generating periodical reports for top management and manufacturer.
\xe2\x80\xa2 9. Representing Sales and Marking department inside and outside the company.
\xe2\x80\xa2 10. Preparing and executing Company\xe2\x80\x99s marketing strategy.
\xe2\x80\xa2 11. Event management and product launching. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 12. Conducting market researches and facts finding. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 13. Economic and political analyzing of the country situation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 14. Cooperation with company other departments. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 15. Visit the customers on a daily or weekly base to understand their needs and provide them with products

Advertising and promotional campaigns for products

b'Social Media Marketing Manager Job SummaryThe first order of business is to assess our current social media marketing processes and strategies. Along with the company stakeholders, the SMMM will create and implement the social media strategy framework that will be applied to each client engagement, including RTE\xe2\x80\x99s internal social media program. This position is far from boring! 1. Managing the social media marketing strategy for RTE and RTE\xe2\x80\x99s clients; focusing on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Google+, YouTube, SlideShare.
2. Execution of all social media activities (i.e. tweeting, sharing, engaging, liking, increasing social reach, doing the heavy lifting, etc) for RTE and RTE\xe2\x80\x99s clients.
3. Communicating in a professional, but unique social media \xe2\x80\x9cvoice\xe2\x80\x9d for each client; directly aligned with the clients\xe2\x80\x99 thought leadership and content platform.
4. Creating social media campaigns and calls-to-action that drive target buyers to client sites and generate leads for our clients.
5. Spending hours on LinkedIn every day engaging with our clients\xe2\x80\x99 target audiences by sharing content, finding ways to grow LinkedIn company followership, and improve overall engagement with our clients\xe2\x80\x99 LinkedIn Company Pages.
6. Staying ahead of the curve in leveraging LinkedIn as a professional social media network and as a content hub, such as leveraging LinkedIn Publishing Platform to understand influential content that is shared and the people who are sharing them.
7. Tweeting at least 30 \xe2\x80\x93 50 times a day while engaging influencers to increase the followership of our clients\xe2\x80\x99 social media profiles; receiving multiple mentions and retweets in the process.
8. Posting several Facebook posts each day and finding new ways to leverage Facebook for professional and business purposes.
9. Implementing Social Media SEO tactics aligned with our clients\xe2\x80\x99 keyword and SEO strategies.
10. Working within Hootsuite, Moz, FollowerWonk, dlvr.it and other social media tools.
11. Writing articles about B2B Social Media Marketing for RTE\xe2\x80\x99s inbound marketing blog.
12. Conduct competitive analysis studies on client competitors, including digital footprint analysis. Sales/Marketing 1. Graduated with 4 year degree with focus on Marketing or Journalism from a reputable university.
2. 2+ Years of Social Media Marketing experience in a corporate marketing or agency marketing role.
3. 2+ Years of Social Media Marketing in a B2B capacity. In other words, the primary target audience you\xe2\x80\x99ve been chatting up on social media over the past couple years are business people, professionals, decision makers, and industry thought leaders.
4. 2+ Years of Social Media Marketing experience on all major social media platforms \xe2\x80\x93 LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Google+, YouTube, and SlideShare.
5. Verifiable examples of social media marketing successes and wins.
6. Work as a full time employee remotely from your home office, which can be anywhere in US. We need someone who\xe2\x80\x99s dedicated, and \xe2\x80\x9cworking on the side\xe2\x80\x9d won\xe2\x80\x99t cut it.'

b'Sales & Marketing Manager Job SummaryThe sales and Marketing Manager is responsible for developing, implementing company strategic sales and marketing policies, plans and procedures in order to identify and attract potential customers and retain existing ones. Where he reports to both top management and manufacturer. 1. Developing and executing sales and marketing policies. 
2. Analyzing and forecasting the vehicles market demand.
3. Monitoring the market trend and competitors movement.
4. Communication with manufacturer for demand and supply related issues. 
5. Leading the sales team for their daily activities.
6. Participating in both  local and international biddings and negotiating with customers.
7. Reviewing and approving contacts terms and conditions.
8. Generating periodical reports for top management and manufacturer.
9. Representing Sales and Marking department inside and outside the company.
10. Preparing and executing Company\xe2\x80\x99s marketing strategy.
11. Event management and product launching. 
12. Conducting market researches and facts finding. 
13. Economic and political analyzing of the country situation.
14. Cooperation with company other departments. 
15. Any other jobs given by managing director.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Sales/Marketing 1. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Business Administration or Marketing is required; MBA in marketing is desirable. 
2. Five years\xe2\x80\x99 work experience in sales and marketing is required minimum three years should be in manager level.'

b'TAPI National Coordinator Job SummaryAbout TAPI Coordination Office:
The Turkmenistan- Afghanistan- Pakistan- India Natural Gas Pipeline (TAPI) project aims to export up to 33 billion cubic meters of natural gas per year through, a proposed, approximately 1,800 km pipeline from Turkmenistan to Afghanistan, Pakistan and India. 
The TAPI Project Office was established in 2016 and is tasked to work as a management, cooperating and coordination body between government of Afghanistan, TAPI Pipeline Company Limited (TPCL) and other stakeholders of the TAPI project. 
TAPI Project Office will work closely with all stakeholders to speed-up and pave the way for better coordination of TAPI activities inside Afghanistan, and represent Afghanistan in TAPI project stakeholders\xe2\x80\x99 meetings.
Moreover, the Office will serve as single source for managing, coordinating, reporting and overall cooperating with stakeholders on TAPI project related matters.
Job Summary:
The TAPI National Coordinator is responsible for organizing and coordinating TAPI Office operations and procedures in order to ensure organizational effectiveness and efficiency and project success and serves as key focal point for the Project at the Ministry of Mines and Petroleum. The TAPI National Coordinator will be responsible for assisting the Ministry of Mine and Petroleum and Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s team of TAPI mainly in following issues: 
1) Serves as key focal point for the TAPI project management issues with Ministry of Mines and Petroleum. 
2) Prepares action plan for substantial improvement of the support and administrative services in the MoMP to assume a timely progress of the Project. 
3) Management, supervision and control of the logistical operations of the Project on day-to-day basis in accordance to strategic plans and policies approved by the MoMP.
4) Managing the Project to ensure plans are effectively implemented, the results are monitored and reported to MoMP.
5) Familiarizes himself/herself with the relevant laws and regulation of Afghanistan and the requirements and relevant Operational Policies of the donors especially the WB.
6) Keeping the MoMP fully informed of all significant operational, financial, environmental and social issues and other matters relevant to the Project. 
7) Ensures the Project has developed and implemented relevant environmental and social safeguards management documents reflecting the Afghanistan National Laws and Regulation as well as the WB relevant safeguards policies. 
8) Oversees and manages the work of national and international consultants hired to prepare relevant environmental and social safeguards documents, prepares ToRs for the consultants to prepare potential ESIAs, RPF, RAP, ESMPs, GRM, Gender Awareness programs and etc. 
9) Exercise appropriate delegation and take final responsibility for the quality and consistency of all documents. 
10) Prepare coordination of all aspects of the relevant TAPI agreement with MoMP and relevant directorate as well as stakeholders of the Project. 
11) Develop the corresponding operating plans, review and report regularly to the MoMP on the overall progress and results against operating and financial objectives and initiate courses of action for improvement. 
12) Establish effective control and coordination mechanisms for all operations and activities, ensures the integrity of the internal control and management systems.
13) Liaising between all stakeholders in the GoIRA as well as external entities, as deemed necessary in the development of TAPI on behalf of GoIRA. 
14) Develop and recommend the overall project organizational structure to MoMP ensuring that personnel and systems are in place so that the day to day business affairs of the project are appropriately managed. 
15) Develop and recommend strategic plan to MoMP and successfully implement the corresponding annual operating plans.
16) Managing financial objectives by preparing an annual budget, scheduling expenditures, initiating corrective actions.
17) Direct and monitor the activities of the project in a manner that ensures that the assets of the project are safeguarded and optimized in the interests of the entire project.
18) Develop and implement operational policies to guide MoMP within any limits prescribed by the procedure and policies.
19) Ensures that he/she transfers knowledge and skills to other individuals and working teams in an effective regular manner in order to improve managerial ability, motivation and confidence. 
20) Coordinate, schedule and assist with MoMP and executive committee meetings and regularly report the project progress with achieving the project\xe2\x80\x99s objective. 
21) Develop action plan for social dialogue in areas where the pipeline passes. 
22) Liaising between the security sectors and consultations in the security plan. 
23) Collaborate with the relevant authorities in order to identify the necessary companies such as mine, buildings and etc. 
24) Cooperation and coordination with relevant agencies in order to identify those eligible for studying needed fields of TAPI in respective provinces. 
25) Continuous communication with Turkmengaz as consortium leader to identify problems and find solutions and make recommendations to the MoMP to solve problems. 
26) Communication with local communities in the pipeline area. 
27) Facilitate for registration of Afghan-TAPI Company and its structure in the future based on TAPI project leadership decision.
28) Participate on behalf of Afghanistan in technical meetings and supporting and coordinating the technical team of the sessions based on continuous interactions with the MoMP leadership.
29) Identify areas necessary for building of training centers in the pipeline route. 
30) Cooperation and coordination with Afghanistan team and other TAPI member\xe2\x80\x99s countries team in the areas of Afghanistan while administrative or research scale works. 
31) Arrange regular awareness meetings for the Afghan people and government about the TAPI project development and coordination of media in this regard. 
32) Any other duties given by supervisor. Management The candidate shall have an advanced (Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree) in Law, International Economic, Business Administration, Public Administration or other related fields. Preference will be given to the candidates with higher studies. 
Experience:  
Experience of working in related field at least 3 years (PhD\xe2\x80\x99s), 5 years (Master\xe2\x80\x99s) and not less than 10 years (Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s). Preference will be given to the candidates with additional years of experience.
Languages:'

b'Liaison Officer Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 All Marketing Activities 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Processing AGGC Invoices with Ministry of Finance 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Processing AGGC Taxes 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordination with Ministries and NPA
\xe2\x80\xa2 Processing AGGC Docs with AISA 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain a regular communication with the Ministries and other companies 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Set up meetings with companies and organizations as per requirement
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform any other duties assigned by the line manager General The Liaison Officer should have at least 3 years of working experience in a similar position, preferably with the private sectors or International NGOs. Excellent command of Pashto and Dari and good command of English\xe2\x80\x93 both written and oral is also necessary. He must also be familiar with software such as: Microsoft Word and Excel. Good communication skills \xe2\x80\x93 both written and interpersonal will be essential, as most of the work will be done through a process of consultation at all levels. Moreover, the candidate must know professionally to ride the motorcycle plus drive the car.'

b"Chief Operations Officer Job SummaryThe Chief Operations Officer (COO) is a senior role undertaking the leadership and management of AACS Consulting's complete operation-related activities, including financial, human resources, logistics and procurement. S/he will ensure that AACS Consulting's activities receive the best possible operational support while ensuring such activities are implemented in most efficient, client-friendly, safe, and professional manner. The incumbent will develop and revise sound operational policies and procedures while also continuously building operations staff capacity and skills. 1. Develop a bi-annual Operations Management Plan, determining action points for upgrading Company operations and optimizing resource utilization.
2. Establish and implement policies & procedures for sound, smooth and effective day-to-day operations of the company.
3. Plan, develop, organize, implement, direct and evaluate the company's fiscal function and performance.
4. Provide timely and accurate budget analysis, financial report and financial trends in order to assist management with decision-making.
5. Provide financial records and documents in timely manners for internal, external and government auditors and ensure that the company complies with all regulatory requirements.
6. Ensure that all operational activities are carried out in compliance with company's, Government of Afghanistan, and donor directives and applicable regulations and laws.
7. Provide technical inputs to proposals and concept notes in areas of expertise.
8. Brainstorm with AACS Consulting management and teams to identify innovative business ideas and develop plans.
9. Attend weekly management meetings at AACS Consulting and accompany management team to meetings with donors and clients as needed.
10. Supervise, manage and build An innovative capacity of Administration and Finance, Human Resources, Logistics and Procurement, and Compliance and Audit teams.
11. Other tasks as assigned by supervisor. Management \xe2\x80\xa2 Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Economics, Business Administration, Financial Management or a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree with an advanced certificate in a relevant field.
\xe2\x80\xa2 A minimum of ten years of progressively responsible work experience, including at least five years working with international organizations in Finance, Accounting, and Administration.
\xe2\x80\xa2 A minimum of two years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in managerial positions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated experience in developing and managing large-scale financial and administrative systems.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated interpersonal skills including diplomacy tact and the ability to negotiate and influence.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proven ability to mentor and build the capacity of junior staff and interns within the Company.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication skills in English a must: speaking, writing and listening.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to set priorities and manage time effectively.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Analytical and problem-solving ability.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to think strategically and to act in the best interest of AACS Consulting.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work both independently and as an effective team member.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advanced skills in Microsoft Office suite and QuickBooks a must."

b'Project Manager Job SummaryThe Project Manager is responsible for project management from inception to the end of the project, including reporting, project budget management, implementation and closeout of \xe2\x80\x9cEncouraging Innovation for Women\xe2\x80\x99s Empowerment in Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x9d project. The Project Manager is also accountable for the successful delivery of all project deliverables in a timely manner, \xe2\x80\x98on budget\xe2\x80\x99, and with the required results as specified in the donor agreement, including quality control, accuracy and timeliness of deliverables, while ensuring compliance with TAF and donor\xe2\x80\x99s requirements, policies and procedures.
Job Purpose 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Project management from inception to the end of the project.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Accountable for successful delivery of the project, ensuring that it is on time, on a budget, and with the required results as specified in the donor agreement. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strengthen implementing partners and short-term staff capacities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to development of M&E framework, and design activities in a manner which contributes to achieving the outcome and output indicators. Responsibilities: 
1. Provide advice and support to project management and implementation
\xe2\x80\xa2 Formulate project implementation & mobilization plans for target provinces/districts. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide management and oversee technical requirements, which includes program deliverables and results.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop work plans for the project, and ensure that the project is implemented in accordance with the specific work plans and schedule. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Establish and maintain appropriate project governance and controls, project gates, documentation, reports and information management. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure achievement of all project milestones within the planned timeframe.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review and evaluate incoming proposals from grassroots women\xe2\x80\x99s organizations (GWOs), acquire supplementary information/research as needed.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Seek endorsements and communicate with advisors on grant proposals.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Enhance and sustain grantee and advisor networks.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Write reports and prepare analyses from field reports of grant making activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the preparation of the grant making program budget.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Share administrative duties within the grant making team including database management and grants administration.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop strategic grant making priorities for different provinces and districts.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design and conduct institutional capacity building support for recipients of funding based on their own understanding and analysis of their needs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Align the project with national commitments and priorities on women\xe2\x80\x99s rights and influence fulfilling these commitments. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design and implement the annual survey on women\xe2\x80\x99s empowerment to evaluate the impact of the project on the overall goal of improving women\xe2\x80\x99s empowerment in Afghanistan.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review partners\xe2\x80\x99 narrative and financial reports to ensure they are accurate and matching the requirements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Respond to all project reporting requirements, including monthly, quarterly, bi-annually and annual program reports, and other deliverables, as specified in the contract.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to fundraising initiatives, including assisting in the writing of proposals.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee performance management of project staff, technical experts and consultants and ensure compliance with TAF and donor\xe2\x80\x99s rules and regulations and policies, and provide timely feedback to them.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design a closeout plan and prepare project closeout report.
2. Advocacy and promotion of Foundation\xe2\x80\x99s mandate and mission 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage events and publications on project related issues contributing to strengthening women\xe2\x80\x99s voice and leadership in Afghanistan.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strengthen Foundation\xe2\x80\x99s networking with grass roots women, women networks/alliances and other relevant organizations to develop grant making and programmatic partnerships and collaborations.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate and represent in relevant forums, conferences and trainings. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support formulation of strategies and monitor progress towards the achievement of project goals. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Implement relevant, high-impact advocacy campaigns with key partners. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to knowledge networks at the provincial and local level. 
3. Budget & financial management 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop project budgets and ensure spending projections are kept up-to-date, expenditures are within approved budgets, that spending targets are met, and that appropriate steps are taken in managing the project budget in accordance with the donor agreement. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Lead on initiating relevant procurement processes in line with programme spending and procurement planning.
4. Monitoring, evaluation, accountability and learning 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Director WEP with ongoing reviews and evaluation of whether initiative is reaching the right target group and achieving its goals. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure, in conjunction with the M&E staff an effective monitoring & evaluation, accountability and learning of the entire project, including meeting the progress of the Key Performance Indicators.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute towards shared learning initiatives including documentation of best practices emanating from the project.
5. Internal and external relations
\xe2\x80\xa2 Extensive interaction with Director WEP, project teams and relevant departments. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Represent the programme along with the Director WEP and project staff in meetings, and with government and implementing partners. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain healthy relationship with government agencies/line departments and cooperating organizations operating in the districts and provinces of the operation
6. Identify problems or risks
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify any potential issues or risks that could affect the progression of the programme(s). 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Must communicate these items with the Project Manager, and work to identify potential solutions.
7. Communication
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain good communication with colleagues and implementing partners.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Checking that everything is working smoothly, and alerting the Project Manager if they endanger the programme(s). Management Knowledge/Qualification
\xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in related field, or equivalent work experience.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Sound knowledge of women\xe2\x80\x99s empowerment, gender equality, women\xe2\x80\x99s voice and leadership concepts.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiarity with risk management and quality assurance control.
Experience 
\xe2\x80\xa2 A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience at the national level in women\xe2\x80\x99s empowerment programmes, community organizations, advocacy and or grant-making.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in providing capacity building services and establishing/maintaining networks or alliances.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated project design and management experience.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated experience in advocacy, monitoring and evaluation of development projects.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated experience in developing of project work plans and budgets.'

b'Project Manager Job SummaryUNCDC is seeking an individual for the position of Project Manager (PM). The incumbent will be part of the Project Support Team (PST). He/she will be responsible to ensure the project is managed efficiently and achieves its operational objectives and deliverables. The incumbent will report directly to UNCDC Managing Director and plays a lead role in developing UNCDC projects in designated infrastructure disciplines, including water, energy, roads and vertical structures, and monitors work progress and prepares reports and other key documents for the UNCDC Senior Management and Managing Director. The incumbent plays an important technical role in the design, analysis; project development and management and data collection for UNCDC designated infrastructure activities. The PM\xe2\x80\x99s tasks will be as follows: 1) Develop an in-depth working knowledge of the general contractual and detailed requirements of the construction contract for each project.
2) Observe the execution of construction to assure adherence to approved drawings and specifications, inspect construction workmanship, materials, methods of equipment, and report as to the conformity and non-conformity to the approved drawings and specifications. 
3) The Project Manager is responsible for the overall project activities on site.
4) Supervise the on-site monitoring and evaluation of UNCDC construction projects, ensuring that they are being implemented according to designs, schedules, and budgets; advise and supervise the implementation of remedial measures, when necessary.
5) Make recommendations on how to correct deficiencies and resolve problems during construction. 
Responsible for all operational aspects of the projects.
6) Overseeing the daily operations of the projects to ensure accurate and correct progress of the projects.          7) Ensuring procurement procedures and financial requirements are being met.
8) Keep the main office updated on the work progress and other issues on site.
9) Review and Edit of design documents and project specifications.
10) Review all the submittal and tests at all stages of the inspection.
11) Ensuring all the materials used and work performed are as per the project requirements and specifications.
12) Day-to-day management of the site, including supervising and monitoring the project labor force and the sub-contractors\xe2\x80\x99 works.
13) Work independently and maintain daily construction surveillance logs ensuring contractor\xe2\x80\x99s compliance with the terms and conditions of the contract between the construction contractor and the UNCDC.
14) Review and analyze contractor\xe2\x80\x99s change order proposals for cost and compliance with the change. Prepare cost of alternatives to design and specifications when requested.
15) Update and monitor contractor construction schedule with regard to ongoing construction, review any proposals for change in construction methods for time implications. 
16) Submit recommendations, including recommending the amount of time for extensions that are justified by the change.
17) Review and provide comments for contractor monthly pay applications including issues such as percentage of completion, accounting accuracy, and materials stored onsite.
18) Prepare weekly, monthly, and other reports of the progress of construction as required. Provide digital photographic records to support reports.
19) Review and analyze material samples, catalogs and brochures, shop drawings, installation manuals, and other technical documents submitted by the construction contractor for conformity with construction contract requirements. Prepare written reports of the analysis, incorporating the comments, and provide recommendations and alternatives for appropriate action.
20) Participate in meetings and conduct discussions with local/municipal & security authorities, as appropriate, on matters pertaining to construction site activities when requested.
21) Oversee all the engineering and project management activities of UNCDC (project identification and definition, technical feasibility assessment, engineering design, environmental compliance, construction supervision, operation and maintenance, planning and implementation, and handover of completed projects), including the preparation of the necessary project documentations for client approval and post-implementation audit.
22) Assessment of potential developments and production of detailed technical reports, including site visits with the appropriate members of the management team to ensure the best cost engineered solution is produced for UNCDC projects.
23) Lead, motivate, communicate with, appraise and performance, develop and manage the project personnel to ensure all the personnel are fully motivated to achieve best performance to meet the UNCDC needs.
24) Plan, coordinate and/or supervise activities of projects and sub-contractors from initial contraction stages to completion of punch list and provide drawings to site on a weekly basis & as appropriate.
25) Co-ordinate production information to a written program to ensure company targets are met for a controlled and cost effective finish to the sites.
26) Production of engineering site feasibilities as instructed by the clients to ensure complies with the required standards and business needs; and implement new ideas and methods and continue to seek ways of both improving contribution to the UNCDC goals and enhancing the reputation of the company.
27) Participate in internal meetings and discussions as required by UNCDC senior management and comply, and assist in enforcing compliance, with project code of ethics, policies, rules, and procedures.
28) Assist in the tendering and sub-contracting of UNCDC construction projects and disseminate standards, procedures, and guidelines for construction supervision, including project progress monitoring and evaluation, certification of interim completion, quality control and assurance, environmental-impact mitigation, and health and safety.
29) Develops technical and financial proposals for UNCDC different projects by assembling information including project nature, objectives/outcomes/deliverables, implementation, methods, timetable, staffing, budget, standards of performance, and evaluation; writing, revising, and editing drafts including executive summaries, conclusions, and organization credentials as required.
30) Perform other engineering support duties that may be requested. Liaison with UNCDC main office, coordinate services as required. Engineering a) University degree in Civil Engineering or construction management with 2 years of related experience in handling USACE projects or overall experience of not less than 3 years in the field of construction management and supervision. Prior international donors experience is preferred. 
b) Knowledge and ability to interpret engineering drawings and implement the field works.
c) Sufficient knowledge of USACE rules, regulations, and procedures desired.
d) Fluent in English. Have good command of English language both written and spoken. Candidates who do not have sufficient English language knowledge will be disqualified.'

b'Construction Manager Job SummaryTo lead a team of MTP1-002 for successful and on time completion of Project considering the contents of the contract, requirement set forward by the Project Manager and the Employer and policy of the company. Construction Manager will have the following duties and responsibilities:
- Assist Contractor Representative in Management of the contract,
- Preparing daily, weekly, monthly workplan and reports,
- Read the contract and manage the entire works of the project accordingly,
- Prepare and submit the submittals and obtain approval,
- Communicate with PM and the Employer,
- Manage the subcontractors,
- Supervise the works of site engineers, foremen, QC and Safety officers, Electrical and Plumbing, Engineers, surveyor, Lab technician, etc.
- Communicate with designers about the designing works and obtain approvals,
- Any other works related to the project. Engineering - Construction of Pump House with installation of 3 x 850 m3/h horizontal pumps including all mechanical and electrical works,
-  Construction of two suction concrete tanks, 1000 m3 capacity each
-  Construction of Generator House including installation of 1 x 1.5 MW generator and fuel tank
-  Construction of Chlorination House including all mechanical and electrical works
-  Construction of 7 nos Pump Stations and Gen Set Houses including installation of submersible pumps and Generators.'

b"Marketing Manager Job SummaryMarketing Manager is responsible for developing, implementing and executing MEC strategic marketing plans in order to attract potential clients and retain existing ones. She will be responsible for developing pricing strategies, identifying new clients, supporting lead generation efforts, categorizing the advertising tactics and creating promotions. \xe2\x80\xa2	Attract new students across the MEC\xe2\x80\x99s portfolio of programs 
\xe2\x80\xa2	Publicize the strengths of the academic faculties, institutions and overall educational zones.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Promote the profile of the campus as a whole to external audiences and vendors
\xe2\x80\xa2	Developing a pricing strategy that maximizes profits and market share but considers client satisfaction.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Understanding and developing budgets, including expenditures, research and development appropriations, and return-on-investment and profit-loss projections in order to maintain the risk benefit ratio.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Developing and managing advertising campaigns and organizing conferences, trade shows and other major events .
\xe2\x80\xa2	Organizing organization conferences, trade shows, and major events.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Building brand awareness and positioning.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Evaluating and maintaining a marketing strategy.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Directing, planning and coordinating marketing efforts.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Communicating the marketing plan.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Developing each marketing campaign from start to finish.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Researching demand for the organization's services.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Evaluating competitors.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Handling social media, public relation efforts, and content marketing.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Establishes marketing goals based on past performance and market forecasts
\xe2\x80\xa2	Ensure execution and maximization of corporate promotional kits at each campus location & programs.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Schedule special events, tastings and encourage student participation in each promotion program
\xe2\x80\xa2	Act as journalist, capturing photos and writing summaries of events for social media and client reviews
\xe2\x80\xa2	Write, distribute and provide newsletters to client partners
\xe2\x80\xa2	Provide social medial posts for the kindergarten, high school, institute and university marketing liaison. 
\xe2\x80\xa2	Conduct audits to ensure compliance with uniform, packaging, merchandising and customer service standards
\xe2\x80\xa2	Build a strategic social media plan that aligns with Complex strategic plan
\xe2\x80\xa2	Create a weekly/monthly calendar of social media posts that align with key events and programs
\xe2\x80\xa2	Generate, edit, publish and share daily copy and visual content  for MEC Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and the MEC website updates.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Create content for each post including images, videos, graphics
\xe2\x80\xa2	Provide analysis and recommendations for future plans to ensure continued success and improved performance
\xe2\x80\xa2	Promotes MEC's work and policies among print and electronic media nationally and internationally to ensure MEC\xe2\x80\x99s visibility.
