b"Senior IS Audit Officer Job SummaryInternal auditing is an independent, objective assurance and consulting activity designed to add value and improve an organization's operations. It helps an organization accomplish its objectives by bringing a systematic, disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of risk management, control, and governance processes. 
To that effect, the Senior Information Systems (IS) Audit Officer, is responsible the internal controls and risks of a FINCA Afghanistan technology network. He/she shall act in a lead role FINCA Afghanistan IS audit and all technology Innovations, designs and develops audit procedures, reviews and evaluates work of associates and, recommends and submits reports on identified corrections and controls in need of improvement. He/she shall also be involved in the planning and execution of internal audit procedures and the creation of internal audit reports and must work within a team to create a solid information technology infrastructure, and collaborate with staff to devise and put in place policies and procedures regarding network security issues. He/she shall maintain all organizational and professional ethical standards and ensures internal audit activities are carried out in compliance with ISACA\xe2\x80\x99s IT audit standard.  Works independently under general direction with extensive latitude for initiative and independent judgment. I. THE PROCESS OF AUDITING INFORMATION SYSTEMS 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and implement a risk-based IT audit strategy in compliance with IT audit standards to ensure that key areas are included.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Plan specific audits to determine whether information systems are protected, controlled and provide value to the organization.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct audits in accordance with IT audit standards to achieve planned audit objectives. Report audit findings and make recommendations to key stakeholders to communicate results and effect change when necessary.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct follow-ups or prepare status reports to ensure appropriate actions have been taken by management in a timely manner.
II. It Governance and Management 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the effectiveness of the IT governance structure to determine whether IT decisions, directions and performance support the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate IT organizational structure and human resources (personnel) management to determine whether they support the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the IT strategy, including the IT direction, and the processes for the strategy\xe2\x80\x99s development, approval, implementation and maintenance for alignment with the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the organization\xe2\x80\x99s IT policies, standards, and procedures, and the processes for their development, approval, implementation, maintenance, and monitoring, to determine whether they support the IT strategy and comply with regulatory and legal requirements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the adequacy of the quality management system to determine whether it supports the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives in a cost-effective manner.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate IT management and monitoring of controls (e.g., continuous monitoring, QA) for compliance with the organization\xe2\x80\x99s policies, standards and procedures.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate IT resource investment, use and allocation practices, including prioritization criteria, for alignment with the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate IT contracting strategies and policies, and contract management practices to determine whether they support the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate risk management practices to determine whether the organization\xe2\x80\x99s IT-related risks are properly managed.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate monitoring and assurance practices to determine whether the board and executive management receive sufficient and timely information about IT performance.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the organization\xe2\x80\x99s business continuity plan to determine the organization\xe2\x80\x99s ability to continue essential business operations during the period of an IT disruption.
III. Is Acquisition, Development and Implementation
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the business case for the proposed investments in information systems acquisition, development, maintenance and subsequent retirement to determine whether it meets business objectives.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the project management practices and controls to determine whether business requirements are achieved in a cost-effective manner while managing risks to the organization.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct reviews to determine whether a project is progressing in accordance with project plans, is adequately supported by documentation and status reporting is accurate.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate controls for information systems during the requirements, acquisition, development and testing phases for compliance with the organization's policies, standards, procedures and applicable external requirements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the readiness of information systems for implementation and migration into production to determine whether project deliverables, controls and organization's requirements are met.
Conduct post-implementation reviews of systems to determine whether project deliverables, controls and organization's requirements are met.
IV. Is Operations, Maintenance and Support
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct periodic reviews of information systems to determine whether they continue to meet the organization\xe2\x80\x99s objectives. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate service level management practices to determine whether the level of service from internal and external service providers is defined and managed.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate third party management practices to determine whether the levels of controls expected by the organization are being adhered to by the provider.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate operations and end-user procedures to determine whether scheduled and non-scheduled processes are managed to completion.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the process of information systems maintenance to determine whether they are controlled effectively and continue to support the organization\xe2\x80\x99s objectives.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate data administration practices to determine the integrity and optimization of databases.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the use of capacity and performance monitoring tools and techniques to determine whether IT services meet the organization\xe2\x80\x99s objectives.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate problem and incident management practices to determine whether incidents, problems or errors are recorded, analyzed and resolved in a timely manner.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate change, configuration and release management practices to determine whether scheduled and non-scheduled changes made to the organization\xe2\x80\x99s production environment are adequately controlled and documented.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the adequacy of backup and restore provisions to determine the availability of information required to resume processing.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the organization\xe2\x80\x99s disaster recovery plan to determine whether it enables the recovery of IT processing capabilities in the event of a disaster.
V. Protection of Is Assets
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the information security policies, standards and procedures for completeness and alignment with generally accepted practices.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the design, implementation and monitoring of system and logical security controls to verify the confidentiality, integrity and availability of information.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the design, implementation, and monitoring of the data classification processes and procedures for alignment with the organization\xe2\x80\x99s policies, standards, procedures, and applicable external requirements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the design, implementation and monitoring of physical access and environmental controls to determine whether information assets are adequately safeguarded.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the processes and procedures used to store, retrieve, transport and dispose of information assets (e.g., backup media, offsite storage, hard copy/print data, and softcopy media) to determine whether information assets are adequately safeguarded.
VI. Other duties:
\xe2\x80\xa2 To follow and implement Global Corporate audit methodology and techniques, applicable at subsidiary level.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To determine whether organizational units in the FINCA Afghanistan are performing their planning, operational, accounting, custodial, or control activities in compliance with management instructions, applicable statements of policy and procedures, and in a manner consistent with both organizational objectives and high standards of administrative practice.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To plan and execute functional, process and field audits in accordance with accepted standards.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To report audit findings and to make recommendations for correcting unsatisfactory conditions, improving operations, and reducing cost.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To perform assigned special reviews according to the given scope. Banking \xe2\x80\xa2 MA/MS in Business Administration, Accounting, Computer Science, Information Systems Administration or related field. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) required. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Internal auditing or forensic certification a plus."

\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Hurricanes and tornadoes - ability to evaluate the lateral force system and areas of local stress.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Flood or dam collapse.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Fire or explosion.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Landslide or avalanche.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Transportation accidents.
5. Knowledge of the appropriate types of structural hazard reduction methods for various types of collapsed
structures, including:
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Shoring and bracing and availability of appropriate materials.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Removal of collapsed structural components and hazards, or debris removal.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Methods for creating safe havens.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Identification of unsafe areas that must be restricted.
6. Knowledge of victim access methods, including:
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0How and where to penetrate various building types to minimize risks.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Effects of lifting large structural components and the ability to calculate weights for rigging and lifting
operations.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of safe rescue practices and procedures.
7. Must have completed the FEMA Structural Specialist Course.
Skills
1. Currently licensed as a structural engineer or equivalent as sanctioned by the FEMA US&R Advisory
Committee.
2. A minimum of five years experience in structure design and analysis to include evaluation of existing
structures, field investigation or construction observation experience.
3. Ability to identify vertical load and lateral force resisting framing systems and be able to identify the critical
elements within those systems.
4. Ability to identify failure indications of building materials, including:
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of how basic building materials and framing systems perform.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of how building materials typically fail under various loading conditions.
\xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of typical falling and collapse hazards from previous failures.
5. Ability to identify building features that could provide entry or access to victims such as ducts, shafts,
etc.
6. Able to recommend practical solutions for US&R operations in compromised structures.'

b'Senior Electrical Engineer Job SummarySenior Electrical Engineer will be the project\xe2\x80\x99s lead person in the implementation of Central Utilities like Power House, Power Distribution, Sanitary Sewer collection and Distribution system along with buildings construction. The Safety Manager is primary responsible for effective implementation of Infrastructure and reconstruction project activities at the field level. Provides technical assistance as Safety Manager to Project manager and all Project team.
The SM compiles all the field level and monitoring information and assists the PM in periodical project report preparation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparation of superior quality electrical construction documents including drawings, specifications, and reports for buildings in retail, restaurant, office, multifamily residential, and institutional market sectors
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design power, lighting, fire alarm, and telecommunications plans including all associated circuitry, details, one line diagrams, and specifications
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform photometric calculations, load calculations, fault current, and any other calculations required to support electrical design
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review electrical documents for areas of conflict with all building systems
\xe2\x80\xa2 Close coordination with the client and the entire design team, including owners, architects, contractors, members of other disciplines, and internal support staff to ensure the design is consistent with the client\xe2\x80\x99s vision, to ensure a fully coordinated interdisciplinary design, and to ensure the design schedule is maintained
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with equipment vendors and manufacturers\xe2\x80\x99 representatives for selection and specification of appropriate equipment
\xe2\x80\xa2 Play an active role in project meetings with clients and colleagues
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide mentoring and guidance for colleagues
\xe2\x80\xa2 To notify the Department Director of upcoming projects.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To market and promote services offered by Fundy Engineering in the field of Electrical Engineering.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To attain copies of \xe2\x80\x9cRequest for Proposals\xe2\x80\x9d and prepare documentation and Fee Estimates for these proposal call-ups.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To establish the needs of the client and to coordinate with other disciplines and office personnel to ensure that these requirements are met.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To assist and mentor support staff in the fundamentals of Electrical design, calculations and preparation of construction documentation
\xe2\x80\xa2 To provide technical assistance and respond to contractor\xe2\x80\x99s inquiries that relate to construction projects.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To prepare technical reports, construction cost estimates and cost analysis.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To coordinate and schedule / plan the projects with support staff to ensure timely completion.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To respect company values and policies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare material cost and timing estimates, reports, and design specifications for electrical building systems and equipment.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Inspect the installation, modification, testing, and operation of electrical equipment
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare contract documents and evaluate tenders for construction or maintenance.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supervise technicians, technologists, programmers, analysts, and other engineers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design of lighting, power, data, communication, security, and fire alarm systems Construction Master Degree in electrical is required..
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
\xe2\x80\xa2 Capable of designing and troubleshooting digital electronics and communication electronics down to the chip level.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Capable of designing and troubleshooting analog electronics for line voltage power supply circuits (linear and switching), low voltage power supply circuits, low voltage analog electronics for data acquisition and sensor instrumentation, and embedded communications circuitry.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Logical approach to performing competitive product assessments.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Providing mentorship to junior staff.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiar with SMT and Thru Hole electronics manufacturing
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiar with PCs, Microsoft Office, etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiar with Oscilloscopes, DVM Meters, Function Generators, etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Handy with a soldering iron in addition to other hand and small power tools necessary for designing, prototyping and testing electronic products
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiar with schematic capture design packages and simulation tools
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiar with developing product that communicates over RS232/485 and/or Ethernet networks.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiar with PCB layout design. Ideal to have had previous experience designing PC Boards while guiding other resources in this person\xe2\x80\x99s current role to accomplish the task.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with agency testing such as UL, CSA, ETL, FCC, CE, etc
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiar with simulators, emulators, programmers, and other software design tools
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiar with assembly and/or C programming for Microchip or Freescale-based microprocessors.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiarity with Orcad Schematic Capture and PCB design tools. Familiarity with AutoCad a plus
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiar with wireless RF communications design employing WIFI, BlueTooth, EnOcean, Zwave, ZigBee or 6LowPAN.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with building management/home automation control systems including communications via RS232, RS485, Ethernet, LonWorks, Bacnet, wireless, etc which control or even integrate HVAC, lighting, security and other aspects of the building environment.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with motor control electronics.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to supervise technician resources
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in developing apps for use with Android and/or iOS platforms'

\xe2\x80\xa2 Handling of PT cash.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing of monthly activity report.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Follow up M16\xe2\x80\x99s and allotment with budget and SDU Department in MoF.

b'Re - Secretary/Translate Job SummaryThe Secretary/Translate works under the overall guidance of the KCRRP Project/PMU Director. The Secretary/Translate is responsible for all the Secretary work, translation and Interpretation assignments of project. Specific responsibilities and duties include but are not limited to;
    Undertake a range of translation and interpretation assignments in English and from English into Dari or Pashto, ensuring that the meaning of the source text is retained.
    Undertake a range of translation   and interpretation assignments in Arabic and from Arabic into Dari or Pashto, ensure that the meaning of that source text in retained.
    Provide accurate and complete versions of documents, such as magazine articles, legal documents, official letters, reports, manuscripts, publications and other material, using the most appropriate range of vocabulary commonly accepted and according to grammar, punctuation and mechanics of the target language (English, Arabic or Dari/Pashto).
    Proofread, edit and correct translations in order to provide to the Editor Corrector a high quality translation, for him to provide the final edition
    Contribute to the development and preparation of multilingual glossaries used by Secretary/Translates and interpreters
    Use of special dictionaries, thesauruses and reference books to find the closest equivalents for terminologies and words.
    Meet deadlines as established by the Supervisor.
    Maintain administrative work in connection with all translation assignments
    Assist in the preparation for presentations.
    Tracking and following-up of pending issues with staff and other entities.
    Assist in maintaining close contacts with the government, executing agency, project partners, and other counterparts through direct contacts, collection and summarizing of information, proposals, incoming and outgoing documents, drafting letters.
    Supervise collecting the data and other information for project activities; maintaining, logging, filing and updating records in prescribed format for subsequent use.
    Contribute to the preparation of status and progress reports. Prepare background material for use in discussions and briefing sessions.
    Assist in monitoring project activities by reviewing a variety of records, including correspondence and reports.
    Assist in the organization of and logistical preparation for workshops, seminars, presentations, etc.
    To do any other tasks, assigned by his/her supervisor
    Follow up logistical arrangement for staff missions and other travel arrangements. Update the mission log on the common drive.
    Organizing travel arrangements and hotel bookings for staff and visitors.
    Carrying out any other duties that may reasonably or exceptionally be required to ensure the smooth cooperation of KCRRP\xe2\x80\x99s work and optimize the functioning of the office, such as substituting for absent colleagues.
    Responsibility to operate KCRRP telephone switchboard by receiving, giving and dispatching office telephone communication to the relevant recipients.
    Receiving and dispatching all office communication by e-mail, fax, post, diplomatic bag, etc. Distributes incoming traffic to the relevant recipients for action or information (assures copying and further distribution).
    Maintaining appropriate logs and chronological files of all written traffic as well as the general archive of the office.
    Daily Check the incoming & outgoing mail and the diplomatic pouch on due time.
    Providing secretarial services as required by KCRRP personnel (i.e. write correspondence, phone calls, photocopies, etc.)
    Arranging appointments of the KCRRP/MPW and/or other personnel if required.
    Secretarial support for other country offices in the region when needed.
    Unofficial translation upon request.
    Maintaining a dairy and arranging day-to-day activities for the Project director.
     Monitoring and processing all incoming and outgoing correspondence on internal memos, business letters, e-mails and faxes for the Project director.
     Screening all telephone calls, ensuring that appropriate parties receive the information for the Project director.
    Writing letters & reports, sending mails and typing confidential works for the Project/PMU director.
    Responsible for manager\xe2\x80\x99s dairy and replying his calls, mails and faxes.
    Booking an air ticket for the Project director, if needed.
    Handling the executive office of the Project director.
    Keep records, control and scheduling appointments for Project director.
    Responsible in set up & maintain an effective filing system for the Project director\xe2\x80\x99s Office.
    Typing all documents and reports for the Project director as required.
    Excellent command of speaking, writing and typing in English and Arabic.
    Administrative support for the organization of the IDB and Constancy meetings and workshop including request of offers, analysis of received quotation/s, logistics requirements, accommodation and travel arrangement, etc.
    Follow up, maintenance and distribution of the office stock of stationery by maintaining a log book for the said items and share the information with the Logistics Team.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces General Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Business Administration, Literature English/Arabic'

b'Security Manager to Implement BC&DRP; Job SummarySecurity Manager will be responsible for monitoring the security situation, issues and operations for the organization. He will be responsible to implement security policies, regulations, rules and norms and make sure that the environment in the organization is safe for the staff, operations and visitors. He will also manage the security guards at the branches as well as check and monitor the access control of the people visiting these offices. He will also be responsible for implementing security protocols, creating emergency response procedures, conducting security evaluations, supervise security guards and keep track of different events. Implementation of OXUS Afghanistan security Plans
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that all staff adheres to security procedures
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all newly inducted staff are aware of the security protocols as well as provide them basic necessary training
\xe2\x80\xa2 Regular security briefing to the staff and management. Update and refresh the briefings
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure OXUS Afghanistan security management plans are regularly updated 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct security and risk assessments for all operational areas (as required) and propose new operational areas
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work in coordination with the security consultant 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Arrange for the visits of OXUS Branches inside Kabul (at least 05 branches) and in the regions (at least 02 regions) by the consultant
\xe2\x80\xa2 Implementation of the recommendations by consultant in security upgrades review document
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the installation of security cameras and completion on time manner
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the construction of strong rooms and completion on time manner
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the relevant teams for the procurement of the required material for security upgrades
\xe2\x80\xa2 Get complete security trainings and drills from the consultant as master trainer
\xe2\x80\xa2 Impart the training to all the relevant staff of OXUS inside Kabul and in the regions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Continuously monitor the security situation in Kabul as well as in the regions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keep in contact with the relevant departments, offices and individuals to get regular security updates
\xe2\x80\xa2 Disseminate the security updates/information to OXUS management on regular basis
\xe2\x80\xa2 Security protocols and arrangements for any expats visiting OXUS Afghanistan
\xe2\x80\xa2 The Security Manager should ensure that there is appropriate, up-to-date training of all staff on security and safety policies, and that policies are written and disseminated in HQ and branches. 
- Infrastructure Management
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct premises security assessment and make recommendations
\xe2\x80\xa2 Follow-up of renovations/upgrades linked to the security
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain emergency equipment (supplies for emergency lock-down, security alarms, surveillance cameras, emergency exits, safe rooms and fire extinguishers) as appropriate
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure good standards of health and security are being observed (as appropriate for security)
-Transport (in conjunction with Logistic\xe2\x80\x93Transport)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure OXUS Afghanistan vehicles are equipped with required security equipment and supplies
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure regular refresher trainings for OXUS Afghanistan drivers are being arranged (about how to respond in security, safe driving, general awareness and behavior)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure maintenance and follow up of automated tracking system
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure24hoursavailabilityof vehicles (with rivers) with required equipment and supplies especially for senior management and any expats (if on-board)
-Travel
The Security Manager will be required to visit the all the branches in Kabul as well as in the regions on regular basis in order to impart security trainings, check their security protocols, arrangements and setup are in place and based on the situation in these areas, if any security change or up-gradation is required, ensure to carry out with the approval of the competent authoritiesTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Banking a) At least 08 to 10 years of professional experience at in the similar position or in security installations, security operations and BCP related areas
b) Knowledge of security environment and hazards
c) Must be a local national
d) Must have related IT training
e) Experience of working with any multi-national or international organization
f) Must have strong communication and interpersonal skills
g) Must be physically fit and active'

b'Legal Advisor Job SummaryThe Legal Advisor is responsible for the all duties & Responsibilities that are explained in the below section. 1. To solve the legal issues and problems between employee, customers and management of Bank-e-Millie Afghan.
2. To provide and find the legal ways for the legal problems which are important and which have to be solved.
3. Proceeding and progress in the process of getting and borrowing money from legal ways and achievements to the problems that accrued during and among these matters.
4. Correction of contracts and terms and conditions among employee people and Bank-e-Mille Afghan and all governmental and personal or nongovernmental organizations.
5. Following and sending the files and achievements to the issues that have to be solved in the related court and providing aid and help to achieve to those matters in the related court of Afghanistan or other institutions related to this matter.
6. After permission of the respected directorate traveling to other provinces and solving the problems which will happen related to possessive lands and other personal properties of Bank-e-Mille Afghan.
7. Reading and reviewing some existence files and during implementation of that, giving legal view and idea related to permitted and given matters.
8. Help and legal cooperation with all departments related to the respected directorate of Bank-e-Mille Afghan
9. Cooperation and advice to the Loans Collection department and provide them legal rules to collect money.
10. Writing and filling of all contracts according to the term, condition and records of the cases with mutual cooperation of all related departments and their management, completion.
11. Investigation and expression of the opinion in the possessive land contracts and other properties of Bank-e-Millie-Afghan under the lease agreement with a person or any other construction organization.
12. Investigation of the contracts and termination of the agreement and contracts of land and properties of Bank-e-Millie-Afghan and giving legal opinion for further progress in the term and condition of the contract of mentioned land.
13. Receive, and equivalencies and attestation of the legal documents of the person who is under lease contract of the land or properties with Bank-e-Millie-Afghan.
14. Reviewing and making sure of the properties of the people and implementation of the term and conditions of the lease or other contract according to the documents of Bank-e-Millie-Afghan.
15. Serious investigation and observation of the duration and termination of the loan contracts and making right and suitable decision against the people who do not making payments according to the terms and conditions of the contract.
16. Correction and preparation of legal documents against those people who are not obeying the orders of the contract and do not submitted to the bank the properties under lease or other agreement to sale and to collect loans. Also the related court is ordering for mutual investigation about the debate and reasoning of them. It is sure that the prepared documents must be submitted in the court of Afghanistan.
17.   Making normal and regular relation and contacts according to justification in these cases.
18.   According to the permission of respected directorate receiving and investigation to legal completion and requesting cases of employees of Bank-e-Millie-Afghan.
19. Receiving to solve those cases where employees of the bank situated under the rumor of stealing money and making sure about the stolen money cases and clearances of those cases.
20. Implementation and performances of all orders that are permitted from respected directorate of Bank-e-Millie-Afghan to the legal advisory department.
21. Protection and security of those files that is helpful to perform the duties of legal advisory department.
22. . Any other task or duty assigned by the CEO. Banking Bachelor degree in law and also Preference is given to higher degrees. 
At least Three-years experience in the related field
Fluency in English, Dari/Pashto, written as well as spoken ability 
Required computer skills ( MS. Windows and MS. Office program) 
Comprehensive knowledge of laws, regulations and other legal documents of the country.'

b'Alternative Delivery Channel Manager Job SummaryThe ATM Manger is responsible for properly managing and maintaining efficient ATM services and operations. The ADC Manager is responsible for administering the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s Automated Teller Machine (ATM) products, operational systems, and services. The ADC Manager will provide oversight regarding the handling and managing of the ATM\xe2\x80\x99s electronic fund transfer. This individual will assist customers with all ATM related issues including, but not limited to, account related problems and fraudulent transactions.
All issues will be handled in accordance with guidelines. The ADC Manager is also responsible for evaluating the daily performance of the ATM\xe2\x80\x99s operational services and recommending upgrades and maintenance accordingly. 1. The ATM Manger is responsible for properly managing and maintaining efficient ATM services and operations. This individual will be held accountable for the administration of quality services. 
2. Network marketing and advertising are a crucial factor in improving ATM services. As the ADC Manager, you will work closely with vendors and management, in regards to appropriate ATM placement.
3. The ADC Manager will be able to reflect back on their experience, to provide valuable insight and make informed decisions regarding how the organization could plan and achieve benchmark goals and objectives. This individual should possess a number of very important leadership qualities, as they are in charge of directing the work of fellow employees. They should be able to effectively communicate with employees and top management. 
4. Provision of assessment allows the ATM Manger to determine the organizations current and future needs, regarding the operation of ATM services. The ADC Manager will be highly effective in recommending certain changes and is a critical component in implementing all new operational or service related processes. New approaches will be monitored and evaluated, and results will be communicated to top management.
5. The ADC Manager establishes a set of goals for the department and the organization. The ADC Manager sets goals that help contribute to the organization\xe2\x80\x99s growth, by implementing and enforcing strategies that aim to optimize organizational operations and services. Operational services include support for debit and credit card production, deposits and withdrawals, retail business banking.
6. Preparation of written proposals and performance of cost benefit analysis, as well as risk analysis in conjunction with the organizations current policies and procedures, is the responsibility of the ADC Manager. This individual will negotiate pricing of certain products and services, in order to increase the amount of revenue generated from ATM related products and services, thereby contributing to the maximization of the organizations profitability. Effective strategies and techniques that work will be recommended accordingly.
7. The ADC Manager is responsible for administering the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s Automated Teller Machine (ATM) products, operational systems, and services. The ADC Manager will provide oversight regarding the handling and managing of the ATM\xe2\x80\x99s electronic fund transfer. This individual will assist customers with all ATM related issues including, but not limited to, account related problems and fraudulent transactions.
8. All issues will be handled in accordance with guidelines. The ADC Manager is also responsible for evaluating the daily performance of the ATM\xe2\x80\x99s operational services and recommending upgrades and maintenance accordingly. Banking \xef\x82\xa7 The successful candidate will be a driven energetic individual with a positive can do attitude and will come with a good track record within the cash businesses.
\xef\x82\xa7 With a good knowledge of operational and services issues and relevant experience, the candidate will have the ability to develop, manage and invest in his team. The candidate will plan, direct, manage and oversee all aspects of the ATM operation and services including technical and operational. 
\xef\x82\xa7 Must have excellent knowledge of the industry and have a sound understanding of the leading technology, operations and business partners needed to run ATM operations successfully.
\xef\x82\xa7 The candidate will support and achieve financial objective of the business in coordination with the Cash/vault Services Manager and keep operations within budget.
\xef\x82\xa7 Setting key performance measures for the team for monitoring the performance of ADC department.
\xef\x82\xa7 Educated to Bachelor Degree or MBA level will be an advantage.
\xef\x82\xa7 An educational qualification in ATM engineering or business related degree.
\xef\x82\xa7 Minimum 3-4 years of experience in a similar role within the Cash business
\xef\x82\xa7 Autonomous and results orientated, with a clear determination to succeed.
\xef\x82\xa7 Excellent communication (written and verbal), interpersonal and negotiation skills.
\xef\x82\xa7 Capable of working effectively and productively with senior team members.
\xef\x82\xa7 Ability to maintain strong ethical and professional values.
\xef\x82\xa7 Excellent command of written and spoken English and local languages
\xef\x82\xa7 The ability to operate in diverse cultural environments.'

b'Female Procurement Analyst Job SummaryTo enhance ANDSF Capabilities and Performance regarding procurement actions within the Ministry of Defense. 1. Participate in all assigned update meetings at the direction of the requiring activity.
2. Within 30 days of assignment, be familiar with all Afghanistan Procurement Laws, Decrees, and Policies.
3. Within 30 days of assignment, develop an internal work plan to accomplish statements of work (SOWs) or performance work statements (PWSs), to include strategies to develop, implement, assess, and modify ANSF acquisition policies, procedures, and core competency processes.
4. Support TAACs when issues arise related to ANSF regional contracting agencies.
5. Train the ANSF on methods of managing and auditing contracts and the procedures for interacting with, and being assessed by a COR.
6. Train ANSF acquisition personnel on PWS/Statement of Work (SOW) and QASP development and execution.
7. Support ANSF contracting personnel on how to prepare requirement packages, conduct bidder/vendor conferences, analyze and evaluate proposals, negotiate contract provisions, develop awards, administer contracts, and negotiate and coordinate additions, deletions, or modifications to contracts. Contractor procurement mentors shall not make decisions on behalf of Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan (GIRoA) with relation to these functions.
8. Support ANSF on how to manage the procurement system and data-flow from ANSF contracting sites to the Ministerial approval authorities, in order to ensure transparency and accountability of funds from contract-award to contract close-out.
9. Provide Support to Afghan acquisition agencies and procurement departments on a full range of acquisition core competencies to include, but not limited to: requirements validation and acquisition prioritization; acquisition financial management; development of request for proposals (RFPs) and other contract solicitations for materiel and services; processes for source (vendor) bid evaluation and selection and award; contract inspection and audit; certification of the delivery of articles and services; preparation and acceptance of material and services receiving reports; processes for vendor payment; and processes encompassing contract closure.
10. Support ANSF contracting personnel on the methods of continuously improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the vendor pay process.
11. Support the ANSF contracting personnel in the development of a contracting training program to include written products such as lesson plans and training plans.
12. Assist the ANSF contracting personnel with contract-closeout procedures.
13. Assist ANSF contracting personnel in the development of contract tracking policies and procedures. Assist ANSF contracting personnel in the development of contract specifications, work statements, and terms and conditions used for procurement of specialized materials, equipment, and services.
14. Assist ANSF officials with acquisition planning, and with the development of acquisition strategies that require both contracted, and organic solutions.
15. Coordinate and conduct training classes with ANSF contracting personnel.
16. Provide a critical link to Ministerial Procurement and Finance Advisors in support of efforts to transition contracted requirements from a Coalition Forces to an Afghan lead contracted requirement.
17. Attend procurement training encompassing Afghan-specific procurement laws and procedures, principles of Afghan contract oversight and execution, and insight toward Afghan culture and business practices.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Procurement 1. Two (2) years of direct contract acquisition experience or a minimum of 5 years of Contract Management or Contract Administration experience at a Government agency
2. Must be capable of operating independently and responsibly, as well as an integrated member of a team. Superior writing, computing, and communications skills.
3. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree from an accredited institution in Finance, Economics or business discipline.
4. Excellent computer literacy skills in MS Office (Word and Excel) and QuickBooks.
5. Experience of financial management, including accounting software.'

b"Admin Associate (SB3/2) Job SummarySummary of Key Functions:
Implementation of operational strategies
Efficient administrative support
Support to supply and assets management
Support to administrative and financial control
Support to common services
Coordination of Registry and Receptionist functions
Support to knowledge building and knowledge sharing 1) Ensures implementation of operational strategies, focusing on achievement of the following results:
Full compliance of administrative activities with UN/UNDP rules, regulations, policies and strategies.
Provision of inputs to the ROICO administrative business processes mapping and implementation of the internal standard operating procedures (SOPs).
Preparation of administrative team results-oriented work plans.
2) Ensures efficient administrative support, focusing on achievement of the following results:
Organization and coordination of shipments and customs clearance
Coordination of travel arrangements. Performing a Requestor role in Atlas for preparation of Requisitions for travel and other administrative expenses.
Organization of workshops, conferences, retreats
Coordination of DSA, travel agencies, and other administrative surveys, surveys for organization of common services.
Support with protocol matters, registration of staff, coordination with local authority on space and other administrative matters.
Supervision of cleaning services.
Coordination of transportation services, regular vehicle maintenance and insurance.
Checking and certifying of vehicle daily log and gas consumption, update and maintenance of vehicle history report.
Prompt reporting and investigation of cases of vehicle accidents, damage, loss or theft of items; update and maintenance of vehicle history report.
Research and retrieval of statistical data from internal and external sources; preparation of statistical charts, tables and reports.
3) Provides support to proper supply and assets management, focusing on achievement of the following result:
Control and management of assets in the RO; timely preparation and submission of periodic asset and inventory reports.
Coordination of the provision of reliable and quality office supplies.
4) Provides support for effective administrative and financial control in the office, focusing on achievement of the following results:
Maintenance of administrative control records such as commitments and expenditures.
Confirmation of availability of funds prior to review by supervisor; creation of vendor setup information in Atlas;
Effective management of cash funds (cash custodian), and elaboration of timely cash reports.
Maintenance of data integrity in the database, control programme; analysis of results and initiation of corrective actions when necessary.
Coordination of common premises/services cost-recovery arrangements.
Proper control of supporting documents of funds and activities. Provision of the information for the audit.
5) Ensures proper common services focusing on achievement of the following result:
Maintenance of common services/office space management to ensure integrated activities on common services and implementation of the UN reform.
6) Coordinates implementation of Registry and Receptionist functions, supervises Registry Clerk and Receptionist, focusing on achievement of the following results:
Provision of efficient general reception and information services.
Provision of reliable registry services.
Management of pouch service in the RO
7) Supports knowledge building and knowledge sharing in the CO, focusing on achievement of the following results:
Training of staff on the administrative procedures
Briefing/debriefing of staff members on issues relating to area of work
Sound contributions to knowledge networks and communities of practice.
8) Support regional office representational function where requested.
Impact of Results:
The key results have an impact on the efficiency of the unit. Accurate analysis and presentation of information, thoroughly researched and fully documented work strengthens the capacity of the office and facilitates subsequent action by the supervisor. Incumbent's own initiative is decisive in results of work and timely finalization. Management Education:
Secondary education.
Certification in administration desirable.
University Degree in Business or Public Administration desirable,
requirement.
Experience:
6 years of relevant experience in administration or programme support service. Experience in the usage of computers and office software packages (MS Word, Excel, etc.).
Experience in handling of web-based management systems."

b'Deputy Coordinator Job SummaryThe Deputy Coordinator has two major areas of responsibility \xe2\x80\x93 management of the center and programming. Work will be done with the support and collaboration of the staff of the Public Affairs Section of the U.S. Embassy, Kabul and implementing partner Social Development and Research Organization for Afghans. The candidate is required to ensure the integrity of the LLC\xe2\x80\x99s financial operations and make sure the operations adhere to the existing policies of the organization and donor requirements. Center Management: 
1. Assist the Coordinator in management of the center \xe2\x80\x93 Responsible for daily opening/closing and maintaining scheduled hours of operation.
2. Serve your customers in a thoughtful way and be considerate of the users at LLC. 
3. Assist the Coordinator to ensure that everyone has access to the center and nothing prohibits them from using the services. 
4. Assist the Coordinator with maintenance of the collection and equipment.
5. Assist the Coordinator to make sure software are up to date and NO illegal software is installed, and password protect computers. 
Programming: 
6. Assist the Coordinator to create and conduct program activities to include speakers, discussion groups, cultural events, and regular classes in English, computer training and any other topic of interest to the local population.
7. Attract volunteers and diverse speakers for programs.
8. Assist the Coordinator to conduct outreach activities (e.g. fliers, event notification, visits to schools)
9. Participate in the online community of American Corners.
10. Work to improve operations and outreach to result in increased user attendance at LLCs and at programs.
Budget Management and financial reporting: 
11. Manage center procurement as per standards. 
12. Assist the Coordinator with all financial documents and see that all financial transactions are sufficiently supported. 
13. Ensure that all policies and procedures are adhered to. 
14. Maintain files for vouchers and other departmental correspondence.
15. Any other assignment given to him by his/her supervisor. Management At least one year of university study in Social Sciences, bachelor degree is given priority and substantial or significant relevant experience may be substituted.
One to three years of work experience'

b'Freelance Training Consultant/Trainer Job SummaryThe Freelance Trainer is primarily responsible to plan, design, organize and delivery of short term trainings to VEER clients. In addition, the consultant is responsible for training evaluation, follow up and learning verification activities and report writing.  The trainer is responsible for facilitation of VEER activities at the national level, with technical support provided by VEER management. \xe2\x80\xa2 Contributes to designing and development of quality training materials for use in training activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design/develop training material. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Deliver training for VEER clients
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the quality of training, through participation in sessions, post-training interviews with participants, review of evaluation forms filled out by participants, and other methods. Utilize the monitoring information for improving the quality of training within VEER.   
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop tools for training impact assessment. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Write report on subject matter delivered training. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to the development of training strategic plan.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares periodic reports for the Training.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct training need assessment if needed. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Introduce tools and consistently collect feedback on training effectiveness from perspective of all the stakeholders including trainees, trainers, line managers, senior managers.  Utilize the feedback for improvement of training.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Partner with line managers and direct supervisors for supporting employees after training to assist them in application of new skills obtained from training. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist training participants in preparation of individual development plans of participants, assisting in preparation and arrangement of coaches Training \xe2\x80\xa2 Masters\xe2\x80\x99 degree in their respective profession and have at least 4 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience \xe2\x80\x9cin training needs analysis/assessment, design/development of training programs, delivery of training courses and evaluation of training programs profession or training consultancy is highly preferred\xe2\x80\x9d.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Masters\xe2\x80\x99 degree in their respective profession and have at least 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience \xe2\x80\x9cin training needs analysis/assessment, design/development of training programs, delivery of training courses and evaluation of training programs profession or training consultancy is highly preferred\xe2\x80\x9d.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Training of Trainers participant certification desirable;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Instructional design knowledge highly desirable'

b'Proposal Writer Job SummaryA proposal writer duties involve researching, writing and organizing ideas, conducting interviews, reviewing products or services, creating strategies, working with graphic designers and presenting proposals. 
Prepares business proposals, business plans, quotations, by determining concept; gathering and formatting information; writing drafts; obtaining approvals. she will participating in key review meetings / final document review, content sign off and document production. Experience of coordinating and updating a knowledgebase system is beneficial.Excellent research skills and the ability to write persuasively and articulately are essential. \xe2\x80\xa2 Determines proposal concept by identifying and clarifying opportunities and needs; studying requests for proposal (RFPs), request for quotation (RFQs), ITBs and attending strategy meetings.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Meets proposal/quotation deadline by establishing priorities and target dates for information gathering, writing, review, and approval; entering and monitoring tracking data; coordinating requirements with contributors; contributing proposal status information to review meetings; transmitting proposals.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Gathers proposal/quotation information by identifying sources of information; coordinating submissions and collections; identifying and communicating risks associated with proposals.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develops proposal by assembling information including project nature, objectives/outcomes/deliverables, implementation, methods, timetable, staffing, budget, standards of performance, and evaluation; writing, revising, and editing drafts including executive summaries, conclusions, and organization credentials.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares presentation by evaluating text, graphics, and binding and coordinate printing.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Obtains approvals by reviewing proposal with key providers and project managers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Improves proposal-writing results by evaluating and re-designing processes, approach, coordination, and boilerplate; implementing changes.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; maintaining personal networks.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Accomplishes organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Concept development of the organization
\xe2\x80\xa2  Lead and/or run the proposal creation process for the responses of MEC developments in conjunction with RFPs and RFIs (requests for information) received.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and maintain compelling, persuasive RFP content
\xe2\x80\xa2 Build compliant outlines for RFPs/RFIs
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in developing and maintaining a proposal/Business plan content library
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work with the proposal team to support the sales team with client-facing, written communications
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review proposals/Business plans to ensure a precise product ready for client review; proofread for content, grammar, style, formatting; edit, organize, and pull attachments and exhibits
\xe2\x80\xa2 Consistently implement MEC brand messaging, including tone, style, and theme, within all responses. Effectively demonstrate and promote the MEC value proposition
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with MEC\xe2\x80\x99 subject matter experts to inform responses to RFPs and/or to support the maintenance of content organized in knowledge base, including its technical accuracy
\xe2\x80\xa2 Write clear, persuasive, and articulate proposal sections; translate technical and other ideas into easily understandable text; rewrite and review proposal sections and related proposal documents.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Under the direction of the Line Manager, interview technical SMEs, Program Managers, Task Leads, and other technical personnel to collect technical and methodology information and incorporate that information into developing winning proposal content
\xe2\x80\xa2 Thoroughly review all proposal response volumes and sections, ensuring written consistency (one voice) in the final proposal after review of various team and technical inputs
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain and update proposal archives/databases, boilerplate past performance documents, and repository
\xe2\x80\xa2 Rewrite technical material and coordinates with technical personnel to ensure accuracy
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate with functional areas, business areas, subcontractors and others to research and develop data required for technical proposal development.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform searches on reusable material and support data calls as requested by capture/proposal team
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage past performance questionnaires (PPQs)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Lead formatting, editing, production, and submission activities
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in the creation of graphics, covers, spines, labels, and org/flow charts
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develops and maintains a strong understanding of investigator research programs across the institution.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Researches governmental funding agencies and private foundations including funding priorities, pay lines, and awards to advise investigators on funding fit and development of successful proposals
\xe2\x80\xa2 Researches funding opportunities and disseminates targeted funding announcements to investigators and departments
\xe2\x80\xa2 Edits proposals for readability including structure, usage, syntax, tone, active voice, and formatting
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develops budget justifications, writes non-scientific narrative such as facilities, institutional resources, and other allied sections of large applications
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develops templates, boilerplate narrative, and related faculty grant writing resources and tools
\xe2\x80\xa2 Draft letters, Memorandum of Understanding, and other institutional communication as needed to support applications and faculty nominations.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manages multiple projects and work flow to ensure on-time submissions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform all other duties as assigned and required. Technical  Proposal Writer needs at least a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Marketing, Economics, Journalism, Communications, Public Relations or related field (MBA preferred). At least 5 years of experience with bachelor and 3years with master\xe2\x80\x99degree directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Overall 5-15 yrs experience. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 8+ years in proposal writing and concept development 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with scheduler programs such as Primavera and MS Project manager is a plus'

b'Technical Adviser & Quality Controller Job SummaryTechnical Adviser & Quality controller main duties & responsibilities is to perform diagnostic assessment, coordination with technical & management team and overall supervision of general repair job.
On job technical training is another key roles to be executed based on requirement and regular explanation of the most difficult task to technicians either theoretical or practical within training center should be conducted.
Overall TA/QC is the technical key staff to resolve any technical issue and cooperate with technical and Management team to retain customer\xe2\x80\x99s satisfaction. 1. Perform diagnosis as per Service Advisor request at reception stalls.
2. Carry out more technically difficult jobs and provide supervision or support to technicians.
3. General Repair list re-check, confirm and submission to Service Advisor.
4. Perform visual inspection upon completion of each job.
5. Report FTR (Field Technical Report) to Service Advisor in case of any.
6. Perform every task of Foreman/Controller on his absence.
7. Arrange work schedule with service advisor and parts dept.
8. Final Road Test will be performed to fully assure himself before handing over the vehicle
9. Confirm completion of job to service advisor.
10. Provide technical explanation or advice when required to service advisor/customer.
11. Technical training should be conducted for technicians (theoretical & Practical)
12. Periodical report to Aftersales Manager
13. Any additional task assign by Aftersales ManagerTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Technical  1. Certification of Diagnostic Technician (DT) / Diagnostic Master Technician (DMT) or equivalent'

b'Social Safeguards Specialist Job SummaryThe social safeguards specialist shall be responsible for: a) being able to fulfil the duties and mainstreaming Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF), Resettlement Policy Framework (RPF) b) identify the potential social safeguards issues within the project activities; c) provide technical assistance on mitigation strategies for the potential negative social impacts; d) identify training needs at different levels of HEDP project and of clients and advising on how to fulfil the ESMF  and RPF and citizen Engagement requirements; e) Coordinating environmental and social commitments and initiatives with relevant government agencies.
The salary for this position is based on NTA salary scale Grade C. 1) Ensure that the project activities follow the guidelines of the ESMF and RPF into overall project operations. 
2) Prepare screening list through field observations in order to identify the potential social safeguards issues and prepare a schematic diagram/base map of each scheme and mark the socio-environmental features of the scheme on the diagram.
3) Prepare the site-specific ESMPs based on environmental and social screening survey and field observations considering the ESMF guidelines, the ESMPs will include Monitoring Plan (MPs).
4) Guided by the ESMF and RPF, conduct environmental and social monitoring of the sub-project in association with engineering staff and ensure the implementation of recommendations prescribed in the ESMPs.
5) Ensure that the land acquisitions approaches are in full compliance with project ESMF and PRF and ensure proper recoding of land documents and prepare abbreviated Resettlement Action Plan if required. 
6) To provide technical assistance to clients on mitigation strategies and requirements for the potential negative social impacts.
7) Provide training to HEDP Project\xe2\x80\x99s staff on overall ESMF and RPF trainings and awareness raising of contractors on their immediate requirements to ensure compliance with ESMF and RPF.  
8) Support the project team on implementation of Citizen Engagement mechanisms and ensure the delivery of satisfaction surveys with the level of affordability and reliability of services.
9) Ensure implementation of Grievance Redress Mechanism which will include the grievance handling procedures, channels, grievance database in order to ensure that all registered complains are addressed properly.  
10) Prepare Grievance Redress Mechanism training materials which to be disseminated among the project staff and project beneficiaries and establish functional GRM system.
11) Conduct training and awareness raising of the project staff and contractors on GRM utilization and functionally.
12) Prepare safeguard training plan which will cover the social safeguard, environmental and GRM aspects.
13) Ensure that grievance redress mechanism (GRM) is functional and its outcome is   included in reporting system.
14) Conduct a cross-checking and vetting of specification conflicts, tender, and contract documents, making them suitably orientated towards the social needs of the residents in the area.
15) Help strengthen capacity for managing Social concerns of the relevant staff and the contractors working with HEDP project.
16) Develop safeguards reporting formats and maintaining social records on established formats.
17) Develop and submit the safeguards monitoring reports to project director on monthly basis; which to be reflected in the progress report to the World Bank.
18) Contribute to capacity building for project staff and partner agencies, training and other dissemination efforts on social safeguards.
19) Addressing the social inclusion of the poor, vulnerable and excluded groups/students and ensuring compliance with social safeguards are included in regular reporting mechanisms.
20) Work closely with environmental safeguards colleague(s) and maintain close linkage for flow of information between the World Bank and the project regarding safeguard issues in project implementation.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Technical  \xe2\x80\xa2 Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in the Social Sciences or Social Development from a recognized university. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Good knowledge of computer packages, including MS Power Point, MS Word and Ms. Excel is required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Full working knowledge (in writing and orally) of English and Pashto and/or Dari.'

You will communicate with employees, stakeholders and customers to ensure our company\xe2\x80\x99s technologies are used appropriately. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure smooth operation and maintenance of the OFC (Optical Fiber Cable) and Copper Cable network.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare standard Operating procedure (SOP) for all departments under this position. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify necessity of any network expansion/upgradation ahead of time based on usage of data.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare Annual Activity Plan/Procurement Plan and resource requirement plan for wire line division.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong Bachelor Degree in Information and Communication Technology/Computer Science  
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least 8 years experience in Optical Fiber Cable Network and fixed line Switch network
\xe2\x80\xa2 Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree will be highly preferred'
