b"Gender and Social Safeguard Officer Job SummaryUnder the overall supervision of the Head of Environmental and Social Management Unit, the Gender and Safeguard Officer is responsible to assist and support the ESMU and the provincial office in the preparation Woman Consultation guideline, and make sure that the women along the project corridor have been consulted properly and their views and comments have been considered in the project documents, Environmental and Social Impact Assessment (ESIA) and Environmental and Social Management Plan (ESMP) and Resettlement Action Plan. Gender mainstreaming into project components along with collection of gender disaggregate data. \xe2\x80\xa2 Under the direct supervision of head of ESMU, the Gender and Social Safeguard Officer will be responsible for the following:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure dissemination of information to women/ PAPs as proposed in the ESIA, RAP and other documents. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Head of Section to oversee the environment and social issues considering gender perspective along the project's corridor. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate with provincial ESM officer for ensuring women participation in the implementation of the ESM provisions especially social development issues during ESMP and RAP implementation, and application of PRA-based community mobilization as per the standard procedures. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop women consultation guideline and procedures in order to integrate gender consideration into project plan design and implementation and improving rural access for women.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out Assessment of women affected by the project; assess vulnerability and entitlement issues and coordination of RAP implementation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify gender and women inclusion training needs of the key counterparts and support the Head of ESMU in the development and delivery of identified trainings.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct awareness and capacity building training for the women GRCs and women participation in the project. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Present and facilitate understanding of gender integration and mainstreaming at the project and Identify opportunities for women participation in projects and make recommendations to the Head of ESMU/PMT on appropriate measures to be taken. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure of proper GRM functionality with the project implementation and women participation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the implementation of gender-specific labor-based works in projects to ensure the smooth implementation of activities. Where implementation challenges arise, coordinate as per GRM procedures to identify appropriate solutions and facilitate the implementation. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the Head of ESMU and provide input related to gender issues and mainstreaming within project activities into any ad hoc progress reports, briefs, periodical reports, and statistical data as required by the project management.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the participation of women\xe2\x80\x99s in the implementation of projects to ensure compliance with the terms agreed within community consultation and participation.  Where compliance is weak take appropriate measures to facilitate dialogue on the agreed terms and make recommendations to address challenges that arise.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support provincial ESM Officers to monitor the implementation and progress towards achieving the project gender-focused targets.  This includes identifying problems and bottlenecks (current and potential) related to the implementation of the works and suggesting solutions or preventive strategies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide input on gender-specific activities into ESM monthly reports considering gender disaggregate-data on project progress highlighting relevant implementation challenges and measures to address such challenges as they arise and ensure timely reporting to the Head of ESMU at all times. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare any ad hoc progress reports, briefs, periodical reports, and statistical data as required;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other tasks as requested by the supervisor.
Monitoring and Progress Controls
\xe2\x80\xa2 Timely submission of monthly and quarterly reports considering the gender disaggregate-data to the  ESM Unit
\xe2\x80\xa2 Timely review of all project contract documents and assure that women issues have been addressed properly 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ad-hoc meetings with provincial field staff on work progress and challenges
Final Product
\xe2\x80\xa2 THRCP project is in full compliance with ESIA, ESMF and RFP requirementsTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Social Science \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor degree in gender studies, environment, social sciences or development studies or equivalent."

b'Senior  ESM Officer Job SummaryUnder the overall supervision of the Head of Environmental and Social Management Unit, the Senior Environment and Social Management Officer is responsible to assist and support the ESMU and provincial office in the preparation and implementation of the THRCP Environmental and Social Impact Assessment (ESIA) and Environmental and Social Management Plan (ESMP) and Resettlement Action Plan and social safeguards issues. Under the guidance of ESM Unit, the Environment and Social Management Senior Officer will ensure the timely and appropriate liaison between Regional Project staff, CSU, Government authorities, community representatives, contractors and THRCP management. 
Specific responsibilities and duties will cover three main areas of activity (a) Based on project ESIA, survey and collection of environmental and social safeguard data, ensuring the implementation of Site-Specific ESMP, RAP and relevant procedures in coordination with provincial office update the EIA, which had been conducted in 2009, commissioned by USAID for the B2B road. The Consultant will also have to assemble, re-evaluate, validate and present additional (if required) baseline data on the relevant environmental characteristics of the project area/proposed road alignment. The data should also include any information about other activities or projects in the project area that are being undertaken by organizations and individuals other than B2B. (b) conduct training activities to ensure the principles and procedures for ESIA are well understood and being followed by technical staff and contractors; (c) monitoring and reporting on the proposed environmental and social mitigation measures in the site-specific ESMP. Based on the impacts predicted, the consultant will have to review/update/prepare a new separate EMP/s for the construction package/s. The EMPs shall fulfil all requirements of NEPA, MoPW and the World Bank Safeguards policies 1- Environmental and Social Safeguard Assessment and Management:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct environmental and social safeguard assessments and date collection for the preparation of RAP and ESMP for each segment of the B2Broad.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Dissemination of project information to community/PAPs as proposed in the ESIA and RAP and Monitor project office compliance with this requirement.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Update and develop site specific Environmental Management Plan-ESMP.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct timely and accurate assessments of people affected by the project implementation in line with the ESIA and RAP requirements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out consultation with PAPs, PAFs, communities, district governor and other stakeholder during RAP preparation and project implementation phase.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in carrying out assessment of the people who affected by the project; assess vulnerability and entitlement issues and coordination of RAP implementation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the implementation of RAP, ESMP in projects to ensure the smooth implementation of activities. Where implementation challenges arise, coordinate as per GRM procedures to identify appropriate solutions and facilitate the implementation. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Under the guidance of ESM Unit establishing the Grievance Reedressal Committees (GRC) along the project corridor and facilitate the election process and train the members of the GRCs regarding their responsibilities for registering the complains and its procedures.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure the proper implementation of site-specific environmental and social management plans ESMP by the contractors.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure the proper implementation of Resettlement Action Plan (RAP) as per the World Bank and Afghanistan government guidelines and procedures. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that all project activities and its implementation are in compliance with approved ESIA, ESMP and Resettlement Action Plan (RAP).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure liaison and coordination with regional agencies (line ministries, governor\xe2\x80\x99s offices, Provincial Councilors; PDC\xe2\x80\x99s, DDAs, NGOs and NEPA) for proper implementation of ESIA provisions especially social development issues during RAP and ESMP implementation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure of proper GRM functionality with the project implementation. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in monitoring the participation of women\xe2\x80\x99s participation in the implementation of projects to ensure compliance with the terms agreed within community consultation and participation and the contractor.  Where compliance is weak, coordinate with Regional & Head office team and other relevant stakeholders to take appropriate measures to facilitate dialogue on the agreed terms and make recommendations to address challenges that arise.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide input on ESM-specific activities into regional monthly reports on project progress highlighting relevant implementation challenges and measures to address such challenges as they arise and ensure timely reporting to ESMU & Project Manager.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform any other tasks as requested by the head of ESMU.
2- Training and Awareness Raising
\xe2\x80\xa2 Train the contractor\xe2\x80\x99s staff and ESM officer on ESMP and the Specific Environmental and Social Conditions proposed in the ESIA and RAP.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure efficient communication with HQ office and Regional Office management and staff regarding ESIA to be taken into account in the project preparatory activities. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Description of implementation arrangement needed for the project, especially the capacity building proposals.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify community inclusion (citizen engagement) training needs of the key counterparts and support the Head of ESMU in the development and delivery of identified trainings.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct awareness and capacity building training for the design team, contractors, GRC members and communities along with the project sites. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate the delivery of training on ESMP and Conditions of Particular Application (COPA) prepared for use in the THRCP.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with the Public Relations and Communications team to raise awareness of the Project ESIA activities and achievements and coordinate inputs into media and visibility initiatives.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the project contractor well understands the EISA and its relevant guidelines and procedures by contractors
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify training needs of the key counterparts in the development and delivery of identified trainings.
3- Monitoring Evaluation and Reporting
\xe2\x80\xa2 Regular site supervision of implementation of the ESMP.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Periodic supervision and monitoring of the project activities and make sure that the activities are in compliance with ESMP and COPA.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out regular monitoring of the environmental and social mitigation measures and RAP implementation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Regular progress report to ESMU regarding ESMP implementation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all relevant gender related socio-economic data on target communities is collected and consolidated and available in the office.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the THRCP management in the preparation of socio-economic impact assessments of projects as required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare and submit regular reports on ESM activities to the ESM Unit.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other duties as requested by the ESM Unit
4- Monitoring and Progress Controls
\xe2\x80\xa2 Timely submission of monthly and quarterly reports to the ESM Unit.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Timely review of all B2B contract documents and issuance of ESMP clearance.
\xe2\x80\xa2  Ad-hoc meetings with Regional field staff on work progress and challenges.
5- Final Product
\xe2\x80\xa2 THRCP project is in full compliance with ESIA requirementsTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Social Science \xe2\x88\x92 Bachelor Degree in Environmental Science/Social Science or similar discipline.'

b"Security Officer, Afghanistan Job SummaryCenter for Civilians in Conflict\xe2\x80\x99s mission is to improve protection for civilians caught in conflicts around the world. We call on and advise international organizations, governments, militaries, and armed non-state actors to adopt and implement policies, tools, and training to prevent civilian harm. When civilians are harmed we advocate for the provision of amends and post-harm assistance. We bring the voices of civilians themselves to those making decisions affecting their lives.  
Our growing organization is currently accepting applications for the role of Country Security Officer, Afghanistan. The successful candidate will identify and report incidents and will be responsible for the security and safety of all field office staff.
The Country Security Officer, Afghanistan (CSO) main aim is to oversee and provide advice/guidance on safety and security risk management through increased capacity, technical support and advice to the and country program on all aspects of staff safety and security and ensure appropriate systems are in place at the country level. The CSO will monitor the country-wide situation, identify inherent threats and minimize risks to the program in consistent with CIVICs Security Policy and Standards.
Job Purpose:               Provide safety and security guidance and management.
Location:                     Kabul, Afghanistan
Travel:                         Up to 40% required (domestic)
Reporting to:               Country Director, Afghanistan
Staff Reporting:           N/A Coordinate and provide training to field staff (Expatriates & Nationals)
o  Conduct safety and security assessments of all CIVIC offices in country
o  Act as a liaison with local and regional officials, and other agencies regarding security issues in the planning, coordination, promotion of, and support for existing and future CIVIC projects
o  Collect, author, compile and analyze security related reports, SOP's and related security information from multiple sources ensuring CIVICs security posture is current and relevant to the situation on the ground
o  Track and report on relevant incidences, near misses, and the geopolitical situation in Afghanistan and relevant bordering countries
o  Ensure CIVIC Afghanistan personnel adhere to all safety and security protocols
o  Support and build the capacity of national staff on security protocols
o  Provide in-country briefing on security and protocols for HQ staff visting.
o  Work with HQ security to insure the proper implementation of security policies and procedures
o  Support CD as requiredTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Social Science Required qualifications include:
o  At least a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in social sciences  
o  Fluent in English- required
o  5 years of field security experience in hostile environments
o  Advance First Aid training
o  Previous experience working in NGO
o  Ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions independently
o  Extremely flexible with the ability to cope with stressful situations and frustrations
o  Ability to relate to and motivate local staff effectively
o  Creativity and the ability to work with limited resources
o  Excellent decision making skills
o  Must work independently under difficult conditions
o  Must be eligible to work in Afghanistan
To apply please send cover letter explaining your interest in CIVIC\xe2\x80\x99s work and resume.
Deadline: September 25, 2018
Resumes are reviewed on a rolling basis so please apply early."

b'Satellite Technical Manager Job SummaryThe Satellite Technical Manager shall manage all technical activities under the direction of the Afghan sat Director. \xe2\x80\xa2 Supervise and coordinate the provision of all type of performances/information relevant to Operation and Maintenance of a satellite and ensure appropriate control reporting structure are maintained in accordance with Afghansat technical Rules and Regulations;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide technical information on the use and fabrication of all types of the satellites end user equipment;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide technical information on frequency management and frequency allocation;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be point of contact for all equipment specifications, design of a network type and equipment;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be point of contact for satellites designs, launch and in orbit use
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the operations and maintenance of the Satellite Broadcast and ICT services.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Operations and maintenance of the Broadcast and ICT Hubs,
\xe2\x80\xa2 To support customers requirement for upgrades, complaints and implementation of services.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform operations and maintenance on the satellite earth station equipment such as RF (Radio Frequency) equipment, Baseband Equipment, satellite modems, Up/Down converters, ODU (Outdoor Unit) etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide operation support, coordination to assist customers in fault isolation and rectification.  Prepare statistical reports of equipment performance and fault reports.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform on-board vessel installation and troubleshooting.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work on the orders of the marketing department
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design future satellites and its requirements, prepare concept notes and do proper coordination with ITU, ATRA and MCIT.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare sector wise specifications for marketing department and other relevant sections.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform duties as and when assigned by his/her supervisor such as briefing of visitors and managing shift duties etc. Technical  \xe2\x80\xa2 MSc. Telecommunication Engineering, Communication and Electronics Engineering, Networking Engineering.  Applicants with MSc. in Satellite Engineering are given first priority
\xe2\x80\xa2 3+ years of work experience in managing positions of Satellite related fields; especially the Earth Station equipment, antenna system, satellite modems and transmission equipment will be an advantage.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in IP network routing will be an advantage.'

b'Sales Supervisor Job SummaryThis position is the most important position in sales department, directly involve in selling, market development and public relation. Sales supervisor play a role of bridge between company and market, company and distributor and distributor and market. - Daily market visit in the assigned area and ensure proper and regular supply of product at the outlets.
- Ensure monthly target achievement for the entire team in the assigned area.
- Guide, control and motivate the Pre-sellers, deliveryman and drivers of his area an effective execution.
- Monitor and ensure proper communication of company prices, Schemes, and computerized invoice to each customer.
- Visit along with Pre-seller and guide them where required. 
- Responsible for cleaning and merchandising of the company cooler given to outlets. 
- Ensure that the company provided cooler should carry only Coca-Cola products. 
- Prepare market visit report on daily basis and submitted to Line Manager. 
- Initiate and analyze market demand for promotional and merchandising material of his area and coordinate with Trade Marketing Coordinator for placement in the market.
- Responsible for market development & availability of Coca-Cola products in market. 
- To obey and perform if any other official duty assigned by senior / line manager. Sales/Marketing Qualified applicants are encouraged to submit their CVs with cover letter mentioning the Position and vacancy number in subject line and send via email to below email address.
Note: Those who do not have related job experience and qualification should not apply and their CVs will not be considered.
Applications after closing date will not be accepted.'

b'Hairdressing (Barber \xd8\xa7\xd8\xb3\xd8\xaa\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaf \xd8\xa2\xd8\xb1\xd8\xa7\xdb\x8c\xd8\xb4 \xd9\x85\xd9\x88) Job SummaryThe hairdresser will be responsible for day to day duties of the salon as per customer requirements 1. Welcome clients as they arrive in the salon and engage them in conversation to determine their needs.
2. Provide suggestions to clients regarding current hairstyles and favorite trends
3. Answer clients question regarding salon\xe2\x80\x99s facilities and hair care products.
4. Inquire from clients about hair care preferences and suggest appropriate resolution to hair and scalp issues
5. Cut and style hair according to client\xe2\x80\x99s instruction.
6. Provide beard trims to clients looking for grooming
7. Provide manicure and pedicure services to clients
8. Give scalp treatment and apply facials
9. Provide clients with head, neck and back massage
10. Check clients for scalp or skin disorders such as sores or abrasions and determine and how to provide a certain service
11. Ensure that all combs and scissors are cleaned and sanitized after use
12. Take telephone calls from clients and provide them with needed information
13. Schedule appointments over the phone and maintain records of work performed on each client
14. Assume responsibility for the upkeep and cleanliness of workstations
15. Perform up-selling services by suggesting retail products placed at the barbershop
16. Ensure that sufficient items such as clean wrap sheets and towels are available on an ongoing basis.
17. Resolve client\xe2\x80\x99s complaints correctly in a bid to ensure recurring business from them Services  1. A high school diploma or equivalent id required buy not a must.
2. Having certificate confirming the completion of a cosmetology program.
3. Must have minimum 3 years of experience as barber.'

b"Sales executive Job SummarySales executive will focus mainly on the practical application and management of the organization's marketing operations.  He/She should be efficient and effective in performing their functions, should have excellent communication and analytical skills. He / She will in charge of the organization's entire marketing activities and handles formulating, directing and coordinating marketing activities so as to influence customers to choose the organization's Services and product over competitors. Detailed responsibilities of the Sales executive are as following:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Sell telecommunications product and services to both individuals and companies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Build market position by locating, developing, defining, negotiating, and closing business relationships.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding current and potential customers through a combination of telephone and in-person cold calls, networking and referrals to obtain appointments.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identifying new business opportunities
\xe2\x80\xa2 Managing the customer journey (customer relationship management)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Write and submit accurate proposal
\xe2\x80\xa2 Submit pricing and pre-qualification requests reflecting the client\xe2\x80\x99s requirements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain and update database in sales database including all activities, partners, and opportunities with their current status.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible to visit the target potential customer as advised by top management.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Measuring success
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring timely delivery
\xe2\x80\xa2 Making customer focused decisions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Making Cold calls
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide daily activity reports to Manager
\xe2\x80\xa2 Other duties as may arise from time to time and as may be assigned to the employee. Sales/Marketing Education
Completion of secondary (high) school is required / Bachelor Degree Preferred
Experience:
Must have prior experience with ISP companies"

b'Sales Executive-Retail Channel Job SummaryTo maximize company\xe2\x80\x99s sales and market penetration in Retail segment (A Class, B Class & C-Class) and to secure the relevant receivables as well as ensuring outstanding service to our customers as a competitive edge.   
ACCOUNTABILITY 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Achieve monthly and annual sales targets.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review ageing report on regular basis, collect due outstanding and ensure reducing bad debts. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the credit limit and credit timeline as per the policies set by finance department. Field Sales Execution
\xe2\x80\xa2	Selling ready stock to pre-assigned customers in a designated route.
\xe2\x80\xa2	To check in-store displays to maximize sales through regular field visits across retails stores.
\xe2\x80\xa2	To set target for individual customers, by category of product.
\xe2\x80\xa2	To execute regular promotions in collaboration with account managers. 
\xe2\x80\xa2	Be responsible for achieving sales target.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Covering and visiting required number of outlets per-day / per-month.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Prepare invoices and collect cash/cheques.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Handling and delivering stocks.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Analysing competitor\xe2\x80\x99s activities and reporting to Sales Manager.  
\xe2\x80\xa2	Prepare daily, weekly, monthly and other required sales reports. 
\xe2\x80\xa2	Responsible to acquire accounts in Kabul territory. 
\xe2\x80\xa2	Keep an open eye on the market and be informed on what competitors are doing. 
\xe2\x80\xa2	Keep the sales team well-informed on any new leads in the market and always keep an open communication channel, brain storm and discuss how to improve internal processes or how to adopt best practices as seen from the market.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Insure that all sales orders are acknowledged within a reasonable response limit.
\xe2\x80\xa2	Maintain good customer relationship with clients. Sales/Marketing Education 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in sales or marketing 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 4 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in the field for direct sales of product'

b'M-Paisa Job Summary\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify business opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating their position in the industry, researching and analyzing sales options.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review existing business products and commercial services to ensure continuous improvement and growth
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and maintain industry knowledge and networks and effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders to achieve both short and long term goals; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify industry/business developments opportunities and challenges; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify product improvements or new products by remaining current on industry trends, market activities, and competitors 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Focus on sales efforts by studying existing and potential volume and value of transactions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products   delivery schedules, merchandising techniques etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Recommend changes in product/services and policy by evaluating results and competitive developments 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Resolve customer/clients complaints by investigating problems, developing solutions, preparing reports and making recommendations to management. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide a roadmap and implementation plans for products and promotions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the Head of Operations and M-Commerce to make sure that Customer issues Field Management Issues are taken care of and do not create risk on the commercial end
\xe2\x80\xa2 Recommend new opportunities and promotions that help increasing the volume and value of transactions. SKILLS:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Presentation Skills, Client Relationships, Emphasizing Excellence, Energy Level, Negotiation, Prospecting Skills, Meeting Sales Goals, Creativity, Sales Planning, Independence, Motivation for Sales & life cycle management.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge and experience of mobile money in general and in Afghan context
QUALIFICATIONS:
BBA with at least 5 years of related experience with any reputable company/organization. Sales/Marketing QUALIFICATIONS:
BBA with at least 5 years of related experience with any reputable company/organization.'

b'Marketing & Salse Executive Job SummaryYou are responsible to develop, manage, monitor and drive the marketing strategy and activities across all segments including ATL, BTL and Culture Marketing. You will work closely with sales department to ensure marketing strategies are in line with growth of brand and achieving sales targets. \xe2\x80\xa2 Establish the company\xe2\x80\x99s products as a strong consumer-focused brand by designing and executing short, mid and long-term programs achieving strong credibility of the product and brand, perfect brand awareness, offering personal experiences to our consumers and adding actuality to our brand.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Drives the development and execution of regional culture-focused marketing initiatives.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage and coordinate all marketing, advertising and promotional staff and activities.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct market research to determine market requirements for existing and future products.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Determine and manage the marketing budget.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Deliver marketing activity within agreed budget.

Minimum 4 years of professional experience in marketing field and marketing management.

b'Senior Reseacher Job SummaryThe Senior Researcher will primarily be responsible to conduct in-depth research of the key industries with the objective of identifying areas where government intervention is required. 
He/she will work with the Research and Economists teams to analyze national economic data and its relationship to the government policies. Evaluate the effectiveness of government policies and to make sure policies formulated are aligned with government\xe2\x80\x99s goals of private sector and industrial development. Research
- Conduct research using appropriate tools with the aim of providing objective analysis on policy issues
- Contribute in preparation of written reports, papers and memos for the Senior Advisor to the President
- Develop data collection instruments for research projects
- Utilize analytical tools such as Spreadsheets, SPSS and STATA to analyze and interpret data
- Supervise research assistants in collecting data and doing literature review for research projects
- Contribute in building an integrated database on current economic issues
- Prepare monthly and quarterly sector analysis reports of construction, agriculture, telecom and manufacturing 
  sector
- Produce research material for publication on website
Communications
- Form a comprehensive, monthly and yearly agenda of topics on economic sectors, to be studied
- Deliver formal presentations to various types of audiences as required
- Develop contacts within government organizations, business community at large and policy research 
  organizations to keep current with public policy issues
- Any other task may assigned, based on requirement. Research/Survey Education
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Economics, Business Administration, Statistics or closely related fields.
Experience
At least 3 years of relevant experience, preference will be given to candidates with additional years of experience. 
Languages
Fluent in written and spoken Dari/Pashto and English languages.
Computer Skills
Competency with Microsoft Office programs such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint'

b'Research Officer Job SummaryThe research officer will be responsible to provide support in technical, administrative, logistics and other areas where needed. Duties and Responsibilities
1. Design of the research and administration
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare detailed project work plan in cooperation with the Project Lead;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collect and provide information on research related projects, laws, rules and principles.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design research instruments and tools according to the project standard and guidelines;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Train field staffs according to the project standard and guidelines provided by Integrity Watch;
2. Conducting of the research
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organize Key Informant Interviews, In-depth Interviews and Focus Group Discussions and transcribe its audio sounds. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct the research based on the methodology and guidance of the research Manger;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage the overall activities of the project from the beginning up to the final end, including data collection, entry, analyzing the data and report writing. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify and collect literature on the project and legal gaps, reports, policies and procedures. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collect data (qualitative and quantitative) from the sampled areas and locations of the project.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out comprehensive desk review of collected materials, documents and reports
\xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out interviews and meetings to implement the project methodology
3. Write up of the research
\xe2\x80\xa2 Transcribe all qualitative data (KIIs, IDIs, and Focus groups interviews sounds, notes) or other forms of the materials.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Translate research related documents including transcripts from local languages to English and vice versa. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Write short data collection report and daily, weekly and monthly progress reports of his/her activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Write up inception reports and policy notes. Research/Survey The successful candidate will possess some or all of the following characteristics:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fluency in written and spoken English, Pashto and Dari. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Master Degree in Law and Political Science 
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least 3-5 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience working in the field of research, social science or management
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proven interest in issues of justice, integrity and anti-corruptions in governance in Afghanistan;
\xe2\x80\xa2 In-depth understanding of the social survey research, data collection, and field management.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to recruit, train, monitor and control field staff
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of computer programs, including Microsoft Word, and Excel;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in program management and logistics;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Punctuality, intellectual curiosity, willingness to take initiative, multi-tasking, and willingness to work under pressure to meet deadlines;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to travel to the provinces, districts and villages level;'

b'Procurement Analyst Job SummaryTo enhance ANDSF Capabilities and Performance regarding procurement actions within the Ministry of Defense. 1. Participate in all assigned update meetings at the direction of the requiring activity.
2. Within 30 days of assignment, be familiar with all Afghanistan Procurement Laws, Decrees, and Policies.
3. Within 30 days of assignment, develop an internal work plan to accomplish statements of work (SOWs) or performance work statements (PWSs), to include strategies to develop, implement, assess, and modify ANSF acquisition policies, procedures, and core competency processes.
4. Support TAACs when issues arise related to ANSF regional contracting agencies.
5. Train the ANSF on methods of managing and auditing contracts and the procedures for interacting with, and being assessed by a COR.
6. Train ANSF acquisition personnel on PWS/Statement of Work (SOW) and QASP development and execution.
7. Support ANSF contracting personnel on how to prepare requirement packages, conduct bidder/vendor conferences, analyze and evaluate proposals, negotiate contract provisions, develop awards, administer contracts, and negotiate and coordinate additions, deletions, or modifications to contracts. Contractor procurement mentors shall not make decisions on behalf of Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan (GIRoA) with relation to these functions.
8. Support ANSF on how to manage the procurement system and data-flow from ANSF contracting sites to the Ministerial approval authorities, in order to ensure transparency and accountability of funds from contract-award to contract close-out.
9. Provide Support to Afghan acquisition agencies and procurement departments on a full range of acquisition core competencies to include, but not limited to: requirements validation and acquisition prioritization; acquisition financial management; development of request for proposals (RFPs) and other contract solicitations for materiel and services; processes for source (vendor) bid evaluation and selection and award; contract inspection and audit; certification of the delivery of articles and services; preparation and acceptance of material and services receiving reports; processes for vendor payment; and processes encompassing contract closure.
10. Support ANSF contracting personnel on the methods of continuously improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the vendor pay process.
11. Support the ANSF contracting personnel in the development of a contracting training program to include written products such as lesson plans and training plans.
12. Assist the ANSF contracting personnel with contract-closeout procedures.
13. Assist ANSF contracting personnel in the development of contract tracking policies and procedures. Assist ANSF contracting personnel in the development of contract specifications, work statements, and terms and conditions used for procurement of specialized materials, equipment, and services.
14. Assist ANSF officials with acquisition planning, and with the development of acquisition strategies that require both contracted, and organic solutions.
15. Coordinate and conduct training classes with ANSF contracting personnel.
16. Provide a critical link to Ministerial Procurement and Finance Advisors in support of efforts to transition contracted requirements from a Coalition Forces to an Afghan lead contracted requirement.
17. Attend procurement training encompassing Afghan-specific procurement laws and procedures, principles of Afghan contract oversight and execution, and insight toward Afghan culture and business practices.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Procurement 1. Two (2) years of direct contract acquisition experience or a minimum of three (3) years of Contract Management or Contract Administration experience at a Government agency
2. Must be capable of operating independently and responsibly, as well as an integrated member of a team. Superior writing, computing and communications skills.
3. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree from an accredited institution in Finance, Economics or business discipline.
4. Excellent computer literacy skills in MS Office (Word and Excel) and QuickBooks.
5. Experience of financial management, including accounting software.'

b'Procurement Officer Job SummaryThe Procurement Officer will be working under overall guidance of the MEC Head of Admin, HR & Procurement and ensures smooth operation of procurement activities at MEC.  The Procurement officer will work closely with Admin Officer and finance department on specific occasions. The key results of procurement officer activities have direct impact on the overall MEC efficiency on budget expenditure, Value for Money and other procurement activities success. Procurement Officer provides information and suggestion to the Head of Admin, HR and Procurement on all procurement budget expenditure matters and on any other issues requested by the Head of department. Ensure transparent, effective and accurate resource management and oversight, focusing on the achievement of the following:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Under the supervision of Head of Admin, HR & Procurement Management and oversight of all small procurement activities of MEC in coordination with other units.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conducting/carrying out procurement activities in line with MEC procurement policy and standard procedures as and when required including preparing PR, obtaining quotes, doing comparisons, sending out PO if required on timely manner. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordination and management of quotations, POs, Good Receive Note and Invoice process for Payment with finance and other departments. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Paying attention to details and make sure the purchases are in line with the established purchasing limitations. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keeping track of all service contracts with venders and inform his/her direct supervisor on the expiry dates. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Initiate the bidding / tendering processes before expiry date of existing service contract when necessary.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Timely follow up with vendors/contractors on any pending invoices and procurement related issues 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordination and liaison with vendors.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage MEC Inventory list, in line with MEC Asset management and disposal Policy. 
o Asset tagging
o Asset maintenance
o Asset disposal as required according to the policy
\xe2\x80\xa2 Any other tasks assign by direct supervisor. Procurement \xe2\x80\xa2 University graduate in Public Administration, Management, Economic, or Business Administration. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in procurement for at least 3 year. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in Dari or Pashto with good English Language skill (written & oral) 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Basic understanding of Microsoft Office ( Word, Excel, PowerPoint) 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Good communication and interpersonal skills 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Willingness to learn new skills, develop and take extra responsibilities.'

b'(Re-Announce)Sr. Procurement & Contract Management Specialist Job SummaryIn Afghanistan, the CASA project includes the following activities:
(i) Component A- Sub-Component A1. High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) Transmission Line. The 500 kV transmission line from Sangtuda to Peshawar has the total length of 750km, out of which 600 km passes in Islamic Republic of Afghanistan which enters from North-East AFG-TJK border and exits at South-East AFG-PAK border. For the HVDC lines in Afghanistan, three EPC contracts have been procured and signed in December 2017. 
(ii) Component B.  Main activities are listed below:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Environment and Social Management Support. This includes two contract. First for Environment and Social Impact Assessment for the HVDC line which has been awarded and second for the Resettlement Action Plan for the HVDC line, which is to be procured;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Audit and Financial Management Support;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Project Management Support to the implementing agency on general project management including procurement and contract management, monitoring, evaluation, and operating costs; and
\xe2\x80\xa2 Capacity Building of the DABS.
(iii) Component C. The CSP will be implemented for individuals and communities located within the 2 km width of the transmission line corridor who will be affected during the design, construction, and operation and maintenance of the transmission line.
Component A and B are financed under the IDA grant for the CASA in the amount of SDR 206.3 million (equivalent of US$ 315.5 million at project appraisal in 2014). Implementing agency is DABS.  Component C is financed under the Afghanistan Reconstruction Trust Fund Grant for CASA CSP in the amount of US$ 40 million.  Implementing agency is the Ministry of Rural Rehabilitation and Development (MRRD). IV. OBJECTIVES AND SCOPE OF ASSIGNMENT
The Senior Procurement & Contract Management Specialist will deliver but not limited to the following tasks: 
In Procurement: 
\xef\x83\xbc Assisting project management team in DABS in procurement and contract management of works, goods, supply-install, consulting and non-consulting services contracts under the Bank funding
\xef\x83\xbc Guiding and assisting in general strengthening/setting up and development of the project management team in DABS, including procurement activities required for the strengthening of the team. 
\xef\x83\xbc To build PMT\xe2\x80\x99s procurement capacity by providing guidance and support, identifying procurement and contract management capacity building programs and advising nomination of PMT staff for the same as procurement expert to PMT staff in various procurement related matters. 
\xef\x83\xbc The incumbent would be expected to devote 20% of time on procurement and contract management capacity building of PMT staff. In the initial period developing capacity of the PMT officials in all aspects of procurement with emphasis on (i) the organization of pre-bid meetings, preparing answers/clarifications/modifications; (ii) receiving and examining bids/ proposals; (iii) organizing technical evaluation committees; (iv) preparing evaluation reports as per the Bank procedures and (v) broad understanding of contract management. The incumbent will make use of dummy cases for imparting the knowledge on procurement under the Bank funded project to the PMT officials. 
\xef\x83\xbc Preparing, reviewing and updating the procurement plans under the Program in consultation with the Technical team members to submit it for internal approvals and no-objection by the Bank.  Following up with DABS-CASA Project and the WB in order to have the procurement plans approved in a timely manner using the Systematic Tracking on Exchanges in Procurement (STEP) software used for the purpose 
\xef\x83\xbc Managing the processes of advertising, bid receipt and bid opening strictly in accordance with the agreed procurement procedures;
\xef\x83\xbc Preparing, reviewing and clearing draft bidding documents, requests for proposals for all procurements prior to submission for approval. Follow up with the concerned government departments and the WB (if required) using STEP in order to have these bidding documents approved and issued in a timely manner according to the approved procurement plans. 
\xef\x83\xbc Conducting Pre-bid meetings, describing project\xe2\x80\x99s procurement regulation to bidders.
\xef\x83\xbc Participating as a permanent member in evaluation committees, providing guidance to other members in evaluation committees on procurement aspects in the process of evaluation of bids or consulting proposals.  
\xef\x83\xbc Preparing, guiding, reviewing and clearing all bid evaluation reports with very transparent method according to the bidding documents provisions, Bank\xe2\x80\x99s Guidelines, WB and applicable Government of Afghanistan rules and regulation,  submission for approval, including preparation of comparison list of bill of quantities of the bidders; following up with the concerned government departments and the WB (if required) including through STEP in order to have bid evaluation reports approved in a timely manner. 
\xef\x83\xbc Preparing, reviewing and clearing all draft contracts from commercial angle and getting the technical due diligence done with the technical team members prior to contract signing.  Following up with the concerned government departments and the WB (if required) in order to have  contracts approved in a timely manner. 
\xef\x83\xbc Reviewing and clearing all correspondences with bidders during procurement process from procurement angle.
\xef\x83\xbc Preparing contracts amendment (final contract amendment, time extension as required by contractors and advised by PM in timely manner as per provisions in the contract to avoid delays in implementation.
\xef\x83\xbc Managing the procurement filing/record system in the office in a systematic and retrieval manner.
\xef\x83\xbc Maintaining the integrity and confidentiality of the procurement and contracts management process and documentation per the provisions of applicable respective guidelines, documents, act, rules and regulations. 
\xef\x83\xbc Monitoring and reporting the procurement implementation progress/status to PIU and the World Bank as required.
\xef\x83\xbc Participating and providing timely inputs to the implementation support missions of the Bank.
\xef\x83\xbc Performing periodic supervision of the performance by other procurement staff in the procurement unit, providing on-the-job training and classroom training enabling them to successful carry out their jobs.
\xef\x83\xbc Proving regularly and timely reports.
\xef\x83\xbc Coordination with CASA secretariat on matters relating to procurement and contracts management.
\xef\x83\xbc Managing other activities required under procurement processes & documentation as assigned by the PM from time to time.
In Contract Management:
\xef\x83\xbc Monitor the overall financial and physical progress of the contracts awarded for implementation in Afghanistan. 
\xef\x83\xbc Review requests for variation orders in coordination with the technical team members and make recommendations for the Project Manager actions.
\xef\x83\xbc Liaise with project Owner\xe2\x80\x99s Engineers/technical staff and make recommendations on mitigation measures to prevent/minimize delays in contract implementation.
\xef\x83\xbc Prepare payment Certificates for payments processing after receiving review by the Owner\xe2\x80\x99s Engineer/Technical staff of payment requests by the contractor.
\xef\x83\xbc Submit periodical reports on contracts progress, including recommendations for delivery performance Improvements.
\xef\x83\xbc Collate and monitor / verify monthly payments to the contractors and review the cash flow projections with the finance management team.
\xef\x83\xbc Coordination with Owner\xe2\x80\x99s Engineer.
\xef\x83\xbc Prepare contractual letter with reference to CASA 1000 Projects Condition of Contract in order to address Contractor\xe2\x80\x99s issues / claims and time extension, as well as completion certificates.
Reporting and Coordination
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare Project Progress Reports regarding procurement and contract management. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Update  Project Procurement  Plan
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be the official point of contact for procurement and contract related issues of CASA.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Carry any other tasks related to the duty.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Directly reporting to DABS Team Leader of CASA 1000 Project Procurement Education: The Senior Procurement & Contract Management Specialist shall have a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Economics, Finance, Social Science, Business Administration, Engineering, Commerce, Law, Management or similar disciplines. A master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in any of these disciplines will be an advantage.  
Working Experience: The Senior Procurement & Contract Management Specialist shall be a professional with a strong and demonstrated capacity for procurement and contracts management, with excellent reporting skills and high morale and ethics. Experience should include activities demonstrating the skills of coordinating and managing the work of staff, contractors, suppliers and consultants. At least seven (7) years of relevant experience in Procurement & Contract Management with demonstrated understanding of Government of Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s Procurement Laws, rules of procedures with respect to legal, institutional, contractual and financial issues and processes. The candidate shall have prior experience in procurement and contract management in infrastructure projects financed by multilateral donor. Previous experience in power sector is a plus.'

b'Logistic Assistant Job SummaryUnder the supervision Logistic Coordinator and Head Office Operation manager, the purpose of this position is to implement the logistics manual, coordinate purchasing practices, maximise savings through responsive purchasing and efficiently manage the logistic stores, transfer of goods and assets from one location to another, and maintain inventory of Afghanaid. In addition, to strengthen the procurement processes through actively engage with relevant networks of stakeholders for timely achieving the agreed department objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the procedures contained within the Logistics Manual, and any other complementary procedures are fully understood and adhered to by all staff.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Managing purchases requests from Programme Areas and departments.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support line Manager in development of organisational procurement plan, ensuring value for money and planning commodity schedules for project activities with programme staff- considering provided Procurement Plan.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organising, and undertaking local purchases.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Overseeing the dispatch of goods to Programme Areas/field sites.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Communicating with programme staff & senior management on the status of supplies and all other logistic issues
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advising on the need for Purchase/Tender committee and contracts as per regulations
\xe2\x80\xa2 To establish and maintain appropriate procurement records and systems for measuring necessary Aspects of the purchasing process pertaining to all individual purchases, authorization signatures on each received and accepted PR stating items or services purchased, costs, product quality or performance and supplier information structured and filed in a logical functional order.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Managing the central store(s): ensuring the proper maintenance of stock and records and undertaking regular stock checks of supplies within each store.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Reporting stock movements and maintaining a centralised stock record of all supplies in the field.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support line manager in corrective measures in line with organisational corrective action plan.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To display an understanding of budgetary commitments, financial limits, agreement & ownership of Cost / split costs, keeping within budgetary limitations and have an awareness towards the chart of Accounts, able to learn and allocate actual budget codes.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To assist in the selection of appropriate suppliers and contractors, to promote good procurement 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Practice with due regard to sustainability, ethical purchasing standards and whole life costing.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide support to field logistic team for day to day activities & help resolve field logistic related challenges
\xe2\x80\xa2 Guide and support purchase/tender committee and contract as per Afghanaid policy.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proper record all transection in logistic system (Microsoft Dynamic NAV 2013 \xe2\x80\x93 Serenic).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Weekly and monthly Prepares narrative, graphical and statistical reports with alternative solutions for resolving issues; prepares correspondence and other written materials.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Recognise unusual or irregular circumstances (e.g. conflict of interest) occurring within the purchasing environment and report to relevant internal authorities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Undertake any other duties as and when required by line manager and/or overview manager. Operation Education/ Training
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree Business, Finance or related discipline.
Work Experience
\xe2\x80\xa2 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in logistics and procurement. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated experience in developing and managing large procurements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience working on projects funded by major international donors.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong coordination/negotiation skills specifically with the ability to convince the stakeholders. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proven ability to think and lead strategically, plan effectively, set priorities and meet deadlines.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in preparing well-organised reports.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Sound understanding of international humanitarian and development work.
Professional Skills, Competencies, Values and Attitudes
Afghanaid seeks a responsible and dependable compliance officer with strong initiative, judgment and adaptability as well as excellent skills in communication, organisational, interpersonal relations, decision-making, financial management, compliance and reporting.
Specifically, the holder of this position should also demonstrate the following:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficiency in computer software including Accounting Packages, MS Office etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 MS Excel knowledge, MS Dynamics NAV (knowledge desirable) and ability to slice and dice numbers using excel functions such as pivot tables/charts.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Sensitise on organizational values i.e. professional, integrity, transparency and accountability
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to deal with difficult, often challenging work situations.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Behavioural role model for peers and fellow team members.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Competent to work with significant levels of autonomy and able to meet tight deadlines.
\xe2\x80\xa2 A results-oriented approach to delivering work priorities in personal workload,
\xe2\x80\xa2 Creative and innovative in conceptual and analytical thinking
\xe2\x80\xa2 Sensitivity to gender issues. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in Dari, Pashto and English (written and oral). 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Personal integrity, sense of humour, intuitive and self-motivation
\xe2\x80\xa2 A clear and firm commitment to the rights, equality, role and empowerment of women, minorities and persons with disabilities. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Flexible and dynamic with the ability to deal with difficult, often ambiguous and challenging situations and creatively solve problems.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of personal strengths and weaknesses, active listener'

b'Procurement Assistant Job SummaryThe Procurement Assistant will assist OFWMP Procurement Unit in all the procurement functions (assigned to him from time to time) by following procurement guidelines and procedures of International Development Association (IDA) and Afghanistan Procurement Law.  Below is an indicative description of duties and responsibilities: i. Follow up with various unit heads for getting the Procurement Requests submitted and receiving & registering them after exercising the due checks (as per the prescribed check lists).  
ii. Preparing shopping documents and assisting in the preparation of Bidding Documents (under NCB procedures) for Goods and Works (as per Standard Bidding documents and Guidelines of World Bank) including their issue/dispatch and coordination for providing required clarifications in close coordination with/guidance of the international/national  procurement specialist and procurement officers.
iii. Preparation of Invitation for Bid (IFB) and arranging their publication/notification to prospective bidders.
iv. Arranging pre-bid/ pre-proposal conferences and assisting in preparation and  circulating their minutes.
v. Assisting in Opening of Technical/financial proposals and Bids by following World Bank procedures and preparing Minutes of bid opening and required tabulation statements for preliminary check of bids and arithmetical checks.
vi. Follow up for convening Evaluation Committee Meetings for evaluation of various proposals and Bids and assisting in the preparation of draft Proposal/Bid Evaluation Reports and obtaining approvals of competent authority.
vii. Assisting in preparation of various types of contracts/Agreements/Purchase Orders in close coordination/guidance of the international/national procurement specialist & procurement officers and coordinating for their signing by the competent authorities.
viii. Helping in handling variations in contracts, preparing and issuing Contract Amendments/Extensions etc.
ix. Coordinating/Assisting for attending various procurement complaints and resolving of various contract disputes.
x. Coordinating/Assisting in obtaining no objection/approvals of competent authorities including World Bank and SPC.
xi. Assisting in the Preparation of Request for Expression of Interest (REOI) for consultancy Services and arranging their publication and preparation of EOI Evaluation/Short listing Reports in close coordination/guidance of the international/national procurement specialist & procurement officers.
xii. Assisting in Preparation/Updating of Procurement Plan as and when required.
xiii. Record keeping for maintaining proper documentation of all procurement activities.
xiv. Any other procurement related duties assigned by OFWMP.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Procurement i. At least bachelor in Engineering/Science/Commerce/Management/Business/ARTs Administration /Law from a Board/University duly recognized by Govt. of Afghanistan. Good working knowledge MS Word, MS Excel and MS Outlook.
ii. Introductory knowledge of procurement procedures.
iii. Good Working knowledge of English Language to comfortably work with Standard procurement documents of World Bank.
iv. About 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in procurement/contract management/construction out of which experience of at least 6 months should be in the procurement for a World Bank funded project.'

b"Branch Manager Job SummaryThe Branch Manager is responsible for the administration and efficient running of a full service branch office, including operations, sales, marketing, customer service, cash, CCTV, general services, security & safety in accordance with the company's objectives and policies. The Branch Manager is ultimately responsible for the profitability and achieving the set targets of the branch. 1. Provide a superior level of customer relations and promotes the sales and service of the branch. 
2. Achieve individual and branch targets through new business sales, referrals and retention of account relationships.
3. Monitor cash operations & cash movements of the branch with taking the necessary measurements.
4. Verify and tally the cash balance of the branch at the end of each working day with the cashier and reporting to HO concerned department for completeness.
5. Perform daily or random surprise control of physical cash at the branch; report any cash shortage/surplus with details immediately to the HO management.  
6. Create a friendly environment in the branch that keeps customers and employees satisfied, and keeps the business and deposit base growing.
7. Establish and maintain long lasting and mutual beneficial business relationships in order to retain existing customers and/or to attract new customers. 
8. Conduct performance evaluation of the branch staff and provide them regular feed-back in order to improve staff\xe2\x80\x99s skills and capabilities.
9. Give value to an employee who has done a big contribution in deposit, sales and operation in order for others to follow the example.
10. Set and follow standards and professionalism for keeping the service to the customers at high standard.
11. Handle the cases of customer queries or complaints.
12. Conduct daily sales and operation assessments and monitor every transaction made in the branch.
13. Make sure that the price of the products or services offered by the branch is competitive and in line with management directives.
14. Send reports to the management and provide updates on the sales and accounts/deposits position of the branch.
15. Make assessment of the security & safety of the branch and report any deficiency to the Security Manager or other concerned departments at the Head Office. 
16. Regularly check and monitor the CCTV cameras and DVR of the branch for proper recording and records. 
17. Control and mitigate branch losses, such as loss resulting from incidents such as human error, theft, violation of regulations or forgery.
18. Coordinate with HO departments for any IT, CCTV, logistical, purchase, renovation, support or other issues pertaining to the branch. 
19. Participate in community affairs as representative of Albashir Exchange and to increase the company's visibility and to enhance existing & new business opportunities. 
20. Looks after for the sanitation and promotes cleanliness in the branch.
21. Other job-related tasks as assigned by the line Manager. Operation \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree, preferably in Business Administration or Marketing.
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least 2-3 years experience in managerial level of a branch. Past managerial experience in financial industry will be an advantage."

b'National MIS Specialist \xe2\x80\x93 Operations Job SummaryIssued Date:  11 October 2018
Closing Date:  26 October 2018
VA No. FAO/KBL/CO/SC/30-2018
Functional  Title: National MIS Specialist \xe2\x80\x93 Operations
Type of Contract: National Project Personnel / Service Contract (NPP/SC)
Grade / Level: SB-5
Number of Post (s) :  01 (One)
Gender / Sex: Male & Female  
Duration :  12 Months 
Extendable / Renewable:  Yes (Extendable, Based on Satisfactory Performance & Budget Availability)
Probationary Period: Initial 3 Months  
Project / Programme / Unit:   FAO Representation / Country Office 
Duty Station:  Kabul - With Possible Field Missions to Project Sites
Sub \xe2\x80\x93 Station:  N/A 
REMUNERATION: 
\xef\x82\xa7 The remuneration for the post of National MIS Specialist \xe2\x80\x93 Operations is between USD 2,808 to USD 3,571 (SB-5 Step 1 to 3) monthly based on the qualification and experience of the candidate.
\xef\x82\xa7 The selected candidate will also receive an additional 8.33% monthly salary as pension benefit/coverage on a monthly basis. Reporting Lines / Supervision Received/Exercised: 
Under the general supervision of the FAO Representative and direct supervision of the National Senior Operations Officer, in close collaboration with other FAO staff and government counterparts, in particular the Operations unit and other unit and section, the National MIS Specialist \xe2\x80\x93 Operations will fulfill the following tasks under FAO Representation/Country Office; 
Key Functions/Results:
\xef\x82\xa7 Act as focal point for assigned projects\xe2\x80\x99 operational matters; 
\xef\x82\xa7 Prepare project task force meetings as required and ensure the secretariat of such meetings;
\xef\x82\xa7 Develop and maintain local MIS for FAOR and relevant entities that will track work-plan, all processes, status, progresses and pending tasks; generate routine and ad-hoc progress project reports;
\xef\x82\xa7 Develop and maintain online Afghanistan Programme MIS that will keep track of all the FAO projects in the country with project summary and data;
\xef\x82\xa7 Develop and maintain MIS for FAOAF that will facilitate and track the internal administrative processes of functions from different users at field level and to the focal units at the FAO Representation through e-Management. FAOAF-MIS should display the detail and status of all processes/actions taken by each individual person/unit in general and in specific for each project;
\xef\x82\xa7 Update the status of LFM, work-plan and budget in FPMIS for pipeline and ongoing projects;
\xef\x82\xa7 Review the Semi-annual, Annual Progress and Terminal Reports of assigned projects;
\xef\x82\xa7 Contribute to ensure the timely provision of project inputs (personnel, technical support services, sub-contracts, training, equipment and supplies) directly by the Organization or, when appropriate, through contractors; 
\xef\x82\xa7 Participate in the identification and preparation of concept note and project formulation as required, and provide necessary support on the development of project work plans, operational clearance, appraisal and approval process in FPMIS, quality assurance
\xef\x82\xa7 Monitor progress of the projects, facilitate/support operational and financial closure and, where necessary, identify corrective measures to overcome operational constraints; 
\xef\x82\xa7 Contribute to ensure project budget management and prepare revisions as required; 
\xef\x82\xa7 Contribute to ensure project Field Budget Authorization (FBA) and prepare revisions as required; 
\xef\x82\xa7 Contribute to ensure timely preparation and submission of the Quarterly and Semi-Annual Project Implementation Reports and any other reports required by the Organization;
\xef\x82\xa7 Contribute to ensure preparation of analytical reports on project performances, as required;
\xef\x82\xa7 Coordinate action concerning the completion of field projects and arrange for timely and adequate reporting, including identification of project follow-up requirements; Contribute to the preparation and/or assessment of new projects, and 
\xef\x82\xa7 Perform other related duties as required. 
Expected outputs:
\xef\x82\xa7 MIS applications developed for FAO Representation, projects and line ministries (MAIL, MEW, NEPA, MRRD, MoPH and etc.)
\xef\x82\xa7 A number of reports (progress report, terminal report, end of assignment report and etc.) reviewed and operationally cleared 
\xef\x82\xa7 As per operational procedure and guidelines, a number of CN, ProDoc and Budget reviewed and operationally cleared 
\xef\x82\xa7 Assist in project openings and closure actions
\xef\x82\xa7 On regular basis updated FPMIS for all projects 
\xef\x82\xa7 Finalized a number of budget revisions and FBAs
\xef\x82\xa7 Developed Analytical Reports as requiredTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Operation Education:
\xef\x82\xa7 University degree, (preferably MSc) in computer science, agricultural economics or agriculture, public or business administration (including forestry and fisheries), or closely related fields;
Work Experience: 
\xef\x82\xa7 At least seven years of professional experience in planning, implementation, and administration of agricultural development programmes, including the preparation, monitoring or evaluation of development projects. 
\xef\x82\xa7 Working knowledge (level C) of the English, and ability to communicate clearly and concisely, orally and in writing, in Dari, and Pashto. 
\xef\x82\xa7 General knowledge of the local socio-economic conditions and institutions and minimum knowledge of development-related policies and procedures of the country of assignment. 
\xef\x82\xa7 Ability to identify and resolve problems expeditiously and pragmatically.
\xef\x82\xa7 Should possess tact, good initiative and sound judgment, and have the ability to establish and maintain good working relations with people of different national and cultural backgrounds. 
\xef\x82\xa7 Good IT skills and experience in operating Management Information System (MIS) is highly essential. 
\xef\x82\xa7 Computer literacy and skills to use word-processing equipment is necessary.
\xef\x82\xa7 Ability to use a logical and structured approach to collate, archive and synthesis information.
\xef\x82\xa7 Experience and knowledge of the FAO rules and regulations and good skills of multi-stakeholders coordination, operations and management
\xef\x82\xa7 Experience of working with UN, and government entities is highly desirable;
Language Skills:
Excellent knowledge of English and local languages, both spoken and written skills.
COMPTENCIES:
\xef\x82\xa7 Core competencies: FAO core competencies include: Understanding FAO\xe2\x80\x99s mandate & its global context; planning, organizing, and delivering quality results; communicating to build understanding & support; working together in teams and partnerships; engaging in continuous learning.
\xef\x82\xa7 Operational Effectiveness: Working independently, structuring tasks, establishing priorities and adhering to deadlines. Show a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail. Contribute ideas and suggestions for process improvement.
\xef\x82\xa7 Client Orientation: Focus on results for the client. Attend to inquiries from internal and external clients in an effective, timely and courteous manner. Treat clients with courtesy and respect even when working under pressure. Express a high level of professionalism.
\xef\x82\xa7 Interpersonal Communications and Teamwork: Work effectively and efficiently with staff at all levels, listen to others and openly share own ideas. Express sensitivity, cultural empathy and respect for diversity. Productively handle differing views and opinions and strive for achievement of shared goals. Respond positively to feedback.
\xef\x82\xa7 Knowledge Exchange and Learning: Share own knowledge and promote a learning culture within the work environment. Actively work towards professional development, including personal learning.  Apply newly acquired skills and support flexibility within the work environment.'

b'ICU Nurse Nangarhar Job SummaryThe ICU Nurse is responsible for effective and serious nursing care services in ICU. Check and keeping record of vital signs, administration of medicines, match the drug dosage and care of wound in compliance with established ICU policies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that patient receives its required medicines on time as per specialist order. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare and arrange a regular schedule for emergency care patients.
\xe2\x80\xa2  Medical services to patients in order to perform nursing duties within the bed.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collection information responsibly about patient and its care. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Performing nursing issues such as checking and recording vital signs, distribution of medicines, match the drug dosage and care of wound. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Register of patient\xe2\x80\x99s vital signs and all other nursing related treatment charts of patients. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure performing laboratory examination and on time informing of doctor. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare and arrangement of activities monthly quarterly  and yearly  plan   
\xe2\x80\xa2 Performing night shift duty as per hospital schedule. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide report of progress of the related sector activities. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other duties related to the task that is entrusted by the relevant department. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Active participation in designing and implementing various training within the nursing service.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Compliance with all conditions to prevent infection and compliance with medical uniform in the official working time. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Implementation and compliance with strict standards set by the relevant department.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Active participation in the evaluation of Quarterly assigned standard of related sector. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Report to related head nurse and ICU responsible Nursing \xe2\x80\xa2 Graduated from recognized health institutes. Degree/diploma must be attested by Ministry of Higher Education or & Ministry of Public Health. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Basic knowledge and understanding of English language  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong Communication and interpersonal Skill
Younger than 30 years is preferable'
