b'M&E Officer Job SummaryThe Project consists of the following parts:
Part A: On-Farm Water Management 
1. Carrying out social mobilization for the establishment of Irrigation Associations (IAs) in the Project Areas, including, inter alia, the provision of: (a) training to communities in organization and management of IAs; (b) facilitation services for communities to develop the IAs\xe2\x80\x99 internal legal rules and regulations (by-laws); (c) assistance to IAs in order for them to be registered under the Water Law (1388); and (d) technical training to IAs regarding water distribution, maintenance of irrigation infrastructure, irrigation methods, water-saving techniques, crop-water requirements, and good agronomic practices.
2. (a) Carrying out rehabilitation works to small irrigation schemes or tertiary canals (watercourses) covering approximately 40,000 hectares in total in the Project Areas, including, inter alia: (a) rehabilitation of existing intakes, (b) canal lining; (c) construction of control structures and outlets; (d) construction of, culverts, laundry basins and cattle troughs; and
(b) Improving design standards and strengthening the private sector\xe2\x80\x99s capacity for contract management and construction techniques.
3. Establishing easily accessible pilot irrigation demonstration sites in the Project Areas to showcase improved water management practices/technology and agronomic water saving techniques/measures, as well as proper farm planning and layout for an efficient use of irrigation water.
Part B: Institutional Strengthening and Capacity Building of MAIL
 Developing the institutional capacity of MAIL to plan, design, implement and monitor irrigation programs, including, inter alia: (a) construction and/or renovation of  office buildings, one each in Kabul, Jalalabad, Baghlan, Mazar-e-Sharif and Herat, respectively for MAIL and Project  staff; (b) strengthening of MAIL\xe2\x80\x99s  Directorate of Irrigation at national, provincial and district levels; (c) strengthening the legal framework for the irrigation sector, (d) developing a national irrigation program, (e) undertaking of technical training in the irrigation sector including study tours transferring on-farm water management know-how; and (f) developing a database covering irrigation systems throughout the country.
Part C: Project Management, Coordination, Monitoring & Evaluation
 Strengthening the institutional capacity of MAIL for Project implementation, policy development, and technical innovation, monitoring and evaluation, by establishing and maintaining a Project Implementation Unit comprised of a Kabul-based core team, five (5) Project Area Teams and internationally recruited experts.
Part D: Support for Productivity Enhancement
1. Establishing easily accessible pilot irrigation demonstration sites in the Project Area to showcase improved water management practices/technology and agronomic water saving techniques/measures, improved agronomic and social management practices, as well as proper farm planning and layout for an efficient use of irrigation water.
2. Promoting land leveling and high-efficiency irrigation technologies in the Project Area.
3. Establishing Information Centers for farmers at the provincial and district level in the Project Area. \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in the selection process of the project areas and sites
\xe2\x80\xa2 Selection of farmers for baseline data collection
\xe2\x80\xa2 Data compilation, cleaning/validation and entry in to data base 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design, in cooperation with the team members, a M&E system for progress, effect and impact monitoring
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate with the other team members for the data collection to develop a proper M&E system
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collection of Mid-term evaluation data, compilation, validation and entry in PMIS, analyze and reporting against baseline 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collection of impact evaluation data and analyze it  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collect, in cooperation with the other team members, the basic data required for the estimation of the financial feasibility of the proposed interventions, analyze the financial feasibility of the proposed interventions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Project completion report 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring of irrigation scheme under construction
\xe2\x80\xa2 Internal monitoring project stuff
\xe2\x80\xa2 Properly document the in-kind contribution by the Irrigation Association in the actual physical/rehabilitation work of the watercourse
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the M&E firm in his/her respective duty station
\xe2\x80\xa2 Report the proposed M&E System, the collected data as well as financial analysis as part of the survey reports
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare a first year plan of operations for M&E data collection
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform any other task assigned by Area Team leader/M&E SpecialistTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces M & E \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor degree in (Agriculture, Agriculture Economic, Economics and Business Administration)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Four years of relevant experience in relevant field with national and/or international organizations.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Two years of  experience with Master Degree 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Major achievement in career may substitute for long experience and educational requirements.'

b'Monitoring & Evaluation Manager Job SummaryThe M&E Manager is a key position within the Fundraising & Communications Department.  In close collaboration with the Head of Fundraising & Communications, the incumbent will support DACAAR in the planning and execution of its M&E activities, ensuring quality in accordance with accepted standards and feedback of M&E information for learning, accountability and decision making purposes, including for development of new project proposals. This will include the implementation of Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (PMEL) System and support to the management of the system. S/he will train staff and build DACAAR\xe2\x80\x99s internal capacity for Monitoring and Evaluation through engaging staff in continuous on-the-job mentoring and coaching as well as providing real time technical advice, support and assistance. Specific Responsibilities:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support DACAAR in the planning and execution of its M&E activities, ensuring quality in accordance with accepted standards 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and implement a monitoring framework in support of the Strategic Programme Framework Document (2017-2020). 
\xe2\x80\xa2 In close collaboration with the Head of Fundraising & Communications Department, lead the implementation of Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (PMEL) system.  The PMEL system should be upgraded to serve the Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning needs for the organization in line with the Strategic Programme Framework Document (2017-2020).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support and build the capacity of the staff in the department for management and practical application of the PMEL system, including for the elaboration of analyses based on information from the system.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the Head of Fundraising & Communications and staff in designing and undertaking (or commissioning) and managing evaluations and assessments of specific projects or other activities. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the Head of Fundraising & Communications, Grants & Communications Advisor, the M&E team and Reporting team to ensure that lessons learned in terms of process and impact, and best practices captured during M&E of projects are channeled to reports, design of future project proposals, and to support the development of knowledge products for internal and external use.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the design of M&E related parts of project proposals, e.g. development of logframes or results frameworks.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the provision of M&E inputs for reports to donors and other bodies, and internal quarterly and annual reports.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Build the capacity of Programme staff in monitoring and evaluating implementation of projects through training and on-the-job coaching and mentoring.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the Programme in the designing of assessments and baseline methodologies and questionnaires in order to ensure quality of project implementation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the Technical Unit embedded in the Programme Department to ensure that PMEL system and framework reflects the specific needs (i.e for indicators, impact monitoring, etc) for each thematic area, namely; Water, Sanitation & Hygiene; Natural Resource Management; Women\xe2\x80\x99s Empowerment and Small Scale Enterprise Development.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with Head of Fundraising & Communications, Grants & Communications Adviser and finance staff to ensure all proposals have a budget line for M&E activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 In addition to the above specific tasks and responsibilities, the M&E Manager will undertake any other relevant tasks assigned by the Head of Fundraising & CommunicationsTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces M & E Education/ Qualification and Employment Benefits                                                
Education: Master Degree or equivalent in the relevant field 
Experience: At least 3 years of experience in relevant field is required.
Other qualifications\xe2\x80\x99 an advantage: 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge and experience of bilateral and multilateral donor such as ECHO, IN agencies, DANIDA etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Hands on experience in project management
\xe2\x80\xa2 A strong team player with good coordination skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficiency in the English language both written and spoken.      
\xe2\x80\xa2 Good report writing skills
Languages: Fluent Written & Spoken English
Employment benefits:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Good training opportunities to enhance employees\xe2\x80\x99 skills 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Severance pay: one month salary per year of service
\xe2\x80\xa2 24 days of paid annual leave per year 
\xe2\x80\xa2 10 days of paid sick leave per year
\xe2\x80\xa2 2 days weekend
\xe2\x80\xa2 30 days of paid Hajj leave (after the completion of one year service)
\xe2\x80\xa2 90 days of paid maternity leave for female employees(after the completion of three months service) 
\xe2\x80\xa2 5 days of paid paternity leave for male employees(after the completion of three months service)
\xe2\x80\xa2 15 days of public holidays per year
\xe2\x80\xa2 Pick and drop Allowance AFN (1500)/ month'

b'Gender manager Job SummaryGender manager will lead CHAMP gender team to integrate women in processing, post- harvest management and marketing, with a particular focus on women owned or operated businesses so that they can produce quality horticultural processed products for promising domestic and international markets. 
The Gender Manager maintains a network with colleagues from different aid Agencies, Government officials, and civil society. \xef\x82\xa7 Consult with stakeholders on key gender issues and opportunities to advance women\xe2\x80\x99s economic empowerment in the CHAMP target areas. 
\xef\x82\xa7 Oversee the development and implementation of a gender equity and social inclusion strategy, to effectively empower women within all CHAMP activities
\xef\x82\xa7 Assist small processors with the design of new processing facilities, development of new fruit and vegetable preservation processes and formulation of new products.
\xef\x82\xa7 Improved post-harvest handling for high paying markets, including sorting, grading and packaging of fresh fruits, vegetables and nuts; 
\xef\x82\xa7 Assisting women-owned agribusinesses in exploring profitable markets for their products domestically and internationally.
\xef\x82\xa7 Collate and analyze data related to food quality and safety, formulate control measures to reduce commodity losses and improve food quality and safety.
\xef\x82\xa7 To ensure that CHAMP gender activities are in line with national policies and priorities.
\xef\x82\xa7 Design and implement appropriate training courses for small-scale processors and CHAMP female extension officers. 
\xef\x82\xa7 Representation of CHAMP in different working groups and interagency working groups.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Management Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in, economics, business, social sciences is required- MSc/MBA/Master\xe2\x80\x99s in related field is strongly preferred. 
\xef\x82\xa7 At least 5 years of experience in developing, planning, and executing activities that integrate gender, particularly in food processing and policies that attract private sector investment preferred. Knowledge of USAID and its operations and other donor-funded programs strongly preferred.'

b'Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Officer Job SummaryThe Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Officer is responsible for M&E reporting to M&E Specialist, contributes toward the relevance, effectiveness and efficiency of the M&E unit as well as the overall programme(s) implementation. Key Purpose
\xe2\x80\xa2 M&E activities planning and supervision 
\xe2\x80\xa2 M&E activities administration
\xe2\x80\xa2 M&E activities reporting
\xe2\x80\xa2 M&E activities data collection and record keeping
1. M&E activities administration, supervision and reporting
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare monthly schedule (work plan) of M&E related activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the field reports based on project implementation plan and M&E framework through WEP monitoring and evaluation tools. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare informative field and desk reports, identify shortcomings and make relevant recommendations on a weekly basis.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Enter qualitative and quantitative data into M&E system.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct data quality checks on M&E reports and ensure accuracy and completeness of M&E tools.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collect data, enter and analyze data based on project requirements, and ensure data accuracy and reliability. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keep record of hard copies and soft copies of data.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop monthly a success story and case study from the field. 
2. Conduct surveys, focus group discussion, key informant interviews, baseline, etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop operational monitoring tools (checklist, questionnaires, databases, interview and survey forms, etc. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct observations, surveys, focus group discussions and key informant interviews with different persons of different age groups (children, youth, adults) and a different gender.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Enter data from FGDs, surveys, observations and KIIs, participate in data analysis and draft reports.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in the baseline, mid-term and end of term evaluation of programmes in accordance with the M&E framework.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support short-term M&E evaluators and experts as required. 
3. Capacity building 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in developing personal and organizational expertise on M&E issues (using training, distance study, experience sharing with implementing partners).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate and attend capacity building events as required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Handle any other relevant duties as may be assigned by the M&E Specialist. 
4. Identify problems or risks
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify any potential issues or risks that could affect the progression of the project. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Must communicate these items with the M&E Specialist and Director WEP, and work to identify potential solutions.
5. Communication
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain good communication with colleagues and implementing partners. M & E \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor degree required in relevant field, or equivalent combination of education and work experience in a relevant competency area, including statistics, international development, economics or other.
Experience 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 6 years of experience working on monitoring, evaluation and learning for donor funded projects.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated understanding of Log Frame and Project Implementation Plans.'

b'Re-announced Coordinator Job SummaryThe Coordinator has two major areas of responsibility \xe2\x80\x93 management of the center and programming. Work will be done with the support and collaboration of the staff of the Public Affairs Section of the U.S. Embassy, Kabul and implementing partner Social Development and Research Organization for Afghans. The candidate is required to ensure the integrity of the LLC\xe2\x80\x99s financial operations and make sure the operations adhere to the existing policies of the organization and donor requirements. Center Management: 
1. Management of the center \xe2\x80\x93 Responsible for daily opening/closing and maintaining scheduled hours of operation.
2. Serve your customers in a thoughtful way and be considerate of the users at LLC. 
3. Ensure that everyone has access to the center and nothing prohibits them from using the services. 
4. Maintenance of the collection and equipment.
5. Make sure software are up to date and NO illegal software is installed, and password protect computers. 
6. Develop and post rules for patrons and ensure their implementation. 
7. Work closely with local U.S. Government representative.
8. Enhance center staff capacity through timely feedback and training as needed.
9. Establish and maintain effective working relations with host institution, educational institutions, the Embassy, and local government officials.
Programming: 
10. Responsible for creating and conducting program activities to include speakers, discussion groups, cultural events, and regular classes in English, computer training and any other topic of interest to the local population.
11. Attract volunteers and diverse speakers for programs.
12. Frequently conduct outreach activities (e.g. fliers, event notification, visits to schools)
13. Participate in the online community of American Corners.
14. Work to improve operations and outreach to result in increased user attendance at LLCs and at programs.
15. Develop, compile and coordinate yearly activity calendar.
16. Develop and send activity reports to Kabul as required. 
Budget Management and financial reporting: 
17. Manage center procurement as per standards. 
18. Check and review all financial documents and see that all financial transactions are sufficiently supported.  
19. Ensure that all policies and procedures are adhered to. 
20. Enter all processed financial transactions into the computerized system and ensure its accuracy before posting.
21. Assist Kabul management in reconciliation of other financial reports.
22. Maintain files for vouchers and other departmental correspondence.
23. Any other assignment given to him by his/her supervisor.
Traits 
1. Most importantly, the Coordinator should be someone who is creative, energetic, reliable, and full of initiative.
2. Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing in English, Dari and Pashtu.
3. Ability to maintain library programs and collections and access the resource needs of library users.
4. Skill in working with youth and providing youth training.
5. Computer skills including Microsoft Office applications and Internet research.
6. Ability to do long term planning, budget preparation and report writing.
7. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from the Embassy, customers and the general public.
8. Some knowledge of the United States of America. Management - Bachelor degree in Business or Social Sciences.
- Three to five years of relevant experience'

b"Logistic / Procurement officer Job SummaryA logistics officer is responsible for handling the company's physical resources. Typical logistics activities include procurement of materials, storage, transportation and distribution of the finished product. The logistic officer is responsible of dept understanding of Supply chain and to eliminate inefficient processes in the chain. 1. Obtain Approvals from Administration and finance department in due course according to the budget line.
2. Preparation and review of quotation from different vendors
3. Purchase, check in and receive daily deliveries from different vendors and distributor as per ATVI purchasing procedure.
4. Close and on time coordination with Donor agencies
5. Keep proper record of all receipts, payments etc.
6. Good Knowledge of Afghanistan Government and procurement Law
7. Thoroughly inspect received items for unsatisfactory or unacceptable quality or damage and follow procedures for returning to distributors as necessary.

9. Assist with compilation of food and supply market orders according to established guidelines and procedures of ATVI

11. Report the current logistic situation within the organization on monthly basis to the administration and finance Managers.

13. Responsible for the maintenance of equipment and accessories

b'Staff Attorney Job SummaryThe Legal Support Attorney/Advocate shall possess expertise and demonstrate understanding in the following fields: the Constitution of Afghanistan, rule of law, judicial processes, political science, criminal justice principles, and purpose and function of Afghan governing bodies.  The selected candidates will fill a critical void in supporting the Ministry of Defense legal entities, to include both the Ministry of Defense Legal Department (MoDL) and the General Staff Legal Department (GS-Legal).  Candidates selected will provide accurate legal advice on various issues affecting the Ministry of Defense after analyzing applicable law, legal principles, concepts, regulations, precedent, and practices.  The Ministry of Defense Legal Department (MoD Legal) is currently making every effort to support procurement reform.  They are regularly engaging with AT&L and AA to help the procurement process on various fronts. 1. Knowledge of, and skill in applying, fundamental legal analysis and skills in laws, principles, systems, policies, methods, and practices; as well as analytical, and research techniques sufficient to conduct fact finding and recommend solutions to legal issues affecting the Ministry of Defense. Ability to register and track cases, provide assigned investigators and inspectors with legal advice and guidance to assist them during investigative process.
2.     MoD Legal attorneys are reviewing contracts that are up for award;  currently, there not   
    enough attorneys to review the amount of reviewed requested.
3.     MoD Legal attorneys are supporting AT&L with creating a training program for both  
          procurement officials and attorneys, to include (hopefully) setting up a Mobile Training  
          Team (MTT).
4.     MoD Legal attorneys are supporting the PoA, MINDEF, and FDM in providing sound 
    advice for acquisition policies/procedures.
5. Ability to either assist in the prosecution of cases in a support capacity or prosecute cases, as directed, in accordance with Afghan law and MoD policies and regulations. 
6. To use computers or other advanced technology to maintain documents, plans, and reports.  Document management may include arranging files and confirming submission of legal reports and opinions to other departments, receipt of documents from other departments, and properly archiving and storing and retrieving archived documents.   
7. To have the ability to understand, abide by, and advise on the policies, processes, and standard operating procedures of the Afghan National Army.
8. Candidate will agree to any continuing legal and professional development education requirements, as directed by supervisory chain of command.  
9.     Additional duties may be assigned as necessary, as determined by supervisory chain 
          of command, so long as those duties relate to supporting the mission in a legal 
      or professional development capacity (for example, candidate may be required to teach 
          a block of instruction on an assigned legal topic, support conference planning for 
          training seminars, attend meetings, as directed, where ANA legal representation may 
          be required.  This list is not all-inclusive.) Legal 1. Three (3) years of work experience in legal field. 
2. Must be capable of operating independently and responsibly, as well as an integrated member of a team. Superior writing, computing and communications skills.
3. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree from an accredited institution in degree in the legal field, either as an attorney, prosecutor, or judge.
4. Excellent computer literacy skills in MS Office (Word and Excel).
5. A candidate should demonstrate a working knowledge and skill level for proper use of Microsoft Office Word products.  The most vital function is ability to create Microsoft Word Documents.  Although not required, expertise in Excel, Power Point, and Access programs and/or other systems/applications is beneficial and will be reviewed favorably.    
6. A candidate should demonstrate a professional demeanor, respect for others, and have the ability to be a team player and work well with others.  A candidate should have the ability to providing legal opinions and analysis to senior leaders and may, on occasion, be asked to provide presentations in a professional manner to senior leaders.'

b"Legal Specialist Job SummaryAfghanistan International Bank (AIB) is seeking a Legal Specialist to join its Legal team. The Specialist will be part of a fastest growing and reputable financial institution of the country. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in review of current Standard Operating Procedure (SOPs) of different departments of AIB, Contracts, Undertakings, Memorandum of Understandings and other legal documents to ensure compliance with the current laws and regulations of the country.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Draft Legal documents, including but not limited to Policies, Standard Operating Procedure (SOPs), Contracts, Undertakings, Memorandum of Understandings (MOUs), Memos, case reports and any other document as required, ensuring compliance with AIB\xe2\x80\x99s legal policies and procedures.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct extensive legal research and assist in analysis for complex legal issues. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organize and maintain legal documents in various databases, including the contract management database and Sharedrive.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Translate, review and edit documents from English to local languages and vice versa. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in providing legal support to the bank\xe2\x80\x99s day-to-day operations under supervision of Chief Legal Officer.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Other duties related to Legal Department. Legal Education
\xe2\x80\xa2 Applicant must possess a Bachelor's Degree in Law or equivalent from an accredited university, (priority would be given to Applicants with LLM degree).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Must be familiar with Legal System of Islamic Republic of Afghanistan, Knowledge of Banking Law and related Regulations is an asset.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Membership of Afghanistan Independent Bar Association is a plus.  
Skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong analytical and organizational skills. Excellent and interpersonal and communication skills; the abilities to articulate ideas clearly. Research and investigative skills,
\xe2\x80\xa2 Able to work in groups, strong drafting skills and strong coordination skills,
\xe2\x80\xa2 Computer literate, fluent in both written and spoken English and one of the languages (i.e. Dari or Pashto),
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proven ability to meet stringent deadlines and adapt to changing priorities, operating in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Experience
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of 3 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in Research, Drafting, Legal Analysis or Legal Translation. Priority would be given to Applicants with background in financial sector."

b'Recovery Officer Job SummaryThe Recovery Officer is responsible for the collection of late loans. He has to make sure that all set targets and goals are achieved: a) Work on the recovery of all the  late loans as assigned by COO/Senior Management and or Recovery Manager/Arrears recovery Committee.
b) Take a hand over of all the loans late loans as assigned by Operation department.
c) Put pressure on the clients on the field to collect the late installments. 
d) Use all the means at his disposition to recover the money.
e) Visit very regularly late clients, be very strict with them to make them realize that they should better repay the loan
f) Give clear message to the delinquent client on the fact that OXUS will never give up pressurizing him to make him repay the installments.
g) Put a strong Psychological and Social pressure on the delinquent clients to convince them to repay the loans
h) Use all the contact available in the communities with local leaders to recover the money.
i) Pressurize the client and his family to recover the money.
j) Pressurize the guarantor to recover the money
k) If it seems useful, use the police department or the legal department of the area to recover the money.
l) Implement the selling of late client\xe2\x80\x99s collaterals or assets in link with Legal officer and or recovery Manager.
m) Advise other loan officers in term of delinquency management and actions to take against delinquent clients
n) Send weekly collection report to the Head Quarter and or Recovery Manager.
o) The recovery officer position is a regional position. He is based in the regions and working on the delinquency of all the branches of the region.
p) The Recovery Officer is working under the supervision of the Recovery Manager.
q) The recovery manager will work in close coordination interaction with Legal and operation department Law r)   BA degree in law, criminology, Sharia and or Economic preferred.
s)  age should be 25 and above
t)   Familiarity with Afghanistan legal system.
u)  Work experience in police and or judicial system is preferred.'

b'Computer Management Assistant FSN-08 (Multiple Vacancies) Job SummaryFemale candidates are strongly encouraged to apply
I. GENERAL INFORMATION
1. SOLICITATION NO.: 72030619R10001
2. ISSUANCE DATE: October 15, 2018 
3. CLOSING DATE/TIME FOR RECEIPT OF OFFERS: October 29, 2018 no later than 4:30 pm Kabul time. 
4. POSITION TITLE: Computer Management Assistant - (Multiple Vacancies)
5. MARKET VALUE:-Equivalent to FSN-08 (Step 1-13)
In accordance with AIDAR Appendix J and the Local Compensation Plan of US Embassy Afghanistan. Final compensation will be negotiated within the listed market value.
6. PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: The period of performance is one year, with the possibility of extensions up to a total of five years, subject to availability of funds, satisfactory job performance and need for continued service.
7. PLACE OF PERFORMANCE: Kabul, Afghanistan.
8. SECURITY LEVEL REQUIRED: As an employment precondition, the successful applicant is required to obtain U.S Embassy Afghanistan RSO Security Clearance.
9. STATEMENT OF DUTIES
1. General Statement of Purpose of the Contract
This position is located in the Information & Resource Management Division (IRM) in the Executive Office and the position is responsible for assisting in the management of computer systems and automated programs. The incumbent is involved in the day-to-day operations, development, installation, repair, maintenance, support and management of Windows, Personal Computer/ Local Area Network (PC/LAN) and PC hardware, software, peripherals, accessories, and automation.  The incumbent is responsible for the development, installation, operation, and maintenance of the Mission's network and desktop installations. The work involves providing management advisory services, user support and training. The incumbent is expected to develop, implement and manage computer-training program on different Applications and Operating Systems. The incumbent provides USAID/Afghanistan Information Technology (IT) systems and application support to users on all Mission Offices. Application support incorporates the use and refinement of hardware, software and user expertise in Mission Standard Applications. The incumbent works with other IT members in developing, maintaining and updating USAID/Afghanistan Intranet website. The incumbent works under the Supervision of the Computer Management Specialist at all times. Performs systems development and maintenance of applications related to the operations of the Division. 2. Statement of Duties to be Performed
Systems Support, User Support and Troubleshooting     
\xe2\x80\xa2 The incumbent serves as the primary contact person for users with PC, Laptop, Smartphone problems. Promptly investigates problem, if unable to solve the same day, writes a technical support notice, and makes a plan to solve expeditiously with the supervisor. Incumbent serves as the primary contact person to escort external storage devices (CDs, USB devices) and laptops brought in by visitors into the Mission and scan for vulnerabilities before being used in the Mission. The incumbent assists in planning and scheduling adequate technical support for all systems this would include Routine Preventive Maintenance schedule (RPM) for all equipment at least once every four (4) months.
\xe2\x80\xa2 The incumbent is called on to install, upgrade, and maintain a wide assortment of commercial, locally developed, and department developed software applications. Updates and service patches must be loaded when the department approves them. Anti-virus definitions must be kept up-to-date. Unexpected problems must be diagnosed and de-bugged. The incumbent works with her/his co-worker to create and maintain an orderly library of the Mission's software and reference material. Develops and maintains a systematic, preventive-oriented approach to routine network maintenance tasks.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provides software support services designed to maximize Automatic Data Processing (ADP) systems utilization and increase office productivity.  These services include telephone assistance; on-site technical assistance; answers to queries; software installation and reinstallation, update and fixes; recovery of operating and optional software; hardware or software problem isolation, identification and resolution; and ADP consultations. The incumbent conducts computer training to the LAN users. Generally, training will be one-on-one; however, when there is a need the incumbent will organize larger, more formal classes. Training will include commercial applications such as Cloud Technologies, Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Exchange and Outlook. The incumbent is called on frequently to assist users in learning department specific software. The incumbent may also be called on to teach locally developed software. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 For all diagnosed hardware problems incumbent reports the nature of the problem to the supervisor while keeping detailed maintenance log to monitor equipment down time, turnaround time from repair shops, which components fail most and why. Responsible for scheduling preventative maintenance and cleaning for all PC\xe2\x80\x99s printers and UPS\xe2\x80\x99s. The incumbent serves as the primary contact person for all visits by contractors and vendors for PC and Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) maintenance and regular preventative maintenance checks; is responsible for notifying them in advance of any special needs or requirements. Incumbent must have the understanding and be vigilant about internet, system and communication security, including anti-virus software updates, network intrusion detection, and proper file security settings.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Incumbent recommends to the supervisor the acquisition of professional engineering services from outside contractor on situations such as ADP System is under warranty or maintenance contract; special tools, software or documentation is necessary which is not available to the Mission; critical services requiring experienced specific professionals.
Local Area Network (LAN) Administration 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Performs LAN administration routines such as adding/removing users, support of Windows 2008 Servers, PC/LAN and PC hardware, software, applications, peripherals (Workstations, printers, scanners, tapes and disk drives, Optical character recognition (OCR) and CD-ROM readers, etc.), data communication equipment (Server, router, bridge, cards or controller and LAN wiring, etc.), accessories and auxiliary equipment (Central UPS, small to medium UPSs, monitor server room temperatures etc.) Mail Server configurations and User management. Sets up user\xe2\x80\x99s Access Rights to system files and software applications in the Windows File and Print Server. Carries out the installation and setup of new equipment in a PC-LAN network which includes setup of network devices, applying mission standard operating system image, configure desktops and procedures. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Incumbent manages network resources for Windows such as accessing the print services & print queues; ensures that USAID Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) Security Guidelines are being followed and patches/hotfixes are applied immediately when vulnerabilities are reported. Antivirus software is updated promptly on the LAN and the workstations and oversees that Software Copyright laws are strictly followed in the Mission. The incumbent takes the responsibility to perform the job of the Systems Administrator (SA) of secured systems.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for scheduling all disks to take backups, including all document libraries and all automated systems. Maintains a detailed log of all the tapes being used for backup. Responsible for off shore tape backups, schedules and maintain a log of all tape backups sent to the off-site storage each week and also the tapes that are retrieved from the off-site storage. This includes complete system backup, incremental backups. Performs all data recovery operations. Incumbent also carries out activities relating to the various telecommunications links of the USAID network.
System Development, Maintenance and Implementation   
\xe2\x80\xa2 Incumbent is responsible for ensuring all authorized United States Government (USG) programs are being used in the Mission along with application to be developed and maintained for the better work flow in the Mission. Develops an information system to prioritize and schedule the implementation of all possible and planned information systems. Writes the basis for such prioritizing and discusses it with the Computer Management Specialist. In consultation with the Computer Management Specialist performs periodic housekeeping activities required on PC/LAN servers to remove unnecessary files, release unused disk space, re-organize databases, delete outdated mails, archive inactive documents, etc. with the ultimate goal of balancing workload, minimize system degradation, improve system performance, data integrity and maximum utilization of disk space.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identifies, analyzes and writes technical specifications for possible new information systems for eventual implementation. Estimates the hardware and manpower resources necessary to implement them. Incumbent evaluates and recommends PC & LAN hardware configurations, and software package appropriate for Mission use. Tests and implements all automation software from AID/Washington and other Missions. Incumbent provides in-depth training to all the Computer Center staff on the Automation software and applications being used in the Mission so as to back-up on technical issues during absence; and  provides prompt repair and maintenance services to automation equipment by utilizing contractor engineers working under various repair and maintenance contract agreements with the Mission for the repair and maintenance of network equipment including LAN servers and PC hardware, software, applications, peripherals, accessories, auxiliary equipment and testers
\xe2\x80\xa2 The incumbent makes recommendations to supervisor as to how hardware resources should be balanced between offices, particularly whenever any significant percentage of hardware is down; performs development and maintenance services on applications that: electronically logs service calls; monitors of repair and maintenance services; records of parts replaced; status and conditions of ADP systems; and preventive maintenance schedules.  Incumbent ensures the compliance to Mission-adopted development and documentation standards, performs systems analysis and design of application and databases; programming coding, compilation, testing and debugging using standard macro programming, standard desktop publishing, forms designer software and related tools; parallel run using live data to beta test completed programs; implement application, input data, regular and ad hoc reports generation; maintains applications to cope with management and technology changes.
Management support and coordination  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Makes recommendations to supervisor as to how hardware resources should be balanced between offices, particularly whenever any significant percentage of hardware is down; suggest Budget Planning for yearly procurement of Integrated Resource Management System (IRMS) and should also plan the allocation of Hardware to the entire mission Users. This position helps in setting up multimedia equipment as per the request from different offices within the office building (conference rooms) as well as in outside locations (hotels). This includes setting up laptop, speakers and multimedia projectors and microphone and audio/video.  The incumbent is required from time to time maintain files such as Mission Notices, Mission Orders, Agency General Notices on the mission intranet.
\xe2\x80\xa2 The incumbent is required to design and develop dynamic Intranet Web Pages using web page development tools and language like Active Server Pages / Hypertext Preprocessor (ASP/PHP); will also be required to develop highly informative, precise and animated presentations, charts and maps using Graphical Software such as Photo Shop, Power Point etc. coordinate work with Department of State (DOS) General Service Office (GSO) section on all Computer related items. The incumbent maintains database and inventory of all computer hardware Non Expendable property and Expendable property (NXP and EXP) as assigned to office. Logs all movements and maintenance activities and reports changes to the DOS GSO section 
Administrative Functions       
\xe2\x80\xa2 Receives, inspects, and records all automation-related deliveries, warranty claims, short shipment claims, out-of-office or out-of-country repairs, inter-office transfers, and disposal. Regularly updates the Mission inventory of automation hardware, software, peripherals, and auxiliary equipment.  Incumbent manages the automation facilities implementing time-in and time-out log, pull-out and return log, spare parts control and issuance, physical security, cleanliness, non-smoking and other administrative policies applicable.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares purchase requisitions for any PC hardware and software required.  Does follow-ups with DOS Procurement office until the equipment arrives. Keeps record of all correspondences and fillings of the Computer Center. This position also conducts requisition of office supplies for IT department.
The contractor is eligible for temporary duty (TDY) travel to the U.S., or to other Missions abroad, to participate in the "Foreign Service National" Fellowship Program, in accordance with USAID policy.
3. Supervisory Relationship
The incumbent works under the overall direction of the Computer Management Specialist. 
4. Supervisory Controls 
None. 
10. AREA OF CONSIDERATION: 
Cooperating Country Nationals (CCN), meaning an individual who is a cooperating country citizen or a non-cooperating country citizen lawfully admitted for permanent residence in the cooperating country. 
11. PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The work requested does not involve undue physical demands.
12. POINT OF CONTACT:-
Any questions about this solicitation may be directed to: KblAIDHR@usaid.gov. Applications submitted to this email address will not be considered.
Note: No in-person appointments or telephone calls will be entertained, unless you are required to have more information about this solicitation. IT a. Education: A bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in computer science or information technology is required. (Education requirement must be met at the time of application for the subject position).
b. Work Experience: Incumbent must have a minimum of three (3) years of progressively responsible technical experience in the field of Information technology LAN/Wide Area Network (WAN) management in large computer operations with a Non-Governmental Organization, donor organization or International Organization is required. Experience should include but not limited to Network installation and support, web page designing and maintenance, operation and support of IT-related equipment, programs and systems management.  Experience with Windows 2003/2008 Servers, WEB Servers, SharePoint, (RAS) Remote Access, Cisco network equipment, Video Conferencing devices, as well as peripherals management to include printers, scanners, digital senders and modems is highly needed. (Work experience requirement must be met at the time of application for the subject position).
c. Language: Level IV (Fluent) in speaking/reading English, and Level IV (Fluent) in speaking/reading of Dari and/or Pashtu is required. (English language ability will be tested).
d. Knowledge: Incumbent must have a good understanding and knowledge of LAN administration routines such as adding/removing users, support of Windows 2008 Servers, PC/LAN and PC hardware, software, applications, peripherals (Workstations, printers, scanners, tapes and disk drives, OCR and CD-ROM readers, etc.), data communication equipment (Server, router, bridge, cards or controller and LAN wiring, etc.), accessories and auxiliary equipment (Central UPS, small to medium UPSs, monitor server room temperatures, etc.). Mail Server configurations and User management. Sets up user\xe2\x80\x99s Access Rights to system files and software applications in the Windows File and Print Server. Carries out the installation and setup of new equipment in a PC-LAN network which includes setup of network devices, applying mission standard operating system image, configure desktops and procedures. Incumbent must also have a good knowledge of managing network resources for Windows such as accessing the print services & print queues. 
III. EVALUATION AND SELECTION FACTORS
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work Experience   35 points
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge    50 points
\xe2\x80\xa2 Skills and Abilities  15 points
 Maximum Points:             100 points
After an initial application screening, the best qualified applicants will be invited for a written examination, English Proficiency Test and to an oral interview.'

b'Specialist Information Security Job SummaryThe Specialist Information Security  is in charge of the Information Security Management function, providing line management, leadership and strategic direction for the function and liaising closely with other managers.  The purpose of the Information Security Management function, in turn, is to bring the organization\xe2\x80\x99s information security risks under explicit management control through the Information Security Management System.
This job description will be subject to periodic review and amendment in accordance with the needs of the Etisalat Afghanistan and the continuous changing on this agenda.
To provide expert guidance around data security management that may require the authority to take a course of action, which may could involve substantial impact on resources. \xe2\x80\xa2 To establish and chair a Data Security Working Group represented by service areas and to set the agenda for these meetings, chair the meetings and ensure that reliable, accurate information is relayed and recorded.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To advise customers on security concerns and recommendations with regard to the security of data and systems and to build strong relationships with all service areas in order to foster excellent team working and support for improved data security management.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To regularly report on information security incidents to the Technology and Information Management Board, the Corporate Management Board and members, as required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To represent the Etisalat Afghanistan on project boards that have a strong security delivery to ensure that appropriate actions are taken to ensure continued compliance with corporate data security standards.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To define, document and implement security policies that affect all directorates within the council, working to develop Islington\xe2\x80\x99s IT Security Policy Framework (this is the overarching policy framework for Etisalat Afghanistan technology security arrangements and describes the governance arrangements in place to make sure they are fit for purpose).
\xe2\x80\xa2 To develop and ensure data security procedures are approved that provide the more detailed steps that service areas need to adhere to in order to implement that data security policies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Lead on an annual health check of all Etisalat IT infrastructure systems and facilities, to include, but not restricted to, the following: (a) a full penetration test, (b) a network summary that will identify all IP addressable devices, (c) network analysis, including exploitable switches and gateways, (d) vulnerability analysis, including patch levels, poor passwords and services used, (d) exploitation analysis, and (e) a summary report with recommendations for improvement.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To assist in the development of the annual health check action plan. This involves the assessment of Etisalat IT security systems, processes and policies against standards within own area of responsibility, and liaison with staff across the organization.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To ensure that the Etisalat Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s information systems are secure and to respond to security related incidents in whatever way is appropriate.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To ensure robust systems are in place for monitoring data security incidents and information security incidents are recorded and that all \xe2\x80\x98evidence\xe2\x80\x99 related to any incident is recorded and maintained for legal retention periods.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To meet tight deadlines and priorities demands in order to manage incidents for the authority and security incidents as required, this may involve audit trails, manually checking individual\xe2\x80\x99s accounts, interviews, producing system reports regarding activity etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To research and develop a security strategy by being aware of potential threats and possible countermeasures. Using this knowledge to make judgments based on analysis of a range of options and conflicting opinions to best ensure that the highly complex security issues are understood, and that the risks are managed.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To set in place the vehicle for the raising and monitoring risks on a regular basis, with reference to the Technology and Information Management Board and do regular risk assessments are completed in departments and that results are recorded.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To ensure the most appropriate anti-virus software is deployed across the EA and carry out regular reviews and evaluations of all procedures and processes relating to anti-virus, email monitoring, Internet access and network access.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To assist and provide guidance to the First Line engineers and Network engineers in the event of a Security alert, and investigate the vulnerability of the EA to potential malicious attacks and recommend defensive actions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To communicate with all levels of staff including senior staff in the organization in relation to data protection / information security matters. This entails providing advice and support that may be actioned by others. Meet with department heads and third party suppliers to discuss security and legal issues many of which are extremely complex. Analyze and recommend courses of action through presentations and reports.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding the agreed current and future security requirements of the business and the existing Business Security Policy and plans
\xe2\x80\xa2 Implementation of a set of security controls that support the Information Security Policy and manage risks associated with access to services, information and systems
\xe2\x80\xa2 Documentation of all security controls, together with the operation and maintenance of the controls and their associated risks
\xe2\x80\xa2 Management of suppliers and contracts regarding access to systems and services, in conjunction with Supplier Management.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Management of all security breaches and incidents associated with all systems and services
\xe2\x80\xa2 The proactive improvement of security controls, and security risk management and the reduction of security risks. IT Bachelor degree in IT/ CIS/ CS or (Cyber Security / Information Security is preferred and recommended)'

b"Android Developer Job SummaryAfghanistan Holding Group is looking for a qualified Android. You will be responsible for development and maintenance of applications aimed at a range of Web, Android, iOS devices including mobile phones, tablets, wearables, and computers. Your primary focus will be leading the development of software, their integration with back-end services, and conducting tests for quality assurance and software requirements. You will be working alongside other developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential. Experience developing, releasing, and maintaining native Java Applications (point us to your apps on Google Play). 
Ability to work within a highly collaborative, Agile team environment
Excellent knowledge in core Java
Strong knowledge in RESTful web services
Deep understanding of Android SDK's
Experience in Gradle.
Experience in Locations and Map API's in mobile apps is a big plus.
Hands on experience with Android studio & Gradle build system
Strong knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices
Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
Ability to design applications around natural user interfaces, such as \xe2\x80\x9ctouch\xe2\x80\x9d
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications
Understanding of Google\xe2\x80\x99s Android design principles and interface guidelines
Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability.
 PROFESSIONAL CONDUCT
Comply with personal legal liabilities and fiduciary requirements of diligence and care in carrying out the duties of AHG.
Act honestly in all the affairs of AHG and avoid conflict of interest and, should this arise, it must be declared. IT Education
Android Apps Development Experience \xe2\x80\x93 show us you apps on Google Play Store. 
Experience:
2 - year experience, providing your portfolio of work would help us in the shortlisting proc"

b'Sr. IT and networking Officer Job SummarySr. IT and Networking Officer will be working under the overall responsibility of Program Executive Director and under the day to day supervision of National Program Coordinator.
The IT and Networking Officer will be involved in the following activities: 1. Startup:
Plan the IT system for WEE-NPP and develop a comprehensive system of IT for WEE-NPP 
a. The IT and Networking Officer is responsible for startup of the office IT Systems such as but not limited IT infrastructure, Support, Documentation and Print, and continued support to the IT infrastructure of the project and the physical location of the WEE-NPP. 
b. The IT and Networking Officer is responsible for preparing documents, policies and technical specifications as required for both infrastructure upgrades, staff, MIS Development etc. 
c. Create floor plans, physical and logical network diagrams, bills of quantities, scheduling projections, inventory reports, site survey reports, and other documents as required;
d. Implementation of required server and centralized applications such as Ms. Exchange, Active Directory, WSUS, Anti-virus, switches, routers, firewalls etc.
e. As part of maintenance he/she should ensure that computer have updated antivirus software/systems.
f. The officer creates a shared drive for the staff of WEE-NPP in which all sharable documents are shared. (This helps better knowledge management in the office and avoids the risk that if the person leaves they take away important files).
2. Day-to-Day Support/ Maintenance: 
a. Maintenance and Troubleshooting of any IT related issues with WEE-NPP staff have with their workstations, office printers and other shared systems, office networks and internet connections, Windows file/print/DNS/etc. server, Cisco routers, WAPs, and switches, and the email servers;
b. Makes sure the required stock of required day-to-day equipment is up to date and required checklists are checked in a timely manner. 
c. Monitor and report on the implementation of various network construction, internet-service provision, and end-user support contracts;
d. Maintain regular backups of office data, and periodically test the restoration of them;
e. Maintain a consistent accounting of software license usage, request new license purchases when required. Maintains proper inventory of all IT related equipment. 
3. Automation: 
a. Makes strategies in alliance with MIS team to develop proper systems. 
b. Provides backbone support to applications that are developed. I.e. Hosting My SQL, Apache web server, Domain, Data management, security etc. 
c. Design, test, and update changes to group policy configuration;
d. Automate a wide range of tasks using batch files, shell scripts, macros, etc.
4. Other tasks:
a. Obtain and compare price quotes, investigate market capacity, and research locally-available and locally-supportable solutions to a wide range of IT problems,
b. Perform other job related tasks assigned time to time by respective supervisorTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces IT Qualifications and Experience: 
a. Having at least a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or its equivalent degree in IT or Computer Science with 5 (Five) years of relevant Working Experience 
b. Previous experience with any Donor, International NGO or International Implementer or Government agencies is required. 
c. Effective communication, (i) a full working knowledge of English (ii) fluency in one national language and good reading, writing, listening and speaking skill in the other and (iii), the ability to interact and coordinate with WEE-NPP staff, contractors, Government officials, consultants and the World Bank staff.
Language requirements:
Fluency of speaking and writing in local language and English required.'

b"Adjunct Instructor / Asst. Professor / Assoc. Professor of Information Technology Job SummaryThis is a contracted adjunct position for one semester\xe2\x80\x94renewable semester-to-semester upon mutual consent\xe2\x80\x94to teach one or more courses in Information Technology at the pre-undergraduate, undergraduate or gradual level depending upon ability and experience and qualifications, at a rank of Adjunct Instructor, Adjunct Assistant Professor or Adjunct Associate Professor according to qualifications.
Key outcomes include:
\xef\x83\x98 International quality teaching and learning Faculty fulfil the roles and responsibilities described in the Faculty Handbook and university policies and procedures that detail specific faculty duties for adjuncts. Major responsibilities are listed below. 
With the exception of holidays, university closures, weekends, and other breaks, faculty are expected to be working on campus in Afghanistan during the whole semester, including pre- and post-semester faculty workshops and advising. The contractual period extends from one week before the start of the semester to one week after the end of the final exam period of the semester.
Teaching and Mentoring
\xe2\x80\xa2 Teach one or more undergraduate or graduate courses per term, evaluating student work and assessing student learning outcomes.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Hold regular office hours and work with individual students, acting as academic mentor.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Remain engaged and current in the academic profession and in their disciplines. IT \xe2\x80\xa2 Master degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or a very much-related discipline from a reputable university.
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least two years of progressive work and teaching experience within any of the qualifying fields is required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preferred additional qualification is a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Networking.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preferred expertise in one or more of the following areas: Networking, Programming and Web Design, Data Visualization, Data Analysis, Big Data Management and Business Information Systems.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent English-language communication skills."

b'Private Sector Development Specialist Job SummaryAbout MoIC/WSMED:
Ministry of Commerce and Industries envisages a socially responsible market economy, where sustainable and equitable growth is private sector led, resulting into increased employment, higher living standards and reduction of poverty to the benefit of the citizens. Within the government, the ministry has the specific responsibility to bring forward legislation, programs and other measures to support, facilitate and regulate the private sector through the development of appropriate policies and regulations, in consultation with all stakeholders. Job Description:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop a work plan and technical approach for private & public sector engagement related activities to be implemented under the Creative Industries Project. This will include developing materials on private & public sector engagement to be incorporated into guidelines and training curricula developed for Afghan Businesswomen. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out a situational analysis of women engagement in Private Sector.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide training on private & public sector engagement to Afghan Businesswomen in Kabul and Provinces.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Research on national and international potential capacity building programs to enhance the professional skills and knowledge of Afghan Businesswomen contributing in private sector.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop a relation of awareness encouragement between CIP project and private sector.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide technical assistance on the design and layout of short-term medium-term and long-term training programs plan for the capacity building and public awareness of the Department and other stakeholders such as private sector especially women. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Planning, organizing, delivering and implementing capacity building public awareness consultation and coordination programs with private sectors.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Cooperate with the newly establish private entities to assess the needs of building institutional capacity and arrangement of capacity-building programs especially in the field of licensing and export promotions. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the implementation of a provincial public awareness programs on the Introduction of \xe2\x80\x9cMade by Afghan Women Logo\xe2\x80\x9d and Simplification of Export and Licensing Procedures for Afghan Businesswomen for the purpose of women\xe2\x80\x99s economic empowerment across Afghanistan. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute inputs to CIP project reports and monitoring and evaluation activities as related to private sector development. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in project technical team meetings during action reviews and other staff meetings as directed.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Other activities as directed and assigned. Industrial Job Requirements:
Knowledge:
Adherence to GoA laws and regulations regarding private sector.  
Knowledge of women economic empowerment National Priority program. 
familiarity with the Afghanistan industry regulatory framework.  
Qualifications and Experiences required:
The candidate should have the following qualifications, skills and experiences:
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Finance, Commerce, Business Administration, Management, or Economics.
At least 5 years of relevant experience in relevant discipline. 
Good team worker, capable of working effectively in a very challenging environment'

b'Industrial Analysis Advisor Job SummaryAbout MoIC/WSMED:
Ministry of Commerce and Industries envisages a socially responsible market economy, where sustainable and equitable growth is private sector led, resulting into increased employment, higher living standards and reduction of poverty to the benefit of the citizens. Within the government, the ministry has the specific responsibility to bring forward legislation, programs and other measures to support, facilitate and regulate the private sector through the development of appropriate policies and regulations, in consultation with all stakeholders. Job Description:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Analyze industry dynamics, including the profitability of women owned companies, regulatory structure, and impediments to growth and Promotions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop both general as well as industry specific market analysis to provide visual perspective regarding competitive trends in women markets, data-driven analysis and auction dynamics.
\xe2\x80\xa2  Benchmark industries versus international peers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Analyzing industries current and past financial data and performance and providing feedback based on the analysis. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare complex financial models and analyze them for effective implementation by Afghan Businesswomen. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identifying trends in financial performance and providing recommendations for improvement of women owned industries across Afghanistan. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Research price, market values, distribution channels and other transactions and make suggestions for the women owned companies to improve revenues, quality and cost base.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct various surveys for related to various industries as and when required
\xe2\x80\xa2 Study and analyze the value and supply chain of the industries in various sectors. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct PESTEL analysis on regular basis. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare detailed memoranda and presentations describing the key attributes of industries including Private companies and private-public partnership based companies.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Exploring investment opportunities based on financial models. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing reports and projections based on analysis.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Undertaken any other task assigned by the project manager or line manager. Industrial Job Requirements:
Knowledge:
Adherence to GoA laws and regulations regarding private sector.  
Knowledge of women economic empowerment National Priority program. 
familiarity with the Afghanistan industry regulatory framework.  
Qualifications and Experiences required:
The candidate should have the following qualifications, skills and experiences:
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Finance, Commerce, Business Administration, Management, or Economics.
At least 5 years of relevant experience in relevant discipline. 
Good team worker, capable of working effectively in a very challenging environment'

b'Marketing Manager Job SummarySCALE is hiring marketing manager for marketing purpose of its potato chips production. Communication with clients, planning and decision making, distribution and distribution planning, vehicles route planning, call management General Language perfection'

b'Intern, Parwan Job SummaryThe intern will provide a wide range of support to one of the programs or units of Integrity Watch Afghanistan. The intern has to be exceedingly open to new learning, well organized, flexible and enjoy the challenges of supporting an office of diverse people and programs. The intern is expected to possess the ability to interact with staff (at all levels) in a fast paced environment, sometimes under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient. Holding a high level of professionalism and confidentiality is crucial to this role. Satisfactory level of written and verbal communication skills, good decision making ability and attention to detail are equally important. \xef\x83\xbc File and retrieve documents and reference materials.
\xef\x83\xbc Arrange and coordinate meetings.
\xef\x83\xbc Attend and take internal and external meetings and take minutes.
\xef\x83\xbc Disseminate advocacy, communication or community monitoring materials to civil society, government agencies and citizen groups
\xef\x83\xbc Answer and manage incoming calls.
\xef\x83\xbc Support the team in event management
\xef\x83\xbc Provide preliminary assistance in report writing
\xef\x83\xbc Prepare invoices or other procurement and administrative documents as instructed by the supervisor, if required.
\xef\x83\xbc Enter the forms collected from community/integrity volunteers into the online database (communitymonitoring.org) on weekly basis
\xef\x83\xbc During entering the data, translate the phrases and sentences of forms from Dari/Pashto into English General \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum Bachelor degree in Economics, Business Administration, Public Policy, Social Sciences, Engineering or Natural Sciences.
EXPERIENCE
\xe2\x80\xa2 Any volunteer and internship experience is preferred.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Candidates with no work experience are preferred.'

b'Focal Point Job SummaryFocal Point will perform a series of issues related to the project such as mobilizing the community, managing trials monitoring process and the data comes from the field, leading the local monitoring group, coordinating field work. She/he also reports every two weeks to the program officer and maintains business relation with stakeholder. Responsibilities and duties
3.1      Responsibilities
- Ensure in a professional sound, efficient and effective manner the execution of the tasks outlined in these ToR.
- To motivate and encourage communities to promote accountability and transparency in their communities through monitoring the courts and trails in their areas of living.
- Establish and maintain respectful and effective relations with the target communities. 
- Treat information of IWA internal issues confidentially and respect the general IWA principles and values. 
- Manage and develop sound relation between Local Monitors and court officials. 
- Maintain good relation with communities and involve them in monitoring of court transparency.    
3.2. Competence
The Community Facilitator has the competence to take appropriate measures to implement a work plan for the tasks under his/her responsibility. Such weekly or monthly work plans (project monitoring plan) have to be submitted to Senior Program Officer for coordination and approval.
3.3. Main Tasks
3.3.1. Community Organization:
- To establish relation with community shuras, CSOs, Village community groups, or community institution to involve them in process of court monitoring.
- Organizing the local communities, leading the local monitoring group, managing the monitoring process, visiting the courts, and leading surveys conducting by LMs.
- Organizing and coordination field works. 
- Gathering and managing the data collection from the field. 
- Offering field report to the program officer every week.
- Field visit and work closely with LMs in monitoring of trails and assist the LMG in their daily activities. 
- Identify areas for improving within shuras and CSOs. 
- Identify the village influential peoples and potential mobilizers  
- Create an atmosphere of mutual trust and cooperation with communities. 
- Identify the most vulnerable people and the women headed household for adopted program support
- Assist the shuras to organize related meetings within the community  
- Introduce IWA and CBM-T principles and working strategy to the communities
-  Communicate problems and obstacles of the community to the Senior Program Officer. General \xe2\x80\xa2      Must be graduated from Law/ Sharia faculty.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Working knowledge of MS Office.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in Dari and Pashto both written and verbal, English is an asset'
