b'Provincial Coordinator (Balkh) Job SummaryThe Provincial Coordinator will assist in the overall implementation of the Community Based Monitoring. He will be directly responsible for the implementation of the programs in Kunar province. Responsibilities and duties
- Achieve the expected results and objectives as outlined in the Program Strategy Proposals submitted to different donors. 
- Ensure in a professional, efficient and effective manner the execution of the tasks outlined in these ToRs.
- Provide guidance and support to collaborators to achieve the expected results.   
- Respect and defend the values and principles of IWA.
Competence
- Elaborate/approve the work plans of all staff in the Province.
- Upon prior approval of the planning, take operational decisions in line with the Programs Strategy and Programs annual plan, the approved budget and existing management guidelines as well as Program Procedure Manual. 
- Firm understanding of Integrity and transparency as well as rural development. 
- Able to organize and train local community members. 
- Manage large flow of information and make it available to wider program team. 
- Propose strategic changes for the CBM program if deemed necessary, and advice on the overall program development of IWA 
- Organize the Kunar office autonomously in line with the management guidelines.  
Main Tasks
Coordination and Networking
- Coordinate all CBM provincial activities with all program stakeholders at the provincial level. 
- Network with concerned government authorities, CDC and NGOs at provincial levels.
Community Development
- Mobilize the newly selected communities through arranging meeting and ensure that the community elect their member as Integrity Volunteers in democratic and consensus way. 
- Support the work of elected community members (Integrity Volunteer), elected community members as Local Monitors. 
- Develop and implement all training activities for the targeted projects, including on job training of IVs in integrity and transparency. Make sure that developed training materials are appropriate-especially for community members with low literacy.  
- If there are ongoing reconstruction activities in the province, facilitate monitoring the progress by community members have regular meetings with the members of target communities, including shuras/ Community Development Councils and report to the community on regular basis.
- PC\xe2\x80\x99s main role is to manage with provincial staff the provincial plans implementation, reporting and coordination.
- PC is supervised by DHOP.
Project Cycle 
- Elaborate in close cooperation with the PM plan of operation, PO on the light of overall annual program plan.
- Elaborate monthly, and weekly plan
- Implement program activities at the provincial level according to the plan and advise staff and stakeholders, monitor and evaluate all CBM activities.
- Negotiate with CDCs, Shuras, other community members and Government officials to achieve a maximum possible transfer of know-how and transparency & integrity.
- Arrange monthly meeting with all IVs, and address their problems/concerns.
- Arrange monthly visit to make sure that the Integrity Volunteers and Integrity Leaders provide enough support to the communities and addressing the needs of IVs. 
- Assist the provincial department of Economy in set up and coordinating Provincial Monitoring Board.
- Collects and compiles monitoring data from the field and forward it to the Data base Assistant. 
- In collaboration with PM and M&E staff, make certain that all program activities are documented according to the log frame and M&E system
Finances and Administration 
- Contribute to the elaboration of budgets and plan the expenditures accordingly. 
- Oversee the procurement of goods locally.
- Organize the rent of vehicles according to the IWA procurement rules.
- Prepare monthly and quarterly budget forecast for approval to the PM
- Keep records and a professional filing system for program, general administration and finances;
- Ensure that confidentiality and right of privacy is maintained with regard to the collected data and ID of IVs and ILs. 
Staff Management
- Supervise all staff to perform well in Province. 
- Train and coach field staff. 
- Ensure the respect of IWA staff policy and other guidelines.
- Control the attendance and performance of CBM program staff at the provincial level. 
- Evaluate the work performance of Integrity volunteers with close cooperation of Integrity Leaders, evaluate the performance of Program Assistant.
Reporting and Knowledge Sharing
- Produce narrative reports on projects monitored in the field. 
- Prepare monthly reports to the program manager and attend formal meetings with the Government Authorities. 
- Prepare half-yearly and yearly project reports of CBM provincial activities.
- Assist the Program Manager in networking, coordination and liaison with government and other agencies; on provincial level. 
- Provides prompt and accurate reply to the queries put by program management. 
- Assist in capitalising experiences and sharing successes and important lessons learnt.
5. Complementary Tasks (upon prior request and time availability)
Replace other staff during their absence General Education
\xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficiency in English as well in Pashto/Dari
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated proficiency in word processing, PowerPoint, Spreadsheet analysis, E-mail and other information technology
\xe2\x80\xa2 Able to work collaboratively with teams as a constructive team member 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong oral and written communication skills.'

b'HVAC Engineer Job SummaryHVAC Engineer will be the project\xe2\x80\x99s lead person in the implementation of Central Utilities like Power House, Power Distribution, Sanitary Sewer collection and Distribution system along with buildings construction. The Safety Manager is primary responsible for effective implementation of Infrastructure and reconstruction project activities at the field level. Provides technical assistance as Safety Manager to Project manager and all Project team.
The SM compiles all the field level and monitoring information and assists the PM in periodical project report preparation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain and perform repair on all refrigeration equipment\xe2\x80\x99s and perform troubleshoot on all HVAC equipment\xe2\x80\x99s and perform repairs all coolers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage all metal duct components and install all HVAC systems and monitor all provide resolutions for all emergency alarm in systems and perform repair to all ventilating and air conditioning units.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage all data center applications and operate various centrifugal chillers and install and maintain dehumidification systems and oversee al maintenance activities for various technicians.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design and provide enhancements to all conservation programs for electricity and natural gas and assist to plant instrument and perform troubleshoot on equipment\xe2\x80\x99s and ensure compliance to all EPA regulations.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor all resources and ensure optimal utilization for same and achieve all customer objectives and provide support to all equipment\xe2\x80\x99s and perform calculations and implement various plans for HVAC
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate all approval systems for new and revised maintenance jobs and monitor all work instructions and maintain all deliverables for projects to maintain optimal qualities within required timeframe and coordinate with stakeholders to analyze all project requirements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform audit on all HVAC system and collect data and perform periodic evaluation and monitor all log books and manage all change processes and resolve all issues.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collaborate with stakeholders to perform regular audit and ensure compliance to all corporate regulations and assist to design an efficient HVAC system and adhere to all architectural requirements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Analyze all load programs and perform required calculations on same and manage all electrical requirements for HVAC equipment\xe2\x80\x99s and recommend improvements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintains repairs, calibrates and/or replaces portions of HVAC system, including air handlers, ducts, control valves and systems, pumps, compressors, dampers and filters including preventive maintenance on all equipment.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintains and repairs all associated HVAC piping, including coils, supplies, returns, traps, strainers and valves.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintains and repairs refrigeration equipment, including centrifugal units, cooling towers and heat exchangers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintains and provides proper water treatment to HVAC system. Change filters as required and periodically cleans coils, inlet screen, plenums and other duct areas.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Trouble-shoots malfunctions and effects repairs to system controls, calibrates, repairs or replaces pneumatic and/or electric controls, relays and circuits.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Repairs coils, bearings, seals and other equipment parts as required for proper system operations and as directed by the Utilities Engineer or Maintenance Supervisor.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Performs other associated work as assigned or directed, including moving of equipment, painting and cleaning work areas.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Physical Demands: Must be able to stand and work for prolonged periods of time. Must be able to lift and move heavy materials and equipment weighing up to approximately 100lbs. Engineering \xe2\x80\xa2 Master Degree is required.
Punctual and able to meet deadlines
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent oral and written communication skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Professional Engineer license
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with 3D Modeling programs such as AutoCAD'

b'Irrigation Design Drainage Engineer Job SummaryThe Irrigation Design / Drainage Engineer will be the AACS Consulting project\xe2\x80\x99s technical team member. This position is responsible for all Engineering infrastructure and irrigation aspects of the SWIM project activities in the assigned targeted areas of Project. Irrigation Design and Drainage Engineer will manage engineering activities and work closely with Senior International Irrigation Design Engineer to select projects to conduct feasibility assessments in collaboration with other program staff follow the developed design and estimation of the projects and supervise project implementation in the project\xe2\x80\x99s sites. In addition to overall technical project management, the Irrigation Design & Drainage Engineer will work closely with the Project team and other stakeholders to build their capacity on the subject area. \xe2\x80\xa2 Under the supervision of Senior International Irrigation Design Engineer, the Irrigation Design and Drainage Engineer will work together with the program team to ensure that all infrastructure projects are implemented in the selected communities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Should have full knowledge of designs of irrigation canals siphons culverts retaining walls small and medium size bridges passageways spillways and all irrigation related structures. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible The innovative in selection of projects conducting feasibility studies preparing design cost estimation preparing work plans implementation of the infrastructure projects.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Regular field visits to determine any deviation and challenges and suggest appropriate solutions in developing irrigation designs, plans and drawings.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Senior International Irrigation Design Engineer in Preparation of technical specification for infrastructure projects.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist GIS Specialist in hydrological data collection.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for estimating the river and main canal flow rate as well as provide hydrological data based on hydrological boundaries.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Senior International Irrigation Design Engineer in Preparation of all technical documentation for the tendering process.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify training need and deliver capacity-building activities both for the program engineering team as well as for beneficiaries.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure full adherence to the AACS Consulting security plans and protocols conscientiously respecting the declared go and no-go zones.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Senior international Irrigation Design Engineer on developing the site visit and quality check reports and contribute to overall program reporting to the donor and the government. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct survey, design, and feasibility studies of the selected irrigation schemes.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collect information about hydrology e.g. catchment characteristics, rainfall, stream/channel, design discharge, linear waterway, scour depth for all irrigation activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare detailed technical drawings good for irrigation construction, prepared as per national and international standards using AutoCAD (and other popular software), containing all details required for execution of the activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare Bill of Quantities (BoQs) for the designed activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Have strong ability to write proposals for the designed irrigation activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Investigate proposed locations of structures (flow control gates, turnout, flow measurement weirs, etc.) and prepare initial designs in coordination with the team. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist national and international consultants as directed by the Project Team Leader. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Other duties as assigned by the Project Team Leader. Engineering \xe2\x80\xa2 Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Water Resources Engineering/Agricultural Engineering /Civil Engineering with focus on design and construction/rehabilitation of irrigation infrastructure (design of canal, water control gates, flow measurement structure, siphons, culverts, construction of flood control levees etc.).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be able to independently design , intakes, canals, water diversion dams, siphons, aqueducts, culverts, protection and retaining walls, etc. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be able to analyze survey reports, maps, drawings, blueprints, aerial photography, or other topographical or geologic data.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Computer simulation/use of computer models is required. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent AutoCAD, Eagle Point, Revit skills 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Must be efficient in the completion of the assigned tasks, and be able to deliver under pressure. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong Pashto, Dari, and English language skills.'

b'Civil Engineering Drafter Job SummaryBalwan Engineering is seeking a CAD designer to support various engineering drafting needs. Applicants shall possess 2-5 years of experience in Autodesk Civil 3D design field. Candidates should be certified in AutoCAD use or possess equivalent experience. A good understanding of mechanical, hydraulic, and hydrologic civil engineering concepts as well as the standard US codes and standards that are in effect regarding those disciplines is desired. Applicants should be organized and be able to keep track of numerous project files through the various phases of design. CAD Designer will be supporting the design of the following:
Civil 
Civil design \xe2\x80\x93 grading and Public Works (School, Roads and utilities)
CAD Design Functions will include:
Make revisions to project drawings marked up by client and/or Engineer.
Create and manage electronic document file structure, naming convention in accordance with company standards.
Work closely with Project Managers and Engineers to set-up and manage contract and construction drawings.
Communicate with outside agencies and clients in exchanging data and manage that data in accordance with guidelines set.
Create and/or modify base drawings, which may be used in a variety of presentation documents.
Can be relied on as productive team member and AutoCAD user to work a typical set of project documents from beginning to end with professional quality output that conforms to company standards.
Must be able to work on multiple projects at the same time.
Follow CAD standards.
Candidate resumes will be evaluated relative to experience and knowledge of all areas of water resources, general civil and land development. Compensation will be commensurate with experience and capabilities. Engineering Requirements
Should be certified in advanced areas of Civil 3D use or equivalent experience.
2-5 years of experience predominantly in Civil 3D design.
Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to be receptive and adaptive to change.
Autodesk civil 3d 2017 required, AutoCAD MEP and  REVIT'

b'Hydrology/River Sediment Specialist Job SummaryIslamic Republic of Afghanistan
Request for \xe2\x80\x9cExpressions of Interest\xe2\x80\x9d for National Individual Consultants 
Organization: Project Coordination Unit (PCU)
Project: Irrigation Restoration and Development Project (IRDP)
Reference No.: MEW/PCU/REOI/594
Announcement Date: 09-Oct-2018 closing Date: 29- Oct -2018
Nationality:  Afghanistan    Duration: one year (Likely to be extended)
The Islamic Republic of Afghanistan, Ministry of Energy & Water has applied for a grant from the International Development Association toward the cost of Irrigation Restoration and Development Project, and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this \xe2\x80\x9cgrant\xe2\x80\x9d to payments for hiring the services of following qualified national individual consultants. Below is a detailed description of duties and responsibilities which include following:  
1. Simulate sediment in the catchment using Water Erosion Predict Project (Geo WEPP) model.
2. Assist the hydrology /River sediment team in the day-to-day management of hydrology and sediment data processing and rainfall-runoff modeling.
3. Process, analysis and hydrological modeling in particular River Basin using sediment raw data. 
4. Hydrological stations network design in the River Basins.
5. Simulate climate change prediction using SimCLIME model.
6. Simulate long term data using Mann-Kendall trend test.
7. Capability of installation of automatic hydrological, meteorological and snow survey stations.
8. Simulate peak runoff in the catchment using Water Erosion Predict Project (Geo WEPP) model.
9. Have a thorough understanding of MS office package, AutoCAD, GIS, QGIS and any other filed relevant software.
10. Capability of operation and maintenance of automatic hydrology stations.
11. Analysis and predict future climate change impacts on air temperature and precipitation.
12. Analyses climate change scenario.
13.  Most effective way to gap filling the missing hydrological data.
14. Run the Data integration and Analysis System(DIAS)
15. Connect automatic hydrological stations sensors to satellite. Engineering \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree/ Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Civil engineering/ environmental engineering/ water resources engineering and management hydrological modeling.
Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree holder will be highly preferred. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least 5 years\xe2\x80\x99 relevant experience.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Have good analytic and reporting skills.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be able to present complex technical problems in clear manners.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Having experience of working with national and international organization.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be able to deliver on given tasks on time.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge and experience of the necessary internal and external meetings and presentation at local and international conference.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of developing training materials, and offer trainings related to water- related models to other staff of Ministry of Energy and Water(MEW) and give presentation and seminars internally and other stakeholders.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent oral and written communication skills in national languages as well as English.'

\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent verbal, written, organizational and interpersonal skills.

b'Structural Engineer Job SummaryBalwan Co.ltd is seeking an engineer with at least four years of building design experience to support its new office in Kabul. The position requires the ability to work on a wide range of engineering projects and play a prominent role in the firm\xe2\x80\x99s local business development efforts. Proficiency with design and modeling programs including Revit, AutoCAD, RAM concept, RAM Steel etc. is necessary. Experience with both new and existing structures is preferred. Candidate will work with team members from other offices on select projects and work independently on others. Communication and networking skills will play a prominent role in the position. Versatility and the ability to work on several projects simultaneously are necessary. . Proficiency with design and modeling programs including Revit, AutoCAD, RAM concept, RAM Steel etc. is necessary. Experience with both new and existing structures is preferred. Candidate will work with team members from other offices on select projects and work independently on others. Communication and networking skills will play a prominent role in the position. Versatility and the ability to work on several projects simultaneously are necessary. Engineering Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Civil, Structural or Architectural Engineering
* minimum 4 years of experience in structural engineering design
* Strong oral and written communication skills are critical
* Proficient in Revit / AutoCAD
* Experience with a variety of design and modeling programs including Bentley products (RAM Steel, RAM Concept, Elements etc)'

b'Senior Teacher ELT Business Development Job SummaryTo manage both the active pursuit and effective delivery of English contracts, projects and services in order to achieve the defined regional and local strategic outcomes. To lead on contract pursuit. To manage Grant-Funded ELT programmes, including the provision of administrative & logistical support in line with agreed policies and procedures related to procurement, finance and customer services. To play a key role in upholding a culture of cooperation and collaboration by delivering customer focussed support to the programme team and clients. To deliver training and observe teachers and trainers. To pursue new ELT business opportunities for British Council Afghanistan. \xe2\x80\xa2 To oversee the contract pursuit, design, development, delivery, administration, organisation, technical supervision and promotion of a range of British Council English projects and events, including Regional and Global Projects.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Delivering well-planned and appropriate teacher training input sessions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring and recording teacher quality through classroom observations
\xe2\x80\xa2 To provide support on Country Delivery Plan in terms of English projects to satisfaction of Country Director and/or Head of English and Exams
\xe2\x80\xa2 To oversee/deliver the preparation of relevant sections of Country Delivery Plan, Country Marketing Analysis, Project Initiation documents to the satisfaction of Country Director, Head of English & Exams and Regional Project Manager(s).
\xe2\x80\xa2 To make sure that Regional & local products and services are delivered within budget, on time, and to the agreed quality standards
\xe2\x80\xa2 To oversee all financial matters (planning, budget estimates, quotations, payments requests, commitments, expenditure records, cash flow forecasts etc) are maintained and submitted in a timely and accurate manner in accordance with British Council systems.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To make sure all correspondence and enquiries relevant to the programme are answered promptly within the standard time limit
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluation (including REF MCC & ACC) carried out to corporate standards and methodology
\xe2\x80\xa2 Regular and active participation in cross departmental office meetings and training sessions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Confidence in processing correspondence and liaising with government departments as required
\xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee contract pursuit and delivery of programmes as per corporate policies and standards, including Corporate Customer Service Standards, British Council Equality & Diversity (EO&D) policies & practice, Child Protection & Data Protection requirements 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform SAP related duties to oversee the programme activities Education Essential Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in relevant subject area,  desirable MA in ELT/ MBA or CELTA Qualified'

\xe2\x80\xa2 Classroom management.

b'Project Officer Job SummaryTo implement the above two projects, the Foundation has eight Coordinators in eight regions, and also engages an Implementing Partner (IP). In addition, the Foundation works closely with two specific directorates within the Ministry of Education: General Directorate of Academic Supervision and Learning Assessment (GDASLA) and General Directorate of Science and Educational Technology (GDSET). The focus of this job is to ensure, through a variety of activities: 
\xe2\x80\xa2 students increase their interest and performance in science, 
\xe2\x80\xa2 teachers receive adequate in-service training; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 school administrators support both teachers and students to improve science learning and teaching; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 parents are engaged with the school; and 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Kankor preparation training is integrated into the regular science and math teaching curriculum. Technical support
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide administrative and logistics support required for the successful implementation of project activities such as workshops and conferences; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain project electronic and hard copies documents and ensure that the education folder on TAF intranet is accurate, update and organized.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review documents prepared by IPs and provide input in the areas of distance learning, web-site development, and ICT tools recommended for use in these areas; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and implement activities (through the field coordinators and IP) that increase the interest of students in science and math subjects; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the Ministry and selected schools to develop and implement strategies for engaging parents to improve their children\xe2\x80\x99s interest in science and math; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the procurement department and IP in purchasing laboratory equipment for schools;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Takes notes/minutes at meetings and ensure follow up; and 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other duties assigned by Project Manager and senior management.
 Planning and Coordination
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support Regional Coordinators in the development of schools\xe2\x80\x99 physical visit schedules.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review field reports to recommend solutions to challenges and activities that foster continued improvement in teaching/learning of science and maths; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support efforts to strengthen the integration of Kankor preparation; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support M&E team in the development M&E work plans by providing relevant field data such as start/end dates of academic year, examination schedules and so on; and 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the central GDSET and GDASLA staff to ensure they are fully informed and involved in the implementation of the activities
Reporting
\xe2\x80\xa2 Follow up with grantees on timely submission of the reports.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review the weekly reports received from IPs and send feedback for further development. 
Internal Contacts
TAF AG Education Team, HR, Procurement; Administration and Finance & Grants Departments
External Contacts
Sub-grantees, Afghan government ministries, schools and universities Education Education:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in science, mathematics, or Computer Science.  
Experience:
\xe2\x80\xa2 A minimum of three to five years of working experience with academic institutions, national and/or international organizations in the field of education, preferable with focus in science and technology.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated experience in the areas of coordination of work to be done by others, organizing workshops and conferences, knowledge of key M&E concepts, and writing reports such as weekly reports and meeting minutes. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experienced in working with ministries \xe2\x80\x93 preferably MoE and MoHE. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experienced in working on USAID projects, but not necessary. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Must be willing to travel to secure provinces / areas within Afghanistan. Mahram costs are provided.'

- Preparing lesson plan.

b"University Chancellor Job SummaryThe chancellor is the leader of the university, who holds the highest academic position & responsible for watching over the programs and activities of the whole university. She is an official who has been given the great responsibility to oversee the university\xe2\x80\x99s whole faculty and student body, including the financial status and general well-being of the institution. Basically, the university chancellor is like the acting chief executive officer of the institution in that the heads of each department report to her. The specific duties and responsibilities of the Chancellor are to:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparation of the monthly, quarterly and annually work plan for the achievement of the strategic objectives of the University.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Serves as the leader of the education & development team, providing guidance on institutional priorities, strategically planning;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Serve as public face of university & meeting with internal and external constituents, provide and giving speeches to large or small group of people; represent the University in an official capacity at external functions from time to time and advance the University\xe2\x80\x99s mission through her role as an ambassador;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide leadership and advice in fundraising campaigns and in relations with donors & actively involve with cultivating donor relationships and crafting requests for major financial gifts; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Act as an ambassador for the University, promoting its activities in the wider community and, in particular, assisting with the philanthropic activity and fund raising projects of the University.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preside the meetings of the scientific council of the university and take care of the implementation of their decisions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Approval or rejection of the scientific councils of the relevant faculties and, if necessary, to submit them to the scientific council of the university.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Represent the University at such events as shall be deemed appropriate by the Chancellor in consultation with the University Administration
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that every facet of the university is efficient and effective include oversight of the physical campus, academic planning, policy review and development, personnel matters and regular review of academic programs and student services;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide leadership, academic and administrative to the whole University; prepare and recommend changes to academic curriculum;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design & develop policies, administrative guidelines, monitor & evaluate, control & execute all academic issues within the university; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Secure a financial base sufficient to allow the delivery of the University's mission, aims and objectives; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support and promote the mission and values of the University;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Promote and further the strategic goals and ambitions of the University;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in institutional planning, policy and procedure development and problem resolution with the President and other senior officers, including researching, reviewing and making recommendations on new or revised policies and strategies and on intra-departmental or inter-departmental issues, and if required, serving on university planning and policy-making committees.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain working relationships across the university community, specifically with the Faculty Deans, University executive officers, University External Relations personnel and the faculty members of the MEC 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with Human Resource regarding all University staffing issues including job descriptions, reclassifications, performance evaluations, payroll records and staff management issues.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supervision and control of the activities of the relevant departments in order to appoint, promote, retire and disrupt members of the faculty and staff in accordance with the provisions of the law.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out certain important ceremonial and civic duties, cultural programs;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provides leadership to the executive vice chancellors, vice chancellors, deans, faculty, students and staff.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Giving direction to the university\xe2\x80\x99s academic and institutional officers provide university-wide management in such areas as academic policy, planning, and business affairs; faculty, student, and staff affairs; legislative policy; institutional research; legal affairs; capital planning; and university relations and development.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Act in an advisory and supportive role to the president;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Act as the Chair of the Convocation and thereby specifically foster links with the alumni of the University.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in the governance of the University as a member of the Board of Directors 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Crises management & Knowing how to manage issues internally and externally, take appropriate steps to avoid conflicts of interest, or the appearance of conflicts of interest between financial or other personal interests and the goals and policies of the university.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preside at convocation ceremonies and confer all degrees and diplomas;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Host, attend or preside at other special events of the University;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Take reports and summaries from the head of each particular department, analyzing the reports & give proper advice to them.
Do everything in order to make the university run smoothly as possible. Education Educational Qualifications
Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Public Administration, Leadership, Business Administration or related field
Work Experience
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least 10 years\xe2\x80\x99 active work experience, including at least 6 years in a management /team leadership role, preferably in an educational, academic and/or healthcare environment
\xe2\x80\xa2 Able to demonstrate leadership in or management of positive changes to improve organizational performance or service delivery.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with funding instruments and the establishment and implementation of research contracts between industry and academia
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiarity with the administrative, academic and governance structures of a university
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent networking skills and ability to maintain critical and sensitive relationships with government, industry and media among others
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conversant with industry\xe2\x80\x99s research and development approach and able to translate to academic terms
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with researching and analyzing corporate mandates to assess a company\xe2\x80\x99s suitability as a research partner
\xe2\x80\xa2 Specialized in the areas of Leadership, Organizational Behavior or Development, Strategy or Innovation Management.
\xe2\x80\xa2 We especially encourage academics with an entrepreneurial mindset searching for possibilities to leave their mark in a creative, dynamic and ambitious environment
Language Skills
Strong reading, writing, speaking and understanding skills in Dari, Pashto and English 
Desirable Attributes
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of applicable legislation, standards, policies and procedures within specialty area.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge and understanding of institutional policies and procedures and the regulatory environment within which they operate."

b"Consultant- English Tutor Job SummaryUSWDP\xe2\x80\x99s University Partnerships Department has agreement with Jawzjan University that provides technical support for the department of Oil and Gas. This effort falls under the partnership agreement between two universities. The objective is to provide tailored English language training to two Jawzjan University faculty over a period of three months. Additional details below. Deliverable:
The consultant should deliver an English language training as part of a tailored program for the two faculty members of Jawzjan University, who are beginner English learners. The program is meant to be an intensive, short-term training that will build participants\xe2\x80\x99 English capacity in a structured and engaging way.
Course content should build capacity in the following areas: English language comprehension, listening, writing and conversation.
The candidate should propose a specific curriculum to be used and explain the components as well as the method of delivery and learning strategies.
Duration: 3 Months, beginning late October (date TBD)
Hours: 4 hours/ day for two participants
Time: 06:00 AM to 12:00 PM (some flexibility possible)
Days: daily, Saturday to Wednesday  Education \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor's degree in literature of English Language
\xe2\x80\xa2 4 years of experience in teaching with institutes or universities "

b'Beautician / \xd8\xa2\xd8\xb1\xd8\xa7\xdb\x8c\xd8\xb4\xda\xaf\xd8\xb1 Job SummaryThe beautician will be responsible for day to day duties of the Queen Salon as per customers requirement. - Greet customers upon arrival.
- Be updated with the latest trends in beauty services and technology.
- Book appointments over the phone and serve walk-ins based on availability
- Provide the necessary services to those who want to look beautiful at all times.
- Discuss hair-style, makeup and customer order options.
- Show the right values towards customers according to her request.
- Exercise punctuality to schedules.
- Apply makeup products properly to customers
- Recommend hairstyles and nail colors to match clients\xe2\x80\x99 needs and personal style
- Cut, dry, and style hair properly.
- Wash, color, and condition hair
- Inspect hair, face, and scalp, to recommend treatment
- Discusses hair, skin and nail care methods with customers.
- Washes and conditions hair prior to cutting or styling.
- Applies chemical solutions in the form of permanents and relaxers to hair as part of the styling process.
- Provides effective solutions for common issues concerning hair, scalp, nails and skin.
- Discusses various style options with clients.
- Remove hair using permanent and temporary methods (e.g. electrolysis and waxing)
- Apply hair products, like serum, cream and clay to style hair
- Give manicures and pedicures following clients\xe2\x80\x99 preferences
- Provide guidelines to clients on how to take care of their skin
- Maintain updated client records (e.g. contact details and treatments)
- Cross-sell therapies and beauty products, when relevant
- Maintain a cheerful and warm disposition in dealing with customers at all times.
- Always available to attend to the needs of customers.
- Aim to satisfy every customer.
- Maintain cleanliness and observe proper hygiene.
- Maintain good and proper grooming at all times.
- Make sure our working area is clean and equipment is sterilized at all times
- Keep track of levels of stock (e.g lotions and nail polishes & makeup needs)
- Communicates with clients in order to provide the requested services.
- Restocks shelves and supplies.
- Keeps records of hair color and nail color used by each customer at past visits. Designer - Minimum must have a high school diploma or equivalent. University degree is an asset.
- Having certificate confirming the completion of a cosmetology program.
- Familiarity with both Pashto and Dari, having working knowledge of English language and communication with Urdu/Hindi is an asset.
- Hands-on training necessary as part of a certificate program as well as on-the-job training.
- Must have minimum 3 years of experience as beautician.
- Age must be between 20 to 40 years'

b'Hairdresser (Barber) / \xd8\xb3\xd9\x84\xd9\x85\xd8\xa7\xd9\x86 Job SummaryThe Hairdresser will be responsible for day to day duties of the King Salon as per customers requirement. - Welcome clients as they arrive in the salon and engage them in conversation to determine their needs.
- Provide suggestions to clients regarding current hairstyles and favorite trends
- Answer clients\xe2\x80\x99 questions regarding salon\xe2\x80\x99s facilities and hair care products
- Inquire from clients about hair care preferences and suggest appropriate resolutions to hair and scalp issues
- Cut and style hair according to clients\xe2\x80\x99 instructions
- Provide beard trims to clients looking for grooming
- Provide manicure and pedicure services to clients
- Give scalp treatments and apply facials
- Provide clients with head, neck and back massages
- Check clients for scalp or skin disorders such as sores or abrasions and determine how to provide a certain service
- Ensure that all combs and scissors are cleaned and sanitized after use
- Take telephone calls from clients and provide them with needed information
- Schedule appointments over the phone and maintain records of work performed on each client
- Assume responsibility for the upkeep and cleanliness of workstations
- Perform up-selling services by suggesting retail products placed at the barbershop
- Ensure that sufficient items such as clean wrap sheets and towels are available on an ongoing basis
- Supervise trainees and apprentices to ensure that they are working according to the salon\xe2\x80\x99s protocols
- Resolve clients\xe2\x80\x99 complaints correctly in a bid to ensure recurring business from them Designer - A high school diploma or equivalent is required, but not a must. University degree is an asset.
- Having certificate confirming the completion of a cosmetology program.
- Familiarity with both Pashto and Dari, having working knowledge of English language and communication with Urdu/Hindi is an asset.
- Hands-on training necessary as part of a certificate program as well as on-the-job training.
- Must have minimum 3 years of experience as barber.
- Age must be between 20 to 40 years'

b'Video Editor and Graphic Designer Job SummaryVideo Editor & Graphic designer will be responsible to Edit and Create Videos and Design graphics for Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock. He/she should Prepares visual presentations by designing art and copy layouts, Weekly, Magazines, Banners, labels, advertising and signboard, video spots and etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Create and Edit Innovative videos for Facebook and some other medias  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Presenting and design style, format, print production and timescales.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing concepts, graphics and layouts for product illustrations, company logos, social media and websites.
\xe2\x80\xa2  Determining size and arrangement of illustrative material and copy, and font style and size.
\xe2\x80\xa2  Preparing rough drafts of material based on an agreed brief.
\xe2\x80\xa2  Reviewing final layouts and suggesting improvements if required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaising with printers on a regular basis to ensure deadlines are met and material is printed to the highest quality.
\xe2\x80\xa2  Employ color, type, illustration, photography, animation, and various print and layout techniques when designing project.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design the Farmer weekly, Dehkada Magazine and other needed files creatively.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Designer Education:
A degree in Art, Graphic Design and other related fields.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Up to date with industry leading software and technologies (In Design, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, Photoshop, after effect, Premier etc.)
\xe2\x80\xa2 An understanding of the global development landscape
\xe2\x80\xa2 A track record of producing videos that have measurable impact
\xe2\x80\xa2 Motion graphics expertise (animating maps, data, graphs, etc.)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Videography skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Solid social media writing and video scripting skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong editorial judgement and/or experience working in a newsroom
\xe2\x80\xa2 Creative text designer
Experience:
At least 4 years related experience of Graphic designer and video editing.'

b'Consultancy for the External Review of Sustainable Livelihood and Social Development (SLSD) Job SummaryWith the main goal to have a strategic control of the SLSD programme, SDC is commissioning this review in order to assess the relevance, effectiveness, efficiency, sustainability, and impact primarily of the second phase of the SLSD project, however the previous work done by TLO in the first phase should also be briefly looked at, in order to get an overview of the overall project outcomes and impacts on livelihood improvement over the last 5 years (2013-2018). Further to that the review should provide concrete insights and recommendations to SDC for the development of the third phase of the program, aligned with SDC\xe2\x80\x99s strategic priorities for Afghanistan for 2019-2022. The review shall take place in both projects provinces Paktiya and Khost.
Mandate: Consultancy for the External Review of Sustainable Livelihood and Social Development (SLSD) Project
Organization:  Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)
Locations: Kabul, Paktya and Khost
Duration:  24 working days during the months of November- December 2018 (tentative)
Announcement date: 16.10.2018
Closing date:  04.11.2018
Start date:  11.11.2018 (tentatively) The external review should particularly focus on the following aspects/questions:
a. Evaluation of current phase:
\xe2\x80\xa2 The overall effectiveness of the project from a results-based perspective;
\xe2\x80\xa2 The overall direct and indirect results (outputs and outcomes) of the project produced through the utilization of SDC financial and technical assistance during the phase;
\xe2\x80\xa2 What are the major external and internal factors influencing the achievement of the project?
\xe2\x80\xa2 The level of acceptance of TLO by beneficiaries, communities, stakeholders and authorities;
\xe2\x80\xa2 How effective has been the collaboration with relevant governmental departments, particularly PAIL
\xe2\x80\xa2 Are the current promoted income generating activities for the poor and women effective enough?
\xe2\x80\xa2 To what extend have aspects of gender and governance been considered during the implementation?
\xe2\x80\xa2 How is the current monitoring and evaluation mechanism assessed? Does this mechanism serve as a feedback system for improving project implementation? Make recommendations on improving the project M&E systems for improved future integration of economic and financial analysis concerns. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 A financial and economic analysis to be conducted preferably through a \xe2\x80\x98Cost Benefit Analysis\xe2\x80\x99. If it is not feasible (monetarizing outcomes) the review team is expected to provide a short justification and conduct a \xe2\x80\x98Cost Effectiveness Analysis\xe2\x80\x99 instead. 
b. Recommendation for next phase:
\xe2\x80\xa2 What are the good practices and the lessons learnt from the second phase of SLSD that could be replicated and up scaled in a next phase?
\xe2\x80\xa2 What are the proposed measures and alternate implementation approach to make the program more effective and efficient?
\xe2\x80\xa2 What income generating activities should be promoted for the poor and women?
\xe2\x80\xa2 While overviewing the effectiveness of the implemented subprojects, at which level (community, district or watershed level) interventions could be more effective in improving livelihoods coupled with targeting more beneficiaries? 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Does it make sense to include other themes, such as access to water for irrigation and drinking in the next phase? How does that fit with the overall strategic goal of the domain?
3. Methodology of External Review
The external review will be carried out in three stages:
1. Desk review: A comprehensive review of the available documents, reports and evidence will take place in the desk review stage. In this stage, SDC and TLO will act as focal points for the review and will provide the review team with the available written documentation which may include but are not limited to:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Project documents;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Project progress and financial reports;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Project annual reports;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Mission reports;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Internal and external review reports;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Agreements/contracts;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organizational chart of the project;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Internal SDC credit proposals;
\xe2\x80\xa2 SDC draft cooperation strategy 2019-2022;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Any other available relevant and important documents.
The review will be complemented by interviews with SDC and TLO staff (if needed) to provide the consultant with as much information as possible.
2. Data collection and consultation in the field: In this stage of the review exercise, a participatory and inclusive approach will be used to collect primary data and verification of secondary data obtained through the desk review stage throughout the external review exercise. In this stage the review team will conduct interviews and focus groups discussions with all main stakeholders. The use of surveys needs to be evaluated by the team and prepared during the preparatory phase. As a focal point for the review, SDC together with TLO will assist the review team with arranging all required meetings and consultation sessions and forums. 
3. In the final stage of the review, the review team will analyze the collected data and materials to produce the deliverables of the evaluation. 
The review team, nevertheless, is allowed to revisit proposed methodology and come up with a modify/revised methodology, shall the team feel such a need. In any case, the team will submit to SDC and TLO work plan of its proposed methodology. The outline may contain the following information:
\xe2\x80\xa2 A specific and time bound work plan within the suggested timeframe
\xe2\x80\xa2 Details of how the review exercise will take place
\xe2\x80\xa2 Reporting, debriefing in the end
It is anticipated that the evaluation team will present its methodology and detailed work plan to a joint meeting (briefing) attended by SDC and TLO prior to stage one of the exercise.
4. Deliverables:
The review team is expected to produce the following specific outputs:
1. A work-plan describing how the evaluation will be carried out, bringing refinements, specificity and elaboration to the terms of reference. The work-plan shall comprise at least the following elements:
a. Overview of the mandate and expectations of the reviewer;
b. Review techniques methodology;
c. Key expected issues for all elements of the external review described above;
d. Reporting;
e. Work schedule (timeframe).
2. Briefing and presenting the work plan, methodologies, procedures etc.to SDC and TLO in Kabul prior to the start of the review process.
3. With SDC/TLO support, the review team will organize a de-briefing at the end of the review in Kabul presenting SDC and TLO with the initial findings and recommendations.
4. Draft report, providing comprehensive and well-structured information and answering the review questions outlined above. It should be submitted no later than 10 working days after the debriefing and will be subject to SDC/TLO comments and suggestions.
5. Final Report: Upon receipt of SDC and TLO comments on the draft report, the review team will revise the report and incorporate received comments and suggestions, unless not contrary to the review findings and submit it to SDC no later than 5 working days after having received the comments.
6. Analytic data, calculation, assumptions are delivered in editable formats.
The External Review Report should not exceed 30 pages and summarize the key findings and recommendations, and comprised of at least the following parts:
a. Executive Summary (not to exceed 3 pages);
b. Overview of the mandate;
c. Key issues, findings and recommendations on all elements of the external review; 
d. Conclusion
e. The document(s) shall be delivered in electronic format (Ms. Word and Excel), in English. Consulting This announcement is open to a consultant or a team of consultants (max. 3, international and national, female and male). The consultant/team shall have solid expertise in monitoring and evaluation (especially NGOs working in agriculture and livelihood) and in the field of agriculture and livelihood development. In particular, the consultant/team shall have the following expertise and skills:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advanced degree in a relevant field;
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least five years of experience in reporting, monitoring and reviewing of projects in the agriculture and livelihood sector;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Extensive experience in undertaking reviews/studies and impact assessments of development projects;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to present information in a transparent and comprehensive manner;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Written and spoken fluency in English and in Pashtu;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Previous work experience in Afghanistan, preferable in M&E-related fields. 
Timeframe
The external review exercise shall be performed within a maximum of 24 working days as outlined below: 
Work No. of Days
Preparation (work plan, methodologies, timeframe etc.) 3
Desk Review 4
Inception report submission 1
Field Work in Paktiya and Khost including desk review and travel days 8
Briefing and Debriefing in Kabul 1
Preparing/Writing the Review Report 5
Finalization of the Report after SDC comments 2
Total no. of working days 24 days
7. Logistic and Security
The consultant/team must be able to arrange logistics (transport, accommodation, and visa) on its own account. SDC may facilitate access to relevant information, organizations and stakeholders upon request. 
The consultant/team is responsible for its own safety and the safety of its staff (including relevant insurances). SDC is not liable for any kind of damage to staff or property and cannot be held accountable for any claims or costs related to injury, death, and loss of or damage to property. SDC will facilitate access to security related information and provide the team with a security briefing up-on request.'

b'Consultant (Support Conducting Education Joint Sector Review 2018) Job SummaryThe consultant will assist the Ministry of Education\xe2\x80\x99s Strategic Monitoring and Evaluation Directorate
in conducting the Education Joint Sector Review. S/he will be based in the central building of the
ministry, and will be required to travel to the field along with the technical team in order to assist them. The consultant will perform the following duties:
\xef\x82\xb7 Review the related documents and previous EJSR reports.
\xef\x82\xb7 Assist the technical team in revising and standardization of the assessment tools
\xef\x82\xb7 Where possible, travel to the field along with the technical team in order to observe the ground
level realities.
\xef\x82\xb7 Act as the main focal person in keeping the record of field visit observation reports.
UNESCO is committed to promoting geographical distribution and gender equality within its Secretariat. Therefore, women
candidates are strongly encouraged to apply, as are nationals from non- and under-represented Member States. Persons with disabilities
equally are encouraged to apply.
Worldwide mobility is required as staff members must be ready to serve in other duty stations in accordance with UNESCO\xe2\x80\x99s geographical
mobility policy.
UNESCO applies a zero tolerance policy against all forms of harassment.
UNESCO DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE AT ANY STAGE OF THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS.
\xef\x82\xb7 Consolidate and analyze the field mission reports into one in Dari language, produce the
summary for each section based on NESP III components (Access, Quality and Management)
and translate them into English language.
\xef\x82\xb7 Coordinate the EJSR Taskforce meetings and exchange of information.
\xef\x82\xb7 Translate the EJSR relevant material including tools, documents, reports, summaries, graphs,
charts and tables into English and vice versa.
\xef\x82\xb7 Work closely with the International Consultant and facilitate the relevant material as needed.
\xef\x82\xb7 Assist the International Consultant and the technical team in drafting the final EJSR report as
well as the relevant presentations for dissemination.
Deliverables:
\xef\x82\xb7 Consolidate summary of previous EJSR reports in English Language, assist MoE in revision
of set of EJSR data collection tools and instruments, and prepare them in both Dari and
English language.
\xef\x82\xb7 Consolidate field visit reports in Dari language, produce summary of the field reports based on
NESP III components (Access, Quality and Management), and translate them into English
language.
\xef\x82\xb7 Prepare the EJSR report in Dari language based on the English version that will be produced
by the international consultant.
\xef\x82\xb7 Develop a comprehensive EJSR presentation in Dari language based on the English version
produced by the international consultant.
Supervisory arrangements
The consultancy will be undertaken under the overall supervision of the Director and Representative
of the UNESCO Office in Afghanistan and the direct supervision of the Chief of Education. Consulting with a focus on educational planning.
\xef\x82\xb7 At least 3 years of relevant work experience in educational planning/management, previous
experience in education specially in sector reviews and evaluations and drafting review reports
\xef\x82\xb7 Excellent understanding of education systems, policies, and procedures
\xef\x82\xb7 Fluent English as well as national languages.
\xef\x82\xb7 Excellent report writing, consolidation, integration and analysis skills.'

b'Telecommunication Specialist Job SummaryTelecommunication Specialist will be the project\xe2\x80\x99s lead person in the implementation of Central Utilities like Power House, Power Distribution, Sanitary Sewer collection and Distribution system along with buildings construction. The Safety Manager is primary responsible for effective implementation of Infrastructure and reconstruction project activities at the field level. Provides technical assistance as Safety Manager to Project manager and all Project team.
The SM compiles all the field level and monitoring information and assists the PM in periodical project report preparation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Plans network installations by studying technical specifications; preparing an installation schematic.
\xe2\x80\xa2  Manage, supervise and provide technical advice on telecommunications systems
\xe2\x80\xa2  Receive feedback, identify users\xe2\x80\x99 needs and requirements and mobilize existing technology to meet their criteria
\xe2\x80\xa2  Document plans, requests, activities and specifications and report on them
\xe2\x80\xa2  Program features, design networks and systems and allocate resources as necessary
\xe2\x80\xa2  Monitor and test systems and peripheral equipment and troubleshoot problems
\xe2\x80\xa2  Evaluate systems performance level and improve capabilities as needed
\xe2\x80\xa2  Oversee and coordinate telecommunications activities
\xe2\x80\xa2  Purchase electronic equipment and prepare budgetary justifications
\xe2\x80\xa2  Cooperate with management to develop staff and improve their skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 \xe2\x80\xa2  Follow industry\xe2\x80\x99s standards and best practices
\xe2\x80\xa2 Establishes voice and data networks by programming features; establishing interfaces and integrations; following industry standards; activating remote access tools.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Verifies service by testing and re-programming circuits, equipment, and alarms; identifying and correcting problems; conferring with engineers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Documents network by recording configuration diagrams and programming.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintains network by troubleshooting and repairing outages; testing network back-up procedures; updating documentation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintains customer rapport by listening to and resolving concerns; answering questions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintains safe work environment by following standards and policies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading technical publications.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Enhances department and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments. Construction Master Degree in Telecommunications or relevant field is required.
 \xe2\x80\xa2 Telecommunications Knowledge, Telecommunications Technologies, Technical Understanding, Technical Zeal, Technical Documentation, Attention to Detail, Independence, Functional and Technical Skills, Dealing with Complexity, Decision Making, Operating Systems
\xe2\x80\xa2  Proven work experience as a telecommunications specialist
\xe2\x80\xa2  Familiarity with MS Office and databases
\xe2\x80\xa2  Hands on experience with all telecommunications systems including peripheral equipment (e.g. Computer networks, optical fiber, on site controllers, data modems, terminals, etc.)
\xe2\x80\xa2  Adequate interpersonal and organizational skills
\xe2\x80\xa2  Team player with customer service orientation'

b'Quality Control Manager Job SummaryQuality Control program, including the coordination, performance and execution of construction inspection and testing services for the project. The QC Manager is responsible for assuring that the quality of the work meets or exceeds the project\xe2\x80\x99s contractual requirements and maintains the standard of excellence established by TATEKAN.
The position will also ensure that the electrical, mechanical team and subcontractors provides consistent, high-quality, cost-effective, and timely deliverables and products for the construction of relevant project.  Oversees, guides, and manages the work of sub-contractors, vendors, and suppliers in the field of mechanical, construction and electrical scope of work of TATEKAN.
Candidate must be professional and a personable leader committed to the overall objective and self-development within the company. The following is a list of the major responsibilities of the QC Manager:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all work meets or exceeds the contract specifications and standard of excellence of the Client & TATEKAN.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supervises inspections, reports and the documentation issued by inspectors and collect and file the required Quality Records. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supervises the Quality Control functions/activities of a project or its parts, including Quality Control inspection schedules and the collection of Quality Records.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supervises and manages preconstruction submittals and materials submittals for projects.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all materials meet or exceed the contract specifications.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate and schedule field testing and performance QA/QC inspections. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor daily construction activities and materials delivered to the site. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review all special inspecntion and material testing perform by third parties. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage and document all inspection, approvals, RFI\xe2\x80\x99s, Change Orders and testing in QC reports. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manages, expedites, and supports all document submittals, Prep. Meetings, Daily Reports and RFI\xe2\x80\x99s to Client. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Serves as an interface between the Engineering team, Electrical, mechanical & construction\xe2\x80\x99s sub-contractors and clients, including the Construction, Operations, Environmental, Health & Safety, to facilitate interdepartmental relations.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assists with the development of new electrical, mechanical & construction engineering standards and maintains and improves existing standards and guidelines, implementing industry and company best practices.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Acts as a subject matter expert regarding QC activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Interacts closely with internal teams to ensure that project needs and objectives are met.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares QC-related scope documents, exhibits, budgets, specifications & schedules.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Leads or participates in project meetings and conference calls with Client and partners.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Produces quality engineering plans, studies, and specifications while ensuring compliance with department, project, company, utility, and industry requirements and standards.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participates in engineering, design, and construction review processes.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinates project construction with Project Manager and Operations Manager to resolve critical and time-sensitive construction-related electrical, mechanical and construction issues.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be responsible to supervise and manage all QC team/staff members/officers of TATEKAN. Construction To be considered for this position you will possess the following skills, attributes, and abilities:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 5 Year experience as a Quality Control Manager on construction project with USACE / International Agencies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 The QCM should have working knowledge of Quality Assurance and Quality Control procedures and practices.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Candidate should have update CQM-C certificate from USACE.
\xe2\x80\xa2 College or university degree in an engineering / construction related field.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Must have understanding of construction terms.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Good knowledge of construction methods and procedures.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in Microsoft Word, and Excel, Civil 3D & AutoCAD.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Certification in Total Construction Quality Management for Contractors from the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge in QCS will be an asset.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent organizational, presentation, and interpersonal skills.'

b'Project Manager Job SummaryThe Project Manager will be responsible design-build project Scope of Work items and the overall project technical and non-commercial correspondences with client\xe2\x80\x99s on-site project management team, the PM manages, the and updates WBS and prepares monthly progress reports to client and TATEKAN head office. The PM oversees execution of the project and manages the field teams, controls the schedule and budget for the project.
He will need to organize the best team possible to complete the project in accordance with the contract documents in close coordination with the Executive Director, at the same time PM will provide instructions, training and teaching the project teams toward the TATEKAN\xe2\x80\x99s Code of Ethics & Compliance and Policies. \xe2\x80\xa2 The following is a list of the major responsibilities of the Project Manager:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee and manage the project scope of work, discuss and resolve issues related to SOW with Client on-site project management team when required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain and prepare project reports, correspondences and work progress reports to the client\xe2\x80\x99s on-site project management team and TATEKAN head office on a regular basis as required by a project. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage and organize WBS and update on regular basis.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee the execution of the project and manage field teams and TATEKAN sub-tiers at the site. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in the preparation of the project schedule and control the project schedules and weekly schedules.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review the project plans and specifications and comment on the designs, scheduling, possible cost savings measures and potential construction problems.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supervises and manages the project execution managers and teams.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manages sub-tiers, vendors, machinery and all other resources through the construction team. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist TATEKAN in preparation of project budget and must ensure project budget controls are in place toward successful completion of the project per the approved budget plan for the project.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in assembling the job site office and equipment requirements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Have confidence in own ability to intelligently communicate with design team/client as well as effectively lead the trades.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Raise and discuss relevant issues at the job site meetings. Prepare & issue minutes of all site meetings
\xe2\x80\xa2 Inform the Consultant/Client of any errors, discrepancies or omissions contained within the Consultant\xe2\x80\x99s design drawings.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage & expedite all submittals, RFI & CO (change order) and maintain proper logs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor site safety and ensure that the requirements of the Occupational Health and Safety Act are enforced.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Issue monthly progress draws percentage and invoicing to consultant and client including final holdbacks.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain and enforce good construction standards and quality control.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain control and responsibility for the security and operation of project\xe2\x80\x99s directly owned equipment on the job site in conjunction with site staff.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Control and monitor labor, material and equipment expenses.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare monthly cost forecasting summaries.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that \xe2\x80\x9cas-\xc2\xad\xe2\x80\x90built\xe2\x80\x9d drawings are prepared on an ongoing basis by all trades during the construction period and issue final close-\xc2\xad\xe2\x80\x90outs to client accordingly.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all required inspections, testing, permits, and correspondences are performed.
\xe2\x80\xa2 The project manager reports to the executive director and performs any other tasks as assigned by direct supervisor. Construction \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree in Civil Engineering or construction management with 5 years of related experience in handling USACE projects or overall experience of not less than the years in the field of construction management and supervision. Prior international donors experience is preferred.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge and ability to interpret engineering drawings and implement the field works.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Sufficient knowledge of USACE rules, regulations, and procedures desired.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in English. Have good command of English language both written and spoken. Candidates who do not have sufficient English language knowledge will be disqualified.'

b'Metal Work Instructor (\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb3\xd8\xaa\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaf \xd9\x81\xd9\x84\xd8\xb2\xda\xa9\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xdb\x8c) Job SummaryUnder general supervision the Welding Instructor will perform a variety of routine duties, as needed, to teach structural fabricating, repair and maintenance, MIG, TIG, and ARC, 0XY/ACE welding and cutting and plasma cutting. Welding involves permanently joining pieces of metals, a technique used in construction and manufacturing. 1. \xc2\xa8  Prepares performance-based objectives and outlines for course of study following curriculum guidelines and requirements of the school, State and Federal initiatives; meets State and local 
performance measures. 
2. \xc2\xa8 Develops annual goals for program improvement; revise and update program curriculum 
using performance based open entry/open exit individualized curriculum materials, as 
needed. 
3. \xc2\xa8  Organizes program of practical and technical instruction, including demonstrations of skills 
required in welding professions, and lectures on theory, techniques, and terminology; 
prepares outline of instructional programs and studies and assembles materials to be 
presented; reviews with supervisor, as needed. 
4. \xc2\xa8  Instructs students in subject areas, i.e., use, maintenance, and the safe operation of tools and 
equipment, codes or regulations related to the welding program. 
5. \xc2\xa8  Instructs  students in the importance of accuracy, neatness, efficiency, resourcefulness and 
good work habits in obtaining employment in industries that depend on welding to build their 
products. 
6. \xc2\xa8  Initiates purchase requisitions for supplies, materials, and equipment  following ATVI  procurement policies and procedures; ensures preventive maintenance program for equipment is in place. 
7. \xc2\xa8  Assigns lesson to students and corrects homework; administers tests to evaluate achievement 
of students in technical knowledge and practical skills; records results, and issues reports to 
students, school and to parents. 
8. \xc2\xa8  Keeps records of daily attendance and student progress;
9. \xc2\xa8  Confers with team leader, team members, i.e., enrichment instructor, counselor, job 
developer, etc. to obtain additional information and to gain insight on student behavioral 
disorders affecting the learning processes. 
10. \xc2\xa8  Designs with team leader and team members special help programs for low achievers, 
encouraging parent-teacher cooperation. 
11. \xc2\xa8  Presents subject matter to students, utilizing a variety of methods and techniques, such as 
lectures, discussions, or demonstrations; ensures use of classroom time is organized and that 
instruction and clean-up can be accomplished within the allotted time.  
12. \xc2\xa8  Assists students, individually or in groups, with lesson assignments to present or reinforce 
learning concepts; responds to basic student questions; may initiate study groups in 
preparation for exams. 
13. \xc2\xa8  Enforces classroom protocols, rules and regulations; maintains classroom discipline; utilizes 
effective classroom management techniques. 
14. \xc2\xa8  Maintains a clean and orderly classroom and  lab area; ensures that waste and byproducts are 
Disposed.
15. \xc2\xa8  Provides feedback to supervisor and co-workers regarding student progress and/or 
comprehension of course content. 
16. \xc2\xa8  Assists students to develop and implement effective study skills, practices and techniques. 
17. \xc2\xa8  Assists students to develop and complete resumes, applications for employment, cover letters, etc. 
18. \xc2\xa8  Develops and implements record keeping procedures that ensure proper documentation of 
action plans for success per requirements of supervisor; keeps and reports data required by 
funding agencies, i.e., attendance, progress, and competency based data for each student. 
19. \xc2\xa8  Ensures confidentiality of all program records and student information. 
20. \xc2\xa8  Develops and maintains an active program advisory committee; provides documentation of 
meetings, i.e., attendance reports and minutes of each meeting Construction Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or advanced degree from an accredited university or college in Industrial Arts or
