b'Plumbing Instructor (\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb3\xd8\xaa\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaf \xd9\x86\xd9\x84\xd8\xaf\xd9\x88\xd8\xa7\xd9\x86\xdb\x8c) Job SummaryStudy building plans and inspect structures to assess material and equipment needs, to establish the sequence of pipe installations, and to plan installation around obstructions such as electrical wiring. 1) Assemble pipe sections, tubing and fittings, using couplings, clamps, screws, bolts, cement, plastic solvent, caulking, or soldering, brazing and welding equipment.
2) Fill pipes or plumbing fixtures with water or air and observe pressure gauges to detect and locate leaks.
3) Review blueprints and building codes and specifications to determine work details and procedures.
4) Prepare written work cost estimates and negotiate contracts.
5) Study building plans and inspect structures to assess material and equipment needs, to establish the sequence of pipe installations, and to plan installation around obstructions such as electrical wiring.
6) Keep records of assignments and produce detailed work reports.
7) Perform complex calculations and planning for special or very large jobs.
8) Locate and mark the position of pipe installations, connections, passage holes, and fixtures in structures, using measuring instruments such as rulers and levels.
9) Measure, cut, thread, and bend pipe to required angle, using hand and power tools or machines such as pipe cutters, pipe-threading machines, and pipe-bending machines.
10) Install pipe assemblies, fittings, valves, appliances such as dishwashers and water heaters, and fixtures such as sinks and toilets, using hand and power tools.
11) Cut openings in structures to accommodate pipes and pipe fittings, using hand and power tools. 
12) Hang steel supports from ceiling joists to hold pipes in place.
13) Repair and maintain plumbing, replacing defective washers, replacing or mending broken pipes, and opening clogged drains.
14) Direct workers engaged in pipe cutting and preassembly and installation of plumbing systems and components.
15) Install underground storm, sanitary and water piping systems and extend piping to connect fixtures and plumbing to these systems.
16) Clear away debris in a renovation.
17) Install oxygen and medical gas in hospitals.
18) Use specialized techniques, equipment, or materials, such as performing computer-assisted welding of small pipes, or working with the special piping used in microchip fabrication. Construction \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree from one of the recognized universities, or equivalent experience'

b'Project Manager Job SummaryThe Project Manager is responsible for planning, executing, and evaluating projects according to predetermine timelines and budgets.   Building and managing project teams, reporting to the Project Sponsor, and ensuring quality control throughout project life cycles are central to this position. Specific and key accountabilities and responsibilities outlined as below:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Plan and implement projects
\xe2\x80\xa2 Project integration change management
\xe2\x80\xa2 Help define project scope, goals and deliverables
\xe2\x80\xa2 Define tasks and required resources
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collect and manage project team
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage budget
\xe2\x80\xa2 Allocate project resources
\xe2\x80\xa2 Create schedule and project timeline
\xe2\x80\xa2 Track deliverables
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support and direct team
\xe2\x80\xa2 Lead quality assurance
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor and report on project progress
\xe2\x80\xa2 Present to stakeholders reports on progress as well as problems and solutions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Implement and manage change when necessary to meet project outputs
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate and assess result of project Construction \xe2\x80\xa2 B.Sc. degree in engineering or construction management with 9 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience, MSc is preferable with 6 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Project management certification or equivalent
\xe2\x80\xa2 Theoretical and practical project management knowledge
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of techniques and tools
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience as a project manager
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in strategic planning, risk management and/or change management
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficiency in project management software tools
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient with MS office (word, excel, PPT) \xe2\x80\x93 Adobe Reader, Auto CAD, Primavera, MS project
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to fluent speak, read, write, and understand English'

b"Masonry Instructor (\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb3\xd8\xaa\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaf \xd9\x85\xd8\xb9\xd9\x85\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xdb\x8c) Job SummaryPreserve the things delivered to his for carrying out his work and shall upon the termination 
of this Agreement hand over to the Employer all documents, correspondence, lists, books, 
tools and records related to the Employer's business, and all other property belonging to the 
Employer. 1. Carry out his duties and responsibilities in a prudent and professional manner in accordance with, and as specified in the Job Description. 
2. Carry out the work by himself and shall abide by a professional standard of care in the 
execution of his duties and shall follow the instructions given by the Employer and its 
management. 
3. Preserve the Employer's industrial and commercial secrets and not disclose the same in any 
manner even after the termination of this Agreement. 
4. Preserve the things delivered to his for carrying out his work and shall upon the termination 
of this Agreement hand over to the Employer all documents, correspondence, lists, books, 
tools and records related to the Employer's business, and all other property belonging to the 
Employer. 
5. Be required to work as instructed and authorized by the Employer and where appropriate 
under the supervision of the officers and managers appointed by the Employer. 
6. The Employee shall not engage in any other work, whether paid or unpaid with any 
company, institution or third party other than with the Employer. 
7. The Job Description may be altered by the Employer as the work develops. 
8. The Employee shall comply with the policies and procedures of the Employer as well as all 
applicable legislation in force. Construction Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree from one of the recognized universities, or equivalent experience
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent interpersonal skills, decision maker, goal oriented, polite and highly motivated person
\xe2\x80\xa2 Background and experience in job placement and administration
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent managerial, supervisory and administrative skills"

b'Carpentry Instructor (\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb3\xd8\xaa\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaf \xd9\x86\xd8\xac\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xdb\x8c) Job SummaryAssemble and join structural components with the aid of nails, screws or adhesives Build scaffolding and ladders for construction work on tall structures. 1 Create a layout for construction using tools such as rules and pencils.
2 Read and interpret blueprints for a structural concept Measure, cut, and shape wood materials using tapes, saws, and chisel.
3 Assemble and join structural components with the aid of nails, screws or adhesives Build scaffolding and ladders for construction work on tall structures.
4 Oversee the selection of construction raw materials to specify type and quantity of required materials.
5 Build sleds for conveying wood materials through unmotorable roads.
6 Ensure the positioning and alignment of structures using spirit levels, rules, and surveying equipment such as theodolite.
7 Construct stairs, tables, cabinet, racks, and numerous wooden fixtures Install pre-constructed materials/structures such as insulators and cabinets in homes and offices.
8 Implement health and safety standards when carrying out job operations to ensure public and environmental safety.
9 Remove and replace damaged or worn-out parts of structures .
10 Operate power implements such as circular saws, nail guns, and sanders.
11 Construct frames/structures for casting of concrete during building construction Create structures that meet the needs and requirement of a client.
12 Prepare drawings for cabinetry, framing and other construction projects on-site.
13 Interpret client requests and provide mock-ups for clients to approve prior to commencing work.
14 Build cabinets, vanities, tub and shower surrounds and other projects based on demand Frame room additions as needed for client.
15 Select and evaluate materials for defects.
16 Install cabinets, counters and molding
17 Follow all code requirements for kitchens and baths in remodeling projects Construction \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree from one of the recognized universities, or equivalent experience'

b'Research & Communication Manager Job SummaryJob Title:  Research & Communication Manager
Duty Station:  AMA Head Office \xe2\x80\x93 Kabul
Reports to: Executive Director
Salary: According to the NTA salary scale
Nationality: Afghan
Gender: Male/Female
Age:  25-45 years
Organization Name: Afghanistan Microfinance Association (AMA)
Employment Type: Fixed Term
Contract Duration: One year with three months probationary \xe2\x80\x93 possibility of extension
Post Date: 10 October 2018
Expiration Date: 27 October 2018 Data collection and dissemination:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop formats based on the best international practices and disclosure norms to collect members and stakeholders data.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Educate members on AMA data collection formats and work closely with them to build internal reporting systems that capture these data points accurately.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with members to timely collect and verify data as per the formats.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review and validate the data to ensure compliance with the standards.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collect, analyze and report Afghanistan data to its affiliates at national and international levels at different time intervals.
Communication:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare presentations on AMA and sector overview for different events such as general assembly, coordination meetings, awareness meetings, etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage and update the AMA website, online applications, contact database, and members\xe2\x80\x99 information directory.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Make sure that the staff referral database is updated with new information and used by AMA members.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure appropriate media coverage (print and electronic) in the microfinance sector.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review and edit weekly, bi-weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports drafted by the PIC officer for different donors and submit.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Write/review the minutes of the meetings organized at AMA or outside.
Research & Publication:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop content and design the publications: MicroView Report, Annual Report, Magazine, State of the Sector Report, E-Newsletter, Press Release, Success Stories, Information Booklets and etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct researches/surveys: collect and analyze data, prepare report, design publication, and publish.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Make sure that the AMA visibility materials such as brochures, ad-hoc publications, banners, etc. are well prepared and designed by PIC Officer.   
Other:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Validate data provided by the members and stakeholders for the MicroView and State of the Sector reports.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Overview the member organizations utilization process of the Public Credit Registry (PCR) and provide necessary supports.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Represent AMA in relevant meetings, forums, working groups etc. as deemed necessary. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for overall office IT and electronics.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage daily tasks of subordinate staff.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform any other duties as assigned by the Executive Director. Communication \xe2\x80\xa2 Education: At least Bachelor degree in relevant field, Master degree will be an advantage.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience: At least three years of relevant working experience in the field of communication, research or IT. Microfinance or banking experience will be an advantage. Working experience in management position will be preferred. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Communication: Excellent written and oral communication skills in English and local languages.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Computer: Good IT skills, graphic designing, MS Office.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Personal qualification: Quick learner, talented, energetic, and active individual with the ability to meet tight deadlines.'

b'Risk Management Committee\xe2\x80\x99s Member Job SummaryThe Risk Committee members is responsible for the all duties & Responsibilities that are explained in the below section. \xe2\x80\xa2 Review and evaluate the bank\xe2\x80\x99s proposed policies, strategies, limits and procedures for risk management, and make recommendations to the Board of Supervisors regarding their approval. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that bank\xe2\x80\x99s risk management policies, strategies and limits are appropriate for the bank\xe2\x80\x99s business strategy as approved by the Board of Supervisors and regulators. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the implementation of those policies, strategies and limits through receipt of reports from senior management and/or the bank\xe2\x80\x99s risk management function. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review and monitor Credit Risk, Operational Risk, Market Risk, Interest Rate Risk, Liquidity Risk, investment risk, compliance risk, IT security and other risks.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 To Review Bank\xe2\x80\x99s risk exposure under different products
\xe2\x80\xa2 To Review the performance of classified and non-performing loan portfolio. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 To Monitor and ensure that Bank Capital is sufficient to support risk taking activities 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Submit reports to Board of Supervisors on the effectiveness of the bank\xe2\x80\x99s risk management process. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Periodically review the bank\xe2\x80\x99s risk management policies, strategies and limits, and recommend to the Board of Supervisors any changes that the Committee deems necessary. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Board of Supervisors to ensure that the bank\xe2\x80\x99s risk management program is conducted in accordance with the policies, strategies and limits approved by the Board of Supervisors and with relevant laws and regulations of Da Afghanistan Bank. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other tasks assigned to it by the Board of Supervisors relative to the bank\xe2\x80\x99s risk management program. Banking Qualification, Experience and Skills requirement 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Risk Certified (FRM, PRM or APRM,) 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum MBA degree and a minimum of 10 years banking experience is required
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in risk assessment, stress testing and other risk management models. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Analytic and decisive decision-making skills with the ability to prioritize and communicate key objectives and tactics.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Confident and self-assured while putting others at ease. Strong problem-solving skills, creative and resourceful, ability to find new approaches and solutions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with regulatory compliance, including working with examiners and regulators'

b'Cook Job SummaryQualified Cookwill be selected to help Digital CASA staff in cooking and preparing tea and coffee and refreshment for staff & guest. \xe2\x80\xa2 Cooking of food, preparing tea, coffee etc for Digital CASA Afghanistan staff
\xe2\x80\xa2 Cleaning of the kitchen, cups, waresetc
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain a minimum stock of cleaning aides as dictated by the admin officer of CASA-Digital.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare tea and other Conference Room facilities as and when required. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assisting office personnel with any other duties when requested to do so. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be prepared to work flexible hours to accommodate the office hours requirements (e.g. assist with official visits in the evening and on weekends). Construction 1. This position is only open to Afghan nationals;
2. Should have a minimum of 2 years of experience in cooking, tea and coffee preparation, cleaning, preferably in Government or NGO sector;
3. Female candidates are highly encourages to apply.
4. Must not be a drug addict of any kind and nature.
5. Must not have any infectious diseases.
6. Must be a mature, respectful and honest person of high integrity that is able to work in a team and make meaningful contributions to the team objectives;
7. Must be flexible in and able to adapt to abrupt changes in programs at short notice'

b"Member of Board of Supervisors for State Owned Banks Job SummaryThese Terms of References identify the responsibilities, qualifications and skills needed for membership of Board of Supervisors of state-owned banks in Afghanistan. The responsibilities of Boards of Supervisors of individual banks may vary slightly from bank to bank, but the principal responsibilities are:
- To convene each session of the General Assembly of the shareholders and adopt the agenda for each session
- To approve the bank's organizational structure
- To make decisions regarding the establishment and dissolving of subsidiaries, branch offices and representative offices of the bank
- To appoint and dismiss members of the bank\xe2\x80\x99s Board of Management and to agree their remuneration as members of the Board of Management
- To oversee and make recommendations on the performance of the bank's Board of Management
- To consider, make recommendations on revisions to, and approve the bank's business strategy and annual budget
- To consider, make recommendations on revisions to, and approve policies for the conduct of operational performance, including the bank's risk management policy
- To consider and make recommendations on potential or actual conflicts of interest
- To issue guidance to the Board of Management for the successful implementation of agreed policies
- To determine the conditions under which credit may be granted by bank employees, including where the granting of credit requires the prior approval of the Board of Supervisors
- To ensure that the bank\xe2\x80\x99s processes, systems and operations respond adequately to Da Afghanistan Bank\xe2\x80\x99s and related legislation and regulations
- To ensure the adequacy of internal controls and risk management systems for the bank
- To ensure the integrity of the bank's financial reporting, including financial reporting to Da Afghanistan Bank
- To ensure that appropriate Internal Audit functions, systems and processes are established
- To receive and consider reports from the Internal Audit Department at meetings of the Board of Supervisors
- To make recommendations to the General Assembly on matters requiring shareholders\xe2\x80\x99 approval
- To make recommendations to the General Assembly concerning the appointment of the external auditors for the bank
- To ensure the timely execution of the bank's annual external audit
- To follow up with the Board of Management and banking officers on any managerial letters or qualifications identified in the annual external audit process
- To take decisions concerning capital distributions, subject to the legislative and regulatory requirements of Da Afghanistan Bank, and what amount of any net profit of the bank shall be transferred to bank reserve
- To take decisions in accordance with the requirements of current Da Afghanistan Bank\xe2\x80\x99s current legislation and regulations regarding the distribution of capital or any net profit
- To proactively and pre-emptively advise Da Afghanistan Bank in writing, or require the Board of Management to do so, of any deterioration in the financial situation of the bank, of any identified risk of such deterioration, and any other facts that may materially affect the financial situation of the bank, and in particular if the bank becomes undercapitalized
- To ensure implementations of directives and instructions issued by Da Afghanistan Bank
- To take decisions on any other matters placed in the competence of the Board of Supervisors by the bank's charter or by-laws
General responsibilities of the Board of Supervisors
The Board of Supervisors is ultimately responsible, and is accountable to all stakeholders (including the General Assembly, depositors, and Da Afghanistan Bank) for the conduct of the bank's affairs and condition.
Although the Board members cannot guarantee success, they are expected to supervise bank operations to ensure that they reflect sound planning, are effectively governed by comprehensive policies and internal control procedures, and are administered by competent management.
While the Board of Supervisors may depend upon the Board of Management\xe2\x80\x99s technical, industrial, and managerial expertise to run the bank's day-to-day operations, members of the Board of Supervisors remain responsible for ensuring that those operations are properly controlled, comply with the policies adopted by the Board of Supervisors and applicable laws and notifications, and are consistent with sound banking practices.
   Ensuring appropriate policies and procedures are in place
The Board of Supervisors must adopt and approve written policies and procedures that direct management on all significant banking activities and the management of risk, including what banking practices and levels and types of risk are acceptable.
All major areas of the institution's business should be covered by appropriate policies and procedures, which must be in place before any new activity begins.
The policies should establish clear standards and responsiveness to changing business conditions. Associated procedures should detail how the policies will be implemented and include steps for obtaining appropriate approval of Board of Supervisors for exceptions.
Monitoring operations, ensuring adequate internal controls and compliance with laws and regulations
The Board of Supervisors must ensure that the Board of Management implements the policies and procedures, as well as any corrective actions required by the Da Afghanistan Bank. To achieve this goal, the Board of Supervisors should ensure that management incorporates a sound system of internal controls into the bank's day-today operating procedures.
The Board of Supervisors should require periodic briefings and written reports from the Board of Management regarding the financial condition and operation of the bank, and recommendations for maintenance or improvement. The Board of Supervisors should closely examine such reports and recommendations to verify their accuracy and feasibility.
The Board of Supervisors should hold frequent, regularly scheduled meetings (not less than monthly) in order to properly monitor the bank's operations. Special meetings should also be held if circumstances warrant the board's immediate attention between regularly scheduled meetings. 
At all Board of Supervisors meetings, complete minutes should be taken to record significant decisions and discussions.
The Board of Supervisors responsibilities to supervise the financial operations of bank are not diminished by the examiners of Da Afghanistan Bank. The Board of Supervisors is independently responsible for the bank's financial condition and may not rely on Da Afghanistan Bank examiners to identify or correct problems.
The Board of Supervisors should expect its auditors and the Board of Management to assist it in identifying any problems the bank may experience.
Prevention of Conflicts of Interest
To achieve the goal of ensuring that the personal interests of members of the Board of Supervisors and Board of Management do not conflict with the best interests of the bank, the Board of Supervisors should:
Establish and adhere to a written policy on salaries, fees, loans, and expenses granted to insiders of the institution, especially members of the Board of Supervisors and Board of Management
Consult with the bank's legal advisors before entering into or approving transactions involving the bank with members of the Board of Supervisors or Board of Management, except transactions that are allowed as per bank's policies approved by the Board of Supervisors
  Meetings of the Board of Supervisors
This is not a full time employment and the board members will be working as part time.
Board of Supervisors shall meet regularly, at least once a month.
Special meetings may be held as necessary. A special meeting shall be called if:
1. The bank becomes undercapitalized
2. A special meeting is requested by the Internal Audit Committee or external auditor of the bank
3. It is instructed to do so by Da Afghanistan Bank.
Da Afghanistan Bank may require a bank to hold a special meeting of its Board of Supervisors if it deems it necessary, and to consider the matters set forth in a written notice of Da Afghanistan Bank.
Relationships between Shareholders and the Board of Supervisors
Members of Board of Supervisors shall be appointed by the General Assembly or in any extraordinary meeting of the General Assembly according to the Article 49 of Banking Law of Afghanistan. Before a bank appoints a person to serve on its board of supervisors or management board, the bank must propose the issue to Da Afghanistan Bank as well as submit documents pursuant to Article 12 of the Afghan Banking Law, during an application for a banking license, and shall obtain Da Afghanistan Bank\xe2\x80\x99s authorisation. 
The Board of Supervisors will ensure that, within the framework of the statutory rules, Shareholders are properly provided with appropriate information to enable them to reach a decision.
The Board of Supervisors directly reports to Shareholders and advises on related matters. Banking Key qualifications for membership of the Board of Supervisors may include, but are not limited to:
\xe2\x80\xa2 A history of community bank involvement
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated leadership skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong and diverse banking experience
\xe2\x80\xa2 Impeccable character
\xe2\x80\xa2 Involvement or awareness of the financial and banking sector
\xe2\x80\xa2 Sound understanding of local community and the proposed banking market 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrable knowledge of Da Afghanistan Bank, its role and operations.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in management
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in audit 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in insurance 
Experience:
7-10 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience directly related to a commercial bank Experience and audit operating systems, Excellent analytical, creativity and problem solving skills. Able to advise for improvements."

b'Deputy Chief Islamic Banking Officer Job SummaryThe job holder is assigned to work with the Islamic Banking Window of Afghan United Bank as Deputy Chief Islamic Banking Officer and he/she is directly reporting to the Chief Islamic Banking Officer. Islamic Banking Window is a separated system of Banking which is free of Reba (interest), Maiseer (Gambling), and Uncertainty. IBW is a system of banking which is based on Islamic principles, Islamic ethics, Law of Banking, Da Afghanistan Bank (DAB) Islamic rules and guidelines. 1.  Extending help and guidance to Media Department in preparation of Brochures and Advertisement material for 
    Islamic banking.
2. Preparation of formats, documents and related material for Islamic Banking.
3. Adding of his comments/recommendation on all the Lending Proposals being considered by the Bank and 
    ensuring that these fall within the scope of Islamic Banking and are Shariah Compliant.
5. Ensuring that Profit payable to the investors and depositors by the bank under Islamic banking are within the 
    scope of Islamic banking and are Shariah Compliant and that the procedure adopted for this purpose by the 
    bank remains compliant to the rules and regulations issued by Central bank or any other relevant regulatory 
    authority set up for this purpose by the government.
6. Ensuring that Profit recoverable from the Borrowers on the Lending products under the Islamic banking are 
    within the scope of Shariah Compliant banking and that the procedure adopted for this purpose by the bank 
    remains compliant to the rules and regulations issued by Central Bank or any other relevant regulatory 
    authority set up for this purpose by the government.
7. Ensuring that contacts are made on regular basis with Bank\xe2\x80\x99s appointed Shariah Committee (Shura Ulema), 
    Central Bank and any other regulatory authority set up by the Government for this purpose for guidance and 
     obtaining their consents where required. 
8. Attends various Islamic Banking related committees like profit distribution committee, investment committee 
    (HOCC), Charity Committee \xe2\x80\xa6 etc and makes decisions in the light of Shariah Compliant rules and 
    regulations in the absence of CIBO.
9. Offering explanations about Shariah based banking and the products the bank offers under it to the clients, 
     panel of Ulema or Central Bank/regulatory authority where required, in the absence of head of IBW.
10.To issue Fiqah based written statements about Islamic banking based on verdicts from Shariah Committee of 
      the Bank where required in the absence of head of IBW.
11. Offering advices to the Bank in the light of Shariah regarding Treatment of Penalties on Shariah compliant 
      lending products in the absence of CIBO.
12. Offering advices to the bank in the light of Shariah regarding transfers to be made to Charity Fund A/c and its 
       subsequent utilization in the absence of CIBO.
13. Offering advices to the bank on Treatment of profit and Loss under Islamic Banking in the absence of CIBO.
14. Offering advices to the bank on the Accounting Procedures and IT related support for the Islamic banking in 
      the absence of CIBO.
16. Helps and guides CTO to ensure that IT support in smoothing out procedures for Islamic banking is available 
      and IT related problems in the system are taken care of in the absence of head of IBW.
6. Control on vouchers/ entries:
    He ensures that a proper system, limits and procedures are in place and is being followed for passing 
   entries/vouchers whether system raised or otherwise and that record of vouchers is maintained by the Islamic 
   Area properly where required.
7. Compliance with AML, KYC & Audit;
    To ensure that Accounts are opened by the Bank in compliance with the rules and regulations of the Bank and 
   AML/KYC. Also ensures that the Audit recommendations by the Internal Audit or DAB or the External Audit are 
   followed in letter and spirit.
8. Reporting/Returns/Statements:
    To ensure that the required reporting by the Islamic Banking Side to HO or DAB is done timely and accurately 
   and that all the required Returns are submitted to Finance Department of the Bank accordingly. Also ensures 
  that the periodical account statements are sent out to the clients timely and accurately.
9. Customer Service:
    To ensure that best possible service standards are maintained in all the areas of Islamic Banking of the Bank 
     and complaints lodged by the clients if any are attended and grievances addressed in best possible manner.
10. Timely controlling, monitoring and observing the operation, risk, investment and other Islamic related divisions 
   and make sure their activities are done properly. 
10. Other responsibilities:
       To attend any other matter which may not have been mentioned in this JD (job description) but is otherwise 
       required to be attended by the job holder in the absence of CIBO of IBW. Job Holder is to attend to any Bank 
       related assignment given by Chief of Islamic Banking Window and management of the bank. Banking 1) Master Degree related to Banking or Islamic Studies
2) Minimum 8 years of experience in the Islamic Banking, 5 years in managerial positions
3) Interview with the Central Bank of Afghanistan (DAB)
4) Ability of analysing and solving problems'

b'Deputy Branch Manager for Paktia Job SummaryThe Deputy Branch Manager is Assist Branch manager on daily management, Administration, treasury follow up and other operations related to Customers and Treasury.
1. Respect and follow-up of Bank-e-Millie rule, regulation, and financial procedures.
2. Respect and follow-up the Bank-e-Millie all policies and procedures;
3. Assist Main Branch Manager on Cash management and daily follow up.
4. Assist Branch Manager in prepare a report to Board management.
5. Assist in daily routine 1. Supervision and control of administration, accounts, attendance, and staff 
2. Controlling and checking all cash and transfer Transaction within his limit 
3. Implementation and control of daily work 
4. Overall supervision of Afghani account and other currencies in saving section 
5. Checking and controlling all deposit, withdrawal slips and controlling transfer documents related to saving accounts.
6. Deputy Branch Manager is Responsible for all the Duties of Branch Manager in case of his Absence.
7. Implementation of Fair and Standard Interest Calculation Procedure.
8. Having Tight Control on Interest Calculation Process to prevent any mistake.
9. Reporting Interest to Related Departments.
10. Reconciling Saving Account Balances with Accounts on Daily Basis.
11. Any task or duty assigned by the line manager Banking Must possess a Bachelor degree and/or at least (3) years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in a related

b'Project Manager Job SummaryThe PM will head the Project Management Unit (PMU). He will be responsible for ensuring the project is managed efficiently and achieves its operational objectives and deliverables. The PM will report to the National Program Director. The PM\xe2\x80\x99s tasks will be as follows: \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for day-to-day Project technical management of the project and the relevant sub-components. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 He should also closely work with the project director on the recruitment of technical (livestock, agriculture) staff required by the project. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure close and effective collaboration at the provincial and district levels staff of MAIL functionaries and related service providers/ agencies so that project objectives and deliverables are realized at the target group level.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure the adequate and timely preparation and submission of all the Annual Work Plan & Budgets
\xe2\x80\xa2 Help the project director and the finance team on the withdrawal applications, disbursements, preparation of all supporting documents, financial reports, travel claims, procurement and audit reports together with timely preparation of quarterly and annual progress reports for submission to the Government and IFAD.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Undertake regular monitoring and supervision visits to project areas and facilitate cross learning and sharing of experiences between project functionaries; ensure best practices are documented and disseminated within and beyond the project; insist that IFAD\xe2\x80\x9fs policies and standards (transparency and accountability, gender sensitivity, inclusiveness, targeting) are complied with across all levels of the project; sanctioned plans are executed as envisaged; personnel and SPs are adequately resourced and equipped for the task; and arrange/conduct impact assessment surveys periodically.
\xe2\x80\xa2 In collaboration with the PSU staff ensure that the staff of the PMU as well as project staff are sensitizedon gender issues; targeting and activities specified for women are regularly monitored; gender issues are identified and resolved during project meetings, periodic gender assessments and the same reflected in reports to the PMU and PSU.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide technical support and back-stopping to communities/ common interest groups and service providers as needed and ensure implementation of the participatory and multi-faceted interventions of the programme in line with project strategy. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organise training and learning events for project staff so as to upgrade their competencies and capabilities in accordance with the approved Training Calendar.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide support to all supervision, monitoring, evaluation teams from IFAD, third party agencies or anyone else contracted to undertake these functions for the Project. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate with the procurement unit of the PST on undertaking contract management and monitoring compliance of Service Providers with the terms of their contracts and keep the PSU informed accordingly.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Any other project specific tasks assigned by the project director.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Agriculture a. Post graduate Degree or higher qualification in Agricultural, Agriculture. Master degree in any other field such as business administration can also be considered. 
b. 7 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience of which at least 5 years at senior management level relating to programmes with focus on agricultural production, marketing or business development. and rural financial services.
c. Experience in planning and implementing a large rural development programme and/or programmes aimed at reducing rural poverty with particular focus on increasing the competitiveness and inclusiveness of value chain, including agricultural value chains and rural financial services.
d. Demonstrated experience in ability to liaise with a wide range and levels of organizations including government, donors, private/corporate sector, NGOs, and the community institutions.
e. Demonstrated creativity, willingness to innovate, think systemically and design new approaches to programme activities.
f. Commitment to serve and travel in challenging areas.
g. Strong communication skills (oral, written, presentation).'

b'Admin Finance Officer Job SummaryThe Project consists of the following parts:
Part A: On-Farm Water Management 
1. Carrying out social mobilization for the establishment of Irrigation Associations (IAs) in the Project Areas, including, inter alia, the provision of: (a) training to communities in organization and management of IAs; (b) facilitation services for communities to develop the IAs\xe2\x80\x99 internal legal rules and regulations (by-laws); (c) assistance to IAs in order for them to be registered under the Water Law (1388); and (d) technical training to IAs regarding water distribution, maintenance of irrigation infrastructure, irrigation methods, water-saving techniques, crop-water requirements, and good agronomic practices.
2. (a) Carrying out rehabilitation works to small irrigation schemes or tertiary canals (watercourses) covering approximately 40,000 hectares in total in the Project Areas, including, inter alia: (a) rehabilitation of existing intakes, (b) canal lining; (c) construction of control structures and outlets; (d) construction of, culverts, laundry basins and cattle troughs; and
(b) Improving design standards and strengthening the private sector\xe2\x80\x99s capacity for contract management and construction techniques.
3. Establishing easily accessible pilot irrigation demonstration sites in the Project Areas to showcase improved water management practices/technology and agronomic water saving techniques/measures, as well as proper farm planning and layout for an efficient use of irrigation water.
Part B: Institutional Strengthening and Capacity Building of MAIL
 Developing the institutional capacity of MAIL to plan, design, implement and monitor irrigation programs, including, inter alia: (a) construction and/or renovation of  office buildings, one each in Kabul, Jalalabad, Baghlan, Mazar-e-Sharif and Herat, respectively for MAIL and Project  staff; (b) strengthening of MAIL\xe2\x80\x99s  Directorate of Irrigation at national, provincial and district levels; (c) strengthening the legal framework for the irrigation sector, (d) developing a national irrigation program, (e) undertaking of technical training in the irrigation sector including study tours transferring on-farm water management know-how; and (f) developing a database covering irrigation systems throughout the country.
Part C: Project Management, Coordination, Monitoring & Evaluation
 Strengthening the institutional capacity of MAIL for Project implementation, policy development, and technical innovation, monitoring and evaluation, by establishing and maintaining a Project Implementation Unit comprised of a Kabul-based core team, five (5) Project Area Teams and internationally recruited experts.
Part D: Support for Productivity Enhancement
1. Establishing easily accessible pilot irrigation demonstration sites in the Project Area to showcase improved water management practices/technology and agronomic water saving techniques/measures, improved agronomic and social management practices, as well as proper farm planning and layout for an efficient use of irrigation water.
2. Promoting land leveling and high-efficiency irrigation technologies in the Project Area.
3. Establishing Information Centers for farmers at the provincial and district level in the Project Area. The Admin/Finance Officer shall manage administrative and financial activities of the project. This support will include but not limited to:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supervise and coordinate the provision of all administrative, personnel and financial support required to the project, ensuring that appropriate control reporting structure are maintained in accordance with OFWM/MAIL Rules and Regulations.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide guidance and direction to the PM, Senior Admin/ Logistic Officer and Finance Managers and Consult on administrative, logistics, budgeting and other financial management issues.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in and support preparation of annual work plans and budgets.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate with the procurement unit of goods, works and services in accordance with WB Guidelines for Procurement.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in development of, and monitor use of core budget project funds following sound accounting, budgeting, and financial control and audit procedures acceptable to WB.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare withdrawal applications and maintain disbursement records;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate and act as focal point for issues relating to human resources including annual leaves etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage and oversee activities related to logistical support for the Program and maintaining liaison with government offices and the executing agencies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate the asset inventory process, including procurement.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Performs quarter inventory count and reconciliation in coordination with IT and logistics staff
\xe2\x80\xa2  Reports to admin/logistics manager to resolve discrepancies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keeps proper record of standard inventory (cost, prices, quantity, handovers and takeovers).
\xe2\x80\xa2 To undertake other duties as requested by core team supervisor/regional managerTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Agriculture \xef\x83\x98 This position requires  Bachelor degree in Finance & accounting, Business Administration, economics is preferred.
\xef\x83\x98 4 years of relevant experience is required. Fluency in Pashto/Dari and English languages is must.
\xef\x83\x98 Computer skills, including extensive experience using Microsoft Word and Excel.  Internet and e-mail skills required'

b'FSL Expert Job SummaryMission 1: Contribute to deliberations on strategy and the positioning of the FSL Department  
The FSL Expert is responsible for:
\xef\x83\x98 ongoing, systematic and thorough analysis of the humanitarian situation in respect of FSL and of the context of intervention in his/her field of activity;
\xef\x83\x98 internal dissemination of information gathered and its analysis to the Field Coordinator and the HoD
\xef\x83\x98 taking part in the determination of strategy in his/her area of activity and sectorial strategy at national level
Mission 2: Identify needs and contribute to project elaboration
The FSL Expert is responsible for:
\xef\x83\x98 Identifying humanitarian needs in the field of FSL and in his/her area of activity, this to include the submission of reports pertaining to such matters
\xef\x83\x98 Including, where appropriate, target populations and local actors in the identification of needs and ways of responding to them
\xef\x83\x98 Participation in defining FSL programs
\xef\x83\x98 Contributing to the writing of the FSL sections of project proposals
Mission 3: Set up, implement and report on FSL projects
The FSL Expert is responsible for:
\xef\x83\x98 Setting up of the FSL program(s) taking into account the logical framework of the program(s), the budget, and the logistical and administrative processes of ACF
\xef\x83\x98 The quality of the programs established in conformity with the technical and project management standards of ACF
\xef\x83\x98 Identifying the technical constraints associated with the implementation of the projects
\xef\x83\x98 Proposing innovative technical solutions in response to such constraints
\xef\x83\x98 The implementation of technical recommendations concerning his/her project 
\xef\x83\x98 Supervising his/her programs, by means of internal APR monitoring tools, regular presence in the field, maintenance of a timeline, monthly review of the budget
\xef\x83\x98 Preparing in time to meet deadlines the FSL components of external and internal reports relating to his/her projects
\xef\x83\x98 Identifying and implementing safety measures for both the teams and the wider population
Mission 4: Contribute to the quality, accountability and impact measurement process of his/her program
The FSL Expert is responsible for :
\xef\x83\x98 Promoting and taking part in the evaluation of the impact of his/her project 
\xef\x83\x98 Promoting and contributing to learning and improvement of quality (internal evaluation and joint visits)
\xef\x83\x98 Implementing complaints procedures for ethical and transparency reasons, particularly in respect of the beneficiary populations
\xef\x83\x98 Ensuring that a double CAP survey is put in place (baseline/final)
Mission 5: Participate in the coordination, representation and partnerships of ACF in his/her area of intervention  
The FSL Expert is responsible for:
\xef\x83\x98 Coordination of activities with other sectors and departments of ACF in order to ensure rational use of resources and optimum integration
\xef\x83\x98 Representing ACF and ensuring coordination with partners, the authorities, agencies of the United Nations and NGOs in his/her sector, in collaboration with the Field Coordinator
Mission 6: Supervise and manage the team
The FSL Expert is responsible for:
\xef\x83\x98 Team management (leadership, monitoring, motivation)
\xef\x83\x98 Evaluation of team members
\xef\x83\x98 Staff development of team members
\xef\x83\x98 Providing agriculture trainings and capacity building
Mission 7: Contributing to capitalization and technical development in his/her sector
The FSL Expert  is responsible for:
\xef\x83\x98 Capitalization of program-related data and documentation of the innovations achieved
\xef\x83\x98 Contributing to the upward transmission of data from the ground the better to inform ACF communications Mission 1: Contribute to deliberations on strategy and the positioning of the FSL Department  
Mission 2: Identify needs and contribute to project elaboration
Mission 3: Set up, implement and report on FSL projects
Mission 4: Contribute to the quality, accountability and impact measurement process of his/her program
Mission 5: Participate in the coordination, representation and partnerships of ACF in his/her area of intervention  
Mission 6: Supervise and manage the team
Mission 7: Contributing to capitalization and technical development in his/her sector Agriculture Experience:
Diploma/Level of Studies: Degree in the fields of agriculture, extensive training background or equivalent experience.'

b'Laboratory technician Herat Job Summary\xe2\x80\xa2 Overall Management of laboratory services with all aspects of project Role and responsibilities:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Overall Management of laboratory services with all aspects of project
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for all laboratory services.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform Lab examinations for the clients referred through DIC and outreach
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for the all routine examination and HIV tests for clients according to NACP testing algorithm
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that all laboratory supplies are well stored and consumed
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keep records of all consumed Lab strips and material 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintaining the integrity of the specimen during handling and processing
\xe2\x80\xa2 Properly labelling the specimen
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proper documentation of laboratory activities and registration
\xe2\x80\xa2 Reporting of laboratory results in a timely manner
\xe2\x80\xa2 Safe disposal of laboratory specimens
\xe2\x80\xa2 Will provide appropriate education and counselling to the client before, during and after HIV testing and specimen collection
\xe2\x80\xa2 To perform with keeping information on standard revised medical practices and diagnostic principles.  Laboratory Qualifications & Requirement:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Must be technologist/Technician  
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least two years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in laboratory areas  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in the delivery of HIV Testing   
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work pleasantly with high risk groups specially with People Who Inject Drug
\xe2\x80\xa2 Effective written and verbal communication.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work well under pressure.'
