b'Police Reform and Capacity Building     Adviser to Deputy Minister for Administration Job SummaryJob Code Title:  Police Reform and Capacity Building    
Adviser to Deputy Minister for Administration
Position Number: 1
Department:   DMA-MOIA
Reports to: Deputy Minister for Administration  (DMA) 
Approved Grade: B
The Deputy Ministry of Administration is responsible for recruitment, training, personnel management, and management of the civil service elements of the Ministry. It also oversees the processing of national identity cards (tazkira), passports and visas, motor vehicle registrations, and drivers\xe2\x80\x99 licenses. Under the overall supervision of the Deputy Minister for Administration (DMA) and in close collaboration with the MoIA International partners, RS, C-STICA, UNDP/LOTFA, GPPT, GIZ/EU Police reform project, SSMI and other stakeholders the Deputy Minister Advisor will:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with international partners on police reform, system development and capacity building of Afghan National Police at national and International level.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Frequent travel to the provinces across the country; where regional training centers exist and police training and education programs are implemented and enhance the capacity of the RTCs to provide quality education for male and female police.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate with RS/PAIT team to plan and implement different capacity building program for ANP at national level.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate and manage current female training program in Sivas, Turkey with UNDP/LOTFA and other MoIA partners to build the capacity in Afghanistan.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Implement the Memorandum of Understanding of academic cooperation between Ministry of Interior Affairs and Ministry of Higher Education to ensure quality education in ANP higher education institutions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Rollout the Police Master Degree in Education and Law Enforcement with American University of Afghanistan for MoIA instructors and peronnels.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate the implementation of the Memorandum of Understanding between Ministry of Interior Affairs of Afghanistan and Ministry of Home Affairs of India on police capacity development.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Deputize for the DMA and assist in managing the other directorates and commands and represent DMA in coordination meetings with MoIA leadership and International partners.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Being the focal point of DMA for all international partners and other Afghan government ministries and institutions on police reform and capacity building.
Overall Function:
The incumbent of this position works in close collaboration and daily contact with the MoIA partners on implementation of all tasks and activities with national and international partners involved in the work of the Police Professionalization.  The advisor will continue to focus most attention on the Afghan National Police reform and capacity building at PHQ and PD levels this includes frequent travel to these provinces. The position also will support to 119 Emergency Call Center development, Police Information Desks establishment   and training at the regional level, District Safety and Security Surveys (DSSS) in the assigned provinces and Police Women\xe2\x80\x99s Councils/Family Response Units regionalisation. Deputisation functions will involve high level coordination of cross output activities, supporting MoIA staff in meetings and negotiations with third parties and assisting with the development of plans and delivery of capacity building agreements and contracts (goods and services) for MoIA education institutions. Facilitation meetings between MoIA and with senior MoIA officials and other international partners. Transfer of technical knowledge to and building of capacity MoIA/DMA related directorates and amongst individual counterparts within the MoIA namely the training and education institutions is a major criterion for judging the success of this position.
Key Function:
Under the direct supervision of the Deputy Minister for Administration, the incumbent will ensure the following key functions are performed to a high standard.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage and coordinate the work of the capacity development projects and programs using MISP implementation plans as a guide to achievement of results.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide technical advise to H.E Deputy Minister for Administration on police development initiatives and plans.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Arrange all meetingings for the H.E Deputy Minister for Administration with Resolute Support and other international stickholders.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Help MoIA for the development and approval of revision of education policy and develop and awareness plan of the police laws and policies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate work of the DMA with other elements of education institutions and the international community in the central and provincial level.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the MOIA and members of the UNDP project to develop and expand concepts relevant to building trust and confidence in police (taking into account the work of other national and international partners).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate the donor meetings with the Deputy Minister and provide technical assistance in preparing the reports to H.E minister of interior affairs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the RS initiative to provide standards female training program in enhancing the existing training resources in Afghanistan to replace Sivas, Turkey basic training program.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the DMA Police Professionalisation:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist DMA in quality assurance of the education in Afghan National Police Academy, Police Staff College and RTCs in Afghanistan.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate liaison activities between Resolute Support and DMA relevant directorates at Provincial Police Headquarter (PPHQs) and other senior office holders for the coordination of police development initiatives.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to management of technical assistance and support for all substantive work of the MoIA including major revisions police master degree program memorandum of understanding and delivery of the education for targeted MoIA instructors and personnels.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in identifying appropriate local/international development opportunities for regular capacity development under the MoIA and regional countries south-south cooperation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Facilated the negotiation between UNDP/LOTFA to support police capacity building programs in the regional countries.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain high level oversight and support for all DMA related programs and plans of the Police Professionalisation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Encourage the use of initiative, flexibility and enthusiasm amongst all team members and others in the Deputy Ministry for Administration.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop a supportive and inclusive working environment based on respect, trust and appreciation of diversity.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the DMA in conducting sensitive negotiations concerning police development matters and lead such negotiations where appropriate.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain a high level liaison with senior office holders of the MOIA inkling the Minister, Deputy ministers and key project contact at all levels. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the DMA through timely verbal and written briefs in relation to emerging issues within the broader police and security environment in Afghanistan. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the development of Work Plans for the delivery of associated activities and key results necessary for achievement of capacity building oversees.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support staff in the development of implementation plans to assist in tracking progress in delivery of Plan results and prepare monthly/quarterly progress report. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supporting DMA and other MoIA training institutions to develop an implementation plan for the MoU signed between MoIA and Ministry of Higher Education.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with MoIA senior capacity building committee and international partners to support police stations reform and capacity building.
\xe2\x80\xa2 In the absence of DMA, manage the work of police training institutions and pay regular visit to these institutions to observe the progress of the ongoing projects and provide technical assistances.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Lead and provide secretarial support for national and international delegations examining police professionalization issues.
IV. Impact of Results 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Through exposure to contemporary project-based management activities and sound public/business administration principles, the MoIA/DMA at ANPA, PSC and RTC level, will have an enhanced capacity to fulfil its function as an ecffective training/ learning division of the ANP.
\xe2\x80\xa2 This position will be a connecting hub between DMA office holders, directorates and MoIA International partners.
\xe2\x80\xa2 An understanding of MoIA training and education requirements to meet current and projected police priority needs is clarified and responded to by MoIA and training institutions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 MoIA training institutions have made a specific and measurable improvement in its development and career management of instructional staff.
\xe2\x80\xa2 MoIA and training institutions have implemented a series of programs in support of staff development and career management for its officers in line with MoIA\xe2\x80\x99s Human Resuources policies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge Management system developed within MoIA training and education institutions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Police development plan prepared inline with MISP for MoIA/DMA training institutions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Active partnership has made between MoIA and International partners for police capacity building and development. Adviser \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor degree in, Education and social science, Journalism, public administration or any other relevant field with an understanding of normative Education System of ANP 
\xe2\x80\xa2 With a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree 4 years of relevant work experience or with a master\xe2\x80\x99s degree and 3 years\xe2\x80\x99 relevant work experience.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 3 years of progressive working experience working in the area of police Professionalisation with a special focus on police training and education.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated knowledge of quality assurance frame work and Afghan higher education accreditation standards.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Having knowledge of Afghan (civilian and military) higher education law. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Good knowledge of developing progress report quarterly/annual.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Substantive experience of working with Afghan police in the areas of civilianization.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated experience of organizing surveys, policy research and analysis and developing high-quality briefing note/policy brief for senior leaderships.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in working with RS, UN entities, international organisations, in the relevant field of police training and education is highly desirable.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Computer literate, fully competent in MS-Office based applications, and internet research.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Highly proficiency in English - written and spoken;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in Dari and/or Pashto.'

b'Public Outreach and Advocacy Capacity Building Specialist Job SummaryWe are seeking one individual for a long-term position.  The Public Outreach and Advocacy Capacity Building Specialists will report to the Public Outreach and Advocacy CSO Support Team Leader in Kabul, and will assist that Team Leader in overseeing the public outreach and advocacy component.
ADALAT does not discriminate on the basis of gender, disability, or many other characteristics.  We encourage all people that have the qualifications (listed below) to apply. \xe2\x80\xa2 SUMMARY: Assist in overseeing the public outreach and advocacy component work.  This typically includes informing the public of important legal issues through publications, radio and television.  Much of our Advocacy and Outreach activities are accomplished through grants to civil society organizations and other organizations: this position ensures those organizations are performing their obligations of the grant.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in assessing the capacity of partner CSOs receiving public outreach and advocacy grants.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in the design of request for grant applications.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in evaluation of grant applications.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in monitoring/managing of partner CSOs/NGOs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in providing direct technical assistance to build the administrative, advocacy and outreach capacity of partner CSOs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in conducting participatory organization development assessments of ADALAT partner CSOs and develop action plans for the organizations\xe2\x80\x99 development. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Follow up with ADALAT partner CSOs, on the implementation of their action plans. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist ADALAT partner CSOs to access resources for addressing organization capacity needs and help them to plan for and get the most out of organization capacity interventions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in developing advocacy manual and conduct Advocacy ToT to partner CSOs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in organizing workshops for ADALAT partner CSOs on topics such as strategic planning, communication and outreach/ advocacy and management.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in providing ADALAT partner CSOs with direct practical technical assistance according to their needs and areas of expertise.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support ADALAT partner CSOs in completing capacity assessment checklists.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Travel to provinces as required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other tasks assigned by the Public Outreach and Advocacy CSO Support Team LeaderTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Programme The Public Outreach and Advocacy Capacity Building Specialist must have the following minimum set of qualifications:
\xe2\x80\xa2 University degree in Law, Journalism, Public Administration, Management or related field
\xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor degree with 5 years relevant experience or 7 years relevant work experience.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Three years of experience working with the Afghan Civil Society Organizations, in particular with work related to capacity building, advocacy, outreach.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with managing grants is preferred.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong writing, presentation, and training communication skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fluency in Dari and/or Pashto.'

b'Multiple Positions in WISE Herat Job SummaryWISE Organization looking for two female self-sufficient project managers, two trainers, one admin finance assistant. They will be responsible for ensuring the projects are managed efficiently and achieves project defined goals and objectives and deliverable. They will be directly report to the program manager. 1- Responsible for day-to-day project management of their projects and the relevant sub-components under each project.
2- Work closely with government staff with close coordination of program manager
3- Ensure that the overall project activities are being implemented based on the work plan that approved by related donors
4- Help the project director and the finance team on disbursements, preparation of all supporting documents, financial reports, travel.
5- Ensure that the reports are complete and ready to be provided for related counterparts on time without delaying.
6- Undertake regular monitoring and supervision of each project activity are being done based the donors demand and make sure the projects goals are meet with the best practices.
7- Any other project specific tasks assigned by the program manager or director. Programme 1- Project Manager with bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Journalism
2- Project manager with bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in political science
3- Trainers with bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in political science 
4- Admin finance Assistant with bachelor degree in economics.
5- Master degree is preferred if available for all.   
6- Two years working experience for project manager, one year for trainers and one year for admin finance assistant.'

b'Senior Business Development Advisor Job SummaryThe Senior Business Development Advisor develops business development strategy/action plan in line with ASMO Strategic Plan 2019 \xe2\x80\x93 2023 and ensures its sound implementation. S/he will work closely with the Executive Director, Director of Operations and Social Marketing Manager to provide leadership to business development initiatives in order to expand ASMO business, cultivate sound relationship with donors, UN agencies, line ministries and private investors/corporate companies in order to expand and diversify ASMO source of funding. 1. Program Strategy and Implementation :
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manages and oversees program strategy development and implementation for major program areas \xe2\x80\x93     Business Development (BD) and Public Relation (PR) in coordination with the management team.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provides longer term business development focus to expand areas of business and diversify source of funding in order to increase income and ensure future growth of the organization.
2. Business Development:
\xe2\x80\xa2 In consultation with the Executive Director, drafts business development strategy and prepares the annual Business Development plan.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develops a donor mapping document and regularly update it. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develops new business relationships with donors to attract more businesses for ASMO.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Searches new local and international opportunities and projects by analyzing business needs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develops proposals in coordination with the management team. 
3. Public Relations:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contributes in the development of corporate communication strategy for ASMO and ensure its implementation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Presents ASMO to potential clients/donors through direct communication in face to face meetings, telephone calls and emails. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provides constructive input in the development of capability statement, brochure, briefers, posters and organizational profile.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Represents ASMO at external events, including workshops, conferences, and meetings to promote and advance the organization\xe2\x80\x99s work.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Interfaces with, and cultivates relations with government agencies, international and local partners.
4. Others: 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Adheres to all ASMO administrative and operations policies and procedures. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assumes other duties, as directed by Executive Director Adviser Education: 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Having a Master Degree in business, economics, development studies or related field from a recognized university
Experience:
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least 5 years of work experience in senior business development and marketing positions  
\xe2\x80\xa2 A track record of generating new business worth of around half million USD per annum
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work experience with donor agencies, national and international NGOs in relevant capacities
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evidences of successful program management, proposal writing and winning the projects in the past
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience of working with other USAID projects is preferable
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience of working in the health and development sector is a plus'

b'Programme Associate (Sustainable Results) Job SummaryORGANIZATIONAL CONTEXT:
With a committed government, rich natural resources, and a young and diverse population, Afghanistan has the potential to make significant progress on the 2030 Agenda. However, a complex and protracted conflict, combined with challenges related to climate change, demographics, gender inequalities, underemployment, and transparency issues, has dramatically impeded its efforts to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), including SDG 2 on Zero Hunger. The 2017 Afghanistan Zero Hunger Strategic Review (ZHSR) found that the country suffers from high, and in some cases rapidly rising, levels of food insecurity and undernutrition, and outlines a series of recommendations to address the problem.
WFP is well placed to help Afghanistan implement several of the key recommendations through their new Country Strategic Plan (2018-2022). The overarching goal of the WFP Afghanistan CSP is to support the country to achieve Zero Hunger by 2030 in a manner that also contributes, wherever possible, to the broader, longer-term transition to peace and development. Mainstreaming the cross-cutting issues of gender equality and women\xe2\x80\x99s empowerment, protection, and accountability to affected populations, the CSP will focus on six, highly interrelated outcomes that span both SDG 2 and 17 (partnering for the goals).
Many vulnerable people struggle to meet their food and nutrition needs even after emergencies are over, especially if they have been displaced. Others face chronic challenges. It is therefore critical to complement the efforts to ensure access to food and nutrition during and immediately after emergencies (SO1) with support to help populations become increasingly self-reliant, in order to achieve the access target of SDG 2. Self-reliance efforts require several years of support to have a meaningful impact, but discernible progress should be made by the end of the CSP. At the same time, WFP will work to enhance the country\xe2\x80\x99s ability to respond to emergencies by strengthening the capacity of ANDMA and other relevant institutions and thereby limiting the impact of future crises on potentially affected populations. Taken together, these measures should enable more vulnerable people to meet their food security and nutrition needs on their own by 2022.
This outcome will be achieved through the following output:
\xe2\x80\xa2Vulnerable people benefit from nutrition-sensitive livelihood support in order to enhance self-reliance, reduce disaster risk and adapt to climate change (SDG 13), create employment (SDG 8) in urban (SDG 11) and rural areas, and support stability (SDG 16).
JOB PURPOSE:
With the above mentioned organizational context in mind, the Programme Assistants for Sustainable Results to be responsible for planning, implementation and reporting on all activities under Strategic Outcome 2. The SO 2 Programme Associate will be based in the WFP Country Office in Kabul, reporting to the SO 2 Outcome Manager.  He/she will provide operational and administrative support to all activities under SO2 including WFP\xe2\x80\x99s activities to build resilience, support livelihoods and reduce disaster risks through large scale asset creation projects as well as vocational skills and other training activities to create employment.
The SO 2 Programme Associate will also be expected to travel to field offices as necessary to work with the SO2 Field Outcome Managers. He/She will also be responsible to to liaise with the Operations unit for activity planning and will also follow up with finance and donor relations units as necessary.
Main activities are highlighted below
\xe2\x80\xa2Provide support to the SO 2 Outcome Manager when reviewing the proposals, budgets, Field Level Agreements (FLAs) and amendments when needed.
\xe2\x80\xa2Communication with all the AOs/SOs related to the progress in SO2-related activities based on the plan assigned by the Manager.
\xe2\x80\xa2Assist the SO 2 Outcome Manager in identification, development and management of potential partnerships for joint programming implementation and strengthen existing partnerships. Manage logistics for any meetings with the partners.
\xe2\x80\xa2Support the SO 2 Outcome Manager in developing and strengthening of the capacity of the relevant CPs\xe2\x80\x99 staff, government staff, WFP field staff, and PAT monitors, through conducting training needs assessment followed by relevant trainings.
\xe2\x80\xa2Take lead on gathering and recording the project related data in a tracking sheet for convenient reporting, when required.
\xe2\x80\xa2Provide support to the AOs/SOs related to the decision to use CBT or in-kind in the response, liaising with the CBT team and possibly attending the CBT/SCOPE Working Group meetings as required.
\xe2\x80\xa2Follow up with the AOs/SOs to submit the SO2 proposals, standby agreements and supporting documents on time.
\xe2\x80\xa2Attend the meetings related to the SO2 activities with WFP partners and government when needed.
\xe2\x80\xa2Any other duty as requiredTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Programme Education: University degree in agriculture, engineering or project management, or a related field.
Experience:
\xe2\x80\xa2At least 5 years experiences in livelihood or asset creation program management (especially humanitarian response) including planning, coordination, implementation and monitoring.
\xe2\x80\xa2Work experience in programme management, especially in resilience and recovery areas, including assert creation.
\xe2\x80\xa2Experience in design or implementation of livelihood, asset creation or vocational skills training programmes
\xe2\x80\xa2Experience of working with UN or NGOs in Afghanistan will be an asset.
Language: Fluency (level C) in English language, plus Pashto and/or Dari, preferably both.'

b"National Professional Officer (Programme and Resilience) Job SummaryPosition Title: National Professional Officer (Programme & Resilience) Grade Level: N-2
Duty Station: Afghanistan, Kabul
Organizational Unit: FAO Representation in Afghanistan, FAAFG Duration *: Fixed Term: one year (with a possibility of
extension)
Post Number: 2004138
CCOG Code: 1A02
Reporting Lines
The National Professional Officer (Programme and Resilience) reports to the FAO Representative and Assistant FAO
Representative (Programme). He/she works with independence and initiative and applies knowledge of local socio-economic
conditions, language, and institutions. He/she performs a range of normative and programming tasks in support of the activities of
the FAO Representation in the areas of agriculture, forestry and rural development with particular attention to Strategic Objective
Number 5 of the Organization (SO5) on resilience. The National Professional Officer (NPO) may be asked to represent FAO in
meetings, workshops, working groups and in other forums. He/she works in close collaboration with the Assistant FAOR
(Administration), the National Operations Officer, the Field Security Officer and the Chief Technical Advisers (CTAs) and project
teams in the country.
Technical Focus
Programme development, coordination and operational assistance based on the knowledge of the local conditions, culture,
language and institutions of the country of assignment. Design and implementation of a sound Monitoring and Evaluation (M-E)
system for major Programmes in Agriculture related to Emergencies and Resilience with focus on food security and nutrition,
Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and agriculture data analysis.
Key Results
Effective and efficient coordination and provision of the technical and operational support of the programme and project activities of
the FAO Representation. Develop, implement, monitor and evaluate assigned programme/projects. Key Functions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaises and assists government authorities and local, national and international institutions in the areas of FAO's
activities in the country and with other UN agencies. He/she may represent FAO at inter-agency meetings as
required;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Promotes the image of FAO through advocacy of the Organization's mandate, programmes, national priorities and
activities including development and maintenance of communication tools such as website, press releases and
publications, and supports the implementation of FAO's regulatory framework (Codex Alimentarius, Code of
Conduct for Responsible Fisheries, Safe Use of Pesticides, etc.) in the country;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinates the collection, consolidation and maintenance of country data on food, crops, livestock, forestry and
fisheries including information on external aid in FAO's corporate systems and monitors changes in national
policies affecting the agricultural sector;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participates in producing technical, economic and policy studies as required and developing country level
development frameworks such as the Country Programming Framework (CPF) and the United Nations
Development Assistance Frameworks (UNDAF);
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participates in the identification, formulation and preparation of programme and project proposals and monitors
and reviews the status of programme/project implementation to ensure that all operational activities are carried
out in line with the work plan and the project document; identifies inconsistencies and delays and, when necessary,
proposes corrective measures to overcome operational constraints;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Briefs, trains and supervises lower grade programme staff regarding all aspects of the job. Ensures adherence to
procedures and work requirements and accuracy and diligence of the work provided.
Specific Functions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supports the development, identification, preparation and formulation of pipeline programs and projects proposals
particularly related to SO5, in liaison with Government services, UN Agencies, Multilateral/Bilateral Donors, and
FAO Technical and Operational Divisions and Services;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contributes to need assessments especially collecting and analyzing the secondary data related to SO5;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Specifies quantities and determines technical specification of agricultural inputs, as well as timing of agricultural
inputs required as immediate assistance of emergencies/resilience activities;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Initiates emergency/resilience project implementation until the boarding of the project CTA/manager;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitors the resilience projects' implementation in order to ensure quality implementation on timely manner;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaises with FAO regional focal points to better coordinate and implement the resilience interventions;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participates in project preparation in support of strengthening the SO5 component of the Country Program
Framework (CPF) and inserts newly prepared concept notes and project documents in FAO relevant systems for
approval processing;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provides inputs for the FAO Representatives annual reports and participates in the preparation of reports on FAO
resilience program/emergencies project development, implementation and monitoring;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Promotes the image of FAO through advocacy of the Organization's mandates, programs and priorities and
national activities and assists government counterparts, NGOs, the private sector and others to understand how
to access FAO knowledge and resources. Programme Minimum Requirements
\xe2\x80\xa2 National of Afghanistan;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advanced university degree in agriculture, agricultural economics, forestry, fisheries, or any other field related to
the work of the Organization;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Two years of relevant experience in agricultural development and/or project implementation in an area of FAO's
activities in the country, that combines project planning and formulation, agriculture, food security and nutrition,
DRR, M-E, emergency response etc.;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Level C of the official communication language used for FAO communication with the country (English, French,
Spanish, Arabic, Chinese or Russian);
\xe2\x80\xa2 Working knowledge of the local language (if not English, French, Spanish, Arabic, Russian or Chinese);
\xe2\x80\xa2 Limited knowledge (Level B) of English (if the main communication language is French, Spanish, Arabic, Russian
or Chinese)."

b'Social Organiser Job SummaryThe Social Organiser is responsible for social mobilization at the community level; facilitate Afghanaid\xe2\x80\x99s work with communities, ensuring wide participation of community women and/or men in decision making and equity in the benefits of development activities. The incumbent will be responsible for ensuring equity in the benefits of development activities and community support for project implementation and the sustainability of social development. The incumbent will also be responsible for organizing women into women\xe2\x80\x99s groups or men into men\xe2\x80\x99s groups and training them in selected topics. Finally, the Social Organizer will contribute to Afghanaid\xe2\x80\x99s efforts to continually learn from its implementation experience (both of Afghanaid and other development actors/researchers) and to feed that learning into the design of new projects, programs and development strategy, particularly those related to women\xe2\x80\x99s social and economic development and empowerment. Responsibilities
\xe2\x80\xa2 Planning, developing and implementing an appropriate community mobilisation approach in the selected areas of the respective province in a professional and timely manner.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate a community decision making process that ensures wide participation. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the organisation of official workshops, conferences, and meetings to link women beneficiaries with human rights defenders and service providers at the district and provincial level. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring that the project is implemented in accordance with national, organisational and donor requirements, standards, policies and procedures and that those commitments to the donor, communities and other programme partners are fulfilled in a professional and timely manner.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinating and communicating with other team members and liaise with provincial stakeholders.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the project technical team in designing and conducting a social analysis and study of best practices to enhance project visibility and to be applied into Afghanaid\xe2\x80\x99s future plan of action.
Specific duties:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Mobilise the participating communities to get their support and/or involvement in the project implementation through raising awareness on project purpose, objectives and progress among the project participants and female communities; regularly monitor whether the project gets support from the communities. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Building the capacity of female project participants and facilitate the trainings and meetings conducted for the project participants by the technical team.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the organisation and facilitation of official workshops, conferences, and meetings to link women beneficiaries with human rights defenders and service providers at the district and provincial level. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct regular visits to project area and ensure field acidities are properly implemented according to plan, technically sound, cost-effective and relevant to the target beneficiaries\xe2\x80\x99 needs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide support to the project team in organising meetings with relevant stakeholders, CDCs and in establishing strong linkages between the women\xe2\x80\x99s groups and the CDCs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide support to the team developing and disseminating learning/technical messages to enable communities at various levels to manage their social and economic resources and share project benefits in an equitable manner for long term sustainability.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct needs assessments of project participants supporting the designing of training programs to address the identified needs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advice and assist the Project Manager and Project Coordinator in designing, developing and monitoring the implementation plan related to community mobilisation; 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to the preparation of quarterly and annual project work plans and budgets and assist the Project Manager and Project Coordinators in budget tracking and analysis as necessary.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the project team to foster useful communication, collaboration and harmony within the team and promote individual and collective commitment to implementation quality.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure a good working relationship between the project team and relevant government departments and administration.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate, in close coordination with the project team, any visits of internal or external stakeholders to monitor the project implementation. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keep appropriate records for collecting project implementation evidence: attendance sheets, distribution lists, training needs assessment records, pre- and post-training assessment, etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the M&E Officer in collecting case studies, success stories and other relevant M&E data; provide support to conduct result relevant baseline assessment and other surveys.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the equipment distribution process. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform any other duties as required. Programme Education/ training
Diploma in a related field 
University Degree
Work Experience 
Minimum three years of experience in a similar capacity 
Prior work experience in the fields of community development and community mobilisation. 
Experience in assessing training needs and building the capacity of project participants
Professional Skills and Competencies 
Dependable professional with strong organisational and coordination skills, initiative, judgment and adaptability with significant levels of autonomy. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated ability to effectively plan, setting priorities and meeting tight deadlines; results-oriented approach to delivering work priorities
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated commitment to continuous learning and professional development; ability to convert lessons learnt and experiences gained from delivering trainings in the field to improving the training approach;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong communication, analytical and report writing skills with fluency in spoken and written Dari, and Uzbek in the case of Samangan;   
\xe2\x80\xa2 Willingness, enthusiasm and experience in working with vulnerable women with a focus on their economic and social empowerment.  
Knowledge and skills in basic computing
Working knowledge in English, or other local languages
Values and attitude \xe2\x80\xa2 
Strong interpersonal skills in working in a multi-disciplinary team. 
A clear and firm commitment to human rights, equality, role and empowerment of women, minorities and persons with disabilities. 
Understanding and knowledge of Islamic perspective on women\xe2\x80\x99s rights and strong understanding of the local context.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible, committed and honest in his/her work
\xe2\x80\xa2 Detail-oriented person.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Resilience to live, travel and work in isolated and possibly insecure locations. 
Flexible, dynamic, ability to multitask.'

b'Project Coordinator Job SummaryCoordination and supervision of the project\xe2\x80\x99s interventions; ensuring smooth implementation in the respective province and providing livelihoods and civic engagement expertise to support the Project Manager and all relevant field staff. Responsibilities
\xe2\x80\xa2 To coordinate and supervise project activities, ensuring smooth project implementation according to the project work plan and achieving planned results. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Providing livelihoods and civic engagement development support and assistance to the Project Manager and the provincial team to ensure implementation according to technical standards.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage AEPO\xe2\x80\x99s contribution to the project. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordination of the project activities with all relevant stakeholders, especially Community Development Councils, the Department of Women\xe2\x80\x99s Affairs; the Department of Education, and the Department of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock.
Specific duties:
Management and supervision 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advise and assist the Project Manager in planning, implementing and further developing the project components to ensure that they are technically sound, cost-effective and relevant to the target beneficiaries\xe2\x80\x99 needs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keep the Project Manager and relevant staff informed of any significant changes / opportunities in the local environment, problems and quality of the work.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage AEPO\xe2\x80\x99s contribution to the project. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop quarterly and monthly work plans and budget planning in all the project components with support and guidance from the Project Manager and in close cooperation with the other two provincial Project Coordinators.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare quarterly and monthly procurement plans and provide technical assistance to the Operations team in procurement processes and quality control of the project materials. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate all project activities with relevant stakeholders, including project participants, their household members, communities outside of the project, Community Development Council representatives, religious leaders, governmental departments, NGOs and other national and international institutions and make sure the implementation is in compliance with the national, organisational and donor\xe2\x80\x99s regulations and policies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Actively participate in sectorial meetings of government departments and meetings of other relevant stakeholders in consultation with the Project Manager.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Project Manager in responding to enquiries of a technical nature from field staff, the government, donors and other stakeholders.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Translation of documents from and to Dari. 
HR management
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in the recruitment and technical appraisal of all relevant staff. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Continually assess the quality of work and technical competence of all relevant field staff and ensure that capacity building needs are met through training, on-the-job coaching or other methods, as appropriate.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Regular visits to all project sites and provinces to assess the performance of staff and quality of project implementation, and provide information, encouragement and technical support as required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop capacity building plans and conduct trainings for field staff if necessary.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide logistical and technical support to external consultants and visitors monitoring the project.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate and actively participate in experience sharing workshops and staff meetings at the provincial and national level.
Linkage creation and linkaging events
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure the establishment of linkages between project participants and the market, MFIs, market players, suppliers and service providers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Promote a savings and entrepreneurial culture for increased income general at the household and at community level in the project team, so they further motivate the project participants and communities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure the establishment of linkages between project participants, especially self-help group leaders, and services catering to women, as well as human rights defenders at the district and provincial level. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work with the project team to identify and establish links with human rights defenders at the district and provincial level, including through the organisation of official workshops and conferences.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor all production support activities and SHG linkaging activities and make recommendations for modification, improvements or the introduction of new activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organise exposure visits and exchange visits of entrepreneurs. 
M&E
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide support, collect and consolidate monthly reports from the team and submit monthly progress reports to the Project Manager.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support the Project Manager and the M&E Officer in preparing quarterly and annual project reports. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the M&E Officer and the team to document and share case studies, success stories and field visit reports as and when required. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the project M&E Officer in monitoring the project activities. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out joint monitoring of technical aspects of the project with the representatives of different stakeholder groups and ensure field visits can happen on a regular basis.
Perform any other duties as required. Programme Education/ training 
University degree in rural development, enterprise development, marketing, agriculture or a similar field relevant to the project
Work Experience 
4-5 years of experience in a similar capacity 
Professional Skills and Competencies
Ability to provide technical supervision and motivate the project staff, proven skills in mentoring, coaching and facilitating learning and development of staff and peers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Willingness, enthusiasm and experience in working with vulnerable women.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong understanding of the local context and Islamic perspective on women\xe2\x80\x99s rights.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated ability to think strategically, effectively plan, setting priorities and meeting tight deadlines; results-oriented approach to delivering work priorities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong communication, analytical and report writing skills with fluency in spoken and written Dari and English, as well as Uzbek in the case of Samangan. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Good knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Office including spreadsheets, PowerPoint, and word processing
Values and attitude 
A clear and firm commitment to human rights, equality, the role and empowerment of women, minorities and persons with disabilities. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Competent to take initiative, work with significant levels of autonomy and able to meet tight deadlines
\xe2\x80\xa2 Committed and honest in his/her work
\xe2\x80\xa2 Detail oriented person
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible, flexible, adaptable, ability to multitask'

b'Social Organizer Job SummaryThe incumbent of this position is responsible for overall organization of target communities in line with the programme objectives including election, facilitation and problem identification as well as supervising the mobilization of Community Shuras for taining, and programme implementation, identification of projects for the community, facilitation of subprojects\xe2\x80\x99 proposals and completion reports and performing any other identical duty as assigned. The incumbent also the assist to the target communities in conduction of technical survey, design and cost estimation of their prioritized Eco-DRR sub- projects. 1. Overall organization of target communities in line with the programme objectives including formation of CBDMCs, facilitation and problem identification.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Concluding a participatory baseline survey on the potential resources and general problem of the community in the selected villages/ neighborhoods.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conducting facilitation during the participatory Eco- CBDP planning in the concerned communities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Regular visit to the villages for monitoring and supervision of activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate the process of linkages and Net working with Line departments and external resources.
2. Conducting mobilization of Community Shuras for training, and programme implementation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the institutionalization of problem identification, prioritization, Eco-DRR project planning and implementation based on the program objectives and principles.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist and facilitation for conducting Eco-DRR trainings based on the project cycle and need of community and community institution.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Help and facilitation in preparing the work and action plans and needed Eco-DRR training material and training logistics.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Sharing and coordination of field training and experiences vertically and across the district.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the Eco-DRR trainer, Watershed supervisor and field Engineers for enabling the community based social environment.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the CBDMC for the Registration of their established community institution 
3. Facilitate the identification of Eco-DRR projects for the community; facilitate subprojects\xe2\x80\x99 proposals and completion reports.
CBDP)s.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Report on a regular basis to the provincial coordinator on the progress of activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing weekly and monthly reports to the provincial coordinator.
. Perform any other identical duty as assigned. Programme EDUCATION:  BS. Degree in Social Science or other related fields.
WORK EXPERIENCE:  Minimum three years work experience of social works and work in community based DRR/development field.  
SKILLS: High social skills and behavior as well as projects monitoring, community analysis survey, use of PRA methodology, 
LANGUAGES: Excellent knowledge of both written and spoken Pashto and Dari is required.  Fluent in English is preferred
GENERAL: Good interpersonal communication and community organization skills.
TRAITS: 
Build personal and inter project relationship, analyze issues, cultural sensitivity, Gender sensitivity, team work, establish a conductive working environment and persuade others, mobilize communities and implement the projects in the community based Eco-DRR development field. Having a deep knowledge of Afghan traditions is important. 
The incumbent is authorized to, recommend communities projects for approval .
CONTACTS/KEY RELATIONSHIPS:
Provincial Project coordinator, Eco-DRR trainers, Watershed supervisors, irrigation engineers, support staff and community.
WORKING CONDITION:
Stationed in the project /Provincial sub office'

b'Judicial Training Specialist Job SummaryThe Judicial Training Specialist will assist with all judicial training programs for the Assistance for the Development of Afghan Legal Access and Transparency (ADALAT) Project and will report to the Team Leader. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Judicial Education Department (JED) in all relevant training affairs and identify gaps in the judicial stage curriculum. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work on standardization of stage training materials and coordinate with the JED to develop stage curriculum and update all required training materials under supervision of Team Leader.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in all project interventions with the judicial stage initial training program and maintain communication and coordination with JED.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the JED in a comprehensive evaluation of training programs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the JED to develop and update the curriculum for the judicial stage. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the JED with the development of a judicial education strategy, in close coordination with other donors.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate as a trainer in Training of Trainers programs. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other duties as assigned by management team and Team Leader.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Programme \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree from Sharia or Law Faculty.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor degree with 5 years relevant experience or 7 years relevant work experience 
\xe2\x80\xa2 The candidate should have worked with Justice/Judicial Sectors and he/she should have minimum 3 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience at the relevant field, preferably with Supreme Court. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Working with National and International NGO is preferred.
\xe2\x80\xa2 The candidate should have knowledge of both procedural and substantive law.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Level 3 English ability.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong communication skills, including interpersonal written and oral English.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Must have Proficiency in Dari and Pashto.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Good computer skills to include Internet, Word, Excel, database.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work both independently and as an effective team member.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work under pressure.'

b'Watershed coordinator Job SummaryTo ensure the implementation of watershed management activities in line with the Catchment approach (Natural Resource Management, Rangeland Management, Agriculture Systems, Social Water Management, Forestry, etc.) Programme Management: 
\xe2\x80\xa2 As a member of the senior project management team, overall to support the Provincial coordinator in effective planning, delivery, monitoring, impact assessment of the project; liaison with Watershed Advisor, stakeholders and the project team management. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Guide / support/ Develop capacities of a team of Agriculture Extension Officer and watershed supervisor and other project team members in order to successfully deliver NRM component of the programme.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure appropriate and timely implementation of NRM plans and Agriculture development plans within the frame work of project and other initiatives as appropriate.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure close and effective working with the team of Community Mobilizer for establishing community based institutions /organizations such as Watershed Management Committee (WMC), Small Holder Group (SHG) WASH,CMG, Common Interest groups (such as Vegetable producer) and develop their capacities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop appropriate MoUs / Agreements with communities and or community institutions in controlled grazing, contribution in NRM, water sharing, establishment of farmers\xe2\x80\x99 field schools/ demonstrations etc. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 To develop system for collecting baseline information and tracking the project progress in line with the log frame indicators.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To develop specific plan on rangeland management, vegetation cover assessment and monitoring by technical manner and aspect. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 To develop and contribute to design and plan NRM and Agriculture interventions in a participatory manner. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Follow up the capacity building of Watershed Management Committee, tracking their progress and ensuring the new established WMC functioning well according the regulation and code of conduct, management body of them able to manage the Watershed Management Committee.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring the small and poorest farmers have equal access to the inputs of Watershed Management Committee and service provider considering small farmers while they providing services to the community. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Follow up the capacity building of Seed/Fodder bank committee management board, tracking their progress and ensuring the seed bank functioning as well according the regulation, statutes.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring the poorest household has equal access to the inputs and services of Seed Bank Committee.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 To assist in identification of target group through participatory processes. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 To ensure in program design and assessment stage environmental protection, equity and disaster risk reduction measures incorporate into program activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide trainings to the project staff and community members on NRM, Agriculture, forestry, horticulture, Agro forestry etc issues.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organize social events to promote community based natural resources management, equity and right based principles.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organize policy advocacy campaigns to enhance community awareness about agriculture, NRM, CBO government policies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify opportunities and strategic needs of the communities in order to enhance the SIDA funded project results and enhance community ownership, participation and contribution.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the projects are carried out according standard operating procedures, technical manuals and policies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collection and compiling of seed multiplication, on farm trials, fruit/vegetable nurseries, forest plantation and range management area.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Inform Provincial coordinator, Watershed advisor about any technical problems, e.g., appearance of pest and diseases.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Inform Provincial coordinator about procurement of agreed input and equipment to the farmers and project participants.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure / promote women participation wherever possible.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify opportunities for external consultants\xe2\x80\x99 inputs and develop TORs, accordingly together with the project manager identify consultants.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Afghanaid is committed to HAP to ensure downward accountability. Concern activities are guided by HAP standards in all stages both emergency and development projects /programs. In Afghanistan we also bounded our activities by Accountability framework and therefore any Afghanistan employees are responsible to comply with HAP principles and benchmarks as instructed by its policies and therefore make sure that you accept and implement HAP standards in all your activities. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 To give your full support in relation to emergencies when occurring in any area that Afghanaid will respond. 
Monitoring & Impact Assessment: 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure regular information collection on each agreed indicators and reported through reports as per organizational and donor needs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work with the monitoring and evaluation manager and develop impact monitoring indicators and system to understand, document and disseminate the impact of the project and learning. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organize internal monitoring and impact assessment visits
Reporting & Communication: 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and submit accurate monthly work plans and reports to the Sr.PM/ provincial Coordinator.  These reports should include technical social and impact information.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with Provincial PC regarding technical aspect of NRM implementing activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop high quality donor reports for the NRM and agriculture related activities, that is contributing to the project donor reports as required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure government participation in key social events such as trainings, exposure visits, workshops etc, as appropriate
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with relevant government departments and keep updated them on the project progress and achievements on regular basis.
Capacity Building
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop training modules in aspects of NRM / Agriculture and other relevant topics and deliver training to NRMC(Natural resource management committee) ,CIGs (Common Interest Group,) CMGs (Crisis Management Groups) ,PSC( Provincial Steering Committee) and FCs(Farmer Cooperative) /CDC(Community Development Councils) /CMA(Catchment management association), project participants and project team members.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organize exchange / exposure visits for NRMC/CDC/CMA, Government stakeholders and project team members.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Awareness rising of NRMC/CDC/CMA and other stockholders on development of bylaws/statutes and implementation of that among community.  
Staff Management: 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Effective Manage a team of Agriculture Extension officers and NRM officers, this includes development and review of job objectives, performance management, and weekly action planning.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Development of performance development plans and implements them together with the Provincial coordinator 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide, in writing feedback to the team members and keep informed the project manager and HR, as appropriate.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in staff recruitments as advised by the Program coordinator.
Net Working: 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with relevant government departments, NGO networks as advised by the Program Coordinator.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in relevant national, provincial and district level meetings and represent the BDK program.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in CMA / NRMC meetings as appropriate.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in Farmer cooperatives group meeting in the district level. Programme .Education degree
Graduate /Post Graduate Degree in Agriculture/ Forestry/ horticulture/ Environmental related field
Computer skills (Word, Excel, Outlook) essential
Fluent in written and spoken English
Experience
1. At least five years\xe2\x80\x99 experience (if post graduate degree three years\xe2\x80\x99 experience) of NRM / Agriculture / Forestry etc.
2. Experience of staff management
3. Experience in CBO trainings and experience of developing training modules and extension materials such as leaflets and posters.
4. Experience in the establishment and support of community led projects particularly NRM / Watershed activities.
Writing skills in English /Dari
.  Communication and Reporting
1. Develop and submit accurate monthly work plans and reports to the Provincial coordinator / Program Manager.  These reports should include technical and impact information.
2. Liaise with watershed advisor aspect of NRM activities.
3. Liaise with relevant government departments and keep updated them on the project progress and achievements on regular basis.
Excellent reporting and communication skills'

b'Translator Job SummarySamuel Hall (www.samuelhall.org) is seeking an experienced and professional Translator to join its team for a full-time position based in our Kabul office.
Translators have the opportunity to apply their skills in our Kabul office. They are an integral component of our research projects and work on desk reviews, key informant interviews, and research tools. TRANSLATION
\xe2\x80\xa2 Translate all research tools such as questionnaires, focus group discussion guidelines, interview guidelines, training documents, presentations, authorization letters, field interviews, field notes, executive summaries, reports and briefings
\xe2\x80\xa2 Translate all office documentation such as standard operating procedures, communication documents, contact lists, etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Interpret interviews and other conversations led by international staff when needed
\xe2\x80\xa2 Interpret and liaise between international research staff and field teams when needed
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide the above services to all staff members from:
o English to Dari
o Dari to English
o (English to Pashto)
o (Pashto to English)
o (Dari to Pashto)
o (Pashto to Dari)
PROBLEM SOLVING AND MANAGEMENT
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review past translations from other team members and provide feedback in order to improve the quality of the work when needed
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify gaps and propose solutions regarding tool design, data collection and other translation issues
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supervise the outsourced work of external translators hired on a short-term basis
\xe2\x80\xa2 Devise potential tests and training materials for national applicants
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be proactive and propose innovative ideas for the improvement of research cycle and office procedures related to translation tasks Translation Applicants will need to possess and demonstrate the following qualifications and transferable skills:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advanced university degree with a minimum of four years of higher education
\xe2\x80\xa2 Complete written and oral fluency in English and Dari; Pashto is an asset
\xe2\x80\xa2 Exceptional English writing skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keen attention to detail
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to adapt and work well within a team
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to cope well under pressure, work occasionally irregular hours and meet tight deadlines
\xe2\x80\xa2 Three strong and verifiable references'

b'Female Finance Analyst Job SummaryThe Financial Analyst shall conduct analytical studies to determine the financial position for budgetary units, apply instructions to complete budget cycle, identify all appropriate sources of information, and the methods used in accomplishing the work.  The Financial Analyst shall review financial and operational data and generate summary reports, compile annual budgets from various standard or prescribed sources, prepare schedules of disbursements, and statistical charts reflecting the financial and operating characteristics of organizations.  The Financial Analyst shall perform work in connection with various agency programs and involve work in the development of salary requirements, operating standards and other safeguarding measures for insuring stability of financial organizations. Develop analytical studies to determine the financial position of the ministry for all
    budgetary units.
2. Apply instructions to complete budget cycle, identifying all appropriate sources of information, and the methods used in accomplishing the work.
3. Analyze financial and operational data submitted by organizations and provide summary reports to USG advisors engaged in financial work. Compile annual budgets from various standard or prescribed sources. 
4. Prepare schedules of disbursements, statistical charts reflecting the financial and operating characteristics of organizations, and similar material.
5.    Compare prior and current years to forecast, or provide forecasting advice to leadership.
6. Develop a spend plan, which shows month to month expenditures, track expenditures to the plan and report to management the status of execution.  
7. Evaluate accounting material to determine whether it is accurate, consistent, and a full and fair disclosure of economic and financial condition.
8. Recommend the issuance of requests for amendments to correct deficiencies. Perform financial duties to include but not limited to relating needs and accomplishments of the organization to anticipated and actual dollar figures in the budget and relate this knowledge to the needs of the serviced organizations.
9. Search records, files, and other readily accessible sources for information pertaining to documents with responsibility for determining consistency with or noting discrepancies between currently- and previously-filed information. 
10. Assemble information concerning specified items from various readily accessible, commonly used sources for financial activities, which include providing financial information to and coordinating with USG advisors on behalf of Ministry of Defense (MOD). Check payroll filings or other forms for compliance with instructions regarding the forms used for filing, proper execution of legal documents, and presence of required supporting documents.
11. Obtain, compile, and summarize narrative information and quantitative data for use by others within the office.
12.    Verify line item costs in the budget and enter costs in standard forms and schedules.
13. Extract budget and program data from computer printouts of accounting records, forms, and reports for use by co-workers.
14. Remain current on Afghan Financial Management laws, rules, and policy knowledge and competencies, and industry environments to maintain professional development.
15. Any of the duties as required by higher authorities in accordance with laws, regulations and objectives of the ministry/agency.
16.    Performs financial management/budget formulation work involving preparation of detailed   
   analyses of annual and/or multi-year budget and estimates of annual funding needs for one    
   or more budget years.
17.    Performs budget execution, trend analysis and financial management work involving the  
   monitoring of obligations incurred and the actual expenditures of funds, different sources 
   and types of funding; such as direct annual appropriations.
18.    Provides advice, assistance, and guidance on budgeting, cost estimating and financial
19.    management related information.
20.    Conducts analysis, reviews, and special studies of financial management and/or cost related
   information. Account/Finance 1. At least two (2) years of experience in a financial position or a relevant field.
2. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree from an accredited institution in Finance, Economics or business discipline.
3. Excellent computer literacy skills in MS Office (Word and Excel) and QuickBooks.
4. Experience of financial management, including accounting software'

b'Accounting& Finance Manager Job Summary Handle finance for the projects, supervise and training accounts staff and prepare financial reports and budgets. Account/Finance \xe2\x80\xa2 Passed finalist of ACCA or CIMA.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 05 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience heading Accounting& Finance Division, finalizing monthly accounts, cash flow, Budgeting and forecasts and having a sound knowledge of cost and accounting principles , practices and procedures.

\xe2\x80\xa2 Proactive, result driven and ability to work under pressure with minimum supervision
