b"Accountant / Quickbooks Operator Job SummaryA professional accountant with relevant education and experience is required to establish accounting systems for multiple ongoing projects of the company and its other business operations using QuickBooks accounting software. Accountant, using Quickbooks software will track all financial transactions, managing all accounting functions, invoicing, collections, payables, and producing financial statements. Another essential part of the job is inventory/stock tracking and performing procurement operations. Using Quickbooks, the following duties shall be performed. 
- Establish correct accounting system using Quickbooks software for ongoing projects and other business operations of the company. 
- Inventory/Stock tracking of materials  using Quickbooks
- Producing invoices, tracking invoices
- Tracking receivables,
- Tracking payrolls and pay bills
- Procurement operations
- Cost Accounting and Inventory
- Maintains and balances accounts by verifying, allocating, reconciling transactions; resolving discrepancies. 
- Perform monthly balance sheet, income statement and changes in financial 
- Work closely with site leadership. 
- Investigate and report to the manager any inconsistencies or improprieties. 
- Analyze data to ensure proper accounting procedures have been followed. 
- Provide timely, relevant and accurate reporting & analysis of the results of the sites' 
-  Other routine accounting dutiesTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Account/Finance 1)  3+ years of Accounting & Finance experience
2)  Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Accounting Required.
3) Proficient in Quickbooks software with previous experience of accounting using Quickbooks"

b'Financial Analyst Job SummaryThe Financial Analyst will be responsible for conducting complex financial analysis to support the Office of Senior Advisor with business plan evaluation and help state-owned enterprises and companies to improve their financial planning and reporting. He/She will work with the Finance team to prepare monthly and quarterly financial reporting and is supervised by the Senior Financial Analyst. 1- Perform financial reporting, ad-hoc project analysis, and financial modeling
2- Analyze current and past corporate financial information and prepare complex financial models to analyze data
3- Conduct evaluations of investment proposals and business plans by using appropriate corporate finance tools
4- Evaluate state-owned enterprises/companies in terms of management and operations and make suggestions to improve their financial planning
5- Build CAPEX models for state-owned enterprises/companies to re-activate the enterprises and improve their production capacity
6- Work with state-owned enterprises to identify areas for improvements (this may require traveling to various cities through Afghanistan)
7-Conduct case studies for investment projects where appropriate
8- Communicate with government and private sector stakeholders and prepare reports and summaries
9- Develop ad-hoc business analysis and present recommendations to Senior Advisor on strategic decisions Account/Finance Education
A Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Economics, Finance, Business Administration or a closely related field. Preference will be given to Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree holders.
Experience
At least 3 years of relevant experience. Preference will be given to candidates with additional years of experience.'

b"Finance Manager Job SummaryThe Finance Manager is responsible for the budget planning, and supports the MEC executive management team by offering insights and financial advice. This might involve advising on investments, savings, taxation, financial planning, budgeting and other related services Administer and monitor the financial system in order to ensure that the campus finances are maintained in an accurate and timely manner.
Maintain the accounts payable and accounts receivable systems in order to ensure complete and accurate records of all moneys
Administer employee payroll, files and records in order to ensure accurate payment of benefits and allowances
Main Activities:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with preparation of the budget and appropriate implementation of the financial policies and procedures. Establish and maintain cash controls, maintain and reconcile the general ledger
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor cash reserves and investments and producing long-term business plans.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare and reconcile bank statements and controlling income, cash flow and expenditure.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Establish and maintain supplier accounts and processes supplier invoices
\xe2\x80\xa2 Issue cheques for all accounts due and maintain the purchase order system.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure security for all credit cards and verify charges
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure transactions are properly recorded and entered into the computerized accounting system
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing and managing financial systems/models
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare income statements and the balance sheets,  financial reports & assist with the annual audit
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain financial files and records, Ensure the safeguarding of all transactions, Issue, code and authorize purchase orders, Reconcile the accounts payable, Prepare journal summaries, Reconcile the accounts receivable, Compile source documents, Issue receipts, Reconcile weekly deposits
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the day-to-day financial operations within the company, such as payroll, invoicing, and other transactions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee financial department employees, including financial assistants and accountants
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contract outside services for tax preparation, auditing, banking, investments, and other financial needs as necessary
\xe2\x80\xa2 Track the company's financial status and performance to identify areas for potential improvement
\xe2\x80\xa2 Seek out methods for minimizing financial risk to the company
\xe2\x80\xa2 Research and analyze financial reports and market trends
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide insight full information and expectations to senior executives to aid in long-term and short-term decision making
\xe2\x80\xa2 Analyze financial performance against key business metrics and document pertinent financial highlights that will enable management to determine progress against budgets.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify, investigate, and analyze potential operational improvement. As appropriate, based on findings make proposal for operational changes (policy, procedures, processes, etc.)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Submit the proposed budget and assist the overall financial planning process
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain a strategic financial plan that will indicate the trends and requirements of the campus development plan and will forecast future year budgets
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify additional finance required to fund the campus\xe2\x80\x99s proposed activities
\xe2\x80\xa2 Present timely and fully costed proposals, recommendations or bids
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform all other duties as assigned and required. Account/Finance \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Finance, Audit, Accounting, business administration or related field (MBA preferred)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Overall 5-15 yrs experience. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 5+ years in Finance/Account management  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with Finance programs such as Quick Book is a plus
\xe2\x80\xa2 The successful candidate will be fully qualified (ACA/ACCA/CIMA/CIPFA) and likely to come from an Audit background."

b'Re -(Financial Reporting Officer) \xda\xa9\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xd9\x85\xd9\x86\xd8\xaf \xd8\xb1\xd8\xa7\xd9\xbe\xd9\x88\xd8\xb1\xd8\xaf\xd9\x87\xdb\x8c \xd9\x85\xd8\xa7\xd9\x84\xdb\x8c Job SummaryWorking under the Head of Finance this position is expected to be conversant with Accounting, IFRS, ERP and Afghan tax laws related with corporation and commercial enterprises. Acts as the primary support in all matters related to preparation of financial reports, ERP and taxation \xe2\x80\xa2 Gathering of Accounting and Financial data (Mainly General Journals) and its analysis (Verification with physical documents, BRS, Ensuring proper accounting, working on different heads of Balance Sheet, Preparing audit required schedules and breakups) rectification (doing adjustments and instructing the related party to avoid future similar mistakes) and compilation in to financial statements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that DABS complies with reporting requirements especially with respect to IFRS standards, timeliness and accuracy.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare estimated Financials for each year.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing responses to queries from government ministries and departments on submitted reports (including tax/revenue department of MOF).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supporting auditors whether internal or external in their audit process.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparation of different other financial and accounting MIS reports in coordination with other departments for top management.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Regular Control & Monitoring of the accounting environment (ensuring accurate accounting and accounting procedures, periodical or year-end activities) of DABS and his responsible units/areas.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Regular Control & Monitor of compliance of his responsible units/areas with article of incorporation of DABS, IFRS, DABS accounting and other policies, Tax laws and if any.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Close collaboration with banks & cash department regarding any BRS related issues.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be part of the team of implementation and successful operation of the DABS ERP.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide long run regular support in operation of the ERP to his responsible units/areas.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Gathering tax/revenue department of MOF required data in soft & hard.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring tax law rules and procedures are properly followed by all the units/areas of DABS.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fill the tax forms and Izharnama correctly, timely and submit it to tax/revenue department of MOF to avoid penalties and any other complication.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure timely tax clearance from tax/revenue department of MOF.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Tax planning and advising on avenues available for tax saving.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Implements financial controls and ensures accuracy of tax reporting.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Operates effective internal and external tax reporting.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist his Line manager and DABS management in all the daily activities or any specific job assigned apart from above. Account/Finance Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field (Any professional certification).
Two (2) to four (4) years of experience in related setting.'

b'Tax Manager Job SummaryTaxation specialists are the experts in providing commercially-focused tax advice and tax services to a wide range of clients who operate in all sectors of the economy. This involves devising tax-efficient strategies for multinational and domestic-based clients in diverse business situations, including mergers, takeovers and corporate reconstructions. Taxation specialist work continually to help ensure that their clients make the best business decisions in the light of fiscal change and development. They monitor and anticipate changes to tax legislation and respond quickly with advice specific to their clients\xe2\x80\x99 particular commercial requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Helping businesses and individuals to create strategies for dealing with tax and prepare for their future in the financial market
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advising and consulting with clients in order to provide advice about tax legislation, e.g. ensuring businesses and assets are properly structured to minimize the incidence of taxation
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review and analyze government apportionment/allocation information
\xe2\x80\xa2 Calculating tax liability, ensuring compliance is completed speedily and efficiently, and submitting tax returns and associated documents by the appropriate deadlines
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in responding to tax audit inquiries
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review base reporting data for property tax returns in order to minimize reportable cost basis
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring that tax withheld are deposited to Government within due time
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing monthly reports of taxes withheld (client\xe2\x80\x99s)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Filing relevant documents of taxes withheld and deposited to Government
\xe2\x80\xa2 Dealing with Ministry of Finance regarding any tax issue
\xe2\x80\xa2 Obtaining tax exemption certificates from appropriate department of MoF for the newly awarded projects
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keeping monthly record of individual staff\xe2\x80\x99s salaries and taxes withheld (client\xe2\x80\x99s)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing annual tax deduction certificates for individual staff members as Income tax of Afghanistan and ensuring that a copy of each certificate is submitted to Ministry of Finance within due time
\xe2\x80\xa2 Providing clients with relevant documents to be submitted to Ministry of Finance for obtaining annual clearance.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing and submitting to Ministry of Finance any other statement as may be announced by Income tax authorities from time to time
\xe2\x80\xa2 Dealing with any other tax issue that may arise
\xe2\x80\xa2 Undertaking duties and responsibilities as directed/requested by Managing Partner. Account/Finance \xe2\x80\xa2 Masters degree in Accounting, Business/Public Administration or related field preferred
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 5 years experience in Taxation 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent command of English and local languages (Dari and Pashto)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong interpersonal verbal and written communications skills, demonstrated professional disposition
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of Afghan taxation Law
\xe2\x80\xa2 Effective computer skills (MS Office suite).'

- Doing all accounts of the company

b'Cashier Job SummaryThe Cashier works under the overall guidance of the Finance Head with financial guidance from the IC and PMT Finance team of THRCP, The Cashier in general is responsible for the petty cash/operational advance management of THRCP Finance. \xe2\x80\xa2 Disburse cash on the basis of properly approved vouchers, advance sheets and other required documents. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Regular tracking and clearance of advances with Employees. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain the petty cash and operation advance imprest system on regular basis as per the approved FM manual.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct periodically cash count and ensure that cash is always reconciled with the cash book 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare and maintain the entire document of petty cash and operation advance based on project FM manual.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proper Filing of petty cash and operation advance documents
\xe2\x80\xa2 Record all PC and OA transactions into the journals and system as required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability of using computer and accountancy skills for the precise cash count and documentation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain the updated track of the advances issued and timely liquidation. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparation of proper documents for replenishment and clearance of advances.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain proper custody of the cash at safe.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be aware of having enough Cash in the safe.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Solving all their cash related queries
\xe2\x80\xa2 On time reporting of any discrepancies to immediate supervisor 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Making daily, weekly and monthly transaction reports of PC and OA.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Having knowledge of procurement and finance rules and regulations 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Have enough knowledge of Govt. Financial management system for managing Cash.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide guarantee letter/document to be as custodian of cash within project.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform any other finance relevant assigned by supervisor.
Monitoring and Progress Controls
\xe2\x80\xa2 Meeting with head of section and exchanging of information related to cash management with team.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keeping and tracking of record to the cash management/ petty cash ledger.   
\xe2\x80\xa2 Timely and accurate submission of petty cash count on a monthly basis.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Follow with project operation staff for early clearance of petty cash/ operational advance.
Final Product
\xe2\x80\xa2 Overall petty cash management of THRCP, from requisition to disbursement and reporting.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Account/Finance \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in accounting or finance, ACCA professional certification or equivalents completed or in progress.'

b'Finance & Admin Officer Job SummaryFinance & Admin Officer Finance Duties:
1. Responsible for and plans, organizes and manages the finance and administration process for the company.
2. Full knowledge and clearance of (BRT, Withholding, Salary, Rent and Income Tax).
3. Full knowledge and perform bank reconciliations weekly, monthly and yearly.
4. Prepare Payment, Receipt, Adjusting, Transfer & Withdrawal vouchers, obtain necessary verification, check, control and approvals and enter the vouchers in QuickBooks as per finance manual & IFRS Standards. 
5. Prepare monthly payroll.
6. Maintain good and reliable filling system of Finance & Admin functions.
7. Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual financial reports to management as per agreed formats.
8. Budgeting and budget controls.
Ensures that the finance process is in adherence to company and client requirements, company policies and procedures and company Regulations to ensure successful accomplishment of the requirements.
9. Plan and organize and liaise company need and purchases in close coordination & collaboration with Relative Supervisors.
10. Organize and manage office supplies, kitchen supplies for the company.
11. Ensuring that company expenditures are adequately tracked according to the agreed budget in close coordination with Relevant Supervisors.
12. Facilitate timely, accurate month-end closing, cash requests and cash reconciliations.
13. Receiving complete documents, invoices, bills, etc.\xe2\x80\xa6 insuring the proper name, date, stamp and supportive documents.
14. Prepare weekly, monthly plan and monthly financial progress report to the Relevant Supervisors.
15. Forecast costs and revenues.
16. Monitor and report on accounting discrepancies.
17. Preparing in a timely manner accurate financial reports as required by the Relevant supervisors.
18. Perform month-end and year-end close processes.
19. Perform any other Finance related tasks assigned by supervisor.
Admin Duties:
1. Maintain and manage fixed assets, stationery and inventory registers for company.
2. Arrange field visits by purchasing air ticket, hotel accommodation and transportation for staff.
3. Support and supervise guards, cook/cleaner and drivers to make sure the assigned tasks has been accomplished on time.
4. Supervise in Maintaining of Attendance, registers, log books and etc.
5. Perform any other Admin related tasks assigned by the supervisor Account/Finance 1. At Least Bachelor degree in Finance, Business Administration or Economics (Specialization in Finance) will be given the priority
2. At least over 2-3 Years progressive practical experience in the field relevant field.'

b"Deputy Finance Manager Job SummaryTo lead, supervise and develop the accounts/finance team to handle day to day financial accounting tasks including book keeping, preparation of periodic financial statements, management reporting, dealing with taxation matters and ensuring strict adherence to the company policies. - Lead, supervise and develop accounts and finance team.
- Maintaining books of accounts and ensure proper day closing.
- Understand multiple accounting systems/interfaces and can investigate related issues.
- Ensure timely preparation & submission of all tax payments and statement/returns in accordance with prevailing tax laws.
- Ensure timely preparation & submission of quarterly and annual financial statements in accordance with IFRS.
- Manage smooth conduct of all assignments assigned to accounts/finance team.
- Conduct effective & regular meetings to review performance & provide feedback
- Ensure timely preparation & submission of daily, weekly and monthly defined reports for management.
- Ensure strict compliance to the company financial and general policies within accounts department.
- Any other assignment as & when required.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Account/Finance - Master's degree in accounting or finance field, ACCA, CPA.
- 3+ years related experience.
- Private sector experience a plus
- Proven ability to work under stress and considerable pressure.
- Proven ability to work and to operate as part of a team."

b'Finance Associate (SB3/3)-Rule of Law Unit Job Summarynder the guidance and supervision of the Finance Analyst, the Finance Associate ensures effective execution of financial and Administrative support services in FFFMU and ensure proper and transparent utilization of financial resources. The Finance Associate promotes a client-oriented approach consistent with UNDP rules and regulations.
The Finance Associate provides critical financial and administrative support in the FFFMU Finance Team. The Finance Associate works in close collaboration with the project personnel, operations, and programme staff in the Country Office for resolving finance-related issues and information exchange. 1.Ensures Administration and implementation of operational strategies, adapts processes and procedures focusing on achievement of the following results;
Full compliance with UN/UNDP rules and regulations of financial processes, financial records and reports and audit follow up; implementation of the effective internal control framework.
Follow up on contributions with PSU within the Country Office resource mobilization efforts
2.Ensures administration of project budget and cost recovery focusing on achievement of the following resul;
Preparation and modifications of project budget
Presentation of researched information for planning and status of project financial resources.
Entering project budgets in Atlas for budget revision based on approved project Annual Work Plan and/or signed Project Document
3.Provides Administrative and Accounting support services to the FFFMU Finance Team focusing on achievement of the following results:
Proper control of the supporting documents for payments as per the Payment Check List; preparation of all types of vouchers and GLJEs;
Preparation of PO and non-PO vouchers for the project in Atlas;
Support country office global payrolls processing in Atlas by reviewing chartfields for positions based on approved project AWP and analyzing GP expenditure transactions on a monthly regular basis;
Maintenance of the internal expenditures control system which ensures that vouchers processed are matched and completed, transactions are correctly recorded and posted in Atlas; payrolls are duly prepared and processed; travel claims, and other entitlements are duly processed
Timely project accounts closure
Timely corrective actions on unposted vouchers, including the vouchers with budget check errors, match exceptions, unapproved vouchers. Timely response to Country Office requests to resolve financial data issues.
Maintenance of the Accounts Receivables for the project and follow-up with PSU in Country Office on contributions, deposits creation in Atlas and their application to AR pending items.
4.Ensures proper Project cash management functioning focusing on achievement of the following results:
Alternate to Finance Analyst for timely review and preparation of cashflow forecasts of the project to ensure sufficient funds on hand for disbursements. Timely identification and recording of receipts for income application.
Competencies
Knowledge Management
Ability to capture, develop, share and effectively use information and knowledge
Operational Efficiency
Ability to identify and execute opportunities to improve operational efficiency
Relationship Management
Ability to engage and foster strategic partnerships with other parties, Inter-Agency Coordination and forge productive working relationships
Required Skills and Experience Account/Finance Education:
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in business administration or Public administration with specialized certification in Accounting and Finance is required.
Experience:
With bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s 5 years of progressively responsible finance experience is required at the national or international level.
Experience in the usage of computers and office software packages (MS Word, Excel, etc) and advance knowledge of spreadsheet and database packages, experience in handling of web-based management systems is required.
Language:
Fluency in English is required.
Fluency in Pashto or Dari is required. 
Other:
Accounting Finance Test (AFT) is a requirement of this post.'

b'Finance Officer (SB4/1)- Rule of Law Unit Job SummaryUnder the guidance and direct supervision of the Finance Specialist, the Finance Officer provides leadership in execution of financial services in the Country Office (CO) ensuring effective and transparent utilization of financial resources and integrity of financial services. The Finance Officer promotes a client-oriented approach consistent with UNDP rules and regulations.
The Finance Officer supervises and leads the support staff of the Finance Unit. The Finance Officer works in close collaboration with the operations, programme and project teams in the CO and UNDP HQs staff to resolve complex financial management and operational-related issues and information delivery. 1.Ensures administration and implementation of operational strategies, adapts processes and procedures focusing on achievement of the following results:
Full compliance with UN/UNDP rules, regulations, and policies of financial activities, financial recording/reporting system, preparation for and follow-up on audit recommendations related to financial matters; implementation of effective internal controls, proper functioning of a client-oriented financial resources management system.
CO Finance business processes mapping and elaboration of the content of Standard Operating Procedures in Finance in consultation with office management.
Continuous analysis and monitoring of the financial situation at programme and project levels, and preparation of monthly and ad hoc finance reports for all projects highlighting discrepancies, contributions, and delivery against targets.
Manage donor agreements and ensure implementation in line with agreements including tranche requests, monitoring compliance with any earmarked funding and funding end dates, and donor fiscal years for funding utilization.
Routinely monitors financial exception reports for unusual activities, transactions, and investigates anomalies.
Supports preparations for and contributes to NIM/DIM audits as well as implementation of recommendations and management responses. 
2.  Ensures administration of budgets and functioning of the optimal cost-recovery system focusing on achievement of the following results:
Preparation and modifications of budgets for UNDP projects, follow up with HQs on authorized spending limits (ASL) for development projects.
Implementation of the control mechanism for development projects through monitoring budgets preparation and modifications, budgetary status versus ASL, follow up with HQs on ASL for development projects, maintenance of the General Ledger.
Development, implementation and follow up on Programme Portfolio Pipeline and Project Tree in Atlas.
Programme financial resources management through planning, guiding, controlling the use of resources.
Implementation of effective internal controls, proper functioning of a client-oriented financial resources management system. Identification of operational and financial problems, proposal of solutions.
Analysis of requirements and synthesis of proposals on proper mechanisms to eliminate deficiencies in budget management
Provision of advice on reporting, preparation of reports including donor reports including preparation of all financial reports for reporting to be cleared by Chief of Finance or Finance Specialist.
Presentation of thoroughly researched information for planning of financial resources of projects, reports containing analysis of the financial situation.
Timely preparation of cost-recovery bills in Atlas for the services provided by, elaboration and implementation of the income tracking system and follow up on cost recovery.
3.   Provides accounting and administrative support to the Finance Unit focusing on achievement of the following results:
Proper control of the supporting documents for payments, review of financial reports for NEX projects.
Maintenance of the internal expenditures control system which ensures that vouchers processed are matched and completed, transactions are correctly recorded and posted in Atlas; payrolls are duly prepared; travel claims, MPOs and other entitlements are duly processed.
Coordination and review of accounts closure
Timely corrective actions on unposted vouchers, including the vouchers with budget check errors, match exceptions, unapproved vouchers. Timely response to HQ requests to resolve financial data issues.
Maintenance of the Accounts Receivables for UNDP projects and follow up with partners on contributions.
Proper receipting of goods and services and establishment of accruals.
4.   Ensures facilitation of knowledge building and knowledge sharing in the CO focusing on achievement of the following results:
Organization of training for the operations/programme/projects staff on financial management.
Synthesis of lessons learnt and best practices in financial management.
Sound contributions to knowledge networks and communities of practice.
Competencies
Team building
Ability to work effectively with diverse groups of professionals towards common goals
Learning and Development
Knowledge of enterprise learning and development issues, concepts, and principles, and ability to apply them to enhance the fulfillment and performance of employees
Knowledge Management
Ability to capture, develop, share and effectively use information and knowledge
Result-based Management
Ability to manage programmes and projects with a strategy aimed at improved performance and demonstrable results
Design Thinking
Knowledge of method (s) for practical, creative resolution of problems and creation of solutions, with the intent of an improved future result.
Internal Reporting and Accountability
Ability to create internal reporting and accountability processes and standards
Required Skills and Experience Account/Finance Education:
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Business or Public administration, with specialized certification in Accounting and Finance is a requirement.
Part-qualified accountants from an internationally recognized institute of accountancy will have a distinct advantage.
Experience:
5 years of progressively responsible finance and accounting experience is required with a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s is required.
Experience in the usage of computers and office software packages (MS Word, Excel, etc) and advance knowledge of spreadsheet and database packages, experience in handling of web-based management systems and ERP financials, preferably PeopleSoft.
Knowledge of IPSAS and/or IFRS required.
Language:
Fluency in English is required.
Fluency in Pashto or Dari is required.
Other:
Advance Accounting Finance Test (AAFT) is a requirement.'

b'Power Supervisor Job SummaryWe are looking for an experienced Power Supervisor to provide guidance regarding the installation, maintenance and repair of electrical systems.
Power supervisors are experienced electricians who lead, motivate, monitor and oversee a team of electricians to ensure they produce quality work. \xe2\x80\xa2 Making schedules, assigning work and training employees
\xe2\x80\xa2 Motivate electricians to increase their productivity and meet work goals
\xe2\x80\xa2  ensure the proper maintenance of equipment, compliance with electrical codes and adherence to safety regulations
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with electrical system installation, troubleshooting and repair as needed
\xe2\x80\xa2 Purchase supplies, ensure adequate inventory, coordinate with power director for planning budgets, prioritize purchases, prepare cost estimates and document their purchases
\xe2\x80\xa2 Cooperates with representatives of other organizations in solving interrelated administrative, organizational, and electrical problems
\xe2\x80\xa2 Delegates functional activities to workers and establishes supervisory schedules and responsibilities to ensure quality. Reviews and approves material requisitions and work authorization
\xe2\x80\xa2 Reviews and approves drawings for facilities
\xe2\x80\xa2 Schedules operation and maintenance work programs and periodically inspects work activities to ensure compliance with company and government regulations
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares monthly operating report
\xe2\x80\xa2 Any other duty assigned by department manager Electrical Engineering \xe2\x80\xa2 Associate\xe2\x80\x99s bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in an electrical or engineering field
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 3+years of experience is necessary along with leadership and troubleshooting skills'

b'Electrical Engineer \xe2\x80\x93 Officer Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparation of superior quality electrical construction documents including drawings, specifications, and reports for buildings in retail, restaurant, office, multifamily residential, and institutional market sectors
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design power, lighting, fire alarm, and telecommunications plans including all associated circuitry, details, one line diagrams, and specifications
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform photometric calculations, load calculations, fault current, and any other calculations required to support electrical design
\xe2\x80\xa2 Review electrical documents for areas of conflict with all building electrical systems
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with equipment vendors and manufacturers\xe2\x80\x99 representatives for selection and specification of appropriate equipment
\xe2\x80\xa2 Play an active role in project meetings with clients and colleagues
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide mentoring and guidance for colleagues
\xe2\x80\xa2 To market and promote services offered by Fundy Engineering in the field of Electrical Engineering.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To attain copies of \xe2\x80\x9cRequest for Proposals\xe2\x80\x9d and prepare documentation and Fee Estimates for these proposal call-ups.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To establish the needs of the client and to coordinate with other disciplines and office personnel to ensure that these requirements are met.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To assist and mentor support staff in the fundamentals of Electrical design, calculations and preparation of construction documentation
\xe2\x80\xa2 To provide technical assistance and respond to contractor\xe2\x80\x99s inquiries that relate to electrical part of construction projects.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To prepare technical reports, construction cost estimates and cost analysis.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To coordinate and schedule / plan the projects with support staff to ensure timely completion.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To respect company values and policies.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare material cost and timing estimates, reports, and design specifications for electrical building systems and equipment.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Inspect the installation, modification, testing, and operation of electrical equipment
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare contract documents and evaluate tenders for construction or maintenance.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supervise technicians, technologists, programmers, analysts, and other engineers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Checks cable laying and cable identification. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Checks power transformers, switchboard, accumulator battery, sockets outlet, lighting system. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Performs visual inspections, dimensional test, checks rating and material for connection.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Performs tests of continuity, insulation resistance. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Performs test communication functionalities. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Verify special processes and the relevant workers\xe2\x80\x99 qualifications. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Witness the tests, controls and inspections carried out. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Check conformity with the Quality Control Plan, obtain the relevant documentation, check procedures and equipment to be used in tests, controls and inspections, manage documents certifying tests, controls and inspections. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure the correct implementation of the approved Inspection Test Plan. Electrical Engineering \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree in Electrical Engineering with 5 years of related experience in handling USACE projects or overall experience of not less than 8 years in the field of construction management and supervision. Prior international donors experience is preferred.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge and ability to interpret engineering drawings and implement the field works.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Sufficient knowledge of USACE rules, regulations, and procedures desired.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in English. Have good command of English language both written and spoken. Candidates who do not have sufficient English language knowledge will be disqualified.'

b'Senior Grant Consultant (HSS program) Job Summary1. To improve access and increase the coverage of immunization and other essential health services particularly for the underserved population 
2. To improve quality, effectiveness and utilization of health care and immunization services. 
3. To improve the ability of MOPH to fulfil its stewardship responsibilities at all levels with a more focus on peripheral level
As per the approved proposal under the HSS3 grant a number of key activities/ interventions are being implemented by the MoPH through GCMU. The Senior Grant Consultant based in GCMU will be part of the team responsible for procurement of consultancy services and managing contracts for the assigned portfolios 1. Undertaking the procurement of consultancy services of the HSS program activities referred to GCMU
2. Ensure NGO partner contract/grant compliance and project implementation in accordance with the terms and conditions of the contract/grant. 
3. Preparing announcement, RFPs (bid documents) and technical assistance in the process of short listing, proposals evaluation, cost analysis, negotiation, contract preparation and award grants as per selection methods. 
4. Review the proposals in light of the Afghan procurement law and rules of procedures, MoPH policies, donor requirements, applicable regulations and technical guidelines.
5. Review reports of expression of interest\xe2\x80\x99 short listings, proposals evaluation, technical and financial negotiations under the applicable laws and regulations. 
6. Technical support to HSS unit in developing the terms of reference for the consultancy service projects and other relevant activities under HSS Program.
7. Review the technical reports of PHP contractors and provide constructive and timely feedback.
8. Establish appropriate monitoring and supervision and reporting system between GCMU, M&E and PHP contractors and relevant stakeholders.
9. Preparing any required contract modifications and obtaining any required approvals before their issue;
10. Coordination and interaction with the related stakeholders like; line ministries, MoPH departments at the central and provincial level, governmental authorities and community representatives.
11. Technical review the out puts and outcomes as per the milestone of the activities in line with MOPH/ HSS concept and TOR, as required. 
12. Produce annual and ad-hoc reports of the grants, as required.
13. Keep proper record of correspondence and documents related to PHP contract management.
14. Any other related tasks to be assigned by line manager and head of unit relevant to his/her qualification and expertise agreed up on. Health/Medical 1. To be a MD Doctor or equivalent from a recognized institution or/and MPH preferable
2. With at least 7 year experience of work with NGOs, UN agencies or Government institutions in Public Health. Including 2 years of experience in the relevant field of project management including technical reports preparation and reviews of the narrative reports. Or five years of experience with a Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in public health or equivalent. 
3. Good knowledge and experience in health management and administration.
4. Knowledge and experiences of procurement for consultancy services is preferable. 
5. Good communication skills to work and deal with MoPH NGOs UN agencies and other related people. Having the report writing skills and experience to write comments and review of narrative reports.
6. To be able to develop, revise and comment the health project budget.
7. Have an excellent knowledge of English (written, speaking, and understanding)
8. Have a good computer knowledge MS word, excel, power point.
9. Willingness to travel to targeted provinces and districts.'

b'National Grant and Contracts Coordinator (HSS-Program) Job SummaryThe incumbent will provide full time support for the implementation and establishment of a replicable model of partnership with private service providers to provide access to immunization and basic reproductive health (RH) services in the targeted provinces. The primary purpose of the recruitment of a national consultant is to assist GCMU in successful implementation PHP project  including: preparing the contract, awarding grants, reviewing quarterly reports and deliverables, ensuring grantee payments; monitoring, reporting and evaluation of results, monitoring the progress against the plans, tracking expanses against budgets and generating required reports. 1) Manage and oversee NGO partner contract/grant compliance and project implementation in accordance with the terms and conditions of the contract/grant. Responsible for contract management and contract modifications of PHP contracts. 
2) Assist in developing or adapting formats, procedures, and regulations to be used for contract and grant management according to Afghan\xe2\x80\x99s Procurement Law, MOPH and donor requirements and regulations.
3) Contribute actively in developing the ToR and other related required documents for the RFP for the new HSS projects.
4) Coordination and interaction with the related stakeholders such as NGO partners, MoPH departments at the central and provincial level, governmental authorities and community representatives.
5) Review the proposals in light of the GOIRA procurement rules, MoPH policies, regulation and technical guidelines.
6) Ensure that the contracting NGOs implementing PHP contracts submit all the required project documents including the technical reports on timely basis aligned with the contracts.
7) Review the technical reports of PHP contractors and provide constructive and timely feedback.
8) Establish appropriate monitoring and supervision and reporting system between GCMU, M&E and PHP contractors and relevant stakeholders.
9) Monitor the contractors activities to make sure the performance is in compliance with the contract requirements including analyzing the quarterly data and reporting using routine information sources (quarterly reports, HMIS, monitoring visit reports, etc.) and ad-hoc information, and ensure that action plans and corrective actions are taken in a timely manner to achieve desired performance outcomes.
10) Collaborate with development budget department to assist in timely payments and monitoring /reporting the financial performance.
11) Keep proper record of correspondence and documents related to PHP contract management.
12) Produce monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc report of the PHP contracts, as required.
13) Any other tasks to be given by line manager relevant to his qualification and expertise Health/Medical F. EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:
1) To be a MD or equivalent from a recognized university with at least 7 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience of working with NGOs, UN agencies or government of Afghanistan; or Masters in Public Health with at least 5 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience of working with NGOs, UN agencies or government of Afghanistan for health project management and coordination. 
2) Knowledge and experiences of procurement for consultancy services is preferable. 
3) To be able to develop, comment and review health project budgets.
4) Have an excellent knowledge of English (writing, speaking, and understanding), fluency in national languages
5) Willingness to travel to targeted provinces and districts, 15-25% of his/her time.'

b'(Re-announce)Senior Electrical Engineer, Distribution Job SummaryDABS World Bank PIU intends to hire a Senior Electrical Distribution Network Engineer to support the implementation work of NHRP particularly survey, design, and estimation of electrical distribution networks which shall be funded under NHRP grant. The following tasks to be undertaken by the Senior Electrical Distribution Network Engineer:
These duties shall comprise (but not necessarily be limited to) the following:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Survey of areas which are supposed to be electrified under NHRP grant in close coordination with DABS\xe2\x80\x99 technical survey and engineering team,
\xe2\x80\xa2 prepare engineering designs, technical specification, BoQs and cost estimations of electrical distribution networks, including poles, conductors, insulators, ground wires, etc. in accordance with relevant technical standards,
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing drawings and sketches of the villages to be electrified using GPS or any other possible alternative.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing SLD of distribution networks.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Quantity and Cost estimation of all drawings and equipment needed for electrification of villages. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate with project manager, site engineers and other experts on project
implementation schedule and contract management arrangements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare detailed project implementation schedules showing anticipated progress of works and expenditures 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proper reporting system to PM of NHRP Project at DABS HQ.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Any other assignment instructed by Project Director and Project Manager. Electrical Engineering The candidates must have the following qualifications:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Must have a degree in Electrical engineering with 5 years of related Experience, Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree is a privilege. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work experience in survey, design, estimation and implementation of MV and LV distribution networks is highly required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Candidates who are familiar with Tagab environment and be able to survey at any location in Tagab villages shall be preferred.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Competent in reading and understanding Specifications, drawings, and reviewing of design and all other disciplines related to project and engineering documentation.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work experience with International donors such as World Bank, USAID, and ADB is preferred. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Good English language skills are required.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Good computer skills (Ms. Office, Technical Engineering Software\xe2\x80\x99s,  AutoCAD, and some other necessary software\xe2\x80\x99s Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project).'

b'General Surgery Specialist for Emergency Care Unit Job SummaryResponsibilities of Emergency Care Unit General Surgery  Specialist includes but not limited to regular check-up of admitted patients and completion of its history, physical examination, laboratory investigation management and treatment, participation in in-service training and training of new employees and trainees. 1. History taking and completion of related documentations for admitted patients.
2. Perform complete physical examination of patients as per their need.
3. Advice, completion and accurate interpretation of laboratory and radiology exams according to patient\xe2\x80\x99 needs and relevant guidelines and forms.
4. Conduct regular patient visit as needed and instructed by Emergency Care Unit In-charge.   
5. Make accurate diagnosis of patient\xe2\x80\x99s illnesses in consideration to history, physical exam and laboratory exam findings.
6. Advice and manage treatment of admitted patients as per diagnosis and patient\xe2\x80\x99s needs.
7. Ensure that the Emergency Care procedures are applied for patients. 
8. Counseling, managing and follow up of critically ill patients according to patient health status.
9. Assist in data collection according to data collection method and tools.
10. Participate actively in the training of new employees and trainees.
11. Follow up of specific standards, protocols, procedures, rules in regulations during daily works.
12. Built his/her self own capacity and participate in training session assigned for.
13. Provide preventive and primitive counseling in emergency Unit to the patients and clients 
14. Attend Night shift duty when assigned. 
15. Participate actively in the infection prevention of Emergency Unit and hospital.
16.  Perform other related tasks assigned by supervisor.
17. Reporting to Emergency Care Unit In-charge.
18. Reporting to Emergency Care Unit In-charge Health/Medical 1. Medical Degree attested by MoHE
2. Specialization degree in general Surgery attested by MoPH or MoHE.
3. Strong communication skill. 
4. Good interaction and pleasant behavior with patients, clients and colleagues.
5. Very good knowledge of Pashto, Dari and English Language (written and spoken).
6. Basic computer (Ms. Office) skills.'

b'District Health Promotion (Community Dialogue) Assistant Job SummaryThe District Health Promotion (Community Dialogue) Assistant (DHPA) will be an FHI 360 employee working and placed at the HEMAYAT Provincial Office based in focused districts of Kandahar (Panjwayee and Daman). The District Health Promotion (Community Dialogue) Assistant will be, responsible for facilitating implementation and monitoring of community dialogue plus (CD+) activity within the donor-approved work plan. S/he will report directly to the provincial CBHC Officer and the CD+ Focal Point in Demand Generation Team at Kabul. 1. Participate in TOT of Community Dialogue Plus (CD+) in the center of the respective province 
2. Adapt/ Adopt training Package of CD+ according to the context of the designated districts.  
3. Assist HEMAYAT Provincial CBHC Officer in selection of the villages for the implementation of CD+.  
4. Actively participate and implement together with Trainer and CBHC Officer in the first village and then implement in the other villages individually.  
5. Facilitate dialogue sessions in the selected villages to identify main barriers to RMNCH services and find out the root causes of the problems.  
6. Facilitate the dialogue in the selected villages to design local solutions and develop action plan to implement the solutions.  
7. Actively follow up with CD+ committee to ensure implementation of CD+ Action plan and track and review change in the indicators and report of the of the CD+ sessions. 
8. Assist Provincial CBHC Officer in orientation of district and health facility staff and heads of selected villages. 
9. Facilitate monthly and quarterly review meetings and update provincial and central team from the progress.  
10. Assist provincial team to select villages and teams to be recognized on the day of celebration. 
11. Any other health promotion and community based health activities assigned from the provincial CBHC and or central DG team. Health/Medical 1. Graduated from recognized high school. 
2. One-year experience of work with community. 
3. Experience with health surveys and campaign.  
4. More active and enthusiastic to work in community.  
5. Willingness and ability to travel to targeted areas.'

b'Manager, Cancer Center Job SummaryUnder the direct supervision of National Cancer Control Program coordinator, the Cancer Center Manager is responsible for planning, organizing, directing and controlling all resource departments and services of the Cancer Center, including personnel, financial, facilities, equipment and supplies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Managing clerical, administrative, clinical, and professional staff
\xe2\x80\xa2 Managing the recruitment, selection, appraisal and development of staff
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supervising the day-to-day management of the Cancer Department/Center
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assessing the clinical and non-clinical competence of staff as part of a person centered approach
\xe2\x80\xa2 Introducing on-going learning strategies into services, including tutorials, instructional sessions, and supervised practice sessions, regarding the use of medical/care equipment or best clinical care skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing and implementing effective policies, guidelines for all operational procedures
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring, evaluating, and correcting staff performance relating to care/clinical practice and assist the head of units in raising the standards of practice
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaising and negotiating with medical and non-medical staff internally and with people in external organisations, e.g. social services, voluntary groups or the private sector
\xe2\x80\xa2 Gathering and analysing data and using it to plan and manage both projects and systems
\xe2\x80\xa2 Working towards ensuring quality and value for patients
\xe2\x80\xa2 Resolving potential issues with patients
\xe2\x80\xa2 Extrapolating data for quality assurance and monitoring purposes
\xe2\x80\xa2 Setting budgets and maintaining finances within tight constraints
\xe2\x80\xa2 Planning and implementing strategic changes to improve service delivery
\xe2\x80\xa2 Attending meetings, writing reports and delivering presentations to a variety of audiences; clinical governance and audit
\xe2\x80\xa2 Setting up various committees and working groups 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinating daily staffing to ensure that all units are covered. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Handling communications and corporate affairs
\xe2\x80\xa2 Managing premises, catering, cleaning, portering and security 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring prompt ordering and stocking of medical and office supplies
\xe2\x80\xa2 Using computers to manage information and financial data and to analyse and measure performance
\xe2\x80\xa2 Providing training to new employees
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supporting ICT systems and planning new provision and development, sometimes for major projects.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Performing other duties and responsibilities relevant to the position as assigned by the program director Health/Medical \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelors in medicine, public health or other health sciences 
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least three years of managerial experience in a health facility'

b'National Technical Officer (HF and HIS) Job SummaryThe incumbent will support HSD unit in undertaking research, assist MoPH and in building
the capacity of health workers aimed at increasing the efficiency, effectiveness and quality of the
Health Financing Department and HIS to participate in joint field visits with related departments of MoPH to monitor program delivery. Under the Programme Manager, HSS and overall guidance of WHO Representative the incumbent will
provide technical support to MoPH (Health System Strengthening Department), Evaluation and Health
Information Directorate, and Medical Council. The incumbent will primarily focused on operational research
and Health Financing and HIS.
*Summary of Assigned Duties
(Describe what the incumbent has to do to achieve main objectives; include main achievements expected)
1. Assist WHO HSD team in provision of technical guidance to MoPH on the formulation and implementation of policies, legislation, strategies, norms, standards aiming to achieve Universal Health Coverage (UHC)
2. Provide support to the implementation of health financing strategy
3. Collaborate with MoPH Health Economics and Finance Directorate on sustainable financing for health and support the preparation of national health accounts
4. Assist in increasing domestic and external resource mobilization for health 
5. Represent WHO in various technical committees related to health system 
6. Support the implementation of WHO biannual plan 
7. Contribute to WHO program planning and reviews 
8. Support Health Information System, contribute to various research/assessment related to health system and promote evidence-based decision making
9. Provide technical guidance on the implementation of national civil registration and vital statistics (CRVS) strategy
10. Perform any other relevant duties assigned by HSD program manager/WRTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Health/Medical Education Qualifications
*Essential: An advanced university degree in medicines or bachelor degree in public health and
Master of Public Health  from an accredited/recognized institute
Experience
*Essential: At least 3 years of experience of working in health sector (government, NGOs, UN) 
Desirable
Working experience with WHO/ and other UN agencies working for health 
4. Use of Language Skills
Languages
English 
Read:  Expert knowledge     [Yes] Required
Write:  Expert knowledge
Speak:  Expert knowledge
Local language: working knowledge of Pashto and Dari 
Other Skills (e.g. IT)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
Note: Contract Type (Local Individual Contractor Agreement (LICA))
Criteria:
Screening of the candidates;
Long List - The candidates shall be longlisted base on the minimum qualifications and relevant experience to the Vacancy Notice (VN).
Short List - Further shortlist shall be done base on years of relevant experience, higher education and required skills.
Assessment method:
WHO may conduct written/presentation and interview or combination of the mentioned mediums to select the most qualified candidate.
WHO is an equal opportunity employer and quali\xef\xac\x81ed women are particularly encouraged to apply and equally quali\xef\xac\x81ed female candidate will be given preference.'

b'Training and Capacity Building of Female Nurses to Enter into Labor Market Job SummaryTraining Summary\nFemale Nurses who are graduated recently and don\xe2\x80\x99t have the required professional skills. This training is a subset of nursing skill training which contains theoretical and practical instructions applied for 10 weeks, 5 days in each week and 4 hours in each day. Standard Curriculum for the training is developed under the supervision of international advisors and Qualified Lecturers. The Training will be held  at Moraa Educational Complex located in Afshar behind Red Crescent Main Office with the cooperation of USAID | Promote \xe2\x80\x93 Women in the Economy for 60 female nurses who are graduated recently and don\xe2\x80\x99t have the required professional skills. The goal for this program is to fill the gap that what nurses achieve in university education life and what skills they need in a real workplace environment. This program will make 60 female nurses able to find a good experience that is necessary for their employment. This training will enable the trainees to find the experience and empowerment for further development through a valid certificate considered by USAID and the Moraa Educational Complex after completion of the course.  Most of the cost will be covered by WIE/MEC and the trainees who successfully passed the interview have to pay 3,400 AFA at the beginning of the course.  Health/Medical '

b'National Technical Officer (HRH, BPHS and EPHS) Job SummaryThe incumbent will support HSD unit in undertaking research, assist MoPH and Medical Council in building
the capacity of health workers aimed at increasing the efficiency, effectiveness and quality of the
workforce and participate in joint field visits with related departments of MoPH to monitor program
delivery. Under the Programme Manager, HSS and overall guidance of WHO Representative the incumbent will
provide technical support to MoPH (Health System Strengthening Department), Evaluation and Health
Information Directorate, and Medical Council. The incumbent will primarily focused on operational research
and human resource development.
*Summary of Assigned Duties
(Describe what the incumbent has to do to achieve main objectives; include main achievements expected)
1. Guide MoPH in planning and building capacity of Human Resources for Health aimed at increasing efficiency, effectiveness and quality of health workforce (including addressing gender inequalities)
2. Assist the Afghanistan Medical Council for institutionalizing medical accreditation and certification system
3. Support MoPH in the implementation of Basic Package of Health Services (BPHS) and Essential Package of Hospital Services (EPHS), quality assurance and patient safety initiatives 
4. Act as WHO focal point for general directorate of curative medicines and support the implementation of hospital sector strategy 
5. Assist WHO team in the implementation of GAVI and GFATM HSS support 
6. Contribute to the planning and technical support activities of the WHO\xe2\x80\x99s HSD unit, and be involved in the preparation of work plans as part of the biennial planning and monitor their implementation
7. Promote community based initiatives in support of UHC
8. Represent WHO in various technical committees related to health system 
9. Perform any other relevant duties assigned by HSD program manager/WR Health/Medical Education Qualifications
*Essential: An advanced university degree in medicines or bachelor degree in public health and
Master of Public Health  from an accredited/recognized institute
Experience
*Essential: At least 3 years of experience of working in health sector (government, NGOs, UN) 
Desirable
Working experience with WHO/ and other UN agencies working for health 
4. Use of Language Skills
Languages
English 
Read:  Expert knowledge     [Yes] Required
Write:  Expert knowledge
Speak:  Expert knowledge
Local language: working knowledge of Pashto and Dari 
Other Skills (e.g. IT)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
Note: Type of contract (Local Individual Contractor Agreement (LICA)
Criteria 
Screening of the candidates;
Long List - The candidates shall be longlisted base on the minimum qualifications and relevant experience to the Vacancy Notice (VN).
Short List - Further shortlist shall be done base on years of relevant experience, higher education and required skills.
Assessment method:
WHO may conduct written/presentation and interview or combination of the mentioned mediums to select the most qualified candidate.
WHO is an equal opportunity employer and quali\xef\xac\x81ed women are particularly encouraged to apply and equally quali\xef\xac\x81ed female candidate will be given preference.'

b'Radiographer Job SummaryTo obtain radiography films of various positions of the patient as requested by referring physicians, ensuring safety procedures for themselves, patients and equipment, and performing related duties as advised by supervisor The ideal candidate would be able to:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keeping X-Ray equipment at proper distance and angle from the patient to obtain clear and undisturbed view
\xe2\x80\xa2 Proper film and cassette handling (type, analogue & digital) as per standard procedure 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform especial X-Ray procedures / CT / MRI / Mammography procedure as requested by referring clinicians, also observing safety of procedures 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Properly log performed procedures 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Determine proper voltage, current and desired exposure time for each Radiograph 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Adjust contrast of the films in computer to make it read for print and check quality as required 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Repeat exposure procedure from different angles as requested by the physician 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Schedule patients for X-Ray procedures if required 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain equipment by cleaning, making minor adjustments and report to supervisor in case of any fault or breakdown 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in training of new Technicians 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform portable X-Rays of in patients unable to come to radiology department, as assigned 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform duties in shifts
\xe2\x80\xa2 Any other related task assigned by supervisor
\xe2\x80\xa2 Change the radiation dose monitoring device on monthly basis or as advised by radiation protection committee Health/Medical \xe2\x80\xa2 Graduated from 12th Class is preferred 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Diploma of the Radiologic Technology Course from a recognized institute (3years)'

b'Psychosocial Officer Job SummaryObjective 1: Participate in implementing psychosocial care practice integrated with nutrition and health intervention implemented for in patient and out patient centres for malnutrition
Objective 2: Formal training and on the job support implemented for health facility staff and family health action groups 
Objective 3: Support hygiene promotion implementation plan Objective 1: Participate in implementing psychosocial care practice integrated with nutrition and health intervention implemented for in patient and out patient centres for malnutrition:
\xef\x82\xa7 Support the identification of psychosocial care needs of  the mothers and care takers in the inpatient and outpatient health facilities 
\xef\x82\xa7 Improve child stimulation and facilitate mother and child interactions, attachments and relationships 
\xef\x82\xa7 Participate in data collection for real time evaluations of program implementation 
\xef\x82\xa7 Work closely with the health and nutrition staff 
\xef\x82\xa7 Organize and direct sessions on breast-feeding practices or on child development 
Objective 2: Formal training and on the job support implemented for health facility staff and family health action groups 
\xef\x82\xa7 Assess the capacity or potential of psychosocial services within targeted health facilities, and contribute to improving  these psychosocial services in the health facilities with formal on site training regarding care practises including diffusion of Infant and Young Children Feeding messages 
\xef\x82\xa7 Creation of child and mother friendly spaces within mobile clinics and health facilities;
Objective 3: Support hygiene promotion implementation plan  
\xef\x82\xa7 Participate in the development of training manuals, actively creating opportunities for participation of community key focal points 
\xef\x82\xa7 Participate in the successful promotion of hygiene promotion trainings and the development of information, education and communication materials for men and women Health/Medical Background/qualifications 
 - Minimum of diploma in psychosocial services or psychology or related field from reputed university and/or
- Strong prior experience in and/or familiarity with mental health, care practises and psychosocial support in emergency'

b'Programme Associate (Nutrition) Job SummaryAfghanistan experiences high rates of undernutrition. While significant progress has been made in the past 15 years, the prevalence of stunting in children under 5 years is almost 41 percent at the national level which is classified as very high according to World Health Organization (WHO) thresholds. The situation is even more serious at the provincial level, with stunting prevalence of 60\xe2\x80\x9370 percent in some provinces. The prevalence of wasting among children under 5 years is 9.5 percent but this national rate masks large differences at disaggregated levels. In eight provinces, global acute malnutrition rates exceed 15 percent, the WHO threshold for an emergency situation. Children under 5 years, especially boys, are particularly vulnerable to undernutrition, as are adolescent girls and pregnant and lactating women and girls (PLWG).
Recently WFP Afghanistan developed a 4 year Country Strategic Plan (CSP) that was developed through a series of internal and external consultations and with a focus on identifying how to help the country achieve the SDG 2 target on ending malnutrition, WFP\xe2\x80\x99s Strategic Outcome 3 focuses on preventing and treating undernutrition among vulnerable people by following a life-cycle approach. For prevention, it concentrates on provinces with a prevalence of stunting of more than 40 percent in children aged 6\xe2\x80\x9359 months. For treatment, it targets provinces with wasting rates of more than 15 percent, or of more than 10 percent with aggravating factors, and emergency situations where there is potential for a rapid rise in global acute malnutrition. In line with the life-cycle approach, and informed by gender, age and protection analyses, the immediate nutrition needs of nutritionally vulnerable people will be met while longer-term nutrition-related roles and responsibilities are addressed in a gender-transformative manner.
This outcome will be achieved through the following two outputs:
\xe2\x80\xa2Vulnerable people throughout the lifecycle \xe2\x80\x93 children aged 6\xe2\x80\x9359 months, schoolchildren, adolescent girls, and pregnant and lactating women and girls \xe2\x80\x93 receive nutrition services and appropriate specialized nutritious foods in order to prevent and treat malnutrition.
\xe2\x80\xa2Vulnerable people and their wider communities receive effective social behaviour change communication (SBCC) in order to prevent and treat malnutrition and contribute to gender equality.
Programme Assistants for Nutrition to be responsible for planning, implementation and reporting on all activities under Strategic Outcome 3 \xe2\x80\x93 Nutrition throughout the lifecycle. The SO 3 \xe2\x80\x93 Nutrition Programme Assistants will be based in the WFP Kandahar Sub-office, reporting to the Sub-Office Head of Programme but with technical oversight from the SO 3 Outcome Manager in the WFP Afghanistan Country Office.  He/she will provide operational and administrative support to all activities under SO3 including:
\xe2\x80\xa2Nutrition specific activities for treatment of moderate acute malnutrition in children 6-59 months and pregnant and lactating women and girls (PLWG), blanket supplementary feeding programmes (BSFP) to prevent nutrition deterioration during emergencies, and
\xe2\x80\xa2Nutrition sensitive programmes such as social behavior change communication (SBCC) and other activities to prevent stunting. 
In Kandahar, the Programme Assistant will also be responsible for school based nutrition activities. 
Main activities are highlighted below
\xe2\x80\xa2Actively contribute for development of SO -3 (Nutrition treatment and prevention and school feeding) component of implementation plan for the relevant field office and ensure that all nutrition and school feeding project proposals submitted to the Field Office Project Technical Review Committee (PTRC) have gone through an effective and efficient review process in consultation with CO technical unit
\xe2\x80\xa2Responsible for preparation of all nutrition and school-feeding field level agreements with cooperating partners.
\xe2\x80\xa2Provide required inputs to SO-3 Outcome Manager in CO for donor proposal development in coordination with Head of Field Office;
\xe2\x80\xa2Assist in identification, development and management of potential partnerships for joint programming implementation and strengthen existing partnerships with concerned UN agencies, national & international NGOs, government key counterparts and communities;
\xe2\x80\xa2Coordinate and communicate with relevant local partners, relevant government entities, agencies, NGOs and government institutions to perform accurate analyses of nutrition data at field office level and to ensure effective and efficient delivery of nutrition/school feeding interventions;
\xe2\x80\xa2Develop and strengthen required capacity of relevant CPs\xe2\x80\x99 staff, government staff, WFP staff and PAT monitors, through conducting training needs assessment followed by relevant trainings, on the job instructions and other initiatives;
\xe2\x80\xa2Support development of comprehensive monitoring plan for nutrition and school-feeding activities at field office level including the relevant partners and ensure use of appropriate monitoring tools/checklists by all parties;
\xe2\x80\xa2Regularly review and analyse monitoring findings from partners and third party monitors, summarize key issue in a tracking sheet and share recommendations for improvement and follow-up on its implementation;
\xe2\x80\xa2Conduct monitoring/supervision visits to nutrition and school-feeding programmes sites;
\xe2\x80\xa2Regular review and analysis of nutrition and school feeding reports, provide regular feedback to partners, raise issues of concern to higher-level management and, collaborate with CO M&E, investigate any irregularity or data inaccuracy;
\xe2\x80\xa2Any other duty as requiredTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Health/Medical Education: University degree in health or nutrition is required; additional degree or diploma in Business Administration (Management) is desirable.
Experience: 
\xe2\x80\xa2At least 3 years experiences in Health or Nutrition program management (especially humanitarian response) including planning, coordination, implementation and monitoring.
\xe2\x80\xa2Experience in direct implementation of supplementary and therapeutic feeding programs (IMAM), micronutrient supplementation, maternal health and nutrition programs and multi-sectorial responses addressing the underlying causes of under nutrition.
\xe2\x80\xa2Experiences in School Feeding Programme.
\xe2\x80\xa2Experience of working with UN or NGOs in Afghanistan.   
Language: Fluency (level C) in English language and in Dari and/or Pashto;'

b'Regional Focal Point Health Emergency Job SummaryPurpose of the Position
Afghanistan is a disaster prone country with numerous recurrent natural and man-made disasters. The protracted complex emergency situation and prevailing insecurities negatively affects more than 50% of the country\xe2\x80\x99s preparedness and coping capacities, thus increasing the vulnerability and impacting communities\xe2\x80\x99 resilience. Hence the all hazard emergency risk reduction, preparedness and response approach should be in place and operational to reduce the morbidity, mortality and disability due to such emergencies especially among vulnerable population. 
For WHO Regional sub-office(s) to better lead the health emergency cluster and closely coordinate multi-sectoral interventions, an emergency focal point will be required at the regional hubs.
2. Job Description
Objectives of the Programme and of the immediate Strategic Objective
The program objectives are to:
- Ensure access to essential life-saving health care services to affected populations with focus to conflict affected and those of IDPs and returnees.
- To address public health risks with focus to communicable diseases among the most vulnerable affected populations.
- To ensure effective coordination among the health partners on health emergency preparedness and response. Under the direct supervision of the team leader health emergency and the overall leadership of WR Afghanistan, the incumbent is responsible to assess and prioritize the health needs, monitor the health situation, assist in planning and implementation of WHO and health cluster operational plans ensuring humanitarian and health cluster standards and best practices in the health emergency response.
Summary of Assigned Duties
The incumbent will lead all WHO program including the health emergency activities in the region and work along with the Ministry of Public Health (MoPH) and health partners at the regional level (Paktia, Paktika, Khost and Ghazni).
Specific duties 
1. Represent WHO and health sector in all regional inter-sectorial meetings Regional Emergency Team (chaired OCHA) , PDMC (chaired by Governor or delegate) 
2. Represent WHO in the Regional Emergency health meetings
3. Ensure liaison with the provincial emergency response committee Provincial Health Directorates and Health NGOs.
4. Ensure liaison, coordination and collaboration with WHO regional focal points for nutrition as well as with the PPHD nutrition officers 
5. Timely provide all relevant information on the crisis, emergencies and context changes to the EHA team in Kabul
6. Provide leadership, technical and coordination support in defining response strategies for acute emergencies and development and revision of the provincial and regional contingency plans
7. Monitor and support the implementation of contingency plans at provincial and regional level including emergency stock distribution and usage (for WHO, PPHDs and health partners), including inventory reports. 
8. Be the first support for the assessment and initial support to alerts of crisis with public health consequences and coordinate further interventions with the EHA team in Kabul. 
9. Coordinate the health sector participation in all inter-sectorial assessments together with PPHD and NGOs 
10. Organize and conduct provincial level assessments as planned with EHA and MoPH teams
11. When possible support the access negotiations for health partner through linkages with ICRC, Polio team, Local influential parties, and OCHA regional offices. Follow up and compile reports on security incidents related to HFs infrastructure and ambulances/vehicles, Health staff, and patients, coordinate with OCHA and ICRC (when relevant) and inform Kabul
12. Monitoring and evaluation of the EHA and CHF funded projects, and recommendations
13. Support the assessment of management and operational capacity of health partners for funding through CHF.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Health/Medical Essential: University degree in medicine or health related fields. 
Desirable: Degree in public health as well as Knowledge and experience of the WHO and UN system.
Experience:
Essential: Minimum of 5 years\xe2\x80\x99 field experience of emergency health service delivery and working with MOPH/NGO in EPHS/BPHS. At least two years of project management experience at the national or international level. 
Other Skills (e.g. IT)
- Proficiency in MS Office.'
