b'Maternal Health Products Senior  Officer Job SummaryUnder the direct supervision of  Social Marketing Manager the incumbent will manage ASMO maternal health products specific activities, including  brand development; provider training, development/execution of creative strategy; oversee advertising production, media buys, promotions/trade shows, market research/intelligence, and new product development \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in developing/implementing a cohesive product marketing strategy across the maternal health products.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate/coordinate new product development process with relevant department inside ASMO and MoPH   
\xe2\x80\xa2 Lead partnerships with external vendors, especially creative agencies, Communications/production agencies and media companies on the design, development and broadcast of product specific campaigns. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist social marketing manager in developing product-wise budget Work in close collaboration with other departments (sales, M&E, procurement) to ensure smooth implementation of maternal  health products work plan
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct/facilitate trainings/workshops for private sector health providers (Obe/Gyn pharmacists/outlet owners) on maternal health products 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Hold orientation sessions for sales/ promotion team on family planning & maternal health products to upgrade their knowledge on the products
\xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee family planning & maternal health products marketing activities at the field and provide support to sales executive in marketing/detailing of maternal health products
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in sales team to conduct regional sales workshop for wholesalers and retailers on maternal health products
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop/Adopt curriculum and job aids on required family planning & maternal health products.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist marketing and M&E teams in conducting market assessment and pretest of print/promotion materials for family planning & maternal health products 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Attend RMNCAH and FP meeting at MoPH. Health/Medical \xe2\x80\xa2 MD specialized in gynecology obstetrics and/or public health. Master degree is preferred.
\xe2\x80\xa2  At least 5 years in maternal health programs with national/international organizations. Experience in family planning methods & counseling is strongly preferred'

b'Marketing Officer Job SummaryThe Marketing Officer oversees organization\xe2\x80\x99s marketing campaigns both internally and externally and plays a key part in communicating the organization\xe2\x80\x99s marketing message \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing and planning of the marketing aspects of the project.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Creating marketing campaigns and working with private sector.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Creating and developing new innovative ways to communicate the organization\xe2\x80\x99s message to outside market customers.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contributing to the sales and marketing plan.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conducting Marketing & BDS Trainings to the beneficiaries.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing and implementing an internal marketing program.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supporting the project team and the vocational trainers in day to day marketing activities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Set clear procedures, identifying objectives and needs for marketing opportunities.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor marketing trends and competition activities and propose counter actions.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advise the beneficiaries for market demands products.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Timely and accurate communication of marketing plans and achievements with the project manager.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Timely reporting of the activities to the project manger.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Act as job placement officer for the project and identify job placement opportunities for all training sections.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform any additional task given by the supervisor. Business Administration \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor degree in Business Administration and or similar field and/or equivalent knowledge gained through working experiences and on-job-trainings
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 2 years of experience working in similar position with international/national NGOs.'

b'Account Payable Assistant Job SummaryThe incumbent is responsible to perform the account payable duties of the Afghan Telecom including review and check of the financial documents, preparation of vouchers, recording vouchers into the financial management system and preparation of the desired financial worksheet and reports. The account payable Assistant is responsible to undertake the daily account payable services and perform all the duties of the account payable section.  The duties may include:
1. Review the claims and prepare Check payment vouchers for all claims submitted to finance
2. Prepare adjustment journal entry vouchers for all the correcting entries as well as month end entries.
3. Record all check vouchers in the financial management system.
4. Recording all Expenses & Liabilities of Head Quarter & Regions in General Vouchers in Tally System
5. Keeping Proper record of all Advances to employees & pursuing the employees on time clearance of their advances
6. Preparation of Monthly reports of Advances, Expenses & Liabilities of the organization.
7. Proper Management of Prepaid Expenses & regular reviewing it for adjustments.
8. Recording of all Teleshop & BTS Expenses In the End of each month
9. Recording & reviewing the salary transactions in system.
10. Provide day to day support to the Payable Manager and other account payable staff members
11. Be gender sensitive and institutionalize organizational values at the work place and the daily activities.
12. Maintain good relations with all department and individuals and be a team player.
13. Participate in professional training and development activities, as needed or requested; help plan for and implement job-related training and development activities for assigned staff, as needed.
14. Checking out Bank Statements and Reporting to Accounts Payable Manager on Daily Basis
15. Responsible for all Advance Payments of All Staffs & their Clearances.
16. Preparing Payment Vouchers for all the claims (Advances for employees, Payment to suppliers, and payment to sundry creditors) submitted to the Account Department
17. Receiving all direct and advance Payments from Procurement Department.
18. Recording Salaries Expenses, liabilities & payments in Tally System of HQ & Regions on Monthly basis
19. Preparation of Summaries of all Regional Expenditures which are recorded in Tally on Monthly basis.
20. Calculation of Fuel Expenses of the Regions in Excel for Payment purposes.
21. Reviewing the Accounts for all adjustments required in Tally especially for Accruals & Prepaid Expenses.
22. Entering of Depreciation expenses on monthly basis, as report received from Inventory officer.
23. Responsible to review Bank Receipts, Bank Payment Vouchers, and other related financial documents which handed to Finance Department on daily or monthly basis.
24. Properly filing the Documents & storing them in safe location as per Afghan Telecom Procedure
25. Perform other duties as necessary and/or as requested. Business Administration \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
\xe2\x80\xa2 2 years of work experience is required in the related field'

b'Donor Relations Coordinator Job SummaryCRIDA is currently looking for a Donor Relations Coordinator to play an active role in managing and attracting donor related activities, meanwhile developing the relevant activities/tasks for achieving the business development and donors\xe2\x80\x99 attraction goals of CRIDA on objective basis.
Under the direct supervision of Business Development and Donors\xe2\x80\x99 Attraction Manager, the Donor Relations Coordinator will be responsible for all aspects of donor relations reporting, including identify, qualify, solicit and steward donor prospects portfolio, utilize collateral such as a campaign reports and program overview and tailor as needed for solicitation of donors and develops solicitation proposals for various projects. The Incumbent is also responsible for the coordination and management of the donor reporting and funding proposal schedules and strategies. She/he will be closely involved in contribution management issues, particularly as they report to donor relations. Reporting Line:
The Donor Relations Coordinator would directly report to Business Development and Donors\xe2\x80\x99 Attraction Manager.
Duties/Responsibilities:
1. Works to foster lasting relationships between CRIDA and donors through appropriate stewardship and engagement. 
2. Identify, qualify, solicit and steward a portfolio of donor prospects.
3. Identify respondents and new donors to be reached on a monthly basis.
4. Participate as a key team member in conducting outreach missions, meet with executives from donor agencies and persuading donors and prospects. 
5. Maintain a deep understanding of the issues and events impacting the work of the organization and its programs, services, and staff.
6. Initiates activities and messages to create a stream of positive information to encourage and inspire donors. Builds relationship and raises awareness.
7. Analyze organizational need and donor preference or history to time solicitations for best outcomes.
8. Maintain an evolving plan of actions specific to each donor or groups of donors.
9. Utilize collateral such as a campaign reports and program overview and tailor as needed for solicitation of donors.
10. Create customized solicitation strategies and campaigns for individuals or groups of donors and implement those strategies for revenue goals. 
11. Develops solicitation proposals for various projects.
12. Coordinate a stewardship plan, with individual acknowledgement, as well as preparing and sending reports on project outcomes.
13. Maintain record keeping in centralized donor database; producing lists and revenue reports demonstrating progress towards outcome goals.
14. Coordinate with subordinate officers and other development colleagues.
15. Play key role in CR business development initiatives and participate in regular meetings.
16. Assist in special projects such as proposal development, campaigns, and events, as needed by director of IR.
17. Ability to work with diverse groups including corporations, foundations and boards.
18. Be able to work with a team to achieve the stated goals. Business Administration \xe2\x80\xa2 Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree or equivalent in Business Administration, Social Science, or Arts is preferred. Previous experience and successful work in business development field is very beneficial.
\xe2\x80\xa2 5 years or more, of relevant experience at private and public sector in providing donor support and coordination services.\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Experience in donor funded projects is preferable.'

b'Accounts Receivable Assistant Job SummaryThe incumbent is responsible to perform the account receivable of the Afghan Telecom including review and check of the financial documents, preparation of the receipt vouchers, recording vouchers into the financial management system and preparation of the desired financial worksheet and reports. The account receivable assistant is responsible to undertake the daily duties of the account receivable section.  The duties may include:
1. Responsible to check and review the financial documents for all deposits into the AFTEL accounts at the head office. 
2. Prepare receipt vouchers for all deposits to the AFTEL accounts and secure their approval. 
3. Prepare adjustment journal entry vouchers for all correcting entries of the account receivable section.
4. Review the accounts sub ledgers and speed up the process of collection for all receivables. 
5. Conduct an audit of the official receipts and match the issued receipts with the cashier\xe2\x80\x99s books. Advise the management in case of any discrepancy
6. Contact the bills payment defaulters and keep the aging track of the outstanding bills.
7. Keeping a check on monthly receivables activity while making sure that that billing, collection, and reporting activities are carried out per specified dates.
8. Looking into and researching customer account details, which include non-payments, delayed payments, and other irregularities.
9. Creating an appropriate communication system that reminds the customer about payment without offending them.
10. The communication can make use of telephone calls, post mail, email, and so on. 
11. Preparation of Monthly reports of Receivables & Collection
12. keeping an up-to-date billing system since inaccuracies result in collection errors
13. Preparing Monthly Invoices for various Government & Non-Government Organizations for both Head Quarter & Regions.
15. Daily Check up of all Bank Accounts for any Receivables
16. Follow up on sending invoices to subscribers and receipt of payments against the invoices. 
17. Any other assignment pertinent to the job and given by the supervisor Business Administration \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
\xe2\x80\xa2 2 years of work experience is required in the related field'

b"Administrative Officer Job SummaryAdmin Officer is responsible to provide day to day admin and finance support to the team in performing administration tasks. To prepare admin, financial, procurement and HR documents required for smooth functioning of the office
To look after management and maintenance of overall administrative records and documents in a professional manner.
To arrange meetings and ensuring that each participant is properly informed and have confirmed, and keeping records of all official meetings
To follow up with Administrative Office of the President on any pending administrative documents and other related issues.
To look after providing, distributing and keeping proper balance and update of office stationery
To maintain staff attendance
To maintain stock records.
Perform any other related duties as required. Administrative Education
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration/Management or a closely related field. 
Experience
At least 2 years of relevant experience. Preference will be given to candidates with additional years of experience."

b'BRANCH SUPERVISOR Job SummaryWe are looking for a talented Branch Supervisor to assign and direct all work performed in the branch and to supervise all areas of operation. You will manage staff, foster a positive environment and ensure customer satisfaction and proper branch operation. The successful candidate will have a hands-on approach and will be committed to the expansion and success of the business by implementing strategies that increase productivity and enable sales targets achievement. 1. Supervise all operational aspects of sales
2. Assess local market conditions and identify current and prospective sales opportunities
3. Develop forecasts, financial objectives and business plans
4. Meet goals and objectives
5. Manage budget and allocate funds appropriately
6. Locate areas of improvement and propose corrective actions that meet challenges and leverage growth opportunities
7. Share information with other branches and headquarters on effective practices, competitive intelligence, business opportunities and needs
8. Address customer and employee satisfaction issues promptly
9. Adhere to high ethical standards, and comply with all regulations/applicable laws
10. Network to improve the presence and reputation of the branch and company
11. Stay abreast of competing markets and provide reports on market movement and penetration
12. To comply rules and regulation of SKY Travel and Tours
Overall boost the sales in Mazar BranchTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Business Administration Minimum Bachelor Degree in Business Administration (BBA) Master degree will be preferred.'

b"Managing Director Job SummaryThe post Managing Director has been created with the intention that the job-holder will be a member of the President's senior staff, reporting directly to the President. She will handle matters of policy and institutional importance on behalf of the President, manage special projects related to university officials, community and government leaders, and oversee the MEC\xe2\x80\x99s organizational units.
The Managing Director (MD) will manage operations and lead strategic operational initiatives for the MEC. While the MD is responsible for achieving MEC goals and assuring that day-to-day operations align with these goals, the MD will directly assist the President in meeting these responsibilities and serve as the second-in-command of MEC operations. 
The MD will be responsible for the supervision of the programmatic departments of MEC. Under the leadership of the President, the MD will set direction for MEC's Associate Directors, and serve as their mentor, coach, and guide. Through metrics established with the MD, the MD will manage MEC activities and hold the staff accountable for performance against those metrics. The Managing Director will be responsible for drafting/creating MEC's annual report and operating budgets. She will identify best practices and improve internal systems with an eye toward future needs and budget realities. She will also lead hiring of new staff, promotions/raises of current staff, as well as nurture organizational culture and cohesiveness of MEC.
The MD will assist the President with strategic planning and the execution of strategic initiatives to align the organization's programs, projects, and messaging with the strategic direction of the organization. The MD will take the lead on the execution of priority strategic initiatives. This responsibility will critically involve writing grants, contracts, and proposals at the initiation phase; executing new programs at the implementation stage, and marketing and communicating program success at the concluding state. Strategic initiatives include marketing campaigns, fundraising and donor management, business development, and partnership activities. Provide guidance to executive director for marketing, media relations, public relations and issues management activities. Trouble shoot any interim problems as they arise. The job-holder will, among other tasks:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in institutional planning, policy and procedure development and problem resolution with the President and other senior officers, including researching, reviewing and making recommendations on new or revised policies and strategies and on intra-departmental or inter-departmental issues, and if required, serving on university planning and policy-making committees.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing reports and other communications on behalf of the President.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Serve as the President's primary liaison with the MEC\xe2\x80\x99s operational units (Top Management, University, Institute, School and Kindergarten), and/or government and community leadership on strategic and operational matters pertaining to the specific area of institutional interest.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Respond to routine inquiries as delegated by the President and coordinate special projects on his behalf.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Enhance professional growth and development through participation in educational programs, in-service meetings and workshops.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all organizational units of the President function in line with overall MEC policies, goals, and mission and support the President in dealing with lecturers, staff, and student issues.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work with the President to define and advance the overall goals of MEC and manage the day-to-day operations of the Moraa Educational Complex
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in the creation and implementation of a strategic business plan that defines the goals, activities and metrics of the Moraa Educational Complex
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate internal communications and regular meetings with the membership, committees and boards of the MEC 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fostering interactions with prospective industry, academic and government partners, and stewarding existing collaborations
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manage external relationships, including developing and servicing client relationships and tracking outcomes
\xe2\x80\xa2 Target, pursue and cultivate external relationships, collaborations and partnerships
\xe2\x80\xa2 Be first contact for inquiries about MEC from the private sector, government, other institutions and the media
\xe2\x80\xa2 Gain full understanding of the scope of MEC activities and strategic plans
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keep MEC membership informed and aware of inquiries and potential research opportunities and will help to assess their viability
\xe2\x80\xa2 Actively pursue new national and international partnerships
\xe2\x80\xa2 Planning and implementing of marketing and communications initiatives
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in developing a professional portfolio of marketing communications tools (e.g. brochures, presentation slide sets, conference booths, collateral), manage MEC brand strategy
\xe2\x80\xa2 Actively participate in managing content for the MEC's website
\xe2\x80\xa2 Deliver or participate in presentations to corporations, government and industry
\xe2\x80\xa2 Media management (press releases, media inquiries, advertisements)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate and participate in campus visits, events, workshops, and conferences
\xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitating cybersecurity or privacy-related research proposal preparation and implementation
\xe2\x80\xa2 As requested and where appropriate, participate in the preparation, coordination and implementation of major funding proposals stemming from the MEC 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Soliciting and orchestrating direct funding opportunities from government ministries at both the provincial and federal levels.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Securing private sector, in-kind commitments and letters of support
\xe2\x80\xa2 Managing administrative and supervisory functions
\xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to the leadership and supervision for all administrative staff employees of the MEC, including aspects of planning for training and development, conducting performance appraisals, assigning job responsibilities and general supervision.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with Human Resources regarding all MEC staffing issues including job descriptions, reclassifications, performance evaluations, payroll records and staff management issues.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Authorize, in consultation with the President, the purchase and allocation of equipment and furnishings for administration and outreach.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain internal relationship and communications with the Office of Research, Faculty- and University-level Development Staff and UW Service Offices (Finance, Graphics, Food Services etc.)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Oversees day-to-day administrative and management operations with the President of MEC.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Manages MEC finances related to student, professional, and faculty production work, including strategic planning, management of production related accounts, petty cash and student payroll. Generates budgets and quarterly reports.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Helps ensure positive relations with vendors and prompt payment of bills and reimbursements.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Trains, mentors and advises student staff in professional areas such as marketing, audience development, arts administration and general administration.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advises current students and student organizations, including those entering the profession and post-graduate study.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Encourages a collaborative environment between students, faculty and staff in curricular, co-curricular, and professional settings.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Serves on relevant University boards and committees.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Leads or attends finance and management related meetings, and other duties as assigned.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Act as the line manager for top management staff member within the team. Administrative Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Public Administrations, International Relations, Political Science Business Administration or related field (PhD preferred)
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least 10-15 years\xe2\x80\x99 active work experience, including at least 8 years in a management / team leadership role, preferably in an educational, academic and/or healthcare environment
\xe2\x80\xa2 Able to demonstrate leadership in or management of positive changes to improve organizational performance or service delivery.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with funding instruments and the establishment and implementation of research contracts between industry and academia
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent networking skills and ability to maintain critical and sensitive relationships with government, industry and media among others
\xe2\x80\xa2 We especially encourage academics with an entrepreneurial mindset searching for possibilities to leave their mark in a creative, dynamic and ambitious environment"

b"Administrative Assistant Job Summary This Administrative Assistant position is located in the Administrative Unit of the UNESCO Kabul Office.
The Administrative Assistant will perform the full range of administration support functions to provide timely
and professional benefits and entitlements services to staff members and other UNESCO employees, in
compliance with the UNESCO Rules and Regulations.
Under the overall authority of the Director and UNESCO Representative and the direct supervision of the Senior
Finance and Administrative officer, the incumbent will have the following key responsibilities:
- Review and process requests for entitlements and claims from staff members in accordance with staff
rules and established HR procedures.
- Carry out a range of personnel actions related to appointments, extensions, transfers, separations,
etc.
- Collect and synthesize data and information on staff members' salaries, allowances and entitlements
for approval/decision and subsequent action
- Maintain effective and efficient communication with the concerned Sectors/Offices or Services on
matters related to staff salaries, allowances and entitlements, and respond promptly to information
requests and inquiries from staff members and other business partners.
- Review and constantly update the HR database in the HR management system.
- Draft a wide range of correspondence and other notification materials, and ensure high quality
standard for all HR communications.
- Assisting in monitoring the elaboration of SC contracts by following up the insertion and maintenance
of personnel data into the Human resources system (STEPS);
UNESCO is committed to promoting geographical distribution and gender equality within its Secretariat. Therefore, women
candidates are strongly encouraged to apply, as are nationals from non- and under-represented Member States. Persons with disabilities
equally are encouraged to apply.
Worldwide mobility is required as staff members must be ready to serve in other duty stations in accordance with UNESCO\xe2\x80\x99s geographical
mobility policy.
UNESCO applies a zero tolerance policy against all forms of harassment.
UNESCO DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE AT ANY STAGE OF THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS.
- Carry out any operation in relation with recruitment process Administrative Education
\xef\x82\xb7 High-school diploma or Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in the relevant field, and administration and finance
qualification will be an asset.
Work Experience
\xef\x82\xb7 At least 5-years (with diploma qualification) or 3 years (with bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree) working experience in
the field of finance and administration or relevant field.
\xef\x82\xb7 Previous experience with UN Agencies and/or UNESCO would be considered as an asset."

b'Senior Student Recruitment Officer Job SummaryThe Senior Student Recruitment Officer plays a critical role in raising the university\xe2\x80\x99 profile with future students, families, and partners. Under the supervision of Director of Admission, the Senior Officer leads and assists the recruitment team in the development and implementation of creative and specific student recruitment strategies, targeted at female and provincial students.  The Senior Officer will lead the Office of Admission\xe2\x80\x99s recruitment unit and will assist the Director of Admission in the formulation and implementation of innovative student recruitment campaigns to achieve the university\xe2\x80\x99s overall enrollment goals every semester and year.  The Senior Officer will be the Admission Office\xe2\x80\x99s lead marketing expert and will ensure that the recruitment efforts are handled in the most effective manner with particular focus to customer service and rendering positive impression to perspective students, families and partners.  
Key outcomes include:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Building and sustaining strong networks and innovative student recruitment system.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Travel to provinces for testing and student recruitment.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identifying new and creative venues for student recruitment.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing creative student recruitment strategies to increase the number of full-time students, including recruitment in provinces.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Building effective partnerships with high schools, businesses, learning centers, and partner organizations to enhance the university\xe2\x80\x99s standing. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Implementing creative on and off-campus programs to engage prospective students and families. The Senior Student Recruitment Officer\xe2\x80\x99s duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Create a robust and creative recruitment system to meet the university\xe2\x80\x99s recruitment goals.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Undertake a range of professional and specialized tasks to build and sustain collaborative relationships with a network of internal and external contacts, particularly in provinces for student recruitment purposes.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supervise the Student Recruitment Officers, provide them with necessary coaching and professional feedback with customer focused approach. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Travel with other admission and recruitment team to provinces for recruitment and testing. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work with provincial government administrations and partners to facilitate the recruitment team\xe2\x80\x99s visit to high schools and obtain all necessary permits and arrangements. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Sustain strong working relationship with all departments within the university, particularly faculty, AUAF Alumni Relations Office and utilize their resources, feedback and contacts for student recruitment purposes. 
\xe2\x80\xa2  Draft, formulate and implement a comprehensive Student Recruitment Plan to meet the recruitment target for the university\xe2\x80\x99s Undergraduate, Graduate and the Academy Programs. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Attend meetings and deliver presentations to potential business partners and donors about the university\xe2\x80\x99s admission procedures, scholarship and financial aid policies and opportunities.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the admission and recruitment team in developing innovative student recruitment strategies and enrollment plans to attract and enroll more students with particular emphasis on female and provincial recruitment. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organize, manage and participate in all recruitment events, open houses, school fairs, information sessions, educational expos, school visits& tours and off-campus events for the purpose of student recruitment. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Build strong working relationships with key ministries and government departments such as Ministry of Education, Departments of Education and LLCs and learning centers in provinces to attract students for the university\xe2\x80\x99s programs. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organize regular visual and in-person meetings and chats with students in districts in Kabul and provinces to provide them information about the university\xe2\x80\x99s educational programs, scholarships and financial aid opportunities. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Continually visit private and public high schools in Kabul and observe key dates to launch the university\xe2\x80\x99s student recruitment campaigns and testing. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Propose and maintain an accurate data system to store and effectively analyze the data for the university\xe2\x80\x99s senior management for effective decision-making regarding enrollment targets, financial aid allocation and future strategic plans. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other job-related duties as assigned by the supervisor. Administrative To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communications or relevant field. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of two years of relevant work experience.
\xe2\x80\xa2 English language proficiency in writing, reading and speaking.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to speak and understand the national languages
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong data management and reporting skills. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Able to multi-task, excellent organizational skills, ability to work independently, good problem solving abilities, and possess strong interpersonal skills. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work under pressure.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Trustworthy and good understanding of handling sensitive materials and information'

b'Student Recruitment Officer Job SummaryThe Student Recruitment Officer is an integral member of the Admission Team at the American University of Afghanistan (AUAF) and is responsible for recruitment of students for the university\xe2\x80\x99s Undergraduate, Graduate and the Academy Programs. The incumbent is also responsible for formulating and coordinating the university\xe2\x80\x99s student recruitment policy, active engagement with schools, learning centers, and potential business partners to identify opportunities for developing closer working relationships and partnerships to meet the university\xe2\x80\x99s overall student enrollment goals. 
Key outcomes include:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Identifying new and creative venues for student recruitment.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing creative student recruitment strategies to increase the number of full-time students, including recruitment in provinces.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Building effective partnerships with high schools, businesses, learning centers and partner organizations to enhance the university\xe2\x80\x99s standing. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Implementing creative on and off-campus programs to engage perspective students and families. The Student Recruitment Officer\xe2\x80\x99s duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Draft, formulate and implement a comprehensive Student Recruitment Plan to meet the recruitment target for the university\xe2\x80\x99s Undergraduate, Graduate and the Academy Programs. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Attend meetings and deliver presentations to potential business partners and donors about the university\xe2\x80\x99s admission procedures, scholarship and financial aid policies and opportunities.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the admission and recruitment team in developing innovative student recruitment strategies and enrollment plans to attract and enroll more students with particular emphasis on female and provincial recruitment. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organize, manage and participate in all recruitment events, open houses, school fairs, information sessions, educational expos, school visits& tours and off-campus events for the purpose of student recruitment. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Build strong contact with like-minded partner organizations in Kabul and provinces to actively organize campus tours, information sessions and community engagement events for the purpose of student recruitment. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Build strong working relationships with key ministries and government departments such as Ministry of Education, Departments of Education and LLCs and learning centers in provinces to attract students for the university\xe2\x80\x99s programs. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organize regular visual and in-person meetings and chats with students in districts in Kabul and provinces to provide them information about the university\xe2\x80\x99s educational programs, scholarships and financial aid opportunities. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Continually visit private and public high schools in Kabul and observe key dates to launch the university\xe2\x80\x99s student recruitment campaigns and testing. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Propose and maintain an accurate data system to store and effectively analyze the data for the university\xe2\x80\x99s senior management for effective decision-making regarding enrollment targets, financial aid allocation and future strategic plans. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Build and maintain strong relationship with the university\xe2\x80\x99s various departments, faculty and alumni to utilize their resources for the purpose of student recruitment. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop effective marketing strategy for the university programs, including website, mailings, on and off-campus events, profile building, campaigns through various communication means. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other job-related duties as assigned by the supervisor. Administrative To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communications or relevant field. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of two years of relevant work experience.
\xe2\x80\xa2 English language proficiency in writing, reading and speaking.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to speak and understand the national languages
\xe2\x80\xa2 Strong data management and reporting skills. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Able to multi-task, excellent organizational skills, ability to work independently, good problem solving abilities, and possess strong interpersonal skills. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work under pressure.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Trustworthy and good understanding of handling sensitive materials and information.'

b'(Re-announce)CASA-1000 Focal Point for MEW Job SummaryProject Components
The CASA 1000 Project will finance the following components: 
(i) Component A. Construction of High Voltage Transmission Infrastructure. Component A consists of four subcomponents:
Sub-component A1. High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) Transmission Line which involves the construction of approximately 750 km of 500 kV HVDC overhead transmission line with capacity of 1,300 MW to interconnect the electricity network of Tajikistan, at the Sangtuda substation (s/s), going through Afghanistan  to connect with the Pakistan network, at the Nowshera substation. 
Sub-Component A2. HVDC Converter Stations which involve the engineering design, construction, and commissioning of two High Voltage Alternating Current (HVAC) to Direct Current (DC) converter stations at Sangtuda s/s (1,300 MW) in Tajikistan and Nowshera s/s (1,300 MW) in Pakistan. 
Sub-component A3. Kyrgyz-Tajik HVAC Transmission Interconnection which includes the construction of about 475 km of 500 kV HVAC overhead transmission line to interconnect the electricity network of the Kyrgyz Republic, at Datka s/s, with the Tajikistan network, at the Khudjand s/s. About 450 km of the line will be in the Kyrgyz Republic and 25 km in Tajikistan. 
Sub-component A4. Tajikistan grid reinforcement which includes reinforcements in Tajikistan including construction of 500 kV line from Regar s/s to Sangtuda s/s and other parts of the network necessary to ensure transfer of Tajikistan and Kyrgyz export power to Sangtuda HVDC station. (Note: This section is not included in the scope of the DC Owner Engineer).
(ii) Component B. Technical Assistance and Project Implementation Support. The component provides support for project implementation and technical assistance for the four countries, IGC and the Secretariat.
(iii) Component C. Community Support Programs. The Component will develop and implement CSPs in each of four countries during project construction period to create a more supportive environment for project implementation by improving livelihood among approximately 670 communities living along the CASA-1000 corridor. CASA-1000 Project Focal Point for MEW will be based in Ministry of Energy and Water and work under the direct supervision of the Deputy Minister of Energy (Ministry of Energy and Water) and act as a deputy head of Joint Working Group (JWG) on behalf of MEW for the project and his duties and responsibilities will be as below: 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and maintain a detailed projects\xe2\x80\x99 schedule of all tasks involved in the project For Minister and Deputy Minister of Energy
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide insight and guidance for the MEW authorities in collaboration with DABS, PIU and CASA-1000 Secretariat in preparations of relevant documents and contracts for the meetings.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Closely Work with main project implementer i.e. DABS and other project stakeholders such as Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Economy, and Ministry of Interior to make sure that the proper coordination is maintained between MEW and these other government departments in implementation stage.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Represent the GoA delegation as and when necessary and when entrusted with such authority in Working Group Levels.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Shall work with DABS, MEW and other stakeholders to develop security plan in implementation stage of the project along the route.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Organize and establish meetings on regular basis with designated individuals and groups to foster positive relationships. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Represent MEW in PC and other meetings as authorized by MEW. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in the development of short and long term plans and  programs  for MEW authorities in implementation stage
\xe2\x80\xa2 Shall arrange regular Video-Conference with various stake-holders.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare monthly progress reports & briefs of the project related activities to the IGC members of Afghanistan.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate on behalf of MEW with DABS, MRRD and other stake holder departments and institutions in the Community Support Program.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Make sure that Host Government Agreement (a document outlining responsibilities of Government Departments in Implementation Stage) is implemented in the best possible manner in implementation stage. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Travel to project member countries and any other places as and whenever needed. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Any other tasks assigned by the supervisor. 
Reporting and Coordination
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare Project Progress Reports. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare Annual Plan for the Program. Inter-agency and inter-project coordination.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Official point of contact for related issues of CASA1000 in Ministry of Energy and Water (MEW).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Official point of contact for coordination with MRRD for related issues of CASA CSP in Ministry of Energy and Water (MEW).
\xe2\x80\xa2 Any other tasks related to the duty.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Reporting to Team Leader of CASA 1000 Project in DABS and Deputy Minister of Energy in particular Administrative Background and Experience: The Project focal Point for MEW for CASA 1000 shall be an independent professional with extensive experience of intern-ministerial cooperation, and with excellent reporting skills. Experience should include activities demonstrating the skills of coordinating the work of similar projects. At least five (5) years of relevant experience in coordination is essential with demonstrated understanding of Government of Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s Laws with respect to legal, institutional, contractual and financial issues and processes. The candidate shall have prior experience in Power Infrastructure Projects or Donor Funded Project. The Consultant should have preferably knowledge and or experience in procurement. HE/She Must have demonstrated ability of leadership and inter-personal skills. Ability to work in a team. The incumbent must be able to develop plans and programs and establish mechanisms for implementation of plans.  
\xe2\x80\xa2 Adequate knowledge of governmental and world bank procedure and regulations 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Adequate interpersonal and communication skills. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Good working knowledge and practical experience of projects
\xe2\x80\xa2 Professional written and verbal English and Pashto/Dari communication. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication skills with the ability to build working relations and engage with project related stakeholders 
Education: The Project Focal Point in MEW for CASA1000 shall have Bachelor Degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, Social Science, Engineering or any other disciplines with at least five (5) years of relevant experience. A master\xe2\x80\x99s degree will be advantageous.'

b'Internship Job SummaryUnder direct supervision, an intern will perform entry level professional duties of moderate difficulty providing the opportunity for professional training in various functional areas throughout related department. Performs assigned duties to acquire knowledge of methods, procedures and standards required for successful performance. May perform duties such as gathering and organizing data to provide information for departmental special projects or reports; basic arithmetic computations; assist in preparing written reports; ACB professional level employees on assignments. Assignments serve to offer practical experience. Utilizes current organization-wide and/or department specific software to complete assignments.
Note: Specific activities vary by assignment. A wide range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Finance, Human Resources, Admin, and M&M. Applied Knowledge & Skills:
Demonstrates basic understanding of the area of specialization, of program procedures, methods, and practices to include knowledge of program and staff responsibilities.
Uses established filing and data systems, functions, and/or procedures that require knowledge of the program.
Reviews data and information for completeness and accuracy using standard guidelines; performs tasks with attention to detail.
Understands software used to perform day-to-day functions. Uses basic office software programs, information systems, and office equipment to access, input, and verify standard information.
Communicates information clearly to staff, clients, and/or public about services, processes, and procedures using prescribed or established guidelines.
Utilizes program specific terminology. Gathers readily available information from office records to drafts e-mails, memos and other documents.
Send weekly report to the department Manager. Administrative \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor Degree in related field (BBA, BCS)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Advanced skills in MS Office Suite (Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access).'

b'Data and Scholarships Manager Job SummaryThe Data and Scholarship Manager is responsible for maintaining a robust database of the development department\xe2\x80\x99s contract, gift agreements, reports, MoUs etc. S/He is also required to set up an efficient system of coordination among all stakeholders \xe2\x80\x93 internal and external.
Key outcomes include:
\xe2\x80\xa2 To Strengthen AUAF relationship with its donors and pave the way for further collaboration
\xe2\x80\xa2 To maintain and update a proper filing system of grants, MoUs, contracts and agreements. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 To improve quality of reports to grantors 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Effective management of data, grants and scholarships to help simplify tracking of implemented objectives, reporting obligation, and grant closing or renewal dates. General Data Management:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Update and maintain Raiser\xe2\x80\x99s Edge data regularly; this requires strong coordination with the following units within the University:  Finance Department, the President\xe2\x80\x99s Office, Provosts Office, and Centers of Excellence. This way, the manager will be able to enter grantors\xe2\x80\x99 (current and potential) data into the system. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain records of all development department\xe2\x80\x99s agreements, policies, MoUs, contracts, teaming agreements etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain a running dashboard of these records to help simplify tracking of implementation, reporting obligation, grant closing or renewal dates.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Communicate the relevant information with the proper departments and stakeholders on a timely basis to ensure all compliance related obligations are met.
Scholarships Coordination:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that all grant agreements between AUAF and respective grantors are updated and properly filed
\xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate with all relevant units within AUAF including Finance, Students Finance, Registrar, Student Affairs, Communications and Provost\xe2\x80\x99s Office to gather all the necessary data on the recipients of the scholarships
\xe2\x80\xa2 Create a robust database for the recipients of all the scholarships at the University, and constantly update it
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work in close coordination with Student Affairs Office to learn more students\xe2\x80\x99 lives on campus (both academic and non-academic); create a strong rapport with the students, which will help in telling their stories to the donors. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with Alumni Relations Office to connect current recipients of scholarships with AUAF\xe2\x80\x99s alumni \xe2\x80\x93 particularly those individuals who benefited from similar scholarship funds while studying at AUAF 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in gathering all the necessary data for writing reports to grantors Administrative \xe2\x80\xa2 The person must hold at least a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in related fields. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 At least five years of experience in communications, networking, and public relations 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Must be able to engage and interact with a wide spectrum of people both internally and externally.
\xe2\x80\xa2 High level of attention to details.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work collaboratively with other departments.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Person of Afghan descent preferred'

b'Learning Centre Coordinator Job Summary\xe2\x80\xa2 To supply and co-ordinate the provision of high-quality English Language learning opportunities to individual/ cadets and groups to help them achieve their English language goals.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To ensure the successful and smooth running of the learning centre.
o Number of hours per week: 0800-1600 Saturday- Thursday = 40 hours.
o Working will vary depending on the needs of the centre. This role is accountable for 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Delivering well-planned and appropriate lessons to timetable and self \xe2\x80\x93 access users. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 The smooth-running of one of our learning centres or Self access centres (including facilities, opening hours resources etc.)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring and reporting of attendance and progress.
The role is responsible for 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Promoting independent study as agreed with the Programme Manager
\xe2\x80\xa2 The recruitment and retention of users.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Helping users to gain maximum benefit from the centre.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintaining and developing client/partner relations.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Playing an active role in the wider English for Security & Defence team
The main duties are:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Teaching 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Supporting users by;
o Giving advice and helping them select self \xe2\x80\x93study materials.
o Drawing up \xe2\x80\x9cstudy paths\xe2\x80\x9d with individual learners.
o Running induction and learning sessions & workshops.
o Providing technical support as required (e.g. with educational software)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Day \xe2\x80\x93to-day management of the centre and its resources including
o The security of materials and equipment.
o The maintenance of an up-to-date inventory.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Developing and maintaining a good knowledge of the resources available and contributing to the development and /or selection of new resources to meet users\xe2\x80\x99 needs.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Attending meetings as required as being an active and supportive member of the English for Security and Defence team.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Attending and participating in training and CPD initiatives organised for English for Security & Defence staff 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Other administrative duties related to courses and lessons Administrative Bachelor or equivalent'

b'Secretary (Rover) FSN-05 (Multiple Vacancies) Job SummaryFemale candidates are strongly encouraged to apply
I. GENERAL INFORMATION
1. SOLICITATION NO.: 72030619R10002
2. ISSUANCE DATE: October 15, 2018
3. CLOSING DATE/TIME FOR RECEIPT OF OFFERS: October 29, 2018 no later than 4:30 pm Kabul time. 
4. POSITION TITLE:-Secretary (Rover) - (Multiple Vacancies)
5. MARKET VALUE:-Equivalent to FSN-05 (Step 1-13)
In accordance with AIDAR Appendix J and the Local Compensation Plan of US Embassy Afghanistan. Final compensation will be negotiated within the listed market value.
6. PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE:-The period of performance is one year, with the possibility of extensions up to a total of five years, subject to availability of funds, satisfactory job performance and need for continued service.
7. PLACE OF PERFORMANCE: Kabul, Afghanistan.
8. SECURITY LEVEL REQUIRED: As an employment precondition, the successful applicant is required to obtain U.S Embassy Afghanistan RSO Security Clearance. 9. STATEMENT OF DUTIES
1. General Statement of Purpose of the Contract
The incumbent serves as an interim or roving Secretary to all USAID Offices, as assigned. The incumbent is assigned to the USAID/Afghanistan Executive Office (EXO), and reports administratively to the Human Resources (HR) Specialist/Assistant for assignment. When serving on assignment as an Office Secretary, day-to-day supervision will be from the appropriate Office Director. The incumbent performs work of a confidential nature, in lieu of secretarial or administrative personnel who are ill, on vacation, or otherwise absent or preoccupied for varying periods of time. The incumbent provides Time and Attendance (T&A) back-up and support of the Office of assignment, or to EXO/HR, as required. The formal supervisor is the Executive Officer. The incumbent performs other office functions appropriate for their training and grade level.
2. Statement of Duties to be Performed
a. Secretarial, Administrative, and Clerical Support 
As assigned, serves as Secretary (to an Office, Branch, or other Unit), with responsibility for providing the full range of secretarial, administrative, and clerical support to the organization staff. Typical duties vary with the assignment, but may include any or all of the following: keeps the organization Director\xe2\x80\x99s calendar: receives visitors and telephone calls to the organization; takes appropriate action depending upon the nature of the visit or the call; to the extent possible, provides information to answer non-technical questions within prescribed guidelines; arranges appointments, meetings, and conferences as requested, to include scheduling conference rooms and notifying participants and assembling background materials for conference use; makes travel and hotel arrangements, and coordinates logistical arrangements for visiting officials; and, as assigned, takes notes, and follows up to ensure commitments made in meetings and conferences are met. The incumbent provides administrative support for organization staff; receives, reviews, and controls incoming and outgoing correspondence and communications, and distributes mail and messages, maintaining controls and following up on actionable correspondence; drafts routine correspondence for signature of organization staff; types a variety of USAID correspondence; proofreads outgoing correspondence to assure they are in proper format, consistent with Mission style requirements, properly addressed, etc., prior to going to the  respective Office Director/Mission Director for clearance or signature; tracks official organization correspondence, Global Acquisition and Assistance System (GLAAS) documents, etc. through the clearance and signature process; and, establishes, maintains files and records, with input EXO/Correspondence and Records (C&R). 
As required by the assignment, the incumbent maintains contact with counterparts in the U.S. Embassy, other international organizations, host-government officials, and third-country nationals. The incumbent provides translation of non-technical articles, letters, and memoranda, for the respective Office Director and staff, translating between Dari/Pashto and English, and English and Dari/Pashto. 
As required by workload, the incumbent may be assigned as a second Secretary or Assistant, assisting organization Secretaries in the performance of their official duties.
b. Backup Time and Attendance Support 
Provides back-up and support to EXO/HR in completing Time and Attendance coverage for the Mission, in the absence or preoccupation of the official Timekeeper.
The contractor is eligible for temporary duty (TDY) travel to U.S., or to other Missions abroad, to participate in the \xe2\x80\x9cForeign Service National\xe2\x80\x9d Fellowship Program, in accordance with USAID policy.
3. Supervisory Relationship
The incumbent is directly supervised by the USAID/Afghanistan Executive Officer, and under day-to-day administrative supervision of the HR Specialist/Assistant. Assignments are made both orally and in writing. Work is reviewed in terms conformance to policy and procedures, and results achieved. \xe2\x80\x82\xe2\x80\x82
4. Supervisory Controls 
None.
10. AREA OF CONSIDERATION: 
Cooperating Country Nationals (CCN), meaning an individual who is a cooperating country citizen or a non-cooperating country citizen lawfully admitted for permanent residence in the cooperating country. 
11. PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The work requested does not involve undue physical demands.
12. POINT OF CONTACT:-
Any questions about this solicitation may be directed to: KblAIDHR@usaid.gov. Applications submitted to this email address will not be considered.
Note: No in-person appointments or telephone calls will be entertained, unless you are required to have more information about this solicitation. Administrative II. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED FOR THIS POSITION
a. Education: Completion of two (2) college study towards a diploma in Secretarial Science or Business Administration is required. (Education requirement must be met at the time of application for the subject position).
b. Work Experience: A minimum of two (2) years of secretarial or clerical experience is required. (Work experience requirement must be met at the time of application for the subject position).
c. Language: Level IV (Fluent) in speaking/reading English, and Level IV (Fluent) in speaking/reading of Dari and/or Pashtu is required. (English language ability will be tested).
d. Knowledge: The incumbent must have a good understanding of general document preparation, and have, or be able to quickly develop, a familiarity with USAID activities and programs, as well as a general knowledge of office procedures and practices. The Secretary should have a good working knowledge of file management, mail handling, and correspondence formatting.
III. EVALUATION AND SELECTION FACTORS
\xe2\x80\xa2 Work Experience   40 points
\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge    30 points
\xe2\x80\xa2 Skills and Abilities  30 points
 Maximum Points:         100 points
After an initial application screening, the best qualified applicants will be invited for a written examination, English Proficiency Test and to an oral interview.'

b'Base Logistician Job SummaryImplement the logistics policy of the mission to ensure good logistical performance and provide the best possible support to the programs throughout his/her zone Mission 1: Implement and ensure the performance of the supply chain
The Base Logistician is responsible for:
- ensuring conformity with ACF procedures at each stage of the supply chain
- performance in respect of costs, quality and timeliness in the supply chain (purchasing, transport, stock) throughout his/her zone
- advice, information and alerts on the processing of requests to the requesters
- comprehensive knowledge of the market in his/her zone
- timely and high quality reporting on his/her area of activity
\xef\x83\x98 Putting in place ACF logistical procedures and training and supervising both clients and suppliers in the application of these procedures
\xef\x83\x98 Contributing to the Project Procurement Plan at the launch of new projects
\xef\x83\x98 Monitoring the Supply Plan
\xef\x83\x98 Establishing the Treasury Forecast
\xef\x83\x98 Receiving and approving the Procurement Requests and updating the Procurement Follow-Up
\xef\x83\x98 Putting in place and arranging for purchases in a timely manner and in accordance with the ACF procedures applying to each purchase (goods, tasks, services, premises)
\xef\x83\x98 Negotiation and selection of suppliers
\xef\x83\x98 Controlling deliveries to bases and programs
\xef\x83\x98 Control stock management (storage conditions, reporting, expiry dates) and stock movements
\xef\x83\x98 Collecting data on the market and local suppliers
Mission 2: Implement and ensure the performance of facilities management
The Base Logistician is responsible for:
- safety of the working and living environment
- provision and maintenance of logistical equipment
- security of logistical equipment, training and assistance to users
- supervision of the building, rehabilitation and maintenance required for the functioning of the base and the living environment
- provision of water and energy supplies to all buildings required for the functioning of the base and the living environment
- timely and high quality reporting on his/her area of activity
\xef\x83\x98 Undertaking or supervising the installation, maintenance and repair of logistical equipment
\xef\x83\x98 Maintaining the equipment list at the base
\xef\x83\x98 Assessing the needs for logistical equipment and ensuring proportional allocation
\xef\x83\x98 Carrying out an inventory and reporting on the state of repairs of property on arrival and departure
\xef\x83\x98 Supervision of the energy sources and vehicle fleet management : maintenance, planning, monitoring costs, administrative aspects (insurance, documentation)
\xef\x83\x98 Supervision of security guards and drivers
\xef\x83\x98 Maintain update list of smoke and carbon monoxide detectors and fire extinguishers
Mission 3: Implement and ensure the performance of information and communication technology and network management
The Base Logistician is responsible for:
- the setting up and efficient operation of the means of communication (voice and data) in accordance with ACF standards
- the security of both equipment and its users
- training and support to users
- rationalization of the costs of equipment utilization
- assistance to the Logistical Coordinator in the strategic choice of equipment
\xef\x83\x98 Undertaking or supervising the installation, maintenance and repair of equipment
\xef\x83\x98 Maintaining the equipment list
\xef\x83\x98 Assessing the needs for equipment and ensuring proportional allocation
\xef\x83\x98 Putting in place rules for the use of equipment and ensuring they are observed
Mission 4: Contribute to security management
The Base Logistician is responsible for:
- working with the person in charge of the base on the definition of a local security plan
- putting in place security guidelines for the base and ensuring they are properly applied  
\xef\x83\x98 Maintenance of an effective network, with local input, on contextual and security matters, collection  and analysis of information to inform the risk and context analysis undertaken by the person in charge of the base
\xef\x83\x98 Security briefing and training of ACF teams
\xef\x83\x98 Monitoring the application of security procedures, issuing reminders and alerting the person in charge of the base as and when necessary
\xef\x83\x98 Manage the key system backup for the base and allocation to the people when necessary
Mission 5: Manage the Logistics team
The Base Logistician is responsible for:
- day-to-day management of his/her team (guidance, follow-up, motivation)
- evaluating the performance and developing the skills of his/her team members
- management of the teams for which s/he is support/technical Manager
\xef\x83\x98 Defining the Human Resources needs in his/her area of activity and producing the organizational chart of his/her team
\xef\x83\x98 Taking part in the recruitment of his/her teams
\xef\x83\x98 Organizing and leading team meetings
\xef\x83\x98 Working out and monitoring individual action plans for team members
\xef\x83\x98 Managing planning operations, task sharing and coordination of work
\xef\x83\x98 Providing for evaluation interviews for team members
\xef\x83\x98 Providing technical support to the teams
\xef\x83\x98 Identifying the training needs of team members
\xef\x83\x98 Devising, organizing and leading training sessions
\xef\x83\x98 Managing difficulties in the team Administrative Diploma / Level of studies : University Degree Certificate or equivalent in logistics or relevant working experience in logistics'

b'Female HR Analyst Job SummaryThe Human Resources Analyst shall possess a mastery of advanced Human Resource Management (HRM) principles, concepts, regulations, and practices, analytical methods and techniques, and seasoned consultative skill sufficient to resolve HRM problems not susceptible to treatment by standard methods.  
The Human Resource Analyst will be involved in the various phases of human resources management specifically, administrative support positions that supervise, lead, or perform human resources (HR) assistance work requiring substantial knowledge of civilian and military HR terminology, requirements, procedures, operations, functions, and regulatory policy and procedural requirements applicable to HR transactions. 1. Conduct fact finding and recommend solutions to moderately difficult but well-precedent and/or recurring issues and problems using the knowledge of, and skill in applying, fundamental Human Resource Management (HRM) laws, principles, systems, policies, methods, and practices; as well as interviewing, analytical, and research techniques.
2. Apply fundamental HR methods, principles, and practices of the specialization(s); and standardized analytical and evaluative methods and techniques.
3. Provide advice and resolve moderately complex, non-controversial, well-precedent factual, procedural, and recurring issues for which there are one or more readily apparent solutions.
4. Make informed judgments on problems and issues.
5. Develop new or modified HR work methods, approaches, or procedures for delivering effective HR services.
6. Provide written and oral communication techniques sufficient to develop and deliver briefings, project papers, status and staff reports, and correspondence to Managers to foster understanding and acceptance of findings and recommendations.
7. Plan, organize, and direct team efforts to persuade management officials to accept and implement recommendations, where the proposals involve substantial agency resources or require extensive changes in established procedures and methods.
8. Analyze factual data to identify the scope and nature of problems or issues, and determining the appropriate action from among many alternatives.
9. Apply appropriate standards in determining the titles, grades, and series codes of lower-grade positions.
10. Apply a standardized body of HR rules, procedures, and operations concerning human resource development.
11. Apply an extensive body of HR rules, procedures, and operations concerning recruitment and placement.
12. Apply an extensive body of HR rules, procedures, and operations concerning human resource development.
13. Identify major duties of the positions being filled and comparing requirements of the positions being filled with the backgrounds of applicants to determine that minimum eligibility requirements have been met. Determine the relative degree to which applicant experience meets various rating factors. Rank applicants based on their demonstrated ability to perform specific work.
14. Develop, interpret, and analyze data extracts and reports from automated HR databases and develop the most efficient and effective automated systems approaches for presenting HR reports and graphics for management.
15. Provide support to HR specialists involved in one or more specialties such as classification and employee benefits.
16. Log HR action requests into the automated tracking system.
17. Forward actions through the system to an HR specialist or other employee assigned to perform the next action on the document.
18. Assist the HR Manager in developing Human Resources Management Policies and Procedures.
19. Contribute to the wellbeing of all staff members and deal with lower staff concerns and queries and provide solutions, in consultation with relevant supervisor. Human Resource 1. At least Two (2) years of professional experience with national, international and agencies in the field of Human Resources 
2. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Human Resources or business discipline 
3. Excellent computer literacy skills in MS Office (Word and Excel) and HR Management systems.
4. Experience in human resource management, including HR management software
5. Excellent communication, interpersonal and training skills.'

b'Team Assistant, (Temporary Appointment at Grade GS.4) Job SummaryPurpose of the Post:
To provide a variety of secretarial/administrative work in support of Project/programme activities.
Objectives of the Programme:
To deliver WHO core functions at country level with a particular focus on the organization\xe2\x80\x99s directing and coordinating role for international health as expressed in the Constitution. In this framework, specific activities include: 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support to the formulation, implementation and evaluation of national health policies, strategies, and plans;
\xe2\x80\xa2 Development and management, at the country level, of the organization\xe2\x80\x99s programme of technical cooperation and coordination of the organization\xe2\x80\x99s activities with those of other bodies and with the Government\xe2\x80\x99s National Health Programmes to this end. Terms of Reference :
Under the direct supervision of National Professional Officer, Nutrition and over all guidance of the Head of WCO, Afghanistan, the incumbent will perform the following duties:
1.    Provide a full range of secretarial services, ensuring that deadlines are met and correspondence and queries are responded to in a timely manner. Type and edit technical reports, documents and presentations in accordance with WHO style, draft general correspondence on own initiative or upon instructions. 
2.    Receive, screen and process incoming correspondence and requests, obtaining and attaching background information and forward to the staff concerned; drawing their attention to specific issues/problems as necessary.
3.     In close coordination with the Administration/Finance unit, process all requests related to programme activities, such as procurement of goods and services, DFC, APWs, Fellowships, consultants, etc, obtain necessary approvals and initiate action in GSM. Follow up with concerned parties the completion of deliverables and payments.
4.     Make necessary arrangements for field visits and duty travel of team members, consultants and visiting missions, follow up on ticket and hotel reservations, security clearances, and initiate the travel requests in GSM.
5. Assist in organizing meetings, workshops and training activities, by typing documents and presentations, sending letters to participants, photocopying and preparing files, follow up with logistics units regarding arrangements. Provide secretarial support during meetings. 
6. Screen and receive visitors and telephone calls, make appointments, answer queries of and/or redirect visitors and callers. Update and maintain records and reference files.
7. Replace support staff, and perform other related duties including provision of support to other areas of work and teams as required.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Administrative Education:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Essential: Completion of secondary education supplemented by secretarial/administrative training
\xe2\x80\xa2 Desirable: University degree in business administration, Social Sciences of related field is an asset
Experience:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Essential: At least two to four years of relevant secretarial/ administrative experience.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Desirable: Related Experience in the UN system.  
Languages:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Fluency of spoken and written English and local languages.
IT Skills:
 - Ability to operate PC and good knowledge of Microsoft 2003/2007.
- Knowledge of GSM/Oracle applications is an asset.'

b'Admin & HR Officer Job SummaryThe Admin & HR Officer will be responsible for all HR related activities, including policies and procedures implementation, incentive programs, hiring and firing, conducting of events and conducting performance evaluation with other departmental Managers and providing support in the various Human Resource and Administration functions to Top managements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify and analyze the staff vacancy, developing the job description, advertising the position, and long listing  the potential candidates.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Arrange the written test, schedule the interviews, participate in the interview and select the best suitable candidate 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Update and maintain accurate records of all filing system and other related documents of HR department 
\xe2\x80\xa2  Facilitate training for the employees on regular basses 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Draft Letters such as employee\xe2\x80\x99s verification, job offer, termination, appreciation, experience etc.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Attendance Management and preparation of Attendance Report to make sure that staff gets pay correctly and on time.
\xe2\x80\xa2  Negotiate Job Offers, Employment contracts, salaries, working conditions with staff.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Conducting and participating in weekly meetings 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Process, audit for errors and keeping the soft and hard record of payroll, attendance report, recruitment file, and other documents.
\xe2\x80\xa2  Conducting of performance evaluation to ensure that all staff are appraised on regular basses to identify skills gaps, training needs as well as the breakdown of poor, satisfactory and high performing staff.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Respond to all personnel and performance issues in an effective and professional manner, with support of General Manager
\xe2\x80\xa2 Plan and conduct new employee orientation to foster positive attitude toward organizational objectives.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate the separation of employee as per HGML\xe2\x80\x99s procedure and processing final sentiments as per policy.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Provide current and prospective employees with information about policies, job duties, working conditions, monthly package, and opportunities for promotion and employee benefits.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Check and control vehicle logbooks, fuels and prepare fuel requests as and when needed.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare purchase request form for purchase of goods etc. if needed
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that regular cleaning and maintenance of office facility is done by the projects support staff as well as manage safety and security at the office.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that records of vehicle licensing and insurance are maintained to facilitate the necessary renewal of same on time
\xe2\x80\xa2 Keep filing system up to date and accessible for the department. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Develop action plan and tracking sheet for activates related to administration and project.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Other Tasks or responsibilities assigned by the department head.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Human Resource 1. Bachelor degree in Business Administration ( HR) 
2. 3 years of work experience in Admin & HR is required'
