b'Head of Human Resources Department Job SummaryMission 1 : Contribute to defining mission strategy
Mission 2 : Supervising the staff administration and payroll
Mission 3 : Provide for the recruitment and training of all employees and promote career development
Mission 4 : Ensure a coherent organisation of work and establish a policy of compensation and benefits
Mission 5 : Implement collective rules and communicate internally
Mission 6 :  Promote and ensure collaboration and coordination in Human Resources with the mission\xe2\x80\x99s partners
Mission 7 : Prevent and manage cases of fraud and corruption
Mission 8 : Manage the Human Resources team and the home staff in capital and be support/technical Manager for Human Resources Managers in the bases Mission 1 : Contribute to defining mission strategy
The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for:
- developing a Human Resources strategy for the mission
- making Human Resources data available to other departments to facilitate the establishment of the country strategy
- producing high quality and timely Human Resources contributions to "proposals" and reports for funding bodies
\xef\x83\x98 Contributing a Human Resources perspective to coordination discussions
\xef\x83\x98 Advising other departments on their Human Resources needs
\xef\x83\x98 Ensuring that Human Resources needs and constraints are taken into account in the preparation of projects
\xef\x83\x98 Collecting data and writing the Human Resources section of proposals and reports to funding bodies and contributing to the financing plan
\xef\x83\x98 Ensuring that his/her contribution to \xe2\x80\x9cproposals\xe2\x80\x9d and reports is consistent with the rest of these documents
\xef\x83\x98 Representing the mission to outside bodies on issues of Human Resources and developing a network for the exchange of information and good practice
Mission 2 : Supervising the staff administration and payroll
The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for:
- designing and putting in place administrative and payroll procedures which conform to social legislation and with ACF and its funding bodies\xe2\x80\x99 guidelines
- the quality of the tools used in staff administration and payroll, and the reliability and transparency of the data
- conformity with the contractual obligations of ACF vis-\xc3\xa0-vis its employees
\xef\x83\x98 Supervision of the drafting, monitoring and termination of employment contracts of local employees and follow-up of the termination of employment contracts of expatriate staff members
\xef\x83\x98 Checking the documentation of staff files and the archiving of documents according to guidelines laid down by ACF and its funding bodies
\xef\x83\x98 Supervising the collection of data relative to variable elements in staff pay (monitoring hours worked, salary advances, bonuses, deductions etc) for locally recruited and expatriate employees and for the production of  local employees' payroll
\xef\x83\x98 Monitoring the social benefits paid directly by ACF to both locally recruited and expatriate staff (child allowances and other benefits)
\xef\x83\x98 Administering requests for loans by local staff and monitoring their repayment
\xef\x83\x98 Checking the tax returns of local staff and ensure timely payment of taxes to the authorities concerned
\xef\x83\x98 Checking on visas, work permits, expatriates' declarations to the local authorities, and ensuring that all local taxes are paid
\xef\x83\x98 Supporting Human Resources staff on the bases in the implementation of administrative tools and procedures relating to staff administration and payroll
\xef\x83\x98 Producing reports, both monthly and whenever required by headquarters, authorities and funding bodies  
\xef\x83\x98 Monitoring the strict application of contractual requirements and reminding Managers of internal regulations and the social rights of local and expatriate employees
\xef\x83\x98 Monitoring the movements of expatriate employees: breaks, arrival/return to mission, ensuring that regulations are adhered to and forwarding the relevant documents to headquarters and other interested parties
Mission 3 : Provide for the recruitment and training of all employees and promote career development
The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for::
- putting in place fair and transparent procedures for recruitment, access to training, promotion and internal mobility, in accordance with legal requirements and ACF guidelines
- using all necessary means in the search for appropriate candidates for vacant posts
- providing employees with the means to acquire the skills necessary for the proper exercise of their functions
- ensuring that all employees have access to a formal annual appraisal meeting (or meetings), that such meetings are of high quality and that they take place on the planned date   
\xef\x83\x98 Adapting the ACF recruitment policy for local employees to the local context and taking part in the recruitment of both local and expatriate employees
\xef\x83\x98 Defining and implementing the induction process for new employees
\xef\x83\x98 Drawing up an annual training plan for local employees, monitoring its operation and producing a review on the basis of feedback from employees and their managers
\xef\x83\x98 Maintaining relations with universities and other external sources in the context of recruitment and training policies
\xef\x83\x98 Setting down a procedure for individual appraisal interviews and the associated annual schedule, monitoring its application and the quality of outcomes  
\xef\x83\x98 Promoting the career development of local employees, in particular by making use of the process of appraisals and training
\xef\x83\x98 Providing support to managers and training new managers in matters of recruitment, appraisals and team management
\xef\x83\x98 Providing support to Human Resources staff on the bases in implementing the tools and procedures of recruitment, training and career management
 Mission 4 : Ensure a coherent organisation of work and establish a policy of compensation and benefits
The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for:
- ensuring that organisational charts are coherent and are conform to ACF classification grid
- ensuring that remuneration systems are fair and consistent with the cost of living for local employees
- ensuring that all local employees are covered by health care
\xef\x83\x98 Implementing the ACF classification grid and job descriptions and informing headquarters of specific local circumstances
\xef\x83\x98 Advising managers on the drafting of organisational charts for new projects
\xef\x83\x98 Consolidating the organisational chart of the mission and forwarding it to headquarters
\xef\x83\x98 Assessing the efficiency of the organisation and making recommendations
\xef\x83\x98 Establishing the minimum wage and the national salary grid, as well as the procedure for its revision
\xef\x83\x98 Defining the criteria for placement in the national salary grid and the procedure for both collective and individual salary increases
\xef\x83\x98 Defining the national policy for variable elements in staff pay (bonuses, transport costs etc)
\xef\x83\x98 Defining the national policy concerning social benefits and, where appropriate, negotiating contracts and ensuring articulation with external private bodies (medical, retirement, insurances....)
\xef\x83\x98 Drawing up and monitoring the annual budget of the Human Resources department, approving the creation of new posts, calculating costs and financial forecasts relative to the introduction of new projects
\xef\x83\x98 Warning of any difficulty in maintaining the payment of salaries and social benefits in situations of budgetary shortfall
Mission 5 : Implement collective rules and communicate internally
The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for:
- implementing ACF regulations (internal regulations and convention on social benefits) adapted to the local context of the mission and local legislation
- consulting and informing local employees through the medium of staff representatives, in conformity with the relevant social legislation
- providing accurate information to all employees regarding the ACF charter and its organisational regulations (internal regulations and convention on social benefits)
- stimulating internal communications on both general and Human Resources issues
- anticipating risks associated with national Human Resources
\xef\x83\x98 Adapting and updating the internal regulations and the convention on social benefits and ensuring that they are lodged with the relevant authorities
\xef\x83\x98 Putting in place health and safety at work procedures and working towards their improvement as and when necessary
\xef\x83\x98 Advising managers on conflicts with and within their teams and providing mediation when needed
\xef\x83\x98 Being attentive to the social climate in coordination with the Field Coordinators ; preventing and managing conflict
\xef\x83\x98 Defining and implementing the procedure for managing disciplinary problems and sanctions in respect of local employees
\xef\x83\x98 Providing support to Field Coordinators and Human Resources staff in the bases in implementing disciplinary procedures in respect of local employees and approving proposed sanctions
\xef\x83\x98 Maintaining a substantive dialogue and undertaking negotiations with staff representatives
\xef\x83\x98 Preparing and activating social plans in collaboration with the Country Director and the Heads of Departments involved
\xef\x83\x98 Identifying legal, social and financial risks associated with national Human Resources policy (the provision of indemnities on termination of contract, review of dismissals, ongoing judicial proceedings) and flagging up issues where necessary
\xef\x83\x98 Maintaining close relations with local authorities in the domain of Human Resources (labour inspectorate, the Ministry of Labour)
\xef\x83\x98 Securing the services of a lawyer and seeking his/her advice whenever necessary
\xef\x83\x98 Making available and explaining Human Resources regulations and procedures to all employees
\xef\x83\x98 Organising general information meetings for staff
Mission 6 :  Promote and ensure collaboration and coordination in Human Resources with the mission\xe2\x80\x99s partners
The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for:
- participating in the process of selecting partners and validating the Human Resources risk analysis provided by the bases
- defining with partners the modes of Human Resources management in the framework of joint projects
- validating the Human Resources aspects of partnership conventions and agreements
- taking full advantage at mission level of all innovative Human Resources practices in the framework of partnerships
Mission 7 : Prevent and manage cases of fraud and corruption
The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for:
- identifying the risks of fraud and corruption in his/her field of competence and putting in place preventative and monitoring mechanisms
- making his/her team aware of the risks of fraud and corruption
- alerting the Country Director to cases of fraud and corruption and undertaking  corrective action
- putting in place and monitoring recommendations arising from the day-to-day control and audit
Mission 8 : Manage the Human Resources team and the home staff in capital and be support/technical Manager for Human Resources Managers in the bases
The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for:
- day-to-day management of the team (guidance, follow-up, motivation\xe2\x80\xa6)
- evaluating the performance and developing the skills of his/her team members
- management of the teams for which s/he is support/technical Manager
\xef\x83\x98 Defining the Human Resources needs in his/her area of activity and producing the organisational chart of his/her team
\xef\x83\x98 Taking part in the recruitment of his/her teams
\xef\x83\x98 Organising and leading team meetings
\xef\x83\x98 Working out and monitoring individual action plans for team members
\xef\x83\x98 Managing planning operations, task sharing and coordination of work
\xef\x83\x98 Providing for appraisal interviews for team members
\xef\x83\x98 Providing technical support to the teams
\xef\x83\x98 Identifying the training needs of team members
\xef\x83\x98 Devising, organising and leading training sessions
\xef\x83\x98 Managing difficulties in the team Human Resource o You have a master degree in relevant field with minimum 3 years of overall experience with at least 2 years at senior management role 
o Bachelor's degree in relevant field with minimum 5 years\xe2\x80\x99 overall experience with 3 years at senior management role 
o You have experience in developing and implementing HR policies and procedures in a consistent manner.
o You have the ability to work cooperatively with subordinates, colleagues and supervisory staff at all levels.
o You have strong coaching & training skills.
o You are diplomatic, able to mediate conflict in stressful conditions.
o You are comfortable applying HR policies consistently & tactfully.'

b"HR Expert PSU/MoMP Job SummaryUnder the Direct Supervision of HR Coordinator, HR Expert is responsible for the functions related to the providing feedback on HR efforts, In coordination with the HR Coordinator , provide administration of transparent and competitive recruitment and selection processes including drafting of terms of references (TORs), job classification, Vacancy Announcement (VA) advertisements, applicant screening, matrix preparation, scheduling interviews and drafting interview minutes, relevant committee preparation and submission, check-up and other related administrative concerns. 1. Develop an action plan based on job description.
2. Explain Ministries\xe2\x80\x99 personnel policies, benefits, and procedures to employees or job applicants.
3. Assist to verify, and maintain documentation relating to personnel activities such as staffing, recruitment, training, grievances, performance evaluations, and classifications.
4. Record data for each employee, including such information as addresses, weekly earnings, absences, supervisory reports on performance, and reasons for terminations.
5. Process and review employment applications in order to evaluate qualifications or eligibility of applicants.
6. Answer questions regarding examinations, eligibility, salaries, benefits, and other pertinent information.
7. Gather personnel records from other departments and/or employees.
8. Request information from law enforcement officials, previous employers, and other references in order to determine applicants' employment acceptability.
9. Provide assistance in administering employee benefit programs and worker's compensation plans.
10. In coordination with the HR Coordinator , provide administration of transparent and competitive recruitment and selection processes including drafting of terms of references (TORs), job classification, Vacancy Announcement (VA) advertisements, applicant screening, matrix preparation, scheduling interviews and drafting interview minutes, relevant committee preparation and submission, check-up and other related administrative concerns.
11. Maintain and regularly update leave and attendance records of project personnel.
12. Ensure a properly working filing system of local personnel with respect to relevant documents, contracts; follow through with a properly working archive system as required.
13. Develop and implement hiring strategies to meet the human resources needs of an organization.
14. Developing and implementing policies on issues like working conditions, performance management, equal opportunities, disciplinary procedures and absence management.
15. And any other tasks assigned by the direct manager according law and regulation. Human Resource \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, Public Administration, Economy or any other related subject; Master\xe2\x80\x99s preferable.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 5 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in related field.
\xe2\x80\xa2 The candidate must have excellent analytical and drafting skills, ability to listen, be a team player as well as having management and leadership skills.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent analytical, interpersonal and communication skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Able to produce reports and other standards documents up to a professional standard Fluency in English (written and spoken), Pashto and Dari, local language proficiency is desirabl"

b'Recruitment Officer Job SummaryOfficer Recruitment is responsible for managing all recruitment activities in DABS including provinces.
To create effective working system and coordination of recruitment process, its implementation and following up are the main duties of this post. \xe2\x80\xa2 Is responsible for managing all recruitment activities in consideration with recruitment policy and procedure.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To prepare work plan assistants and following up its action. 
\xe2\x80\xa2 To coordinate with regional offices (provinces Breshna Directorates) in employees\xe2\x80\x99 recruitment.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Collecting and finalizing the job descriptions of vacancies and make them for announcement.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for completing all recruitment documents prior to assign the candidate.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for posting vacancies inside the company through portal / notice board.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for collecting and shortlist of CVs for posts.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for coordinating the interviews like written and panel interviews.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for preparing and evaluation of proposal and contracts of employees.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Design and creation of working methods and recruitment procedure and remarks for its amendment.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To manage recruitment committee while interviewing.
\xe2\x80\xa2 To consult the assistants for receiving work reports.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Performing any other human resources duties as directed by direct supervisor Human Resource BBA, Law , 2 yaers Experience ,'

b"HR Officer PSU/MoMP Job SummaryUnder the Direct Supervision of HR Coordinator of PSU Directorate, HR Officer is responsible for the functions related to the HR operations of the PSU Directorate and other developmental projects of MoMP, Including explanation of Ministries\xe2\x80\x99 personnel policies, benefits, and procedures to employees or job applicants, record data for each employee, including such information as addresses, weekly earnings, absences, supervisory reports on performance, and reasons for terminations. 1. Prepare/develop an action plan for him/her based on jobs description.
2. Explain Ministries\xe2\x80\x99 personnel policies, benefits, and procedures to employees or job applicants.
3. Process, verify, and maintain documentation relating to personnel activities such as staffing, recruitment, training, grievances, performance evaluations, and classifications.
4. Record data for each employee, including such information as addresses, weekly earnings, absences, supervisory reports on performance, and reasons for terminations.
5. Process and review employment applications in order to evaluate qualifications or eligibility of applicants.
6. Answer questions regarding examinations, eligibility, salaries, benefits, and other pertinent information.
7. Examine employee files to answer inquiries and provide information for personnel Actions
8. Gather personnel records from other departments and/or employees.
9. Search employee files in order to obtain information for authorized persons and organizations.
10. Request information from law enforcement officials, previous employers, and other references in order to determine applicants' employment acceptability.
11. Compile and prepare reports and documents pertaining to personnel activities.
12. Inform job applicants of their acceptance or rejection of employment.
13. Select applicants meeting specified job requirements and refer them to hiring personnel.
14. Provide assistance in administering employee benefit programs and worker's compensation plans.
15. Performing any other tasks related to the position which, on the basis of laws, regulations and the goals of ministry will be addiction.
Reporting Obligation:
\xe2\x80\xa2 The HR Officer will report to HR Coordinator. Human Resource \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelors degree in Business administration, Management, Economics or other related field 
\xe2\x80\xa2 Prospective HR Officer should have a background in Human Resources) with 4 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in related field.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Past work experience with the donors or donor funded projects in the context of Government Line Ministrie"

b'Project Analyst Job SummaryThe incumbent will work with the Projects Team to plan and execute economic/infrastructure programs/projects. He/she will be responsible to analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of projects, identify problem areas and provide recommendations to improve projects/program effectiveness. He/she will also be responsible to develop new or modified policies, processes, or performance measures, which helps better implementation of the projects. Provide analysis and assistance in planning and implementation of projects that impact Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s economic growth
Ensure development of effective project management strategies focusing on achievement of results;
Conduct impact analysis of strategies already implemented
Identify project issues and escalate them to avoid project delays
Hold regular meetings with the private sector to identify sectoral challenges 
Strengthen relationships with private sector, relevant government organizations, and foreign partners
Continuously follow up for decision implementation
Do other tasks as assigned by the Senior Advisor to the President Government Education:
At least Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Business Administration or closely related fields 
Language:
Fluent in written and spoken Dari/Pashto and English languages 
Experience:
At least 2 years of relevant experience. Preference will be given to candidates with additional years of experience.'

b'Migration Statistics Specialist - Reannounce Job SummarySummary of the Position Providing technical assistance on the preparation of statistics related to internal and international migration, in accordance with the direction of the relevant director Duties and Responsibilities \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing work plan in accordance with the general plan of the Central Statistics Organization (NSIA) in order to achieve the goals set by the NSIA \xe2\x80\xa2 Providing technical assistance on the collection of information regarding migrations \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring the quality of the collected data \xe2\x80\xa2 Studying, checking and controlling the migration data and ensuring it is worth of providing to national and international authorities and it does not possess any kind of errors and flaws \xe2\x80\xa2 Creating the required tables regarding the major migration indicators on international level for the usage of relevant department \xe2\x80\xa2 Developing questionnaires for migration surveys, analyzing migration data and establishing and developing the indicators related to migration, immigration, emigration, returnees, displacements and other indicators related to migration  \xe2\x80\xa2 Analysis of migration data taking into account the relevant SDG indicators. \xe2\x80\xa2 Writing reports on migration statistics \xe2\x80\xa2 Implementing the objectives of the programs in the directorate of population statistics in order to achieve the desired goals. \xe2\x80\xa2 Training and transferring knowledge, skills and experience to the staff of relevant department \xe2\x80\xa2 Performing other duties and tasks assigned by the top management in accordance with the laws and regulations of the organization.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Training and transferring knowledge, skills and experience to the staff of relevant departmentTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Government Qualifications Qualifications and Experience: Migration Statistics Specialist would have the following qualification and work experience; \xe2\x80\xa2 A Master degree with 1 year of relevant experience in Demography, Economics, Business Administration, Mathematics or Statistics. \xe2\x80\xa2 A bachelor degree with 2 years of relevant experience in Demography, Economics, Business Administration, Mathematics or Statistics and Computer (Combined Degree). \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient user of MS Office and one of the statistical analysis software SPSS, STATA and R \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong communication skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work in a team.'

b'Admin Assistant Officer Job SummaryAdministrative Assistant Officer will be hired to perform all administrative tasks of VHC with national/international and having a good communication skill with VHC donors and etc. Under the direct supervision of the VHC head and representative, the administrative assistant is responsible for planning, coordinating and implementing , daily, weekly, monthly and yearly reports of development implementation activities for VHC head and representative. 1. Support VHC head in the areas of development implementation and project remarks. 2. Maintain and monitoring systems of the project and program; supervise and maintain operational expenditures are in accordance with approved documents and that all committing documents are complete and consistent; and report variations from budgets considerations. 3. Organize /select and analyze data from a wide variety of sources, including VHC corporate systems and data. 4. Monitor the receipt of Government contributions and ensure that all procurements and other documents projects and the office are properly requested and obtained.\xc2\xa0 5. Brief local and international staff, experts, and consultants on specific aspects of allowances, salaries, financial matters, contracts, recruitment etc.\xc2\xa0 6. Ensure the good formal communication with other national/international organizations.  7. Keep proper record of all receipts, payments and close and on time coordination with Donor agencies 8. Purchase, check in and receive daily deliveries from different vendors and distributor as per VHC purchasing procedure. 9. Obtain Approvals from Administration and finance department in due course according to the budget line. 10. Perform other related duties as required Administrative 1. 12th Graduated or University degree in a field related to administration or extensive work experience in relevant areas. 2. Minimum of one year of professional experience in the field of management, administration, development management, including supervisory experience and exposure to personnel management. 3.     Working knowledge of the VHC official language used for communication within the country English and working knowledge of the most widely used local language (Dari and Pashto)'

b"DCOP Job SummaryThe Deputy Chief of Party (DCOP) acts as the company's back up Chief of Party (COP) for Oxus' support of Kabul Carpet Export Center (KCEC) within Afghanistan; In addition to the primary role of assisting with technical matters related to the carpet trade of Afghanistan, the DCOP is responsible for supporting the Chief of Party (COP) in all operational management and decisions necessary to meet agreed upon expectations from the prime contractor. This includes overall project administration and management of the KCEC inclusive of program management and impact; external representation; and coordination with USAID, program partners and stakeholders, other donors and other program contractors. The DCOP serves as the key point of contact when the COP is not available for USAID/Afghanistan, the Afghan government, and any other key stakeholders for the program. General Job Functions: \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide program leadership, managing assigned aspects of the program in Afghanistan, working closely with Oxus Management, the KCEC prime contractor leadership, and COP.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Building strategic partnerships with USAID/Afghanistan \xe2\x80\x9cfor role of COP when COP is not available\xe2\x80\x9d, the Afghan carpet industry and government, and other program stakeholders in the carpet sector.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Works closely with project team members to monitor implementation and to ensure high quality and timely completion and submission of all contractually required deliverables.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinates and Oversees with guidance of COP the design and implementation of efficient, results-oriented, cost-effective interventions to improve Afghan carpet production, exports and new job creation.  Specific Job Functions: \xe2\x80\xa2 Supervisory: Directly supervises Managers; cooperate with the COP to supervise employees; and addresses any personnel and management issues that escalate to a senior level needing direct oversight. Carries out responsibilities in accordance with office policies and applicable U.S. and Afghan laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, training and supervising Mangers; planning, assigning and directing work; appraising performance; addressing complaints; and resolving problems before they are escalated to a senior level.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Introduces the COP to carpet manufacturers and assists KCEC in vetting carpet makers for each project.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Arranges meetings between manufacturers, KCEC and customers utilizing online media options \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversees the KCEC personnel on the process of product development , order entry, carpet production, inspections, (repairs, if necessary), packing, export paperwork, customs clearing and shipping.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Acts as KCEC principal liaison when the COP is not available. Responds to office visits and telephone inquiries from clients, and other stakeholders \xe2\x80\xa2 Provides input and helps oversee the development and implementation of KCEC strategies, business plans and goals. Identifies problems, and introduces policies and procedures through an organized recommendation and acceptance policy directly with the COP \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversees development and implementation of employee standard operation procedures.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintains good working relationships with the COP, Mangers, Functional Leaders, Senior Advisors, Consultants, staff and clients in Afghanistan and bolsters relations with the active prime-contractor and Oxus U.S. based operations.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Undertakes task directives from COP. Reviews daily, weekly, and monthly agenda and assists with received direction.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Meets or beats established deadlines.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Establishes and memorializes best practices and lessons learned.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Works a flexible schedule including long hours, nights and weekends. Comfortable living and working in Afghanistan and not averse to the changing security environment.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Reports directly to the COP. Receives periodic formal performance reviews from the COP as it relates to fulfillment of requirements outlined in the job functions.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Business Administration \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree in Business Administration or any relevant other relevant field, or higher, preferably MBA.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of 5 years of professional experiences in the relevant field, work experience with USAID funded projects in Afghanistan is an advantage. \xe2\x80\xa2 Work experience economic sector and private sector development would be an asset.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent oral and written communication skills in both English and local languages."

b'Receptionist Job Summary 1. WORK AS A BRIDGE: A Bank receptionist is like a bridge between the clients and bank personnel 2. BASIC DUTIES: He or she has to perform the basic duties of clerical which is a combination of administrative work, and banking tasks 3. PROVIDES CUSTOMER SERVICE: Bank receptionist has to provide customer service and must help customers with any queries and provide them with information and guidance needed.  4. DOCUMENT MAINTAINANCE: He or she has to maintain the documents also and deal with supply management, file maintenance and record keeping. 5. HELPING CLIENTS: He or she has to help clients if knows more than one language in translating the interactions 6. Manages the phone desk throughout the day and channelize the calls to the right members of the staff. 7. Taking care of postal and courier consignments. 8. Any other tasks assigned by the line supervisor. Administrative DBA holder with one year of Experience (14th grade graduate), BBA preferable.'

b'Energy Supervisor Job SummaryIn this context, MSF is recruiting  ENERGY SUPERVISOR (for Kunduz Construction Team) MAIN PURPOSE Ensure the day to day management of works and demands related to his field of expertise for all Energy activities. The activities include the construction phase and the project development phase prior to construction. Coordinate, implement and supervise, ensuring all technical and scheduling aspects (technical aspects, drawings, design, and close supervision of all energy works), Energy activities in the project, according to MSF protocols and under the supervision of the Energy Managers. TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES  \xc2\xad Ensure the Energy assessment in collaboration with the Energy Manager, identifying electrical needs and recommending appropriate responses  \xc2\xad Provide support to the logistical and medical teams in the identification, implementation and monitoring of the energy activities in all MSF structures according to the protocols of MSF  \xc2\xad Ensure the implementation of Energy strategies and policies for all MSF structures and outreach activities (safety of installations),  \xc2\xad Ensure the physical organization of materials and tools used in Energy activities (Stock inventories; Receiving, processing and quality control of relevant material; Check that the amounts received are recorded; Monthly consumption follow up)  \xc2\xad Manage the technical teams involved in electrical activities (medical structures and community based related activities). Ensure the site supervision and project management for all construction and/or rehabilitation works related to electrical activities. \xc2\xad Participate in the quality control and implementation for all electrical works  \xc2\xad Support in the administrative part (contract management, market assessment, renewal of documentation etc.) for the activities related to his field of expertise  \xc2\xad Ensure compliance to the Mission policies, procedures, protocols related to his respective technical family for all electrical and cold chain installations and activities  \xc2\xad Train the project Energy technical staff, on daily maintenance tasks and troubleshooting, in order to improve capabilities and ensure their development  \xc2\xad Give regular feedback to the line manager and report directly any issue or incident  \xc2\xad In order to ensure the coverage of the human resources needs and maintain high standards of quality, organize and coordinate the activities of team supervised (week\xe2\x80\x99s schedule, annual leave, absences, etc.), communicate with the HR Admin department all relevant information in due time, evaluate performance, define and ensure the needs for training  \xc2\xad Perform hands on tasks as part of the team whenever required or needed in order to optimize the resources and to contribute with his/her knowledge and experience  \xc2\xad Participate in monthly reports according to guidelines Electrical Engineering MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Education  \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree in Electrical engineering essential  \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient user of MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) essential  \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient user of AutoCAD drawing program essential and Visio drawing program essential Experience  \xe2\x80\xa2 Essential to have at least 2 years in similar position, such as supervision of construction site, development of technical drawings, team management) \xe2\x80\xa2 NGO experience desirable Languages  \xe2\x80\xa2 Dari/Pashtu: oral and written essential  \xe2\x80\xa2 English: oral and written essential  WORKING HOURS AND SALARY Full Time 40 hours a week - 5 days a week  Gross Salary: 32,850 AFN (non-negotiable)'

b'Coordinator - Rem. & Human Capital ( Re- announcement)  Job Summary The mission is to Coordinate Human resources remuneration and human capital process being implemented and ensure compliance  Responsible for the implementation Employee recognition program in order to build a culture of reward & recognition of exceptional performance within MTNA on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis Key Tasks:  Perform the process of Reward & Recognition i.e., the MTN Shine program in MTNA, develop culture of reward and recognition and keep line managers informed of MTN Shine nominees  Educate the business about online Innovation Submission Form processes and criteria, encourage employees to present nominations and review all nominations  Advertise the MTN Shine program inside MTNA premises to inform employees of various stages of the program and of the winners  Develop and implement OpCo change plan to implement integrated recognition framework and drive education campaigns defining the value, benefits and ROI of recognition  Identify constraining factors and causes that hinder managers from recognizing employees,  Develop and implement new initiatives to drive manager led recognition; align these initiatives and assess their impact on the culture of recognition and fostering of MTN values  Facilitate behavioral change and sustenance of manager led recognition  Provide input for process improvement  Prepare all the Human Capital Reports and ensure that all necessary reports are accurately and timely prepared  Daily monitoring of attendance system, Timely reporting of absentees, Timely registration of MTNA employees  Ensure installation of Hand key readers in all MTNA premises  Report /resolve issues of attendance / door system if any  Provide timely and accurate ID cards to the new recruitments, problem solution of the issues raised in MTNA ID cards  Ensure to provide ID cards within 2 days to the employees who lose their IDs and Proper record of the ID cards  Ensure employees get new ID cards with new MTNA logo until the end of March 2011  Prepare accurate list of employees birth dates, Celebrate employees birthdays on the exact dates; also Provide a bouquet of flower on the birthday  Provide a birthday card duly signed by the GM \xe2\x80\x93 HR, concerned Division head and CEO  Clear the invoices of cake and bouquet suppliers on the end of each month and to keep a proper record  Collect the TIN forms from new recruitments and existing if any and Send them to the MoF for the TIN generation  Ensure to provide the original TIN number form to employee  Keep proper record of all TIN numbers issued to MTNA staff  Accurate record keeping of all employees  Ensure presence of necessary documents  Ensure all the relevant documents of employees are timely placed in their personnel file  Ensure all personnel files are properly placed in the hanging files  Ensure the files are placed on MTNA number in the shelves  Ensure all the processes are followed  No single task to be carried out without the proper steps of HR processes  Report any amendments / modifications as required or necessary  Prepare a proper format for the reports  Timely provision of reports required  Ensure the customers are dealt well in your area  Timely request fulfillment of customers  Ensure all clearance forms are processed immediately  Ensure to receive all the necessary items like ID card, SIM card etc  Place all the clearance forms in to the personnel files of employees  Ensure that balance leave of employees are indicate in the clearance forms  Report the reasons in exit interview form to immediate supervisor  Ensure all employees are provided with necessary medical services when needed, Proper tracking of all records  Proper process and tracking of payment reimbursement for Medical service provider  Ensure new comers timely receive their Email ID and official GSM  Proper tracking and record Human Resource Education: Bachelor degree-business degree major in HR or equivalent Experience: 4-5 years of relevant experience Training: Business & HR planning Computer literacy-MS project, MS Word, MS Excel, MS access, MS PowerPoint Statistical analysis'

b'Natural Resources and Infrastructure Statistics Analyst- Reannouce Job SummarySummary of the Position The collection compilation and analysis of natural resources and infrastructure data Duties and Responsibilities Preparing work plan in accordance with the general plan of the Central Statistics Organization (CSO) in order to achieve the goals set by the CSO Preparation and arrangement of tables of statistical figures of natural resources and infrastructure for publishing in the statistical yearbook Ensuring the accuracy and precision of statistical data about natural resources and infrastructure Designing and developing standard questionnaires related to natural resources and infrastructure Analysis of natural resources and infrastructure data taking into account the relevant SDG indicators Writing technical reports on natural resources and infrastructure statistics Completion and filling of questionnaires of national and international organizations in order to provide accurate information Providing constructive advices to resolve the problems of the relevant department Training and transferring knowledge skills and experience to the staff of relevant department Performing other duties and tasks assigned by the top management in accordance with the laws and regulations of the organization Training and transferring knowledge skills and experience to the staff of relevant department. Qualifications and Experience: Natural Resources and Infrastructure Statistics Analyst would have the following qualification and work experience; A Master degree with five years of relevant experience in Economics Environmental Sciences Agriculture Business Administration Mathematics Agricultural Economics Statistics or Engineering (Civil or Mining). A bachelor degree with seven years of relevant experience in Economics Environmental Sciences Agriculture Business Administration Mathematics Agricultural Economics Engineering (Civil or Mining) or Statistics and Computer (Combined Degree). Proficient user of MS Office and one of the statistical analysis software SPSS STATA and R Strong communication skills. Ability to work in a team. Professional Competencies Ability to exhibit strong commitment in the relevant disciplines Excellent written and oral communication skills in English and working knowledge of national languages i.e. Dari and Pashto Ability to work with and be a partner of a team of diverse backgrounds Ability to work efficiently and to meet deadlines Ability to function effectively in a team environment inspiring trust and cooperation of other team member Strong communication negotiating skills and good interpersonal relationsTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Government Qualifications and Experience: Natural Resources and Infrastructure Statistics Analyst would have the following qualification and work experience; \xe2\x80\xa2 A Master degree with one year of relevant experience in Economics, Environmental Sciences, Agriculture, Business Administration, Mathematics, Agricultural Economics, Statistics or Engineering (Civil or Mining). \xe2\x80\xa2 A bachelor degree with two years of relevant experience in Economics, Environmental Sciences, Agriculture, Business Administration, Mathematics, Agricultural Economics, Engineering (Civil or Mining) or Statistics and Computer (Combined Degree). \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient user of MS Office and one of the statistical analysis software SPSS, STATA and R \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong communication skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work in a team.'

b'(DRR) master trainer Job SummaryThe central role of this job holder is to ensure sound technical quality of all disaster risk reduction activities and supporting the participation of community in preparedness, mitigation and response initiatives under SIDA funded project. This will include thorough analysis of local disaster risks, and regular visits to project sites to support and stimulate communities to plan and consider how they can mitigate the impact of disaster and mobilize resources to implement mitigation plan, as well as establishing Eco- Disaster Management Committees in disaster prone areas and providing trainings on ECo-Disaster Risk Reduction and Emergency preparedness and Planning whenever required. The post holder will lead and manage the planning and successful implementation of Afghanaid Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) programme at national level with particular emphasis on the implementation of ECo- Community Based Disaster Risk Management (CBDRM) approach at the provincial level \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate and support the provincial teams on planning, budgeting and implementation of Community Based Eco- Disaster Risk Management activities in Samangan, Ghor, Nangarhar and Badakshan provinces  \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with Afghanaid other programme staff on mainstreaming DRR in to existing programme activities such as agriculture, livelihood, micro enterprise etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop ToRs and coordinate with partner organisations to organise and conduct DRR related capacity development trainings such as CBDRM, First Aid, Search & Rescue, Early Warning & Evacuation and community disaster preparedness etc  \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with ANDMA, Provincial DMA, DRR National Platform and NGO DRR coordination body for advocacy and networking  \xe2\x80\xa2 With the support of DRR specialist, develop Community Based DRR operational guidelines for field staff and work towards developing Afghanaid National DRR programme strategy \xe2\x80\xa2 Work together with DRR specialist and partner organisations to develop DRR training modules and CBDRM manual for field staff  \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in national level Technical Working Groups and contribute to the development of Strategic National Action Plan (SNAP) of the government of Afghanistan  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support ANDMA sub-national tiers at provincial and district level through their capacity development, supporting them to develop National, provincial and district disaster risk management plans through consultative process involving representatives of rural women and men \xe2\x80\xa2 Support field staff to organise and conduct Hazard Vulnerability and Capacity Assessments (HVCAs)  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the field staff to develop community DRR plans based on the HVCAs and implement community level risk reduction activities  \xe2\x80\xa2 Work together with DRR specialist and relevant artists to develop and print disaster preparedness awareness materials such as posters, leaflets etc.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify training needs of the field staff and volunteers and  facilitate capacity development initiatives  \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify best practices related to DRR and develop case studies and other knowledge management outputs for sharing and improvement of the programmes \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in national and international forums and contribute to the on-going debate to develop the DRR sector  \xe2\x80\xa2 Design, resource and deliver DRR-CBDRM capacity development strategy, plan and resources as part of the overall CBDRM strategy and plan, including planning and implementation of community awareness programme to reduce impacts of disaster risks on human life and productive assets (animals, crops, water, etc.); CD will be focused on staff, community-based DRR structures, and government institutions (e.g. district and provincial level tiers of ANDMA) \xe2\x80\xa2 Working closely with relevant provincial teams and district teams members to integrate and mainstream DRR in the ongoing agenda and priorities of existing community and cluster level structures of informal governance (i.e. CDC, CLDC) including establishment of village DRR committees  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support community and cluster level governance structures to identify and prioritise appropriate CBDRM interventions to reduce vulnerabilities of communities to potential future disasters; develop medium term plans and support them to identify financial resources through government and non-governmental sources to fund these interventions \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in Afghanaid internal meetings and discussions to develop systems, guidelines, programme approaches and project proposals  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the field staff to conduct emergency needs assessments as and when necessary. Plan and coordinate emergency response activities in consultation with the senior management  \xe2\x80\xa2 Promoting Gender Equity and Diversity: To ensure that gender is fully taken into account in all aspects of the programme analysis, design and implementation. Others:   To perform any other related duties as required by the line manager. \xe2\x80\xa2 Staff and community capacity development experience including designing capacity development medium term initiatives and delivering them for grassroots \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring and evaluation skills and experience \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to link with other players in the DRR and CBDRM sector working in the province setting \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work against tight timelines \xe2\x80\xa2 Be able to resolve conflicts within community and team  \xe2\x80\xa2 Design and deliver capacity development initiatives b'(DRR) master trainer Job SummaryThe central role of this job holder is to ensure sound technical quality of all disaster risk reduction activities and supporting the participation of community in preparedness, mitigation and response initiatives under SIDA funded project. This will include thorough analysis of local disaster risks, and regular visits to project sites to support and stimulate communities to plan and consider how they can mitigate the impact of disaster and mobilize resources to implement mitigation plan, as well as establishing Eco- Disaster Management Committees in disaster prone areas and providing trainings on ECo-Disaster Risk Reduction and Emergency preparedness and Planning whenever required. The post holder will lead and manage the planning and successful implementation of Afghanaid Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) programme at national level with particular emphasis on the implementation of ECo- Community Based Disaster Risk Management (CBDRM) approach at the provincial level \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate and support the provincial teams on planning, budgeting and implementation of Community Based Eco- Disaster Risk Management activities in Samangan, Ghor, Nangarhar and Badakshan provinces  \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with Afghanaid other programme staff on mainstreaming DRR in to existing programme activities such as agriculture, livelihood, micro enterprise etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop ToRs and coordinate with partner organisations to organise and conduct DRR related capacity development trainings such as CBDRM, First Aid, Search & Rescue, Early Warning & Evacuation and community disaster preparedness etc  \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with ANDMA, Provincial DMA, DRR National Platform and NGO DRR coordination body for advocacy and networking  \xe2\x80\xa2 With the support of DRR specialist, develop Community Based DRR operational guidelines for field staff and work towards developing Afghanaid National DRR programme strategy \xe2\x80\xa2 Work together with DRR specialist and partner organisations to develop DRR training modules and CBDRM manual for field staff  \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in national level Technical Working Groups and contribute to the development of Strategic National Action Plan (SNAP) of the government of Afghanistan  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support ANDMA sub-national tiers at provincial and district level through their capacity development, supporting them to develop National, provincial and district disaster risk management plans through consultative process involving representatives of rural women and men \xe2\x80\xa2 Support field staff to organise and conduct Hazard Vulnerability and Capacity Assessments (HVCAs)  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the field staff to develop community DRR plans based on the HVCAs and implement community level risk reduction activities  \xe2\x80\xa2 Work together with DRR specialist and relevant artists to develop and print disaster preparedness awareness materials such as posters, leaflets etc.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify training needs of the field staff and volunteers and  facilitate capacity development initiatives  \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify best practices related to DRR and develop case studies and other knowledge management outputs for sharing and improvement of the programmes \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in national and international forums and contribute to the on-going debate to develop the DRR sector  \xe2\x80\xa2 Design, resource and deliver DRR-CBDRM capacity development strategy, plan and resources as part of the overall CBDRM strategy and plan, including planning and implementation of community awareness programme to reduce impacts of disaster risks on human life and productive assets (animals, crops, water, etc.); CD will be focused on staff, community-based DRR structures, and government institutions (e.g. district and provincial level tiers of ANDMA) \xe2\x80\xa2 Working closely with relevant provincial teams and district teams members to integrate and mainstream DRR in the ongoing agenda and priorities of existing community and cluster level structures of informal governance (i.e. CDC, CLDC) including establishment of village DRR committees  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support community and cluster level governance structures to identify and prioritise appropriate CBDRM interventions to reduce vulnerabilities of communities to potential future disasters; develop medium term plans and support them to identify financial resources through government and non-governmental sources to fund these interventions \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in Afghanaid internal meetings and discussions to develop systems, guidelines, programme approaches and project proposals  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the field staff to conduct emergency needs assessments as and when necessary. Plan and coordinate emergency response activities in consultation with the senior management  \xe2\x80\xa2 Promoting Gender Equity and Diversity: To ensure that gender is fully taken into account in all aspects of the programme analysis, design and implementation. Others:   To perform any other related duties as required by the line manager. Programme Education / Training Bachelor degree in a relevant field  Master degree in a relevant field  Experience Minimum 3  years hands on experience of CBDRM and Eco- DRR at a middle level programming structure within an international NGO or a large national NGO Having working relationships and understanding of ANDMA at Kabul level, preferably also at provincial level  Competencies, Skills & Abilities \xe2\x80\xa2 Hands on proven track record of Eco- DRR and CBDRM sector \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent written and spoken Dari and Pashtu \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to communicate well in English language  \xe2\x80\xa2 Project cycle management experience \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrative evidence of skills in hazard and vulnerability mapping \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to lead rapid assessments  \xe2\x80\xa2 Staff and community capacity development experience including designing capacity development medium term initiatives and delivering them for grassroots \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring and evaluation skills and experience \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to link with other players in the DRR and CBDRM sector working in the province including the government authorities \xe2\x80\xa2 Computer literacy (word processing, power point, and basic excel) \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to travel extensively  \xe2\x80\xa2 Commitment to Red Cross Code of conduct and Sphere Standards \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience of preparedness work, especially around floods and droughts \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong team building skills and orientation of working in team setting \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work against tight timelines \xe2\x80\xa2 Be able to resolve conflicts within community and team  \xe2\x80\xa2 Design and deliver capacity development initiatives \xe2\x80\xa2 good report writing  \xe2\x80\xa2 Previous experience of having designed CBDRM projects for floods, landslides  and drought mitigation \xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding of grassroots early warning systems  \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of the district and provincial level DRR and CBDRM programmes including of PDMA be an added advantage. Values & attitude \xe2\x80\xa2 Team approach \xe2\x80\xa2 Respect for all views and opinions \xe2\x80\xa2 Commitment to value of equality regardless of gender, faith and ethnicity \xe2\x80\xa2 Respect for local communities and their ways of life  \xe2\x80\xa2 Respect of government authorities   Languages Dari and Pashtu, Uzbek will be a definite advantage'

b'Female Translator Job SummaryIn this context, MSF is recruiting Female Translator OBJECTIVES OF THE POSITION As a translator:  - Translate documents from / to mission language into a local one upon request  - Translate discussions / meetings as requested  - Always keep respect towards patients, collaborators, authorities, military factions and MSF staff participating in discussions.  - Ensure confidentiality of all translation is maintained as directed by the Mission/Project coordination team  - Ensure neutrality and accuracy when translating  - Declare any \xe2\x80\x9cconflict of interest\xe2\x80\x9d when asked to translate (e.g. personal involvement) which would necessitate using other staff members for translation  - Inform international staff about local customs, tradition, etc., that will help understand better the context and better communicate Translation MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS AND COMPETENCIES  Education  - High school diploma (12th class) essential  - University degree desirable  - Proficient user of MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) essential  Experience  - Other experience in similar position desirable  Languages  - Dari/Pashtu: oral and written essential  - English: oral and written essential  - English: knowledge of medical vocabulary is required. WORKING HOURS AND SALARY FULL TIME / ROSTER Salary : 27,250 AFN / Gross Per Month (non negotiable)'

b'Labour Statistics Specialist- Reannounce Job SummarySummary of the Position The collection, compilation and analysis of statistical data of labour statistics, workforce statistics and labour market statistics. Duties and Responsibilities \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing work plan in accordance with the general plan of the National Statistics and Information Authority (NSIA) in order to achieve the goals set by the NSIA \xe2\x80\xa2 Providing advices and technical assistance to the head of labour statistics  \xe2\x80\xa2 The final check and control of numbers and figures related to labour statistics and labour market statistics for sake of ensuring their quality and put forward for publication \xe2\x80\xa2 Studying and reviewing all the prepared data for the questionnaires of ministries, departments and other authorities before forwarding and also ensuring their precision and accuracy \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring data collection from ministries, departments and other authorities in order to overcome deficiencies, solving problems and accelerating the processes of data collection related to labour force and labour market data \xe2\x80\xa2 Designing labour force survey and developing questionnaires for labour force survey  \xe2\x80\xa2 Analyzing labour force data and produce labour force and labour market indicators  \xe2\x80\xa2 Writing technical reports on labour force statistics and labour market statistics \xe2\x80\xa2 Studying the annual statistical tables and standard forms to ensure that they are according to the plan and program of the NSIA \xe2\x80\xa2 Making decisions after the realization of goals and programs of the organization and provide technical advices to the technical working environment of the relevant department \xe2\x80\xa2 Training and transferring knowledge, skills and experience to the staff of relevant department \xe2\x80\xa2 Performing other duties and tasks assigned by the top management in accordance with the laws and regulations of the organizationTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Government Qualifications Qualifications and Experience: Labour Statistics Specialist would have the following qualification and work experience; \xe2\x80\xa2 A Master degree with 1 year of relevant experience in Economics, Business Administration, Mathematics, Agricultural Economics or Statistics \xe2\x80\xa2 A bachelor degree with 2 years of relevant experience in Economics, Business Administration, Mathematics, Agricultural Economics or Statistics and Computer (Combined Degree). \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient user of MS Office and one of the statistical analysis software SPSS, STATA and R \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong communication skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work in a team'

b'Telemarketing Officer Job SummaryTelemarketing officer will answer the phone calls, receive customer orders and solve customers problem over the phone \xe2\x80\xa2 Answer incoming calls from prospective customers \xe2\x80\xa2 Receive orders over the telephone \xe2\x80\xa2 Input order details into the computer system \xe2\x80\xa2 Use scripts to provide information about product\xe2\x80\x99s features, prices etc. and present their benefits \xe2\x80\xa2 Ask pertinent questions to understand the customer\xe2\x80\x99s requirements \xe2\x80\xa2 Persuade the customer to buy by demonstrating how merchandise or services meet their needs \xe2\x80\xa2 Record the customer\xe2\x80\x99s personal information accurately in a computer system \xe2\x80\xa2 Communicate respectfully and politely with potential customers at all times Sales/Marketing Must have a high school degree.'

b"Marketing Officer Job SummaryThe Marketing Officer oversees the company\xe2\x80\x99s marketing campaigns both internally and externally and plays a key part in communicating the organizations marketing message. Preparing, planning, and project managing the publication of all publicity material to maximize brand promotion. Creating marketing campaigns and working with the company's external PR agency to see them executed. Creating and developing new innovative ways to communicate the company message to their existing customers. Contributing to the annual sales and marketing plan. Planning and project managing marketing events and evaluating their success. Evaluating the effectiveness of all marketing activity. Developing and implementing an internal marketing programme. Supporting the marketing manager in day to day marketing activities. Plan, develop and deliver campaigns as agreed within timescales. Sales/Marketing Previous experience in a similar marketing role. Ideally, a degree in marketing although not essential. Strong and confident communicator. Excellent copywriting skills and experience. Design skills including graphics and web design."

b'Social Media Officer Job SummaryUsing a range of social media platforms (YouTube, Facebook and Twitter) to promote special campaigns, events, community-outreach efforts, promotions, etc. on a daily basis. This may include both managing online presence and creating or translating creative content for social networking sites. \xe2\x80\xa2 Using a range of social media platforms (YouTube, Facebook and Twitter) to promote special campaigns, events, community-outreach efforts, promotions, etc. on a daily basis. This may include both managing online presence and creating or translating creative content for social networking sites \xe2\x80\xa2 Managing communities effectively - monitoring, listening and responding to users and online communities in a way which cultivates engagement  \xe2\x80\xa2 Generating internal/external reports from social media platforms to distill key insights. \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor effective benchmarks for measuring the impact of social media programs, and analyze, review, and report on effectiveness of campaigns in an effort to maximize results. \xe2\x80\xa2 Feeding in data required for evaluating performance and effects of campaigns \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in the development of effective communications strategies and approaches \xe2\x80\xa2 Generate work plans and long-term flow sheets \xe2\x80\xa2 Use bulk uploading services of social media content \xe2\x80\xa2 Work well with complementary departments whether internal or external teams, ensuring quality and timely implementation; \xe2\x80\xa2 Capture key insights from social media \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor and advise on risks to project implementation and make recommendations for risk mitigation measures as required;  \xe2\x80\xa2 Community management and day-to-day engagement of users \xe2\x80\xa2 Briefing AV content to support social media campaigns to creative \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide regular and ad hoc updates where necessary at the request of the Country Manager  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure the project filing system (shared drive) is updated on a regular basis, updating the Lapis projects database with relevant creative material;  \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Program Manager/Director in client liaison where appropriate \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide inputs where necessary for promotional and PR materials for Lapis, including the website, YouTube channel, Moby updates and other promotional materials;  \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in the planning and implementation of larger Moby wide initiatives and projects where necessary;  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the Program Team in the development of proposals to clients as requested, including but not limited to the development of production concepts, work plans, budgets and presentations as they relate to social media \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other duties as may be assigned Sales/Marketing \xe2\x80\xa2 1 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in social media marketing and content creation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Displays ability to effectively communicate information and ideas in written format \xe2\x80\xa2 Solid understanding of current social media best practices \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible, organized, and calendar-focused; And able to translate content from English to Dari and Pashto.'

b'Marketing Officer Job SummaryThe Marketing Officer oversees the company\xe2\x80\x99s marketing campaigns and plays a key part in communicating the organization\xe2\x80\x99s marketing message. Contribute in the implementation of marketing strategies Visit the customers on a daily or weekly base to understand their needs and provide them with products Filing and making documents archive for all transactions with customers  Collect money from the customers to whom he sold the goods Support the marketing manager in overseeing the department\xe2\x80\x99s operations Organize and attend marketing activities or events to raise brand awareness Advertising and promotional campaigns for products  Prepare content for the publication of marketing material and oversee distribution Conduct market research to identify opportunities for promotion and growth Analyze and report of market & competitors  Report activities to branch manager according to determined schedule Sales/Marketing Education Degree in Medical Technology, Pharmacy, Nursing and Marketing  (Priority goes to those Having experience in marketing of medical products)'

b'Social Media Marketing Manager Job SummaryThe first order of business is to assess our current social media marketing processes and strategies. Along with the company stakeholders, the SMMM will create and implement the social media strategy framework that will be applied to each client engagement, including RTE\xe2\x80\x99s internal social media program. This position is far from boring! 1. Managing the social media marketing strategy for RTE and RTE\xe2\x80\x99s clients; focusing on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Google+, YouTube, SlideShare. 2. Execution of all social media activities (i.e. tweeting, sharing, engaging, liking, increasing social reach, doing the heavy lifting, etc) for RTE and RTE\xe2\x80\x99s clients. 3. Communicating in a professional, but unique social media \xe2\x80\x9cvoice\xe2\x80\x9d for each client; directly aligned with the clients\xe2\x80\x99 thought leadership and content platform. 4. Creating social media campaigns and calls-to-action that drive target buyers to client sites and generate leads for our clients. 5. Spending hours on LinkedIn every day engaging with our clients\xe2\x80\x99 target audiences by sharing content, finding ways to grow LinkedIn company followership, and improve overall engagement with our clients\xe2\x80\x99 LinkedIn Company Pages. 6. Staying ahead of the curve in leveraging LinkedIn as a professional social media network and as a content hub, such as leveraging LinkedIn Publishing Platform to understand influential content that is shared and the people who are sharing them. 7. Tweeting at least 30 \xe2\x80\x93 50 times a day while engaging influencers to increase the followership of our clients\xe2\x80\x99 social media profiles; receiving multiple mentions and retweets in the process. 8. Posting several Facebook posts each day and finding new ways to leverage Facebook for professional and business purposes. 9. Implementing Social Media SEO tactics aligned with our clients\xe2\x80\x99 keyword and SEO strategies. 10. Working within Hootsuite, Moz, FollowerWonk, dlvr.it and other social media tools. 11. Writing articles about B2B Social Media Marketing for RTE\xe2\x80\x99s inbound marketing blog. 12. Conduct competitive analysis studies on client competitors, including digital footprint analysis. Sales/Marketing 1. Graduated with 4 year degree with focus on Marketing or Journalism from a reputable university. 2. 2+ Years of Social Media Marketing experience in a corporate marketing or agency marketing role. 3. 2+ Years of Social Media Marketing in a B2B capacity. In other words, the primary target audience you\xe2\x80\x99ve been chatting up on social media over the past couple years are business people, professionals, decision makers, and industry thought leaders. 4. 2+ Years of Social Media Marketing experience on all major social media platforms \xe2\x80\x93 LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Google+, YouTube, and SlideShare. 5. Verifiable examples of social media marketing successes and wins. 6. Work as a full time employee remotely from your home office, which can be anywhere in US. We need someone who\xe2\x80\x99s dedicated, and \xe2\x80\x9cworking on the side\xe2\x80\x9d won\xe2\x80\x99t cut it.'
