b'Sales & Marketing Manager Job SummaryThe sales and Marketing Manager is responsible for developing, implementing company strategic sales and marketing policies, plans and procedures in order to identify and attract potential customers and retain existing ones. Where he reports to both top management and manufacturer. 1. Developing and executing sales and marketing policies.  2. Analyzing and forecasting the vehicles market demand. 3. Monitoring the market trend and competitors movement. 4. Communication with manufacturer for demand and supply related issues.  5. Leading the sales team for their daily activities. 6. Participating in both  local and international biddings and negotiating with customers. 7. Reviewing and approving contacts terms and conditions. 8. Generating periodical reports for top management and manufacturer. 9. Representing Sales and Marking department inside and outside the company. 10. Preparing and executing Company\xe2\x80\x99s marketing strategy. 11. Event management and product launching.  12. Conducting market researches and facts finding.  13. Economic and political analyzing of the country situation. 14. Cooperation with company other departments.  15. Any other jobs given by managing director.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Sales/Marketing 1. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Business Administration or Marketing is required; MBA in marketing is desirable.  2. Five years\xe2\x80\x99 work experience in sales and marketing is required minimum three years should be in manager level.'

b'TAPI National Coordinator Job SummaryAbout TAPI Coordination Office: The Turkmenistan- Afghanistan- Pakistan- India Natural Gas Pipeline (TAPI) project aims to export up to 33 billion cubic meters of natural gas per year through, a proposed, approximately 1,800 km pipeline from Turkmenistan to Afghanistan, Pakistan and India.  The TAPI Project Office was established in 2016 and is tasked to work as a management, cooperating and coordination body between government of Afghanistan, TAPI Pipeline Company Limited (TPCL) and other stakeholders of the TAPI project.  TAPI Project Office will work closely with all stakeholders to speed-up and pave the way for better coordination of TAPI activities inside Afghanistan, and represent Afghanistan in TAPI project stakeholders\xe2\x80\x99 meetings. Moreover, the Office will serve as single source for managing, coordinating, reporting and overall cooperating with stakeholders on TAPI project related matters. Job Summary: The TAPI National Coordinator is responsible for organizing and coordinating TAPI Office operations and procedures in order to ensure organizational effectiveness and efficiency and project success and serves as key focal point for the Project at the Ministry of Mines and Petroleum. The TAPI National Coordinator will be responsible for assisting the Ministry of Mine and Petroleum and Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s team of TAPI mainly in following issues:  1) Serves as key focal point for the TAPI project management issues with Ministry of Mines and Petroleum.  2) Prepares action plan for substantial improvement of the support and administrative services in the MoMP to assume a timely progress of the Project.  3) Management, supervision and control of the logistical operations of the Project on day-to-day basis in accordance to strategic plans and policies approved by the MoMP. 4) Managing the Project to ensure plans are effectively implemented, the results are monitored and reported to MoMP. 5) Familiarizes himself/herself with the relevant laws and regulation of Afghanistan and the requirements and relevant Operational Policies of the donors especially the WB. 6) Keeping the MoMP fully informed of all significant operational, financial, environmental and social issues and other matters relevant to the Project.  7) Ensures the Project has developed and implemented relevant environmental and social safeguards management documents reflecting the Afghanistan National Laws and Regulation as well as the WB relevant safeguards policies.  8) Oversees and manages the work of national and international consultants hired to prepare relevant environmental and social safeguards documents, prepares ToRs for the consultants to prepare potential ESIAs, RPF, RAP, ESMPs, GRM, Gender Awareness programs and etc.  9) Exercise appropriate delegation and take final responsibility for the quality and consistency of all documents.  10) Prepare coordination of all aspects of the relevant TAPI agreement with MoMP and relevant directorate as well as stakeholders of the Project.  11) Develop the corresponding operating plans, review and report regularly to the MoMP on the overall progress and results against operating and financial objectives and initiate courses of action for improvement.  12) Establish effective control and coordination mechanisms for all operations and activities, ensures the integrity of the internal control and management systems. 13) Liaising between all stakeholders in the GoIRA as well as external entities, as deemed necessary in the development of TAPI on behalf of GoIRA.  14) Develop and recommend the overall project organizational structure to MoMP ensuring that personnel and systems are in place so that the day to day business affairs of the project are appropriately managed.  15) Develop and recommend strategic plan to MoMP and successfully implement the corresponding annual operating plans. 16) Managing financial objectives by preparing an annual budget, scheduling expenditures, initiating corrective actions. 17) Direct and monitor the activities of the project in a manner that ensures that the assets of the project are safeguarded and optimized in the interests of the entire project. 18) Develop and implement operational policies to guide MoMP within any limits prescribed by the procedure and policies. 19) Ensures that he/she transfers knowledge and skills to other individuals and working teams in an effective regular manner in order to improve managerial ability, motivation and confidence.  20) Coordinate, schedule and assist with MoMP and executive committee meetings and regularly report the project progress with achieving the project\xe2\x80\x99s objective.  21) Develop action plan for social dialogue in areas where the pipeline passes.  22) Liaising between the security sectors and consultations in the security plan.  23) Collaborate with the relevant authorities in order to identify the necessary companies such as mine, buildings and etc.  24) Cooperation and coordination with relevant agencies in order to identify those eligible for studying needed fields of TAPI in respective provinces.  25) Continuous communication with Turkmengaz as consortium leader to identify problems and find solutions and make recommendations to the MoMP to solve problems.  26) Communication with local communities in the pipeline area.  27) Facilitate for registration of Afghan-TAPI Company and its structure in the future based on TAPI project leadership decision. 28) Participate on behalf of Afghanistan in technical meetings and supporting and coordinating the technical team of the sessions based on continuous interactions with the MoMP leadership. 29) Identify areas necessary for building of training centers in the pipeline route.  30) Cooperation and coordination with Afghanistan team and other TAPI member\xe2\x80\x99s countries team in the areas of Afghanistan while administrative or research scale works.  31) Arrange regular awareness meetings for the Afghan people and government about the TAPI project development and coordination of media in this regard.  32) Any other duties given by supervisor. Management The candidate shall have an advanced (Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree) in Law, International Economic, Business Administration, Public Administration or other related fields. Preference will be given to the candidates with higher studies.  Experience:   Experience of working in related field at least 3 years (PhD\xe2\x80\x99s), 5 years (Master\xe2\x80\x99s) and not less than 10 years (Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s). Preference will be given to the candidates with additional years of experience. Languages:'

b'Liaison Officer Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 All Marketing Activities  \xe2\x80\xa2 Processing AGGC Invoices with Ministry of Finance  \xe2\x80\xa2 Processing AGGC Taxes  \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordination with Ministries and NPA \xe2\x80\xa2 Processing AGGC Docs with AISA  \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain a regular communication with the Ministries and other companies  \xe2\x80\xa2 Set up meetings with companies and organizations as per requirement \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform any other duties assigned by the line manager General The Liaison Officer should have at least 3 years of working experience in a similar position, preferably with the private sectors or International NGOs. Excellent command of Pashto and Dari and good command of English\xe2\x80\x93 both written and oral is also necessary. He must also be familiar with software such as: Microsoft Word and Excel. Good communication skills \xe2\x80\x93 both written and interpersonal will be essential, as most of the work will be done through a process of consultation at all levels. Moreover, the candidate must know professionally to ride the motorcycle plus drive the car.'

b'Project Manager Job SummaryUNCDC is seeking an individual for the position of Project Manager (PM). The incumbent will be part of the Project Support Team (PST). He/she will be responsible to ensure the project is managed efficiently and achieves its operational objectives and deliverables. The incumbent will report directly to UNCDC Managing Director and plays a lead role in developing UNCDC projects in designated infrastructure disciplines, including water, energy, roads and vertical structures, and monitors work progress and prepares reports and other key documents for the UNCDC Senior Management and Managing Director. The incumbent plays an important technical role in the design, analysis; project development and management and data collection for UNCDC designated infrastructure activities. The PM\xe2\x80\x99s tasks will be as follows: 1) Develop an in-depth working knowledge of the general contractual and detailed requirements of the construction contract for each project. 2) Observe the execution of construction to assure adherence to approved drawings and specifications, inspect construction workmanship, materials, methods of equipment, and report as to the conformity and non-conformity to the approved drawings and specifications.  3) The Project Manager is responsible for the overall project activities on site. 4) Supervise the on-site monitoring and evaluation of UNCDC construction projects, ensuring that they are being implemented according to designs, schedules, and budgets; advise and supervise the implementation of remedial measures, when necessary. 5) Make recommendations on how to correct deficiencies and resolve problems during construction.  Responsible for all operational aspects of the projects. 6) Overseeing the daily operations of the projects to ensure accurate and correct progress of the projects.          7) Ensuring procurement procedures and financial requirements are being met. 8) Keep the main office updated on the work progress and other issues on site. 9) Review and Edit of design documents and project specifications. 10) Review all the submittal and tests at all stages of the inspection. 11) Ensuring all the materials used and work performed are as per the project requirements and specifications. 12) Day-to-day management of the site, including supervising and monitoring the project labor force and the sub-contractors\xe2\x80\x99 works. 13) Work independently and maintain daily construction surveillance logs ensuring contractor\xe2\x80\x99s compliance with the terms and conditions of the contract between the construction contractor and the UNCDC. 14) Review and analyze contractor\xe2\x80\x99s change order proposals for cost and compliance with the change. Prepare cost of alternatives to design and specifications when requested. 15) Update and monitor contractor construction schedule with regard to ongoing construction, review any proposals for change in construction methods for time implications.  16) Submit recommendations, including recommending the amount of time for extensions that are justified by the change. 17) Review and provide comments for contractor monthly pay applications including issues such as percentage of completion, accounting accuracy, and materials stored onsite. 18) Prepare weekly, monthly, and other reports of the progress of construction as required. Provide digital photographic records to support reports. 19) Review and analyze material samples, catalogs and brochures, shop drawings, installation manuals, and other technical documents submitted by the construction contractor for conformity with construction contract requirements. Prepare written reports of the analysis, incorporating the comments, and provide recommendations and alternatives for appropriate action. 20) Participate in meetings and conduct discussions with local/municipal & security authorities, as appropriate, on matters pertaining to construction site activities when requested. 21) Oversee all the engineering and project management activities of UNCDC (project identification and definition, technical feasibility assessment, engineering design, environmental compliance, construction supervision, operation and maintenance, planning and implementation, and handover of completed projects), including the preparation of the necessary project documentations for client approval and post-implementation audit. 22) Assessment of potential developments and production of detailed technical reports, including site visits with the appropriate members of the management team to ensure the best cost engineered solution is produced for UNCDC projects. 23) Lead, motivate, communicate with, appraise and performance, develop and manage the project personnel to ensure all the personnel are fully motivated to achieve best performance to meet the UNCDC needs. 24) Plan, coordinate and/or supervise activities of projects and sub-contractors from initial contraction stages to completion of punch list and provide drawings to site on a weekly basis & as appropriate. 25) Co-ordinate production information to a written program to ensure company targets are met for a controlled and cost effective finish to the sites. 26) Production of engineering site feasibilities as instructed by the clients to ensure complies with the required standards and business needs; and implement new ideas and methods and continue to seek ways of both improving contribution to the UNCDC goals and enhancing the reputation of the company. 27) Participate in internal meetings and discussions as required by UNCDC senior management and comply, and assist in enforcing compliance, with project code of ethics, policies, rules, and procedures. 28) Assist in the tendering and sub-contracting of UNCDC construction projects and disseminate standards, procedures, and guidelines for construction supervision, including project progress monitoring and evaluation, certification of interim completion, quality control and assurance, environmental-impact mitigation, and health and safety. 29) Develops technical and financial proposals for UNCDC different projects by assembling information including project nature, objectives/outcomes/deliverables, implementation, methods, timetable, staffing, budget, standards of performance, and evaluation; writing, revising, and editing drafts including executive summaries, conclusions, and organization credentials as required. 30) Perform other engineering support duties that may be requested. Liaison with UNCDC main office, coordinate services as required. Engineering a) University degree in Civil Engineering or construction management with 2 years of related experience in handling USACE projects or overall experience of not less than 3 years in the field of construction management and supervision. Prior international donors experience is preferred.  b) Knowledge and ability to interpret engineering drawings and implement the field works. c) Sufficient knowledge of USACE rules, regulations, and procedures desired. d) Fluent in English. Have good command of English language both written and spoken. Candidates who do not have sufficient English language knowledge will be disqualified.'

b'Project Manager Job SummaryThe Project Manager is responsible for project management from inception to the end of the project, including reporting, project budget management, implementation and closeout of \xe2\x80\x9cEncouraging Innovation for Women\xe2\x80\x99s Empowerment in Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x9d project. The Project Manager is also accountable for the successful delivery of all project deliverables in a timely manner, \xe2\x80\x98on budget\xe2\x80\x99, and with the required results as specified in the donor agreement, including quality control, accuracy and timeliness of deliverables, while ensuring compliance with TAF and donor\xe2\x80\x99s requirements, policies and procedures. Job Purpose  \xe2\x80\xa2 Project management from inception to the end of the project. \xe2\x80\xa2 Accountable for successful delivery of the project, ensuring that it is on time, on a budget, and with the required results as specified in the donor agreement.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Strengthen implementing partners and short-term staff capacities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to development of M&E framework, and design activities in a manner which contributes to achieving the outcome and output indicators. Responsibilities:  1. Provide advice and support to project management and implementation \xe2\x80\xa2 Formulate project implementation & mobilization plans for target provinces/districts.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide management and oversee technical requirements, which includes program deliverables and results. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop work plans for the project, and ensure that the project is implemented in accordance with the specific work plans and schedule.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Establish and maintain appropriate project governance and controls, project gates, documentation, reports and information management.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure achievement of all project milestones within the planned timeframe. \xe2\x80\xa2 Review and evaluate incoming proposals from grassroots women\xe2\x80\x99s organizations (GWOs), acquire supplementary information/research as needed. \xe2\x80\xa2 Seek endorsements and communicate with advisors on grant proposals. \xe2\x80\xa2 Enhance and sustain grantee and advisor networks. \xe2\x80\xa2 Write reports and prepare analyses from field reports of grant making activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the preparation of the grant making program budget. \xe2\x80\xa2 Share administrative duties within the grant making team including database management and grants administration. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop strategic grant making priorities for different provinces and districts. \xe2\x80\xa2 Design and conduct institutional capacity building support for recipients of funding based on their own understanding and analysis of their needs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Align the project with national commitments and priorities on women\xe2\x80\x99s rights and influence fulfilling these commitments.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Design and implement the annual survey on women\xe2\x80\x99s empowerment to evaluate the impact of the project on the overall goal of improving women\xe2\x80\x99s empowerment in Afghanistan. \xe2\x80\xa2 Review partners\xe2\x80\x99 narrative and financial reports to ensure they are accurate and matching the requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Respond to all project reporting requirements, including monthly, quarterly, bi-annually and annual program reports, and other deliverables, as specified in the contract. \xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to fundraising initiatives, including assisting in the writing of proposals. \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee performance management of project staff, technical experts and consultants and ensure compliance with TAF and donor\xe2\x80\x99s rules and regulations and policies, and provide timely feedback to them. \xe2\x80\xa2 Design a closeout plan and prepare project closeout report. 2. Advocacy and promotion of Foundation\xe2\x80\x99s mandate and mission  \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage events and publications on project related issues contributing to strengthening women\xe2\x80\x99s voice and leadership in Afghanistan. \xe2\x80\xa2 Strengthen Foundation\xe2\x80\x99s networking with grass roots women, women networks/alliances and other relevant organizations to develop grant making and programmatic partnerships and collaborations. \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate and represent in relevant forums, conferences and trainings.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support formulation of strategies and monitor progress towards the achievement of project goals.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Implement relevant, high-impact advocacy campaigns with key partners.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to knowledge networks at the provincial and local level.  3. Budget & financial management  \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop project budgets and ensure spending projections are kept up-to-date, expenditures are within approved budgets, that spending targets are met, and that appropriate steps are taken in managing the project budget in accordance with the donor agreement.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Lead on initiating relevant procurement processes in line with programme spending and procurement planning. 4. Monitoring, evaluation, accountability and learning  \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Director WEP with ongoing reviews and evaluation of whether initiative is reaching the right target group and achieving its goals.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure, in conjunction with the M&E staff an effective monitoring & evaluation, accountability and learning of the entire project, including meeting the progress of the Key Performance Indicators. \xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute towards shared learning initiatives including documentation of best practices emanating from the project. 5. Internal and external relations \xe2\x80\xa2 Extensive interaction with Director WEP, project teams and relevant departments.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Represent the programme along with the Director WEP and project staff in meetings, and with government and implementing partners.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain healthy relationship with government agencies/line departments and cooperating organizations operating in the districts and provinces of the operation 6. Identify problems or risks \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify any potential issues or risks that could affect the progression of the programme(s).  \xe2\x80\xa2 Must communicate these items with the Project Manager, and work to identify potential solutions. 7. Communication \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain good communication with colleagues and implementing partners. \xe2\x80\xa2 Checking that everything is working smoothly, and alerting the Project Manager if they endanger the programme(s). Management Knowledge/Qualification \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s or Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in related field, or equivalent work experience. \xe2\x80\xa2 Sound knowledge of women\xe2\x80\x99s empowerment, gender equality, women\xe2\x80\x99s voice and leadership concepts. \xe2\x80\xa2 Familiarity with risk management and quality assurance control. Experience  \xe2\x80\xa2 A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience at the national level in women\xe2\x80\x99s empowerment programmes, community organizations, advocacy and or grant-making. \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in providing capacity building services and establishing/maintaining networks or alliances.   \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated project design and management experience. \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated experience in advocacy, monitoring and evaluation of development projects. \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated experience in developing of project work plans and budgets.'

b'Construction Manager Job SummaryTo lead a team of MTP1-002 for successful and on time completion of Project considering the contents of the contract, requirement set forward by the Project Manager and the Employer and policy of the company. Construction Manager will have the following duties and responsibilities: - Assist Contractor Representative in Management of the contract, - Preparing daily, weekly, monthly workplan and reports, - Read the contract and manage the entire works of the project accordingly, - Prepare and submit the submittals and obtain approval, - Communicate with PM and the Employer, - Manage the subcontractors, - Supervise the works of site engineers, foremen, QC and Safety officers, Electrical and Plumbing, Engineers, surveyor, Lab technician, etc. - Communicate with designers about the designing works and obtain approvals, - Any other works related to the project. Engineering - Construction of Pump House with installation of 3 x 850 m3/h horizontal pumps including all mechanical and electrical works, -  Construction of two suction concrete tanks, 1000 m3 capacity each -  Construction of Generator House including installation of 1 x 1.5 MW generator and fuel tank -  Construction of Chlorination House including all mechanical and electrical works -  Construction of 7 nos Pump Stations and Gen Set Houses including installation of submersible pumps and Generators.'

b"English Teacher Job SummaryThe English Teacher is primarily responsible to plan, design, organize and teach English classes to Elham students. \xe2\x80\xa2 Organizing and delivering classroom lectures to students. \xe2\x80\xa2 Developing English lesson plans in line with the National Curriculum. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare assignments for the students.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Design and propose new English programs based on market needs.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluating a students' class work and assignments. \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing classroom and coursework materials, homework assignments, and handouts. \xe2\x80\xa2 Recording and maintain accurate student attendance records and grades. \xe2\x80\xa2 Classroom management. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintaining discipline in the classroom. \xe2\x80\xa2 Creating a vibrant teaching atmosphere. \xe2\x80\xa2 preparing and setting tests, examination papers and exercises; \xe2\x80\xa2 marking and providing appropriate feedback on oral and written work; \xe2\x80\xa2 devising, writing and producing new materials, including audio and visual resources; \xe2\x80\xa2 preparing information for inspection visits and other quality assurance exercises; \xe2\x80\xa2 Basic administration, such as keeping student registers and attendance records. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares periodic reports Education \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficiency in English curriculum development/customization.  \xe2\x80\xa2  At least 3 years of experience in academic English teaching.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Degree in relevant function."

b"Marketing Manager Job SummaryMarketing Manager is responsible for developing, implementing and executing MEC strategic marketing plans in order to attract potential clients and retain existing ones. She will be responsible for developing pricing strategies, identifying new clients, supporting lead generation efforts, categorizing the advertising tactics and creating promotions. \xe2\x80\xa2\tAttract new students across the MEC\xe2\x80\x99s portfolio of programs  \xe2\x80\xa2\tPublicize the strengths of the academic faculties, institutions and overall educational zones. \xe2\x80\xa2\tPromote the profile of the campus as a whole to external audiences and vendors \xe2\x80\xa2\tDeveloping a pricing strategy that maximizes profits and market share but considers client satisfaction. \xe2\x80\xa2\tUnderstanding and developing budgets, including expenditures, research and development appropriations, and return-on-investment and profit-loss projections in order to maintain the risk benefit ratio. \xe2\x80\xa2\tDeveloping and managing advertising campaigns and organizing conferences, trade shows and other major events . \xe2\x80\xa2\tOrganizing organization conferences, trade shows, and major events. \xe2\x80\xa2\tBuilding brand awareness and positioning. \xe2\x80\xa2\tEvaluating and maintaining a marketing strategy. \xe2\x80\xa2\tDirecting, planning and coordinating marketing efforts. \xe2\x80\xa2\tCommunicating the marketing plan. \xe2\x80\xa2\tDeveloping each marketing campaign from start to finish. \xe2\x80\xa2\tResearching demand for the organization's services. \xe2\x80\xa2\tEvaluating competitors. \xe2\x80\xa2\tHandling social media, public relation efforts, and content marketing. \xe2\x80\xa2\tEstablishes marketing goals based on past performance and market forecasts \xe2\x80\xa2\tEnsure execution and maximization of corporate promotional kits at each campus location & programs. \xe2\x80\xa2\tSchedule special events, tastings and encourage student participation in each promotion program \xe2\x80\xa2\tAct as journalist, capturing photos and writing summaries of events for social media and client reviews \xe2\x80\xa2\tWrite, distribute and provide newsletters to client partners \xe2\x80\xa2\tProvide social medial posts for the kindergarten, high school, institute and university marketing liaison.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tConduct audits to ensure compliance with uniform, packaging, merchandising and customer service standards \xe2\x80\xa2\tBuild a strategic social media plan that aligns with Complex strategic plan \xe2\x80\xa2\tCreate a weekly/monthly calendar of social media posts that align with key events and programs \xe2\x80\xa2\tGenerate, edit, publish and share daily copy and visual content  for MEC Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and the MEC website updates. \xe2\x80\xa2\tCreate content for each post including images, videos, graphics \xe2\x80\xa2\tProvide analysis and recommendations for future plans to ensure continued success and improved performance \xe2\x80\xa2\tPromotes MEC's work and policies among print and electronic media nationally and internationally to ensure MEC\xe2\x80\x99s visibility.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tOffers advice on media outreach at the national level and helps strengthen the connection with local, national and international media.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tDevelops media advisories, press releases and promotional/ communication material.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tLiaises and networks with national and international media in the country.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tArranges the translation of MEC\xe2\x80\x99s publicity material, discussion papers and reports.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tReads and reviews MEC materials, selects relevant materials for translation and publication in consultation with program staff.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tDevelops communication/advocacy materials including brochures, pamphlets, and other publications.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tArranges media participation to cover MEC\xe2\x80\x99s events and activities.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tWrites and edits web-based information materials and provides content and materials for MEC\xe2\x80\x99s website update.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tEnsures that the information posted on MEC\xe2\x80\x99s website is user friendly, appropriate, effective and visible.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tPrepares weekly, monthly, quarterly, periodic and annual media reports and keeps media logs for all events.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tContributes to all areas of MEC\xe2\x80\x99s program.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tGathering necessary assets to develop a campaign (photos, Knowledge 1. Successful completion of Rescue Systems 1 2. Comprehensive knowledge of building materials, to include: \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of the design and construction techniques for wood, masonry, concrete, and steel. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of the design and construction techniques utilizing architectural materials such as unreinforced masonry and concrete. 3. Knowledge of the behavior of structures under adverse loading conditions. 4. Ability to identify features that allow for the determination of the condition of structures subjected to adverse loading from: \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Earthquakes - ability to evaluate the remaining lateral force system capacity in the event of aftershocks. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Hurricanes and tornadoes - ability to evaluate the lateral force system and areas of local stress. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Flood or dam collapse. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Fire or explosion. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Landslide or avalanche. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Transportation accidents. 5. Knowledge of victim access methods, including: \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0How and where to penetrate various building types to minimize risks. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Effects of lifting large structural components and the ability to calculate weights for rigging and lifting operations. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of safe rescue practices and procedures. 7. Must have completed the FEMA Structural Specialist Course. Skills 1. Currently licensed as a structural engineer or equivalent as sanctioned by the FEMA US&R Advisory Committee. 2. A minimum of five years experience in structure design and analysis to include evaluation of existing structures, field investigation or construction observation experience. 3. Ability to identify vertical load and lateral force resisting framing systems and be able to identify the critical elements within those systems. 4. Ability to identify failure indications of building materials, including: \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of how basic building materials and framing systems perform. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of how building materials typically fail under various loading conditions. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of typical falling and collapse hazards from previous failures. 5. Ability to identify building features that could provide entry or access to victims such as ducts, shafts, etc. 6. Able to recommend practical solutions for US&R operations in compromised structures.'

b"Senior IS Audit Officer Job SummaryInternal auditing is an independent, objective assurance and consulting activity designed to add value and improve an organization's operations. It helps an organization accomplish its objectives by bringing a systematic, disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of risk management, control, and governance processes.  To that effect, the Senior Information Systems (IS) Audit Officer, is responsible the internal controls and risks of a FINCA Afghanistan technology network. He/she shall act in a lead role FINCA Afghanistan IS audit and all technology Innovations, designs and develops audit procedures, reviews and evaluates work of associates and, recommends and submits reports on identified corrections and controls in need of improvement. He/she shall also be involved in the planning and execution of internal audit procedures and the creation of internal audit reports and must work within a team to create a solid information technology infrastructure, and collaborate with staff to devise and put in place policies and procedures regarding network security issues. He/she shall maintain all organizational and professional ethical standards and ensures internal audit activities are carried out in compliance with ISACA\xe2\x80\x99s IT audit standard.  Works independently under general direction with extensive latitude for initiative and independent judgment. I. THE PROCESS OF AUDITING INFORMATION SYSTEMS  \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and implement a risk-based IT audit strategy in compliance with IT audit standards to ensure that key areas are included. \xe2\x80\xa2 Plan specific audits to determine whether information systems are protected, controlled and provide value to the organization. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct audits in accordance with IT audit standards to achieve planned audit objectives. Report audit findings and make recommendations to key stakeholders to communicate results and effect change when necessary. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct follow-ups or prepare status reports to ensure appropriate actions have been taken by management in a timely manner. II. It Governance and Management  \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the effectiveness of the IT governance structure to determine whether IT decisions, directions and performance support the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate IT organizational structure and human resources (personnel) management to determine whether they support the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the IT strategy, including the IT direction, and the processes for the strategy\xe2\x80\x99s development, approval, implementation and maintenance for alignment with the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the organization\xe2\x80\x99s IT policies, standards, and procedures, and the processes for their development, approval, implementation, maintenance, and monitoring, to determine whether they support the IT strategy and comply with regulatory and legal requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the adequacy of the quality management system to determine whether it supports the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives in a cost-effective manner. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate IT management and monitoring of controls (e.g., continuous monitoring, QA) for compliance with the organization\xe2\x80\x99s policies, standards and procedures. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate IT resource investment, use and allocation practices, including prioritization criteria, for alignment with the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate IT contracting strategies and policies, and contract management practices to determine whether they support the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate risk management practices to determine whether the organization\xe2\x80\x99s IT-related risks are properly managed. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate monitoring and assurance practices to determine whether the board and executive management receive sufficient and timely information about IT performance. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the organization\xe2\x80\x99s business continuity plan to determine the organization\xe2\x80\x99s ability to continue essential business operations during the period of an IT disruption. III. Is Acquisition, Development and Implementation \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the business case for the proposed investments in information systems acquisition, development, maintenance and subsequent retirement to determine whether it meets business objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the project management practices and controls to determine whether business requirements are achieved in a cost-effective manner while managing risks to the organization. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct reviews to determine whether a project is progressing in accordance with project plans, is adequately supported by documentation and status reporting is accurate. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate controls for information systems during the requirements, acquisition, development and testing phases for compliance with the organization's policies, standards, procedures and applicable external requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the readiness of information systems for implementation and migration into production to determine whether project deliverables, controls and organization's requirements are met. Conduct post-implementation reviews of systems to determine whether project deliverables, controls and organization's requirements are met. IV. Is Operations, Maintenance and Support \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct periodic reviews of information systems to determine whether they continue to meet the organization\xe2\x80\x99s objectives.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate service level management practices to determine whether the level of service from internal and external service providers is defined and managed. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate third party management practices to determine whether the levels of controls expected by the organization are being adhered to by the provider. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate operations and end-user procedures to determine whether scheduled and non-scheduled processes are managed to completion. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the process of information systems maintenance to determine whether they are controlled effectively and continue to support the organization\xe2\x80\x99s objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate data administration practices to determine the integrity and optimization of databases. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the use of capacity and performance monitoring tools and techniques to determine whether IT services meet the organization\xe2\x80\x99s objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate problem and incident management practices to determine whether incidents, problems or errors are recorded, analyzed and resolved in a timely manner. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate change, configuration and release management practices to determine whether scheduled and non-scheduled changes made to the organization\xe2\x80\x99s production environment are adequately controlled and documented. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the adequacy of backup and restore provisions to determine the availability of information required to resume processing. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the organization\xe2\x80\x99s disaster recovery plan to determine whether it enables the recovery of IT processing capabilities in the event of a disaster. V. Protection of Is Assets \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the information security policies, standards and procedures for completeness and alignment with generally accepted practices. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the design, implementation and monitoring of system and logical security controls to verify the confidentiality, integrity and availability of information. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the design, implementation, and monitoring of the data classification processes and procedures for alignment with the organization\xe2\x80\x99s policies, standards, procedures, and applicable external requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the design, implementation and monitoring of physical access and environmental controls to determine whether information assets are adequately safeguarded. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the processes and procedures used to store, retrieve, transport and dispose of information assets (e.g., backup media, offsite storage, hard copy/print data, and softcopy media) to determine whether information assets are adequately safeguarded. VI. Other duties: \xe2\x80\xa2 To follow and implement Global Corporate audit methodology and techniques, applicable at subsidiary level. \xe2\x80\xa2 To determine whether organizational units in the FINCA Afghanistan are performing their planning, operational, accounting, custodial, or control activities in compliance with management instructions, applicable statements of policy and procedures, and in a manner consistent with both organizational objectives and high standards of administrative practice. \xe2\x80\xa2 To plan and execute functional, process and field audits in accordance with accepted standards. \xe2\x80\xa2 To report audit findings and to make recommendations for correcting unsatisfactory conditions, improving operations, and reducing cost. \xe2\x80\xa2 To perform assigned special reviews according to the given scope. Banking \xe2\x80\xa2 MA/MS in Business Administration, Accounting, Computer Science, Information Systems Administration or related field.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) required.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Internal auditing or forensic certification a plus."

b'Security Manager to Implement BC&DRP; Job SummarySecurity Manager will be responsible for monitoring the security situation, issues and operations for the organization. He will be responsible to implement security policies, regulations, rules and norms and make sure that the environment in the organization is safe for the staff, operations and visitors. He will also manage the security guards at the branches as well as check and monitor the access control of the people visiting these offices. He will also be responsible for implementing security protocols, creating emergency response procedures, conducting security evaluations, supervise security guards and keep track of different events. Implementation of OXUS Afghanistan security Plans \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that all staff adheres to security procedures \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all newly inducted staff are aware of the security protocols as well as provide them basic necessary training \xe2\x80\xa2 Regular security briefing to the staff and management. Update and refresh the briefings \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure OXUS Afghanistan security management plans are regularly updated  \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct security and risk assessments for all operational areas (as required) and propose new operational areas \xe2\x80\xa2 Work in coordination with the security consultant  \xe2\x80\xa2 Arrange for the visits of OXUS Branches inside Kabul (at least 05 branches) and in the regions (at least 02 regions) by the consultant \xe2\x80\xa2 Implementation of the recommendations by consultant in security upgrades review document \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the installation of security cameras and completion on time manner \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the construction of strong rooms and completion on time manner \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the relevant teams for the procurement of the required material for security upgrades \xe2\x80\xa2 Get complete security trainings and drills from the consultant as master trainer \xe2\x80\xa2 Impart the training to all the relevant staff of OXUS inside Kabul and in the regions \xe2\x80\xa2 Continuously monitor the security situation in Kabul as well as in the regions \xe2\x80\xa2 Keep in contact with the relevant departments, offices and individuals to get regular security updates \xe2\x80\xa2 Disseminate the security updates/information to OXUS management on regular basis \xe2\x80\xa2 Security protocols and arrangements for any expats visiting OXUS Afghanistan \xe2\x80\xa2 The Security Manager should ensure that there is appropriate, up-to-date training of all staff on security and safety policies, and that policies are written and disseminated in HQ and branches.  - Infrastructure Management \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct premises security assessment and make recommendations \xe2\x80\xa2 Follow-up of renovations/upgrades linked to the security \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain emergency equipment (supplies for emergency lock-down, security alarms, surveillance cameras, emergency exits, safe rooms and fire extinguishers) as appropriate \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure good standards of health and security are being observed (as appropriate for security) -Transport (in conjunction with Logistic\xe2\x80\x93Transport) \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure OXUS Afghanistan vehicles are equipped with required security equipment and supplies \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure regular refresher trainings for OXUS Afghanistan drivers are being arranged (about how to respond in security, safe driving, general awareness and behavior) \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure maintenance and follow up of automated tracking system \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure24hoursavailabilityof vehicles (with rivers) with required equipment and supplies especially for senior management and any expats (if on-board) -Travel The Security Manager will be required to visit the all the branches in Kabul as well as in the regions on regular basis in order to impart security trainings, check their security protocols, arrangements and setup are in place and based on the situation in these areas, if any security change or up-gradation is required, ensure to carry out with the approval of the competent authoritiesTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Banking a) At least 08 to 10 years of professional experience at in the similar position or in security installations, security operations and BCP related areas b) Knowledge of security environment and hazards c) Must be a local national d) Must have related IT training e) Experience of working with any multi-national or international organization f) Must have strong communication and interpersonal skills g) Must be physically fit and active'

b'Legal Advisor Job SummaryThe Legal Advisor is responsible for the all duties & Responsibilities that are explained in the below section. 1. To solve the legal issues and problems between employee, customers and management of Bank-e-Millie Afghan. 2. To provide and find the legal ways for the legal problems which are important and which have to be solved. 3. Proceeding and progress in the process of getting and borrowing money from legal ways and achievements to the problems that accrued during and among these matters. 4. Correction of contracts and terms and conditions among employee people and Bank-e-Mille Afghan and all governmental and personal or nongovernmental organizations. 5. Following and sending the files and achievements to the issues that have to be solved in the related court and providing aid and help to achieve to those matters in the related court of Afghanistan or other institutions related to this matter. 6. After permission of the respected directorate traveling to other provinces and solving the problems which will happen related to possessive lands and other personal properties of Bank-e-Mille Afghan. 7. Reading and reviewing some existence files and during implementation of that, giving legal view and idea related to permitted and given matters. 8. Help and legal cooperation with all departments related to the respected directorate of Bank-e-Mille Afghan 9. Cooperation and advice to the Loans Collection department and provide them legal rules to collect money. 10. Writing and filling of all contracts according to the term, condition and records of the cases with mutual cooperation of all related departments and their management, completion. 11. Investigation and expression of the opinion in the possessive land contracts and other properties of Bank-e-Millie-Afghan under the lease agreement with a person or any other construction organization. 12. Investigation of the contracts and termination of the agreement and contracts of land and properties of Bank-e-Millie-Afghan and giving legal opinion for further progress in the term and condition of the contract of mentioned land. 13. Receive, and equivalencies and attestation of the legal documents of the person who is under lease contract of the land or properties with Bank-e-Millie-Afghan. 14. Reviewing and making sure of the properties of the people and implementation of the term and conditions of the lease or other contract according to the documents of Bank-e-Millie-Afghan. 15. Serious investigation and observation of the duration and termination of the loan contracts and making right and suitable decision against the people who do not making payments according to the terms and conditions of the contract. 16. Correction and preparation of legal documents against those people who are not obeying the orders of the contract and do not submitted to the bank the properties under lease or other agreement to sale and to collect loans. Also the related court is ordering for mutual investigation about the debate and reasoning of them. It is sure that the prepared documents must be submitted in the court of Afghanistan. 17.   Making normal and regular relation and contacts according to justification in these cases. 18.   According to the permission of respected directorate receiving and investigation to legal completion and requesting cases of employees of Bank-e-Millie-Afghan. 19. Receiving to solve those cases where employees of the bank situated under the rumor of stealing money and making sure about the stolen money cases and clearances of those cases. 20. Implementation and performances of all orders that are permitted from respected directorate of Bank-e-Millie-Afghan to the legal advisory department. 21. Protection and security of those files that is helpful to perform the duties of legal advisory department. 22. . Any other task or duty assigned by the CEO. Banking Bachelor degree in law and also Preference is given to higher degrees.  At least Three-years experience in the related field Fluency in English, Dari/Pashto, written as well as spoken ability  Required computer skills ( MS. Windows and MS. Office program)  Comprehensive knowledge of laws, regulations and other legal documents of the country.'

b'Alternative Delivery Channel Manager Job SummaryThe ATM Manger is responsible for properly managing and maintaining efficient ATM services and operations. The ADC Manager is responsible for administering the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s Automated Teller Machine (ATM) products, operational systems, and services. The ADC Manager will provide oversight regarding the handling and managing of the ATM\xe2\x80\x99s electronic fund transfer. This individual will assist customers with all ATM related issues including, but not limited to, account related problems and fraudulent transactions. All issues will be handled in accordance with guidelines. The ADC Manager is also responsible for evaluating the daily performance of the ATM\xe2\x80\x99s operational services and recommending upgrades and maintenance accordingly. 1. The ATM Manger is responsible for properly managing and maintaining efficient ATM services and operations. This individual will be held accountable for the administration of quality services.  2. Network marketing and advertising are a crucial factor in improving ATM services. As the ADC Manager, you will work closely with vendors and management, in regards to appropriate ATM placement. 3. The ADC Manager will be able to reflect back on their experience, to provide valuable insight and make informed decisions regarding how the organization could plan and achieve benchmark goals and objectives. This individual should possess a number of very important leadership qualities, as they are in charge of directing the work of fellow employees. They should be able to effectively communicate with employees and top management.  4. Provision of assessment allows the ATM Manger to determine the organizations current and future needs, regarding the operation of ATM services. The ADC Manager will be highly effective in recommending certain changes and is a critical component in implementing all new operational or service related processes. New approaches will be monitored and evaluated, and results will be communicated to top management. 5. The ADC Manager establishes a set of goals for the department and the organization. The ADC Manager sets goals that help contribute to the organization\xe2\x80\x99s growth, by implementing and enforcing strategies that aim to optimize organizational operations and services. Operational services include support for debit and credit card production, deposits and withdrawals, retail business banking. 6. Preparation of written proposals and performance of cost benefit analysis, as well as risk analysis in conjunction with the organizations current policies and procedures, is the responsibility of the ADC Manager. This individual will negotiate pricing of certain products and services, in order to increase the amount of revenue generated from ATM related products and services, thereby contributing to the maximization of the organizations profitability. Effective strategies and techniques that work will be recommended accordingly. 7. The ADC Manager is responsible for administering the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s Automated Teller Machine (ATM) products, operational systems, and services. The ADC Manager will provide oversight regarding the handling and managing of the ATM\xe2\x80\x99s electronic fund transfer. This individual will assist customers with all ATM related issues including, but not limited to, account related problems and fraudulent transactions. 8. All issues will be handled in accordance with guidelines. The ADC Manager is also responsible for evaluating the daily performance of the ATM\xe2\x80\x99s operational services and recommending upgrades and maintenance accordingly. Banking \xef\x82\xa7 The successful candidate will be a driven energetic individual with a positive can do attitude and will come with a good track record within the cash businesses. \xef\x82\xa7 With a good knowledge of operational and services issues and relevant experience, the candidate will have the ability to develop, manage and invest in his team. The candidate will plan, direct, manage and oversee all aspects of the ATM operation and services including technical and operational.  \xef\x82\xa7 Must have excellent knowledge of the industry and have a sound understanding of the leading technology, operations and business partners needed to run ATM operations successfully. \xef\x82\xa7 The candidate will support and achieve financial objective of the business in coordination with the Cash/vault Services Manager and keep operations within budget. \xef\x82\xa7 Setting key performance measures for the team for monitoring the performance of ADC department. \xef\x82\xa7 Educated to Bachelor Degree or MBA level will be an advantage. \xef\x82\xa7 An educational qualification in ATM engineering or business related degree. \xef\x82\xa7 Minimum 3-4 years of experience in a similar role within the Cash business \xef\x82\xa7 Autonomous and results orientated, with a clear determination to succeed. \xef\x82\xa7 Excellent communication (written and verbal), interpersonal and negotiation skills. \xef\x82\xa7 Capable of working effectively and productively with senior team members. \xef\x82\xa7 Ability to maintain strong ethical and professional values. \xef\x82\xa7 Excellent command of written and spoken English and local languages \xef\x82\xa7 The ability to operate in diverse cultural environments.'

b'IT Specialist/ Officer Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 Tracking of IT equipment and assigning equipment to employees following proper chain of command with the appropriate approvals and handover documentation \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with network and security management \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with data storage architecture  \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide user lever technical support for end users, computers, printers, etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor printers, copiers, and fax machines to make sure they are working properly and getting regular maintenance.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to troubleshoot common hardware/software issues \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to meet deadlines and adjust to changing priorities \xe2\x80\xa2 ask questions and get information in order to diagnose computer problems and discern what level of support is needed when a problem is presented \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist IT Manager in providing IT related support to all staff with a friendly and customer service driven attitude \xe2\x80\xa2 Check and load papers on the printers in each office daily \xe2\x80\xa2 Service the printers on daily basis \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide the finger print data to HR department on monthly basis. \xe2\x80\xa2 Check systems in order to optimize performance and to initiate recovery action after system failures. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide assistance in procurement and evaluation of IT technical equipment as needed \xe2\x80\xa2 Updated the Micro banking system on daily bases. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide full support of Micro banking when employee face with a problem. IT \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor degree in Computer Science. \xe2\x80\xa2 2-3 years of relevant experience.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Sound knowledge of laptop / desktop computing hardware and proficiency in network administration. \xe2\x80\xa2 MS applications, MS Office, MS Project. \xe2\x80\xa2 Common client applications such as Adobe Acrobat. \xe2\x80\xa2 Basic IT troubleshooting skills and experience. \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated ability to resolve IT problems both independently and collaboratively. \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated ability to identify priorities and work to tight deadlines. \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. \xe2\x80\xa2  Excellent in Dari, Pashto, and English.'

b'Cleaner Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide comprehensive cleaning service within the building and outdoor areas, roof tops, balconies, driveways. This includes cleaning; of the kitchens, offices, training halls, toilets and public areas. \xe2\x80\xa2 Deep cleaning of offices, hallways, corridors,   and outdoor areas. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Procurement department to set up the purchased equipment in storage rooms \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide guests with tea & coffee. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide drinking Water for all offices \xe2\x80\xa2 Assisting cooks to arrange tables for daily lunch. \xe2\x80\xa2 Clean the house glassware, furniture and electronic items on daily basis at minimum \xe2\x80\xa2 Empty all trash cans whenever required \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that Office, bathroom and cleaning supplies are placed in their appropriate areas when required \xe2\x80\xa2  Keep hygiene of the tea/coffee station and keep the tools washed and cleaned at all the times. \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform all the assigned tasks regularly. Operation \xe2\x80\xa2 At least 1-2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience as a Cleaner in a similar type setting  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability read, write national languages and communicate clearly  \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong organizational and prioritization skills  \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong interpersonal skills  \xe2\x80\xa2 At least 12th class graduated.'

b'Communication/Marketing Specialist Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain ADF communications which promotes the work of ADF and increase awareness of what it does.   \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate, develop, and maintain strong and ongoing relationships with journalists from the print, radio, online, and television media in Kabul and provinces. Write press releases and disseminate information to the media on project activities.   \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with media outlets to broadcast a constant, consistent message to the stakeholders and general public. \xe2\x80\xa2 Craft messages and disseminate information for the achievements and results of ADF \xe2\x80\xa2 Lead the production of high-quality communications materials for the project intended for the public. This may include production of brochures, fact sheets, posters, videos and other multi-media products.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate and manage events from board meeting to high profile media events  \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and maintain ADF website in 3 languages and other social media outlets. Communication \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor degree in communication, Business Administration, Journalism. \xe2\x80\xa2 Over 2-3 years of experience in the field of communication and Public Relations. \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent command of spoken and written languages: English, Dari & Pashto languages. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to write in a variety of styles to appeal to different audiences. \xe2\x80\xa2 Events management skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of graphic design software.'

b'Senior Manager Branch Channel Development Job SummaryDevelops new deposit and consumer loan business; provides a superior customer experience and promotes a sales and service culture through coaching, guidance and staff motivation. Develop creative guidance and manuals for improving customer service in the branch level. Achieves individual and consumer banking sales goals through new business development, referrals and retention and expansion of account relationships. Responsible for meeting consumer banking profitability targets. - Working across all branches and business teams, channels and markets - Ensure full commercialization possibility of consumer banking business and customer service initiatives by planning and communication  - Ensure proper customer strategy of communication of product and services channel deliveries - Leads all aspect of retail sales and service within the consumer banking - Responsible for the attainment of consumer banking sales, service and financial goals  - Facilitate regular team meetings focused on sales, service and product and compliance training - Perform regular coaching sessions in sales, referrals, customer service and teamwork - Working across the branch network innovation and processes  - Work on branches channel evolution  - Provide reward and recognition as appropriate - Educate consumer banking team and branch network about product and services offered through other lines of business.  - Focus on enhancing customer service and customer relationships - Participates in community organizations and activities to enhance the bank\xe2\x80\x99s image and develop additional business and referral sources.  - Assist and support the Head of Consumer Banking in all affairs relates to branches development and other units of consumer banking Requirements:  - Strategic thought and people leadership in a complex environment.  - Overall financial services industry knowledge with specific functional expertise. - Advanced judgmental skills to identify and resolve problems. - Ability to motivate and lead people, employing appropriate management styles. - Very strong knowledge of the external environment, regulatory, political, competitors  - Business reengineering knowledge. - Work independently and have the gravitas and acumen to influence at the Senior Management level. Be confident to challenge where appropriate. - Proven ability to work with senior stakeholders and business sponsors. - Be self-motivated and driven but able to manage and work in a team. - Ability to assimilate large amounts of data from multiple sources to provide a clear process to organize the data into the ideas pipeline. - Advanced Business analysis, requirements gathering and design techniques. - Extensive experience of using multiple analysis techniques in a change environment, with a mix of business, operations and technology focused analysis. - Excellent communication, interpersonal and negotiating skills. - Excellent decision-making and problem solving ability. - Be proactive to the needs of the various stakeholders. Typically, he or she should have high energy and sense of urgency. Banking Education \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree MBA  \xe2\x80\xa2 Specialized knowledge: Branch Banking and Business development  \xe2\x80\xa2 Professional Certification: Preferred banking leadership  Skills  \xe2\x80\xa2 Skills: Managerial, staffing skills, Customer service management, Effective communication, leadership skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Abilities: Fluent in English, Dari and Pushto  Experience \xe2\x80\xa2 5 years in Branch banking preferred.'

b'HSC Program Officer Kabul Job SummaryTitle of position:    HSC Program Officer  Kandahar No of Vacancy :  HSC Program Officer / Kandahar Location:   Kandahar N of Position :                         1  Nationality                              Afghan   Gender  Male/ Female  Report to:                                HSC Program coordinator  Grade:    NTA Salary Scale A :                                            2018/1027 B :                                            2018/11/8 Purpose of the position: The Program Officer has overall responsibility for the planning and implementation of a high quality theoretical and practical HSC training program. 1. Make sure that the HSC program is implementing according to the goal and objectives of the program.   2. Responsible for HSC curriculum revision with other HSC team.  3. Coordinate administrative, procurement, finance and technical affairs of HSC program  4. Provide administrative support to the project such as scheduling, preparing for meetings;  Taking notes, writing letters, invitation, reply to letters and messages, mailing, filing, inventory and dissemination of related document for program activities. 5. Prepare and maintain office filing system. 6.    Prepare presentations and other documents as requested 7.    Follow up and lead purchasing committee  8.    To prepare procurement plan for HSCE-Program 9. To ensure staff attendance sheet and leave forms and keeps routine control on implementation of them.  10. Submitting regular attendance reports of staff for payroll purpose 11. Identifies training needs of staff and facilitates and supports their professional development   12. Ensures a clean, safe and secure working environment and takes all necessary measures to minimize risks to health and safety.  13. Ensures all HSC training program properties, all resources and equipment are maintained and in good working conditions and keeps an update inventory of resources which is regularly checked.  14. Oversee and controlling administrative and academic process of HSC in order to implement educational and learning standards. 15. Identifying problems and finding solution. 16. Coordination with MoPH, PPHD, BPHS, relevant provincial government and other stakeholders  17. Liaises/report and coordinates with the HSC Program Coordinator the MoPH/GIHS and to ensure effective and efficiently running of HSC training program.  18. Inform HSC program coordinator regarding the progress of course and any other problem related to students, course, and instructor evaluations.   19. Advocacy for deployment of HSC graduates in coordination with PPHDs, BPHSs and communities. 20. Preparation of monthly , quarterly and annual progress reports at provincial level  21. Report to HSC Coordinator at GIHS 22. Conduct social mobilization, community awareness for students selection based on HSC program plan 23. Conduct regular meetings with technical and administrative staff and report to HSC coordinator.  24. Monitors staff performance and undertakes regular appraisal according to MoPH guidelines including maintaining personnel files 25. Any other tasks assigned by supervisor Health/Medical 1. Bachelor degree from a recognized university  in Social Sciences, Nursing, BBA, Public Health, Sociology, Psychology, MD doctor is preferable  2. At least 4 years working experience in project/ program management, operation administration, procurement, finance'

b'Islamic Finance Specialist Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 Arranges SAB meetings.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Reviews all Sharia compliant transaction documentation prior to being submitted to the TRC and Credit Committee to ensure they are accurate, appropriate and of the highest quality. \xe2\x80\xa2 Acts as first point of contact for all Sharia compliant issues within ADF. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develops and implements new processes, procedures, and templates for use by the lending team in line with the lending policies and procedures of the organization.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist loan officers in managing portfolio of loans in light of the overall organization mandate keeping default rates to a minimum and performing loans to a maximum level possible. Business Administration \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience working in financial services, banks and in private business.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to analyze loan documentation and prepare financial statements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong Communication and presentation skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to quickly grasp key Agricultural concepts and Islamic Lending.  \xe2\x80\xa2 A University degree, preferably in Business. \xe2\x80\xa2 2 to 3 years of progressively responsible experience. \xe2\x80\xa2 Working experience at regional and provincial level \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent English, excellent Pashto and Dari.'

b'Credit Administration Specialist Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 File and labels all the loan files and document s in the credit Administration Department. \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform general clerical duties to include but not limited to: photocopying, mailing, filing and also saving the scan of the documents in Credit Admin folder. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with the compilation of the Technical Credit Committee and Credit Committee loan packages and disburse the packages to the appropriate parties 72 hours prior to the beginning of the respective meetings. \xe2\x80\xa2 Receiving, scanning, and copying all the original documents of Credit Administration. \xe2\x80\xa2 Receiving the most important documents (original Qabalas) and saving in the save lockers. \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for all the keys of save lockers (The most important documents are kept inside save lockers). \xe2\x80\xa2 Sending Daily reminder SMS Massages to the client\xe2\x80\x99s payments. \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for all the Shaira Documents and Advisory Board Documents. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist Credit Admin, with maintaining office supplies and stationary stock and distributions to office staff. \xe2\x80\xa2 Updating the excel sheet for maintaining client\xe2\x80\x99s contacts and other business related basic info.   \xe2\x80\xa2 Assisting CA with tracking monthly reports (printing, getting signatures and filing the reports). Business Administration \xe2\x80\xa2 A Bachelor degree in Business, Economics. \xe2\x80\xa2 At least 2-3 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in an equivalent position.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication skills (verbal and written). \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent interpersonal skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Problem solving skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work both independently and as part of a team. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to create a supportive working relationship with all project teams. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work under pressure.'

b'Loan Operation Assistant Job Summary - Ensure strict adherence to loan disbursement and booking procedures. - Record receipt of booking instruction from Finance Department. - Record receipt of copies of loan documentation from Credit Administration. - Accurate capture of information on MicroBanker-creates client profile; new loan details. - Booking of old and new disbursements plus repayments received on bank statements. - Submit booking instruction and loan documentation to supervisor for review and approval. - Print required repayment schedules, invoices, transaction slips etc. - Submit above documents to related lending officers. - Maintain and oversee proper filling for the Loan Operation. - Updating client profiles as and when necessary. - Generate and distribute required reports. - Any other duties assigned by the immediate supervisor. Account/Finance - A Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Business Administration, Commerce or Economics. - At least 2-3 years\xe2\x80\x99 relevant experience. - Experience working in financial services, banks and in private business.  - Ability to analyze loan documentation and prepare financial statements - Strong Communication and presentation skills - Ability to quickly grasp key Agricultural concepts and Islamic Lending  - Fluent English, excellent Pashto and Dari.'

b'Procurement /Administration Specialist Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee the General Administration staff to ensure that all key functions are fulfilled efficiently and effectively and are in compliance with policies and procedures.  Provide high quality service to all units of the ADF. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assign institutional resources including office space, vehicles, furniture and equipment; maintain accurate inventory records & reports. \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the management of ADF central and regional office properties, vehicles, and equipment; ensure that all are functioning properly.   Supervise Facilities and Logistics Specialists.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide budget analysis for the administration of the program.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Produce reports and documents regarding overall general administration and procurement of the ADF whenever required. \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage team workload and resources; conduct periodic performance reviews. \xe2\x80\xa2 Supervise Facility and Logistic Departments to maintain an accurate physical inventory count of all expendable and non-expendable supplies which includes stationary, fuel, kitchen supplies, spare parts, equipment and other supplies items. \xe2\x80\xa2  Issue Request for Quotation for procurement purchases goods/services.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Updating of trackers such as (RFP, SRF, PRF, Pipeline etc...) \xe2\x80\xa2 Take parts in bed openings as nonvoting member.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate the implementation of purchases, service agreements and subcontracts. \xe2\x80\xa2 Tracking of All POs and BPAs deadline.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Tracking of the payments in order to be sure that all payments are done in proper time. Administrative \xe2\x80\xa2 Good oral and written English and Pashto. Competency in Dari is preferable. \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in Microsoft Office. \xe2\x80\xa2 At least 2-3 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in office administrative, recording keeping, document production and filing systems, preferably with international agencies or NGOs.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong organizational skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum BA/ BSc.'

b'HR Specialist Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintaining staff personnel files properly and professionally per ADF HR rules. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintaining staff personnel file check list at all the time and ensuring it\xe2\x80\x99s up to dated. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in staff appraisals including notification to supervisors, employment amendments, and contract end date notifications etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Communicating with staff regarding missing personnel file documents \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure accurate records of pay records. \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for tracking leaves, disseminating leaves to staff, recording, filing and monthly report of leave taken and available \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in posting job advertisements internally, receiving applications forms \xe2\x80\xa2 Inform short-listed candidates for test/interviews and the final result.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring time sheet completion for all national staff.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Enter HR data into HMIS to generate reports. \xe2\x80\xa2 Respond to human resources queries from staff in the unit and elsewhere in the program. \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other related duties as required. Human Resource \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in HR. \xe2\x80\xa2 University education, in Business Administration or related field preferred. \xe2\x80\xa2 Having basic accounting/ finance background is plus. \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication skills (verbal and written). \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent interpersonal skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Good follow-up and organizing skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to multi task. \xe2\x80\xa2 Problem solving skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to create a supportive working relationship with all staff. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work under pressure.'
