b'Internal Audit Specialist Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist audit manager in the preparation of the annual Internal Audit Plan and program when requested. \xe2\x80\xa2 Deliver weekly, monthly and quarterly reports about Internal Audit Activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare periodically Risk Report and share it with all credit staff. \xe2\x80\xa2 Implement the annual plan for internal audit. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assisting the Manager Internal Audit in preparation of the internal audit reports.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct a Pre-Audit according to ADF Internal Audit Manual and delivering Pre-Audit for each loan in the pipeline. \xe2\x80\xa2 Visit clients in different regions of the country and review the Internal Control Systems in place. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the scoring risk according to ADF Internal Audit Manual. \xe2\x80\xa2 Update the scoring risk for loans in the pipeline. \xe2\x80\xa2 Collaborate with the Credit Officer on the credit file findings. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct Finance Audit after each disbursement and prepare Finance Audit Report after each Finance Audit. \xe2\x80\xa2 Visit clients in different regions of the country and physically inspect the utilization how the loan is being used. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and maintain files both (soft & hard) for all conducted audits  \xe2\x80\xa2 Other activities initiated by supervisor. Account/Finance \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree in Finance Management, Accounting, or related finance and banking field.  \xe2\x80\xa2 At least 2-3 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in an equivalent position \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent interpersonal skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Conflict management skills  \xe2\x80\xa2 Problem solving skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work both independently and as part of a team \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to create a supportive working relationship with all project teams \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work under pressure'

b'Telemarketing Officer Job SummaryTelemarketing officer will answer the phone calls, receive customer orders and solve customers problem over the phone \xe2\x80\xa2 Answer incoming calls from prospective customers \xe2\x80\xa2 Receive orders over the telephone \xe2\x80\xa2 Input order details into the computer system \xe2\x80\xa2 Use scripts to provide information about product\xe2\x80\x99s features, prices etc. and present their benefits \xe2\x80\xa2 Ask pertinent questions to understand the customer\xe2\x80\x99s requirements \xe2\x80\xa2 Persuade the customer to buy by demonstrating how merchandise or services meet their needs \xe2\x80\xa2 Record the customer\xe2\x80\x99s personal information accurately in a computer system \xe2\x80\xa2 Communicate respectfully and politely with potential customers at all times Sales/Marketing Must have a high school degree.'

b"Marketing Officer Job SummaryThe Marketing Officer oversees the company\xe2\x80\x99s marketing campaigns both internally and externally and plays a key part in communicating the organizations marketing message. Preparing, planning, and project managing the publication of all publicity material to maximize brand promotion. Creating marketing campaigns and working with the company's external PR agency to see them executed. Creating and developing new innovative ways to communicate the company message to their existing customers. Contributing to the annual sales and marketing plan. Planning and project managing marketing events and evaluating their success. Evaluating the effectiveness of all marketing activity. Developing and implementing an internal marketing programme. Supporting the marketing manager in day to day marketing activities. Plan, develop and deliver campaigns as agreed within timescales. Sales/Marketing Previous experience in a similar marketing role. Ideally, a degree in marketing although not essential. Strong and confident communicator. Excellent copywriting skills and experience. Design skills including graphics and web design."

b"Marketing Manager Job SummaryMarketing Manager is responsible for developing, implementing and executing MEC strategic marketing plans in order to attract potential clients and retain existing ones. She will be responsible for developing pricing strategies, identifying new clients, supporting lead generation efforts, categorizing the advertising tactics and creating promotions. \xe2\x80\xa2\tAttract new students across the MEC\xe2\x80\x99s portfolio of programs  \xe2\x80\xa2\tPublicize the strengths of the academic faculties, institutions and overall educational zones. conferences, trade shows, and major events. \xe2\x80\xa2\tBuilding brand awareness and positioning. \xe2\x80\xa2\tEvaluating and maintaining a marketing strategy. \xe2\x80\xa2\tDirecting, planning and coordinating marketing efforts. \xe2\x80\xa2\tCommunicating the marketing plan. \xe2\x80\xa2\tDeveloping each marketing campaign from start to finish. \xe2\x80\xa2\tResearching demand for the organization's services. \xe2\x80\xa2\tEvaluating competitors. \xe2\x80\xa2\tHandling social media, public relation efforts, and content marketing. \xe2\x80\xa2\tEstablishes marketing goals based on past performance and market forecasts \xe2\x80\xa2\tEnsure execution and maximization of corporate promotional kits at each campus location & programs. \xe2\x80\xa2\tSchedule special events, tastings and encourage student participation in each promotion program \xe2\x80\xa2\tAct as journalist, capturing photos and writing summaries of events for social media and client reviews \xe2\x80\xa2\tWrite, audits to ensure compliance with uniform, packaging, merchandising and customer service standards \xe2\x80\xa2\tBuild a strategic social media plan that aligns with Complex strategic plan \xe2\x80\xa2\tCreate a weekly/monthly calendar of social media posts that align with key events and programs \xe2\x80\xa2\tGenerate, edit, publish and share daily copy and visual content  for MEC Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and the MEC website updates. \xe2\x80\xa2\tCreate content for each post including images, videos, graphics \xe2\x80\xa2\tProvide analysis and recommendations for \xe2\x80\xa2\tDevelops media advisories, press releases and promotional/ communication material.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tLiaises and networks with national and international media in the country. participation to cover MEC\xe2\x80\x99s events and activities.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tWrites and edits web-based information materials and provides content and materials for MEC\xe2\x80\x99s website update. The job may require writing across the following categories: Inbound marketing \xe2\x80\xa2  Strategic plans \xe2\x80\xa2  Buyer personas \xe2\x80\xa2  Blog posts \xe2\x80\xa2  Email campaigns \xe2\x80\xa2  Web page content \xe2\x80\xa2  Paid search ads \xe2\x80\xa2  Local online listings \xe2\x80\xa2  Social media updates and ads \xe2\x80\xa2  Landing pages \xe2\x80\xa2  Promotional video scripts \xe2\x80\xa2  Marketing infrastructure \xe2\x80\xa2  Website sitemaps \xe2\x80\xa2  Website content Outbound marketing \xe2\x80\xa2  Print ads \xe2\x80\xa2  Billboards \xe2\x80\xa2  Direct mail pieces \xe2\x80\xa2  Trade show displays \xe2\x80\xa2  TV spots \xe2\x80\xa2  Radio spots \xe2\x80\xa2  Sales \xe2\x80\xa2  Proposals for add-on services Sales/Marketing Qualifications \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications or related field (MBA preferred) \xe2\x80\xa2 Overall 3-15 yrs experience.  \xe2\x80\xa2 5+ years in marketing and promotion \xe2\x80\xa2 Technical and Designing skills."

b'Marketing Officer Job SummaryThe Marketing Officer oversees the company\xe2\x80\x99s marketing campaigns and plays a key part in communicating the organization\xe2\x80\x99s marketing message. Contribute in the implementation of marketing strategies Visit the customers on a daily or weekly base to understand their needs and provide them with products Filing and making documents archive for all transactions with customers  Collect money from the customers to whom he sold the goods Support the marketing manager in overseeing the department\xe2\x80\x99s operations Organize and attend marketing activities or events to raise brand awareness Advertising and promotional campaigns for products  Prepare content for the publication of marketing material and oversee distribution Conduct market research to identify opportunities for promotion and growth Analyze and report of market & competitors  Report activities to branch manager according to determined schedule Sales/Marketing Education Degree in Medical Technology, Pharmacy, Nursing and Marketing  (Priority goes to those Having experience in marketing of medical products)'

b'Sales Supervisor Job SummaryThis position is the most important position in sales department, directly involve in selling, market development and public relation. Sales supervisor play a role of bridge between company and market, company and distributor and distributor and market. - Daily market visit in the assigned area and ensure proper and regular supply of product at the outlets. - Ensure monthly target achievement for the entire team in the assigned area. - Guide, control and motivate the Pre-sellers, deliveryman and drivers of his area an effective execution. - Monitor and ensure proper communication of company prices, Schemes, and computerized invoice to each customer. - Visit along with Pre-seller and guide them where required.  - Responsible for cleaning and merchandising of the company cooler given to outlets.  - Ensure that the company provided cooler should carry only Coca-Cola products.  - Prepare market visit report on daily basis and submitted to Line Manager.  - Initiate and analyze market demand for promotional and merchandising material of his area and coordinate with Trade Marketing Coordinator for placement in the market. - Responsible for market development & availability of Coca-Cola products in market.  - To obey and perform if any other official duty assigned by senior / line manager. Sales/Marketing Qualified applicants are encouraged to submit their CVs with cover letter mentioning the Position and vacancy number in subject line and send via email to below email address. Note: Those who do not have related job experience and qualification should not apply and their CVs will not be considered. Applications after closing date will not be accepted.'

b'Multiple Positions in WISE Herat Job SummaryWISE Organization looking for two female self-sufficient project managers, two trainers, one admin finance assistant. They will be responsible for ensuring the projects are managed efficiently and achieves project defined goals and objectives and deliverable. They will be directly report to the program manager. 1- Responsible for day-to-day project management of their projects and the relevant sub-components under each project. 2- Work closely with government staff with close coordination of program manager 3- Ensure that the overall project activities are being implemented based on the work plan that approved by related donors 4- Help the project director and the finance team on disbursements, preparation of all supporting documents, financial reports, travel. 5- Ensure that the reports are complete and ready to be provided for related counterparts on time without delaying. 6- Undertake regular monitoring and supervision of each project activity are being done based the donors demand and make sure the projects goals are meet with the best practices. 7- Any other project specific tasks assigned by the program manager or director. Programme 1- Project Manager with bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Journalism 2- Project manager with bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in political science 3- Trainers with bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in political science  4- Admin finance Assistant with bachelor degree in economics. 5- Master degree is preferred if available for all.    6- Two years working experience for project manager, one year for trainers and one year for admin finance assistant.'

b'Hydrology/River Sediment Specialist Job SummaryIslamic Republic of Afghanistan Request for \xe2\x80\x9cExpressions of Interest\xe2\x80\x9d for National Individual Consultants  Organization: Project Coordination Unit (PCU) Project: Irrigation Restoration and Development Project (IRDP) Reference No.: MEW/PCU/REOI/594 Announcement Date: 09-Oct-2018 closing Date: 29- Oct -2018 Nationality:  Afghanistan    Duration: one year (Likely to be extended) The Islamic Republic of Afghanistan, Ministry of Energy & Water has applied for a grant from the International Development Association toward the cost of Irrigation Restoration and Development Project, and it intends to apply part of the proceeds of this \xe2\x80\x9cgrant\xe2\x80\x9d to payments for hiring the services of following qualified national individual consultants. Below is a detailed description of duties and responsibilities which include following:   1. Simulate sediment in the catchment using Water Erosion Predict Project (Geo WEPP) model. 2. Assist the hydrology /River sediment team in the day-to-day management of hydrology and sediment data processing and rainfall-runoff modeling. 3. Process, analysis and hydrological modeling in particular River Basin using sediment raw data.  4. Hydrological stations network design in the River Basins. 5. Simulate climate change prediction using SimCLIME model. 6. Simulate long term data using Mann-Kendall trend test. 7. Capability of installation of automatic hydrological, meteorological and snow survey stations. 8. Simulate peak runoff in the catchment using Water Erosion Predict Project (Geo WEPP) model. 9. Have a thorough understanding of MS office package, AutoCAD, GIS, QGIS and any other filed relevant software. 10. Capability of operation and maintenance of automatic hydrology stations. 11. Analysis and predict future climate change impacts on air temperature and precipitation. 12. Analyses climate change scenario. 13.  Most effective way to gap filling the missing hydrological data. 14. Run the Data integration and Analysis System(DIAS) 15. Connect automatic hydrological stations sensors to satellite. Engineering \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree/ Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Civil engineering/ environmental engineering/ water resources engineering and management hydrological modeling. Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree holder will be highly preferred.  \xe2\x80\xa2 At least 5 years\xe2\x80\x99 relevant experience. \xe2\x80\xa2 Have good analytic and reporting skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Be able to present complex technical problems in clear manners. \xe2\x80\xa2 Having experience of working with national and international organization. \xe2\x80\xa2 Be able to deliver on given tasks on time. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge and experience of the necessary internal and external meetings and presentation at local and international conference. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of developing training materials, and offer trainings related to water- related models to other staff of Ministry of Energy and Water(MEW) and give presentation and seminars internally and other stakeholders. \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent oral and written communication skills in national languages as well as English.'

b"National Professional Officer (Programme and Resilience) Job SummaryPosition Title: National Professional Officer (Programme & Resilience) Grade Level: N-2 Duty Station: Afghanistan, Kabul Organizational Unit: FAO Representation in Afghanistan, FAAFG Duration *: Fixed Term: one year (with a possibility of extension) Post Number: 2004138 CCOG Code: 1A02 Reporting Lines The National Professional Officer (Programme and Resilience) reports to the FAO Representative and Assistant FAO Representative (Programme). He/she works with independence and initiative and applies knowledge of local socio-economic conditions, language, and institutions. He/she performs a range of normative and programming tasks in support of the activities of the FAO Representation in the areas of agriculture, forestry and rural development with particular attention to Strategic Objective Number 5 of the Organization (SO5) on resilience. The National Professional Officer (NPO) may be asked to represent FAO in meetings, workshops, working groups and in other forums. He/she works in close collaboration with the Assistant FAOR (Administration), the National Operations Officer, the Field Security Officer and the Chief Technical Advisers (CTAs) and project teams in the country. Technical Focus Programme development, coordination and operational assistance based on the knowledge of the local conditions, culture, language and institutions of the country of assignment. Design and implementation of a sound Monitoring and Evaluation (M-E) system for major Programmes in Agriculture related to Emergencies and Resilience with focus on food security and nutrition, Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and agriculture data analysis. Key Results Effective and efficient coordination and provision of the technical and operational support of the programme and project activities of the FAO Representation. Develop, implement, monitor and evaluate assigned programme/projects. Key Functions \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaises and assists government authorities and local, national and international institutions in the areas of FAO's activities in the country and with other UN agencies. He/she may represent FAO at inter-agency meetings as required; \xe2\x80\xa2 Promotes the image of FAO through advocacy of the Organization's mandate, programmes, national priorities and activities including development and maintenance of communication tools such as website, press releases and publications, and supports the implementation of FAO's regulatory framework (Codex Alimentarius, Code of Conduct for Responsible Fisheries, Safe Use of Pesticides, etc.) in the country; \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinates the collection, consolidation and maintenance of country data on food, crops, livestock, forestry and fisheries including information on external aid in FAO's corporate systems and monitors changes in national policies affecting the agricultural sector; \xe2\x80\xa2 Participates in producing technical, economic and policy studies as required and developing country level development frameworks such as the Country Programming Framework (CPF) and the United Nations Development Assistance Frameworks (UNDAF); \xe2\x80\xa2 Participates in the identification, formulation and preparation of programme and project proposals and monitors and reviews the status of programme/project implementation to ensure that all operational activities are carried out in line with the work plan and the project document; identifies inconsistencies and delays and, when necessary, proposes corrective measures to overcome operational constraints; \xe2\x80\xa2 Briefs, trains and supervises lower grade programme staff regarding all aspects of the job. Ensures adherence to procedures and work requirements and accuracy and diligence of the work provided. Specific Functions \xe2\x80\xa2 Supports the development, identification, preparation and formulation of pipeline programs and projects proposals particularly related to SO5, in liaison with Government services, UN Agencies, Multilateral/Bilateral Donors, and FAO Technical and Operational Divisions and Services; \xe2\x80\xa2 Contributes to need assessments especially collecting and analyzing the secondary data related to SO5; \xe2\x80\xa2 Specifies quantities and determines technical specification of agricultural inputs, as well as timing of agricultural inputs required as immediate assistance of emergencies/resilience activities; \xe2\x80\xa2 Initiates emergency/resilience project implementation until the boarding of the project CTA/manager; \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitors the resilience projects' implementation in order to ensure quality implementation on timely manner; \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaises with FAO regional focal points to better coordinate and implement the resilience interventions; \xe2\x80\xa2 Participates in project preparation in support of strengthening the SO5 component of the Country Program Framework (CPF) and inserts newly prepared concept notes and project documents in FAO relevant systems for approval processing; \xe2\x80\xa2 Provides inputs for the FAO Representatives annual reports and participates in the preparation of reports on FAO resilience program/emergencies project development, implementation and monitoring; \xe2\x80\xa2 Promotes the image of FAO through advocacy of the Organization's mandates, programs and priorities and national activities and assists government counterparts, NGOs, the private sector and others to understand how to access FAO knowledge and resources. Programme Minimum Requirements \xe2\x80\xa2 National of Afghanistan; \xe2\x80\xa2 Advanced university degree in agriculture, agricultural economics, forestry, fisheries, or any other field related to the work of the Organization; \xe2\x80\xa2 Two years of relevant experience in agricultural development and/or project implementation in an area of FAO's activities in the country, that combines project planning and formulation, agriculture, food security and nutrition, DRR, M-E, emergency response etc.; \xe2\x80\xa2 Level C of the official communication language used for FAO communication with the country (English, French, Spanish, Arabic, Chinese or Russian); \xe2\x80\xa2 Working knowledge of the local language (if not English, French, Spanish, Arabic, Russian or Chinese); \xe2\x80\xa2 Limited knowledge (Level B) of English (if the main communication language is French, Spanish, Arabic, Russian or Chinese)."

b'Project Manager Job SummaryUNCDC is seeking an individual for the position of Project Manager (PM). The incumbent will be part of the Project Support Team (PST). He/she will be responsible to ensure the project is managed efficiently and achieves its operational objectives and deliverables. The incumbent will report directly to UNCDC Managing Director and plays a lead role in developing UNCDC projects in designated infrastructure disciplines, including water, energy, roads and vertical structures, and monitors work progress and prepares reports and other key documents for the UNCDC Senior Management and Managing Director. The incumbent plays an important technical role in the design, analysis; project development and management and data collection for UNCDC designated infrastructure activities. The PM\xe2\x80\x99s tasks will be as follows: 1) Develop an in-depth working knowledge of the general contractual and detailed requirements of the construction contract for each project. 2) Observe the execution of construction to assure adherence to approved drawings and specifications, inspect construction workmanship, materials, methods of equipment, and report as to the conformity and non-conformity to the approved drawings and specifications.  3) The Project Manager is responsible for the overall project activities on site. 4) Supervise the on-site monitoring and evaluation of UNCDC construction projects, ensuring that they are being implemented according to designs, schedules, and budgets; advise and supervise the implementation of remedial measures, when necessary. 5) Make recommendations on how to correct deficiencies and resolve problems during construction.  Responsible for all operational aspects of the projects. 6) Overseeing the daily operations of the projects to ensure accurate and correct progress of the projects.          7) Ensuring procurement procedures and financial requirements are being met. 8) Keep the main office updated on the work progress and other issues on site. 9) Review and Edit of design documents and project specifications. 10) Review all the submittal and tests at all stages of the inspection. 11) Ensuring all the materials used and work performed are as per the project requirements and specifications. 12) Day-to-day management of the site, including supervising and monitoring the project labor force and the sub-contractors\xe2\x80\x99 works. 13) Work independently and maintain daily construction surveillance logs ensuring contractor\xe2\x80\x99s compliance with the terms and conditions of the contract between the construction contractor and the UNCDC. 14) Review and analyze contractor\xe2\x80\x99s change order proposals for cost and compliance with the change. Prepare cost of alternatives to design and specifications when requested. 15) Update and monitor contractor construction schedule with regard to ongoing construction, review any proposals for change in construction methods for time implications.  16) Submit recommendations, including recommending the amount of time for extensions that are justified by the change. 17) Review and provide comments for contractor monthly pay applications including issues such as percentage of completion, accounting accuracy, and materials stored onsite. 18) Prepare weekly, monthly, and other reports of the progress of construction as required. Provide digital photographic records to support reports. 19) Review and analyze material samples, catalogs and brochures, shop drawings, installation manuals, and other technical documents submitted by the construction contractor for conformity with construction contract requirements. Prepare written reports of the analysis, incorporating the comments, and provide recommendations and alternatives for appropriate action. 20) Participate in meetings and conduct discussions with local/municipal & security authorities, as appropriate, on matters pertaining to construction site activities when requested. 21) Oversee all the engineering and project management activities of UNCDC (project identification and definition, technical feasibility assessment, engineering design, environmental compliance, construction supervision, operation and maintenance, planning and implementation, and handover of completed projects), including the preparation of the necessary project documentations for client approval and post-implementation audit. 22) Assessment of potential developments and production of detailed technical reports, including site visits with the appropriate members of the management team to ensure the best cost engineered solution is produced for UNCDC projects. 23) Lead, motivate, communicate with, appraise and performance, develop and manage the project personnel to ensure all the personnel are fully motivated to achieve best performance to meet the UNCDC needs. 24) Plan, coordinate and/or supervise activities of projects and sub-contractors from initial contraction stages to completion of punch list and provide drawings to site on a weekly basis & as appropriate. 25) Co-ordinate production information to a written program to ensure company targets are met for a controlled and cost effective finish to the sites. 26) Production of engineering site feasibilities as instructed by the clients to ensure complies with the required standards and business needs; and implement new ideas and methods and continue to seek ways of both improving contribution to the UNCDC goals and enhancing the reputation of the company. 27) Participate in internal meetings and discussions as required by UNCDC senior management and comply, and assist in enforcing compliance, with project code of ethics, policies, rules, and procedures. 28) Assist in the tendering and sub-contracting of UNCDC construction projects and disseminate standards, procedures, and guidelines for construction supervision, including project progress monitoring and evaluation, certification of interim completion, quality control and assurance, environmental-impact mitigation, and health and safety. 29) Develops technical and financial proposals for UNCDC different projects by assembling information including project nature, objectives/outcomes/deliverables, implementation, methods, timetable, staffing, budget, standards of performance, and evaluation; writing, revising, and editing drafts including executive summaries, conclusions, and organization credentials as required. 30) Perform other engineering support duties that may be requested. Liaison with UNCDC main office, coordinate services as required. Engineering a) University degree in Civil Engineering or construction management with 2 years of related experience in handling USACE projects or overall experience of not less than 3 years in the field of construction management and supervision. Prior international donors experience is preferred.  b) Knowledge and ability to interpret engineering drawings and implement the field works. c) Sufficient knowledge of USACE rules, regulations, and procedures desired. d) Fluent in English. Have good command of English language both written and spoken. Candidates who do not have sufficient English language knowledge will be disqualified.'

b'Humanitarian Affairs Specialist - UNOCHA Job SummaryUnder the supervision of the Head of Office, leads and directs a team of staff; may oversee activities for a discrete work section or equivalent; plans and allocates work assignments; coaches, mentors and evaluates staff; participates in recruitment, selection and training of new staff and in the development of training programs. The incumbent will be expected to be able to perform the following, but tasks will be assigned according to regional requirements and capacity: Summary of key functions: Coordination Civil Military/Access Coordination Information Management / Advocacy Coordination Assist in establishing partnerships with other humanitarian agencies to plan and evaluate complex humanitarian and emergency assistance programmes; help ensure that latest findings, lessons learned, policy guidelines, etc. are incorporated into these activities, including gender-related considerations; Assist in the coordination of delivery of international humanitarian/emergency assistance for complex emergency/disaster situations; complete rapid assessments, prepare situation reports, analyzing the situation and specifying unmet requirements of stricken areas; Assist in the coordination of disaster response/preparedness and in the formulation of project proposals; provide technical support to the assigned regional office; Coordinate with government entities, including ANDMA and DORR across the region; Backstop international HAOs in cluster coordination and developing a strong knowledge base and relationships with clusters and key humanitarian partners. Emergency Response Preparedness & Contingency Planning including assistance in the implementation of the OCHA-led biannual regional Emergency Response Preparedness (ERP) review; Civil-Military/Access Coordination Assist in all matters related to civil military coordination including the organization and facilitation of civil\xe2\x80\x93military coordination meetings Support the development of strong relations with all provincial and regional civil-military stakeholders, including with ANA, ANP, and ANBP Assist in the development of the regional CMCoord training for the dissemination of the Civil Military Guidelines; Prepare the training material in local languages; Work with the HoO to represent the humanitarian community to the appropriate military/access actors Help develop appropriate civil-military advocacy messages on behalf of the humanitarian community Maintain the civil-military database Support the HAC on day-to-day operations related to humanitarian access \xe2\x80\x93 identification of interlocutors, negotiations for operational access and compiled Compile a database that UN and partners can use to determine humanitarian access modalities;  Assist UN Agencies and NGOs in obtaining passage to hard-to-reach areas and timely coordination from relevant authorities needed for unfitted movement / access; Provide and coordinate information on a case by case basis for areas where there is acute need for assistance; Follow up on the humanitarian access incidents (information gathering, liaison, reporting, etc) and update OCHA access database; Support access liaison functions with the authorities and other entities when UN and NGO staff face humanitarian access issues- whether cross line or cross border; Provide training and advice to UN, NGOs for access of personnel and goods; Information Management/Advocacy Assist in the collection, monitoring and analysis of information on humanitarian developments, disaster relief/management programmes or emergency situations in the assigned region; help develop and maintain a \xe2\x80\x9cwatch list\xe2\x80\x9d of areas with potential for humanitarian crisis; Assist in the establishment and maintenance of contacts with provincial government officials, other UN agencies, non-governmental organizations, diplomatic missions, media, etc., in the assigned region; Assist in the production of analytical reports on the humanitarian situation and assist in strengthening information networks to gather humanitarian data; Help establish, consolidate and maintain a database of information on who is doing what where; assist in developing provincial profiles for provinces in the assigned region, as well as hazard maps, contact lists and databases on humanitarian assistance and preparedness; Support advocacy efforts concerning humanitarian issues based on analysis of the humanitarian situation, especially on the protection of civilians; Contribute to the preparation of various written reports, documents and communications, e.g. draft sections of studies, background papers, policy guidelines, briefings, case studies, presentations (including PowerPoint), correspondence, etc., as required; Assist in organizing work groups, meetings, conferences, consultations with other agencies and partners on humanitarian and emergency relief-related matters. Knowledge management Develop and maintain a repository of key documents, presentations, photos and other materials that are necessary for the team to access and make use of knowledge products Facilitate the exchange of knowledge on specific thematic areas with regards to UN OCHA\xe2\x80\x99s mission Contribute to the identification and drafting of success stories, gaps and best practices with regards to UN OCHA\xe2\x80\x99s mission Other tasks that may be required Assist the HoO in identifying significant humanitarian issues and problems to be addressed in the assigned region. Develop well-reasoned, innovative suggestions and approaches to problem resolution in dealing with complex policy/technical issues.  Assist the HoO to manage projects and work teams, ensuring timely delivery of outputs. Help meet organizational objectives and provide sound analytical inputs and advice with respect to coordination of humanitarian/emergency action. Provide effective guidance on cultural and political issues intrinsic to the assigned region. Timely deliver assigned outputs, develop partnerships and effectively interact with colleagues internally and externally. Perform other duties as required Management Education: Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree or Bachelor Degree in political science, social science, international studies, public administration, economics, engineering, earth sciences or a related field. Experience: With Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree 5 Years and with Bachelor Degree 7 years of progressively responsible experience in humanitarian affairs, emergency preparedness, crisis/emergency relief management, rehabilitation, development, or other related area.'

Provides technical assistance as Safety Manager to Project manager and all Project team. The SM compiles all the field level and monitoring information and assists the PM in periodical project report preparation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Supports Quality Assurance Manager/Team Lead to ensure CAP/CLIA/FDA regulatory compliance in all aspects of laboratory operations. \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitors, tracks pre-analytical, analytical, and post analytical performance and advises QA Manager/Team Lead when performance standards are not met. \xe2\x80\xa2 Reviews maintenance records, charts/documents, maintain QA records. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conducts internal audits of various Diagnostic, Research and Specimen Processing sections. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conducts monthly reviews of Patient Records. \xe2\x80\xa2 Reviews, maintains Corrective Action Logs, and ensures corrective actions are completed documented, tracked and trended. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conveys QA/QC data and audit findings in a concise and professional manner. \xe2\x80\xa2 Writes, reviews SOPs, verification/validation Protocols and Reports. \xe2\x80\xa2 Reviews, edits, and version control all documents using MasterControl (SOPs, Policies, Worksheets, etc.) as they pertain to DLDM activities \xe2\x80\xa2 Performs Sub-system Administrator tasks in MasterControl. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintains personnel 6-part training folders and assists with training requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintains Proficiency Testing records, receipt of PTs, tracking PT assignments, pre- submission review, and review of the post evaluation reports. \xe2\x80\xa2 Works with QA Manager/Team Lead to maintain the laboratory website. \xe2\x80\xa2 Other duties as assigned. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all Swyft hardware systems arriving at Oakland go through proper QA and QC inspection checks before being accepted into inventory \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure product and hardware peripherals and spare parts are being received and tested properly before being accepted into inventory \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all staging activities are going through the correct processes \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all staging travelers are continually updated, reported and filed appropriately at completion \xe2\x80\xa2 Strictly enforce and maintain an MRB (Material Review Board) Area, both in the warehouse and in our ERP system \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in coordinating staging activities as directed such as overseeing kitting activities in preparation for staging pipeline or transportation of various hardware to designated sections of the warehouse \xe2\x80\xa2 Sign off on final machine readiness prior to machine transportation to install location \xe2\x80\xa2 Typical hours are 7AM to 4PM Monday to Friday \xe2\x80\xa2 Must be willing to work occasionally on weekends or overtime in weekday evenings as scheduled/requested \xe2\x80\xa2 Previous warehouse and technical staging experience is required \xe2\x80\xa2 Previous QA/QC experience is preferred \xe2\x80\xa2 High attention to detail is required \xe2\x80\xa2 Compensation details available upon request Construction \xe2\x80\xa2 Master Degree in construction engineering is required. \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent laboratory, technical, communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently once trained and maintains excellent records with a keen attention to detail. Knowledge of GMP, GCP, GCLP and or CAP/CLIA/FDA regulatory requirements and experience working in a GCLP, GMP, CAP/CLIA and/or FDA accredited laboratory. Excellent record keeping and organizational skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Must be flexible and willing to work long hours in order to meet the deadline  \xe2\x80\xa2 The ability to use your initiative and make decisions under pressure \xe2\x80\xa2 Willing to spend long hours in the field. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work harmoniously within a multicultural team Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously \xe2\x80\xa2 Must be able to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner \xe2\x80\xa2 Reliable, Honest, Transparent; Commitment for hard work & exceptional work ethics \xe2\x80\xa2 Attention to detail \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to maintain confidentiality \xe2\x80\xa2 Good communication and negotiation skills to manage expectations \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines'

b'Re-announced Coordinator Job SummaryThe Coordinator has two major areas of responsibility \xe2\x80\x93 management of the center and programming. Work will be done with the support and collaboration of the staff of the Public Affairs Section of the U.S. Embassy, Kabul and implementing partner Social Development and Research Organization for Afghans. The candidate is required to ensure the integrity of the LLC\xe2\x80\x99s financial operations and make sure the operations adhere to the existing policies of the organization and donor requirements. Center Management:  1. Management of the center \xe2\x80\x93 Responsible for daily opening/closing and maintaining scheduled hours of operation. 2. Serve your customers in a thoughtful way and be considerate of the users at LLC.  3. Ensure that everyone has access to the center and nothing prohibits them from using the services.  4. Maintenance of the collection and equipment. 5. Make sure software are up to date and NO illegal software is installed, and password protect computers.  6. Develop and post rules for patrons and ensure their implementation.  7. Work closely with local U.S. Government representative. 8. Enhance center staff capacity through timely feedback and training as needed. 9. Establish and maintain effective working relations with host institution, educational institutions, the Embassy, and local government officials. Programming:  10. Responsible for creating and conducting program activities to include speakers, discussion groups, cultural events, and regular classes in English, computer training and any other topic of interest to the local population. 11. Attract volunteers and diverse speakers for programs. 12. Frequently conduct outreach activities (e.g. fliers, event notification, visits to schools) 13. Participate in the online community of American Corners. 14. Work to improve operations and outreach to result in increased user attendance at LLCs and at programs. 15. Develop, compile and coordinate yearly activity calendar. 16. Develop and send activity reports to Kabul as required.  Budget Management and financial reporting:  17. Manage center procurement as per standards.  18. Check and review all financial documents and see that all financial transactions are sufficiently supported.   19. Ensure that all policies and procedures are adhered to.  20. Enter all processed financial transactions into the computerized system and ensure its accuracy before posting. 21. Assist Kabul management in reconciliation of other financial reports. 22. Maintain files for vouchers and other departmental correspondence. 23. Any other assignment given to him by his/her supervisor. Traits  1. Most importantly, the Coordinator should be someone who is creative, energetic, reliable, and full of initiative. 2. Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing in English, Dari and Pashtu. 3. Ability to maintain library programs and collections and access the resource needs of library users. 4. Skill in working with youth and providing youth training. 5. Computer skills including Microsoft Office applications and Internet research. 6. Ability to do long term planning, budget preparation and report writing. 7. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from the Embassy, customers and the general public. 8. Some knowledge of the United States of America. Management - Bachelor degree in Business or Social Sciences. - Three to five years of relevant experience'

b'Cost Estimation Engineer Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 Assessing and analyzing provided construction projects costing tables. \xe2\x80\xa2 Good understanding of RFP\xe2\x80\x99s of USACE, USAID, WB and other donors RFP specifications. \xe2\x80\xa2 Working knowledge of US Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) projects \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparation and evaluation of Bill of Quantities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepared detailed cost breakdown as per the scope including detailed material take off, activity wise resource requirements, indirect costs etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitating, calculating and measuring of prices per unit cost \xe2\x80\xa2 Application of appropriate methods of material/labor percentage per construction jobs\xe2\x80\x99 units \xe2\x80\xa2 Formulate and calculate the volume quantity of construction works based on architecture and engineering drawings specification  \xe2\x80\xa2 Study, assess determine and calculate the volume quantities of the jobs done on the site, the remaining vs. total quantities estimated. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare financial proposal including statements, planning inputs, data sheets, techno commercial qualifications in coordination with relevant department \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluation and Monitoring according to volumetric quantities of Structure \xe2\x80\xa2 Study, assess, determine and calculate the quantities discrepancies between adding extra and/or cutting the jobs per contract and offers\xe2\x80\x99 provision. \xe2\x80\xa2 Site supervision of ongoing projects as required by the office. \xe2\x80\xa2 Submission of weekly, monthly and annual reports to relevant sections \xe2\x80\xa2 To assist the invoice in the preparation of the actual billing of documents Engineering \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree Civil Engineering or a related field is desirable. \xe2\x80\xa2 At least Four years of direct relevant field. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to oversee all aspects of construction projects (technical design, planning, budgeting, logistic and implementation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Have strong knowledge of AutoCAD, and performing material takeoffs with CAD. \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluency in Dari, Pashto and English is required. \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong analytical skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong oral and written communication skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Able to adapt quickly to changing needs and priorities \xe2\x80\xa2 Able to work independently or as a team member \xe2\x80\xa2 Broad technical expertise in the construction sector. \xe2\x80\xa2 Planning, organizing, management skills and ability to work independently. \xe2\x80\xa2 Extensive experience in USACE, USAID Projects  \xe2\x80\xa2 Flexibility in working hours. Ability to work under pressure.'

b'Surveyor/Distributer Job SummaryThe Surveyor/Distributors work under supervision of IDP Protection Monitoring Project Manger and are responsible to communicate, coordinate, and implement the Winterization support related activities in Badghis Province. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct Survey in the IDPs settlements in QIN of Badghis province \xe2\x80\xa2 Follow up selection criteria/tools for BS in accordance with the donor guideline/requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Communicate appropriately with the target communities and IDPs representatives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate with the line departments and other stakeholders. \xe2\x80\xa2 Identification of the beneficiaries and verification of selected ones according to the donor\xe2\x80\x99s BS. \xe2\x80\xa2 Proper documentation and record of beneficiaries\xe2\x80\x99 data. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct post distribution monitoring after services delivery. \xe2\x80\xa2 Report to the project manager on regular basis. General \xe2\x80\xa2 High school graduate (university degree preferred). \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 3 years of experience working in similar position with international/national NGOs.'

b'Translator Job SummarySamuel Hall (www.samuelhall.org) is seeking an experienced and professional Translator to join its team for a full-time position based in our Kabul office. Translators have the opportunity to apply their skills in our Kabul office. They are an integral component of our research projects and work on desk reviews, key informant interviews, and research tools. TRANSLATION \xe2\x80\xa2 Translate all research tools such as questionnaires, focus group discussion guidelines, interview guidelines, training documents, presentations, authorization letters, field interviews, field notes, executive summaries, reports and briefings \xe2\x80\xa2 Translate all office documentation such as standard operating procedures, communication documents, contact lists, etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Interpret interviews and other conversations led by international staff when needed \xe2\x80\xa2 Interpret and liaise between international research staff and field teams when needed \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide the above services to all staff members from: o English to Dari o Dari to English o (English to Pashto) o (Pashto to English) o (Dari to Pashto) o (Pashto to Dari) PROBLEM SOLVING AND MANAGEMENT \xe2\x80\xa2 Review past translations from other team members and provide feedback in order to improve the quality of the work when needed \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify gaps and propose solutions regarding tool design, data collection and other translation issues \xe2\x80\xa2 Supervise the outsourced work of external translators hired on a short-term basis \xe2\x80\xa2 Devise potential tests and training materials for national applicants \xe2\x80\xa2 Be proactive and propose innovative ideas for the improvement of research cycle and office procedures related to translation tasks Translation Applicants will need to possess and demonstrate the following qualifications and transferable skills: \xe2\x80\xa2 Advanced university degree with a minimum of four years of higher education \xe2\x80\xa2 Complete written and oral fluency in English and Dari; Pashto is an asset \xe2\x80\xa2 Exceptional English writing skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite \xe2\x80\xa2 Keen attention to detail \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to adapt and work well within a team \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to cope well under pressure, work occasionally irregular hours and meet tight deadlines \xe2\x80\xa2 Three strong and verifiable references'

b'Interpreter / Translator Job SummaryTranslation of all documents (verbally, written and electronically) submitted by CSSP which may be from English in Pashto/Dari, or vice versa. He/She is responsible to report his/her related supervisor regarding their daily assignments. (Phone calls translations, views, requests or proposals from the advisors counterpart to the applicable Government agency or NGO organizations). Other Duties as assigned. Travel will be required for this position. Translation of all documents (verbally, written and electronically) submitted by CSSP which may be from English in Pashto/Dari, or vice versa. He/She is responsible to report his/her related supervisor regarding their daily assignments. (Phone calls translations, views, requests or proposals from the advisors counterpart to the applicable Government agency or NGO organizations). Other Duties as assigned. Travel will be required for this position.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Translation Education- graduated from High School (Grade 12/ Bachelor Degree). Translation testing to include but no limited to verbal, written and electronic translation, will be administered at the time of the interview.'

b'Translator Job SummaryAfghanaid is currently implementing many projects in four provinces of Afghanistan with support from different donors such as DIFD, EC, MRRD, MAIL, WFP. The main purpose of the assignment is to translate Afghanaid official documents from English to Dari and Pashto and vice versa. This is not a full or part time job within Afghanaid but would rather be a consultancy service contract. The translator is responsible for: \xe2\x80\xa2 Translating documents from English to Dari and Pashto and vice versa in a high quality, easy to understand and accurate manner. \xe2\x80\xa2 Translating all text within a document including text contained in figures, boxes, captions, sources and covers. \xe2\x80\xa2 Incorporating suggested changes by Afghanaid to the translations.   \xe2\x80\xa2 Following ethical codes that protect the confidentiality of information.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Using accurate and appropriate technical terms and terminology during the translation of documents \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring the quality and accuracy of the entire document before submitting it to Afghanaid. \xe2\x80\xa2 Meeting agreed deadlines for submitting translated documents. The agreed deadline will be negotiated for each task. Note: If the quality of the translation was not as per organization expectation that will directly affect the payment for the translation as per the prior consultancy contract. 4. Reporting Line The Consultant will report directly to the Commissioning Manager, Deputy Director Human Resources and on his absence, to the Human Resource Coordinator. Translation \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor degree from the English language deptartment of a recognised university and in-depth knowledge of English, Dari and Pashto languages. \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of 5 years experience in professional written translation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated experience in translating professional documents. \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in translating documents for NGOs and understanding of NGO\xe2\x80\x99s work and Programme, UN and governmental organisations.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Outstanding translation and editing skills in English, Dari and Pashto.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in translating issues relating to disaster risk reduction, livelihoods, gender, community development, natural resource management etc.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Fully proficient in computer skills. The contract will be for one year.'

b'Freelance Training Consultant/Trainer Job SummaryThe Freelance Trainer is primarily responsible to plan, design, organize and delivery of short term trainings to VEER clients. In addition, the consultant is responsible for training evaluation, follow up and learning verification activities and report writing.  The trainer is responsible for facilitation of VEER activities at the national level, with technical support provided by VEER management. \xe2\x80\xa2 Contributes to designing and development of quality training materials for use in training activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Design/develop training material.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Deliver training for VEER clients \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the quality of training, through participation in sessions, post-training interviews with participants, review of evaluation forms filled out by participants, and other methods. Utilize the monitoring information for improving the quality of training within VEER.    \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop tools for training impact assessment.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Write report on subject matter delivered training.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to the development of training strategic plan. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares periodic reports for the Training. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct training need assessment if needed.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Introduce tools and consistently collect feedback on training effectiveness from perspective of all the stakeholders including trainees, trainers, line managers, senior managers.  Utilize the feedback for improvement of training.   \xe2\x80\xa2 Partner with line managers and direct supervisors for supporting employees after training to assist them in application of new skills obtained from training.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist training participants in preparation of individual development plans of participants, assisting in preparation and arrangement of coaches Training \xe2\x80\xa2 Masters\xe2\x80\x99 degree in their respective profession and have at least 4 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience \xe2\x80\x9cin training needs analysis/assessment, design/development of training programs, delivery of training courses and evaluation of training programs profession or training consultancy is highly preferred\xe2\x80\x9d. \xe2\x80\xa2 Masters\xe2\x80\x99 degree in their respective profession and have at least 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience \xe2\x80\x9cin training needs analysis/assessment, design/development of training programs, delivery of training courses and evaluation of training programs profession or training consultancy is highly preferred\xe2\x80\x9d. \xe2\x80\xa2 Training of Trainers participant certification desirable; \xe2\x80\xa2 Instructional design knowledge highly desirable'

b"Security Officer, Afghanistan Job SummaryCenter for Civilians in Conflict\xe2\x80\x99s mission is to improve protection for civilians caught in conflicts around the world. We call on and advise international organizations, governments, militaries, and armed non-state actors to adopt and implement policies, tools, and training to prevent civilian harm. When civilians are harmed we advocate for the provision of amends and post-harm assistance. We bring the voices of civilians themselves to those making decisions affecting their lives.   Our growing organization is currently accepting applications for the role of Country Security Officer, Afghanistan. The successful candidate will identify and report incidents and will be responsible for the security and safety of all field office staff. The Country Security Officer, Afghanistan (CSO) main aim is to oversee and provide advice/guidance on safety and security risk management through increased capacity, technical support and advice to the and country program on all aspects of staff safety and security and ensure appropriate systems are in place at the country level. The CSO will monitor the country-wide situation, identify inherent threats and minimize risks to the program in consistent with CIVICs Security Policy and Standards. Job Purpose:               Provide safety and security guidance and management. Location:                     Kabul, Afghanistan Travel:                         Up to 40% required (domestic) Reporting to:               Country Director, Afghanistan Staff Reporting:           N/A Coordinate and provide training to field staff (Expatriates & Nationals) o  Conduct safety and security assessments of all CIVIC offices in country o  Act as a liaison with local and regional officials, and other agencies regarding security issues in the planning, coordination, promotion of, and support for existing and future CIVIC projects o  Collect, author, compile and analyze security related reports, SOP's and related security information from multiple sources ensuring CIVICs security posture is current and relevant to the situation on the ground o  Track and report on relevant incidences, near misses, and the geopolitical situation in Afghanistan and relevant bordering countries o  Ensure CIVIC Afghanistan personnel adhere to all safety and security protocols o  Support and build the capacity of national staff on security protocols o  Provide in-country briefing on security and protocols for HQ staff visting. o  Work with HQ security to insure the proper implementation of security policies and procedures o  Support CD as requiredTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Social Science Required qualifications include: o  At least a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in social sciences   o  Fluent in English- required o  5 years of field security experience in hostile environments o  Advance First Aid training o  Previous experience working in NGO o  Ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions independently o  Extremely flexible with the ability to cope with stressful situations and frustrations o  Ability to relate to and motivate local staff effectively o  Creativity and the ability to work with limited resources o  Excellent decision making skills o  Must work independently under difficult conditions o  Must be eligible to work in Afghanistan To apply please send cover letter explaining your interest in CIVIC\xe2\x80\x99s work and resume. Deadline: September 25, 2018 Resumes are reviewed on a rolling basis so please apply early."

b'Adjunct Instructor / Asst. Professor / Assoc. Professor of Mathematics Job SummaryThis is a contracted adjunct position for one semester\xe2\x80\x94renewable semester-to-semester upon mutual consent\xe2\x80\x94to teach one or more courses in Mathematics at the pre-undergraduate, undergraduate or gradual level depending upon ability and experience and qualifications, at a rank of Adjunct Instructor, Adjunct Assistant Professor or Adjunct Associate Professor according to qualifications. Key outcomes include: \xef\x83\x98 International quality teaching and learning Faculty fulfil the roles and responsibilities described in the Faculty Handbook and university policies and procedures that detail specific faculty duties for adjuncts. Major responsibilities are listed below.  With the exception of holidays, university closures, weekends, and other breaks, faculty are expected to be working on campus in Afghanistan during the whole semester, including pre- and post-semester faculty workshops and advising. The contractual period extends from one week before the start of the semester to one week after the end of the final exam period of the semester. Teaching and Mentoring \xe2\x80\xa2 Teach one or more pre-undergraduate, undergraduate or graduate courses per term, evaluating student work and assessing student learning outcomes. \xe2\x80\xa2 Hold regular office hours and work with individual students, acting as academic mentor. \xe2\x80\xa2 Remain engaged and current in the academic profession and in their disciplines. Social Science \xef\x83\x98 Master degree in Mathematics or a very much-related discipline from a reputable university. \xef\x83\x98 At least two years of progressive work and teaching experience in Mathematics or a closely-related field is required. \xef\x83\x98 Excellent English-language communication skills'

b'National Social Mobilization Specialist Job SummaryVACANCY ANNOUNCEMENT Issued Date:  25 October 2018 Closing Date:  08 November 2018 VA No. FAO/HRT/PRJ/SC/33-2018 Functional  Title: National Social Mobilization Specialist Type of Contract: National Project Personnel / Service Contract (NPP/SC) Grade / Level: SB-4 Number of Post (s) :  01 (One) Gender / Sex: Male & Female   Duration :  12 Months  Extendable / Renewable:  Yes (Extendable, Based on Satisfactory Performance & Budget Availability) Probationary Period: Initial 3 Months   Project / Programme / Unit:   Improving Economic Growth in the Western Region of Afghanistan through Community Irrigation and Livelihood Enhancement (GCP/AFG/097/JPN) Duty Station:  Herat - With Possible Field Missions to Other Project Sites/Location Sub \xe2\x80\x93 Station:  N/A  REMUNERATION:  \xef\x82\xa7 The remuneration for the post of National Social Mobilization Specialist is USD 1,947 (SB-4 Step 1) monthly based on the qualification and experience of the candidate. \xef\x82\xa7 The selected candidate will also receive an additional 8.33% monthly salary as pension benefit/coverage on a monthly basis. Organization Settings: Through its Country Offices, or FAO Representations, FAO assists governments to develop policies, Programmes and projects to address hunger, food security and malnutrition, and provides technical support for the sustainable development of their agricultural, livestock, animal health, and irrigation and forestry sectors as well as emergency preparedness and response. The activities of the FAO Representation include design and implementation of country-tailored field Programmes, liaison with local donor representatives and active public awareness raising and outreach activities related to the mandate of FAO.  The position is located in FAO project in Herat \xe2\x80\x93 Afghanistan with frequent travels to other project locations in the country. Project Background:  The livelihood of the project area (Koshk District of Herat Province) is primarily based on agricultural. From the prevailing land cover map, it is quite evident that the area is predominantly covered with rainfed crop and only small patches of irrigated land. Out of the total land area available rangeland accounts for about 33 percent, rain-fed area accounts for about 56 percent while potential irrigated area is only about 1 percent, and the actual irrigated area is far less than the potential due to poor condition of irrigation canals.  Four small rivers originate from Kushk Kohna District and pass along Kushk Rabat Sangi District within a distance of 70 km and end in Turkmenistan. These rivers have not been utilized properly and the existing traditional irrigation system (intakes and catchments) every year is damaged or destroyed during the flood. Therefore, community in the area is in dire need of improved irrigation system. Majority of people are involved in agriculture and raising of livestock. Major crops are: wheat, barley, pea and melon. Every year thousands of livestock (sheep, goat, cattle and camel) are imported and sold in the market of Herat City. Communities use irrigation water for multiple purposes such as: irrigation, domestic water use and kitchen gardening. Working Relationship: The project has envisaged improving the economic growth in the Western Region of Afghanistan through community irrigation and livelihood enhancement activities. It is expected to result in the sustainable development of water resources in HariRud-Murghab River Basin and livelihood enhancement of the marginalized farmers in the area.  The project will support demand management-based efforts for soil and water conservation (e.g. increase of irrigation efficiency) through effective on-farm management practices. Capacity building and institutional strengthening of the farmers\xe2\x80\x99 institutions and government entities is also an area of focus. The proposed project will be implemented with the broad and integrated approach of water resources management for sustainable water resources development in tune with the master plan for the HariRud-Murghab River Basin Development. Another area needing attention is the enhancement of livelihood of the residents of the area. This can be achieved through a combination of programmes like rainwater harvesting/water conservation targeting the upland areas, micro-irrigation (sprinkler and drip system) for orchard farming and expansion of grazing land for raising the livestock. Impact of Work:  Successful implementation of the project as outlined in the project document and in line with FAO rules, regulation and procedure and as per demand of the Recipient Government and Resource Partners. Reporting Lines / Supervision Received/Exercised:  Under the general supervision of the FAO Representative in Afghanistan and direct supervision of the International Project Technical Adviser (PTA) and International Community Development Specialist and National Project Manager (Senior Engineer), in close cooperation with the counterpart MAIL authorities/staff, other project staff, the incumbent will be responsible for implementation of the relevant objectives/activities of the \xe2\x80\x9cProject for Improving Economic Growth in the Western Region of Afghanistan through Community Irrigation and Livelihood Enhancement\xe2\x80\x9d.  Key Functions/Results: \xef\x82\xa7 Raise awareness regarding the purpose of the project at community level by disseminating information through locally relevant communication channels such as mosques, village meetings, NGOs and women\xe2\x80\x99s CDCs, as well as broadcast and print media. \xef\x82\xa7 Identify primary and secondary stakeholders at local level in consultation with village leadership and conduct meetings with the stakeholders\xe2\x80\x99 representatives. \xef\x82\xa7 Seek the opinions of the beneficiaries on proposed activities; and involve them in planning, design, implementation, supervision and monitoring of the proposed activities jointly with the DAIL personnel. \xef\x82\xa7 Provide priority to seek the views of the most disadvantaged and marginalized groups. Encourage an enhanced participation of women (especially female-headed households), landless, disabled and elderly people. \xef\x82\xa7 Contribute in the preparation of the technical, social and agriculture inventory for the initial bench marking in tune with the project output indicators.  \xef\x82\xa7 Use socio-environmental findings to determine whether land acquisition including voluntary donation is required to enable the sub project to proceed. \xef\x82\xa7 Carry out joint diagnostic walkthrough with the Mirabs, community and the technical staff both from the project and from the DAIL for the identification of the maintenance need as well as institutional and agricultural problems associated with the proposed sub-project at the farm, tertiary, branch and the main canal levels. \xef\x82\xa7 Facilitate negotiations between the community and projects regarding the cost sharing (cash/kind/labour) as well as roles and responsibilities in the part of both the entities and prepare the Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) between them. \xef\x82\xa7 Initiate the formation of the Irrigation Associations (IAs) in the sub-project areas conducting the general assembly meetings with the wider participation of the sub-project beneficiaries. \xef\x82\xa7 Conduct a training need assessment and train government staff to deliver specific trainings for relevant local government officers, Mirabs, members of IAs and other key stakeholders on the subjects such as canal O&M, Irrigation management, resource mobilization etc. \xef\x82\xa7 Help in identifying alternative livelihood options for the landless and marginalized farmers and oversee the implementation of such livelihood enhancement programmes. \xef\x82\xa7 Mediate for the dispute resolution among the community as well as between the community and the contractor during the sub-project implementation. \xef\x82\xa7 Contribute to the periodic reports to be submitted by the project to the resource partner. \xef\x82\xa7 Any other duties requested and instructed by the Project Technical Advisor (PTA) and the International Community Development Specialist and FAO Representative. Expected Outputs: \xef\x82\xa7 Timely production of outputs considered satisfactory by the Project Technical Adviser, International Community management Specialist and National project Manager/Senior Engineer. Prepare end of assignment report after completion of the assignment.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Social Science Education: \xef\x82\xa7 University degree in Social Science, Agriculture, development studies or equivalent qualification, Civil/ Agriculture Engineering and Irrigation, or closely related fields; Work Experience:  \xef\x82\xa7 At least seven (07) years of professional experience in irrigation schemes, on civil works contracts; preferably experience with UN and/or NGOs in the western region of Afghanistan; \xef\x82\xa7 Computer literacy and skills to use word-processing equipment is necessary; \xef\x82\xa7 Excellent report writing skills; \xef\x82\xa7 Experience of working with UN, government entities and western region is highly desirable. Other Desirable Skills: \xef\x82\xa7 Excellent interpersonal communication and coordination skills, and proven ability to work constructively with a variety of stake holders to achieve common goals; \xef\x82\xa7 The candidate should have the proven records of organizing and managing the rehabilitation of irrigation projects and watershed management;  \xef\x82\xa7 Similarly, the candidate should possess the ability to other water sector experiences; \xef\x82\xa7 Good knowledge of protocol, good judgment and initiative;  Language Skills: Excellent knowledge of English and local languages, both spoken and written skills. COMPTENCIES: \xef\x82\xa7 Core competencies: FAO core competencies include: Understanding FAO\xe2\x80\x99s mandate & its global context; planning, organizing, and delivering quality results; communicating to build understanding & support; working together in teams and partnerships; engaging in continuous learning. \xef\x82\xa7 Operational Effectiveness: Working independently, structuring tasks, establishing priorities and adhering to deadlines. Show a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail. Contribute ideas and suggestions for process improvement. \xef\x82\xa7 Client Orientation: Focus on results for the client. Attend to inquiries from internal and external clients in an effective, timely and courteous manner. Treat clients with courtesy and respect even when working under pressure. Express a high level of professionalism. \xef\x82\xa7 Interpersonal Communications and Teamwork: Work effectively and efficiently with staff at all levels, listen to others and openly share own ideas. Express sensitivity, cultural empathy and respect for diversity. Productively handle differing views and opinions and strive for achievement of shared goals. Respond positively to feedback. \xef\x82\xa7 Knowledge Exchange and Learning: Share own knowledge and promote a learning culture within the work environment. Actively work towards professional development, including personal learning.  Apply newly acquired skills and support flexibility within the work environment.'
