b'Female Security Guard Job SummaryThe incumbent protect FMIC\xe2\x80\x99s premises, assists and personnel, check-up the visitors and guests and get confirmation from related authorities. He or she will maintain a high visibility presence and prevent all illegal or inappropriate actions. \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for the access control, screening and vetting of all vehicles and personnel entering the          compound, defending access to the premises and providing an active incident response capability. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conducts thorough vehicle and personnel searches to secure the compound from weapons, explosives,          contraband, and other threats. \xe2\x80\xa2 Patrols assigned areas on foot and takes action to investigate, report, prevent, or stop; suspicious activity,          hostile actions, fires, vandalism, theft, inappropriate behavior, or safety hazards.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Performs the day to day protective security functions as specified in daily post or general orders. \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitors and authorizes entrance and departure of residents, employees, visitors, and other persons to          guard against theft and maintain security of the premises.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Communications technology including local cell phone, regional and global satellite phone, and UHF/VHF          radio. \xe2\x80\xa2 Drafts and completes Incident and Serious Incident reports as required using the proper required formatting          structure. \xe2\x80\xa2 Observes activity and traffic in assigned areas to enforce compound rules/regulations; alerts guests or          visitors of infractions, or of emergencies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Report in detail any suspicious incidents patrol randomly or regularly building and perimeter \xe2\x80\xa2 Checks doors and windows of buildings to ensure they are secured notes in written log any unlocked          doors/windows; submits information to supervisor. \xe2\x80\xa2 Always conducts him/herself in the most professional manner when dealing with guests, Customers, visitors,          employees, coworkers, and supervisors. Security/Safety Able to read and write in local languages, ability to read and write in English is an added advantage'

b"Sales executive Job SummarySales executive will focus mainly on the practical application and management of the organization's marketing operations.  He/She should be efficient and effective in performing their functions, should have excellent communication and analytical skills. He / She will in charge of the organization's entire marketing activities and handles formulating, directing and coordinating marketing activities so as to influence customers to choose the organization's Services and product over competitors. Detailed responsibilities of the Sales executive are as following: \xe2\x80\xa2 Sell telecommunications product and services to both individuals and companies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Build market position by locating, developing, defining, negotiating, and closing business relationships. \xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding current and potential customers through a combination of telephone and in-person cold calls, networking and referrals to obtain appointments. \xe2\x80\xa2 Identifying new business opportunities \xe2\x80\xa2 Managing the customer journey (customer relationship management) \xe2\x80\xa2 Write and submit accurate proposal \xe2\x80\xa2 Submit pricing and pre-qualification requests reflecting the client\xe2\x80\x99s requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain and update database in sales database including all activities, partners, and opportunities with their current status. \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible to visit the target potential customer as advised by top management. \xe2\x80\xa2 Measuring success \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring timely delivery \xe2\x80\xa2 Making customer focused decisions \xe2\x80\xa2 Making Cold calls \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide daily activity reports to Manager \xe2\x80\xa2 Other duties as may arise from time to time and as may be assigned to the employee. Sales/Marketing Education Completion of secondary (high) school is required / Bachelor Degree Preferred Experience: Must have prior experience with ISP companies"

b'Sales Executive-Retail Channel Job SummaryTo maximize company\xe2\x80\x99s sales and market penetration in Retail segment (A Class, B Class & C-Class) and to secure the relevant receivables as well as ensuring outstanding service to our customers as a competitive edge.    ACCOUNTABILITY  \xe2\x80\xa2 Achieve monthly and annual sales targets. \xe2\x80\xa2 Review ageing report on regular basis, collect due outstanding and ensure reducing bad debts.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the credit limit and credit timeline as per the policies set by finance department. Field Sales Execution \xe2\x80\xa2\tSelling ready stock to pre-assigned customers in a designated route. \xe2\x80\xa2\tTo check in-store displays to maximize sales through regular field visits across retails stores. \xe2\x80\xa2\tTo set target for individual customers, by category of product. \xe2\x80\xa2\tTo execute regular promotions in collaboration with account managers.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tBe responsible for achieving sales target. \xe2\x80\xa2\tCovering and visiting required number of outlets per-day / per-month. \xe2\x80\xa2\tPrepare invoices and collect cash/cheques. \xe2\x80\xa2\tHandling and delivering stocks. \xe2\x80\xa2\tAnalysing competitor\xe2\x80\x99s activities and reporting to Sales Manager.   \xe2\x80\xa2\tPrepare daily, weekly, monthly and other required sales reports.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tResponsible to acquire accounts in Kabul territory.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tKeep an open eye on the market and be informed on what competitors are doing.  \xe2\x80\xa2\tKeep the sales team well-informed on any new leads in the market and always keep an open communication channel, brain storm and discuss how to improve internal processes or how to adopt best practices as seen from the market. \xe2\x80\xa2\tInsure that all sales orders are acknowledged within a reasonable response limit. \xe2\x80\xa2\tMaintain good customer relationship with clients. Sales/Marketing Education  \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in sales or marketing  \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 4 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in the field for direct sales of product'

b'Marketing & Salse Executive Job SummaryYou are responsible to develop, manage, monitor and drive the marketing strategy and activities across all segments including ATL, BTL and Culture Marketing. You will work closely with sales department to ensure marketing strategies are in line with growth of brand and achieving sales targets. \xe2\x80\xa2 Establish the company\xe2\x80\x99s products as a strong consumer-focused brand by designing and executing short, mid and long-term programs achieving strong credibility of the product and brand, perfect brand awareness, offering personal experiences to our consumers and adding actuality to our brand.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Development and implementation of strategies and plans for the company\xe2\x80\x99s events. \xe2\x80\xa2 Drives the development and execution of regional culture-focused marketing initiatives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage and coordinate all marketing, advertising and promotional staff and activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Overseeing all marketing activity and ensuring it fits with the marketing strategy. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct market research to determine market requirements for existing and future products. \xe2\x80\xa2 Analysis of customer research, current market conditions and competitor information. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and implement marketing plans and projects for new and existing products. \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor, review and report on all marketing activity and results. \xe2\x80\xa2 Determine and manage the marketing budget. \xe2\x80\xa2 Deliver marketing activity within agreed budget. \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaison with media and advertising. Sales/Marketing \xe2\x80\xa2 Masters or Bachelor Degree in Marketing.  Minimum 4 years of professional experience in marketing field and marketing management. \xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding of traditional and emerging marketing channels. \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to think creatively and innovatively. \xe2\x80\xa2 Budget-management skills and proficiency. \xe2\x80\xa2 Professional judgement and discretion that comes from years of experience in the field. \xe2\x80\xa2 Analytical skills to forecast and identify trends and challenges.'

b'Sales & Relationship Officer Job Summary 1- Manage and maintains current business relationships and seeks a new customer through sales, marketing, and referrals. 2-  Build and maintain executive relationships with customers and act as a trusted advisor 3- Follow up on new leads and referrals to generate business 4- Contribute to planning, development, and delivery of marketing campaigns designed to sell Company\xe2\x80\x99s products/services and to enhance its image 5- Assist in creating, developing and implementing new innovative ways to communicate the Company\xe2\x80\x99s products/services to existing and new customers. 6- Stay current with issues and trends in the field of both sales and marketing. 7- Attend internal and external meetings, events, conventions, and other gatherings to expand professional expertise and maintain professional contacts that support the sales function 8- Proactively manage existing and prospective clients, and follow up of relations. Build extensive networks in order to generate sales volume 9- Serve as the primary customer contact for all sales-related activities 10- Develop and implements sales plans to achieve sales targets 11- Abel to Assess problem situations to identify causes, gather and process relevant information, generate possible solutions, and make recommendations and/or solve the problem 12- Maintain positive business and customer relationships in the effort to extend customer lifetime value 13- Perform any other task as assigned by Sales Manager Sales/Marketing \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor degree in business, administration or marketing,  \xe2\x80\xa2 1-2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in sales & marketing field  \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in Afghan local languages as well as English. \xe2\x80\xa2 Good negotiator and strong influence skills.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in the Microsoft Office program.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Must possess excellent communication skills (both verbal and written), with proven effectiveness in both areas. \xe2\x80\xa2 Being flexible regarding working hours.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of the local market and local contacts.'

b'M-Paisa Job Summary\xe2\x80\xa2 Identify business opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating their position in the industry, researching and analyzing sales options. \xe2\x80\xa2 Review existing business products and commercial services to ensure continuous improvement and growth \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and maintain industry knowledge and networks and effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders to achieve both short and long term goals;  \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify industry/business developments opportunities and challenges;  \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify product improvements or new products by remaining current on industry trends, market activities, and competitors  \xe2\x80\xa2 Focus on sales efforts by studying existing and potential volume and value of transactions. \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products   delivery schedules, merchandising techniques etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Recommend changes in product/services and policy by evaluating results and competitive developments  \xe2\x80\xa2 Resolve customer/clients complaints by investigating problems, developing solutions, preparing reports and making recommendations to management.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards. \xe2\x80\xa2 Require travel to the regions to promote M-Paisa to regional Roshan staff and potential clients/customers; and get an understanding of the regional market dynamics \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure the platform requirements are defined to support products and promotions \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide a roadmap and implementation plans for products and promotions \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the Head of Operations and M-Commerce to make sure that Customer issues Field Management Issues are taken care of and do not create risk on the commercial end \xe2\x80\xa2 Recommend new opportunities and promotions that help increasing the volume and value of transactions. SKILLS: \xe2\x80\xa2 Presentation Skills, Client Relationships, Emphasizing Excellence, Energy Level, Negotiation, Prospecting Skills, Meeting Sales Goals, Creativity, Sales Planning, Independence, Motivation for Sales & life cycle management. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge and experience of mobile money in general and in Afghan context QUALIFICATIONS: BBA with at least 5 years of related experience with any reputable company/organization. Sales/Marketing QUALIFICATIONS: BBA with at least 5 years of related experience with any reputable company/organization.'

experience, skills and capabalities  \xef\x82\xa7 Supervises the day to day visits and account status of the segment team \xef\x82\xa7 Supervises segment sales team on their day to day business b'Senior IT Technician Job Summary Detailed responsibilities of the Senior IT Technician are as following: \xe2\x80\xa2 Answer phones \xe2\x80\x93 Politely and speak clearly and confidently at all times. \xe2\x80\xa2 Complete projects within the time constraints provided by your manager. \xe2\x80\xa2 Articulate to customer the issue and resolution to trouble tickets. \xe2\x80\xa2 Understand ticketing system and billing procedures. \xe2\x80\xa2 Document all steps taken to resolve all trouble tickets. \xe2\x80\xa2 Document any undocumented processes for other technicians to reference when facing a new issue. \xe2\x80\xa2 Articulate to other staff the steps taken on a trouble ticket and be willing to ask for assistance when you are stuck or research and approach appropriate staff before implementing a resolution. \xe2\x80\xa2 Know when an issue is beyond your capabilities and articulate to upper level/seasoned technician\xe2\x80\x99s steps you\xe2\x80\x99ve already taken to try to resolve. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide afterhours, holiday work and support as needed. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide night shift support as needed  \xe2\x80\xa2 :Troubleshoot customer network  \xe2\x80\xa2 Install Customer site link and activate it  \xe2\x80\xa2 Install Company Sites link and devices  \xe2\x80\xa2 Setup an email account, forward, distribution group for customer  \xe2\x80\xa2 Setup email on a mobile device (Blackberry, iPhone, iPad, Droid, etc) \xe2\x80\xa2 Configure Email client on a Mac or PC \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform a site email provider cutover from start to finish \xe2\x80\xa2 Troubleshoot loss of network drive connectivity \xe2\x80\xa2 Configure and Deploy ACS managed service software Other Duties as may arise from time to time and as may be assigned to the employee Sales/Marketing \xe2\x80\xa2 BS degree in Computer Science  \xe2\x80\xa2 MCSE/CCNA/CCNP Will be preferable  \xe2\x80\xa2 Basic Knowledge of MikroTek. \xe2\x80\xa2 Confident and dynamic personality. Qualifications Education High School Graduate Experience: Must have prior experience as a IT Technician\xe2\x80\x93 Experience with ISP or Telecom Sector is highly preferred'

b'Sales Manager Job SummaryTo develop and implement marketing & sales policies, standards and strategies as well as take responsibility for sales campaigns and projects within the company. The candidate is responsible for business development activities in Kabul and abroad. He/she is an essential part of the business development and responsible for all the activities related to business development of Aeroparcel and building market awareness of Aeroparcel services and maintaining awareness of market trends and emerging demands. sales manager is responsible for developing, implementing and executing strategic marketing & sales plans for an entire organization (or lines of business and brands within an organization) in order to attract potential customers and retain existing ones. Driving new business revenues through the acquisition of servicing new clients. He will also be tasked with dealing with Corporate Clients, cross selling and up selling to grow and develop business. He/ She will be responsible for profit and loss, (team) revenue target and ensuring all KPI\xe2\x80\x99s are met. Your responsibilities as Sales Manager would be mainly as follows: \xe2\x80\xa2 Guarantee a considerable business growth year by year \xe2\x80\xa2 Find, create and manage a robust pipeline of business opportunities nationally and internationally jointly with your sales team. \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify customer tenders and RFQs and develop sustainable innovative transport and logistics solutions for proposal. \xe2\x80\xa2 Coach, train, lead and develop a team of sales officers. \xe2\x80\xa2 Keep your ear on the market, identify new trends and developments. \xe2\x80\xa2 Closely exchange and work with the operations and customer service departments, especially in case of service hick ups. \xe2\x80\xa2 Of course there is also some administrative tasks involved like creating sales budgets, reports, planning and monitoring exercises etc... Still seems like a fit to you ? Then contact us, we are waiting and are happy to make your acquaintance.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Sales/Marketing 1. Bachelor in Sales or transportation with specialization in Sales Management, Master holders will be preferred.  2. Extra diploma in shipping, courier management or operations management is an advantage.'

b'Tele-Sales Assistant Job SummaryTelesales Assistant contributes in generating sales for the company and is responsible for closing sales deals over the phone and maintaining good customer relationships. The goal is to help the company grow by bringing in customers and developing business. 1. Managing, tracking and following up on leads by calling them. 2. Influencing customers to open account with AIP by following a prepared script to give service reference information. 3. Meeting monthly and quarterly sales targets. 4. Maintaining expert product knowledge in order to meet all clients\xe2\x80\x99 queries. 5. Maintaining long lasting customer relationships. 6. Conducting business reviews to ensure clients are satisfied with the service of AIP. 7. Maintaining clients\xe2\x80\x99 database by entering/writing, verifying, and backing up data. 8. Maintaining quality service by following AIP\xe2\x80\x99s standards. 9. Keeping records of calls and sales and note useful information. 10. Pursuing and following up with prospect clients to understand their requirements and close deals. 11. Presenting products or services of AIP over the phone as well as dealing with queries and doubts. 12. Other job-related tasks as assigned by the line manager. Sales/Marketing \xe2\x80\xa2 High school graduated; bachelor degree in Marketing or Business Administration will be preferred.'

b'Sales Officer Job SummaryThe incumbent will be responsible to demonstrate a diverse range of sales skills to assist business development, in order to attract potential customers and retain existing ones. He/she is an essential part of the business development and responsible for all the activities related to business development of Aeroparcel and building market awareness of Aeroparcel services and maintaining awareness of market trends and emerging demands. 1. In depth experience in transportation and/or express business, air & ocean cargo, courier and parcel; 2. Excellent network to cargo and express customers and clients (private industries, all sectors, Government (national and international), NGOs; 3. Identifies business opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating their position in the industry; researching and analyzing sales options; 4. Sells products by establishing contact and developing relationships with prospects; recommending solutions; 5. Maintains relationships with clients by providing support, information, and guidance; researching and recommending new opportunities; recommending profit and service improvements; 6. Identifies product improvements or new products by remaining current on industry trends, market activities, and competitors; 7. Attending trade exhibitions, conferences and meetings; 8. Demonstrating and presenting products to the market and customers; 9. Maintaining and developing relationships with existing customers in person and via telephone calls and emails; 10. Negotiating on price, costs, delivery and specifications with buyers and managers; 11. Creating detailed proposal documents, often as part of a formal bidding process which is largely dictated by the prospective customer; 12. recording sales and order information and sending copies to the sales office, or entering figures into a computer system; 13. cold calling to arrange meetings with potential customers to prospect for new business; 14. To be responsible for ensuring that the Sales and Marketing service in relation to service is delivered in an effective and cost effective manner within specified budgets and approved programs; 15. To ensure an excellent customer service is provided to customers involved in the sales, marketing and ongoing services at Aeroparcel; 16. To ensure the sales and marketing service is efficiently and effectively delivered in line with business plan expectations and that the service continuously improves to meet best practice and customer expectations; 17. To build effective relationships with a range of partners including key internal officers/teams, external customers, solicitors, and developers; 18. To contribute to the Sales & Marketing Plans, monitoring and to report on performance; 19. To assist Marketing & Sales Manager in the preparation of reports to Senior Management Team, Sub-Committees, Board and meetings as required [and attend where necessary]; 20. To act as the day to day lead for all Aeroparcel sales and marketing activity within Kabul and provinces. To provide expert advice on all aspects of sales and the sales process; 21. Work closely with the Development Team to ensure that all forecast programs targets in relation to Aeroparcel sales met; 22. Ensure the delivery of an excellent quality sales service against Key Performance Indicators, which are continually improved and meet the diverse needs of customers; 23. Co-ordinate the setting of the sales and marketing budgets and ensure that these are appropriately monitored against Key Performance Indicators; 24. Prepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information; 25. Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards; 26. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks and benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; 27. Travel within and outside Afghanistan; 28. Attend business meeting, conferences, and other events within and outside Afghanistan& 29. Perform any other task assigned by the line manager.  Reporting \xe2\x80\xa2 Sales Officer reporting line will be directly to Sales & Marketing Manager of Aeroparcel, Inc. PHYSICAL DEMANDS  \xe2\x80\xa2 An energetic and physically well employee is needed.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Sales/Marketing REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: 1. Bachelor in Sales & Marketing with specialization in Sales Management  2. Extra diploma in shipping, courier management or operations management is an advantage.  EXPERIENCE  \xe2\x80\xa2 3 year of professional experience with international or national organizations. Private sectors experience especially in courier and shipping industry is highly desirable.  ADDITIONAL ELIGIBILITY QUALIFICATIONS  \xe2\x80\xa2 The employee should be able to furnish two individuals as a guarantor for attesting the social worthiness of the employee.'

b'Research Consultant Job SummaryTITLE:                   Research Consultant TRAVEL:                             As needed to Badakhshan and Kandahar REPORTING TO:                Country Director, Afghanistan DURATION:                       40 to 60 days. NATIONALITY:                  Afghan STAFF REPORTING:          N/A \xe2\x80\xa2        Use an appropriate methodology to design and manage a research project, which may involve the use of quantitative and/or qualitative methods for data analysis; \xe2\x80\xa2     Sort and cluster the collected data and make sure they are all translated into English; \xe2\x80\xa2     Analyze the collected data from the field. b'Social Organiser Job SummaryThe Social Organiser is responsible for social mobilization at the community level; facilitate Afghanaid\xe2\x80\x99s work with communities, ensuring wide participation of community women and/or men in decision making and equity in the benefits of development activities. The incumbent will be responsible for ensuring equity in the benefits of development activities and community support for project implementation and the sustainability of social development. The incumbent will also be responsible for organizing women into women\xe2\x80\x99s groups or men into men\xe2\x80\x99s groups and training them in selected topics. Finally, the Social Organizer will contribute to Afghanaid\xe2\x80\x99s efforts to continually learn from its implementation experience (both of Afghanaid and other development actors/researchers) and to feed that learning into the design of new projects, programs and development strategy, particularly those related to women\xe2\x80\x99s social and economic development and empowerment. Responsibilities \xe2\x80\xa2 Planning, developing and implementing an appropriate community mobilisation approach in the selected areas of the respective province in a professional and timely manner. \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate a community decision making process that ensures wide participation.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the organisation of official workshops, conferences, and meetings to link women beneficiaries with human rights defenders and service providers at the district and provincial level.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring that the project is implemented in accordance with national, organisational and donor requirements, standards, policies and procedures and that those commitments to the donor, communities and other programme partners are fulfilled in a professional and timely manner. \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinating and communicating with other team members and liaise with provincial stakeholders. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the project technical team in designing and conducting a social analysis and study of best practices to enhance project visibility and to be applied into Afghanaid\xe2\x80\x99s future plan of action. Specific duties: \xe2\x80\xa2 Mobilise the participating communities to get their support and/or involvement in the project implementation through raising awareness on project purpose, objectives and progress among the project participants and female communities; regularly monitor whether the project gets support from the communities.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Building the capacity of female project participants and facilitate the trainings and meetings conducted for the project participants by the technical team. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the organisation and facilitation of official workshops, conferences, and meetings to link women beneficiaries with human rights defenders and service providers at the district and provincial level.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct regular visits to project area and ensure field acidities are properly implemented according to plan, technically sound, cost-effective and relevant to the target beneficiaries\xe2\x80\x99 needs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide support to the project team in organising meetings with relevant stakeholders, CDCs and in establishing strong linkages between the women\xe2\x80\x99s groups and the CDCs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide support to the team developing and disseminating learning/technical messages to enable communities at various levels to manage their social and economic resources and share project benefits in an equitable manner for long term sustainability. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct needs assessments of project participants supporting the designing of training programs to address the identified needs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Advice and assist the Project Manager and Project Coordinator in designing, developing and monitoring the implementation plan related to community mobilisation;  \xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to the preparation of quarterly and annual project work plans and budgets and assist the Project Manager and Project Coordinators in budget tracking and analysis as necessary. \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the project team to foster useful communication, collaboration and harmony within the team and promote individual and collective commitment to implementation quality. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure a good working relationship between the project team and relevant government departments and administration. \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate, in close coordination with the project team, any visits of internal or external stakeholders to monitor the project implementation.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Keep appropriate records for collecting project implementation evidence: attendance sheets, distribution lists, training needs assessment records, pre- and post-training assessment, etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the M&E Officer in collecting case studies, success stories and other relevant M&E data; provide support to conduct result relevant baseline assessment and other surveys. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the equipment distribution process.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform any other duties as required. Programme Education/ training Diploma in a related field  University Degree Work Experience  Minimum three years of experience in a similar capacity  Prior work experience in the fields of community development and community mobilisation.  Experience in assessing training needs and building the capacity of project participants Professional Skills and Competencies  Dependable professional with strong organisational and coordination skills, initiative, judgment and adaptability with significant levels of autonomy.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated ability to effectively plan, setting priorities and meeting tight deadlines; results-oriented approach to delivering work priorities \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated commitment to continuous learning and professional development; ability to convert lessons learnt and experiences gained from delivering trainings in the field to improving the training approach; \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong communication, analytical and report writing skills with fluency in spoken and written Dari, and Uzbek in the case of Samangan;    \xe2\x80\xa2 Willingness, enthusiasm and experience in working with vulnerable women with a focus on their economic and social empowerment.   Knowledge and skills in basic computing Working knowledge in English, or other local languages Values and attitude \xe2\x80\xa2  Strong interpersonal skills in working in a multi-disciplinary team.  A clear and firm commitment to human rights, equality, role and empowerment of women, minorities and persons with disabilities.  Understanding and knowledge of Islamic perspective on women\xe2\x80\x99s rights and strong understanding of the local context. \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible, committed and honest in his/her work \xe2\x80\xa2 Detail-oriented person. \xe2\x80\xa2 Resilience to live, travel and work in isolated and possibly insecure locations.  Flexible, dynamic, ability to multitask.'

b'Project Coordinator Job SummaryCoordination and supervision of the project\xe2\x80\x99s interventions; ensuring smooth implementation in the respective province and providing livelihoods and civic engagement expertise to support the Project Manager and all relevant field staff. Responsibilities \xe2\x80\xa2 To coordinate and supervise project activities, ensuring smooth project implementation according to the project work plan and achieving planned results.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Providing livelihoods and civic engagement development support and assistance to the Project Manager and the provincial team to ensure implementation according to technical standards. \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage AEPO\xe2\x80\x99s contribution to the project.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordination of the project activities with all relevant stakeholders, especially Community Development Councils, the Department of Women\xe2\x80\x99s Affairs; the Department of Education, and the Department of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock. Specific duties: Management and supervision  \xe2\x80\xa2 Advise and assist the Project Manager in planning, implementing and further developing the project components to ensure that they are technically sound, cost-effective and relevant to the target beneficiaries\xe2\x80\x99 needs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Keep the Project Manager and relevant staff informed of any significant changes / opportunities in the local environment, problems and quality of the work. \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage AEPO\xe2\x80\x99s contribution to the project.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop quarterly and monthly work plans and budget planning in all the project components with support and guidance from the Project Manager and in close cooperation with the other two provincial Project Coordinators. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare quarterly and monthly procurement plans and provide technical assistance to the Operations team in procurement processes and quality control of the project materials.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate all project activities with relevant stakeholders, including project participants, their household members, communities outside of the project, Community Development Council representatives, religious leaders, governmental departments, NGOs and other national and international institutions and make sure the implementation is in compliance with the national, organisational and donor\xe2\x80\x99s regulations and policies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Actively participate in sectorial meetings of government departments and meetings of other relevant stakeholders in consultation with the Project Manager. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the Project Manager in responding to enquiries of a technical nature from field staff, the government, donors and other stakeholders. \xe2\x80\xa2 Translation of documents from and to Dari.  HR management \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in the recruitment and technical appraisal of all relevant staff.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Continually assess the quality of work and technical competence of all relevant field staff and ensure that capacity building needs are met through training, on-the-job coaching or other methods, as appropriate. \xe2\x80\xa2 Regular visits to all project sites and provinces to assess the performance of staff and quality of project implementation, and provide information, encouragement and technical support as required. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop capacity building plans and conduct trainings for field staff if necessary. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide logistical and technical support to external consultants and visitors monitoring the project. \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate and actively participate in experience sharing workshops and staff meetings at the provincial and national level. Linkage creation and linkaging events \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure the establishment of linkages between project participants and the market, MFIs, market players, suppliers and service providers. \xe2\x80\xa2 Promote a savings and entrepreneurial culture for increased income general at the household and at community level in the project team, so they further motivate the project participants and communities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure the establishment of linkages between project participants, especially self-help group leaders, and services catering to women, as well as human rights defenders at the district and provincial level.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Work with the project team to identify and establish links with human rights defenders at the district and provincial level, including through the organisation of official workshops and conferences. \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor all production support activities and SHG linkaging activities and make recommendations for modification, improvements or the introduction of new activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Organise exposure visits and exchange visits of entrepreneurs.  M&E \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide support, collect and consolidate monthly reports from the team and submit monthly progress reports to the Project Manager. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the Project Manager and the M&E Officer in preparing quarterly and annual project reports.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the M&E Officer and the team to document and share case studies, success stories and field visit reports as and when required.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the project M&E Officer in monitoring the project activities.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out joint monitoring of technical aspects of the project with the representatives of different stakeholder groups and ensure field visits can happen on a regular basis. Perform any other duties as required. Programme Education/ training  University degree in rural development, enterprise development, marketing, agriculture or a similar field relevant to the project Work Experience  4-5 years of experience in a similar capacity  Professional Skills and Competencies Ability to provide technical supervision and motivate the project staff, proven skills in mentoring, coaching and facilitating learning and development of staff and peers. \xe2\x80\xa2 Willingness, enthusiasm and experience in working with vulnerable women. \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong understanding of the local context and Islamic perspective on women\xe2\x80\x99s rights. \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated ability to think strategically, effectively plan, setting priorities and meeting tight deadlines; results-oriented approach to delivering work priorities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong communication, analytical and report writing skills with fluency in spoken and written Dari and English, as well as Uzbek in the case of Samangan.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Good knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Office including spreadsheets, PowerPoint, and word processing Values and attitude  A clear and firm commitment to human rights, equality, the role and empowerment of women, minorities and persons with disabilities.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Competent to take initiative, work with significant levels of autonomy and able to meet tight deadlines \xe2\x80\xa2 Committed and honest in his/her work \xe2\x80\xa2 Detail oriented person \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible, flexible, adaptable, ability to multitask'

b'Programme Associate (Sustainable Results) Job SummaryFood insecurity is widespread and increasing among the population, as measured by the two SDG indicators. A survey using the Food Insecurity Experience Scale (FIES) estimated that 16 percent of the population, or 5.2 million people, suffered from severe food insecurity between 2014 and 2016. Preliminary results from a 2017 study, based on a local SDG indicator, found that overall food insecurity, including moderate and severe forms, had risen from 33 to over 44 percent in the last three years. At the same time, undernourishment, which reached a peak in the late 1990s but declined rapidly in the early 2000s, has recently started to rise again, standing at 26.8 percent in 2015. Although food insecurity affects a wide range of the country\xe2\x80\x99s population, according to the ZHSR, women, children, the displaced, returnees, women-headed households, persons with disabilities, and the poor are the most at-risk groups. Recently WFP Afghanistan prepared a 4 year Country Strategic Plan (CSP) that was developed through a series of internal and external consultations and with a focus on identifying how to help the country achieve the SDG 2 target on improving food access. WFP\xe2\x80\x99s Strategic Outcome 2 focuses on helping vulnerable people in Afghanistan to meet their own food and nutrition needs by 2022. Many vulnerable people struggle to meet their food and nutrition needs even after emergencies are over, especially if they have been displaced. Others face chronic challenges. It is therefore critical to complement the efforts to ensure access to food and nutrition during and immediately after emergencies (SO1) with support to help populations become increasingly self-reliant, in order to achieve the access target of SDG 2. Self-reliance efforts require several years of support to have a meaningful impact, but discernible progress should be made by the end of the CSP. At the same time, WFP will work to enhance the country\xe2\x80\x99s ability to respond to emergencies by strengthening the capacity of ANDMA and other relevant institutions and thereby limiting the impact of future crises on potentially affected populations. Taken together, these measures should enable more vulnerable people to meet their food security and nutrition needs on their own by 2022. This outcome will be achieved through the following output: \xe2\x80\xa2Vulnerable people benefit from nutrition-sensitive livelihood support in order to enhance self-reliance, reduce disaster risk and adapt to climate change (SDG 13), create employment (SDG 8) in urban (SDG 11) and rural areas, and support stability (SDG 16). This SO 2 \xe2\x80\x93 Sustainable Results Programme Associate will be based in the WFP field office Kandahar, reporting to the field office Head of Programme but with technical oversight from the SO 2 Outcome Manager in the WFP Afghanistan Country Office.  He/she will provide operational and administrative support to all activities under SO2 including: \xe2\x80\xa2Provide conditional, nutrition-sensitive, gender-transformative livelihood support to vulnerable people, including conditional seasonal support, asset creation and vocational skills training activities.  \xe2\x80\xa2Provide capacity strengthening to emergency preparedness institutions including ANDMA and other UN partners and institutions, as a complement to the livelihood efforts.  Main activities are highlighted below \xe2\x80\xa2Actively contribute for development of SO -2 (Asset creation, VST and conditional livelihood suport) component of implementation plan for the relevant field office and ensure that all project proposals submitted to the Field Office Project Technical Review Committee (PTRC) have gone through an effective and efficient review process in consultation with CO technical unit \xe2\x80\xa2Responsible for preparation of all SO 2 field level agreements (FLAs) with cooperating partners. \xe2\x80\xa2Provide required inputs to SO-2 Outcome Manager in CO for donor proposal development in coordination with Head of Field Office; \xe2\x80\xa2Assist in identification, development and management of potential partnerships for joint programming implementation and strengthen existing partnerships with concerned UN agencies, national & international NGOs, government key counterparts and communities; \xe2\x80\xa2Coordinate and communicate with relevant local partners, relevant government entities, agencies, NGOs and government institutions to perform accurate analyses of nutrition data at field office level and to ensure effective and efficient delivery of livelihood interventions; \xe2\x80\xa2Develop and strengthen required capacity of relevant CPs\xe2\x80\x99 staff, government staff, WFP staff and PAT monitors, through conducting training needs assessment followed by relevant trainings, on the job instructions and other initiatives; \xe2\x80\xa2Support development of comprehensive monitoring plan for all SO 2 activities at field office level including the relevant partners and ensure use of appropriate monitoring tools/checklists by all parties; \xe2\x80\xa2Regularly review and analyse monitoring findings from partners and third party monitors, summarize key issue in a tracking sheet and share recommendations for improvement and follow-up on its implementation; \xe2\x80\xa2Conduct monitoring/supervision visits to So 2 programme sites; \xe2\x80\xa2Regular review and analysis of SO 2 project reports, provide regular feedback to partners, raise issues of concern to higher-level management and, collaborate with CO M&E, investigate any irregularity or data inaccuracy; \xe2\x80\xa2Any other duty as requiredTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Programme Education: University degree in agriculture, engineering or project management, or a related field. Experience: \xe2\x80\xa2At least 3 years experiences in livelihood or asset creation program management (especially humanitarian response) including planning, coordination, implementation and monitoring. \xe2\x80\xa2Experience in design or implementation of livelihood, asset creation or vocational skills training programmes \xe2\x80\xa2Experience of working with UN or NGOs in Afghanistan. Language: Fluency (level C) in English language and in Dari and/or Pashto.'

b'Social Organizer Job SummaryThe incumbent of this position is responsible for overall organization of target communities in line with the programme objectives including election, facilitation and problem identification as well as supervising the mobilization of Community Shuras for taining, and programme implementation, identification of projects for the community, facilitation of subprojects\xe2\x80\x99 proposals and completion reports and performing any other identical duty as assigned. The incumbent also the assist to the target communities in conduction of technical survey, design and cost estimation of their prioritized Eco-DRR sub- projects. 1. Overall organization of target communities in line with the programme objectives including formation of CBDMCs, facilitation and problem identification. \xe2\x80\xa2 Concluding a participatory baseline survey on the potential resources and general problem of the community in the selected villages/ neighborhoods. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conducting facilitation during the participatory Eco- CBDP planning in the concerned communities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Regular visit to the villages for monitoring and supervision of activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate the process of linkages and Net working with Line departments and external resources. 2. Conducting mobilization of Community Shuras for training, and programme implementation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the institutionalization of problem identification, prioritization, Eco-DRR project planning and implementation based on the program objectives and principles. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist and facilitation for conducting Eco-DRR trainings based on the project cycle and need of community and community institution. \xe2\x80\xa2 Help and facilitation in preparing the work and action plans and needed Eco-DRR training material and training logistics. \xe2\x80\xa2 Sharing and coordination of field training and experiences vertically and across the district. \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the Eco-DRR trainer, Watershed supervisor and field Engineers for enabling the community based social environment. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the CBDMC for the Registration of their established community institution  3. Facilitate the identification of Eco-DRR projects for the community; facilitate subprojects\xe2\x80\x99 proposals and completion reports. CBDP)s. \xe2\x80\xa2 Report on a regular basis to the provincial coordinator on the progress of activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing weekly and monthly reports to the provincial coordinator. . Perform any other identical duty as assigned. Programme EDUCATION:  BS. Degree in Social Science or other related fields. WORK EXPERIENCE:  Minimum three years work experience of social works and work in community based DRR/development field.   SKILLS: High social skills and behavior as well as projects monitoring, community analysis survey, use of PRA methodology,  LANGUAGES: Excellent knowledge of both written and spoken Pashto and Dari is required.  Fluent in English is preferred GENERAL: Good interpersonal communication and community organization skills. TRAITS:  Build personal and inter project relationship, analyze issues, cultural sensitivity, Gender sensitivity, team work, establish a conductive working environment and persuade others, mobilize communities and implement the projects in the community based Eco-DRR development field. Having a deep knowledge of Afghan traditions is important.  The incumbent is authorized to, recommend communities projects for approval . CONTACTS/KEY RELATIONSHIPS: Provincial Project coordinator, Eco-DRR trainers, Watershed supervisors, irrigation engineers, support staff and community. WORKING CONDITION: Stationed in the project /Provincial sub office'

b'(DRR) master trainer Job SummaryThe central role of this job holder is to ensure sound technical quality of all disaster risk reduction activities and supporting the participation of community in preparedness, mitigation and response initiatives under SIDA funded project. This will include thorough analysis of local disaster risks, and regular visits to project sites to support and stimulate communities to plan and consider how they can mitigate the impact of disaster and mobilize resources to implement mitigation plan, as well as establishing Eco- Disaster Management Committees in disaster prone areas and providing trainings on ECo-Disaster Risk Reduction and Emergency preparedness and Planning whenever required. The post holder will lead and manage the planning and successful implementation of Afghanaid Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) programme at national level with particular emphasis on the implementation of ECo- Community Based Disaster Risk Management (CBDRM) approach at the provincial level \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate and support the provincial teams on planning, budgeting and implementation of Community Based Eco- Disaster Risk Management activities in Samangan, Ghor, Nangarhar and Badakshan provinces  \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with Afghanaid other programme staff on mainstreaming DRR in to existing programme activities such as agriculture, livelihood, micro enterprise etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop ToRs and coordinate with partner organisations to organise and conduct DRR related capacity development trainings such as CBDRM, First Aid, Search & Rescue, Early Warning & Evacuation and community disaster preparedness etc  \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with ANDMA, Provincial DMA, DRR National Platform and NGO DRR coordination body for advocacy and networking  \xe2\x80\xa2 With the support of DRR specialist, develop Community Based DRR operational guidelines for field staff and work towards developing Afghanaid National DRR programme strategy \xe2\x80\xa2 Work together with DRR specialist and partner organisations to develop DRR training modules and CBDRM manual for field staff  \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in national level Technical Working Groups and contribute to the development of Strategic National Action Plan (SNAP) of the government of Afghanistan  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support ANDMA sub-national tiers at provincial and district level through their capacity development, supporting them to develop National, provincial and district disaster risk management plans through consultative process involving representatives of rural women and men \xe2\x80\xa2 Support field staff to organise and conduct Hazard Vulnerability and Capacity Assessments (HVCAs)  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the field staff to develop community DRR plans based on the HVCAs and implement community level risk reduction activities  \xe2\x80\xa2 Work together with DRR specialist and relevant artists to develop and print disaster preparedness awareness materials such as posters, leaflets etc.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify training needs of the field staff and volunteers and  facilitate capacity development initiatives  \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify best practices related to DRR and develop case studies and other knowledge management outputs for sharing and improvement of the programmes \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in national and international forums and contribute to the on-going debate to develop the DRR sector  \xe2\x80\xa2 Design, resource and deliver DRR-CBDRM capacity development strategy, plan and resources as part of the overall CBDRM strategy and plan, including planning and implementation of community awareness programme to reduce impacts of disaster risks on human life and productive assets (animals, crops, water, etc.); CD will be focused on staff, community-based DRR structures, and government institutions (e.g. district and provincial level tiers of ANDMA) \xe2\x80\xa2 Working closely with relevant provincial teams and district teams members to integrate and mainstream DRR in the ongoing agenda and priorities of existing community and cluster level structures of informal governance (i.e. CDC, CLDC) including establishment of village DRR committees  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support community and cluster level governance structures to identify and prioritise appropriate CBDRM interventions to reduce vulnerabilities of communities to potential future disasters; develop medium term plans and support them to identify financial resources through government and non-governmental sources to fund these interventions \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in Afghanaid internal meetings and discussions to develop systems, guidelines, programme approaches and project proposals  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the field staff to conduct emergency needs assessments as and when necessary. Plan and coordinate emergency response activities in consultation with the senior management  \xe2\x80\xa2 Promoting Gender Equity and Diversity: To ensure that gender is fully taken into account in all aspects of the programme analysis, design and implementation. Others:   To perform any other related duties as required by the line manager. Programme Education / Training Bachelor degree in a relevant field  Master degree in a relevant field  Experience Minimum 3  years hands on experience of CBDRM and Eco- DRR at a middle level programming structure within an international NGO or a large national NGO Having working relationships and understanding of ANDMA at Kabul level, preferably also at provincial level  Competencies, Skills & Abilities \xe2\x80\xa2 Hands on proven track record of Eco- DRR and CBDRM sector \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent written and spoken Dari and Pashtu \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to communicate well in English language  \xe2\x80\xa2 Project cycle management experience \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrative evidence of skills in hazard and vulnerability mapping \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to lead rapid assessments  \xe2\x80\xa2 Staff and community capacity development experience including designing capacity development medium term initiatives and delivering them for grassroots \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring and evaluation skills and experience \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to link with other players in the DRR and CBDRM sector working in the province including the government authorities \xe2\x80\xa2 Computer literacy (word processing, power point, and basic excel) \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to travel extensively  \xe2\x80\xa2 Commitment to Red Cross Code of conduct and Sphere Standards \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience of preparedness work, especially around floods and droughts \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong team building skills and orientation of working in team setting \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work against tight timelines \xe2\x80\xa2 Be able to resolve conflicts within community and team  \xe2\x80\xa2 Design and deliver capacity development initiatives \xe2\x80\xa2 good report writing  \xe2\x80\xa2 Previous experience of having designed CBDRM projects for floods, landslides  and drought mitigation \xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding of grassroots early warning systems  \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of the district and provincial level DRR and CBDRM programmes including of PDMA be an added advantage. Values & attitude \xe2\x80\xa2 Team approach \xe2\x80\xa2 Respect for all views and opinions \xe2\x80\xa2 Commitment to value of equality regardless of gender, faith and ethnicity \xe2\x80\xa2 Respect for local communities and their ways of life  \xe2\x80\xa2 Respect of government authorities   Languages Dari and Pashtu, Uzbek will be a definite advantage'

b'DRR & Resilience Advisor to ANDMA Job SummaryBased at ANDMA, the DRR & Resilience Advisor will support the State Minister on strategic and operational issues, strengthening Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and Resilience in the country 1. Strategic Support  \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate Deputy Special Representative of the Secretary-General (DSRSG) - Ministerial meetings \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop policy position papers for State Minister for Disaster Management and Humanitarian Affairs \xe2\x80\xa2 Support operationalization of DRR/Resilience Global frameworks signed by Afghanistan \xe2\x80\xa2 Support Coordination with Regional bodies such as SAARC, ECO, UNISDR and ASEAN for DRR and emergency response in Afghanistan \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate exposure visits for capacity building of State Minister for Disaster Management and Humanitarian Affairs staff \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify international funding sources/opportunities and prepare Govt. of Afghanistan to apply for bids \xe2\x80\xa2 Support development of National Disaster Preparedness Plan \xe2\x80\xa2 Support coordination in development of a National Action Plan for DRR, Resilience and Climate Change Adaptation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Influence integration of DRR/Resilience within line ministries, e.g. MoE, MRRD, MAIL, NEPA and AMA \xe2\x80\xa2 Support development, operationalization and sustainability of National Disaster Management Information System (NDMIS) database 2. Operational Support \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate DRR Working Group meetings including secretarial responsibility \xe2\x80\xa2 Represent SMDM in UN Cluster meetings \xe2\x80\xa2 Represent SMDM in National/Regional NGO/Donor meetings and conferences \xe2\x80\xa2 Collect and maintain 3Ws (Who, What and Where) of DRR and emergency response in Afghanistan \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate standardization of models, templates and TORs for DRR and emergency response \xe2\x80\xa2 Map prepositioned materials and emergency response equipment available in the country and identify gaps \xe2\x80\xa2 Map CBDP plans, SBDP plans, CERT kits and Early Warning Systems available at community levels and identify gaps \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate information of DRR/Resilience projects being implemented in the country where SMDM has been defined as a stakeholder \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate identification, procurement and engagement of international Technical Assistance and Technical Expertise to SMDM Programme Position Requirements This is senior position within State Ministry of Disaster Management that demands equal competence in working effectively with the stakeholder e.g. relevant ministries, donors and NGOs.  Afghanaid wants to attract an individual with experience in DRR as well as high academic qualifications. Suitable candidates will have successful track records of working in government, UN, donors and/or NGOs at a senior level. The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic and ambitious, she/he will set high professional standards for him/him self and others, will possess strong interpersonal and diplomatic skills and a \xe2\x80\x9ccan do\xe2\x80\x9d mentality when approaching challenges. Education & Professional Qualification Essential: 1. Masters degree from a well-recognized University in project management, business administration, international development, disaster management, international relations or other related field. Work Experience and Knowledge Essential: \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of 8-10 years managing development and humanitarian projects and team \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of 8-10 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience and in fragile and conflict \xe2\x80\x93affected country \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of 10 years working experience directly in humanitarian relief and development \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated ability to think strategically, plan effectively, set priorities and meet project deadlines in an emergency relief/ development context \xe2\x80\xa2 Proven ability to effectively design and implement logical frameworks and work plans \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent financial management, able to plan, control and manage budgets and cash flow \xe2\x80\xa2 Broad experience and understanding of international humanitarian and development work, including community infrastructure, livelihoods, agriculture, community development and governance, gender mainstreaming, disaster risk reduction and emergency responses \xe2\x80\xa2 Proven and substantive expertise in policy analysis, development and advocacy, especially around leading edge DRR, resilience and/or climate change adaptation principles and practices \xe2\x80\xa2 Cleary exhibited knowledge of sustainability and exit strategies \xe2\x80\xa2 Displayed ability in preparing well-organized, coherent reports, templates and other documents. \xe2\x80\xa2 Consistent and proven track record as an exceptional team player and leader \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge\xe2\x80\x99s of SFDRR, SDGs, Paris agreement and have the experience of work with UN agencies in the country \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience of managing large and medium size donor funded projects especially in the field of DRR, Resilience and climate change. \xe2\x80\xa2 Proven developed and applied CBDRR manuals which were supported any project in the country or the manuals verified/published by any UN agencies in the country. Desirable   1 Experience of working as advisor to the minister level 2 A career path that clearly reflects ambition, commitment and determination.  3 Previous experience of NGOs and UN DRR working group, with best of knowledge\xe2\x80\x99s of ACBAR and other existing NGOs forums. Professional Skills, Competencies and Qualities Essential: \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluency in written and spoken English, Dari and Pashto and demonstrated ability to write, lay out and present high quality documents and reports for diverse audiences \xe2\x80\xa2 Personal integrity, initiative and drive to get the things done and achieve results \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent conceptual and analytical skills able to distil key ideas with clarity and precision \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong organizational and coordination skills, able to work with significant levels of autonomy, manage personal priorities and meet tight deadlines \xe2\x80\xa2 An outgoing and engaging personality with a strong sense of humour and a natural inclination to engage others, able to build trust, work collaboratively in teams and manage relationships with a variety of stakeholders \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to clearly and confidently articulate ideas in a persuasive manner at a senior level, able to lead and influence others with diplomacy and tact \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong facilitation, training design and presentation skills, able to organise and leading meetings, workshops, trainings and conferences \xe2\x80\xa2 Flexible and dynamic with the ability to deal with difficult, often ambiguous and challenging situations and creatively solve problems \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficiency in common office software: spread sheets, word processing, PowerPoint and Outlook \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated commitment to continuous learning and professional development \xe2\x80\xa2 Commitment to the vision, mission and values of Afghanaid \xe2\x80\xa2 Gender-sensitive, able to work effectively with and promote the participation and engagement of both men and women coupled with a thorough appreciation for the role and vulnerability of women and girls in DRR and disaster management. \xe2\x80\xa2 Resilience to live, travel and work under confining security protocols. Note:  This job description does not form part of the contract of employment; it is subject to change in accordance with the changing needs of the organisation. The post-holder will work at all times in a way which is consistent with the organisation\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to equality of opportunity.'

b'Senior Program Assistant Job SummaryPurpose:   The Senior Program Assistant (Central Region) will manage the Musharikat coalition membership spreadsheet and hard copy files, including ensuring the information is accurate and current. Specific Objectives and Duties: \xe2\x80\xa2 Provides assistance to Central Region office. \xe2\x80\xa2 Serves as a key point of contact (along with the Regional Director) for Musharikat in the central region. \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for data entry, accuracy and maintenance of the electronic Coalition Member \xe2\x80\x9cMaster Tracker\xe2\x80\x9d spreadsheet as well as the hard copy files for CSO and individual members and other documents related to central region.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Revise records in master tracker on weekly bases to reflect any changes to membership records . \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate closely with regional director and technical team in planning of Kabul based coalition events/activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provides assistance to Regional Director in development of advocacy initiatives, issue-based coalitions and capacity building programs for CSOs that are part of Musharikat coalitions.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the project with any filing, printing, copying and scanning needs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Other duties as assigned by the supervisor. Programme Education: \xe2\x80\xa2 A Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree with 3 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in related field  Work Experience:  \xe2\x80\xa2 At least three years\xe2\x80\x99 work experience in similar position for an international donor funded program  \xe2\x80\xa2 Documented experience maintaining a large, complex database or spreadsheet \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledgeable about civil society organizations in central Afghanistan, particularly women\xe2\x80\x99s rights organizations \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience working on USAID-funded programs is an advantage Other Skills: \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Highly computer literate with advanced e-mail, word processing and Microsoft excel spreadsheet management skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of TAMIS is preferred  Must be able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment Languages: \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent English, Dari and Pashto language proficiency, spoken and written  Female candidates are strongly encouraged to apply. Reporting: The position reports to the Central Region Director'

b'Project Support Specialist Job SummaryUnder the direct supervision of the Director Program, the Project Support Specialist is responsible to provide day-to-day support on various projects in areas of contract administration, project performance and financial status updates, communication with partners and donors, and other project management functions. Duties and Responsibilities The duties and responsibilities of the Project Support Specialist shall include but not limited to the following: \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain a contract tracking tool to document deliverables including targets established by MISFA for partners and by donors for MISFA. \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor MISFA and partners\xe2\x80\x99 compliance with agreements (MISFA/donors and MISFA/partners) and brief the management on a regular basis. \xe2\x80\xa2 Review project deliverables (budgets, reports, TORs, products, guidelines, policies, procedures etc) to ensure quality and compliance with the agreed upon terms and update Director Program accordingly. \xe2\x80\xa2 Work with partners and MISFA staff to assist with timely completion of the project/contract deliverables. This may include but not limited to regular follow-up with the partners and MISFA program staff and offering relevant support and assistance as needed. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare monthly financial status update on donor funded projects in consultation with MISFA\xe2\x80\x99s Finance Department. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare performance status updates on projects to donors and MISFA management as requested. \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate communication with partner institutions, receiving T.A. and other grants from MISFA. \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with MISFA\xe2\x80\x99s Finance Department, and Monitoring and Supervision Department to provide project management support on an as needed basis or as suggested by supervisor. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide facilitation and support to short-term consultants and advisors working on various projects within MISFA and/or at MISFA partner institutions. \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other activities as requested by supervisor. Programme \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum Bachelor Degree, Master Degree will be a plus'

b'Female Procurement Analyst Job SummaryTo enhance ANDSF Capabilities and Performance regarding procurement actions within the Ministry of Defense. 1. Participate in all assigned update meetings at the direction of the requiring activity. 2. Within 30 days of assignment, be familiar with all Afghanistan Procurement Laws, Decrees, and Policies. 3. Within 30 days of assignment, develop an internal work plan to accomplish statements of work (SOWs) or performance work statements (PWSs), to include strategies to develop, implement, assess, and modify ANSF acquisition policies, procedures, and core competency processes. 4. Support TAACs when issues arise related to ANSF regional contracting agencies. 5. Train the ANSF on methods of managing and auditing contracts and the procedures for interacting with, and being assessed by a COR. 6. Train ANSF acquisition personnel on PWS/Statement of Work (SOW) and QASP development and execution. 7. Support ANSF contracting personnel on how to prepare requirement packages, conduct bidder/vendor conferences, analyze and evaluate proposals, negotiate contract provisions, develop awards, administer contracts, and negotiate and coordinate additions, deletions, or modifications to contracts. Contractor procurement mentors shall not make decisions on behalf of Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan (GIRoA) with relation to these functions. 8. Support ANSF on how to manage the procurement system and data-flow from ANSF contracting sites to the Ministerial approval authorities, in order to ensure transparency and accountability of funds from contract-award to contract close-out. 9. Provide Support to Afghan acquisition agencies and procurement departments on a full range of acquisition core competencies to include, but not limited to: requirements validation and acquisition prioritization; acquisition financial management; development of request for proposals (RFPs) and other contract solicitations for materiel and services; processes for source (vendor) bid evaluation and selection and award; contract inspection and audit; certification of the delivery of articles and services; preparation and acceptance of material and services receiving reports; processes for vendor payment; and processes encompassing contract closure. 10. Support ANSF contracting personnel on the methods of continuously improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the vendor pay process. 11. Support the ANSF contracting personnel in the development of a contracting training program to include written products such as lesson plans and training plans. 12. Assist the ANSF contracting personnel with contract-closeout procedures. 13. Assist ANSF contracting personnel in the development of contract tracking policies and procedures. Assist ANSF contracting personnel in the development of contract specifications, work statements, and terms and conditions used for procurement of specialized materials, equipment, and services. 14. Assist ANSF officials with acquisition planning, and with the development of acquisition strategies that require both contracted, and organic solutions. 15. Coordinate and conduct training classes with ANSF contracting personnel. 16. Provide a critical link to Ministerial Procurement and Finance Advisors in support of efforts to transition contracted requirements from a Coalition Forces to an Afghan lead contracted requirement. 17. Attend procurement training encompassing Afghan-specific procurement laws and procedures, principles of Afghan contract oversight and execution, and insight toward Afghan culture and business practices.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Procurement 1. Two (2) years of direct contract acquisition experience or a minimum of 5 years of Contract Management or Contract Administration experience at a Government agency 2. Must be capable of operating independently and responsibly, as well as an integrated member of a team. Superior writing, computing, and communications skills. 3. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree from an accredited institution in Finance, Economics or business discipline. 4. Excellent computer literacy skills in MS Office (Word and Excel) and QuickBooks. 5. Experience of financial management, including accounting software.'

Support TAACs when issues arise related to ANSF regional contracting agencies. 5. Train the ANSF on methods of managing and auditing contracts and the procedures for interacting with, and being assessed by a COR. 6. Train ANSF acquisition personnel on PWS/Statement of Work (SOW) and QASP development and execution. 7. Support ANSF contracting personnel on how to prepare requirement packages, conduct bidder/vendor conferences, analyze and evaluate proposals, negotiate contract provisions, develop awards, administer contracts, and negotiate and coordinate additions, deletions, or modifications to contracts. Contractor procurement mentors shall not make decisions on behalf of Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan (GIRoA) with relation to these functions. 8. Support ANSF on how to manage the procurement system and data-flow from ANSF contracting sites to the Ministerial approval authorities, in order to ensure transparency and accountability of funds from contract-award to contract close-out. 9. Provide Support to Afghan acquisition agencies and procurement departments on a full range of acquisition core competencies to include, but not limited to: requirements validation and acquisition prioritization; acquisition financial management; development of request for proposals (RFPs) and other contract solicitations for materiel and services; processes for source (vendor) bid evaluation and selection and award; contract inspection and audit; certification of the delivery of articles and services; preparation and acceptance of material and services receiving reports; processes for vendor payment; and processes encompassing contract closure. 10. Support ANSF contracting personnel on the methods of continuously improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the vendor pay process. 11. Support the ANSF contracting personnel in the development of a contracting training program to include written products such as lesson plans and training plans. 12. Assist the ANSF contracting personnel with contract-closeout procedures. 13. Assist ANSF contracting personnel in the development of contract tracking policies and procedures. Assist ANSF contracting personnel in the development of contract specifications, work statements, and terms and conditions used for procurement of specialized materials, equipment, and services. 14. Assist ANSF officials with acquisition planning, and with the development of acquisition strategies that require both contracted, and organic solutions. 15. Coordinate and conduct training classes with ANSF contracting personnel. 16. Provide a critical link to Ministerial Procurement and Finance Advisors in support of efforts to transition contracted requirements from a Coalition Forces to an Afghan lead contracted requirement. 17. Attend procurement training encompassing Afghan-specific procurement laws and procedures, principles of Afghan contract oversight and execution, and insight toward Afghan culture and business practices.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Procurement 1. Two (2) years of direct contract acquisition experience or a minimum of three (3) years of Contract Management or Contract Administration experience at a Government agency 2. Must be capable of operating independently and responsibly, as well as an integrated member of a team. Superior writing, computing and communications skills. 3. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree from an accredited institution in Finance, Economics or business discipline. 4. Excellent computer literacy skills in MS Office (Word and Excel) and QuickBooks. 5. Experience of financial management, including accounting software.'
