b"Video Editor Job Summary\xe2\x80\xa2 Assembling all raw footage, with camera shots either recorded or transferred on to video tape in preparation for inputting into the computer \xe2\x80\xa2 Assembling all raw footage, with camera shots either recorded or transferred on to video tape in preparation for inputting into the computer \xe2\x80\xa2 Receiving a brief, and maybe an outline of footage and/or a shot list, script, or screenplay. \xe2\x80\xa2 Inputting uncut rushes and sound, and synchronizing and storing them into files on the computer. \xe2\x80\xa2 Digitally cutting the files to put together the sequence of the film and deciding what is usable. \xe2\x80\xa2 Creating a 'rough cut' (or assembly edit) of the program/film and determining the exact cutting for the next and final stages \xe2\x80\xa2 familiarizing yourself with the style of specific directors \xe2\x80\xa2 consulting with the director, producer and/or client throughout the post-production process \xe2\x80\xa2 Reordering and tweaking the content to ensure the logical sequencing and smooth running of the film/video. \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other duties as assigned by line manager Media \xe2\x80\xa2 High School Diploma or equivalent with at least 1-2 years of relevant experience. \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in Adobe Premiere CC, Adobe After Effect CC and Adobe Photoshop CC. \xe2\x80\xa2 Fast typing: Dari, Pashto & English  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to perform in team \xe2\x80\xa2 Good communication and interpersonal skill \xe2\x80\xa2 Computer proficiency with email, Microsoft Excel, Word and Power Point"

b'Gender manager Job SummaryGender manager will lead CHAMP gender team to integrate women in processing, post- harvest management and marketing, with a particular focus on women owned or operated businesses so that they can produce quality horticultural processed products for promising domestic and international markets.  The Gender Manager maintains a network with colleagues from different aid Agencies, Government officials, and civil society. \xef\x82\xa7 Consult with stakeholders on key gender issues and opportunities to advance women\xe2\x80\x99s economic empowerment in the CHAMP target areas.  \xef\x82\xa7 Oversee the development and implementation of a gender equity and social inclusion strategy, to effectively empower women within all CHAMP activities \xef\x82\xa7 Assist small processors with the design of new processing facilities, development of new fruit and vegetable preservation processes and formulation of new products. \xef\x82\xa7 Improved post-harvest handling for high paying markets, including sorting, grading and packaging of fresh fruits, vegetables and nuts;  \xef\x82\xa7 Assisting women-owned agribusinesses in exploring profitable markets for their products domestically and internationally. \xef\x82\xa7 Collate and analyze data related to food quality and safety, formulate control measures to reduce commodity losses and improve food quality and safety. \xef\x82\xa7 To ensure that CHAMP gender activities are in line with national policies and priorities. \xef\x82\xa7 Design and implement appropriate training courses for small-scale processors and CHAMP female extension officers.  \xef\x82\xa7 Representation of CHAMP in different working groups and interagency working groups.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Management Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in, economics, business, social sciences is required- MSc/MBA/Master\xe2\x80\x99s in related field is strongly preferred.  \xef\x82\xa7 At least 5 years of experience in developing, planning, and executing activities that integrate gender, particularly in food processing and policies that attract private sector investment preferred. Knowledge of USAID and its operations and other donor-funded programs strongly preferred.'

b'CEO/Country Manager Job Summary786 PZAF 1) Design and implement business strategies, plans, and procedures 2) Strengthen the sales department, including developing new distribution channels 3) Providing strategic direction on matters relating to business performance and business opportunities, and changes to enhance profitability and shareholder value 4) Preparing regular reports to the board that provide a strategic direction and qualitative assessment on the achievement of the planned goals for the business 5) Ensuring structures and policies are developed and implemented and maintained 6) Establishing and managing highly collaborative relationships with key policy makers, customers and other key stakeholders, both locally and internationally 7) Designing the implementation of marketing strategies and prospects for new business 8) Manage a team of over 60 employees across headquarters and 13 pharmacies 9) Set comprehensive goals for performance and growth. Evaluate performance by analyzing and interpreting data and metrics 10) Oversee daily operations of the company and the work of all departments including but not limited to HR, IT, Marketing, Sales, Finance, Logistics, etc.  11) Lead employees to encourage maximum performance and dedication Management 1) Proven experience as CEO/COO or relevant senior management role. Preference for individuals with work experience in healthcare, retail chains, and distribution experience 2) Excellent organizational, analytical, negotiation, and business management skills 3) Managed a team of at least 20 people 4) Good understanding of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PPT) 5) Track record of leading growth in a company  6) Demonstrable competency in strategic planning and business development 7) Working knowledge of data analysis and performance/operation metrics 8) Strong written and oral communication skills in Dari, Pashto, and English 9) Outstanding organizational and leadership abilities 10) Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree or higher'

b"Programme Director Job SummaryHarakat is seeking a highly qualified and committed individual to manage and coordinate the delivery of the four Programme Pillars of the AICP, and their inter-dependencies.  This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference to business environment reform and the private sector development agenda in Afghanistan. The Programme Director is responsible for developing and establishing the programme model, and monitoring the implementation, to ensure the overall integrity and coherence of all the specific pillar programmes. The Programme Director will also support the four individual programme managers to deliver the pillar outcomes as outlined in the AICP work plan.  The Programme Director will report to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO), and together with the CEO and the Chief Financial Officer (CFO), will form the Senior Executive Team (SET) of Harakat The main objective of the Programme Director is to ensure that the AICP Programme Pillars and cross-cutting workstreams (such as public-private dialogue) are delivered to the satisfaction of the SET, the Harakat Board, and the AICP Funders. The Director will also:  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the work of all the pillars is in compliance with Harakat\xe2\x80\x99s governance documents and Funder requirements \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide strong leadership and act as a role model for the organization  \xe2\x80\xa2 Actively participate in the SET, and provide timely reports to the Board of Directors \xe2\x80\xa2 Establish a comprehensive information management system, and ensure adequate reporting to the AICP FundersTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Management Applications are welcome from candidates with strong experience in Afghanistan and/or strong international experience. Women applicants are strongly encouraged to apply. We are seeking applicants with the following essential attributes: Experience 1. Demonstrable substantial experience of working in Afghanistan 2. A minimum of 10 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in project management roles with at least 5 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in programme development and management 3. Substantial field-based experience and Demonstrable ability to deliver aid development programmes in fragile and conflict state situations particularly investment climate, economic growth and private sector programmes Skills and abilities 4. Very strong skills in programme and project management, with proven competencies in related tools and methodologies 5. Excellent financial and situational analytical skills and knowledge of analysis techniques. 6. Strong contract formation and negotiation skills 7. Exceptional leadership, interpersonal communication, relationship building and networking skills 8. Demonstrable ability to maintain existing client relationships and develop new ones 9. Excellent presentation skills with the ability to address senior management, business and technical audiences 10. Ability to communicate with persons of various cultures and disciplines 11. Excellent written & verbal communication skills 12. Ability to work in a dynamic and responsive environment, and in a fragile or conflict-affected context 13. Ability to work under pressure and respond to multiple tasks 14. Ability to give solution-oriented advice and assistance to staff, clients and stakeholders 15. Ability to allocate and review priorities and meet deadlines 16. Ability to manage teams effectively 17. Professional presentation and approach Knowledge 18. Good knowledge of techniques for planning, monitoring and controlling programmes 19. Good understanding of the procurement process, including negotiation with third parties 20. Demonstrated knowledge of contracting procedures, including financial aspects of contract implementation and monitoring 21. Good knowledge of budgeting and resource allocation procedures Education 22. Advanced University Degree, preferably in Business Administration, or Public Administration, or Engineering, or a related field 23. PRINCE2\xc2\xae, Project Management Institute PMP, or equivalent programme management training and certification an advantage 24. Deep understanding of Afghanistan's cultural norms, languages and governance Language skills 25. Ability to communicate effectively in English, including a high standard of written English 26. Dari and/or Pashto languages would be a strong advantage"

b"Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Job SummaryHarakat is seeking a dynamic, innovative and value-driven leader as Chief Executive Officer (CEO). This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference to business environment reform and the private sector development agenda in Afghanistan. The new CEO will have a focused mandate to create an enabling environment to attract investors and long-term, viable and sustainable investments into the country The CEO will: \xe2\x80\xa2 Lead and own the vision of Harakat including providing dynamic, strategic leadership and direction for Harakat\xe2\x80\x99s delivery of the AICP \xe2\x80\xa2 Lead the development and implementation of Harakat\xe2\x80\x99s AICP interventions, the majority of which will be outsourced by Harakat to suppliers \xe2\x80\xa2 Position Harakat at the forefront of business environment reform in Afghanistan   \xe2\x80\xa2 Effectively develop and manage Harakat as an organization; and \xe2\x80\xa2 Proactively engage with other donors to broaden the funding base for AICP and future programming, over the longer termTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Management Applications are welcome from candidates with strong experience in Afghanistan and/or strong international experience. Women applicants are strongly encouraged to apply. We are seeking applicants with the following essential attributes: Experience 1. At least ten years of practical work experience, with a proven track record Proven complex programme management experience to be able to lead multi-disciplinary teams (including outsourced services) 2. Proven complex programme management experience to be able to lead multi-disciplinary teams (including outsourced services) 3. Experience working with governments, the private sector and civil society  4. Experience of overseeing the various operational elements of the organization, which includes experience of budgeting and procurement 5. Substantial experience working in Afghanistan 6. Experience and effectiveness in cooperating with the Afghan Government and other relevant stakeholders Skills and abilities 7. Be a self-motivated individual with a passion for improving the economic landscape in Afghanistan, and a drive to facilitate the rapid development of  a small organization 8. Ability to maintain the focus of the organization on achieving key strategic goals 9. An innovative approach and the ability to recognize new opportunities and trends, to help Harakat achieve its objectives  10. A leadership style that motivates and engages a wide range of people to make their best contribution, and engenders collaborative efforts to achieve shared goals  11. The ability to respond quickly and effectively to changing contexts, ideally in a fragile or conflict-affected context 12. Strong relationship management abilities 13. Very strong leadership, strategic planning and administrative skills Knowledge 14. Demonstrate deep understanding of Afghanistan's cultural norms, languages and governance 15. Solid understanding of Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s economic growth, legal and regulatory reform and private sector context , and the barriers to business reform Education 16. Hold a masters-level qualification in the areas of law, international development, international business, international economics, or a related field Language skills 17. Ability to communicate effectively in English, including a high standard of written English 18. Dari and/or Pashto languages would be a strong advantage Full Details Full details of the role can be found on Harakat\xe2\x80\x99s website http://harakat.af/"

b"Deputy Section Lead Job SummaryDEPUTY SECTION LEAD, OCB Nationality: Local National (LN)  Base of Operations: Kabul, Afghanistan Required Clearance: INL- Vetting Salary: NTA Salary Scale - Grade B Tetra Tech, Afghanistan Justice Sector Support Program (JSSP), is seeking applications for OCB Deputy Section Lead position for Organizational Capacity Building (OCB) section under the supervision of Section Lead. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist Section Leader in supervising the assigned personnel (e.g., National advisors, translators, and administrative assistants) \xe2\x80\xa2 Advise and assist counterparts in performing their functions, including developing policies, plans and projects \xe2\x80\xa2 Help manage advisors and ensure that their work is consistent \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify needs within the GIROA ministries in conjunction with international advisors and the Afghan National Legal Advisors \xe2\x80\xa2 Help to organize special projects \xe2\x80\xa2 Help coordinate donor efforts \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist key departments in developing plans and projects to perform their functions and strengthen communications between central and provincial offices \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with other offices and coordinate activities to achieve established objectives \xe2\x80\xa2 Report to and perform related duties as assigned by Section Leader \xe2\x80\xa2 File reports for activities and accomplishments on a weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual basis, or as otherwise assigned \xe2\x80\xa2 Establish and maintain relationships with key stakeholders including, but not limited to, local government officials; police and prosecutors; international organizations involved in the justice sector; Afghan organizations involved in the justice sector; and customary and traditional law actors \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare budgets, work plans, and statements of work; submit deliverables, conduct trainings, and insure timely submission of team timesheets, leave, and travel requests \xe2\x80\xa2 Rapidly respond to requests for information from INL/K and INL/AP; and \xe2\x80\xa2 Other duties as directed Management \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of 5 years of professional experience and a Masters, or 7 years of experience and a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree \xe2\x80\xa2 Must have a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in law, international development, public policy and administration, or related field, with a Masters' degree preferred \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience collaborating with Afghan government ministries and institutions on organizational capacity building initiatives \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to develop and maintain relationships with cross-sectoral key stakeholders to ensure collaboration to meet project goals"

b'Project Associate (SB3/3) LoGo Project Job SummarySummary of Key Functions Ensure effective administrative and financial support; Ensure Partnerships 1.    Ensures effective administrative and financial support, by focusing on the following results: operational and technical support to 13 Provinces under SNG component (Provincial Governor Offices, Provincial Council offices, Mostofiiats, DoEc) Analyze, Review and certify the payment documents related with activity and citizen service centers related with Subnational governance component Review, update and track the activities and budget of subnational governance component Ensuring the activities and budgets are in line with procedures and approved AWP. Support component lead and technical staff/consultants to organize weekly staff meeting and prepare minutes of the meetings and follow up of the actions. Support component lead on preparation of the Annual Working Plan, Quarterly action plans, quarterly reports and annual reports for SNG component. Develop and update the database of provincial and central partners on sub national governance. Provide technical support to field staff in developing activity proposal, budget and event management. Provide all necessary support to technical staff/consultants for organizing workshop, seminars and consultation sessions. Provide technical support to regional staff and PGO officials to review BoQ, tendering and construction follow up , quality control of citizen service centers in LoGo covered provinces. Provide admin support (Travel arrangements, security clearance and DSA Process) to LoGo SNG team and field staff for their field visit and translation for international staff Communication focal point for partners of SNG component particularly, PGO officials, Provincial Councils and DoEc. Organize weekly staff Tracking of activities and maintaining records against budget in AWP Maintenance of the files, regulations, administrative instructions, financial administration, project activities in the component (both paper and electronic); Provision of the accurate oral interpretation from English to Dari and/or Pashtu, and from Dari and/or Pashto to English, and taking notes at meetings, conferences, briefings, presentations; Vendor creation for new suppliers in the provinces Taking Project Cash Advances, managing it and clearance with finance 2. Ensures partnerships, focusing on achievement of the following results: Establishment and maintenance of the contacts and effective work relations, including exchange of experiences, with colleagues within the UNDP/UNAMA project team, UNDP regional projects and UNAMA regional offices , UNDP Administrative and Human Resources Unit, well as other units within UNDP/UNAMA, other UN agencies and external organizations and institutions; Perform any other task as appropriately requested by the supervisor. Management Education: High School Degree is required. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree is desired.  Experience: With high school certificate 7 years and with Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree 5 years of progressively responsible administrative or project experience at the national or international level is required; People having bachelor qualification in finance, Business or Public Administration will be highly preferred; Experience in the usage of computers and office software packages (MS Word, Excel, etc) and knowledge of spreadsheet and database packages, experience in handling of web based management systems; Experience in working with UNDP and other UN agencies would be an asset'

b'Hostel Assistant / Kandahar Job SummaryTitle of position: Hostel Assistant Kandahar  No of Vacancy: Hostel Assistant / Kandahar Nationality :     Afghan  Gender:  Female  N of Position : 1 Location: Kandahar Kabul Report to: HSC program officer  Grade: According to NTA salary scale    According to NTA salary scale A: 2018/10/27 C : 2018/11/8 1. Assist HSC Program Officer to facilitate maintenance, repair, renovation, alterations in hostel  2. Ensures the accomplishment of all the planning and work necessary to clean and operate hostel 3. Provides instruction, direction, and supervision to workforce involved in the hostel and kitchen 4. Maintains a file of all inspections conducted, deficiencies noted and corrective actions taken. 5. Prepares and submit daily and night shift duties schedule of guard/cleaners   6. Assist the IHS dorm manager in all issues related to residents of dormitory 7. Serve as a primary personal counseling resource for students in dealing with specific dormitory problems 8. Helps student adjust to Center life and encourage favorable relationships among dormitory residents.  9. Respond promptly to illness, emotional trauma, interpersonal problems and/or maladjustment to Center life.  10. Encourage student participation in the training Programs.  11. Assists in conducting dorm meetings.  12. Conducts bed checks, takes morning attendance and updates the student/employees\xe2\x80\x99 files in Office.  13. Maintains a running log of events and significant incidents and briefs incoming shift. 14. Supervises student/employee housekeeping duties and maintains a clean orderly atmosphere.  15. Inspects dormitory areas.  16. Ensures cleanliness, safety, and attractiveness.  17. Promotes a positive work environment through the use of good social skills and application of Core Values 18. Prepares and submit daily hostel reports   19. Performs all other duties assigned. Management 1. Bachelor degree with 3 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in Hostel Management, Administration, operation or high school graduate with 5 year experience 2. Excellent Dari and Pashto and good communication in English languages  is an asset 3. Should have excellent computer skills 4. Effective communication and problem solving skill 5. Good team player  6. Good interpersonal/human skills'

b'Monitoring & Evaluation Manager Job SummaryThe M&E Manager is a key position within the Fundraising & Communications Department.  In close collaboration with the Head of Fundraising & Communications, the incumbent will support DACAAR in the planning and execution of its M&E activities, ensuring quality in accordance with accepted standards and feedback of M&E information for learning, accountability and decision making purposes, including for development of new project proposals. This will include the implementation of Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (PMEL) System and support to the management of the system. S/he will train staff and build DACAAR\xe2\x80\x99s internal capacity for Monitoring and Evaluation through engaging staff in continuous on-the-job mentoring and coaching as well as providing real time technical advice, support and assistance. Specific Responsibilities: \xe2\x80\xa2 Support DACAAR in the planning and execution of its M&E activities, ensuring quality in accordance with accepted standards  \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and implement a monitoring framework in support of the Strategic Programme Framework Document (2017-2020).  \xe2\x80\xa2 In close collaboration with the Head of Fundraising & Communications Department, lead the implementation of Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (PMEL) system.  The PMEL system should be upgraded to serve the Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning needs for the organization in line with the Strategic Programme Framework Document (2017-2020). \xe2\x80\xa2 Support and build the capacity of the staff in the department for management and practical application of the PMEL system, including for the elaboration of analyses based on information from the system. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the Head of Fundraising & Communications and staff in designing and undertaking (or commissioning) and managing evaluations and assessments of specific projects or other activities.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the Head of Fundraising & Communications, Grants & Communications Advisor, the M&E team and Reporting team to ensure that lessons learned in terms of process and impact, and best practices captured during M&E of projects are channeled to reports, design of future project proposals, and to support the development of knowledge products for internal and external use. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the design of M&E related parts of project proposals, e.g. development of logframes or results frameworks. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the provision of M&E inputs for reports to donors and other bodies, and internal quarterly and annual reports. \xe2\x80\xa2 Build the capacity of Programme staff in monitoring and evaluating implementation of projects through training and on-the-job coaching and mentoring. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the Programme in the designing of assessments and baseline methodologies and questionnaires in order to ensure quality of project implementation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with the Technical Unit embedded in the Programme Department to ensure that PMEL system and framework reflects the specific needs (i.e for indicators, impact monitoring, etc) for each thematic area, namely; Water, Sanitation & Hygiene; Natural Resource Management; Women\xe2\x80\x99s Empowerment and Small Scale Enterprise Development. \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with Head of Fundraising & Communications, Grants & Communications Adviser and finance staff to ensure all proposals have a budget line for M&E activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 In addition to the above specific tasks and responsibilities, the M&E Manager will undertake any other relevant tasks assigned by the Head of Fundraising & CommunicationsTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces M & E Education/ Qualification and Employment Benefits                                                 Education: Master Degree or equivalent in the relevant field  Experience: At least 3 years of experience in relevant field is required. Other qualifications\xe2\x80\x99 an advantage:  \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge and experience of bilateral and multilateral donor such as ECHO, IN agencies, DANIDA etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Hands on experience in project management \xe2\x80\xa2 A strong team player with good coordination skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficiency in the English language both written and spoken.       \xe2\x80\xa2 Good report writing skills Languages: Fluent Written & Spoken English Employment benefits: \xe2\x80\xa2 Good training opportunities to enhance employees\xe2\x80\x99 skills  \xe2\x80\xa2 Severance pay: one month salary per year of service \xe2\x80\xa2 24 days of paid annual leave per year  \xe2\x80\xa2 10 days of paid sick leave per year \xe2\x80\xa2 2 days weekend \xe2\x80\xa2 30 days of paid Hajj leave (after the completion of one year service) \xe2\x80\xa2 90 days of paid maternity leave for female employees(after the completion of three months service)  \xe2\x80\xa2 5 days of paid paternity leave for male employees(after the completion of three months service) \xe2\x80\xa2 15 days of public holidays per year \xe2\x80\xa2 Pick and drop Allowance AFN (1500)/ month'

b'Senior Lawyer Job SummaryKakar Advocates seeks to hire multiple full-time Senior Attorneys who will be working at our firm in Kabul, Afghanistan. The Senior Lawyers should have a master\xe2\x80\x99s degree and 5 years of experience in law filed. They should also be licensed in at least one jurisdiction. Based on qualifications and interests, the Senior Associate will have the opportunity to work on cases in the firm\xe2\x80\x99s various practice areas as well as on ongoing legal reform consultancy projects. The Senior Associate Attorney will be performing the following tasks under the supervision of the Senior Counsel: \xe2\x80\xa2 Coaching associates and legal assistants, building capacity of associates and legal assistants, including periodical evaluation; \xe2\x80\xa2 Handling multiple matters simultaneously and independently; \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsibility for distribution of work among associates; \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsibility for legal end products to clients, which are legally solid and commercially viable; \xe2\x80\xa2 Client management in consultation with Managing Partner and Senior Counsel; \xe2\x80\xa2 Reporting to senior management on progress of matters and general performance of the legal teams on a regular basis; \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing case theories and memorandums; \xe2\x80\xa2 Creating and maintain good rapport with the firm\xe2\x80\x99s clients through effective and consistent communication and proper explanation of legal proceedings to clients; \xe2\x80\xa2 Representing clients independently or alongside other attorneys in all meetings, proceedings, and negotiations;  \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing reports that keep all stakeholders up-to-date of the progress of a case; \xe2\x80\xa2 Performing due diligence in legal matters concerning contracts and agreements; \xe2\x80\xa2 Prospecting for new clients through marketing, networking, writing articles and speaking engagements; \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in business development and marketing related initiatives with a view to building the practice; \xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to the firm values and culture through participation in CSR, pro-bono and social activities. Legal \xe2\x80\xa2 Must have a Juris Doctorate (JD), LLM Degree, or equivalent; \xe2\x80\xa2 Near-native command of English, in speech and writing; \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to produce well-written legal documents and reports in English; \xe2\x80\xa2 Detail oriented with strong communication, research, analytical and writing skills; \xe2\x80\xa2 Should be licensed in at least one jurisdiction; \xe2\x80\xa2 Solid computer skills (Word, Excel, Power Point);'

b'Corrections Case Manager Job SummaryHelps implement case management, classification, GDPDC count systems, and file management operations systems and process in identified facilities within GDPDC. Knowledge and learn services relating to case management, and prisoner classification. Helps counterparts collect, verify, and analyze factual material in preparation of case management and classification summaries for inmates housed in the facilities. Develops and formulates appropriate individual program goals. Prepares written reports based on reviews of written records and adjustments to the facility and the program. Monitors Afghan counterparts to ensure they inform inmates of programs available along with any special needs services that may be used to address concerns or possible issues. b'Senior QA Engineer Job SummaryWe are looking for a Sr. Quality Assurance Engineer to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality. QA engineer responsibilities include designing and implementing tests, debugging and defining corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect densities and open defect counts). The QA engineer role plays an important part in our company\xe2\x80\x99s product development process. Our ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software runs smoothly and meets client needs while being cost-effective. If you hold an engineering background and enjoy providing end-to-end solutions to software quality problems, we\xe2\x80\x99d like to meet you. Ultimately, you should monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality standards. \xe2\x80\xa2 Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback. \xe2\x80\xa2 Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases. \xe2\x80\xa2 Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools. \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor debugging process results. \xe2\x80\xa2 Investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutions. \xe2\x80\xa2 Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts. \xe2\x80\xa2 Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Any other relevant tasks, duties and responsibilities assigned to the Sr. QA Engineer by his/her supervisor/s. IT - Software \xe2\x80\xa2 At least Bachelors\xe2\x80\x99 degree in Information Technology (IT) and/or Computer Sciences or other relevant disciplines, preferably with a focus on software development/engineering, system design and analysis.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Proven professional track record and at-least 3 years of relevant experience as QA engineer or Software implementation and fielding officer. \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes and also knowledge of SQL and scripting. \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases. \xe2\x80\xa2 Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing. \xe2\x80\xa2 Hands-on experience with automated testing tools. \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process. \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus.'

b"Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist Job SummaryThe U.S. Mission in Kabul is seeking eligible and qualified applicants for position of Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist with the INL Section. Serves as a monitoring and evaluation analyst and strategist for the INL programs in Afghanistan. Assist INL in conducting M&E in Afghanistan in concert with other USG and Afghan law enforcement. The applicant will serve as an advisory resource to INL officials on M&E of ongoing sector programs and provides support to projects by applying innovative M&E techniques and evaluating program impact. Provides essential information and data management function, capturing, updating, analyzing and reporting on the performance and impact of INL Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s initiative. Supports the development and monitoring of program and sector strategies and supports team with coaching on indicator selection, validating data quality and field monitoring visits. Performs essential quality control functions, which ensure that program and resource allocation decisions are based upon the best available data and information. The incumbent will provide leadership for INL\xe2\x80\x99s Afghanistan Initiative's analytic agenda by proactively identifying information gaps, assessment and analytical needs. The incumbent will require regular travel throughout the country. The incumbent reports to the FSO Program Officer in charge of the assigned team with policy guidance provided by the INL Policy Officer and is reviewed by the INL Deputy Director for Programs M & E Applicants must address required qualifications criteria listed below with specific information and documentation supporting each item. For example, official transcripts evidencing educational requirements must be attached to the original application submission. Failure to do so may result in a determination that the applicant is not qualified. We are not required to contact applicants who have submitted incomplete application packages.  EXPERIENCE: Five (5) years of progressively responsible, professional-level experience in monitoring and evaluation work, including experience in conducting performance and impact evaluations, formatting logical frameworks, overseeing project monitoring systems and/or evaluating projects related to GIROA, the international or NGO community.  JOB KNOWLEDGE: In-depth knowledge of the GIROA structure, institutions, and ability to learn INL Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s programs and policies and reporting requirements. Proven experience in monitoring and evaluation or social science research, using techniques such as needs assessments, surveys, interviews, and focus groups. Progress and impact assessment, logical frameworks and program/project evaluation. Experience with data validations; planning; quality controls; qualitative and quantitative statistical sampling; information analysis; the design and implementation of assessments; developing analytical reports; and conducting survey/field research. Familiarity and experience with a wide range of security issues such as rule of law, interdiction, and/or law enforcement is desirable.  Education Requirements: Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree from an accredited college or university in Project Management, Statistics, International Relations, Political Science, Sociology, Economics, Public Policy, Public Administration, or Industrial Engineering field with specific course work in economic and/or social statistics and research.  LANGUAGE: Excellent written and oral English and Dari proficiency is required (speaking, reading and writing) level 4 in English and level 4 in Dari required. Must have ability to read complex sources in Dari and translate into English, and to produce correspondence in Dari.  This may be tested."

b'Staff Attorney Job SummaryThe Legal Support Attorney/Advocate shall possess expertise and demonstrate understanding in the following fields: the Constitution of Afghanistan, rule of law, judicial processes, political science, criminal justice principles, and purpose and function of Afghan governing bodies.  The selected candidates will fill a critical void in supporting the Ministry of Defense legal entities, to include both the Ministry of Defense Legal Department (MoDL) and the General Staff Legal Department (GS-Legal).  Candidates selected will provide accurate legal advice on various issues affecting the Ministry of Defense after analyzing applicable law, legal principles, concepts, regulations, precedent, and practices.  The Ministry of Defense Legal Department (MoD Legal) is currently making every effort to support procurement reform.  They are regularly engaging with AT&L and AA to help the procurement process on various fronts. 1. Knowledge of, and skill in applying, fundamental legal analysis and skills in laws, principles, systems, policies, methods, and practices; as well as analytical, and research techniques sufficient to conduct fact finding and recommend solutions to legal issues affecting the Ministry of Defense. Ability to register and track cases, provide assigned investigators and inspectors with legal advice and guidance to assist them during investigative process. 2.     MoD Legal attorneys are reviewing contracts that are up for award;  currently, there not        enough attorneys to review the amount of reviewed requested. 3.     MoD Legal attorneys are supporting AT&L with creating a training program for both             procurement officials and attorneys, to include (hopefully) setting up a Mobile Training             Team (MTT). 4.     MoD Legal attorneys are supporting the PoA, MINDEF, and FDM in providing sound      advice for acquisition policies/procedures. 5. Ability to either assist in the prosecution of cases in a support capacity or prosecute cases, as directed, in accordance with Afghan law and MoD policies and regulations.  6. To use computers or other advanced technology to maintain documents, plans, and reports.  Document management may include arranging files and confirming submission of legal reports and opinions to other departments, receipt of documents from other departments, and properly archiving and storing and retrieving archived documents.    7. To have the ability to understand, abide by, and advise on the policies, processes, and standard operating procedures of the Afghan National Army. 8. Candidate will agree to any continuing legal and professional development education requirements, as directed by supervisory chain of command.   9.     Additional duties may be assigned as necessary, as determined by supervisory chain            of command, so long as those duties relate to supporting the mission in a legal        or professional development capacity (for example, candidate may be required to teach            a block of instruction on an assigned legal topic, support conference planning for            training seminars, attend meetings, as directed, where ANA legal representation may            be required.  This list is not all-inclusive.) Legal 1. Three (3) years of work experience in legal field.  2. Must be capable of operating independently and responsibly, as well as an integrated member of a team. Superior writing, computing and communications skills. 3. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree from an accredited institution in degree in the legal field, either as an attorney, prosecutor, or judge. 4. Excellent computer literacy skills in MS Office (Word and Excel). 5. A candidate should demonstrate a working knowledge and skill level for proper use of Microsoft Office Word products.  The most vital function is ability to create Microsoft Word Documents.  Although not required, expertise in Excel, Power Point, and Access programs and/or other systems/applications is beneficial and will be reviewed favorably.     6. A candidate should demonstrate a professional demeanor, respect for others, and have the ability to be a team player and work well with others.  A candidate should have the ability to providing legal opinions and analysis to senior leaders and may, on occasion, be asked to provide presentations in a professional manner to senior leaders.'

b'Corrections Case Manager Job SummaryThe Corrections Case Manager (Juvenile) is responsible for the implementation of case management, classification, Juvenile Rehabilitation Center count system, file management, and staff mentoring. This position reports directly to the CSSP Juvenile-Senior Project Advisor in Kabul. The Corrections Case Manager (Juvenile) will develop and implement select strategies, policies, and plans that affect operations, delivery of services, and knowledge transfer relating to case management and prisoner classification. He/She will mentor and assist counterparts collect, verify, and analyze factual material in preparation for case management and classification summaries for prisoners.  Duties Include the development and formulation of appropriate individual program goals and prepares written reports based on reviews of written records and prisoner\xe2\x80\x99s adjustments at the facility and accessed needs. Mentor and monitors Afghan counterparts to ensure the proper and timely identification of eligible prisoners for Presidential Decree consideration, and proper assessment of prisoners eligible to participate in available educational, vocational, industries, and other programming in support of the prisoner rehabilitation. Performs other related duties as assigned. The Corrections Case Manager (Juvenile) is responsible for the implementation of case management, classification, Juvenile Rehabilitation Center count system, file management, and staff mentoring. This position reports directly to the CSSP Juvenile-Senior Project Advisor in Kabul. The Corrections Case Manager (Juvenile) will develop and implement select strategies, policies, and plans that affect operations, delivery of services, and knowledge transfer relating to case management and prisoner classification. He/She will mentor and assist counterparts collect, verify, and analyze factual material in preparation for case management and classification summaries for prisoners.  Duties Include the development and formulation of appropriate individual program goals and prepares written reports based on reviews of written records and prisoner\xe2\x80\x99s adjustments at the facility and accessed needs. Mentor and monitors Afghan counterparts to ensure the proper and timely identification of eligible prisoners for Presidential Decree consideration, and proper assessment of prisoners eligible to participate in available educational, vocational, industries, and other programming in support of the prisoner rehabilitation. Performs other related duties as assigned.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Law Completion of a four (4) year degree from an accredited university in law and two years of relevant experience, or four (4) years of experience in an Afghan Rule of Law Program; Afghan Ministry; International Organization; or Non-Government Organizations (NGO) with demonstrated ability to present both verbally and in writing with clarity and precision to senior level executives. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: \xe2\x80\xa2 Local National  \xe2\x80\xa2 Superior interpersonal, oral briefing, and report writing skills  \xe2\x80\xa2 At least five years of experience in a correctional system.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Advisory personnel must possess (5) five years of experience in the correctional specialty they will focus on (e.g., a Gender Advisor must have five years of experience working on female correctional issues).  All advisory personnel must have the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, stressful environment. In addition, they must be flexible, willing to perform other duties as necessary, and work irregular hours. The Advisor must also be able to cite past professional or personal experience that demonstrates the ability to work effectively under stressful situations. The Advisor must further attest that he/she understands that the role of a corrections advisor in Afghanistan necessitates irregular hours and a flexible, positive, and assertive attitude toward his/her job function'

b'Software Engineer/Programmer Job SummaryGeneral Function: We are searching for outstanding web base Software developer to be responsible for developing innovative reusable Web-based tools for progressive online activism. Our Software developer work with Senior Developer, Business analysis and Design team to develop specifications and make recommendations on the use of new and emerging technologies. A web base software developer responsible for design, layout, codding and unit testing of application. \xe2\x80\xa2 Interpreting the needs and developing a concept to suit the purpose of the project assigned. \xe2\x80\xa2 Developing design briefs by gathering information and data through research. \xe2\x80\xa2 Thinking creatively to produce new ideas and concepts  \xe2\x80\xa2 Using innovation to redefine a design brief within the constraints of cost and time. \xe2\x80\xa2 Presenting finalized ideas and concepts to other department/team. \xe2\x80\xa2 A solid understanding of web base application development processes from the layout/user interface to relational database structures. \xe2\x80\xa2 Rapid web base application development using HTML, JavaScript, JQuery, Ajax, CSS, ASP.NET, C#, SQL, Java servlet, XML, JSP. \xe2\x80\xa2 Test the application and identify any technical & security problems. \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrating illustrative skills with rough sketches. \xe2\x80\xa2 Design and develop relational database systems and their applications \xe2\x80\xa2 Must have good knowledge of SQL, IIS, Apache web server \xe2\x80\xa2 Other tasks as needed for successful project completion. IT - Software Qualifications & Skills required \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in related subjects or minimum of 1 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in web base application development and database. \xe2\x80\xa2 In depth SQL, HTML, JQuery, CSS, Java, Java servlet. \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent communication skills and attention to detail.'

b'PMIS Senior Specialist (software developer) Job SummaryUnder the supervision of Procurement Management Information System Manager, incumbent will be responsible for the conceptualization, design, development, and launching of Procurement Management Information System (PMIS) in order to increase productivity, efficiency, transparency, manage overall costs and pave the way for an appropriate control over the procurement processes. Main duties and responsibilities are discussed next. \xe2\x97\x8f Cooperation with requirement gathering in cooperation with system development department. \xe2\x97\x8f Design and conceptualize the PMIS system from the gathered requirements in cooperation with System Development department. \xe2\x97\x8f Participate in deploying strategic plans to ensure the life of the system over time, in terms of change in the resources involved in the system development, change in the technologies and world class standard over time, adaptability to better and more efficient solutions available over time instead of the current ones already deployed. \xe2\x97\x8f Participate in preparing plans and estimation for different purposes and parts of the system, in terms of time, cost and human resources needed. \xe2\x97\x8f Participate in development and implementation of required strategies e.g. testing at different stages, development and collaboration strategy, source code management strategy, security strategy and deployment strategy. \xe2\x97\x8f Participate in development and implementation of a standard for documentation of the system at different stages of the system. \xe2\x97\x8f Participate in software development team capacity building. \xe2\x97\x8f Low level supervision on the quality of code written by all software development team members. \xe2\x97\x8f Develop the high sensitive and complex part of the system from start to end. \xe2\x97\x8f Analyze the possibilities of integration of the system with external systems through APIs. \xe2\x97\x8f Participate in development of a strategic plan for successful completion of phase one in upcoming years and transition to second phase of the project \xe2\x97\x8f Participate in research and input on the hardware required for smoothly and reliably running the system on production server. \xe2\x97\x8f Active participation in business aspect analysis of the system, in order to have a general overview and roadmap of the system. \xe2\x97\x8f Identify how the system development standards should be modified to fit the situations present in Afghanistan.  \xe2\x97\x8f Participate in planning and implementing of a strategy for the procurement entities to utilize the system efficiently. \xe2\x97\x8f The development of the public procurement web site and its ongoing administration. \xe2\x97\x8f Work in close coordination with procurement (monitoring and specialist) officers to ensure proper use of website and PMIS for procurement monitoring. \xe2\x97\x8f Participate in preparing a strategy for e-GP development and institutionalization in Afghanistan. \xe2\x97\x8f Perform any other duties and responsibilities, assigned by PMIS manager IT - Software a) Education: \xe2\x97\x8f Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or any other relevant fields.  b) Work Experience: \xe2\x80\xa2 5 years of experience in case of having Master Degree in similar fields \xe2\x80\xa2 7 years of experience in case of having Bachelor Degree in similar fields c) Language Requirement: \xe2\x97\x8f Must be proficient in writing, reading and speaking in English.  \xe2\x97\x8f Must also have strong communication, reading and writing skills in one of the national languages (Dari or Pashto).'

b'Senior MIS Specialist Job SummaryThe Senior MIS Specialist will be responsible for designing and developing an MIS system for the first PLACED Contracts. These systems will capture information on the jobseekers who participate in the programs (including their personal profiles) and their progress through the programs. It will also be used as a reporting tool for Service Providers to inform the Ministry on a weekly basis on program performance, and for the Ministry to analyze that performance. It will additionally be a key tool in the payments to Service Providers.  The Senior MIS Specialist will be specifically performing the following tasks: \xe2\x80\xa2 Design and develop a web-based database application for the PLACED Project; \xe2\x80\xa2 Base this design on a detailed needs analysis of the PLACED programs; \xe2\x80\xa2 Collaborate and consult with all relevant stakeholders in this design; \xe2\x80\xa2 Pay particular attention to permissions and data security; \xe2\x80\xa2 Produce a project plan for the database development and provide fortnightly reports (as a minimum) on progress; \xe2\x80\xa2 Test the system and revise as necessary; \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare clear and comprehensible user documentation (a User Manual); \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and maintain a Database Administrator Manual (including any/all codes and security policies); \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide training as required to users; \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in the weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad hoc production of performance reports; \xe2\x80\xa2 Further refine the system, adding reports and functionality, in the light of user feedback; \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain the system so that it is robust, accessible and secure, with regular backups; \xe2\x80\xa2 Troubleshot as required and provide ongoing user support; \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform any other relevant tasks as assigned by Project Director.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces IT - Software \xe2\x80\xa2 Having at least a Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree or its equivalent with 5 years working experience or having a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree with 7 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience. \xe2\x80\xa2 Built and maintained at least one database with similar functionality and size. \xe2\x80\xa2 Exceptional interpersonal skills, including the ability to influence behaviour \xe2\x80\xa2 A willingness to roll up your sleeves and make things happen; \xe2\x80\xa2 Exceptional intelligence; \xe2\x80\xa2 The ability to think both creatively and analytically; \xe2\x80\xa2 An eye for detail and desire to deliver beyond expectations; \xe2\x80\xa2 High-level written and spoken English. The team will operate in English, be trained in English, and will be managing some international contractors in English. In particular, you will be working extremely closely with the English-speaking advisors from the World Bank.'

b"Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist - Substitution Level Job SummaryThe U.S. Mission in Kabul is seeking eligible and qualified applicants for position of Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist with the INL Section. Serves as a monitoring and evaluation analyst and strategist for the INL programs in Afghanistan. Assist INL in conducting M&E in Afghanistan in concert with other USG and Afghan law enforcement.  The applicant will serve as an advisory resource to INL officials on M&E of ongoing sector programs and provides support to projects by applying innovative M&E techniques and evaluating program impact.  Provides essential information and data management function, capturing, updating, analyzing and reporting on the performance and impact of INL Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s initiative. Supports the development and monitoring of program and sector strategies and supports team with coaching on indicator selection, validating data quality and field monitoring visits. Performs essential quality control functions, which ensure that program and resource allocation decisions are based upon the best available data and information. The incumbent will provide leadership for INL\xe2\x80\x99s Afghanistan Initiative's analytic agenda by proactively identifying information gaps, assessment and analytical needs. The incumbent will require regular travel throughout the country. The incumbent reports to the FSO Program Officer in charge of the assigned team with policy guidance provided by the INL Policy Officer and is reviewed by the INL Deputy Director for Programs General Applicants must address required qualifications criteria listed below with specific information and documentation supporting each item. For example, official transcripts evidencing educational requirements must be attached to the original application submission. Failure to do so may result in a determination that the applicant is not qualified. We are not required to contact applicants who have submitted incomplete application packages. EXPERIENCE:  Seven (7) years of progressively responsible, professional-level experience in monitoring and evaluation work, including experience in conducting performance and impact evaluations, formatting logical frameworks, overseeing project monitoring systems and/or evaluating projects related to GIROA, the international or NGO community. JOB KNOWLEDGE: In-depth knowledge of the GIROA structure, institutions, and ability to learn INL Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s programs and policies and reporting requirements. Proven experience in monitoring and evaluation or social science research, using techniques such as needs assessments, surveys, interviews, and focus groups. Progress and impact assessment, logical frameworks and program/project evaluation. Experience with data validations; planning; quality controls; qualitative and quantitative statistical sampling; information analysis; the design and implementation of assessments; developing analytical reports; and conducting survey/field research. Familiarity and experience with a wide range of security issues such as rule of law, interdiction, and/or law enforcement is desirable. Education Requirements: Bachelors degree from an accredited college or university in Project Management, Statistics, International Relations, Political Science, Sociology, Economics, Public Policy, Public Administration, or Industrial Engineering field with specific course work in economic and/or social statistics and research. LANGUAGE: Excellent written and oral English and Dari proficiency is required (speaking, reading and writing) level 4 in English and level 4 in Dari required.  Must have ability to read complex sources in Dari and translate into English, and to produce correspondence in Dari. This may be tested."

b'Beneficiary Assessment Verification staff and post-distribution monitoring Job SummaryThe Beneficiary Assessment Verification staff and post-distribution monitoring ensure that the most appropriate and relevant methods are used for successful beneficiaries assessment verification. \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate with target community members  \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct assessment in the field and collect data  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support data entry clerks for proper data entry \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct re-assessment to verify the accuracy of collected data from the field \xe2\x80\xa2 Document and file the selected beneficiaries into files \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with target communities and target beneficiaries for distribution of food items in timely basis \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct post distribution monitoring to make sure that the food items are used by target families \xe2\x80\xa2 Report in biweekly and monthly basis to project manager General \xe2\x80\xa2 High school graduate. \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of 3 years of extensive working experience in similar position with national and/or international NGOs.'

b"Cultural Affairs Specialist Job SummaryU.S. Embassy Kabul Afghanistan The Cultural Affairs Specialist reports directly to the Deputy Cultural Affairs Officer.  S/he frequently acts as the PAS representative in meetings and negotiations with individuals and organizations across the spectrum of public diplomacy contacts. General QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: Applicants must address required qualifications criteria listed below with specific information and documentation supporting each item. For example, official transcripts evidencing educational requirements must be attached to the original application submission. Failure to do so may result in a determination that the applicant is not qualified. We are not required to contact applicants who have submitted incomplete application packages. Education Requirements: Bachelor's degree-level education, in international relations or liberal arts, is required. EXPERIENCE: Minimum 5 years of progressively responsible experience at a cultural or media establishment, a program-oriented non-governmental organization, or in a field such as public relations, university education, or counseling is required. LANGUAGE: Fluency (Level4) in written and spoken Dari and Level 3 Pashto as well as fluency in written and spoken English (Level4) is required. This may be tested. JOB KNOWLEDGE: Thorough knowledge of Afghan political, media, economic, social, educational, and cultural structures and institutions is essential. Thorough knowledge of public diplomacy programs, objective. And techniques are required. Thorough knowledge of U.S. foreign policy priorities is required. SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Ability to develop and maintain contacts at all levels, up to and including the ministerial level, in cultural, government, media, and educational institutions. Must have proven written and oral communication skills. Since the work requires substantial involvement with developing contacts, must have strong interpersonal skills. The incumbent is expected to use an extensive range of contacts with high level/influential leaders in skillfully addressing public diplomacy issues. Must have strong managerial skills. Ability to produce diplomatic and official correspondence in both Dari and English is essential. Must have excellent translation skills and be able to serve as an interpreter, if needed, for PAS officers, Senior Embassy officers and visiting U.S. Government officials in meetings and events at the highest level."

b'Sr. Civil (QA/QC) Engineer ( For Substation)  Job SummaryDABS will hire four Civil Engineers working as Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC) engineers based in Herat province to inspect and supervise the construction work of one out of the four 110kV substations located in districts Chesh Sharif, Hobai, Karokh and Pashton Zarghon, Herat Province The following tasks to be undertaken by the QA/QC Civil Engineer These duties shall comprise (but not necessarily be limited to) the following: \xe2\x80\xa2 The QA/QC engineer will have the overall responsibility of checking and guiding the work of contractors in one out of 4 substations (Chesht, Hobai, Karrokh and Pashton Zarghon of Herat Province).  \xe2\x80\xa2 He has to work in closed coordination with the DABS\xe2\x80\x99s Sr. Civil Engineer/ Site Supervisor and HEP Project Manager for the timely completion of all project activities with the required quality. \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate all technical activities at the sites to make sure that the construction/implementation of project is according to the engineering standards and Technical Specifications are as per the contract document. \xe2\x80\xa2  Working at site (one out of 4 sites above listed), to ensure that work quality and progress is satisfactory and as per the contract standards, technical specification and schedule of the sub project. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that all tests are performed at the site for the various items. \xe2\x80\xa2 Review material submitted by contractors for compliance with the BoQ and specifications and to check compliance of QC requirements as per approved QC plan of the project. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the contractors comply with their work plans to complete work within specified time frame. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the contractor provides the labors with the safety equipment and overseeing health and safety matters on site.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Check and review the works quantity reported by contractor for interim payments. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare daily record of work progress at sites and update project manager on work progress on weekly or bi-weekly basis.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Apply the QC plan for monitoring, reporting and supervision strategy that will help in better implementation of contract guidelines in sub-project activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Be able to correctly organize and file technical project documents. \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing of close out documents as per the project close out procedures. \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform any other project relevant activity assigned by the Sr.Civil Engineer / Site supervisor, HEP- PM and WB-PIU director. Engineering and Construction The candidates must have the following qualifications: \xe2\x80\xa2 Must have a BSc. of Civil Engineering with 5 years of related experience. \xe2\x80\xa2 Competent in reading and understanding Specifications, drawings, and reviewing of design and all other disciplines related to the Project and engineering documentation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Work experience with the International donors such as World Bank, USAID, KfW and ADB is a privilege.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Good communication skills and fluency in reading, writing and speaking English. \xe2\x80\xa2  Good computer skills (Ms. Office and Technical Engineering Software\xe2\x80\x99s).'

b'National Project Manager (Senior Engineer) Job SummaryVACANCY ANNOUNCEMENT Issued Date:  25 October 2018 Closing Date:  08 November 2018 VA No. FAO/HRT/PRJ/SC/31-2018 Functional  Title: National Project Manager (Senior Engineer) Type of Contract: National Project Personnel / Service Contract (NPP/SC) Grade / Level: SB-4 Number of Post (s) :  01 (One) Gender / Sex: Male & Female   Duration :  12 Months  Extendable / Renewable:  Yes (Extendable, Based on Satisfactory Performance & Budget Availability) Probationary Period: Initial 3 Months   Project / Programme / Unit:   Improving Economic Growth in the Western Region of Afghanistan through Community Irrigation and Livelihood Enhancement (GCP/AFG/097/JPN)  Duty Station:  Herat - With Possible Field Missions to Other Project Sites/Location Sub \xe2\x80\x93 Station:  N/A  REMUNERATION:  \xef\x82\xa7 The remuneration for the post of National Project Manager (Senior Engineer) is between USD 2,335 to USD 3,111 (SB-4 Step 2 to 4) monthly based on the qualification and experience of the candidate. \xef\x82\xa7 The selected candidate will also receive an additional 8.33% monthly salary as pension benefit/coverage on a monthly basis. Organization Settings: Through its Country Offices, or FAO Representations, FAO assists governments to develop policies, Programmes and projects to address hunger, food security and malnutrition, and provides technical support for the sustainable development of their agricultural, livestock, animal health, and irrigation and forestry sectors as well as emergency preparedness and response. The activities of the FAO Representation include design and implementation of country-tailored field Programmes, liaison with local donor representatives and active public awareness raising and outreach activities related to the mandate of FAO.  The position is located at the FAO office in Herat \xe2\x80\x93 Afghanistan with frequent travels to other project locations in the country. Project Background:  The livelihood of the project area (Koshk District of Herat Province) is primarily based on agricultural. From the prevailing land cover map, it is quite evident that the area is predominantly covered with rainfed crop and only small patches of irrigated land. Out of the total land area available rangeland accounts for about 33 percent, rain-fed area accounts for about 56 percent while potential irrigated area is only about 1 percent, and the actual irrigated area is far less than the potential due to poor condition of irrigation canals.  Four small rivers originate from Kushk Kohna District and pass along Kushk Rabat Sangi District within a distance of 70 km and end in Turkmenistan. These rivers have not been utilized properly and the existing traditional irrigation system (intakes and catchments) every year is damaged or destroyed during the flood. Therefore, community in the area is in dire need of improved irrigation system. Majority of people are involved in agriculture and raising of livestock. Major crops are: wheat, barley, pea and melon. Every year thousands of livestock (sheep, goat, cattle and camel) are imported and sold in the market of Herat City. Communities use irrigation water for multiple purposes such as: irrigation, domestic water use and kitchen gardening. Working Relationship: The project has envisaged improving the economic growth in the Western Region of Afghanistan through community irrigation and livelihood enhancement activities. It is expected to result in the sustainable development of water resources in HariRud-Murghab River Basin and livelihood enhancement of the marginalized farmers in the area.  The project will support demand management-based efforts for soil and water conservation (e.g. increase of irrigation efficiency) through effective on-farm management practices. Capacity building and institutional strengthening of the farmers\xe2\x80\x99 institutions and government entities is also an area of focus. The proposed project will be implemented with the broad and integrated approach of water resources management for sustainable water resources development in tune with the master plan for the HariRud-Murghab River Basin Development. Another area needing attention is the enhancement of livelihood of the residents of the area. This can be achieved through a combination of programmes like rainwater harvesting/water conservation targeting the upland areas, micro-irrigation (sprinkler and drip system) for orchard farming and expansion of grazing land for raising the livestock. Impact of Work:  Successful implementation of the project as outlined in the project document and in line with FAO rules, regulation and procedure and as per demand of the Recipient Government and Resource Partners. Reporting Lines / Supervision Received/Exercised:  Under the general supervision of FAO Representative (FAOR) in Afghanistan, the technical  supervision of the Lead Technical Officer (LTO) and the direct supervision of the Irrigation Management Specialist and the Project Technical Adviser  and in close consultation and cooperation with the counterpart staff of Provincial Directorate of  Agriculture and Livestock (PAIL) under the Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock (MAIL) of Afghanistan, other concerned government agencies and project staff, the incumbent would act as National Project Manager (Senior Engineer) will share responsibilities for the irrigation sub-projects and Karez Systems implemented by the Project for Improving Economic Growth in the Western Region of Afghanistan through Community Irrigation and Livelihood Enhancement.  Key Functions/Results: \xef\x82\xa7 Assist the PTA (Project Technical Advisor) in all administrative, managerial and technical matters at provincial level; \xef\x82\xa7 Supervise FAO and counterpart staff in their daily activities with respect to the expected deliverables; \xef\x82\xa7 Consult and engage relevant provincial offices in key project cycles to enhance smooth implementation and ensure sustainability; \xef\x82\xa7 Serve as a focal point in all matters related to provincial meetings, plans, targets and act as a bridge to relay relevant information to all concerned at provincial level; \xef\x82\xa7 Assist in design and project document preparation, supervision, working with provincial FAO and counterpart engineers; \xef\x82\xa7 Identify needs on capacity building programmes and submit substantive training plans to PTA for further consideration and conduct on the job-training to counterpart staff; \xef\x82\xa7 Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual reports using standard formats and submit to PTA for compilation; \xef\x82\xa7 Contribute to the technical and terminal report of the project;  \xef\x82\xa7 Collaborate with other FAO projects in the province as needed; \xef\x82\xa7 Involve in procurement of goods and services as per FAO rules and regulations; \xef\x82\xa7 Ensure application of quality control measures for all implementation of works at all times; \xef\x82\xa7 Assist the Project Technical Adviser and Irrigation Management Specialist in implementing all the activities of the project. \xef\x82\xa7 Lead the national team of the surveyors and the design engineers in conducting survey and preparing the design, cost estimate and the technical proposals for the rehabilitation of the irrigation, Karez systems and the schemes under watershed management. \xef\x82\xa7 Help prepare all the tender documents, contract documents and their bidding, and monitor the progress of the contractor or water user groups. \xef\x82\xa7 Prepare detailed project annual work plans in collaboration with stakeholders and make necessary arrangements for their successful implementation in a timely manner;  \xef\x82\xa7 Prepare detailed plans for specific activities under the Project and ensure the quality and timeliness of output of development activities, including the conduct of the seminars, workshops, training courses, and other development activities;  \xef\x82\xa7 Coordinate with the various international staff of the TA team for the development of a shared vision and effective team work among the project staff.  \xef\x82\xa7 Ensure that the quality of the technical design and construction works in the project are in accordance to the best engineering design and construction practices;  \xef\x82\xa7 Prepare necessary field documents, work plans, regular progress reports and a Terminal Report to review and monitor the outputs and results of the project against the agreed work plan, and to identify constraints and issues that require timely resolution and corrective actions;   \xef\x82\xa7 Coordinate with relevant Departments of the government and other agencies and institutions at the regional level for the smooth implementation of the project. Conduct meetings and prepare the minutes of meetings. \xef\x82\xa7 Conduct training courses and on-the-job training of staff and water user groups. \xef\x82\xa7 Performs any other duties as required by the Irrigation Management Specialist, Project Technical Adviser and the FAOR. Project Monitoring and Reporting: \xef\x82\xa7 Monitor project progress as agreed in the Annual Work Plan and Budget (AWP/B), and provide remedial actions such as adjusting activities as necessary, speeding up implementation in case of delays, drafting budget revisions and organizing monitoring missions, if required; \xef\x82\xa7 Elaborate standard project documentation along with the project\xe2\x80\x99s M&E plan such as Project Inception Report, meeting/workshop reports, six-monthly Project Progress Reports including gender/youth assessment, terminal report etc.; Partnership Building and Knowledge Management: \xef\x82\xa7 Maintain regular contact with FAO Country Office and the National Project Director (NPD) on project implementation issues of their respective competence; \xef\x82\xa7 Develop and maintain relationships with counterparts in the country to ensure adequate and timely technical inputs to the project  \xef\x82\xa7 Facilitate information sharing and generate awareness on the project and progress to stakeholders, whenever required;  \xef\x82\xa7 Builds strategic partnerships and synergies to enhance the impact and sustainability of the project outcomes; \xef\x82\xa7 Represent the Organization at project meetings and events, identify strategic partnerships, advocates best practices and increased policy dialogue and develop and negotiate effective working relationships/ consensus and agreements with national stakeholders; Expected outputs: \xef\x82\xa7 Timely production of outputs considered satisfactory by the Project Technical Adviser, International Irrigation Management Specialist and International Community mobilization Specialist. Prepare end of assignment report after completion of the assignment. \xef\x82\xa7 Six monthly progress reports prepared  \xef\x82\xa7 Contribution to preparation of Terminal Report  \xef\x82\xa7 Contribution to preparation of budget revisions  \xef\x82\xa7 Contribution to project M&ETravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Engineering and Construction Education: \xef\x82\xa7 Advanced University degree, (MSc) in Civil Engineering, Irrigation, Agricultural Engineering or closely related fields; Work Experience:  \xef\x82\xa7 At least ten (10) years of professional experience in planning, implementation, and management of irrigation and agricultural development programmes, including the design and implementation of irrigation projects, Karez system and Watershed management activities in semi-arid regions; \xef\x82\xa7 Strong analytical, engineering skills, AutoCad and computer based engineering programs, drawings and etc.  \xef\x82\xa7 Computer literacy and skills to use word-processing equipment is necessary; \xef\x82\xa7 Experience and knowledge of the FAO rules and regulations and good skills of multi-stakeholders coordination, operations and management; \xef\x82\xa7 Excellent report writing skills; \xef\x82\xa7 Experience of working with UN, government entities and western region is highly desirable. Other Desirable Skills: \xef\x82\xa7 Excellent interpersonal communication and coordination skills, and proven ability to work constructively with a variety of stake holders to achieve common goals; \xef\x82\xa7 The candidate should have the proven records of organizing and managing the rehabilitation of irrigation projects and watershed management;  \xef\x82\xa7 Similarly, the candidate should possess the ability to other water sector experiences; \xef\x82\xa7 Solid Managerial skills in Community based development programs; \xef\x82\xa7 Experience in project design, management and implementation; Language Skills: Excellent knowledge of English and local languages, both spoken and written skills. COMPTENCIES: \xef\x82\xa7 Core competencies: FAO core competencies include: Understanding FAO\xe2\x80\x99s mandate & its global context; planning, organizing, and delivering quality results; communicating to build understanding & support; working together in teams and partnerships; engaging in continuous learning. \xef\x82\xa7 Operational Effectiveness: Working independently, structuring tasks, establishing priorities and adhering to deadlines. Show a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail. Contribute ideas and suggestions for process improvement. \xef\x82\xa7 Client Orientation: Focus on results for the client. Attend to inquiries from internal and external clients in an effective, timely and courteous manner. Treat clients with courtesy and respect even when working under pressure. Express a high level of professionalism. \xef\x82\xa7 Interpersonal Communications and Teamwork: Work effectively and efficiently with staff at all levels, listen to others and openly share own ideas. Express sensitivity, cultural empathy and respect for diversity. Productively handle differing views and opinions and strive for achievement of shared goals. Respond positively to feedback. \xef\x82\xa7 Knowledge Exchange and Learning: Share own knowledge and promote a learning culture within the work environment. Actively work towards professional development, including personal learning.  Apply newly acquired skills and support flexibility within the work environment.'
