b'National Design & Quality Control Engineer Job SummaryVACANCY ANNOUNCEMENT Issued Date:  25 October 2018 Closing Date:  08 November 2018 VA No. FAO/HRT/PRJ/SC/32-2018 Functional  Title: National Design & Quality Control Engineer Type of Contract: National Project Personnel / Service Contract (NPP/SC) Grade / Level: SB-4 Number of Post (s) :  01 (One) Gender / Sex: Male & Female   Duration :  12 Months  Extendable / Renewable:  Yes (Extendable, Based on Satisfactory Performance & Budget Availability) Probationary Period: Initial 3 Months   Project / Programme / Unit:   Improving Economic Growth in the Western Region of Afghanistan through Community Irrigation and Livelihood Enhancement (GCP/AFG/097/JPN) Duty Station:  Herat - With Possible Field Missions to Other Project Sites/Location Sub \xe2\x80\x93 Station:  N/A  REMUNERATION:  \xef\x82\xa7 The remuneration for the post of National Design & Quality Control Engineer is between USD 1,947 to USD 2,335 (SB-4 Step 1 to 2) monthly based on the qualification and experience of the candidate. \xef\x82\xa7 The selected candidate will also receive an additional 8.33% monthly salary as pension benefit/coverage on a monthly basis. Organization Settings: Through its Country Offices, or FAO Representations, FAO assists governments to develop policies, Programmes and projects to address hunger, food security and malnutrition, and provides technical support for the sustainable development of their agricultural, livestock, animal health, and irrigation and forestry sectors as well as emergency preparedness and response. The activities of the FAO Representation include design and implementation of country-tailored field Programmes, liaison with local donor representatives and active public awareness raising and outreach activities related to the mandate of FAO.  The position is located at the FAO office in Herat \xe2\x80\x93 Afghanistan with frequent travels to other project locations in the country. Project Background:  The livelihood of the project area (Koshk District of Herat Province) is primarily based on agricultural. From the prevailing land cover map, it is quite evident that the area is predominantly covered with rainfed crop and only small patches of irrigated land. Out of the total land area available rangeland accounts for about 33 percent, rain-fed area accounts for about 56 percent while potential irrigated area is only about 1 percent, and the actual irrigated area is far less than the potential due to poor condition of irrigation canals.  Four small rivers originate from Kushk Kohna District and pass along Kushk Rabat Sangi District within a distance of 70 km and end in Turkmenistan. These rivers have not been utilized properly and the existing traditional irrigation system (intakes and catchments) every year is damaged or destroyed during the flood. Therefore, community in the area is in dire need of improved irrigation system. Majority of people are involved in agriculture and raising of livestock. Major crops are: wheat, barley, pea and melon. Every year thousands of livestock (sheep, goat, cattle and camel) are imported and sold in the market of Herat City. Communities use irrigation water for multiple purposes such as: irrigation, domestic water use and kitchen gardening. Working Relationship: The project has envisaged improving the economic growth in the Western Region of Afghanistan through community irrigation and livelihood enhancement activities. It is expected to result in the sustainable development of water resources in HariRud-Murghab River Basin and livelihood enhancement of the marginalized farmers in the area.  The project will support demand management-based efforts for soil and water conservation (e.g. increase of irrigation efficiency) through effective on-farm management practices. Capacity building and institutional strengthening of the farmers\xe2\x80\x99 institutions and government entities is also an area of focus. The proposed project will be implemented with the broad and integrated approach of water resources management for sustainable water resources development in tune with the master plan for the HariRud-Murghab River Basin Development. Another area needing attention is the enhancement of livelihood of the residents of the area. This can be achieved through a combination of programmes like rainwater harvesting/water conservation targeting the upland areas, micro-irrigation (sprinkler and drip system) for orchard farming and expansion of grazing land for raising the livestock. Impact of Work:  Successful implementation of the project as outlined in the project document and in line with FAO rules, regulation and procedure and as per demand of the Recipient Government and Resource Partners. Reporting Lines / Supervision Received/Exercised:  Under the general supervision of the FAO Representative in Afghanistan and direct supervision of the International Project Technical Adviser (PTA) and International Irrigation Management Specialist and National Project Manager (Senior Engineer), in close cooperation with the counterpart MAIL authorities/staff, other project staff, the incumbent will be responsible for implementation of the relevant objectives/activities of the \xe2\x80\x9cProject for Improving Economic Growth in the Western Region of Afghanistan through Community Irrigation and Livelihood Enhancement\xe2\x80\x9d.  Key Functions/Results: \xef\x82\xa7 Field visits to the project sites under component-1 (Watershed Management) and Component-2 (Rehabilitation of the Irrigation and the Karez system). \xef\x82\xa7 Liaise with the community to understand their irrigation problems so as to propose remedial designs to these problems. \xef\x82\xa7 Carry out the survey and design of canals and structures as well as the structures associated with the watershed management works and prepare the technical proposals incorporating drawings, cost estimates, rate analysis, bills of quantities and carry out construction supervision. \xef\x82\xa7 Assist the International Irrigation Management Specialist and the Senior Engineer to perform technical reviews of technical proposals. \xef\x82\xa7 Exercise quality assurance and quality control on all activities related to adequate designs of irrigation systems. \xef\x82\xa7 Prepare and participate in training courses and on-the-job training. \xef\x82\xa7 Coordinate with relevant government departments and other agencies and institutions in the Herat region. \xef\x82\xa7 Collaborate with international staff and national consultants. \xef\x82\xa7 Inspect the construction works and guide the contractor staff to ensure quality of the construction activities implemented in the field including the material used for construction of civil works; \xef\x82\xa7 Ensure that construction has been carried out in accordance with the design specifications and standards as outlined in the detailed design and drawings; \xef\x82\xa7 Guide and lead the contractors for using proper methods for testing and proper use of construction materials and equipment in the field; \xef\x82\xa7 Inspect and report on the performance of the outsourced Construction Supervision, if any, and Quality Control conducted by consulting firms; \xef\x82\xa7 Monitor the adherence of the contractors in the field to the quality control requirements, by having a qualified engineer in the site, concrete mixers, sieving set, vibrator, etc. as applicable.  \xef\x82\xa7 Submit suitable recommendations on the controversial cases; \xef\x82\xa7 Monitor the use of OK Cards, construction manual and specifications at the site with continuous tracking and guidance on the use of the site logbook and keep them up to date; \xef\x82\xa7 Monitor the use of testing tools/equipment in the construction sites to meet the quality standards; \xef\x82\xa7 Inspect the performance of the work with regard to workmanship, compliance with the specifications and all necessary testing required for acceptance of any item of work; \xef\x82\xa7 Inspect and approve all materials sources nominated by the Contractor; \xef\x82\xa7 Assess and check the laboratory and field tests carried out by the contractors, and carry out independent tests as per the specifications; \xef\x82\xa7 Report and Advice to the Contractor(s) to remove or make good any work which is found to be: 1 - Not in accordance with the drawings 2 - Not in accordance with the specifications in terms of either work method or materials specification; \xef\x82\xa7 Covering work which has not been inspected for acceptance or rejected as unacceptable; \xef\x82\xa7 Maintain records of all testing work, including cross referencing to items of work to which each test refers and location from which any samples were obtained for testing; \xef\x82\xa7 Prepare and participate in training courses and on-the-job training for the site implementing staff/companies, contractors\xe2\x80\x99 supervisors and communities in the quality control measures and use of testing tools/equipment; \xef\x82\xa7 Assist in preparing manuals related to the quality control at different levels such as community, site supervisor engineers, companies with the help of Training Coordinator; and \xef\x82\xa7 Perform any other duties as required and instructed by the Irrigation Management Specialist, Project Technical Adviser, National project Manager (Senior Engineer) and FAOR. Expected Outputs: \xef\x82\xa7 Timely production of outputs considered satisfactory by the Project Technical Adviser, International Irrigation Management Specialist and National Project Manager (Senior Engineer).  \xef\x82\xa7 Prepare end of assignment report after completion of the assignment. \xef\x82\xa7 A number of drawings produced, BOQs and Work Plans prepared \xef\x82\xa7 Quality Control certificates issued on completion of project sites \xef\x82\xa7 Regular reporting of progress of project activities in the site producedTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Engineering and Construction Education: \xef\x82\xa7 University degree, (Preferably MSc) in Irrigation, Civil / Agriculture Engineering or closely related fields; Work Experience:  \xef\x82\xa7 At least seven (07) years of professional experience in irrigation schemes, standard quality control,  field testing procedures on civil works contracts; preferably with UN, and/or NGOs; \xef\x82\xa7 Strong analytical, engineering skills, AutoCad and computer based engineering programs, drawings and etc.  \xef\x82\xa7 Computer literacy and skills to use word-processing equipment is necessary; \xef\x82\xa7 Excellent report writing skills; \xef\x82\xa7 Experience of working with UN, government entities and western region is highly desirable. Other Desirable Skills:  \xef\x82\xa7 Excellent interpersonal communication and coordination skills, and proven ability to work constructively with a variety of stake holders to achieve common goals; \xef\x82\xa7 The candidate should have the proven records of organizing and managing the rehabilitation of irrigation projects and watershed management;  \xef\x82\xa7 Similarly, the candidate should possess the ability to other water sector experiences; \xef\x82\xa7 Good knowledge of protocol, good judgment and initiative;  Language Skills: Excellent knowledge of English and local languages, both spoken and written skills. COMPTENCIES: \xef\x82\xa7 Core competencies: FAO core competencies include: Understanding FAO\xe2\x80\x99s mandate & its global context; planning, organizing, and delivering quality results; communicating to build understanding & support; working together in teams and partnerships; engaging in continuous learning. \xef\x82\xa7 Operational Effectiveness: Working independently, structuring tasks, establishing priorities and adhering to deadlines. Show a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail. Contribute ideas and suggestions for process improvement. \xef\x82\xa7 Client Orientation: Focus on results for the client. Attend to inquiries from internal and external clients in an effective, timely and courteous manner. Treat clients with courtesy and respect even when working under pressure. Express a high level of professionalism. \xef\x82\xa7 Interpersonal Communications and Teamwork: Work effectively and efficiently with staff at all levels, listen to others and openly share own ideas. Express sensitivity, cultural empathy and respect for diversity. Productively handle differing views and opinions and strive for achievement of shared goals. Respond positively to feedback. \xef\x82\xa7 Knowledge Exchange and Learning: Share own knowledge and promote a learning culture within the work environment. Actively work towards professional development, including personal learning.  Apply newly acquired skills and support flexibility within the work environment.'

b'Structural Engineer Job SummaryBalwan Co.ltd is seeking an engineer with at least four years of building design experience to support its new office in Kabul. The position requires the ability to work on a wide range of engineering projects and play a prominent role in the firm\xe2\x80\x99s local business development efforts. Proficiency with design and modeling programs including Revit, AutoCAD, RAM concept, RAM Steel etc. is necessary. Experience with both new and existing structures is preferred. Candidate will work with team members from other offices on select projects and work independently on others. Communication and networking skills will play a prominent role in the position. Versatility and the ability to work on several projects simultaneously are necessary. . Proficiency with design and modeling programs including Revit, AutoCAD, RAM concept, RAM Steel etc. is necessary. Experience with both new and existing structures is preferred. Candidate will work with team members from other offices on select projects and work independently on others. Communication and networking skills will play a prominent role in the position. Versatility and the ability to work on several projects simultaneously are necessary. Engineering Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Civil, Structural or Architectural Engineering * minimum 4 years of experience in structural engineering design * Strong oral and written communication skills are critical * Proficient in Revit / AutoCAD * Experience with a variety of design and modeling programs including Bentley products (RAM Steel, RAM Concept, Elements etc)'

b'Civil Engineering Drafter Job SummaryBalwan Engineering is seeking a CAD designer to support various engineering drafting needs. Applicants shall possess 2-5 years of experience in Autodesk Civil 3D design field. Candidates should be certified in AutoCAD use or possess equivalent experience. A good understanding of mechanical, hydraulic, and hydrologic civil engineering concepts as well as the standard US codes and standards that are in effect regarding those disciplines is desired. Applicants should be organized and be able to keep track of numerous project files through the various phases of design. CAD Designer will be supporting the design of the following: Civil  Civil design \xe2\x80\x93 grading and Public Works (School, Roads and utilities) CAD Design Functions will include: Make revisions to project drawings marked up by client and/or Engineer. Create and manage electronic document file structure, naming convention in accordance with company standards. Work closely with Project Managers and Engineers to set-up and manage contract and construction drawings. Communicate with outside agencies and clients in exchanging data and manage that data in accordance with guidelines set. Create and/or modify base drawings, which may be used in a variety of presentation documents. Can be relied on as productive team member and AutoCAD user to work a typical set of project documents from beginning to end with professional quality output that conforms to company standards. Must be able to work on multiple projects at the same time. Follow CAD standards. Candidate resumes will be evaluated relative to experience and knowledge of all areas of water resources, general civil and land development. Compensation will be commensurate with experience and capabilities. Engineering Requirements Should be certified in advanced areas of Civil 3D use or equivalent experience. 2-5 years of experience predominantly in Civil 3D design. Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to be receptive and adaptive to change. Autodesk civil 3d 2017 required, AutoCAD MEP and  REVIT'

b"English Teacher Job SummaryThe English Teacher is primarily responsible to plan, design, organize and teach English classes to Elham students. \xe2\x80\xa2 Organizing and delivering classroom lectures to students. \xe2\x80\xa2 Developing English lesson plans in line with the National Curriculum. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare assignments for the students.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Design and propose new English programs based on market needs.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluating a students' class work and assignments. \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing classroom and coursework materials, homework assignments, and handouts. \xe2\x80\xa2 Recording and maintain accurate student attendance records and grades. \xe2\x80\xa2 Classroom management. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintaining discipline in the classroom. \xe2\x80\xa2 Creating a vibrant teaching atmosphere. \xe2\x80\xa2 preparing and setting tests, examination papers and exercises; \xe2\x80\xa2 marking and providing appropriate feedback on oral and written work; \xe2\x80\xa2 devising, writing and producing new materials, including audio and visual resources; \xe2\x80\xa2 preparing information for inspection visits and other quality assurance exercises; \xe2\x80\xa2 Basic administration, such as keeping student registers and attendance records. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares periodic reports Education \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficiency in English curriculum development/customization.  \xe2\x80\xa2  At least 3 years of experience in academic English teaching.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Degree in relevant function."

b'BCS Lecturer Job SummaryThe instructor is responsible for the overall teaching and administrative of subjects offered through the its related department. The Institute provides management education and professional development training in a broad variety of fields. 1. ) To teach at undergraduate level in areas allocated by the Head of Department and reviewed from time to time by the Head of Department. 2. ) To carry out research and produce publications, or other research outputs, in line with personal objectives agreed in the Staff review process. 3. ) To obtain research funding support. 4. )To engage with the broader scholarly and professional communities. 5. ) To supervise or assist with supervision of undergraduate students. 6. ) To contribute to the development, planning and implementation of a high quality curriculum. 7. ) To assist in the development of learning materials, preparing schemes of work and maintaining records to monitor student progress, achievement and attendance. 8. ) To participate in departmental and faculty seminars aimed at sharing research outcomes and building interdisciplinary collaboration within and outside the department. 9. ) To participate in the development, administration and marking of exams and other assessments. 10. ) To provide pastoral care and support to students. 11. ) To participate in the administration of the department\xe2\x80\x99s programs of study and other activities as requested. 12. ) To contribute to departmental, faculty, or JU-wide working groups or committees as requested. 13. ) To maintain own continuing professional development. 14. ) To actively follow and promote JU policies, including Equal Opportunities. 15. )To maintain an awareness and observation of fire and health and safety regulations Education Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree (Required), Ph.D. degree (Highly preferred).  \xe2\x80\xa2 Three (3) years teaching experience in university. \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent verbal, written, organizational and interpersonal skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work in a team environment.'

b"Teachers Job Summarythe main responsibility of a teacher is to help their students understand English, speak it and be able to write and read it. Your duties will range from the preparation of coursework, planning of classes and the marking of work handed in. On top of this, you will also have to arrange any extracurricular activities and set targets for your pupils. \xe2\x80\xa2 Advising student on career issues. \xe2\x80\xa2 Organizing and delivering classroom lectures to students. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluating a students' class work and assignments. \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing classroom and coursework materials, homework assignments, and handouts. \xe2\x80\xa2 Recording and maintain accurate student attendance records and grades. \xe2\x80\xa2 Classroom management. \xe2\x80\xa2 Developing English lesson plans in line with the National Curriculum. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintaining discipline in the classroom. \xe2\x80\xa2 Creating a vibrant teaching atmosphere. Education \xe2\x80\xa2 At least Bachelor of English  \xe2\x80\xa2 DEL  \xe2\x80\xa2 IELTS or TOEFL score (optional)"

b'TOEFL/IELTS Instructor Job SummaryOur accredited institution is currently seeking TOEFL/IELTS instructors for our PDI. The students are primarily young adults and they would like to pass TOEFL/IELTS. The administration is experienced and supportive. If you are an experienced teacher who is passionate about sharing your knowledge of English language and culture, this will be a great school for you. The incumbent will be working as instructor for TOEFL or IELTS, English language courses and also participate in course related activities including preparation, meetings, production of syllabus or course teaching plan, maintaining accurate and complete course records, student evaluation and assessment, inputting student attendance, reporting grades, and holding office hours. The incumbent will also work with program related activities such as participation in planning, developing, and evaluating the programs\xe2\x80\x99 curricular and instructional goals; service on and attendance at program committees as assigned; service on University committees shall be on a volunteer basis only; and participation in professional development activities; assistance with registration day. The incumbent will participate in initial and final term activities and attendance at other required program, college, and university meetings and activities. Education Minimum BA degree from an accredited institution of higher education with 10 years of experience Minimum three months of TOEFL/IELTS teaching experience Ability to help students set and reach learning objectives Enthusiastic personality and a passion for teaching'

b'Beautician / \xd8\xa2\xd8\xb1\xd8\xa7\xdb\x8c\xd8\xb4\xda\xaf\xd8\xb1 Job SummaryThe beautician will be responsible for day to day duties of the Queen Salon as per customers requirement. - Greet customers upon arrival. - Be updated with the latest trends in beauty services and technology. - Book appointments over the phone and serve walk-ins based on availability - Provide the necessary services to those who want to look beautiful at all times. - Discuss hair-style, makeup and customer order options. - Show the right values towards customers according to her request. - Exercise punctuality to schedules. - Apply makeup products properly to customers - Recommend hairstyles and nail colors to match clients\xe2\x80\x99 needs and personal style - Cut, dry, and style hair properly. - Wash, color, and condition hair - Inspect hair, face, and scalp, to recommend treatment - Discusses hair, skin and nail care methods with customers. - Washes and conditions hair prior to cutting or styling. - Applies chemical solutions in the form of permanents and relaxers to hair as part of the styling process. - Provides effective solutions for common issues concerning hair, scalp, nails and skin. - Discusses various style options with clients. - Remove hair using permanent and temporary methods (e.g. electrolysis and waxing) - Apply hair products, like serum, cream and clay to style hair - Give manicures and pedicures following clients\xe2\x80\x99 preferences - Provide guidelines to clients on how to take care of their skin - Maintain updated client records (e.g. contact details and treatments) - Cross-sell therapies and beauty products, when relevant - Maintain a cheerful and warm disposition in dealing with customers at all times. - Always available to attend to the needs of customers. - Aim to satisfy every customer. - Maintain cleanliness and observe proper hygiene. - Maintain good and proper grooming at all times. - Make sure our working area is clean and equipment is sterilized at all times - Keep track of levels of stock (e.g lotions and nail polishes & makeup needs) - Communicates with clients in order to provide the requested services. - Restocks shelves and supplies. - Keeps records of hair color and nail color used by each customer at past visits. Designer - Minimum must have a high school diploma or equivalent. University degree is an asset. - Having certificate confirming the completion of a cosmetology program. - Familiarity with both Pashto and Dari, having working knowledge of English language and communication with Urdu/Hindi is an asset. - Hands-on training necessary as part of a certificate program as well as on-the-job training. - Must have minimum 3 years of experience as beautician. - Age must be between 20 to 40 years'

b'Hairdresser (Barber) / \xd8\xb3\xd9\x84\xd9\x85\xd8\xa7\xd9\x86 Job SummaryThe Hairdresser will be responsible for day to day duties of the King Salon as per customers requirement. - Welcome clients as they arrive in the salon and engage them in conversation to determine their needs. - Provide suggestions to clients regarding current hairstyles and favorite trends - Answer clients\xe2\x80\x99 questions regarding salon\xe2\x80\x99s facilities and hair care products - Inquire from clients about hair care preferences and suggest appropriate resolutions to hair and scalp issues - Cut and style hair according to clients\xe2\x80\x99 instructions - Provide beard trims to clients looking for grooming - Provide manicure and pedicure services to clients - Give scalp treatments and apply facials - Provide clients with head, neck and back massages - Check clients for scalp or skin disorders such as sores or abrasions and determine how to provide a certain service - Ensure that all combs and scissors are cleaned and sanitized after use - Take telephone calls from clients and provide them with needed information - Schedule appointments over the phone and maintain records of work performed on each client - Assume responsibility for the upkeep and cleanliness of workstations - Perform up-selling services by suggesting retail products placed at the barbershop - Ensure that sufficient items such as clean wrap sheets and towels are available on an ongoing basis - Supervise trainees and apprentices to ensure that they are working according to the salon\xe2\x80\x99s protocols - Resolve clients\xe2\x80\x99 complaints correctly in a bid to ensure recurring business from them Designer - A high school diploma or equivalent is required, but not a must. University degree is an asset. - Having certificate confirming the completion of a cosmetology program. - Familiarity with both Pashto and Dari, having working knowledge of English language and communication with Urdu/Hindi is an asset. - Hands-on training necessary as part of a certificate program as well as on-the-job training. - Must have minimum 3 years of experience as barber. - Age must be between 20 to 40 years'

b'Consultancy for the External Review of Sustainable Livelihood and Social Development (SLSD) Job SummaryWith the main goal to have a strategic control of the SLSD programme, SDC is commissioning this review in order to assess the relevance, effectiveness, efficiency, sustainability, and impact primarily of the second phase of the SLSD project, however the previous work done by TLO in the first phase should also be briefly looked at, in order to get an overview of the overall project outcomes and impacts on livelihood improvement over the last 5 years (2013-2018). Further to that the review should provide concrete insights and recommendations to SDC for the development of the third phase of the program, aligned with SDC\xe2\x80\x99s strategic priorities for Afghanistan for 2019-2022. The review shall take place in both projects provinces Paktiya and Khost. Mandate: Consultancy for the External Review of Sustainable Livelihood and Social Development (SLSD) Project Organization:  Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) Locations: Kabul, Paktya and Khost Duration:  24 working days during the months of November- December 2018 (tentative) Announcement date: 16.10.2018 Closing date:  04.11.2018 Start date:  11.11.2018 (tentatively) The external review should particularly focus on the following aspects/questions: a. Evaluation of current phase: \xe2\x80\xa2 The overall effectiveness of the project from a results-based perspective; \xe2\x80\xa2 The overall direct and indirect results (outputs and outcomes) of the project produced through the utilization of SDC financial and technical assistance during the phase; \xe2\x80\xa2 What are the major external and internal factors influencing the achievement of the project? \xe2\x80\xa2 The level of acceptance of TLO by beneficiaries, communities, stakeholders and authorities; \xe2\x80\xa2 How effective has been the collaboration with relevant governmental departments, particularly PAIL \xe2\x80\xa2 Are the current promoted income generating activities for the poor and women effective enough? \xe2\x80\xa2 To what extend have aspects of gender and governance been considered during the implementation? \xe2\x80\xa2 How is the current monitoring and evaluation mechanism assessed? Does this mechanism serve as a feedback system for improving project implementation? Make recommendations on improving the project M&E systems for improved future integration of economic and financial analysis concerns.  \xe2\x80\xa2 A financial and economic analysis to be conducted preferably through a \xe2\x80\x98Cost Benefit Analysis\xe2\x80\x99. If it is not feasible (monetarizing outcomes) the review team is expected to provide a short justification and conduct a \xe2\x80\x98Cost Effectiveness Analysis\xe2\x80\x99 instead.  b. Recommendation for next phase: \xe2\x80\xa2 What are the good practices and the lessons learnt from the second phase of SLSD that could be replicated and up scaled in a next phase? \xe2\x80\xa2 What are the proposed measures and alternate implementation approach to make the program more effective and efficient? \xe2\x80\xa2 What income generating activities should be promoted for the poor and women? \xe2\x80\xa2 While overviewing the effectiveness of the implemented subprojects, at which level (community, district or watershed level) interventions could be more effective in improving livelihoods coupled with targeting more beneficiaries?  \xe2\x80\xa2 Does it make sense to include other themes, such as access to water for irrigation and drinking in the next phase? How does that fit with the overall strategic goal of the domain? 3. Methodology of External Review The external review will be carried out in three stages: 1. Desk review: A comprehensive review of the available documents, reports and evidence will take place in the desk review stage. In this stage, SDC and TLO will act as focal points for the review and will provide the review team with the available written documentation which may include but are not limited to: \xe2\x80\xa2 Project documents; \xe2\x80\xa2 Project progress and financial reports; \xe2\x80\xa2 Project annual reports; \xe2\x80\xa2 Mission reports; \xe2\x80\xa2 Internal and external review reports; \xe2\x80\xa2 Agreements/contracts; \xe2\x80\xa2 Organizational chart of the project; \xe2\x80\xa2 Internal SDC credit proposals; \xe2\x80\xa2 SDC draft cooperation strategy 2019-2022; \xe2\x80\xa2 Any other available relevant and important documents. The review will be complemented by interviews with SDC and TLO staff (if needed) to provide the consultant with as much information as possible. 2. Data collection and consultation in the field: In this stage of the review exercise, a participatory and inclusive approach will be used to collect primary data and verification of secondary data obtained through the desk review stage throughout the external review exercise. In this stage the review team will conduct interviews and focus groups discussions with all main stakeholders. The use of surveys needs to be evaluated by the team and prepared during the preparatory phase. As a focal point for the review, SDC together with TLO will assist the review team with arranging all required meetings and consultation sessions and forums.  3. In the final stage of the review, the review team will analyze the collected data and materials to produce the deliverables of the evaluation.  The review team, nevertheless, is allowed to revisit proposed methodology and come up with a modify/revised methodology, shall the team feel such a need. In any case, the team will submit to SDC and TLO work plan of its proposed methodology. The outline may contain the following information: \xe2\x80\xa2 A specific and time bound work plan within the suggested timeframe \xe2\x80\xa2 Details of how the review exercise will take place \xe2\x80\xa2 Reporting, debriefing in the end It is anticipated that the evaluation team will present its methodology and detailed work plan to a joint meeting (briefing) attended by SDC and TLO prior to stage one of the exercise. 4. Deliverables: The review team is expected to produce the following specific outputs: 1. A work-plan describing how the evaluation will be carried out, bringing refinements, specificity and elaboration to the terms of reference. The work-plan shall comprise at least the following elements: a. Overview of the mandate and expectations of the reviewer; b. Review techniques methodology; c. Key expected issues for all elements of the external review described above; d. Reporting; e. Work schedule (timeframe). 2. Briefing and presenting the work plan, methodologies, procedures etc.to SDC and TLO in Kabul prior to the start of the review process. 3. With SDC/TLO support, the review team will organize a de-briefing at the end of the review in Kabul presenting SDC and TLO with the initial findings and recommendations. 4. Draft report, providing comprehensive and well-structured information and answering the review questions outlined above. It should be submitted no later than 10 working days after the debriefing and will be subject to SDC/TLO comments and suggestions. 5. Final Report: Upon receipt of SDC and TLO comments on the draft report, the review team will revise the report and incorporate received comments and suggestions, unless not contrary to the review findings and submit it to SDC no later than 5 working days after having received the comments. 6. Analytic data, calculation, assumptions are delivered in editable formats. The External Review Report should not exceed 30 pages and summarize the key findings and recommendations, and comprised of at least the following parts: a. Executive Summary (not to exceed 3 pages); b. Overview of the mandate; c. Key issues, findings and recommendations on all elements of the external review;  d. Conclusion e. The document(s) shall be delivered in electronic format (Ms. Word and Excel), in English. Consulting This announcement is open to a consultant or a team of consultants (max. 3, international and national, female and male). The consultant/team shall have solid expertise in monitoring and evaluation (especially NGOs working in agriculture and livelihood) and in the field of agriculture and livelihood development. In particular, the consultant/team shall have the following expertise and skills: \xe2\x80\xa2 Advanced degree in a relevant field; \xe2\x80\xa2 At least five years of experience in reporting, monitoring and reviewing of projects in the agriculture and livelihood sector; \xe2\x80\xa2 Extensive experience in undertaking reviews/studies and impact assessments of development projects; \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to present information in a transparent and comprehensive manner; \xe2\x80\xa2 Written and spoken fluency in English and in Pashtu; \xe2\x80\xa2 Previous work experience in Afghanistan, preferable in M&E-related fields.  Timeframe The external review exercise shall be performed within a maximum of 24 working days as outlined below:  Work No. of Days Preparation (work plan, methodologies, timeframe etc.) 3 Desk Review 4 Inception report submission 1 Field Work in Paktiya and Khost including desk review and travel days 8 Briefing and Debriefing in Kabul 1 Preparing/Writing the Review Report 5 Finalization of the Report after SDC comments 2 Total no. of working days 24 days 7. Logistic and Security The consultant/team must be able to arrange logistics (transport, accommodation, and visa) on its own account. SDC may facilitate access to relevant information, organizations and stakeholders upon request.  The consultant/team is responsible for its own safety and the safety of its staff (including relevant insurances). SDC is not liable for any kind of damage to staff or property and cannot be held accountable for any claims or costs related to injury, death, and loss of or damage to property. SDC will facilitate access to security related information and provide the team with a security briefing up-on request.'

b'International Consultant for Ministry of Interior For data analysis, review, and finalization of the Ministry of Interior Vulnerability to Corruption Assessment Report. Job SummaryThe primary responsibility of the International Consultant will be conducting wide-ranging analysis of the corruption vulnerability in the procurement, Human Resource and Logistic department of the Afghan Ministry of Interior (MOI). This is an exciting, ground-breaking study on a difficult but crucial topic. The analysis is being conducted with the full support of Ministry of Interior (MoI). The analysis will be the first comprehensive analysis of the corruption vulnerabilities in the procurement, Human Resource and Logistic departments of MOI. It is including an assessment of the corruption vulnerabilities in the provision of expenditures, policies, services, legal and institutional frameworks, key functions, interaction with the main stakeholders of the security sector, human-resources systems, awarding service & goods contracts, internal oversight and audit regime, information-management systems, and management and leadership \xe2\x80\x93 all with a focus on corruption and practical measures to mitigate such corruption. The VCA will also look at ways to improve MOI Procurement, Human Resource and Logistic departments\xe2\x80\x99 responsiveness to required goods or services for the MOI via reduced corruption, enhance integrity in the procurement department and enable external stakeholders to more effectively fight corruption. The work will mostly proceed via semi-structured interviews, but will also involve analysis of the institutional, policy and legal arrangements of the MOI, investigating the experiences of donors, and desk research on the many corruption issues that have happened in the MOI, and analysis. \xe2\x97\x8f The Consultant will work closely with technical team.  \xe2\x97\x8f The Consultant will be required to be present in Kabul for much of that time, though some work will be able to be done from home.  \xe2\x97\x8f Upon arrival in Kabul, the Consultant will review assembled documentation and conduct an initial analysis \xe2\x80\x93 in conjunction with MOI and MEC \xe2\x80\x93 to determine the scope, detailed methodology, required resources and work plan of the project, including deliverables and milestones, within the first two weeks. The agreed work plan will be used as a base for consultant invoice payments. \xe2\x97\x8f The consultant will act as the domain expert supporting team in doing the work \xe2\x80\x93 much of which will be collating the results, analyzing their meaning and developing the findings. He/she may be asked to lead the team, depending on experience.  \xe2\x97\x8f Over the final months, the Consultant will finalize \xe2\x80\x93 as the primary author \xe2\x80\x93 the Report (in English, and with accompanying recommendations) that MEC will issue, Entitled, \xe2\x80\x9cVulnerability to Corruption Assessment Procurement activity of MOI.\xe2\x80\x9d  \xe2\x97\x8f The Consultant will not be expected to complete, nor be reimbursed for, any tasks performed outside of his or her expected work-days.  \xe2\x97\x8f The final number of working days will likely range from 40 - 60, depending on the agreed-upon timeframe and schedule of the Consultant, supporting consultants, and MEC Team.  \xe2\x97\x8f The format, content, and length of the Special Report can be changed at any time with the approval of the MEC Executive Director. \xe2\x97\x8f Refining the scope of the project by designing a research methodology that will accurately assess MOI vulnerabilities to corruption.  \xe2\x97\x8f Assigning data-collection, report-writing, and any other tasks to the MEC Officers working on this project.  \xe2\x97\x8f Writing the final In-Depth Reports (in English) based on initial drafts already produced, that will be provided, and proposing recommendations according to MEC\xe2\x80\x99s standards in collaboration with the M&E team to address problems identified therein.  Project outline A detailed project outline will be available for successful candidate after being hired. Deliverables: 1) Review and Finalization of the Reports, with recommendations 2) Follow up to explain the reports and the findings within the MOI Consulting The Consultant must have the following qualifications: \xe2\x97\x8f Advanced university degree in Public Policy, Economy, Finances, Public Administration or Business Administration Project Management or a related field; \xe2\x97\x8f A minimum of seven years of auditing experience of project management in politicized environments and multi-million dollar projects;  \xe2\x97\x8f Research and written reports focusing on large sectors or ministries, with a prior record of professional publications; \xe2\x97\x8f Prior international experience, preferably in conflict or post-conflict environments, with a preference for experience in Afghanistan; \xe2\x97\x8f Knowledge of internationally accepted norms and standards in anti-corruption in the procurement sector. \xe2\x97\x8f Ability to work independently with minimal supervision; \xe2\x97\x8f Ability to effectively lead a team in a challenging, multi-cultural and fast-paced environment;  \xe2\x97\x8f Ability to work in a politicized environment on a highly sensitive topic \xe2\x97\x8f Native-level oral and written English required, including the ability to write sophisticated reports in English; \xe2\x97\x8f Dari and/or Pashto language skills are not essential, but would be a significant asset. The Consultant will report to the MEC\xe2\x80\x99s Technical Director and Executive Director.'

b"Quality Control Engineer Job SummaryQuality Control Engineer will be the project\xe2\x80\x99s lead person in the implementation of Central Utilities like Power House, Power Distribution, Sanitary Sewer collection and Distribution system along with buildings construction. The Safety Manager is primary responsible for effective implementation of Infrastructure and reconstruction project activities at the field level. Provides technical assistance as Safety Manager to Project manager and all Project team. The SM compiles all the field level and monitoring information and assists the PM in periodical project report preparation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Report to the project coordinator and the higher management of the company \xe2\x80\xa2 Implementation of the quality control plan \xe2\x80\xa2 The administration of the quality control plan \xe2\x80\xa2 To review the specification and recommend any changes there \xe2\x80\xa2 To review procurement documents to ensure they comply with the contract and specification requirements \xe2\x80\xa2 To review design and as built drawing and ensure the latest updated design documents. \xe2\x80\xa2 specifying quality requirements of raw materials with suppliers \xe2\x80\xa2 investigating and setting standards for quality and health and safety \xe2\x80\xa2 working with operating staff to establish procedures, standards, systems and procedures \xe2\x80\xa2 devising and establishing a company's quality procedures, standards and specifications \xe2\x80\xa2 Using relevant quality tools and making sure managers and other staff understand how to improve the project quality. \xe2\x80\xa2 Inspect review and train subcontractor with methods and procedures of work to ensure their understanding and compliance with the contract and specification Construction \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor Degree in construction is required. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of USACE, AFCEE, USAID, UNOPS, IRD and LBG projects is desirable. \xe2\x80\xa2 Good knowledge of Microsoft Office programs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Working experience with International Organizations and/or NGO. Experience in dealing with      USAID,UNOPS,USACE, AFCEE as well as other international donors is preferred \xe2\x80\xa2 Must be flexible and willing to work long hours in order to meet the deadline  \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge and ability to interpret engineering drawings and implement the field works. \xe2\x80\xa2 The ability to use your initiative and make decisions under pressure \xe2\x80\xa2 Willing to spend long hours in the field. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work harmoniously within a multicultural team \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong organizational skills, ability to work independently, multi-task with attention to detail \xe2\x80\xa2 Time management and prioritization skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work with various departments and foster teamwork and in a cross-cultural environment \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work independently with minimal supervision \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously \xe2\x80\xa2 Must be able to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner \xe2\x80\xa2 Reliable, Honest, Transparent; Commitment for hard work & exceptional work ethics \xe2\x80\xa2 Attention to detail \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to maintain confidentiality \xe2\x80\xa2 strong interpersonal skills to motivate and lead your project team \xe2\x80\xa2 Good communication and negotiation skills to manage expectations \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines \xe2\x80\xa2 excellent organization skills to plan the use of people and resources to meet deadlines \xe2\x80\xa2 having ability to update Accident Prevention Plan \xe2\x80\xa2 At least 3-5 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience of working as Quality control officer/manager at USACE projects"

b'Quantity Surveyor Job SummaryQuality Surveyor will be the project\xe2\x80\x99s lead person in the implementation of Central Utilities like Power House, Power Distribution, Sanitary Sewer collection and Distribution system along with buildings construction. The Safety Manager is primary responsible for effective implementation of Infrastructure and reconstruction project activities at the field level. Provides technical assistance as Safety Manager to Project manager and all Project team. The SM compiles all the field level and monitoring information and assists the PM in periodical project report preparation. \xe2\x80\xa2 price/forecast the cost of the different materials needed for the project \xe2\x80\xa2 prepare tender documents, contracts, budgets, bills of quantities and other documentation \xe2\x80\xa2 track changes to the design and/or construction work and adjusting budget projections accordingly \xe2\x80\xa2 procure or agree the services of contractors and/or subcontractors who work on the construction of the project \xe2\x80\xa2 measure and value the work done on site \xe2\x80\xa2 pay subcontractors \xe2\x80\xa2 liaise with the client and other construction professionals, such as site managers, project managers and site engineers \xe2\x80\xa2 select and/or source construction materials \xe2\x80\xa2 write reports \xe2\x80\xa2 Review architectural plans and prepare quantity needs \xe2\x80\xa2 Estimate quantity and costs of materials \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare contracts and documents \xe2\x80\xa2 Set budgets for payments, inventory needs, and materials \xe2\x80\xa2 Analyze costs for maintenance and additional building needs \xe2\x80\xa2 Track changes in plans or constructions; update budgets \xe2\x80\xa2 Negotiate with contractors and subcontractors \xe2\x80\xa2 Hire and document contractors and subcontractors \xe2\x80\xa2 Act as a liaison between clients and site managers/engineers \xe2\x80\xa2 Keep track of construction materials and inventory \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify potential financial or construction risks \xe2\x80\xa2 Advise clients on improvements, strategies, and/or estimated costs \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare payments for contractors and subcontractors \xe2\x80\xa2 Document progress, materials, and reports on project \xe2\x80\xa2 Advise on property taxes, regulations, and local laws \xe2\x80\xa2 Source maintenance costs and facilities management for clients \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and maintain working relationships with contractors and subcontractors \xe2\x80\xa2 Utilize software to calculate, record, and track inventory and estimates \xe2\x80\xa2 Analyze completed projects to determine ROI and compare costs Construction \xe2\x80\xa2 Master Degree in quantity surveying, construction engineering, management, or related field is required. \xe2\x80\xa2    10 years of general construction estimating experience, financial experience,       construction experience, or related field \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in computer skills and Microsoft Office Suite \xe2\x80\xa2 Able to analyze financial records and apply data to improved results \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong aptitude for numbers, spreadsheets, and financial reports \xe2\x80\xa2 Experienced at compiling and following strict budgets; strong estimating and financial analysis skills \xe2\x80\xa2 In-depth understanding of construction, materials, pricing, and industry \xe2\x80\xa2 Able to analyze problems and strategize for better solutions'

b'Safety Engineer Job SummarySafety Manager (SM) will be the project\xe2\x80\x99s lead person in the implementation of Central Utilities like Power House, Power Distribution, Sanitary Sewer collection and Distribution system along with buildings construction. The Safety Manager is primary responsible for effective implementation of Infrastructure and reconstruction project activities at the field level. Provides technical assistance as Safety Manager to Project manager and all Project team. The SM compiles all the field level and monitoring information and assists the PM in periodical project report preparation. The SM directly reports to Project Manager. \xe2\x80\xa2 Principal duties include. \xe2\x80\xa2 Working as Safety Manager for Power Transmission line projects \xe2\x80\xa2 Working as Safety Manager for USACE Project. Implementing the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) roles and regulation  \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing technical assistant in safety division \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing Safety trainings for field staff \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing Safety Plan \xe2\x80\xa2 Making First Aid Stations  \xe2\x80\xa2 Providing First Trainings to all staff \xe2\x80\xa2 Reporting any problems immediately to the Project Manager \xe2\x80\xa2 Keep Project Manager informed of the progress/shortcomings in implementation of project activities and corresponding work-plan. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop the Safety plan of Utilities Project \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing a technical safety guide and tables  \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct daily site visits to the project site to monitor the construction works. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare all project reports accurately and submit them to the Project Manager on a timely manner. \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform any other job related tasks assigned time to time by the ACI Project Manager and top Management. Construction \xe2\x80\xa2 Master Degree in construction is required. \xe2\x80\xa2 Having Certificate of Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) is a must At least 3 years of experience in construction activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of USACE, AFCEE,USAID,UNOPS,IRD and LBG projects is desirable. \xe2\x80\xa2 Good knowledge of Microsoft Office programs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Working experience with International Organizations and/or NGO. b'Structure Specialist Job SummaryStructure Specialist will be the project\xe2\x80\x99s lead person in the implementation of Central Utilities like Power House, Power Distribution, Sanitary Sewer collection and Distribution system along with buildings construction. The Safety Manager is primary responsible for effective implementation of Infrastructure and reconstruction project activities at the field level. Provides technical assistance as Safety Manager to Project manager and all Project team. The SM compiles all the field level and monitoring information and assists the PM in periodical project report preparation. Assessing the immediate structural condition of the affected area of task force operations, which includes Identifying structure types and specific damage and structural hazards. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Recommending the appropriate type and amount of structural hazard mitigation in order to minimize risks on Site to task force personnel. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Adhering to all safety procedures. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Cooperating with and assisting other search and rescue resources. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Accountability, maintenance, and minor repairs for all issued equipment. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Performing additional tasks or duties as assigned during a mission. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Monitoring assigned structure for condition changes while rescue and recovery operations are proceeding. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Assuming an active role in implementing approved structural hazard mitigation as a designer, inspector, and Possibly a supervisor. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Coordinating and communicating the structural related hazard mitigation with IST Structural Unit Leader. \xe2\x80\xa2 preparing reports, designs and drawings \xe2\x80\xa2 making calculations about loads and stresses \xe2\x80\xa2 selecting appropriate construction materials \xe2\x80\xa2 providing technical advice \xe2\x80\xa2 obtaining planning and/or building regulations approval \xe2\x80\xa2 liaising with relevant professional staff such as architects \xe2\x80\xa2 monitoring and inspecting work undertaken by contractors \xe2\x80\xa2 administering contracts \xe2\x80\xa2 managing projects \xe2\x80\xa2 inspecting properties to check conditions/foundations Construction \xe2\x80\xa2 Master Degree in structural engineer is required. Knowledge 1. Successful completion of Rescue Systems 1 2. Comprehensive knowledge of building materials, to include: \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of the design and construction techniques for wood, masonry, concrete, and steel. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of the design and construction techniques utilizing architectural materials such as unreinforced masonry and concrete. 3. Knowledge of the behavior of structures under adverse loading conditions. 4. Ability to identify features that allow for the determination of the condition of structures subjected to adverse loading from: \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Earthquakes - ability to evaluate the remaining lateral force system capacity in the event of aftershocks. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Hurricanes and tornadoes - ability to evaluate the lateral force system and areas of local stress. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Flood or dam collapse. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Fire or explosion. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Landslide or avalanche. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Transportation accidents. 5. Knowledge of the appropriate types of structural hazard reduction methods for various types of collapsed structures, including: \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Shoring and bracing and availability of appropriate materials. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Removal of collapsed structural components and hazards, or debris removal. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Methods for creating safe havens. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Identification of unsafe areas that must be restricted. 6. Knowledge of victim access methods, including: \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0How and where to penetrate various building types to minimize risks. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Effects of lifting large structural components and the ability to calculate weights for rigging and lifting operations. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of safe rescue practices and procedures. 7. Must have completed the FEMA Structural Specialist Course. Skills 1. Currently licensed as a structural engineer or equivalent as sanctioned by the FEMA US&R Advisory Committee. 2. A minimum of five years experience in structure design and analysis to include evaluation of existing structures, field investigation or construction observation experience. 3. Ability to identify vertical load and lateral force resisting framing systems and be able to identify the critical elements within those systems. 4. Ability to identify failure indications of building materials, including: \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of how basic building materials and framing systems perform. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of how building materials typically fail under various loading conditions. \xe2\x80\xa2\xef\x80\xa0\xef\x80\xa0Knowledge of typical falling and collapse hazards from previous failures. 5. Ability to identify building features that could provide entry or access to victims such as ducts, shafts, etc. 6. Able to recommend practical solutions for US&R operations in compromised structures.'
