b'Project Manager Job SummaryThe Project Manager will be responsible design-build project Scope of Work items and the overall project technical and non-commercial correspondences with client\xe2\x80\x99s on-site project management team, the PM manages, the and updates WBS and prepares monthly progress reports to client and TATEKAN head office. The PM oversees execution of the project and manages the field teams, controls the schedule and budget for the project. He will need to organize the best team possible to complete the project in accordance with the contract documents in close coordination with the Executive Director, at the same time PM will provide instructions, training and teaching the project teams toward the TATEKAN\xe2\x80\x99s Code of Ethics & Compliance and Policies. \xe2\x80\xa2 The following is a list of the major responsibilities of the Project Manager: \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee and manage the project scope of work, discuss and resolve issues related to SOW with Client on-site project management team when required. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain and prepare project reports, correspondences and work progress reports to the client\xe2\x80\x99s on-site project management team and TATEKAN head office on a regular basis as required by a project.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage and organize WBS and update on regular basis. \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee the execution of the project and manage field teams and TATEKAN sub-tiers at the site.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in the preparation of the project schedule and control the project schedules and weekly schedules. \xe2\x80\xa2 Review the project plans and specifications and comment on the designs, scheduling, possible cost savings measures and potential construction problems. \xe2\x80\xa2 Supervises and manages the project execution managers and teams. \xe2\x80\xa2 Manages sub-tiers, vendors, machinery and all other resources through the construction team.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist TATEKAN in preparation of project budget and must ensure project budget controls are in place toward successful completion of the project per the approved budget plan for the project. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in assembling the job site office and equipment requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Have confidence in own ability to intelligently communicate with design team/client as well as effectively lead the trades. \xe2\x80\xa2 Raise and discuss relevant issues at the job site meetings. Prepare & issue minutes of all site meetings \xe2\x80\xa2 Inform the Consultant/Client of any errors, discrepancies or omissions contained within the Consultant\xe2\x80\x99s design drawings. \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage & expedite all submittals, RFI & CO (change order) and maintain proper logs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor site safety and ensure that the requirements of the Occupational Health and Safety Act are enforced. \xe2\x80\xa2 Issue monthly progress draws percentage and invoicing to consultant and client including final holdbacks. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain and enforce good construction standards and quality control. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain control and responsibility for the security and operation of project\xe2\x80\x99s directly owned equipment on the job site in conjunction with site staff. \xe2\x80\xa2 Control and monitor labor, material and equipment expenses. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare monthly cost forecasting summaries. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that \xe2\x80\x9cas-\xc2\xad\xe2\x80\x90built\xe2\x80\x9d drawings are prepared on an ongoing basis by all trades during the construction period and issue final close-\xc2\xad\xe2\x80\x90outs to client accordingly. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all required inspections, testing, permits, and correspondences are performed. \xe2\x80\xa2 The project manager reports to the executive director and performs any other tasks as assigned by direct supervisor. Construction \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree in Civil Engineering or construction management with 5 years of related experience in handling USACE projects or overall experience of not less than the years in the field of construction management and supervision. Prior international donors experience is preferred. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge and ability to interpret engineering drawings and implement the field works. \xe2\x80\xa2 Sufficient knowledge of USACE rules, regulations, and procedures desired. \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in English. Have good command of English language both written and spoken. Candidates who do not have sufficient English language knowledge will be disqualified.'

b'Quality Control Manager Job SummaryQuality Control program, including the coordination, performance and execution of construction inspection and testing services for the project. The QC Manager is responsible for assuring that the quality of the work meets or exceeds the project\xe2\x80\x99s contractual requirements and maintains the standard of excellence established by TATEKAN. The position will also ensure that the electrical, mechanical team and subcontractors provides consistent, high-quality, cost-effective, and timely deliverables and products for the construction of relevant project.  Oversees, guides, and manages the work of sub-contractors, vendors, and suppliers in the field of mechanical, construction and electrical scope of work of TATEKAN. Candidate must be professional and a personable leader committed to the overall objective and self-development within the company. The following is a list of the major responsibilities of the QC Manager: \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all work meets or exceeds the contract specifications and standard of excellence of the Client & TATEKAN. \xe2\x80\xa2 Supervises inspections, reports and the documentation issued by inspectors and collect and file the required Quality Records.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Supervises the Quality Control functions/activities of a project or its parts, including Quality Control inspection schedules and the collection of Quality Records. \xe2\x80\xa2 Supervises and manages preconstruction submittals and materials submittals for projects. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all materials meet or exceed the contract specifications. \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate and schedule field testing and performance QA/QC inspections.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor daily construction activities and materials delivered to the site.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Review all special inspecntion and material testing perform by third parties.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage and document all inspection, approvals, RFI\xe2\x80\x99s, Change Orders and testing in QC reports.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Manages, expedites, and supports all document submittals, Prep. Meetings, Daily Reports and RFI\xe2\x80\x99s to Client.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Serves as an interface between the Engineering team, Electrical, mechanical & construction\xe2\x80\x99s sub-contractors and clients, including the Construction, Operations, Environmental, Health & Safety, to facilitate interdepartmental relations. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assists with the development of new electrical, mechanical & construction engineering standards and maintains and improves existing standards and guidelines, implementing industry and company best practices. \xe2\x80\xa2 Acts as a subject matter expert regarding QC activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Interacts closely with internal teams to ensure that project needs and objectives are met. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares QC-related scope documents, exhibits, budgets, specifications & schedules. \xe2\x80\xa2 Leads or participates in project meetings and conference calls with Client and partners. \xe2\x80\xa2 Produces quality engineering plans, studies, and specifications while ensuring compliance with department, project, company, utility, and industry requirements and standards. \xe2\x80\xa2 Participates in engineering, design, and construction review processes. \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinates project construction with Project Manager and Operations Manager to resolve critical and time-sensitive construction-related electrical, mechanical and construction issues. \xe2\x80\xa2 Be responsible to supervise and manage all QC team/staff members/officers of TATEKAN. Construction To be considered for this position you will possess the following skills, attributes, and abilities: \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 5 Year experience as a Quality Control Manager on construction project with USACE / International Agencies. \xe2\x80\xa2 The QCM should have working knowledge of Quality Assurance and Quality Control procedures and practices. \xe2\x80\xa2 Candidate should have update CQM-C certificate from USACE. \xe2\x80\xa2 College or university degree in an engineering / construction related field. \xe2\x80\xa2 Must have understanding of construction terms. \xe2\x80\xa2 Good knowledge of construction methods and procedures. \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in Microsoft Word, and Excel, Civil 3D & AutoCAD. \xe2\x80\xa2 Certification in Total Construction Quality Management for Contractors from the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge in QCS will be an asset. \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent organizational, presentation, and interpersonal skills.'

b'Police Reform and Capacity Building     Adviser to Deputy Minister for Administration Job SummaryJob Code Title:  Police Reform and Capacity Building     Adviser to Deputy Minister for Administration Position Number: 1 Department:   DMA-MOIA Reports to: Deputy Minister for Administration  (DMA)  Approved Grade: B The Deputy Ministry of Administration is responsible for recruitment, training, personnel management, and management of the civil service elements of the Ministry. It also oversees the processing of national identity cards (tazkira), passports and visas, motor vehicle registrations, and drivers\xe2\x80\x99 licenses. Under the overall supervision of the Deputy Minister for Administration (DMA) and in close collaboration with the MoIA International partners, RS, C-STICA, UNDP/LOTFA, GPPT, GIZ/EU Police reform project, SSMI and other stakeholders the Deputy Minister Advisor will: \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with international partners on police reform, system development and capacity building of Afghan National Police at national and International level. \xe2\x80\xa2 Frequent travel to the provinces across the country; where regional training centers exist and police training and education programs are implemented and enhance the capacity of the RTCs to provide quality education for male and female police. \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate with RS/PAIT team to plan and implement different capacity building program for ANP at national level. \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate and manage current female training program in Sivas, Turkey with UNDP/LOTFA and other MoIA partners to build the capacity in Afghanistan. \xe2\x80\xa2 Implement the Memorandum of Understanding of academic cooperation between Ministry of Interior Affairs and Ministry of Higher Education to ensure quality education in ANP higher education institutions. \xe2\x80\xa2 Rollout the Police Master Degree in Education and Law Enforcement with American University of Afghanistan for MoIA instructors and peronnels. \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate the implementation of the Memorandum of Understanding between Ministry of Interior Affairs of Afghanistan and Ministry of Home Affairs of India on police capacity development. \xe2\x80\xa2 Deputize for the DMA and assist in managing the other directorates and commands and represent DMA in coordination meetings with MoIA leadership and International partners. \xe2\x80\xa2 Being the focal point of DMA for all international partners and other Afghan government ministries and institutions on police reform and capacity building. Overall Function: The incumbent of this position works in close collaboration and daily contact with the MoIA partners on implementation of all tasks and activities with national and international partners involved in the work of the Police Professionalization.  The advisor will continue to focus most attention on the Afghan National Police reform and capacity building at PHQ and PD levels this includes frequent travel to these provinces. The position also will support to 119 Emergency Call Center development, Police Information Desks establishment   and training at the regional level, District Safety and Security Surveys (DSSS) in the assigned provinces and Police Women\xe2\x80\x99s Councils/Family Response Units regionalisation. Deputisation functions will involve high level coordination of cross output activities, supporting MoIA staff in meetings and negotiations with third parties and assisting with the development of plans and delivery of capacity building agreements and contracts (goods and services) for MoIA education institutions. Facilitation meetings between MoIA and with senior MoIA officials and other international partners. Transfer of technical knowledge to and building of capacity MoIA/DMA related directorates and amongst individual counterparts within the MoIA namely the training and education institutions is a major criterion for judging the success of this position. Key Function: Under the direct supervision of the Deputy Minister for Administration, the incumbent will ensure the following key functions are performed to a high standard. \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage and coordinate the work of the capacity development projects and programs using MISP implementation plans as a guide to achievement of results. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide technical advise to H.E Deputy Minister for Administration on police development initiatives and plans. \xe2\x80\xa2 Arrange all meetingings for the H.E Deputy Minister for Administration with Resolute Support and other international stickholders. \xe2\x80\xa2 Help MoIA for the development and approval of revision of education policy and develop and awareness plan of the police laws and policies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate work of the DMA with other elements of education institutions and the international community in the central and provincial level. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist the MOIA and members of the UNDP project to develop and expand concepts relevant to building trust and confidence in police (taking into account the work of other national and international partners). \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate the donor meetings with the Deputy Minister and provide technical assistance in preparing the reports to H.E minister of interior affairs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the RS initiative to provide standards female training program in enhancing the existing training resources in Afghanistan to replace Sivas, Turkey basic training program. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the DMA Police Professionalisation: \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist DMA in quality assurance of the education in Afghan National Police Academy, Police Staff College and RTCs in Afghanistan. \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate liaison activities between Resolute Support and DMA relevant directorates at Provincial Police Headquarter (PPHQs) and other senior office holders for the coordination of police development initiatives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to management of technical assistance and support for all substantive work of the MoIA including major revisions police master degree program memorandum of understanding and delivery of the education for targeted MoIA instructors and personnels. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in identifying appropriate local/international development opportunities for regular capacity development under the MoIA and regional countries south-south cooperation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilated the negotiation between UNDP/LOTFA to support police capacity building programs in the regional countries. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain high level oversight and support for all DMA related programs and plans of the Police Professionalisation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Encourage the use of initiative, flexibility and enthusiasm amongst all team members and others in the Deputy Ministry for Administration. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop a supportive and inclusive working environment based on respect, trust and appreciation of diversity. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the DMA in conducting sensitive negotiations concerning police development matters and lead such negotiations where appropriate. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain a high level liaison with senior office holders of the MOIA inkling the Minister, Deputy ministers and key project contact at all levels.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the DMA through timely verbal and written briefs in relation to emerging issues within the broader police and security environment in Afghanistan.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support the development of Work Plans for the delivery of associated activities and key results necessary for achievement of capacity building oversees. \xe2\x80\xa2 Support staff in the development of implementation plans to assist in tracking progress in delivery of Plan results and prepare monthly/quarterly progress report.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Supporting DMA and other MoIA training institutions to develop an implementation plan for the MoU signed between MoIA and Ministry of Higher Education. \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with MoIA senior capacity building committee and international partners to support police stations reform and capacity building. \xe2\x80\xa2 In the absence of DMA, manage the work of police training institutions and pay regular visit to these institutions to observe the progress of the ongoing projects and provide technical assistances. \xe2\x80\xa2 Lead and provide secretarial support for national and international delegations examining police professionalization issues. IV. Impact of Results  \xe2\x80\xa2 Through exposure to contemporary project-based management activities and sound public/business administration principles, the MoIA/DMA at ANPA, PSC and RTC level, will have an enhanced capacity to fulfil its function as an ecffective training/ learning division of the ANP. \xe2\x80\xa2 This position will be a connecting hub between DMA office holders, directorates and MoIA International partners. \xe2\x80\xa2 An understanding of MoIA training and education requirements to meet current and projected police priority needs is clarified and responded to by MoIA and training institutions. \xe2\x80\xa2 MoIA training institutions have made a specific and measurable improvement in its development and career management of instructional staff. \xe2\x80\xa2 MoIA and training institutions have implemented a series of programs in support of staff development and career management for its officers in line with MoIA\xe2\x80\x99s Human Resuources policies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge Management system developed within MoIA training and education institutions. \xe2\x80\xa2 Police development plan prepared inline with MISP for MoIA/DMA training institutions. \xe2\x80\xa2 Active partnership has made between MoIA and International partners for police capacity building and development. Adviser \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor degree in, Education and social science, Journalism, public administration or any other relevant field with an understanding of normative Education System of ANP  \xe2\x80\xa2 With a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree 4 years of relevant work experience or with a master\xe2\x80\x99s degree and 3 years\xe2\x80\x99 relevant work experience. \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 3 years of progressive working experience working in the area of police Professionalisation with a special focus on police training and education. \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated knowledge of quality assurance frame work and Afghan higher education accreditation standards. \xe2\x80\xa2 Having knowledge of Afghan (civilian and military) higher education law.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Good knowledge of developing progress report quarterly/annual. \xe2\x80\xa2 Substantive experience of working with Afghan police in the areas of civilianization. \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated experience of organizing surveys, policy research and analysis and developing high-quality briefing note/policy brief for senior leaderships. \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in working with RS, UN entities, international organisations, in the relevant field of police training and education is highly desirable. \xe2\x80\xa2 Computer literate, fully competent in MS-Office based applications, and internet research. \xe2\x80\xa2 Highly proficiency in English - written and spoken; \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in Dari and/or Pashto.'

b'Proposal Writer Job SummaryA proposal writer duties involve researching, writing and organizing ideas, conducting interviews, reviewing products or services, creating strategies, working with graphic designers and presenting proposals.  Prepares business proposals, business plans, quotations, by determining concept; gathering and formatting information; writing drafts; obtaining approvals. she will participating in key review meetings / final document review, content sign off and document production. Experience of coordinating and updating a knowledgebase system is beneficial.Excellent research skills and the ability to write persuasively and articulately are essential. \xe2\x80\xa2 Determines proposal concept by identifying and clarifying opportunities and needs; studying requests for proposal (RFPs), request for quotation (RFQs), ITBs and attending strategy meetings. \xe2\x80\xa2 Meets proposal/quotation deadline by establishing priorities and target dates for information gathering, writing, review, and approval; entering and monitoring tracking data; coordinating requirements with contributors; contributing proposal status information to review meetings; transmitting proposals. \xe2\x80\xa2 Gathers proposal/quotation information by identifying sources of information; coordinating submissions and collections; identifying and communicating risks associated with proposals. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develops proposal by assembling information including project nature, objectives/outcomes/deliverables, implementation, methods, timetable, staffing, budget, standards of performance, and evaluation; writing, revising, and editing drafts including executive summaries, conclusions, and organization credentials. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares presentation by evaluating text, graphics, and binding and coordinate printing. \xe2\x80\xa2 Obtains approvals by reviewing proposal with key providers and project managers. \xe2\x80\xa2 Improves proposal-writing results by evaluating and re-designing processes, approach, coordination, and boilerplate; implementing changes. \xe2\x80\xa2 Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; maintaining personal networks. \xe2\x80\xa2 Accomplishes organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments. \xe2\x80\xa2 Concept development of the organization \xe2\x80\xa2  Lead and/or run the proposal creation process for the responses of MEC developments in conjunction with RFPs and RFIs (requests for information) received. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and maintain compelling, persuasive RFP content \xe2\x80\xa2 Build compliant outlines for RFPs/RFIs \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in developing and maintaining a proposal/Business plan content library \xe2\x80\xa2 Work with the proposal team to support the sales team with client-facing, written communications \xe2\x80\xa2 Review proposals/Business plans to ensure a precise product ready for client review; proofread for content, grammar, style, formatting; edit, organize, and pull attachments and exhibits \xe2\x80\xa2 Consistently implement MEC brand messaging, including tone, style, and theme, within all responses. Effectively demonstrate and promote the MEC value proposition \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with MEC\xe2\x80\x99 subject matter experts to inform responses to RFPs and/or to support the maintenance of content organized in knowledge base, including its technical accuracy \xe2\x80\xa2 Write clear, persuasive, and articulate proposal sections; translate technical and other ideas into easily understandable text; rewrite and review proposal sections and related proposal documents. \xe2\x80\xa2 Under the direction of the Line Manager, interview technical SMEs, Program Managers, Task Leads, and other technical personnel to collect technical and methodology information and incorporate that information into developing winning proposal content \xe2\x80\xa2 Thoroughly review all proposal response volumes and sections, ensuring written consistency (one voice) in the final proposal after review of various team and technical inputs \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain and update proposal archives/databases, boilerplate past performance documents, and repository \xe2\x80\xa2 Rewrite technical material and coordinates with technical personnel to ensure accuracy \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate with functional areas, business areas, subcontractors and others to research and develop data required for technical proposal development. \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform searches on reusable material and support data calls as requested by capture/proposal team \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage past performance questionnaires (PPQs) \xe2\x80\xa2 Lead formatting, editing, production, and submission activities \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in the creation of graphics, covers, spines, labels, and org/flow charts \xe2\x80\xa2 Develops and maintains a strong understanding of investigator research programs across the institution. \xe2\x80\xa2 Researches governmental funding agencies and private foundations including funding priorities, pay lines, and awards to advise investigators on funding fit and development of successful proposals \xe2\x80\xa2 Researches funding opportunities and disseminates targeted funding announcements to investigators and departments \xe2\x80\xa2 Edits proposals for readability including structure, usage, syntax, tone, active voice, and formatting \xe2\x80\xa2 Develops budget justifications, writes non-scientific narrative such as facilities, institutional resources, and other allied sections of large applications \xe2\x80\xa2 Develops templates, boilerplate narrative, and related faculty grant writing resources and tools \xe2\x80\xa2 Draft letters, Memorandum of Understanding, and other institutional communication as needed to support applications and faculty nominations. \xe2\x80\xa2 Manages multiple projects and work flow to ensure on-time submissions \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform all other duties as assigned and required. Technical  Proposal Writer needs at least a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Marketing, Economics, Journalism, Communications, Public Relations or related field (MBA preferred). At least 5 years of experience with bachelor and 3years with master\xe2\x80\x99degree directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified  \xe2\x80\xa2 Overall 5-15 yrs experience.  \xe2\x80\xa2 8+ years in proposal writing and concept development  \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with scheduler programs such as Primavera and MS Project manager is a plus'

b'Social Safeguards Specialist Job SummaryThe social safeguards specialist shall be responsible for: a) being able to fulfil the duties and mainstreaming Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF), Resettlement Policy Framework (RPF) b) identify the potential social safeguards issues within the project activities; c) provide technical assistance on mitigation strategies for the potential negative social impacts; d) identify training needs at different levels of HEDP project and of clients and advising on how to fulfil the ESMF  and RPF and citizen Engagement requirements; e) Coordinating environmental and social commitments and initiatives with relevant government agencies. The salary for this position is based on NTA salary scale Grade C. 1) Ensure that the project activities follow the guidelines of the ESMF and RPF into overall project operations.  2) Prepare screening list through field observations in order to identify the potential social safeguards issues and prepare a schematic diagram/base map of each scheme and mark the socio-environmental features of the scheme on the diagram. 3) Prepare the site-specific ESMPs based on environmental and social screening survey and field observations considering the ESMF guidelines, the ESMPs will include Monitoring Plan (MPs). 4) Guided by the ESMF and RPF, conduct environmental and social monitoring of the sub-project in association with engineering staff and ensure the implementation of recommendations prescribed in the ESMPs. 5) Ensure that the land acquisitions approaches are in full compliance with project ESMF and PRF and ensure proper recoding of land documents and prepare abbreviated Resettlement Action Plan if required.  6) To provide technical assistance to clients on mitigation strategies and requirements for the potential negative social impacts. 7) Provide training to HEDP Project\xe2\x80\x99s staff on overall ESMF and RPF trainings and awareness raising of contractors on their immediate requirements to ensure compliance with ESMF and RPF.   8) Support the project team on implementation of Citizen Engagement mechanisms and ensure the delivery of satisfaction surveys with the level of affordability and reliability of services. 9) Ensure implementation of Grievance Redress Mechanism which will include the grievance handling procedures, channels, grievance database in order to ensure that all registered complains are addressed properly.   10) Prepare Grievance Redress Mechanism training materials which to be disseminated among the project staff and project beneficiaries and establish functional GRM system. 11) Conduct training and awareness raising of the project staff and contractors on GRM utilization and functionally. 12) Prepare safeguard training plan which will cover the social safeguard, environmental and GRM aspects. 13) Ensure that grievance redress mechanism (GRM) is functional and its outcome is   included in reporting system. 14) Conduct a cross-checking and vetting of specification conflicts, tender, and contract documents, making them suitably orientated towards the social needs of the residents in the area. 15) Help strengthen capacity for managing Social concerns of the relevant staff and the contractors working with HEDP project. 16) Develop safeguards reporting formats and maintaining social records on established formats. 17) Develop and submit the safeguards monitoring reports to project director on monthly basis; which to be reflected in the progress report to the World Bank. 18) Contribute to capacity building for project staff and partner agencies, training and other dissemination efforts on social safeguards. 19) Addressing the social inclusion of the poor, vulnerable and excluded groups/students and ensuring compliance with social safeguards are included in regular reporting mechanisms. 20) Work closely with environmental safeguards colleague(s) and maintain close linkage for flow of information between the World Bank and the project regarding safeguard issues in project implementation.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Technical  \xe2\x80\xa2 Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in the Social Sciences or Social Development from a recognized university.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Good knowledge of computer packages, including MS Power Point, MS Word and Ms. Excel is required. \xe2\x80\xa2 Full working knowledge (in writing and orally) of English and Pashto and/or Dari.'

b'Technical Adviser & Quality Controller Job SummaryTechnical Adviser & Quality controller main duties & responsibilities is to perform diagnostic assessment, coordination with technical & management team and overall supervision of general repair job. On job technical training is another key roles to be executed based on requirement and regular explanation of the most difficult task to technicians either theoretical or practical within training center should be conducted. Overall TA/QC is the technical key staff to resolve any technical issue and cooperate with technical and Management team to retain customer\xe2\x80\x99s satisfaction. 1. Perform diagnosis as per Service Advisor request at reception stalls. 2. Carry out more technically difficult jobs and provide supervision or support to technicians. 3. General Repair list re-check, confirm and submission to Service Advisor. 4. Perform visual inspection upon completion of each job. 5. Report FTR (Field Technical Report) to Service Advisor in case of any. 6. Perform every task of Foreman/Controller on his absence. 7. Arrange work schedule with service advisor and parts dept. 8. Final Road Test will be performed to fully assure himself before handing over the vehicle 9. Confirm completion of job to service advisor. 10. Provide technical explanation or advice when required to service advisor/customer. 11. Technical training should be conducted for technicians (theoretical & Practical) 12. Periodical report to Aftersales Manager 13. Any additional task assign by Aftersales ManagerTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Technical  1. Certification of Diagnostic Technician (DT) / Diagnostic Master Technician (DMT) or equivalent'

b'Electrical Engineer \xe2\x80\x93 Officer Job Summary \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparation of superior quality electrical construction documents including drawings, specifications, and reports for buildings in retail, restaurant, office, multifamily residential, and institutional market sectors \xe2\x80\xa2 Design power, lighting, fire alarm, and telecommunications plans including all associated circuitry, details, one line diagrams, and specifications \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform photometric calculations, load calculations, fault current, and any other calculations required to support electrical design \xe2\x80\xa2 Review electrical documents for areas of conflict with all building electrical systems \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with equipment vendors and manufacturers\xe2\x80\x99 representatives for selection and specification of appropriate equipment \xe2\x80\xa2 Play an active role in project meetings with clients and colleagues \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide mentoring and guidance for colleagues \xe2\x80\xa2 To market and promote services offered by Fundy Engineering in the field of Electrical Engineering. \xe2\x80\xa2 To attain copies of \xe2\x80\x9cRequest for Proposals\xe2\x80\x9d and prepare documentation and Fee Estimates for these proposal call-ups. \xe2\x80\xa2 To establish the needs of the client and to coordinate with other disciplines and office personnel to ensure that these requirements are met. \xe2\x80\xa2 To assist and mentor support staff in the fundamentals of Electrical design, calculations and preparation of construction documentation \xe2\x80\xa2 To provide technical assistance and respond to contractor\xe2\x80\x99s inquiries that relate to electrical part of construction projects. \xe2\x80\xa2 To prepare technical reports, construction cost estimates and cost analysis. \xe2\x80\xa2 To coordinate and schedule / plan the projects with support staff to ensure timely completion. \xe2\x80\xa2 To respect company values and policies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare material cost and timing estimates, reports, and design specifications for electrical building systems and equipment. \xe2\x80\xa2 Inspect the installation, modification, testing, and operation of electrical equipment \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare contract documents and evaluate tenders for construction or maintenance. \xe2\x80\xa2 Supervise technicians, technologists, programmers, analysts, and other engineers. \xe2\x80\xa2 Checks cable laying and cable identification.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Checks power transformers, switchboard, accumulator battery, sockets outlet, lighting system.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Performs visual inspections, dimensional test, checks rating and material for connection. \xe2\x80\xa2 Performs tests of continuity, insulation resistance.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Performs test communication functionalities.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Verify special processes and the relevant workers\xe2\x80\x99 qualifications.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Witness the tests, controls and inspections carried out.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Check conformity with the Quality Control Plan, obtain the relevant documentation, check procedures and equipment to be used in tests, controls and inspections, manage documents certifying tests, controls and inspections.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure the correct implementation of the approved Inspection Test Plan. Electrical Engineering \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree in Electrical Engineering with 5 years of related experience in handling USACE projects or overall experience of not less than 8 years in the field of construction management and supervision. Prior international donors experience is preferred. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge and ability to interpret engineering drawings and implement the field works. \xe2\x80\xa2 Sufficient knowledge of USACE rules, regulations, and procedures desired. \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in English. Have good command of English language both written and spoken. Candidates who do not have sufficient English language knowledge will be disqualified.'

b"Economist Job SummaryBACKGROUND AND GENERAL DESCRIPTION The MTI practice is looking for an outstanding Country Economist for Afghanistan, to be based in Kabul. The MTI Team in Afghanistan is responsible for macro-economic analysis, economic and fiscal policy dialogue, technical advice and capacity building support in the areas of macro-economic and fiscal management, and budget reform in close collaboration with the Government of Afghanistan. In addition to regular economic monitoring mandate, we are managing a rich program consisting two policy-based financing operations, including the ARTF Incentive Program, and two large, complex programmatic analytic work programs which include the delivery of analytical and advisory products as well as technical assistance and training activities. All of our tasks are cross-sectoral in nature and are integral to the policy dialogue of the country program. Within the country program, we manage half of the ARTF resources through the Incentive Program. The selected candidate will the core member of the Afghanistan MTI team and will be expected to contribute to the analytic and operational work of the team. He or she will report to the MTI Practice Manager covering South Asia, who is based in Bangkok. The Country Economist will: \xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to MTI GP\xe2\x80\x99s Analytical and Advisory Activities (AAA) and Technical Assistance (TA) in the areas of macroeconomic and fiscal management, macro modelling and data work, and economics of the public sector; \xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to the design of the operational and analytical work in alignment with the growth and poverty alleviation objectives of the country; \xe2\x80\xa2 Establish partnerships with other bilateral and multilateral agencies, increasing cooperation and leveraging Bank resources in analytical and operational work; \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring and assessing the macroeconomic and sectoral reform developments in Afghanistan and contribute to the World Bank\xe2\x80\x99s ongoing policy dialogue and lending programs; \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s dialogue with senior government officials; \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare periodic reports and notes on economic issues for Afghanistan and the South Asia Region; \xe2\x80\xa2 Serve as a task leader or a team member for country-specific financing operations and/or analytical and advisory services; \xe2\x80\xa2 Collect, analyze and maintain economic and financial data and information related to Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s economy, and communicate findings in concise form, namely through statistical tables and charts, and short analytical notes.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop, update and manage statistical models for specific programs or projects.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute chapters, sections, and annexes for World Bank\xe2\x80\x99s reports and documents; and \xe2\x80\xa2 Work with colleagues in other sectors (human development, private sector development, infrastructure etc) as required; and support the general work of the World Bank office in Afghanistan. Economic Growth Selection Criteria \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum of a Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in economics (PhD preferred), with 5 years of experience. A PhD would be considered as equivalent to 3 years of work experience; \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong background in macro modelling, public finance and macro policy analysis; \xe2\x80\xa2 Close familiarity with Afghanistan's development problems and issues and some research and working experience in the above areas; \xe2\x80\xa2 Familiarity with relevant local institutions, economic research work and the sources of economic data in Afghanistan; \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent analytical and communications skills and ability to write clearly and concisely; \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively in a team-based environment and under tight time constraints; \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to provide the full range of operational assistance with independent responsibility. Demonstrated ability to carry out research and analytical tasks and to contribute to resolution of sector and country issues. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to build effective working relations with clients and colleagues; \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent knowledge of English is essential; fluency in Dari is required; fluency in Pashto is preferred."

b'\xda\xa9\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xd8\xb4\xd9\x86\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb3 \xd8\xaa\xd8\xaf\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xda\xa9\xd8\xa7\xd8\xaa Job SummaryThe following tasks to be undertaken by the National Procurement Specialist: 1. Preparation of reports on shortlist for EOIs and Bid evaluation and other purchasing documents for technical/financial/commercial purposes. 2. Coordinate with technical departments to verify technical specifications, employer\xe2\x80\x99s requirements, standards, policies, rules and regulations, etc. 3. Complete the technical evaluation committee (TEC) and financial evaluation committee (FEC) reports for approval of DABS management. 4. Correspond with the bidders for clarifications on all under-bids, pre-award, post-award, under-evaluation and rejected/accepted procurements. 5.   Preparing weekly, monthly and quarterly progress reports and submitting them to DABS management. 6. Recommend changes in final BER and shortlist  suggesting  suitable alternatives if it is in the best interests of DABS. 7. Participate in contract negotiations on behalf of DABS.  8. Ensure that procurement guidelines are systematically used and implemented. 9. Ensuring that all evaluations  are conducted in accordance with respective national/international donors requirements & guidelines, and Afghanistan\xe2\x80\x99s procurements requirements & guidelines 10. Confirm that evaluations are conducted taking into account the timeline given for such purpose in PPL and Procurement Procedures.  11.  Any other task as assigned by the director.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Economic Growth 1. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree  preferably in  economics, supply chain, engineering or any other related field from an accredited university. Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree is preferred. 2. Having at least three years\xe2\x80\x99 experience for of public procurement with NGOs, UN agencies, government or national/international donor funded projects out of which a minimum of 3 years should be in the capacity of Procurement Specialist or Senior Procurement Officer.  3. Incumbent shall be able to operate MS office package (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook) and windows.'

b'Communication and Advocacy Officer Job Summary Under the overall authority of the Director of UNESCO Kabul office and overall supervision of Chief of Education Unit, and the direct supervision of the ELA Programme Manager, the incumbent shall perform the following functions:  Provide leadership and support to the Education unit in the area of communication and advocacy to ensure that effective communication strategies have been in put in place to support education programmes especially the ELA programme;  Coordinate with programmes team and Ministry of Education counterparts to ensure communication and advocacy activities remain relevant to the education programmes in accordance with both UNESCO and DMoEL strategic plan. UNESCO being the lead technical agency working with the DMOEL;  Facilitate capacity development of the DMoEL staff in the areas of communication and advocacy and conduct regular communications needs assessments for UNESCO Kabul\xe2\x80\x99s Education unit in the area of advocacy and communications;  Collaborate with UNESCO ELA staff, relevant government departments, officials and other partners to identify advocacy materials and properly communicate it via UNESCO Afghanistan ELA website and other outlets;  Identification of storylines for publications and drafting of substantive articles contributing to UNESCO websites and debates on key development issues. This may involve regular travel to the field.  Participate in UNESCO supported events, including launches, workshops, training, programmatic activities and others and prepare press releases and storylines.  Develop/produce communication and advocacy materials for awareness-raising and communication for and about results, including briefing materials and press releases in coordination with program team and management.  Provide technical leadership in writing, editing and arranging production of newsletters, in-house magazines, pamphlets and brochures, and their dissemination;  Manage the communication and advocacy activities of Education unit, such as drafting concept notes, terms of references, supporting design of print and visual media material, planning media engagement, maintenance of regular contact with printers, photographers and other vendors to ensure production and dissemination;  Prepare and update the contents for the web and social media sites in coordination with program staff and management;  Organize roundtable discussions, press conferences, briefing sessions, interviews, launches, etc. in consultation with UNESCO Senior management, if need arises; UNESCO is committed to promoting geographical distribution and gender equality within its Secretariat. Therefore, women candidates are strongly encouraged to apply, as are nationals from non- and under-represented Member States. Persons with disabilities equally are encouraged to apply. Worldwide mobility is required as staff members must be ready to serve in other duty stations in accordance with UNESCO\xe2\x80\x99s geographical mobility policy. UNESCO applies a zero tolerance policy against all forms of harassment. UNESCO DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE AT ANY STAGE OF THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS.  Prepare donor reports, civic education and community awareness where appropriate to support projects, as well as responses to inquiries for public information materials and also engage on social media in consultation with supervisor;  Provide trainings, consultancy and advice to UNESCO Education unit staff and its partners on communications for development. Communication Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in media relations, journalism, communication, public relations, publishing development or related field  At least 5 years of relevant experience at the national or international level in public relations, communications or advocacy. Previous experience with a multilateral or international organization is helpful but not mandatory.  Experience with advocacy on education issues is required.  Prior experience in UN system will be an advantage.  Experience with the full Microsoft Office software package is required, while experience with InDesign and Photoshop would be an asset.  Good knowledge and experience in handling of web-based management systems would also be an asset.  Experience using social media for organizational advocacy and awareness-raising is required.  Must have ability of travelling to provinces and districts all over Afghanistan.  Experience in capacity building and institutional strengthening of Government institutions is an asset'

b'Training and Capacity Building of Female Nurses to Enter into Labor Market Job SummaryTraining Summary Female Nurses who are graduated recently and don\xe2\x80\x99t have the required professional skills. This training is a subset of nursing skill training which contains theoretical and practical instructions applied for 10 weeks, 5 days in each week and 4 hours in each day. Standard Curriculum for the training is developed under the supervision of international advisors and Qualified Lecturers. The Training will be held  at Moraa Educational Complex located in Afshar behind Red Crescent Main Office with the cooperation of USAID | Promote \xe2\x80\x93 Women in the Economy for 60 female nurses who are graduated recently and don\xe2\x80\x99t have the required professional skills. The goal for this program is to fill the gap that what nurses achieve in university education life and what skills they need in a real workplace environment. This program will make 60 female nurses able to find a good experience that is necessary for their employment. This training will enable the trainees to find the experience and empowerment for further development through a valid certificate considered by USAID and the Moraa Educational Complex after completion of the course.  Most of the cost will be covered by WIE/MEC and the trainees who successfully passed the interview have to pay 3,400 AFA at the beginning of the course.  Health/Medical '

b'District Health Promotion (Community Dialogue) Assistant Job SummaryThe District Health Promotion (Community Dialogue) Assistant (DHPA) will be an FHI 360 employee working and placed at the HEMAYAT Provincial Office based in focused districts of Kandahar (Panjwayee and Daman). The District Health Promotion (Community Dialogue) Assistant will be, responsible for facilitating implementation and monitoring of community dialogue plus (CD+) activity within the donor-approved work plan. S/he will report directly to the provincial CBHC Officer and the CD+ Focal Point in Demand Generation Team at Kabul. 1. Participate in TOT of Community Dialogue Plus (CD+) in the center of the respective province  2. Adapt/ Adopt training Package of CD+ according to the context of the designated districts.   3. Assist HEMAYAT Provincial CBHC Officer in selection of the villages for the implementation of CD+.   4. Actively participate and implement together with Trainer and CBHC Officer in the first village and then implement in the other villages individually.   5. Facilitate dialogue sessions in the selected villages to identify main barriers to RMNCH services and find out the root causes of the problems.   6. Facilitate the dialogue in the selected villages to design local solutions and develop action plan to implement the solutions.   7. Actively follow up with CD+ committee to ensure implementation of CD+ Action plan and track and review change in the indicators and report of the of the CD+ sessions.  8. Assist Provincial CBHC Officer in orientation of district and health facility staff and heads of selected villages.  9. Facilitate monthly and quarterly review meetings and update provincial and central team from the progress.   10. Assist provincial team to select villages and teams to be recognized on the day of celebration.  11. Any other health promotion and community based health activities assigned from the provincial CBHC and or central DG team. Health/Medical 1. Graduated from recognized high school.  2. One-year experience of work with community.  3. Experience with health surveys and campaign.   4. More active and enthusiastic to work in community.   5. Willingness and ability to travel to targeted areas.'

b'Programme Associate (Nutrition) Job SummaryAfghanistan experiences high rates of undernutrition. While significant progress has been made in the past 15 years, the prevalence of stunting in children under 5 years is almost 41 percent at the national level which is classified as very high according to World Health Organization (WHO) thresholds. The situation is even more serious at the provincial level, with stunting prevalence of 60\xe2\x80\x9370 percent in some provinces. The prevalence of wasting among children under 5 years is 9.5 percent but this national rate masks large differences at disaggregated levels. In eight provinces, global acute malnutrition rates exceed 15 percent, the WHO threshold for an emergency situation. Children under 5 years, especially boys, are particularly vulnerable to undernutrition, as are adolescent girls and pregnant and lactating women and girls (PLWG). Recently WFP Afghanistan developed a 4 year Country Strategic Plan (CSP) that was developed through a series of internal and external consultations and with a focus on identifying how to help the country achieve the SDG 2 target on ending malnutrition, WFP\xe2\x80\x99s Strategic Outcome 3 focuses on preventing and treating undernutrition among vulnerable people by following a life-cycle approach. For prevention, it concentrates on provinces with a prevalence of stunting of more than 40 percent in children aged 6\xe2\x80\x9359 months. For treatment, it targets provinces with wasting rates of more than 15 percent, or of more than 10 percent with aggravating factors, and emergency situations where there is potential for a rapid rise in global acute malnutrition. In line with the life-cycle approach, and informed by gender, age and protection analyses, the immediate nutrition needs of nutritionally vulnerable people will be met while longer-term nutrition-related roles and responsibilities are addressed in a gender-transformative manner. This outcome will be achieved through the following two outputs: \xe2\x80\xa2Vulnerable people throughout the lifecycle \xe2\x80\x93 children aged 6\xe2\x80\x9359 months, schoolchildren, adolescent girls, and pregnant and lactating women and girls \xe2\x80\x93 receive nutrition services and appropriate specialized nutritious foods in order to prevent and treat malnutrition. \xe2\x80\xa2Vulnerable people and their wider communities receive effective social behaviour change communication (SBCC) in order to prevent and treat malnutrition and contribute to gender equality. Programme Assistants for Nutrition to be responsible for planning, implementation and reporting on all activities under Strategic Outcome 3 \xe2\x80\x93 Nutrition throughout the lifecycle. The SO 3 \xe2\x80\x93 Nutrition Programme Assistants will be based in the WFP Kandahar Sub-office, reporting to the Sub-Office Head of Programme but with technical oversight from the SO 3 Outcome Manager in the WFP Afghanistan Country Office.  He/she will provide operational and administrative support to all activities under SO3 including: \xe2\x80\xa2Nutrition specific activities for treatment of moderate acute malnutrition in children 6-59 months and pregnant and lactating women and girls (PLWG), blanket supplementary feeding programmes (BSFP) to prevent nutrition deterioration during emergencies, and \xe2\x80\xa2Nutrition sensitive programmes such as social behavior change communication (SBCC) and other activities to prevent stunting.  In Kandahar, the Programme Assistant will also be responsible for school based nutrition activities.  Main activities are highlighted below \xe2\x80\xa2Actively contribute for development of SO -3 (Nutrition treatment and prevention and school feeding) component of implementation plan for the relevant field office and ensure that all nutrition and school feeding project proposals submitted to the Field Office Project Technical Review Committee (PTRC) have gone through an effective and efficient review process in consultation with CO technical unit \xe2\x80\xa2Responsible for preparation of all nutrition and school-feeding field level agreements with cooperating partners. \xe2\x80\xa2Provide required inputs to SO-3 Outcome Manager in CO for donor proposal development in coordination with Head of Field Office; \xe2\x80\xa2Assist in identification, development and management of potential partnerships for joint programming implementation and strengthen existing partnerships with concerned UN agencies, national & international NGOs, government key counterparts and communities; \xe2\x80\xa2Coordinate and communicate with relevant local partners, relevant government entities, agencies, NGOs and government institutions to perform accurate analyses of nutrition data at field office level and to ensure effective and efficient delivery of nutrition/school feeding interventions; \xe2\x80\xa2Develop and strengthen required capacity of relevant CPs\xe2\x80\x99 staff, government staff, WFP staff and PAT monitors, through conducting training needs assessment followed by relevant trainings, on the job instructions and other initiatives; \xe2\x80\xa2Support development of comprehensive monitoring plan for nutrition and school-feeding activities at field office level including the relevant partners and ensure use of appropriate monitoring tools/checklists by all parties; \xe2\x80\xa2Regularly review and analyse monitoring findings from partners and third party monitors, summarize key issue in a tracking sheet and share recommendations for improvement and follow-up on its implementation; \xe2\x80\xa2Conduct monitoring/supervision visits to nutrition and school-feeding programmes sites; \xe2\x80\xa2Regular review and analysis of nutrition and school feeding reports, provide regular feedback to partners, raise issues of concern to higher-level management and, collaborate with CO M&E, investigate any irregularity or data inaccuracy; \xe2\x80\xa2Any other duty as requiredTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Health/Medical Education: University degree in health or nutrition is required; additional degree or diploma in Business Administration (Management) is desirable. Experience:  \xe2\x80\xa2At least 3 years experiences in Health or Nutrition program management (especially humanitarian response) including planning, coordination, implementation and monitoring. \xe2\x80\xa2Experience in direct implementation of supplementary and therapeutic feeding programs (IMAM), micronutrient supplementation, maternal health and nutrition programs and multi-sectorial responses addressing the underlying causes of under nutrition. \xe2\x80\xa2Experiences in School Feeding Programme. \xe2\x80\xa2Experience of working with UN or NGOs in Afghanistan.    Language: Fluency (level C) in English language and in Dari and/or Pashto;'

b'Programme Associate (Nutrition) Job SummaryAfghanistan experiences high rates of undernutrition. While significant progress has been made in the past 15 years, the prevalence of stunting in children under 5 years is almost 41 percent at the national level which is classified as very high according to World Health Organization (WHO) thresholds. The situation is even more serious at the provincial level, with stunting prevalence of 60\xe2\x80\x9370 percent in some provinces. The prevalence of wasting among children under 5 years is 9.5 percent but this national rate masks large differences at disaggregated levels. In eight provinces, global acute malnutrition rates exceed 15 percent, the WHO threshold for an emergency situation. Children under 5 years, especially boys, are particularly vulnerable to undernutrition, as are adolescent girls and pregnant and lactating women and girls (PLWG). Recently WFP Afghanistan developed a 4 year Country Strategic Plan (CSP) that was developed through a series of internal and external consultations and with a focus on identifying how to help the country achieve the SDG 2 target on ending malnutrition, WFP\xe2\x80\x99s Strategic Outcome 3 focuses on preventing and treating undernutrition among vulnerable people by following a life-cycle approach. For prevention, it concentrates on provinces with a prevalence of stunting of more than 40 percent in children aged 6\xe2\x80\x9359 months. For treatment, it targets provinces with wasting rates of more than 15 percent, or of more than 10 percent with aggravating factors, and emergency situations where there is potential for a rapid rise in global acute malnutrition. In line with the life-cycle approach, and informed by gender, age and protection analyses, the immediate nutrition needs of nutritionally vulnerable people will be met while longer-term nutrition-related roles and responsibilities are addressed in a gender-transformative manner. This outcome will be achieved through the following two outputs: \xe2\x80\xa2Vulnerable people throughout the lifecycle \xe2\x80\x93 children aged 6\xe2\x80\x9359 months, schoolchildren, adolescent girls, and pregnant and lactating women and girls \xe2\x80\x93 receive nutrition services and appropriate specialized nutritious foods in order to prevent and treat malnutrition. \xe2\x80\xa2Vulnerable people and their wider communities receive effective social behaviour change communication (SBCC) in order to prevent and treat malnutrition and contribute to gender equality. Programme Assistants for Nutrition to be responsible for planning, implementation and reporting on all activities under Strategic Outcome 3 \xe2\x80\x93 Nutrition throughout the lifecycle. The SO 3 \xe2\x80\x93 Nutrition Programme Assistants will be based in the WFP Faizabad Sub-offices, reporting to the Sub-Office Head of Programme, but with technical oversight from the SO 3 Outcome Manager in the WFP Afghanistan Country Office.  He/she will provide operational and administrative support to all activities under SO3 including: \xe2\x80\xa2Nutrition specific activities for treatment of moderate acute malnutrition in children 6-59 months and pregnant and lactating women and girls (PLWG), blanket supplementary feeding programmes (BSFP) to prevent nutrition deterioration during emergencies, and \xe2\x80\xa2Nutrition sensitive programmes such as social behavior change communication (SBCC) and other activities to prevent stunting.   Main activities are highlighted below \xe2\x80\xa2Actively contribute for development of SO -3 (Nutrition treatment and prevention and school feeding) component of implementation plan for the relevant field office and ensure that all nutrition and school feeding project proposals submitted to the Field Office Project Technical Review Committee (PTRC) have gone through an effective and efficient review process in consultation with CO technical unit \xe2\x80\xa2Responsible for preparation of all nutrition and school-feeding field level agreements with cooperating partners. \xe2\x80\xa2Provide required inputs to SO-3 Outcome Manager in CO for donor proposal development in coordination with Head of Field Office; \xe2\x80\xa2Assist in identification, development and management of potential partnerships for joint programming implementation and strengthen existing partnerships with concerned UN agencies, national & international NGOs, government key counterparts and communities; \xe2\x80\xa2Coordinate and communicate with relevant local partners, relevant government entities, agencies, NGOs and government institutions to perform accurate analyses of nutrition data at field office level and to ensure effective and efficient delivery of nutrition/school feeding interventions; \xe2\x80\xa2Develop and strengthen required capacity of relevant CPs\xe2\x80\x99 staff, government staff, WFP staff and PAT monitors, through conducting training needs assessment followed by relevant trainings, on the job instructions and other initiatives; \xe2\x80\xa2Support development of comprehensive monitoring plan for nutrition and school-feeding activities at field office level including the relevant partners and ensure use of appropriate monitoring tools/checklists by all parties; \xe2\x80\xa2Regularly review and analyse monitoring findings from partners and third party monitors, summarize key issue in a tracking sheet and share recommendations for improvement and follow-up on its implementation; \xe2\x80\xa2Conduct monitoring/supervision visits to nutrition and school-feeding programmes sites; \xe2\x80\xa2Regular review and analysis of nutrition and school feeding reports, provide regular feedback to partners, raise issues of concern to higher-level management and, collaborate with CO M&E, investigate any irregularity or data inaccuracy; \xe2\x80\xa2Any other duty as requiredTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Health/Medical Education: University degree in health or nutrition is required; additional degree or diploma in Business Administration (Management) is desirable. Experience:  \xe2\x80\xa2At least 3 years experiences in Health or Nutrition program management (especially humanitarian response) including planning, coordination, implementation and monitoring. \xe2\x80\xa2Experience in direct implementation of supplementary and therapeutic feeding programs (IMAM), micronutrient supplementation, maternal health and nutrition programs and multi-sectorial responses addressing the underlying causes of under nutrition. \xe2\x80\xa2Experiences in School Feeding Programme. \xe2\x80\xa2Experience of working with UN or NGOs in Afghanistan. b'Maternal Health Products Senior  Officer Job SummaryUnder the direct supervision of  Social Marketing Manager the incumbent will manage ASMO maternal health products specific activities, including  brand development; provider training, development/execution of creative strategy; oversee advertising production, media buys, promotions/trade shows, market research/intelligence, and new product development \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in developing/implementing a cohesive product marketing strategy across the maternal health products. \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate/coordinate new product development process with relevant department inside ASMO and MoPH    \xe2\x80\xa2 Lead partnerships with external vendors, especially creative agencies, Communications/production agencies and media companies on the design, development and broadcast of product specific campaigns.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist social marketing manager in developing product-wise budget Work in close collaboration with other departments (sales, M&E, procurement) to ensure smooth implementation of maternal  health products work plan \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct/facilitate trainings/workshops for private sector health providers (Obe/Gyn pharmacists/outlet owners) on maternal health products  \xe2\x80\xa2 Hold orientation sessions for sales/ promotion team on family planning & maternal health products to upgrade their knowledge on the products \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee family planning & maternal health products marketing activities at the field and provide support to sales executive in marketing/detailing of maternal health products \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in sales team to conduct regional sales workshop for wholesalers and retailers on maternal health products \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop/Adopt curriculum and job aids on required family planning & maternal health products. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist marketing and M&E teams in conducting market assessment and pretest of print/promotion materials for family planning & maternal health products  \xe2\x80\xa2 Attend RMNCAH and FP meeting at MoPH. Health/Medical \xe2\x80\xa2 MD specialized in gynecology obstetrics and/or public health. Master degree is preferred. \xe2\x80\xa2  At least 5 years in maternal health programs with national/international organizations. Experience in family planning methods & counseling is strongly preferred'

b'EMERGENCY-NUTRITION-HEALTH NURSE Job SummaryObjective 1: Providing preventive and curative health care to SC admitted patients  Objective 2: Managing the premises, medicines and medical equipment Objective 3.  Communication and teamwork Objective 4: Recording and Reporting Objective 1: Provide Treatment for acute malnourish Under 5  A) Admissions and FU of eligible children U5  \xef\x82\xa7\tIdentify beneficiaries at risk; \xef\x82\xa7\tManage the medical examination at admission stage: validate admission of beneficiaries in OTP \xef\x82\xa7\tRefer severe acutely malnourished beneficiaries with medical complications to Therapeutic Feeding Units          (TFU);  \xef\x82\xa7\tEnsure the medical examination including childhood illness of beneficiaries at each visit in centre; \xef\x82\xa7\tCheck vaccinations and refer to appropriate health facilities when required; \xef\x82\xa7\tAdminister the appropriate medication; \xef\x82\xa7\tEnsure nutritional follow up of the beneficiaries  \xef\x82\xa7\tIdentify those beneficiaries who do not respond to the treatment and manage their follow up; \xef\x82\xa7\tRecord information on the beneficiary card. Treatment provided should be recorded, as well as relevant          comments;  \xef\x82\xa7\tEnsure medical examination at discharge: validate the discharge upon the status of the beneficiaries;  \xef\x82\xa7\tCheck that the criteria  of discharge are met and that the immunization is satisfactory (after prior referral)                AT discharge  \xef\x82\xa7\tCheck if all the procedures completed before discharge (anthropometric measurements, medical and          nutritional treatment, systematic treatment, and health and nutrition educations). \xef\x82\xa7\tRecord all the necessary information on the registration book and card for each beneficiary.         D) Health and nutrition educations \xef\x82\xa7\tProvide health and nutrition educations to the caregivers and beneficiaries on (breastfeeding,          complementary feeding, and hygiene, care of pregnant and lactating women, prevention of illness). Objective 2 : IMNCI : Diagnostic and treat based on the guideline -\tDetermine if this is an initial or follow up visit for this problem -\tAssess the different sign and determine the main symptom -\tIf needs to do referral  -\tGive the treatment -\tCounsel the caretaker -\tFill up the follow up card, registration\xe2\x80\xa6. Objective 3 : Vaccination        Link with EPI to organize the procurement of vaccine:  o\tOrganize the cold chain o\tCheck the vaccination status and on the needs give the vaccination require o\tOrganize the next vaccination consultation if needed        Objective 4: Prepared all the material  -\tBefore leaving the office ensure all the material is ready (nutrition, medicines\xe2\x80\xa6) -\tAfter the field visit, clean and prepare the morning coming day -\tPrepared the reportsTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Health/Medical Educational / Professional Background :  \xef\x80\xad\tGraduate medical nurse \xef\x80\xad\tAt least 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in the field of health and nutrition.'

b'EMERGENCY NUTRITION-HEALTH MIDWIFE Job SummaryObjective 1: Provide Treatment for acute malnourish PLW and Under 5  Objective 2 : ANC and PNC (for midwife) Objective 3 : IMNCI : Participate to diagnostic and treat based on the guideline Objective 4: Prepared all the material Objective 1: Provide Treatment for acute malnourish PLW and Under 5  A) Admissions and FU of eligible children U5 and PLW  with acute malnutrition \xef\x82\xa7 Identify beneficiaries at risk; \xef\x82\xa7 Manage the medical examination at admission stage: validate admission of beneficiaries in OTP \xef\x82\xa7 Refer severe acutely malnourished beneficiaries with medical complications to Therapeutic Feeding Units         (TFU);  \xef\x82\xa7 Ensure the medical examination including childhood illness of beneficiaries at each visit in centre; \xef\x82\xa7 Check vaccinations and refer to appropriate health facilities when required; \xef\x82\xa7 Administer the appropriate medication; \xef\x82\xa7 Ensure nutritional follow up of the beneficiaries  \xef\x82\xa7 Identify those beneficiaries who do not respond to the treatment and manage their follow up; \xef\x82\xa7 Record information on the beneficiary card. Treatment provided should be recorded, as well as relevant comments;  \xef\x82\xa7 Ensure medical examination at discharge: validate the discharge upon the status of the beneficiaries;  \xef\x82\xa7 Check that the criteria  of discharge are met and that the immunization is satisfactory (after prior referral);  B) AT discharge  \xef\x82\xa7 Check if all the procedures completed before discharge (anthropometric measurements, medical and nutritional treatment, systematic treatment, and health and nutrition educations). \xef\x82\xa7 Record all the necessary information on the registration book and card for each beneficiary. C) Health and nutrition educations \xef\x82\xa7 Provide health and nutrition educations to the caregivers and beneficiaries on (breastfeeding, complementary feeding, and hygiene, care of pregnant and lactating women, prevention of illness). Objective 2 : ANC and PNC (for midwife) A) Pregnancy care, consultation to ensure:  o History taken, Physical exam o Assess to referral o Provide Iron and folic acide o Check for Tetanus and if needs refer for vaccination If VDRL is positive refer for treatment o Counselling o Recording on the card - B) Post-natal care, consultation to ensure: o Define post-partum care, history taken o Diagnostic if post-partum sign, (physical exam, check blood pressure\xe2\x80\xa6.) o Referral if needed o Information and counselling (FP, BF, care for baby) - C) Family planning consultation:  o Counselling o Prescription and medication Objective 3 : IMNCI : Participate to diagnostic and treat based on the guideline - Determine if this is an initial or follow up visit for this problem - Assess the different sign and determine the main symptom - If needs to do referral  - Give the treatment - Counsel the caretaker - Fill up the follow up card, registration\xe2\x80\xa6. Objective 4: Prepared all the material  - Before leaving the office ensure all the material is ready (nutrition, medicines\xe2\x80\xa6) - After the field visit, clean and prepare the morning coming day - Prepared the reportsTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Health/Medical Educational / Professional Background :  \xef\x80\xad Graduate Midwife or medical nurse \xef\x80\xad At least 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in the field of RMNCAH and if IYCF'

b'EMERGENCY NUTRITION-HEALTH SUPERVISOR Job SummaryObjective 1: Ensure quality services: supervision, monitoring and follow up of the Mobile team activities Objective 2 : Management of supply : Objective 3 : Team management : Objective 4 : Reporting and external reporting Objective 1: Ensure quality services: supervision, monitoring and follow up of the Mobile team activities - Ensure the mobile staffs received training and capacity building to do provide quality services  - Ensure mobile clinic guideline is following - Ensure the team to follow the IMAM guideline during the services of the nutrition activities (admissions, FU, transfer\xe2\x80\xa6), - Support the team on medical consultation, IMNCI, ANC/PNC care, SAM 1st consultation, - Ensure psychosocial counselling is conduct and following the  - Make sure that daily, weekly and monthly record of beneficiaries is in place and fulfill efficiently. Objective 2 : Management of supply : Activities : - Prepare the medical and nutrition requisitions for mobile team activities (RUTF and medications). - Follow up on the daily, weekly, monthly consumption, - Manage the box of medical box and medical equipment in coordination with logistic; - Ensure DPM, PM receive the needs and reports on RUTF, RUSF, Super cereal, Objective 3 : Team management : Activities : - Train the team in the rules of hygiene, prescriptions and medical supervision ; - Work in team with the nurses, measurer and the registrar ; - Establish a work plan for his team ; - Control the planning of his team ; - In case of absence of a direct team members, manage who will take over the activities - Organize training sessions ; - Carry out appraisal interviews Objective 4 : Reporting and external reporting - Ensure all data are provide on weekly and on monthly, participate to the APR - Analyze mobile clinic activities and proposed solution when needs  - Coordinate with the community leaders where the mobile clinic provide services, - Participate to the APR Health/Medical Educational / Professional Background :  \xef\x80\xad Graduated degree Medical Doctor  \xef\x80\xad At least 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in the field of health and nutrition'

b'ACF-NUTRITION PROGRAM MANAGER Job SummaryMission 1: : Manage the implementation of all activities and ensure the quality of health/nutrition is maintained at HF and through the mobile team Mission 2: Human resource management and administration of the nutrition team Mission 3: Participate to the selection and organization of the areas of intervention   Mission 4: To participate in internal/external coordination and ensure timely reporting on programmes. Mission 1: : Manage the implementation of all activities and ensure the quality of health/nutrition is maintained at HF and through the mobile team - The Nutrition and Health Programme Manager is responsible for: - Timely and high quality implementation of planned activities within his/her programme and alerting the Line Manager to any delays or excessive or under-use of resources. - Prepared and using the different tools for the implementation of the program  - Ensure the implementation of the different components of the project following the LFA - Monitoring the budget and targets achieved with reference to the project proposal, and making any necessary adjustments in consultation with the Finance Manager in the base and the Field Manager - Sharing information on a regular basis with the ERM and nutH team   - Identify the purchases necessities in accordance with ACF logistic rules - Proposing an operational health and nutritional strategy adapted to the local situation - Participle to Recruit the Nutrition team in accordance with ACF HR rules - Timely and high quality reporting internal and for donors, of the activities of his/her programme, together with a critical analysis - Identify reporting indicators relevant to the programme, following the LFA - Collect statistical data from the treatment centres/mobile clinic - Compile a regular summary of indicators for his/her programme (APR etc.), produce an analysis and prepare necessary reports for the N+1, Head/deputy of Nutrition health and MHCP departments  Mission 2: Human resource management and administration of the nutrition team - Organize training for the team after recruitment and ensure the capacity of the staffs - Organising and leading team meetings and individual monitoring sessions (both regular and \xc2\xab one off \xc2\xbb) - Establishing and monitoring action plans of individual team members - Managing the planning, organisation and division of work - Arranging staff assessment interviews with individual team members and following these through in collaboration with HRM, and yearly evaluation (skill and performance) - Providing technical support to the teams both in the frame of the partnership and in direct implementation - Providing support in dealing with routine problems encountered by team members  - Managing problems of team working in liaison with mission HRM Mission 3: Participate to the selection and organization of the areas of intervention   -  Involve in the data and information collection for the selection of the RRT - Field visit to complete information and selection of the sites for the RRT - Organize the deployment of the RRT - Participate to the exit strategy of the RRT from the province Mission 4: To participate in internal/external coordination and ensure timely reporting on programmes. - Coordination with the DoPH and other stakeholder of the area - Working in collaboration with local health officials on the implementation, development and monitoring of the          programmeTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Health/Medical - 3 years of Experience in Project Management    - Experience in psychosocial activities is must welcome'
