b'National Consultant Internal Audit Job SummaryWe are looking for an objective Internal auditor to add value and improve our operations by bringing a systematic and disciplined approach to the effectiveness of risk management, control, and governance processes. The successful candidate will possess a thorough knowledge of accounting procedures and a sound judgement. The Internal Audit Consultant is responsible for internal auditing activities of the project under the supervision of MoPH internal audit directorate. The Internal auditor will be responsible for the overall oversights of administration, finance and procurement documents. The Internal auditor will insure that the administration, Finance and procurement activities are implemented in line with the rules and regulation of the government of Afghanistan and the donor. 1. Provide Technical Assistance (TA) in development of the annual audit work plan to be approved by the MoPH leadership. 2. Provide technical assistance to audit staff so they perform and control the full audit cycle including risk management and control management over operations\xe2\x80\x99 effectiveness, financial reliability and compliance with all applicable directives and regulations 3. Maintain open communication with management and actively participation in audit committee 4. Provide guidance and extend cooperation audit staff in their audit activities. 5. Assist the audit staff in implementation of legal procedures of financial & economical activities of MoPH departments and implementing partners.  6. Methodic & Practical cooperation with internal auditors. 7. Provide consultation to audit staff in international audit standards.  8. Provide guidance to the internal audit directorate in legal decisions to avoid inappropriate decisions of departments and organizations during auditing. 9. To assist the internal audit directorate in analysis of crimes and legal violations and prepare relevant reports. 10. Careful review of approvals and decisions of authorities and advice the department accordingly. 11. Search and find the new places where needed to be audited. 12. Any other related tasks assigned by internal audit directorate.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Health/Medical \xe2\x80\xa2 Graduate from faculty of Economics and Business Administration from recognized university. \xe2\x80\xa2 At least 5 years working experience is required (including 2 years in the field of audit) with Afghan Government, national/international NGOs or UN agencies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Computer skills (Ms. Word, Excel, Access) knowledge of data base and quick book accounting software is preferred. \xe2\x80\xa2 Working knowledge of English, Dari and Pashto  \xe2\x80\xa2 Competent in the use of key computer software skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Very good Communication and interpersonal skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Must be willing to travel throughout Afghanistan'

b"Senior IS Audit Officer Job SummaryInternal auditing is an independent, objective assurance and consulting activity designed to add value and improve an organization's operations. It helps an organization accomplish its objectives by bringing a systematic, disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of risk management, control, and governance processes.  To that effect, the Senior Information Systems (IS) Audit Officer, is responsible the internal controls and risks of a FINCA Afghanistan technology network. He/she shall act in a lead role FINCA Afghanistan IS audit and all technology Innovations, designs and develops audit procedures, reviews and evaluates work of associates and, recommends and submits reports on identified corrections and controls in need of improvement. He/she shall also be involved in the planning and execution of internal audit procedures and the creation of internal audit reports and must work within a team to create a solid information technology infrastructure, and collaborate with staff to devise and put in place policies and procedures regarding network security issues. He/she shall maintain all organizational and professional ethical standards and ensures internal audit activities are carried out in compliance with ISACA\xe2\x80\x99s IT audit standard.  Works independently under general direction with extensive latitude for initiative and independent judgment. I. THE PROCESS OF AUDITING INFORMATION SYSTEMS  \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and implement a risk-based IT audit strategy in compliance with IT audit standards to ensure that key areas are included. \xe2\x80\xa2 Plan specific audits to determine whether information systems are protected, controlled and provide value to the organization. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct audits in accordance with IT audit standards to achieve planned audit objectives. Report audit findings and make recommendations to key stakeholders to communicate results and effect change when necessary. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct follow-ups or prepare status reports to ensure appropriate actions have been taken by management in a timely manner. II. It Governance and Management  \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the effectiveness of the IT governance structure to determine whether IT decisions, directions and performance support the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate IT organizational structure and human resources (personnel) management to determine whether they support the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the IT strategy, including the IT direction, and the processes for the strategy\xe2\x80\x99s development, approval, implementation and maintenance for alignment with the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the organization\xe2\x80\x99s IT policies, standards, and procedures, and the processes for their development, approval, implementation, maintenance, and monitoring, to determine whether they support the IT strategy and comply with regulatory and legal requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the adequacy of the quality management system to determine whether it supports the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives in a cost-effective manner. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate IT management and monitoring of controls (e.g., continuous monitoring, QA) for compliance with the organization\xe2\x80\x99s policies, standards and procedures. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate IT resource investment, use and allocation practices, including prioritization criteria, for alignment with the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate IT contracting strategies and policies, and contract management practices to determine whether they support the organization\xe2\x80\x99s strategies and objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate risk management practices to determine whether the organization\xe2\x80\x99s IT-related risks are properly managed. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate monitoring and assurance practices to determine whether the board and executive management receive sufficient and timely information about IT performance. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the organization\xe2\x80\x99s business continuity plan to determine the organization\xe2\x80\x99s ability to continue essential business operations during the period of an IT disruption. III. Is Acquisition, Development and Implementation \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the business case for the proposed investments in information systems acquisition, development, maintenance and subsequent retirement to determine whether it meets business objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the project management practices and controls to determine whether business requirements are achieved in a cost-effective manner while managing risks to the organization. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct reviews to determine whether a project is progressing in accordance with project plans, is adequately supported by documentation and status reporting is accurate. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate controls for information systems during the requirements, acquisition, development and testing phases for compliance with the organization's policies, standards, procedures and applicable external requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the readiness of information systems for implementation and migration into production to determine whether project deliverables, controls and organization's requirements are met. Conduct post-implementation reviews of systems to determine whether project deliverables, controls and organization's requirements are met. IV. Is Operations, Maintenance and Support \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct periodic reviews of information systems to determine whether they continue to meet the organization\xe2\x80\x99s objectives.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate service level management practices to determine whether the level of service from internal and external service providers is defined and managed. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate third party management practices to determine whether the levels of controls expected by the organization are being adhered to by the provider. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate operations and end-user procedures to determine whether scheduled and non-scheduled processes are managed to completion. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the process of information systems maintenance to determine whether they are controlled effectively and continue to support the organization\xe2\x80\x99s objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate data administration practices to determine the integrity and optimization of databases. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the use of capacity and performance monitoring tools and techniques to determine whether IT services meet the organization\xe2\x80\x99s objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate problem and incident management practices to determine whether incidents, problems or errors are recorded, analyzed and resolved in a timely manner. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate change, configuration and release management practices to determine whether scheduled and non-scheduled changes made to the organization\xe2\x80\x99s production environment are adequately controlled and documented. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the adequacy of backup and restore provisions to determine the availability of information required to resume processing. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the organization\xe2\x80\x99s disaster recovery plan to determine whether it enables the recovery of IT processing capabilities in the event of a disaster. V. Protection of Is Assets \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the information security policies, standards and procedures for completeness and alignment with generally accepted practices. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the design, implementation and monitoring of system and logical security controls to verify the confidentiality, integrity and availability of information. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the design, implementation, and monitoring of the data classification processes and procedures for alignment with the organization\xe2\x80\x99s policies, standards, procedures, and applicable external requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the design, implementation and monitoring of physical access and environmental controls to determine whether information assets are adequately safeguarded. \xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate the processes and procedures used to store, retrieve, transport and dispose of information assets (e.g., backup media, offsite storage, hard copy/print data, and softcopy media) to determine whether information assets are adequately safeguarded. VI. Other duties: \xe2\x80\xa2 To follow and implement Global Corporate audit methodology and techniques, applicable at subsidiary level. \xe2\x80\xa2 To determine whether organizational units in the FINCA Afghanistan are performing their planning, operational, accounting, custodial, or control activities in compliance with management instructions, applicable statements of policy and procedures, and in a manner consistent with both organizational objectives and high standards of administrative practice. \xe2\x80\xa2 To plan and execute functional, process and field audits in accordance with accepted standards. \xe2\x80\xa2 To report audit findings and to make recommendations for correcting unsatisfactory conditions, improving operations, and reducing cost. \xe2\x80\xa2 To perform assigned special reviews according to the given scope. Banking \xe2\x80\xa2 MA/MS in Business Administration, Accounting, Computer Science, Information Systems Administration or related field.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) required.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Internal auditing or forensic certification a plus."

b'Cheif Risk Officer Job SummaryExtensive Knowledge of credit grading and rating concepts and the technical development of such underlying models as well as working knowledge of the Basel II accord; Strong analytical skills with a working knowledge in the principles of credit risk, market risk, operation risk, liquidity risk and finance. Sound Knowledge of investment risk and portfolio management concepts; Understanding of operational risks including IT Security; Ability to clearly articulate and express a bank\xe2\x80\x99s risk Appetite; Knowledge of Policy development and implementation; Strong command of risk management principles, tools and models; In depth understanding of the regulatory, economic sectors, clients and market environment - To assist Board and senior management to establish and communicate Bank\xe2\x80\x99s Risk Management objectives and direction; - To design  risk management Program and  participate in the risk assessment process; - To develop Risk management framework; - To assist CEO and the risk management committee to develop and Communicate risk      management policies, risk appetite and risk limits; - To assist developing risk mitigation strategies for the Bank\xe2\x80\x99s critical risks; - To implement appropriate risk reporting to CEO, Executive Committee, Board and senior    management on periodical basis; - To establishes, communicate and facilitate the use of appropriate Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) methodologies, tools and techniques; - To work with business units to establish, maintain and continuously improve risk Management capabilities; - To facilitates enterprise-wide risk assessments and monitors priority risks across the Bank; - To ensure effective alignment between the ERM process and internal audit and risk Financing; - To conducts risk management education and training from time to time; - To provide an independent view regarding proposed business plans and transactions Banking Bachelors or Masters in Accounting, Finance, Banking, Economics, or related field. Risk management professional training or certification such as FRM/PRM are desirable.'

b'Deputy Branch Manager for Paktia Job SummaryThe Deputy Branch Manager is Assist Branch manager on daily management, Administration, treasury follow up and other operations related to Customers and Treasury. 1. Respect and follow-up of Bank-e-Millie rule, regulation, and financial procedures. 2. Respect and follow-up the Bank-e-Millie all policies and procedures; 3. Assist Main Branch Manager on Cash management and daily follow up. 4. Assist Branch Manager in prepare a report to Board management. 5. Assist in daily routine 1. Supervision and control of administration, accounts, attendance, and staff  2. Controlling and checking all cash and transfer Transaction within his limit  3. Implementation and control of daily work  4. Overall supervision of Afghani account and other currencies in saving section  5. Checking and controlling all deposit, withdrawal slips and controlling transfer documents related to saving accounts. 6. Deputy Branch Manager is Responsible for all the Duties of Branch Manager in case of his Absence. 7. Implementation of Fair and Standard Interest Calculation Procedure. 8. Having Tight Control on Interest Calculation Process to prevent any mistake. 9. Reporting Interest to Related Departments. 10. Reconciling Saving Account Balances with Accounts on Daily Basis. 11. Any task or duty assigned by the line manager Banking Must possess a Bachelor degree and/or at least (3) years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in a related  field (Branch operations)'

b'Financial and Accounting Specialist Job Summary-  Financial management matters about all branches of the bank; - Oversee all financial management activities relating to the programs and Operations of the Bank;  -Monitor the financial execution of the budget of the Bank in relation to actual  -expenditures, and prepare and submit to the head of the Bank timely  -performance reports. - Prepare and submit the monthly, quarterly, half year and yearly all kinds of Reports to the Da Afghanistan Bank as per Banking laws and regulations issued Thereof. -  Reportable directly to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) of the Bank regarding -  Financial management matters about all branches of the bank; - Oversee all financial management activities relating to the programs and Operations of the Bank;  -Monitor the financial execution of the budget of the Bank in relation to actual  -expenditures, and prepare and submit to the head of the Bank timely  -performance reports. - Prepare and submit the monthly, quarterly, half year and yearly all kinds of Reports to the Da Afghanistan Bank as per Banking laws and regulations issued Thereof. - Prepare and submit all the documents required by the Ministry of Finance related To all bank tax matters, monthly, quarterly and yearly for proper compliance of The Income Tax Laws 2005 of Afghanistan. - Fulfil all documentations/information requirements of internal, external, MOF and -DAB auditors from time to time and facilitate them from execution of audit to Finalization and issuance of reports. Apprise the Management and staff members on latest development in Accounting, Taxation and other related areas.  - Ensure operational effectiveness of the Department in liaison with BoM and BoS.  - Assist Management in framing critical decisions by providing inputs, analysis results etc.  - Impart training to new and existing employees in the areas of Accounts, Finance and Risk Management. Banking Bachelor of Economics with concentrate on accounting and finance or related area of study  Professional certification such as CA/CIA/CBA/ CPA/CISA/CFE / ACCA is desirable.'

b'Chief Credit Officer (CCO) Job Summary\xe2\x80\xa2 7-10 years lending experience with recognized financial institution. \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience should include credit originations, credit evaluation portfolio , management and risk management; \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in managing credit department, developing and implementing credit polices and procedures for commercial lending. knowledge of commercial lending ;credit evaluation and underwriting ;  \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of afghan banking law and regulations, especially regarding the lending function .  \xe2\x80\xa2 Working knowledge of Basel I and II ; \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to manage problem assets and develop workout strategies;  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to develop credit policies, processes and procedures ,together with a creative approach to identifying new credit product and structures for clients.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in finance statement analysis ,risk assessment ,cash flow projection, valuation, stress testing and other financial models; \xe2\x80\xa2 Familiarity with local market corporate and consumer businesses; \xe2\x80\xa2 Basic knowledge of accounting concepts specific to banks and large financial institution on-balance sheet ,off-balance sheet , trading account assets , loans , commitments , guarantees ; \xe2\x80\xa2 Working knowledge of risk management concepts; \xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding of Extensive selling , negotiating , and relationship management skill.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Have high ethical standards and integrity in both their personal and professional dealings; \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent written and verbal communication skill; \xe2\x80\xa2 Leadership skills.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Banking Masters degree in Business with concentration in finance, accounting,  Marketing or in banking or risk management; \xe2\x80\xa2 Professional training or certifications in credit and risk management preferred.'

b'BRANCH SUPERVISOR Job SummaryWe are looking for a talented Branch Supervisor to assign and direct all work performed in the branch and to supervise all areas of operation. You will manage staff, foster a positive environment and ensure customer satisfaction and proper branch operation. The successful candidate will have a hands-on approach and will be committed to the expansion and success of the business by implementing strategies that increase productivity and enable sales targets achievement. 1. Supervise all operational aspects of sales 2. Assess local market conditions and identify current and prospective sales opportunities 3. Develop forecasts, financial objectives and business plans 4. Meet goals and objectives 5. Manage budget and allocate funds appropriately 6. Locate areas of improvement and propose corrective actions that meet challenges and leverage growth opportunities 7. Share information with other branches and headquarters on effective practices, competitive intelligence, business opportunities and needs 8. Address customer and employee satisfaction issues promptly 9. Adhere to high ethical standards, and comply with all regulations/applicable laws 10. Network to improve the presence and reputation of the branch and company 11. Stay abreast of competing markets and provide reports on market movement and penetration 12. To comply rules and regulation of SKY Travel and Tours Overall boost the sales in Mazar BranchTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Business Administration Minimum Bachelor Degree in Business Administration (BBA) Master degree will be preferred.'

b'Contracts Manger Job SummaryThe Contracts Manager is responsible for managing complex procurement, subcontract and administration activities for commercial/government Contracts consistent with customer requirements, government regulations, and company policies and procedures over $10,000.00. The Contracts Manager will support the procurement team and will work closely to oversee and manage all procurement activities in accordance with AUAF\xe2\x80\x99s and USAID\xe2\x80\x99s policy and Regulations. The Contracts Manager will monitor the contracting activities of AUAF\xe2\x80\x99s operations and will ensure compliance with AUAF Procurement Policy and in accordance with the local procurement procedures to ensure compliance from time to time. The Contracts Manger duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following: \xe2\x80\xa2 Act as advisor to Procurement Officers regarding legal requirements, best practices, terms and conditions, and delivery schedules.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares negotiates and manages AUAF Purchase Orders, Subcontracts and Agreements over $10,000.00, unless otherwise assigned. \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee their Request for Proposal preparation, pricing activities, and contract negotiations.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Review/Prepares and submit all procurement documents in compliance with the AUAF Procurement policies and procedures. Drafts and reviews RFQs/RFPs for submittal to the Public. \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage higher-level supplier relationships including leading kick-off meetings, communications, technical evaluation teams and performance measurement.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage the coordination of post-award supplier/vendor\xe2\x80\x99s Purchase Order/Subcontract Terms and Conditions.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares vetting documents for Director of Procurement\xe2\x80\x99s review, approval and submittal. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepares Donor Approval package for the Director of Procurement review. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure proper payment packages are complete for submittal to Finance Department \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor supplier evaluations to collect end-user feedback and identify areas requiring improvements or corrective action.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensures AUAF Procurement Policies and Procedures are fully applied in day to day procurement activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage and oversee procurement closeouts \xe2\x80\xa2 Review and resolve issues on assigned tasks which affect company compliance and ensure satisfaction of legal requirements, and company and customer objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that services and deliverables are delivered in accordance with the agreement terms and conditions. \xe2\x80\xa2 Create and maintain records for all assigned subcontractors and contract close-outs in accordance with AUAF Procurement Manual. \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform other duties as requested Business Administration To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor Degree in Business Administrations, or equivalent required.  \xe2\x80\xa2 5 years of relevant experience with USAID, NGOs and/or, Embassies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Must be familiar with the USAID Procurement Rules and Regulations. \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in English and in local languages, i.e. Dari & Pashto. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of business law, contractual terms and conditions, and how to mitigate risk. \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in Microsoft applications (Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, SharePoint)'

b'Procurement Manager Job SummaryThe Procurement Manager, as a senior level manager provides procurement expertise and assists Stakeholders and Procurement Staff to plan, develop, source and manage Procurements and Procurement Staff for the Procurement Office to effectively meet organizational and business objectives. In addition to directing the activities of the Procurement Staff consisting of Contracting Officer/s, Procurement Officers and Procurement Interns, the Procurement Manager is responsible for managing and executing higher level complex Contracts. It is the Procurement Manager\xe2\x80\x99s primary responsibility to ensure the procurement process of receiving proper Procurement Requisition Forms (PRFs) through procurement close-out of the procurement is conducted in its entirety in accordance with the AUAF Policy and Regulations. Also, he/she will ensure they are completed according to the AUAF Policies and Procedures in a timely manner. What is a Procurement Manager responsible for? A Procurement Manager is responsible for ensuring that a company has a very clear strategy when purchasing goods and services. The Procurement Manager may set policies for purchasing that take into account budgets, stock requirements and skills required. For many companies costs are a key factor in their purchasing decisions so the Procurement Manager will ensure suppliers are aware of this. Quite often companies require suppliers who meet certain standards such as ISO accreditation or a particular level of insurance cover. The Procurement Manager will be responsible for ensuring that suppliers meet these requirements. What is a typical day of a Procurement Manager? In a typical day, the Procurement Manager may be involved in meetings with finance and operational leadership teams to understand issues affecting departments. The Procurement Manager may also be working on upcoming tenders. Much of the day may be spent handling queries from potential suppliers and as a people manager time may also be spent supporting the team. The Procurement Manager duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following: \xe2\x80\xa2 As assigned by the Procurement Director, will manage higher level Contracts in addition to directing the activities of the Procurement Staff consisting of Contracting Officer/s, Procurement Officers and Procurement Interns. \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinates the overall activities of the Procurement Department for procuring goods and services based on approved PRFs with the requesting departments. The requested items may be raw materials, equipment, tools, parts, supplies, advertising. The reviews and acceptance of procurement requisitions will be in accordance with the AUAF Procurement Policy, Standard Operating Instructions and/or directed by the Procurement Director. \xe2\x80\xa2  Review, approves and assigns to the Procurement Staff PRFs. Reviews Purchase Orders and Subcontracts, resolves 1) complex issues on Statements of Work, 2) monitor performance 3) and negotiates complex Purchase Order/Subcontracts as required. \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversees, coordinates or conduct sourcing activities in accordance with established policies and procedures to meet AUAF\xe2\x80\x99s needs and participate in negotiations to establish and review supply arrangements that will deliver value based on cost and budget. \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversees, reviews and manages sources or source list to ascertain that they are solicited according to the AUAF Procurement Policies and Procedures and, if applicable, according to Donor Regulations. \xe2\x80\xa2 Reviews, oversees and approves bid quotations, negotiates higher level complex Purchase Orders and Subcontracts within budgetary limitations and scope of authority completed by Procurement Staff. \xe2\x80\xa2 Reviews and oversee the procurement records\xe2\x80\x99 management in both hard and computerized copy. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure or keep update the Procurement Tracker on timely basis and provide Procurement Status to Procurement Director and AUAF Management based on a transactional basis (Solicitation, Issuance of Purchase Order and Close-Out). \xe2\x80\xa2 Discusses, negotiates and resolves complex or difficult issues with requestor and/or vendor regarding any defective or unacceptable goods or services based on inspection and/or quality control personnel, users, vendors, and others to determine source of trouble and take corrective action. \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee and manages the establishment the Procurement Office a list of qualified vendors who are willing and capable of providing quality products in competitive price. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensures that procurement records and reports are generated as required are recorded as necessary on procurement activity to meet organizational compliance requirements; and provide data to AUAF Management of procurement information as needed. \xe2\x80\xa2 Comply and ensure the Procurement Staff\xe2\x80\x99s compliance with AUAF Procurement Policy and purchasing procedures in the day to day procurement activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversees, manages and ensures the Procurement Office processes the Goods Receipt Notes and vendor\xe2\x80\x99s invoices in a timely manner; and that they are properly executed as part of completed procurement records when sent to the Finance Office payment. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensures that transparency, and integrity of the work conducted by the Procurement Staff is according to the AUAF Policy is fully maintained in day to day procurement activities. \xe2\x80\xa2 Guide and manage the Technical Evaluation Teams. \xe2\x80\xa2 Performs additional duties as assigned by Director. Business Administration To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  \xe2\x80\xa2 The position requires the incumbent to reside in Afghanistan \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor Degree in Business Administrations, or equivalent required \xe2\x80\xa2 5 + years with USAID funded procurements.   \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in English and local languages, i.e. Dari & Pashto \xe2\x80\xa2 Committed to AUAF mission, vision and values'

b'Logistic Officer  Kabul Job SummaryTitle of position: Logistic Officer kabul  No of Vacancy : Logistic Officer / Kabul Number Of Position : 1 Gender: Male  Location: Kabul  Report to: HSC program officer  Grade: According to NTA salary scale According to NTA salary scale Announce 2018/10/27 Close 2018/11/8 Planning and Managing procurement of goods/ supplies for HSC faculty 2. Responsible for overall management of HSC store room 3. Briefing suppliers of different goods on proper shifting and hand dispatching of goods/ supplies.  4. Responsible for proper receiving, storage, recording, distribution, inventory management and reporting  5. Keep update record of all inventory lists. (Medicines, books, food materials, vehicles, and etc.); 6. Guarantee the maintenance of the stock and warehouse (expiry date, cleaning, fumigation\xe2\x80\xa6); 7. Responsible for check and balance of expiry date, damage, and genuine keeping of goods of related store / warehouse; 8. Assisting the performance and schedule of activities of transport affairs ; 9. Check the updated expenses record of his office vehicles and follow up the mileage of vehicles for oil and filter change; 10. Delivering the procured goods to the store, serves as the receiver of goods (storekeeper) 11. Receiving goods supplied by supplier/s and providing receipt and stock them in store;  12. Preparing kits and sets of goods based on the instruction provided by HSC Administrator ; 13. Providing updated manual / soft record of inventory lists of store on monthly base; 14. Supervising the loading and unloading of the goods at the store; 15. Preventing of all the goods in the store from the rain drops, sun shine, etc.  16. Arranging and maintain the goods in the store in proper manner and track them 17. Perform other duties required by his supervisor. Business Administration Bachelor of Business and Administration, Economic and other related field  2. At least 4 year working experience in logistic, procurement  3. Fluent in Dari and Pashto and excellent communication in English languages is an asset 4. Should have excellent computer skills 5. Good team player'

b'Executive Assistant to MD Job SummaryThe Executive Assistant shall provide quality personal and administrative assistance to the Managing Director of the company. He/she will perform a wide range of administrative and support tasks and will execute ordinary and/or complex secretarial activities. The Executive Assistant will manage tight schedules, communicate with executives, customers and parties (internal or external) of the company and provide the required reports & updates to the management as and when required. 1. First point of contact for the Managing Director of the company.  2. Provide efficient and responsive administrative, organizational, and logistical support to the Managing Director. 3. Handle and follow-up on incoming and outgoing correspondence and electronic communications on behalf of the Managing Director and officially rely the important issues and/or taken decisions to the relevant internal or external parties.       4. Plan and organize the workload effectively to resolve issues quickly and in an appropriate manner. 5. Filter general information, queries, meeting requests, phone calls and invitations to the MD and put forward only the important information to the MD.  6. Take minutes of various meetings and file it appropriately.  7. To attend meeting and events (internally or externally) on behalf of MD as and when required.  8. Provide secretarial and administrative support to the management for meetings, conferences or events.  9. Process requests for visas, tickets, hotel reservations and other necessary administrative documents in accordance with requirement of the MD office. 10. Draft correspondence, official letters, memos, circulars and reports as per the instruction of the management.  11. Interact with both internal and external entities, executives and employees, as well as consultants, governmental bodies, clients, vendors and the overseas offices to coordinate various issues and follow-ups.  12. Conduct short-term projects, initiatives, researches or investigations/surveys as requested by the MD. 13. Responsible for the maintenance of MD office files and records in appropriate way. 14. Keep the sensitive information fully confidential; ensure that no access is provided to unauthorized persons to the sensitive details, information and records of MD Office.  15. Follow-up on responses to requests and communications to/from the Managing Director. 16. Greet visitors graciously and in a professional manner, create a good personal image through a neat, clean, businesslike professional appearance and a positive, cheerful attitude. 17. Answer phone calls in a pleasant and professional manner and either redirect the calls or note the message appropriately for further required actions.  18. Receive and meet key guests at the airports or other locations as & when required.  19. Ensure guests meeting with the MD are well taken care of. 20. Preparing and delivering presentations on different organizational and operational reports, projects, initiatives etc.  21. Other job-related tasks as assigned by the line manager. Business Administration \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Business Administration, HR or Public Administration. Higher qualifications will be preferred.'

b'Female HR Analyst Job SummaryThe Human Resources Analyst shall possess a mastery of advanced Human Resource Management (HRM) principles, concepts, regulations, and practices, analytical methods and techniques, and seasoned consultative skill sufficient to resolve HRM problems not susceptible to treatment by standard methods.   The Human Resource Analyst will be involved in the various phases of human resources management specifically, administrative support positions that supervise, lead, or perform human resources (HR) assistance work requiring substantial knowledge of civilian and military HR terminology, requirements, procedures, operations, functions, and regulatory policy and procedural requirements applicable to HR transactions. 1. Conduct fact finding and recommend solutions to moderately difficult but well-precedent and/or recurring issues and problems using the knowledge of, and skill in applying, fundamental Human Resource Management (HRM) laws, principles, systems, policies, methods, and practices; as well as interviewing, analytical, and research techniques. 2. Apply fundamental HR methods, principles, and practices of the specialization(s); and standardized analytical and evaluative methods and techniques. 3. Provide advice and resolve moderately complex, non-controversial, well-precedent factual, procedural, and recurring issues for which there are one or more readily apparent solutions. 4. Make informed judgments on problems and issues. 5. Develop new or modified HR work methods, approaches, or procedures for delivering effective HR services. 6. Provide written and oral communication techniques sufficient to develop and deliver briefings, project papers, status and staff reports, and correspondence to Managers to foster understanding and acceptance of findings and recommendations. 7. Plan, organize, and direct team efforts to persuade management officials to accept and implement recommendations, where the proposals involve substantial agency resources or require extensive changes in established procedures and methods. 8. Analyze factual data to identify the scope and nature of problems or issues, and determining the appropriate action from among many alternatives. 9. Apply appropriate standards in determining the titles, grades, and series codes of lower-grade positions. 10. Apply a standardized body of HR rules, procedures, and operations concerning human resource development. 11. Apply an extensive body of HR rules, procedures, and operations concerning recruitment and placement. 12. Apply an extensive body of HR rules, procedures, and operations concerning human resource development. 13. Identify major duties of the positions being filled and comparing requirements of the positions being filled with the backgrounds of applicants to determine that minimum eligibility requirements have been met. Determine the relative degree to which applicant experience meets various rating factors. Rank applicants based on their demonstrated ability to perform specific work. 14. Develop, interpret, and analyze data extracts and reports from automated HR databases and develop the most efficient and effective automated systems approaches for presenting HR reports and graphics for management. 15. Provide support to HR specialists involved in one or more specialties such as classification and employee benefits. 16. Log HR action requests into the automated tracking system. 17. Forward actions through the system to an HR specialist or other employee assigned to perform the next action on the document. 18. Assist the HR Manager in developing Human Resources Management Policies and Procedures. 19. Contribute to the wellbeing of all staff members and deal with lower staff concerns and queries and provide solutions, in consultation with relevant supervisor. Human Resource 1. At least Two (2) years of professional experience with national, international and agencies in the field of Human Resources  2. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Human Resources or business discipline  3. Excellent computer literacy skills in MS Office (Word and Excel) and HR Management systems. 4. Experience in human resource management, including HR management software 5. Excellent communication, interpersonal and training skills.'

b'Admin & HR Officer Job SummaryThe Admin & HR Officer will be responsible for all HR related activities, including policies and procedures implementation, incentive programs, hiring and firing, conducting of events and conducting performance evaluation with other departmental Managers and providing support in the various Human Resource and Administration functions to Top managements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify and analyze the staff vacancy, developing the job description, advertising the position, and long listing  the potential candidates. \xe2\x80\xa2 Arrange the written test, schedule the interviews, participate in the interview and select the best suitable candidate  \xe2\x80\xa2 Update and maintain accurate records of all filing system and other related documents of HR department  \xe2\x80\xa2  Facilitate training for the employees on regular basses  \xe2\x80\xa2 Draft Letters such as employee\xe2\x80\x99s verification, job offer, termination, appreciation, experience etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Attendance Management and preparation of Attendance Report to make sure that staff gets pay correctly and on time. \xe2\x80\xa2  Negotiate Job Offers, Employment contracts, salaries, working conditions with staff. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conducting and participating in weekly meetings  \xe2\x80\xa2 Process, audit for errors and keeping the soft and hard record of payroll, attendance report, recruitment file, and other documents. \xe2\x80\xa2  Conducting of performance evaluation to ensure that all staff are appraised on regular basses to identify skills gaps, training needs as well as the breakdown of poor, satisfactory and high performing staff. \xe2\x80\xa2 Respond to all personnel and performance issues in an effective and professional manner, with support of General Manager \xe2\x80\xa2 Plan and conduct new employee orientation to foster positive attitude toward organizational objectives. \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitate the separation of employee as per HGML\xe2\x80\x99s procedure and processing final sentiments as per policy. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide current and prospective employees with information about policies, job duties, working conditions, monthly package, and opportunities for promotion and employee benefits. \xe2\x80\xa2 Check and control vehicle logbooks, fuels and prepare fuel requests as and when needed. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare purchase request form for purchase of goods etc. if needed \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that regular cleaning and maintenance of office facility is done by the projects support staff as well as manage safety and security at the office. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that records of vehicle licensing and insurance are maintained to facilitate the necessary renewal of same on time \xe2\x80\xa2 Keep filing system up to date and accessible for the department.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop action plan and tracking sheet for activates related to administration and project. \xe2\x80\xa2 Other Tasks or responsibilities assigned by the department head.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Human Resource 1. Bachelor degree in Business Administration ( HR)  2. 3 years of work experience in Admin & HR is required'

b'Head of Human Resources Department Job SummaryMission 1 : Contribute to defining mission strategy Mission 2 : Supervising the staff administration and payroll Mission 3 : Provide for the recruitment and training of all employees and promote career development Mission 4 : Ensure a coherent organisation of work and establish a policy of compensation and benefits Mission 5 : Implement collective rules and communicate internally Mission 6 :  Promote and ensure collaboration and coordination in Human Resources with the mission\xe2\x80\x99s partners Mission 7 : Prevent and manage cases of fraud and corruption Mission 8 : Manage the Human Resources team and the home staff in capital and be support/technical Manager for Human Resources Managers in the bases Mission 1 : Contribute to defining mission strategy The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for: - developing a Human Resources strategy for the mission - making Human Resources data available to other departments to facilitate the establishment of the country strategy - producing high quality and timely Human Resources contributions to "proposals" and reports for funding bodies \xef\x83\x98 Contributing a Human Resources perspective to coordination discussions \xef\x83\x98 Advising other departments on their Human Resources needs \xef\x83\x98 Ensuring that Human Resources needs and constraints are taken into account in the preparation of projects \xef\x83\x98 Collecting data and writing the Human Resources section of proposals and reports to funding bodies and contributing to the financing plan \xef\x83\x98 Ensuring that his/her contribution to \xe2\x80\x9cproposals\xe2\x80\x9d and reports is consistent with the rest of these documents \xef\x83\x98 Representing the mission to outside bodies on issues of Human Resources and developing a network for the exchange of information and good practice Mission 2 : Supervising the staff administration and payroll The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for: - designing and putting in place administrative and payroll procedures which conform to social legislation and with ACF and its funding bodies\xe2\x80\x99 guidelines - the quality of the tools used in staff administration and payroll, and the reliability and transparency of the data - conformity with the contractual obligations of ACF vis-\xc3\xa0-vis its employees \xef\x83\x98 Supervision of the drafting, monitoring and termination of employment contracts of local employees and follow-up of the termination of employment contracts of expatriate staff members \xef\x83\x98 Checking the documentation of staff files and the archiving of documents according to guidelines laid down by ACF and its funding bodies \xef\x83\x98 Supervising the collection of data relative to variable elements in staff pay (monitoring hours worked, salary advances, bonuses, deductions etc) for locally recruited and expatriate employees and for the production of  local employees\' payroll \xef\x83\x98 Monitoring the social benefits paid directly by ACF to both locally recruited and expatriate staff (child allowances and other benefits) \xef\x83\x98 Administering requests for loans by local staff and monitoring their repayment \xef\x83\x98 Checking the tax returns of local staff and ensure timely payment of taxes to the authorities concerned \xef\x83\x98 Checking on visas, work permits, expatriates\' declarations to the local authorities, and ensuring that all local taxes are paid \xef\x83\x98 Supporting Human Resources staff on the bases in the implementation of administrative tools and procedures relating to staff administration and payroll \xef\x83\x98 Producing reports, both monthly and whenever required by headquarters, authorities and funding bodies   \xef\x83\x98 Monitoring the strict application of contractual requirements and reminding Managers of internal regulations and the social rights of local and expatriate employees \xef\x83\x98 Monitoring the movements of expatriate employees: breaks, arrival/return to mission, ensuring that regulations are adhered to and forwarding the relevant documents to headquarters and other interested parties Mission 3 : Provide for the recruitment and training of all employees and promote career development The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for:: - putting in place fair and transparent procedures for recruitment, access to training, promotion and internal mobility, in accordance with legal requirements and ACF guidelines - using all necessary means in the search for appropriate candidates for vacant posts - providing employees with the means to acquire the skills necessary for the proper exercise of their functions - ensuring that all employees have access to a formal annual appraisal meeting (or meetings), that such meetings are of high quality and that they take place on the planned date    \xef\x83\x98 Adapting the ACF recruitment policy for local employees to the local context and taking part in the recruitment of both local and expatriate employees \xef\x83\x98 Defining and implementing the induction process for new employees \xef\x83\x98 Drawing up an annual training plan for local employees, monitoring its operation and producing a review on the basis of feedback from employees and their managers \xef\x83\x98 Maintaining relations with universities and other external sources in the context of recruitment and training policies \xef\x83\x98 Setting down a procedure for individual appraisal interviews and the associated annual schedule, monitoring its application and the quality of outcomes   \xef\x83\x98 Promoting the career development of local employees, in particular by making use of the process of appraisals and training \xef\x83\x98 Providing support to managers and training new managers in matters of recruitment, appraisals and team management \xef\x83\x98 Providing support to Human Resources staff on the bases in implementing the tools and procedures of recruitment, training and career management  Mission 4 : Ensure a coherent organisation of work and establish a policy of compensation and benefits The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for: - ensuring that organisational charts are coherent and are conform to ACF classification grid - ensuring that remuneration systems are fair and consistent with the cost of living for local employees - ensuring that all local employees are covered by health care \xef\x83\x98 Implementing the ACF classification grid and job descriptions and informing headquarters of specific local circumstances \xef\x83\x98 Advising managers on the drafting of organisational charts for new projects \xef\x83\x98 Consolidating the organisational chart of the mission and forwarding it to headquarters \xef\x83\x98 Assessing the efficiency of the organisation and making recommendations \xef\x83\x98 Establishing the minimum wage and the national salary grid, as well as the procedure for its revision \xef\x83\x98 Defining the criteria for placement in the national salary grid and the procedure for both collective and individual salary increases \xef\x83\x98 Defining the national policy for variable elements in staff pay (bonuses, transport costs etc) \xef\x83\x98 Defining the national policy concerning social benefits and, where appropriate, negotiating contracts and ensuring articulation with external private bodies (medical, retirement, insurances....) \xef\x83\x98 Drawing up and monitoring the annual budget of the Human Resources department, approving the creation of new posts, calculating costs and financial forecasts relative to the introduction of new projects \xef\x83\x98 Warning of any difficulty in maintaining the payment of salaries and social benefits in situations of budgetary shortfall Mission 5 : Implement collective rules and communicate internally The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for: - implementing ACF regulations (internal regulations and convention on social benefits) adapted to the local context of the mission and local legislation - consulting and informing local employees through the medium of staff representatives, in conformity with the relevant social legislation - providing accurate information to all employees regarding the ACF charter and its organisational regulations (internal regulations and convention on social benefits) - stimulating internal communications on both general and Human Resources issues - anticipating risks associated with national Human Resources \xef\x83\x98 Adapting and updating the internal regulations and the convention on social benefits and ensuring that they are lodged with the relevant authorities \xef\x83\x98 Putting in place health and safety at work procedures and working towards their improvement as and when necessary \xef\x83\x98 Advising managers on conflicts with and within their teams and providing mediation when needed \xef\x83\x98 Being attentive to the social climate in coordination with the Field Coordinators ; preventing and managing conflict \xef\x83\x98 Defining and implementing the procedure for managing disciplinary problems and sanctions in respect of local employees \xef\x83\x98 Providing support to Field Coordinators and Human Resources staff in the bases in implementing disciplinary procedures in respect of local employees and approving proposed sanctions \xef\x83\x98 Maintaining a substantive dialogue and undertaking negotiations with staff representatives \xef\x83\x98 Preparing and activating social plans in collaboration with the Country Director and the Heads of Departments involved \xef\x83\x98 Identifying legal, social and financial risks associated with national Human Resources policy (the provision of indemnities on termination of contract, review of dismissals, ongoing judicial proceedings) and flagging up issues where necessary \xef\x83\x98 Maintaining close relations with local authorities in the domain of Human Resources (labour inspectorate, the Ministry of Labour) \xef\x83\x98 Securing the services of a lawyer and seeking his/her advice whenever necessary \xef\x83\x98 Making available and explaining Human Resources regulations and procedures to all employees \xef\x83\x98 Organising general information meetings for staff Mission 6 :  Promote and ensure collaboration and coordination in Human Resources with the mission\xe2\x80\x99s partners The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for: - participating in the process of selecting partners and validating the Human Resources risk analysis provided by the bases - defining with partners the modes of Human Resources management in the framework of joint projects - validating the Human Resources aspects of partnership conventions and agreements - taking full advantage at mission level of all innovative Human Resources practices in the framework of partnerships Mission 7 : Prevent and manage cases of fraud and corruption The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for: - identifying the risks of fraud and corruption in his/her field of competence and putting in place preventative and monitoring mechanisms - making his/her team aware of the risks of fraud and corruption - alerting the Country Director to cases of fraud and corruption and undertaking  corrective action - putting in place and monitoring recommendations arising from the day-to-day control and audit Mission 8 : Manage the Human Resources team and the home staff in capital and be support/technical Manager for Human Resources Managers in the bases The Head of Human Resources Department is responsible for: - day-to-day management of the team (guidance, follow-up, motivation\xe2\x80\xa6) - evaluating the performance and developing the skills of his/her team members - management of the teams for which s/he is support/technical Manager \xef\x83\x98 Defining the Human Resources needs in his/her area of activity and producing the organisational chart of his/her team \xef\x83\x98 Taking part in the recruitment of his/her teams \xef\x83\x98 Organising and leading team meetings \xef\x83\x98 Working out and monitoring individual action plans for team members \xef\x83\x98 Managing planning operations, task sharing and coordination of work \xef\x83\x98 Providing for appraisal interviews for team members \xef\x83\x98 Providing technical support to the teams \xef\x83\x98 Identifying the training needs of team members \xef\x83\x98 Devising, organising and leading training sessions \xef\x83\x98 Managing difficulties in the team Human Resource o You have a master degree in relevant field with minimum 3 years of overall experience with at least 2 years at senior management role  o Bachelor\'s degree in relevant field with minimum 5 years\xe2\x80\x99 overall experience with 3 years at senior management role  o You have experience in developing and implementing HR policies and procedures in a consistent manner. o You have the ability to work cooperatively with subordinates, colleagues and supervisory staff at all levels. o You have strong coaching & training skills. o You are diplomatic, able to mediate conflict in stressful conditions. o You are comfortable applying HR policies consistently & tactfully.'

b"HR Expert PSU/MoMP Job SummaryUnder the Direct Supervision of HR Coordinator, HR Expert is responsible for the functions related to the providing feedback on HR efforts, In coordination with the HR Coordinator , provide administration of transparent and competitive recruitment and selection processes including drafting of terms of references (TORs), job classification, Vacancy Announcement (VA) advertisements, applicant screening, matrix preparation, scheduling interviews and drafting interview minutes, relevant committee preparation and submission, check-up and other related administrative concerns. 1. Develop an action plan based on job description. 2. Explain Ministries\xe2\x80\x99 personnel policies, benefits, and procedures to employees or job applicants. 3. Assist to verify, and maintain documentation relating to personnel activities such as staffing, recruitment, training, grievances, performance evaluations, and classifications. 4. Record data for each employee, including such information as addresses, weekly earnings, absences, supervisory reports on performance, and reasons for terminations. 5. Process and review employment applications in order to evaluate qualifications or eligibility of applicants. 6. Answer questions regarding examinations, eligibility, salaries, benefits, and other pertinent information. 7. Gather personnel records from other departments and/or employees. 8. Request information from law enforcement officials, previous employers, and other references in order to determine applicants' employment acceptability. 9. Provide assistance in administering employee benefit programs and worker's compensation plans. 10. In coordination with the HR Coordinator , provide administration of transparent and competitive recruitment and selection processes including drafting of terms of references (TORs), job classification, Vacancy Announcement (VA) advertisements, applicant screening, matrix preparation, scheduling interviews and drafting interview minutes, relevant committee preparation and submission, check-up and other related administrative concerns. 11. Maintain and regularly update leave and attendance records of project personnel. 12. Ensure a properly working filing system of local personnel with respect to relevant documents, contracts; follow through with a properly working archive system as required. 13. Develop and implement hiring strategies to meet the human resources needs of an organization. 14. Developing and implementing policies on issues like working conditions, performance management, equal opportunities, disciplinary procedures and absence management. 15. And any other tasks assigned by the direct manager according law and regulation. Human Resource \xe2\x80\xa2 University degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, Public Administration, Economy or any other related subject; Master\xe2\x80\x99s preferable. \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 5 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in related field. \xe2\x80\xa2 The candidate must have excellent analytical and drafting skills, ability to listen, be a team player as well as having management and leadership skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent analytical, interpersonal and communication skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Able to produce reports and other standards documents up to a professional standard Fluency in English (written and spoken), Pashto and Dari, local language proficiency is desirabl"

b"HR Officer PSU/MoMP Job SummaryUnder the Direct Supervision of HR Coordinator of PSU Directorate, HR Officer is responsible for the functions related to the HR operations of the PSU Directorate and other developmental projects of MoMP, Including explanation of Ministries\xe2\x80\x99 personnel policies, benefits, and procedures to employees or job applicants, record data for each employee, including such information as addresses, weekly earnings, absences, supervisory reports on performance, and reasons for terminations. 1. Prepare/develop an action plan for him/her based on jobs description. 2. Explain Ministries\xe2\x80\x99 personnel policies, benefits, and procedures to employees or job applicants. 3. Process, verify, and maintain documentation relating to personnel activities such as staffing, recruitment, training, grievances, performance evaluations, and classifications. 4. Record data for each employee, including such information as addresses, weekly earnings, absences, supervisory reports on performance, and reasons for terminations. 5. Process and review employment applications in order to evaluate qualifications or eligibility of applicants. 6. Answer questions regarding examinations, eligibility, salaries, benefits, and other pertinent information. 7. Examine employee files to answer inquiries and provide information for personnel Actions 8. Gather personnel records from other departments and/or employees. 9. Search employee files in order to obtain information for authorized persons and organizations. 10. Request information from law enforcement officials, previous employers, and other references in order to determine applicants' employment acceptability. 11. Compile and prepare reports and documents pertaining to personnel activities. 12. Inform job applicants of their acceptance or rejection of employment. 13. Select applicants meeting specified job requirements and refer them to hiring personnel. 14. Provide assistance in administering employee benefit programs and worker's compensation plans. 15. Performing any other tasks related to the position which, on the basis of laws, regulations and the goals of ministry will be addiction. Reporting Obligation: \xe2\x80\xa2 The HR Officer will report to HR Coordinator. Human Resource \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelors degree in Business administration, Management, Economics or other related field  \xe2\x80\xa2 Prospective HR Officer should have a background in Human Resources) with 4 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in related field. \xe2\x80\xa2 Past work experience with the donors or donor funded projects in the context of Government Line Ministrie"

b'Female Finance Analyst Job SummaryThe Financial Analyst shall conduct analytical studies to determine the financial position for budgetary units, apply instructions to complete budget cycle, identify all appropriate sources of information, and the methods used in accomplishing the work.  The Financial Analyst shall review financial and operational data and generate summary reports, compile annual budgets from various standard or prescribed sources, prepare schedules of disbursements, and statistical charts reflecting the financial and operating characteristics of organizations.  The Financial Analyst shall perform work in connection with various agency programs and involve work in the development of salary requirements, operating standards and other safeguarding measures for insuring stability of financial organizations. Develop analytical studies to determine the financial position of the ministry for all     budgetary units. 2. Apply instructions to complete budget cycle, identifying all appropriate sources of information, and the methods used in accomplishing the work. 3. Analyze financial and operational data submitted by organizations and provide summary reports to USG advisors engaged in financial work. Compile annual budgets from various standard or prescribed sources.  4. Prepare schedules of disbursements, statistical charts reflecting the financial and operating characteristics of organizations, and similar material. 5.    Compare prior and current years to forecast, or provide forecasting advice to leadership. 6. Develop a spend plan, which shows month to month expenditures, track expenditures to the plan and report to management the status of execution.   7. Evaluate accounting material to determine whether it is accurate, consistent, and a full and fair disclosure of economic and financial condition. 8. Recommend the issuance of requests for amendments to correct deficiencies. Perform financial duties to include but not limited to relating needs and accomplishments of the organization to anticipated and actual dollar figures in the budget and relate this knowledge to the needs of the serviced organizations. 9. Search records, files, and other readily accessible sources for information pertaining to documents with responsibility for determining consistency with or noting discrepancies between currently- and previously-filed information.  10. Assemble information concerning specified items from various readily accessible, commonly used sources for financial activities, which include providing financial information to and coordinating with USG advisors on behalf of Ministry of Defense (MOD). Check payroll filings or other forms for compliance with instructions regarding the forms used for filing, proper execution of legal documents, and presence of required supporting documents. 11. Obtain, compile, and summarize narrative information and quantitative data for use by others within the office. 12.    Verify line item costs in the budget and enter costs in standard forms and schedules. 13. Extract budget and program data from computer printouts of accounting records, forms, and reports for use by co-workers. 14. Remain current on Afghan Financial Management laws, rules, and policy knowledge and competencies, and industry environments to maintain professional development. 15. Any of the duties as required by higher authorities in accordance with laws, regulations and objectives of the ministry/agency. 16.    Performs financial management/budget formulation work involving preparation of detailed       analyses of annual and/or multi-year budget and estimates of annual funding needs for one        or more budget years. 17.    Performs budget execution, trend analysis and financial management work involving the      monitoring of obligations incurred and the actual expenditures of funds, different sources     and types of funding; such as direct annual appropriations. 18.    Provides advice, assistance, and guidance on budgeting, cost estimating and financial 19.    management related information. 20.    Conducts analysis, reviews, and special studies of financial management and/or cost related    information. Account/Finance 1. At least two (2) years of experience in a financial position or a relevant field. 2. Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree from an accredited institution in Finance, Economics or business discipline. 3. Excellent computer literacy skills in MS Office (Word and Excel) and QuickBooks. 4. Experience of financial management, including accounting software'
