b'Accounting& Finance Manager Job Summary Handle finance for the projects, supervise and training accounts staff and prepare financial reports and budgets. Account/Finance \xe2\x80\xa2 Passed finalist of ACCA or CIMA. \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 05 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience heading Accounting& Finance Division, finalizing monthly accounts, cash flow, Budgeting and forecasts and having a sound knowledge of cost and accounting principles , practices and procedures. \xe2\x80\xa2 Must be proficient in accounting systems (e.g. QuickBooks). \xe2\x80\xa2 Proactive, result driven and ability to work under pressure with minimum supervision \xe2\x80\xa2 Must be proficient in Microsoft Office packages with very good English Proficiency \xe2\x80\xa2 Salary negotiable  \xe2\x80\xa2 Other Benefits: As per company policy.'

b"Accountant / Quickbooks Operator Job SummaryA professional accountant with relevant education and experience is required to establish accounting systems for multiple ongoing projects of the company and its other business operations using QuickBooks accounting software. Accountant, using Quickbooks software will track all financial transactions, managing all accounting functions, invoicing, collections, payables, and producing financial statements. Another essential part of the job is inventory/stock tracking and performing procurement operations. Using Quickbooks, the following duties shall be performed.  - Establish correct accounting system using Quickbooks software for ongoing projects and other business operations of the company.  - Inventory/Stock tracking of materials  using Quickbooks - Producing invoices, tracking invoices - Tracking receivables, - Tracking payrolls and pay bills - Procurement operations - Cost Accounting and Inventory - Maintains and balances accounts by verifying, allocating, reconciling transactions; resolving discrepancies.  - Perform monthly balance sheet, income statement and changes in financial  - Work closely with site leadership.  - Investigate and report to the manager any inconsistencies or improprieties.  - Analyze data to ensure proper accounting procedures have been followed.  - Provide timely, relevant and accurate reporting & analysis of the results of the sites'  -  Other routine accounting dutiesTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Account/Finance 1)  3+ years of Accounting & Finance experience 2)  Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Accounting Required. 3) Proficient in Quickbooks software with previous experience of accounting using Quickbooks"

b"Finance Manager Job SummaryThe Finance Manager is responsible for the budget planning, and supports the MEC executive management team by offering insights and financial advice. This might involve advising on investments, savings, taxation, financial planning, budgeting and other related services Administer and monitor the financial system in order to ensure that the campus finances are maintained in an accurate and timely manner. Maintain the accounts payable and accounts receivable systems in order to ensure complete and accurate records of all moneys Administer employee payroll, files and records in order to ensure accurate payment of benefits and allowances Main Activities: \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with preparation of the budget and appropriate implementation of the financial policies and procedures. Establish and maintain cash controls, maintain and reconcile the general ledger \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor cash reserves and investments and producing long-term business plans. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare and reconcile bank statements and controlling income, cash flow and expenditure. \xe2\x80\xa2 Establish and maintain supplier accounts and processes supplier invoices \xe2\x80\xa2 Issue cheques for all accounts due and maintain the purchase order system. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure security for all credit cards and verify charges \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure transactions are properly recorded and entered into the computerized accounting system \xe2\x80\xa2 Developing and managing financial systems/models \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare income statements and the balance sheets,  financial reports & assist with the annual audit \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain financial files and records, Ensure the safeguarding of all transactions, Issue, code and authorize purchase orders, Reconcile the accounts payable, Prepare journal summaries, Reconcile the accounts receivable, Compile source documents, Issue receipts, Reconcile weekly deposits \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor the day-to-day financial operations within the company, such as payroll, invoicing, and other transactions \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversee financial department employees, including financial assistants and accountants \xe2\x80\xa2 Contract outside services for tax preparation, auditing, banking, investments, and other financial needs as necessary \xe2\x80\xa2 Track the company's financial status and performance to identify areas for potential improvement \xe2\x80\xa2 Seek out methods for minimizing financial risk to the company \xe2\x80\xa2 Research and analyze financial reports and market trends \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide insight full information and expectations to senior executives to aid in long-term and short-term decision making \xe2\x80\xa2 Analyze financial performance against key business metrics and document pertinent financial highlights that will enable management to determine progress against budgets. \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify, investigate, and analyze potential operational improvement. As appropriate, based on findings make proposal for operational changes (policy, procedures, processes, etc.) \xe2\x80\xa2 Submit the proposed budget and assist the overall financial planning process \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain a strategic financial plan that will indicate the trends and requirements of the campus development plan and will forecast future year budgets \xe2\x80\xa2 Identify additional finance required to fund the campus\xe2\x80\x99s proposed activities \xe2\x80\xa2 Present timely and fully costed proposals, recommendations or bids \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform all other duties as assigned and required. Account/Finance \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Finance, Audit, Accounting, business administration or related field (MBA preferred) \xe2\x80\xa2 Overall 5-15 yrs experience.  \xe2\x80\xa2 5+ years in Finance/Account management   \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with Finance programs such as Quick Book is a plus \xe2\x80\xa2 The successful candidate will be fully qualified (ACA/ACCA/CIMA/CIPFA) and likely to come from an Audit background."

b'Re -(Financial Reporting Officer) \xda\xa9\xd8\xa7\xd8\xb1\xd9\x85\xd9\x86\xd8\xaf \xd8\xb1\xd8\xa7\xd9\xbe\xd9\x88\xd8\xb1\xd8\xaf\xd9\x87\xdb\x8c \xd9\x85\xd8\xa7\xd9\x84\xdb\x8c Job SummaryWorking under the Head of Finance this position is expected to be conversant with Accounting, IFRS, ERP and Afghan tax laws related with corporation and commercial enterprises. Acts as the primary support in all matters related to preparation of financial reports, ERP and taxation \xe2\x80\xa2 Gathering of Accounting and Financial data (Mainly General Journals) and its analysis (Verification with physical documents, BRS, Ensuring proper accounting, working on different heads of Balance Sheet, Preparing audit required schedules and breakups) rectification (doing adjustments and instructing the related party to avoid future similar mistakes) and compilation in to financial statements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that DABS complies with reporting requirements especially with respect to IFRS standards, timeliness and accuracy. \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare estimated Financials for each year. \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing responses to queries from government ministries and departments on submitted reports (including tax/revenue department of MOF). \xe2\x80\xa2 Supporting auditors whether internal or external in their audit process. \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparation of different other financial and accounting MIS reports in coordination with other departments for top management. \xe2\x80\xa2 Regular Control & Monitoring of the accounting environment (ensuring accurate accounting and accounting procedures, periodical or year-end activities) of DABS and his responsible units/areas. \xe2\x80\xa2 Regular Control & Monitor of compliance of his responsible units/areas with article of incorporation of DABS, IFRS, DABS accounting and other policies, Tax laws and if any. \xe2\x80\xa2 Close collaboration with banks & cash department regarding any BRS related issues. \xe2\x80\xa2 Be part of the team of implementation and successful operation of the DABS ERP. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide long run regular support in operation of the ERP to his responsible units/areas. \xe2\x80\xa2 Gathering tax/revenue department of MOF required data in soft & hard. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring tax law rules and procedures are properly followed by all the units/areas of DABS. \xe2\x80\xa2 Fill the tax forms and Izharnama correctly, timely and submit it to tax/revenue department of MOF to avoid penalties and any other complication. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure timely tax clearance from tax/revenue department of MOF. \xe2\x80\xa2 Tax planning and advising on avenues available for tax saving. \xe2\x80\xa2 Implements financial controls and ensures accuracy of tax reporting. \xe2\x80\xa2 Operates effective internal and external tax reporting. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist his Line manager and DABS management in all the daily activities or any specific job assigned apart from above. Account/Finance Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field (Any professional certification). Two (2) to four (4) years of experience in related setting.'

b'Tax Manager Job SummaryTaxation specialists are the experts in providing commercially-focused tax advice and tax services to a wide range of clients who operate in all sectors of the economy. This involves devising tax-efficient strategies for multinational and domestic-based clients in diverse business situations, including mergers, takeovers and corporate reconstructions. Taxation specialist work continually to help ensure that their clients make the best business decisions in the light of fiscal change and development. They monitor and anticipate changes to tax legislation and respond quickly with advice specific to their clients\xe2\x80\x99 particular commercial requirements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Helping businesses and individuals to create strategies for dealing with tax and prepare for their future in the financial market \xe2\x80\xa2 Advising and consulting with clients in order to provide advice about tax legislation, e.g. ensuring businesses and assets are properly structured to minimize the incidence of taxation \xe2\x80\xa2 Review and analyze government apportionment/allocation information \xe2\x80\xa2 Calculating tax liability, ensuring compliance is completed speedily and efficiently, and submitting tax returns and associated documents by the appropriate deadlines \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in responding to tax audit inquiries \xe2\x80\xa2 Review base reporting data for property tax returns in order to minimize reportable cost basis \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensuring that tax withheld are deposited to Government within due time \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing monthly reports of taxes withheld (client\xe2\x80\x99s) \xe2\x80\xa2 Filing relevant documents of taxes withheld and deposited to Government \xe2\x80\xa2 Dealing with Ministry of Finance regarding any tax issue \xe2\x80\xa2 Obtaining tax exemption certificates from appropriate department of MoF for the newly awarded projects \xe2\x80\xa2 Keeping monthly record of individual staff\xe2\x80\x99s salaries and taxes withheld (client\xe2\x80\x99s) \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing annual tax deduction certificates for individual staff members as Income tax of Afghanistan and ensuring that a copy of each certificate is submitted to Ministry of Finance within due time \xe2\x80\xa2 Providing clients with relevant documents to be submitted to Ministry of Finance for obtaining annual clearance. \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing and submitting to Ministry of Finance any other statement as may be announced by Income tax authorities from time to time \xe2\x80\xa2 Dealing with any other tax issue that may arise \xe2\x80\xa2 Undertaking duties and responsibilities as directed/requested by Managing Partner. b'Finance & Admin Officer Job SummaryFinance & Admin Officer Finance Duties: 1. Responsible for and plans, organizes and manages the finance and administration process for the company. 2. Full knowledge and clearance of (BRT, Withholding, Salary, Rent and Income Tax). 3. Full knowledge and perform bank reconciliations weekly, monthly and yearly. 4. Prepare Payment, Receipt, Adjusting, Transfer & Withdrawal vouchers, obtain necessary verification, check, control and approvals and enter the vouchers in QuickBooks as per finance manual & IFRS Standards.  5. Prepare monthly payroll. 6. Maintain good and reliable filling system of Finance & Admin functions. 7. Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual financial reports to management as per agreed formats. 8. Budgeting and budget controls. Ensures that the finance process is in adherence to company and client requirements, company policies and procedures and company Regulations to ensure successful accomplishment of the requirements. 9. Plan and organize and liaise company need and purchases in close coordination & collaboration with Relative Supervisors. 10. Organize and manage office supplies, kitchen supplies for the company. 11. Ensuring that company expenditures are adequately tracked according to the agreed budget in close coordination with Relevant Supervisors. 12. Facilitate timely, accurate month-end closing, cash requests and cash reconciliations. 13. Receiving complete documents, invoices, bills, etc.\xe2\x80\xa6 insuring the proper name, date, stamp and supportive documents. 14. Prepare weekly, monthly plan and monthly financial progress report to the Relevant Supervisors. 15. Forecast costs and revenues. 16. Monitor and report on accounting discrepancies. 17. Preparing in a timely manner accurate financial reports as required by the Relevant supervisors. 18. Perform month-end and year-end close processes. 19. Perform any other Finance related tasks assigned by supervisor. Admin Duties: 1. Maintain and manage fixed assets, stationery and inventory registers for company. 2. Arrange field visits by purchasing air ticket, hotel accommodation and transportation for staff. 3. Support and supervise guards, cook/cleaner and drivers to make sure the assigned tasks has been accomplished on time. 4. Supervise in Maintaining of Attendance, registers, log books and etc. 5. Perform any other Admin related tasks assigned by the supervisor Account/Finance 1. At Least Bachelor degree in Finance, Business Administration or Economics (Specialization in Finance) will be given the priority 2. At least over 2-3 Years progressive practical experience in the field relevant field.'

b"Deputy Finance Manager Job SummaryTo lead, supervise and develop the accounts/finance team to handle day to day financial accounting tasks including book keeping, preparation of periodic financial statements, management reporting, dealing with taxation matters and ensuring strict adherence to the company policies. - Lead, supervise and develop accounts and finance team. - Maintaining books of accounts and ensure proper day closing. - Understand multiple accounting systems/interfaces and can investigate related issues. - Ensure timely preparation & submission of all tax payments and statement/returns in accordance with prevailing tax laws. - Ensure timely preparation & submission of quarterly and annual financial statements in accordance with IFRS. - Manage smooth conduct of all assignments assigned to accounts/finance team. - Conduct effective & regular meetings to review performance & provide feedback - Ensure timely preparation & submission of daily, weekly and monthly defined reports for management. - Ensure strict compliance to the company financial and general policies within accounts department. - Any other assignment as & when required.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Account/Finance - Master's degree in accounting or finance field, ACCA, CPA. - 3+ years related experience. - Private sector experience a plus - Proven ability to work under stress and considerable pressure. - Proven ability to work and to operate as part of a team."

b'Paralegal - Tax Job SummaryWe are looking for a diligent and committed professional to join our tax team. This person will assist taxpayers, including companies and non-profits, to comply with all aspects of their Afghanistan tax obligations at all stages of the tax filing process. We are looking for someone with the highest level of professionalism, who is capable of managing multiple responsibilities and deadlines. Strong communication skills are critical. Candidates should be passionate about and committed to upholding rule of law. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assisting in the preparation of tax filings and the calculation of tax liabilities on behalf of corporate and non-profit clients; \xe2\x80\xa2 Appear on behalf of clients at government offices including but not limited to the Afghanistan Revenue Department, Large Taxpayers Office, Medium Taxpayers Office, DABs, and the Central Business Registry; \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with the processing of annual return filings, monthly and quarterly filings, tax audits, tax clearance certificates, and tax exemption certificates; \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain effective, professional, and timely communication with clients, colleagues, and government officials; \xe2\x80\xa2 Keep abreast of changes and updates to tax laws, regulations, policies, and practices. Account/Finance \xe2\x80\xa2 Bachelor qualifications in law or accounting strongly preferred, ACCA qualifications an advantage; \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience working on taxation issues on behalf of taxpayers, including companies and/or NGOs, strongly preferred; \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficiency in Pashto, Dari, and English essential.'

b'Finance Associate (SB3/3)-Rule of Law Unit Job Summarynder the guidance and supervision of the Finance Analyst, the Finance Associate ensures effective execution of financial and Administrative support services in FFFMU and ensure proper and transparent utilization of financial resources. The Finance Associate promotes a client-oriented approach consistent with UNDP rules and regulations. The Finance Associate provides critical financial and administrative support in the FFFMU Finance Team. The Finance Associate works in close collaboration with the project personnel, operations, and programme staff in the Country Office for resolving finance-related issues and information exchange. 1.Ensures Administration and implementation of operational strategies, adapts processes and procedures focusing on achievement of the following results; Full compliance with UN/UNDP rules and regulations of financial processes, financial records and reports and audit follow up; implementation of the effective internal control framework. Follow up on contributions with PSU within the Country Office resource mobilization efforts 2.Ensures administration of project budget and cost recovery focusing on achievement of the following resul; Preparation and modifications of project budget Presentation of researched information for planning and status of project financial resources. Entering project budgets in Atlas for budget revision based on approved project Annual Work Plan and/or signed Project Document 3.Provides Administrative and Accounting support services to the FFFMU Finance Team focusing on achievement of the following results: Proper control of the supporting documents for payments as per the Payment Check List; preparation of all types of vouchers and GLJEs; Preparation of PO and non-PO vouchers for the project in Atlas; Support country office global payrolls processing in Atlas by reviewing chartfields for positions based on approved project AWP and analyzing GP expenditure transactions on a monthly regular basis; Maintenance of the internal expenditures control system which ensures that vouchers processed are matched and completed, transactions are correctly recorded and posted in Atlas; payrolls are duly prepared and processed; travel claims, and other entitlements are duly processed Timely project accounts closure Timely corrective actions on unposted vouchers, including the vouchers with budget check errors, match exceptions, unapproved vouchers. Timely response to Country Office requests to resolve financial data issues. Maintenance of the Accounts Receivables for the project and follow-up with PSU in Country Office on contributions, deposits creation in Atlas and their application to AR pending items. 4.Ensures proper Project cash management functioning focusing on achievement of the following results: Alternate to Finance Analyst for timely review and preparation of cashflow forecasts of the project to ensure sufficient funds on hand for disbursements. Timely identification and recording of receipts for income application. Competencies Knowledge Management Ability to capture, develop, share and effectively use information and knowledge Operational Efficiency Ability to identify and execute opportunities to improve operational efficiency Relationship Management Ability to engage and foster strategic partnerships with other parties, Inter-Agency Coordination and forge productive working relationships Required Skills and Experience Account/Finance Education: Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in business administration or Public administration with specialized certification in Accounting and Finance is required. Experience: With bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s 5 years of progressively responsible finance experience is required at the national or international level. Experience in the usage of computers and office software packages (MS Word, Excel, etc) and advance knowledge of spreadsheet and database packages, experience in handling of web-based management systems is required. Language: Fluency in English is required. Fluency in Pashto or Dari is required.  Other: Accounting Finance Test (AFT) is a requirement of this post.'

b'Finance Officer (SB4/1)- Rule of Law Unit Job SummaryUnder the guidance and direct supervision of the Finance Specialist, the Finance Officer provides leadership in execution of financial services in the Country Office (CO) ensuring effective and transparent utilization of financial resources and integrity of financial services. The Finance Officer promotes a client-oriented approach consistent with UNDP rules and regulations. The Finance Officer supervises and leads the support staff of the Finance Unit. The Finance Officer works in close collaboration with the operations, programme and project teams in the CO and UNDP HQs staff to resolve complex financial management and operational-related issues and information delivery. 1.Ensures administration and implementation of operational strategies, adapts processes and procedures focusing on achievement of the following results: Full compliance with UN/UNDP rules, regulations, and policies of financial activities, financial recording/reporting system, preparation for and follow-up on audit recommendations related to financial matters; implementation of effective internal controls, proper functioning of a client-oriented financial resources management system. CO Finance business processes mapping and elaboration of the content of Standard Operating Procedures in Finance in consultation with office management. Continuous analysis and monitoring of the financial situation at programme and project levels, and preparation of monthly and ad hoc finance reports for all projects highlighting discrepancies, contributions, and delivery against targets. Manage donor agreements and ensure implementation in line with agreements including tranche requests, monitoring compliance with any earmarked funding and funding end dates, and donor fiscal years for funding utilization. Routinely monitors financial exception reports for unusual activities, transactions, and investigates anomalies. Supports preparations for and contributes to NIM/DIM audits as well as implementation of recommendations and management responses.  2.  Ensures administration of budgets and functioning of the optimal cost-recovery system focusing on achievement of the following results: Preparation and modifications of budgets for UNDP projects, follow up with HQs on authorized spending limits (ASL) for development projects. Implementation of the control mechanism for development projects through monitoring budgets preparation and modifications, budgetary status versus ASL, follow up with HQs on ASL for development projects, maintenance of the General Ledger. Development, implementation and follow up on Programme Portfolio Pipeline and Project Tree in Atlas. Programme financial resources management through planning, guiding, controlling the use of resources. Implementation of effective internal controls, proper functioning of a client-oriented financial resources management system. Identification of operational and financial problems, proposal of solutions. Analysis of requirements and synthesis of proposals on proper mechanisms to eliminate deficiencies in budget management Provision of advice on reporting, preparation of reports including donor reports including preparation of all financial reports for reporting to be cleared by Chief of Finance or Finance Specialist. Presentation of thoroughly researched information for planning of financial resources of projects, reports containing analysis of the financial situation. Timely preparation of cost-recovery bills in Atlas for the services provided by, elaboration and implementation of the income tracking system and follow up on cost recovery. 3.   Provides accounting and administrative support to the Finance Unit focusing on achievement of the following results: Proper control of the supporting documents for payments, review of financial reports for NEX projects. Maintenance of the internal expenditures control system which ensures that vouchers processed are matched and completed, transactions are correctly recorded and posted in Atlas; payrolls are duly prepared; travel claims, MPOs and other entitlements are duly processed. Coordination and review of accounts closure Timely corrective actions on unposted vouchers, including the vouchers with budget check errors, match exceptions, unapproved vouchers. Timely response to HQ requests to resolve financial data issues. Maintenance of the Accounts Receivables for UNDP projects and follow up with partners on contributions. Proper receipting of goods and services and establishment of accruals. 4.   Ensures facilitation of knowledge building and knowledge sharing in the CO focusing on achievement of the following results: Organization of training for the operations/programme/projects staff on financial management. Synthesis of lessons learnt and best practices in financial management. Sound contributions to knowledge networks and communities of practice. Competencies Team building Ability to work effectively with diverse groups of professionals towards common goals Learning and Development Knowledge of enterprise learning and development issues, concepts, and principles, and ability to apply them to enhance the fulfillment and performance of employees Knowledge Management Ability to capture, develop, share and effectively use information and knowledge Result-based Management Ability to manage programmes and projects with a strategy aimed at improved performance and demonstrable results Design Thinking Knowledge of method (s) for practical, creative resolution of problems and creation of solutions, with the intent of an improved future result. Internal Reporting and Accountability Ability to create internal reporting and accountability processes and standards Required Skills and Experience Account/Finance Education: Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Business or Public administration, with specialized certification in Accounting and Finance is a requirement. Part-qualified accountants from an internationally recognized institute of accountancy will have a distinct advantage. Experience: 5 years of progressively responsible finance and accounting experience is required with a bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s is required. Experience in the usage of computers and office software packages (MS Word, Excel, etc) and advance knowledge of spreadsheet and database packages, experience in handling of web-based management systems and ERP financials, preferably PeopleSoft. Knowledge of IPSAS and/or IFRS required. Language: Fluency in English is required. Fluency in Pashto or Dari is required. Other: Advance Accounting Finance Test (AAFT) is a requirement.'

b'Account Director Job SummaryResponsible for client accounts within the agency, and the client-agency relationship Ensuring the profitability and growth of client accounts. Supporting the Account Planner in writing creative briefs and directing the strategic development of creative work.  The Account Director leads a client account (or set of accounts) within an advertising agency, ensuring they are profitable and growing. He takes responsibility for the delivery of quality creative work that meets the client\xe2\x80\x99s needs and addresses their business problems. An Account Director manages their own team, and relies on their ability to lead and inspire others inside and outside the agency. Some will regularly be involved with pitches for new business, approaching these with both a creative and commercial mindset. An Account Director is primarily responsible for the management of relationships with clients.  As the senior point of contact for an agency\xe2\x80\x99s customers, the Account Director also co-ordinates the resources needed to service projects, builds strategic operational plans and balances the expectations of clients with the execution of creative work. \xe2\x80\xa2 Taking a lead in clients\xe2\x80\x99 marketing and advertising strategies \xe2\x80\xa2 Leading a team to provide the utmost level of client service \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaising with clients at a senior level on a day-to-day basis \xe2\x80\xa2 Promoting the expansion of business with existing clients \xe2\x80\xa2 Working with other senior managers to generate new accounts \xe2\x80\xa2 Completing projects to a specific schedule and within an agreed budget \xe2\x80\xa2 Using your skills to push clients, and the agency, creatively and strategically \xe2\x80\xa2 Significant and professional client relationship management \xe2\x80\xa2 A persuasive and confident approach to creative projects \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent written and oral communication skills with client \xe2\x80\xa2 Effective team management capabilities and a good leader  \xe2\x80\xa2 A keen attention to detail and budgetary restraints \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing daily, weekly and monthly schedules \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for all the financial paper works and reports to client and company \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for the team output quality control Account/Finance Bachelor degree (Master will be preferred) 4- 3 to 4 years experience in management'

b'Chief Financial Officer Job SummaryHarakat is seeking a highly qualified and committed individual with hands-on financial management and substantive commercial experience to serve as Chief Financial Officer (CFO) in the delivery of the AICP.  This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference to business environment reform and the private sector development agenda in Afghanistan. The new CFO will be responsible for the overall oversight and financial control of Harakat\xe2\x80\x99s operational, financial and administrative functions. The CFO will report to the CEO on day-to-day operational matters and to the Board of Directors on financial accountability and reporting, and together with the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Programme Director, will form the Senior Executive Team (SET) of Harakat. The CFO will be responsible for:  1. Financial management and reporting 2. Oversight and leadership of procurement strategy 3. Championing commercial capability 4. Compliance with all financial regulations 5. Providing strong leadership and acting as a role model for the organization 6. Acting as a member of the SET and providing reporting to the Board of Directors 7. Ensuring robust reporting and information managementTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Account/Finance Applications are welcome from candidates with strong experience in Afghanistan and/or strong international experience. Women applicants are strongly encouraged to apply. We are seeking applicants with the following essential attributes: Experience 1. Experience of procurement in a complex organization including a solid understanding of procurement policy and practice  2. At least ten years of practical work experience, with a proven track record in financial management, audit management, budgeting, project management and human resource management 3. Proven experience in the management of multi-currency cash flows 4. Proven experience in the design and preparation of financial performance reports 5. Demonstrable experience in the management of contracting procedures for the award of technical assistance contracts 6. Experience of working in a fragile or conflict-affected state or context 7. Experience of working in Afghanistan would be an advantage Skills and abilities 8.An understanding or willingness to get to grips with policy-making, and to support a new organization that is working in a fast-paced environment 9. Excellent stakeholder management skills and ability to effectively performance manage external providers of services to the business 10. Proven financial management skills and capability to oversee the various financial management elements of the organization 11. Ability to translate novel, timely or complex business requirements into a procurement strategy Education 12. A relevant Degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration; 13. An internationally recognized accounting qualification (e.g. ACA, CPA, ACCA) Language skills 14. Proficiency in English is required, including a high standard of written English 15. Dari and Pashto would be an advantage Full details of the role can be found on Harakat\xe2\x80\x99s website http://harakat.af/'

b'SR. FINANCE/TAX ASSISTANT Job SummaryThe Cashier/Finance Assistant will manage all Musharikat\xe2\x80\x99s financial, taxation & bank correspondence files. S/he will ensure that the outlined financial policies and procedures are implemented and followed in the assigned area.  S/he will provide support in other finance areas as necessary. OBJECTIVE AND DUTIES:  \xe2\x80\xa2 Organize and manage all tax reports, statements and documents relating to clients and project. \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing and Submitting tax documents to MOF \xe2\x80\xa2 Answer and respond to clients\xe2\x80\x99 inquiries on their tax problems. \xe2\x80\xa2 Complete quarterly and annual tax reports \xe2\x80\xa2 Organize and update the company\xe2\x80\x99s tax database \xe2\x80\xa2 Processing of all cash transactions, advance and wire transfer payments in FAS. \xe2\x80\xa2 Scanning financial documents \xe2\x80\xa2 Transfer of cash from the bank to the office and ensuring the security of project fund. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that proper approval signatures are obtained and that both parties: Payer and Receiver verify the cash amount of the transaction.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that all cash transactions are entered into FAS by the Accountant Specialist and identify the proper account codes for each transaction and verify the accuracy of cash entries in the ledger.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Keep all salary related information/documentation strictly confidential. \xe2\x80\xa2 Verify that documentation submitted to Finance for payment is approved and complete for processing. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain/ organized files related financial documentation.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that financial files are labeled, organized and audit compliant in accordance with USAID and DAI rules and regulations. \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing and Submitting tax documents to MOF \xe2\x80\xa2 Travel to all provinces of Afghanistan. \xe2\x80\xa2 Other tasks as required. Account/Finance QUALIFICATIONS:  \xe2\x80\xa2 B.A. Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or equivalent.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Two - four years of relevant experience and progressive responsibility in finance and accounting, office administration, or project operations  \xe2\x80\xa2 Previous experience with USAID-funded projects  \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in financial management of USAID projects, including a demonstrated understanding of applicable finance-related USG contracting regulations  \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to respond effectively to the time sensitive inquiries  \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with enterprise accounting software, and Microsoft office suite \xe2\x80\xa2 Demonstrated knowledge of internal controls and audit processes (e.g. procurement, local subcontract agreements, etc.) \xe2\x80\xa2 An energetic, forward-thinking and creative individual with high ethical standards and appropriate professional image \xe2\x80\xa2 An extremely well organized and self-directed individual with sound technical skills, analytical ability, good judgment, and strong operational focus \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluency in English is required REPORTING:  \xe2\x80\xa2 The position reports to the Finance Manager.'

b"Managing Director Job SummaryThe post Managing Director has been created with the intention that the job-holder will be a member of the President's senior staff, reporting directly to the President. She will handle matters of policy and institutional importance on behalf of the President, manage special projects related to university officials, community and government leaders, and oversee the MEC\xe2\x80\x99s organizational units. The Managing Director (MD) will manage operations and lead strategic operational initiatives for the MEC. While the MD is responsible for achieving MEC goals and assuring that day-to-day operations align with these goals, the MD will directly assist the President in meeting these responsibilities and serve as the second-in-command of MEC operations.  The MD will be responsible for the supervision of the programmatic departments of MEC. Under the leadership of the President, the MD will set direction for MEC's Associate Directors, and serve as their mentor, coach, and guide. Through metrics established with the MD, the MD will manage MEC activities and hold the staff accountable for performance against those metrics. The Managing Director will be responsible for drafting/creating MEC's annual report and operating budgets. She will identify best practices and improve internal systems with an eye toward future needs and budget realities. She will also lead hiring of new staff, promotions/raises of current staff, as well as nurture organizational culture and cohesiveness of MEC. The MD will assist the President with strategic planning and the execution of strategic initiatives to align the organization's programs, projects, and messaging with the strategic direction of the organization. The MD will take the lead on the execution of priority strategic initiatives. This responsibility will critically involve writing grants, contracts, and proposals at the initiation phase; executing new programs at the implementation stage, and marketing and communicating program success at the concluding state. Strategic initiatives include marketing campaigns, fundraising and donor management, business development, and partnership activities. Provide guidance to executive director for marketing, media relations, public relations and issues management activities. Trouble shoot any interim problems as they arise. The job-holder will, among other tasks: \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in institutional planning, policy and procedure development and problem resolution with the President and other senior officers, including researching, reviewing and making recommendations on new or revised policies and strategies and on intra-departmental or inter-departmental issues, and if required, serving on university planning and policy-making committees. \xe2\x80\xa2 Preparing reports and other communications on behalf of the President. \xe2\x80\xa2 Serve as the President's primary liaison with the MEC\xe2\x80\x99s operational units (Top Management, University, Institute, School and Kindergarten), and/or government and community leadership on strategic and operational matters pertaining to the specific area of institutional interest. \xe2\x80\xa2 Respond to routine inquiries as delegated by the President and coordinate special projects on his behalf. \xe2\x80\xa2 Enhance professional growth and development through participation in educational programs, in-service meetings and workshops. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure all organizational units of the President function in line with overall MEC policies, goals, and mission and support the President in dealing with lecturers, staff, and student issues. \xe2\x80\xa2 Work with the President to define and advance the overall goals of MEC and manage the day-to-day operations of the Moraa Educational Complex \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in the creation and implementation of a strategic business plan that defines the goals, activities and metrics of the Moraa Educational Complex \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate internal communications and regular meetings with the membership, committees and boards of the MEC  \xe2\x80\xa2 Fostering interactions with prospective industry, academic and government partners, and stewarding existing collaborations \xe2\x80\xa2 Manage external relationships, including developing and servicing client relationships and tracking outcomes \xe2\x80\xa2 Target, pursue and cultivate external relationships, collaborations and partnerships \xe2\x80\xa2 Be first contact for inquiries about MEC from the private sector, government, other institutions and the media \xe2\x80\xa2 Gain full understanding of the scope of MEC activities and strategic plans \xe2\x80\xa2 Keep MEC membership informed and aware of inquiries and potential research opportunities and will help to assess their viability \xe2\x80\xa2 Actively pursue new national and international partnerships \xe2\x80\xa2 Planning and implementing of marketing and communications initiatives \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in developing a professional portfolio of marketing communications tools (e.g. brochures, presentation slide sets, conference booths, collateral), manage MEC brand strategy \xe2\x80\xa2 Actively participate in managing content for the MEC's website \xe2\x80\xa2 Deliver or participate in presentations to corporations, government and industry \xe2\x80\xa2 Media management (press releases, media inquiries, advertisements) \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinate and participate in campus visits, events, workshops, and conferences \xe2\x80\xa2 Facilitating cybersecurity or privacy-related research proposal preparation and implementation \xe2\x80\xa2 As requested and where appropriate, participate in the preparation, coordination and implementation of major funding proposals stemming from the MEC  \xe2\x80\xa2 Soliciting and orchestrating direct funding opportunities from government ministries at both the provincial and federal levels. \xe2\x80\xa2 Securing private sector, in-kind commitments and letters of support \xe2\x80\xa2 Managing administrative and supervisory functions \xe2\x80\xa2 Contribute to the leadership and supervision for all administrative staff employees of the MEC, including aspects of planning for training and development, conducting performance appraisals, assigning job responsibilities and general supervision. \xe2\x80\xa2 Liaise with Human Resources regarding all MEC staffing issues including job descriptions, reclassifications, performance evaluations, payroll records and staff management issues. \xe2\x80\xa2 Authorize, in consultation with the President, the purchase and allocation of equipment and furnishings for administration and outreach. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain internal relationship and communications with the Office of Research, Faculty- and University-level Development Staff and UW Service Offices (Finance, Graphics, Food Services etc.) \xe2\x80\xa2 Oversees day-to-day administrative and management operations with the President of MEC. \xe2\x80\xa2 Manages MEC finances related to student, professional, and faculty production work, including strategic planning, management of production related accounts, petty cash and student payroll. Generates budgets and quarterly reports. \xe2\x80\xa2 Helps ensure positive relations with vendors and prompt payment of bills and reimbursements. \xe2\x80\xa2 Trains, mentors and advises student staff in professional areas such as marketing, audience development, arts administration and general administration. \xe2\x80\xa2 Advises current students and student organizations, including those entering the profession and post-graduate study. \xe2\x80\xa2 Encourages a collaborative environment between students, faculty and staff in curricular, co-curricular, and professional settings. \xe2\x80\xa2 Serves on relevant University boards and committees. \xe2\x80\xa2 Leads or attends finance and management related meetings, and other duties as assigned. \xe2\x80\xa2 Act as the line manager for top management staff member within the team. Administrative Master\xe2\x80\x99s Degree in Public Administrations, International Relations, Political Science Business Administration or related field (PhD preferred) \xe2\x80\xa2 At least 10-15 years\xe2\x80\x99 active work experience, including at least 8 years in a management / team leadership role, preferably in an educational, academic and/or healthcare environment \xe2\x80\xa2 Able to demonstrate leadership in or management of positive changes to improve organizational performance or service delivery. \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with funding instruments and the establishment and implementation of research contracts between industry and academia \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent networking skills and ability to maintain critical and sensitive relationships with government, industry and media among others \xe2\x80\xa2 We especially encourage academics with an entrepreneurial mindset searching for possibilities to leave their mark in a creative, dynamic and ambitious environment"

b'Secretary (Rover) FSN-05 (Multiple Vacancies) Job SummaryFemale candidates are strongly encouraged to apply I. GENERAL INFORMATION 1. SOLICITATION NO.: 72030619R10002 2. ISSUANCE DATE: October 15, 2018 3. CLOSING DATE/TIME FOR RECEIPT OF OFFERS: October 29, 2018 no later than 4:30 pm Kabul time.  4. POSITION TITLE:-Secretary (Rover) - (Multiple Vacancies) 5. MARKET VALUE:-Equivalent to FSN-05 (Step 1-13) In accordance with AIDAR Appendix J and the Local Compensation Plan of US Embassy Afghanistan. Final compensation will be negotiated within the listed market value. 6. PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE:-The period of performance is one year, with the possibility of extensions up to a total of five years, subject to availability of funds, satisfactory job performance and need for continued service. 7. PLACE OF PERFORMANCE: Kabul, Afghanistan. 8. SECURITY LEVEL REQUIRED: As an employment precondition, the successful applicant is required to obtain U.S Embassy Afghanistan RSO Security Clearance. 9. STATEMENT OF DUTIES 1. General Statement of Purpose of the Contract The incumbent serves as an interim or roving Secretary to all USAID Offices, as assigned. The incumbent is assigned to the USAID/Afghanistan Executive Office (EXO), and reports administratively to the Human Resources (HR) Specialist/Assistant for assignment. When serving on assignment as an Office Secretary, day-to-day supervision will be from the appropriate Office Director. The incumbent performs work of a confidential nature, in lieu of secretarial or administrative personnel who are ill, on vacation, or otherwise absent or preoccupied for varying periods of time. The incumbent provides Time and Attendance (T&A) back-up and support of the Office of assignment, or to EXO/HR, as required. The formal supervisor is the Executive Officer. The incumbent performs other office functions appropriate for their training and grade level. 2. Statement of Duties to be Performed a. Secretarial, Administrative, and Clerical Support  As assigned, serves as Secretary (to an Office, Branch, or other Unit), with responsibility for providing the full range of secretarial, administrative, and clerical support to the organization staff. Typical duties vary with the assignment, but may include any or all of the following: keeps the organization Director\xe2\x80\x99s calendar: receives visitors and telephone calls to the organization; takes appropriate action depending upon the nature of the visit or the call; to the extent possible, provides information to answer non-technical questions within prescribed guidelines; arranges appointments, meetings, and conferences as requested, to include scheduling conference rooms and notifying participants and assembling background materials for conference use; makes travel and hotel arrangements, and coordinates logistical arrangements for visiting officials; and, as assigned, takes notes, and follows up to ensure commitments made in meetings and conferences are met. The incumbent provides administrative support for organization staff; receives, reviews, and controls incoming and outgoing correspondence and communications, and distributes mail and messages, maintaining controls and following up on actionable correspondence; drafts routine correspondence for signature of organization staff; types a variety of USAID correspondence; proofreads outgoing correspondence to assure they are in proper format, consistent with Mission style requirements, properly addressed, etc., prior to going to the  respective Office Director/Mission Director for clearance or signature; tracks official organization correspondence, Global Acquisition and Assistance System (GLAAS) documents, etc. through the clearance and signature process; and, establishes, maintains files and records, with input EXO/Correspondence and Records (C&R).  As required by the assignment, the incumbent maintains contact with counterparts in the U.S. Embassy, other international organizations, host-government officials, and third-country nationals. The incumbent provides translation of non-technical articles, letters, and memoranda, for the respective Office Director and staff, translating between Dari/Pashto and English, and English and Dari/Pashto.  As required by workload, the incumbent may be assigned as a second Secretary or Assistant, assisting organization Secretaries in the performance of their official duties. b. Backup Time and Attendance Support  Provides back-up and support to EXO/HR in completing Time and Attendance coverage for the Mission, in the absence or preoccupation of the official Timekeeper. The contractor is eligible for temporary duty (TDY) travel to U.S., or to other Missions abroad, to participate in the \xe2\x80\x9cForeign Service National\xe2\x80\x9d Fellowship Program, in accordance with USAID policy. 3. Supervisory Relationship The incumbent is directly supervised by the USAID/Afghanistan Executive Officer, and under day-to-day administrative supervision of the HR Specialist/Assistant. Assignments are made both orally and in writing. Work is reviewed in terms conformance to policy and procedures, and results achieved. \xe2\x80\x82\xe2\x80\x82 4. Supervisory Controls  None. 10. AREA OF CONSIDERATION:  Cooperating Country Nationals (CCN), meaning an individual who is a cooperating country citizen or a non-cooperating country citizen lawfully admitted for permanent residence in the cooperating country.  11. PHYSICAL DEMANDS The work requested does not involve undue physical demands. 12. POINT OF CONTACT:- Any questions about this solicitation may be directed to: KblAIDHR@usaid.gov. Applications submitted to this email address will not be considered. Note: No in-person appointments or telephone calls will be entertained, unless you are required to have more information about this solicitation. Administrative II. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED FOR THIS POSITION a. Education: Completion of two (2) college study towards a diploma in Secretarial Science or Business Administration is required. (Education requirement must be met at the time of application for the subject position). b. Work Experience: A minimum of two (2) years of secretarial or clerical experience is required. (Work experience requirement must be met at the time of application for the subject position). c. Language: Level IV (Fluent) in speaking/reading English, and Level IV (Fluent) in speaking/reading of Dari and/or Pashtu is required. (English language ability will be tested). d. Knowledge: The incumbent must have a good understanding of general document preparation, and have, or be able to quickly develop, a familiarity with USAID activities and programs, as well as a general knowledge of office procedures and practices. The Secretary should have a good working knowledge of file management, mail handling, and correspondence formatting. III. EVALUATION AND SELECTION FACTORS \xe2\x80\xa2 Work Experience   40 points \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge    30 points \xe2\x80\xa2 Skills and Abilities  30 points  Maximum Points:         100 points After an initial application screening, the best qualified applicants will be invited for a written examination, English Proficiency Test and to an oral interview.'

b'Team Assistant, (Temporary Appointment at Grade GS.4) Job SummaryPurpose of the Post: To provide a variety of secretarial/administrative work in support of Project/programme activities. Objectives of the Programme: To deliver WHO core functions at country level with a particular focus on the organization\xe2\x80\x99s directing and coordinating role for international health as expressed in the Constitution. In this framework, specific activities include:  \xe2\x80\xa2 Support to the formulation, implementation and evaluation of national health policies, strategies, and plans; \xe2\x80\xa2 Development and management, at the country level, of the organization\xe2\x80\x99s programme of technical cooperation and coordination of the organization\xe2\x80\x99s activities with those of other bodies and with the Government\xe2\x80\x99s National Health Programmes to this end. Terms of Reference : Under the direct supervision of National Professional Officer, Nutrition and over all guidance of the Head of WCO, Afghanistan, the incumbent will perform the following duties: 1.    Provide a full range of secretarial services, ensuring that deadlines are met and correspondence and queries are responded to in a timely manner. Type and edit technical reports, documents and presentations in accordance with WHO style, draft general correspondence on own initiative or upon instructions.  2.    Receive, screen and process incoming correspondence and requests, obtaining and attaching background information and forward to the staff concerned; drawing their attention to specific issues/problems as necessary. 3.     In close coordination with the Administration/Finance unit, process all requests related to programme activities, such as procurement of goods and services, DFC, APWs, Fellowships, consultants, etc, obtain necessary approvals and initiate action in GSM. Follow up with concerned parties the completion of deliverables and payments. 4.     Make necessary arrangements for field visits and duty travel of team members, consultants and visiting missions, follow up on ticket and hotel reservations, security clearances, and initiate the travel requests in GSM. 5. Assist in organizing meetings, workshops and training activities, by typing documents and presentations, sending letters to participants, photocopying and preparing files, follow up with logistics units regarding arrangements. Provide secretarial support during meetings.  6. Screen and receive visitors and telephone calls, make appointments, answer queries of and/or redirect visitors and callers. Update and maintain records and reference files. 7. Replace support staff, and perform other related duties including provision of support to other areas of work and teams as required.Travels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Administrative Education: \xe2\x80\xa2 Essential: Completion of secondary education supplemented by secretarial/administrative training \xe2\x80\xa2 Desirable: University degree in business administration, Social Sciences of related field is an asset Experience: \xe2\x80\xa2 Essential: At least two to four years of relevant secretarial/ administrative experience. \xe2\x80\xa2 Desirable: Related Experience in the UN system.   Languages: \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluency of spoken and written English and local languages. IT Skills:  - Ability to operate PC and good knowledge of Microsoft 2003/2007. - Knowledge of GSM/Oracle applications is an asset.'

b'Driver Job SummaryTo be responsible for driving and maintaining of the vehicle assigned and for the safety of the passengers and cargo being carried and Ensure all vehicles are in good condition and functioning well and repaired on timely manner. Driving: \xe2\x80\xa2 Drive the vehicle in a safe manner complying with all Afghanaid regulations and obeying all Road Traffic Acts and to ensure that security advice is obtained before any journey. \xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out daily and weekly checks on the vehicle as assigned and report any required repair and maintenance to the line manager. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the Vehicle is kept clean, tidy and in roadworthy condition. \xe2\x80\xa2 Fill out the Vehicle Log Books and have it signed for each journey. \xe2\x80\xa2 Record the number of kilometres covered, fuel consumption, repairs and services done. \xe2\x80\xa2 Report any damage, mechanical faults or mishaps that occur to the vehicle \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that passengers are driven to and from their destination in a safe manner \xe2\x80\xa2 Comply fully with Afghanaid procedures on the reporting of accidents involving Afghanaid vehicles \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that loads and cargo are secure and transported safely \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the vehicle is parked safely at all times, especially on overnight assignments.  If necessary stay with vehicle when parked \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the vehicle is always parked at a Afghanaid compound or approved alternative \xe2\x80\xa2 Carry out any other relevant duties as assigned by the immediate supervisor. Mechanical \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that all vehicles in Head Office are maintained and checked on time on daily basis, all vehicles are repaired on proper manner and technical advice is given to the drivers. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that the daily checks of Head Office vehicles and need of spare parts and vehicles wiring system are work properly. \xe2\x80\xa2 Having a well organised filing system including records of work done, staffing rosters, and performance reports Reporting: 1. To provide monthly report of tasks for line manager as per need. Administrative \xe2\x80\xa2 12th class graduate is desirable and must have valid Afghan driving license. \xe2\x80\xa2 At least 3-5 years driving work experience is required and skills in minor vehicle  \xe2\x80\xa2 Repair and having knowledge of first aids are an advantage. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of driving rules and regulations \xe2\x80\xa2 Working knowledge of English is required \xe2\x80\xa2 fluency in Dari and Pashto is required \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to operate mobile telephones  OTHER INFORMATION  Afghanaid\xe2\x80\x99s core values are creativity, fairness and honesty. Our staff is passionate about and proud of their work and Afghanaid. Teamwork is fundamental to our standards and demonstrated by taking initiative, assisting others and taking on additional responsibilities / tasks if necessary. We are results driven, committed and motivated to achieve targets and take accountability for our own actions. Our remuneration and benefits package is competitive with other similar organisations.  This position presents an excellent opportunity for someone who has the ambition and determination to move up in their career. Other: To perform any other related duties as required by the line manager.'

b"General Services Clerk Job SummaryThe U.S. Mission in Kabul is seeking eligible and qualified applicants for position of General Services Clerk with the GSO Section located at Camp Alvarado (Hamid Karzai International Airport). Tracks all incoming and outgoing personnel, including USDH, TCNs, Contractors, and LES for all agencies under COM authority and update Post's Kabul Embassy Personnel Accountability System (KEPAS) database, working in conjunction with the GSO Expeditors and Passenger Services Personnel. Serves as a back-up Alvarado housing assistant. Provides administrative support to GSO operations, to include Morale, Welfare, and Recreation (MWR) activities, in service of Camp Alvarado personnel. Administrative Applicants must address required qualifications criteria listed below with specific information and documentation supporting each item. For example, official transcripts evidencing educational requirements must be attached to the original application submission. Failure to do so may result in a determination that the applicant is not qualified. We are not required to contact applicants who have submitted incomplete application packages. EXPERIENCE: Three years of progressively responsible experience in procurement and related fields is required, at least two of which UN, NGO or western Embassy. JOB KNOWLEDGE: Familiar with and knowledge of local sources of supply. Knowledge of DOS procurement regulations and procedures. Must understand local pricing practices, how credit cards work and good working knowledge of internet search engines. Education Requirements: High school is required. LANGUAGE: English - Level 3 (good working knowledge), Dari - Level 3, Pashto - Level 3 (good working knowledge)."

b'Office Peon Job SummaryThe Office peon will work under the supervision of Senior Admin & HR Officer, and under the overall responsibility of the Project Director. The Assignment will be for the period of 12 months and will involve the following tasks: 1. Thoroughly cleaning the office including all floors, furniture, windows, bathrooms, electrical appliances, corridors and kitchen 2. Assists in preparation of table setting, flower arranging etc. for official functions. 3. Taking office files from one place to another as per need 4. Preparing  tea or other refreshment for visitors and staff  5. Shopping for daily office needs 6. Ensuring the kitchen including its storage areas are clean, together with all eating and storage utensils. 7. Any other related task assigned by the supervisor. Administrative \xe2\x80\xa2 At least Middle school and high school will be preferred;  \xe2\x80\xa2 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience with a private sector, government agency or any national or international NGO as peon, cleaner or any other relevant position; \xe2\x80\xa2 Effective communication and interpersonal skills and fluency in one of the national languages with suitable reading, writing, listening and speaking skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Dynamic, flexible, adaptable; \xe2\x80\xa2 Ready to work on shift \xe2\x80\xa2 Sense of responsibility and care'

b'Driver Job SummaryThe driver will work under day to day supervision of Snr. HR and admin officer. \xef\x83\x98 Drive office vehicles for the transport of authorized personnel, delivery and collection of mail, documents and other item as directed by the supervisor \xef\x83\x98 Pick and drop of PLACED official personnel on daily basis \xef\x83\x98 Function as a substitute/backup to the other drivers in case of absence, leave and etc;  \xef\x83\x98 Remain flexible for traveling to provinces and working additional hours if required \xef\x83\x98 Daily maintenance of the given PLACED vehicle (check oil, water, battery, brakes, tires, interior and exterior clean up \xef\x83\x98 Perform minor repair of the vehicle under supervision of supervisor \xef\x83\x98 Log official trip, daily mileage, oil consumption, oil changes, greasing etc. \xef\x83\x98 Purchase office supplies and assist in moving of it as directed by the line supervisor   \xef\x83\x98 Perform any other relevant duties as required and directed by the supervisorTravels to ProvincesRequire Travels to Provinces Administrative \xe2\x80\xa2 Baccalaureate degree from high school/ educational institute/professional institute as per the requirement of the job \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to work well with others as individual and group. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to understand and follow Islamic Republic of  Afghanistan Traffic rules and regulation \xe2\x80\xa2 Strictly avoid use of the vehicle for personal usage \xe2\x80\xa2 Must be punctual, responsible and trustworthy'

b'Lead Reporting Officer (Re-Announce) Job SummaryThe following tasks to be undertaken by the  Reporting Officer: \xe2\x80\xa2 Keep track of reporting schedules according to relevant department framework and its strict follow up with the focal points. \xe2\x80\xa2 Inform various sub-component and unit heads in time, about pending issues and consolidate it in order to feed it to the final report. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure timely collection of monthly, quarterly, semi-annual draft reports from different units on timely basis. \xe2\x80\xa2 Act as data focal point on relevant information and dissemination platform with various departments. \xe2\x80\xa2 Edit and review collected reports, and refer back to relevant reporting focal points for missing information, clarification of inconsistencies, and correction of inaccuracies. Compile and format reports as required. \xe2\x80\xa2 Managing and supervising relevant personnel activities and enhancing their capacities. \xe2\x80\xa2 A capacity development for circulating reports to the relevant department Maintain a backup file of various issues and reports produced and submitted. Travel to project sites, when needed, for collecting stories and pictures for newsletter, reports, and other publications. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with translation and editing / proof reading of documents and reports into Dari and/or Pushto \xe2\x80\xa2 Prepare individuals plans and share periodic reports on the progress of assigned work Attend unit and other meetings as required and take minutes of meeting if requested. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with any other tasks assigned within the team and contribute to other incidental tasks at the department, when requested. \xe2\x80\xa2 Draft all needed templates for guaranteeing the quality of collected data. \xe2\x80\xa2 Train the field\xe2\x80\x99s coordinators on data collection. \xe2\x80\xa2 Set plan for data compilation, and writing of the operational plans, monthly, quarterly and final report and other periodical program documentation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that every project under his/ her profile have these tools completed, updated and in place. \xe2\x80\xa2 Conduct regular monitoring visits to programs/projects and provide detailed monitoring reports. \xe2\x80\xa2 Any other task assigned by the Head of ADB funded projects. Administrative \xe2\x80\xa2 A recognized University degree in Management, Public Administration, Business Administration or any other related area with at least 5 years of relevant experience. \xe2\x80\xa2 At least 3-5 years of progressively responsible work experience at the national and international levels in program management, monitoring and reporting system; including qualitative and quantitative approaches monitoring. \xe2\x80\xa2 Good contextual knowledge of local issues, community priorities and social and cultural constraints and realitiesv \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent knowledge about reporting to several donors.  \xe2\x80\xa2 Proven ability to conceptualize, plan and execute ideas as well as impart knowledge and skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of computer systems, internet navigation and various office applications. \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent writing as well as fluent in speaking and reading skills in English and Local Languages Pashto and Dari. \xe2\x80\xa2 Working with International Donors (World Bank, ADB, USAID and UN) and its projects is preferable.'

b'HR-Admin Officer Job SummaryIn this context, MSF is recruiting HR Admin Officer for a post. OBJECTIVES OF THE POSITION - Execute administrative and legal related tasks under supervision of the Administration Manager - Update personal files in order to ensure accuracy and compliance - Prepare employment contracts in conformity with legal requirements including specific amendments when necessary in order to ensure local labour and fiscal law compliance - Enter data into the HR database and personal files and keep them up-to-date in order to facilitate HR processes management - Update Social security employee files in order to meet legal requirements and duties - Update Tax office employee files in order to meet legal requirements and duties - Draw up monthly pay slips for all staff, editing and updating the necessary data, in order to ensure the punctuality and accuracy of staff payroll - Draw up the final pay slip and employment certificate at the end of a contract in order to meet legal requirements while defending MSF\xe2\x80\x99s interests - Follow up all expiring rental contract dates and inform the Administration Manager in order to leave enough time to arrange a renewal or look for some other alternative - Assist the Administration Manager in the prevision of monthly treasury and planning in order to ensure the coverage of daily needs, advances on salaries, payroll, etc. - Make all administrative information available to the staff (posting, meetings, etc.) - Support the line manager in translating documents into local language; Assist the line manager in meetings upon request - Give regular feedback to the line manager and report directly any issue or incident - In order to ensure the coverage of the human resources needs and maintain high standards of quality, organise and coordinate the activities of team supervised (week\xe2\x80\x99s schedule, annual leave, absences, etc.), communicate with the HR Admin department all relevant information in due time, evaluate performance, define and ensure the needs for training - Perform hands on tasks as part of the team whenever required or needed in order to optimize the resources and to contribute with his/her knowledge and experience - Participate in monthly reports according to guidelines Administrative MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS AND COMPETENCIES \xef\x83\xbc High school diploma (12th class) essential \xef\x83\xbc University degree in Administration or Communication desirable \xef\x83\xbc Proficient user of MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) essential \xef\x83\xbc Other experience in similar position desirable \xef\x83\xbc MSF experience desirable \xef\x83\xbc Dari/Pashtu: oral and written essential \xef\x83\xbc English: oral and written essential WORKING HOURS AND SALARY Full Time 40 hours a week (Saturday \xe2\x80\x93 Wednesday) Gross Salary 32,850 AFN (non-negotiable)'

b'CLEANER Job SummaryAssignment:  Ensure that the house and offices are hygienic and that the premises are clean. Manage the water consumption, rubbish incineration and laundry. Objective 1 : Ensure cleaning of offices and the house Activities: - Dust the surfaces, furniture and equipment; - Clean the windows whenever necessary; - Empty the wastepaper baskets and incinerate their contents; - Sweep and wash the floor; - Clean and disinfect the toilets; - Clean and disinfect the water filters and fill them up. Objective 2 : Take care of dirty washing Activities: - Wash, hang and iron the household linen and clothes (apart from underwear);  - Make the beds Administrative Diploma / Level of studies: N/E'
